sentences: [u'Chinese has a rise in popularity due to the spring up of the Chinese language education .', u'In the poetry of the Tang Dynasty , there is a lot of information in the limited number of Chinese characters .', u'Therefore , how to assist learners in understanding of the background story and emotional feature of poetry is a challenging issue .', u'In this paper , to support the poetry appreciation learning , our idea is to provide the Immersive Poetry Learning with multimedia properties : the Vision such as scenic spot , the Reading with occasional poetry , and the Emotional Reinforcement such as background music .', u'To construct the immersive poetry learning with multimedia environment , the Learning Context ontology , the Poetry Noun Ontology and the Music Emotion ontology are defined to annotate the context information poetry contents and music emotional properties .', u'Thus , the Ontology-based Immersive Poetry Learning system can base on the learner contexts to generate the coherent poetry and music by the ontology mapping .']

sentences: [u'AbstractIn the information retrieval field , ontology plays a crucial role in searching for information that is highly semantic similar to the query concept in origin .', u'It also plays a major roles in returning the results to the user .', u'The main purpose of ontology algorithm lies in obtaining the function for calculating the similarity between concepts .', u'One learning technology in applying ontology is to obtain a ontology function f : V AE R In this structure , it maps each vertex to a real number and the similarity between two concepts is then determined by the difference of their real numbers .', u'In this article , we report a sparse vector learning algorithm for ontology similarity measure and ontology mapping in terms of gradient descent and iterative computation .', u'The ontology penalty term in optimization model is reformulated by virtue of dual norm , and then the smooth approximation to this penalty term is obtained .', u'The main procedure of our algorithm is iterative computation based on gradient descent tricks .', u'Resu ...']

sentences: [u'In this paper , we encompass and extend previous ontology-based data integration system .', u'A semantic privacy-preserving model provides authorized view-based query answering over a widespread multiple servers for data sharing and integration .', u'The combined semantics-enabled privacy protection policies are used to empower the data integration and access control services at the virtual platform ( VP ) .', u'The ontology mapping and merging algorithm with a local-as-view ( LAV ) source description that creates a global ontology schema at the VP by integrating multiple local ontology schemas for data sharing .', u'The perfect rules integration of datalog rules enforces the data query and protection services .', u'Semantics-enable policies are combined together at the VP , but the access control criteria specified in each server are still satisfied .', u'Therefore the soundness and completeness of data sharing and protection criteria are ensured to support the validity of policy combination .', u'This guarantees the trustworthiness of data sharing and protection services in multiple servers .']

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Web courseware', u'Task'), (u'layered ontological paradigm', u'Method')], [(u'ontology-based layers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'courseware authoring architecture', u'Method'), (u'generic authoring tasks', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge classification and indexing mechanism', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'AIMS', u'Method'), (u'learning tasks', u'Task'), (u'Web-based learning/training environment', u'Task')], [(u'vertical layers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system architecture', u'Method'), (u'Author assisting layer and Operational layer', u'Task'), (u'ontological layers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Course ontology', u'Method'), (u'Domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'educational metadata layer', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'domain ontology creation process', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'concept-based domain authoring', u'Task'), (u'ontological support', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'Web courseware'), (u'layered ontological paradigm', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [(u'ontology-based layers', u'PART-OF', u'courseware authoring architecture')], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'learning tasks')], [(u'vertical layers', u'PART-OF', u'system architecture'), (u'Course ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Domain ontology')], [], [(u'generic tasks', u'USED-FOR', u'concept-based domain authoring'), (u'concept-based domain authoring', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontological support')]]
sentences: [u'This paper presents an approach to authoring support for Web courseware based on a layered ontological paradigm .', u'The ontology-based layers in the courseware authoring architecture serve as a basis for formal semantics and reasoning support in performing generic authoring tasks .', u'This approach represents an extension of our knowledge classification and indexing mechanism from a previously developed system , AIMS , aimed at supporting students while completing learning tasks in a Web-based learning/training environment .', u'We propose the addition of two vertical layers in the system architecture , Author assisting layer and Operational layer , with the role of facilitating the creation of the ontological layers ( Course ontology and Domain ontology ) and of the educational metadata layer .', u'Here we focus on the domain ontology creation process , together with the support that the additional layers can provide within this process .', u'We exemplify our method by presenting a set of generic tasks related to concept-based domain authoring and their ontological support .']

sentences: [u'El presente articulo tuvo como objetivo explorar las formas de vinculacion entre la Web Semantica y las relaciones consumidor-marca como base para la construccion , consolidacion y desarrollo del capital de marca , especialmente en el entorno de internet .', u'Para lograr este proposito , se planteo un cuerpo teorico basado en la revision documental de las caracteristicas que definen la Web Semantica y el paradigma relacional , como puente para plantear retos para el desarrollo de bases solidas de la relacion consumidor-marca en internet .', u'Reconociendo la naturaleza interdependiente de la creacion de valor por parte de los clientes que son entendidos como codesarrolladores de sus propias experiencias con la marca ; se vislumbran dos futuras tendencias de las relaciones consumidor-marca en internet : por un lado , la naturaleza en si misma de la relacion , ya que en el mundo virtual la identidad del consumidor es fragmentada y cambiante , lo que amerita una redefinicion de los procesos de segmentacion actualmente empleados ; y por el otro , el proceso mismo de dicha relacion , debido a que el consumidor percibe las relaciones basadas en la web como un medio para llegar a un fin y no un fin en si misma como hasta ahora se habia observado ; siendo dichos fines motivaciones individuales dentro del entorno colaborativo de internet .', u'Palabras clave : Web Semantica , Marca , Consumidor-marca , Mercadeo relacional .', u'THE SEMANTIC WEB : A NEW CONTEXT FOR CONSUMER-BRAND RELATIONSHIP ABSTRACT This study aims to explore ways of linking the Semantic Web and Consumer-Brand Relationship as a basis for the construction , consolidation and development of Brand Equity .', u'To achieve this purpose , we raised a body of theory based on documentary review of the defining characteristics of the Semantic Web and Relational Paradigm as a bridge to pose challenges for developing a solid foundation of Consumer-Brand on the Internet .', u"Recognizing the interdependent nature of value creation by customers are understood as co-developers of their own experiences with the brand ; two future trends are emerging in consumer-brand relationships online : On the one hand , nature the relationship itself , as in the virtual world `` identity '' of the consumer is fragmented and changing , which drives a redefinition of the current segmentation processes ; and on the other hand , the process of this relationship , because the consumer perceives relationships based on the web as a means to an end not an end in itself as so far been observed .", u'Key Word : Semantic Web , Brand , Consumer-Brand , Relational marketing LA WEB SEMANTICA : UN NUOVO CONTESTO PER LE RELAZIONI CONSUMATORE-MARCA RIASSUNTO La finalita di questo articolo e stata di esplorare le forme di vincolazione tra la Web Semantica e le Relazioni Consumatore Marca come base per la costruzione , consolidazione e sviluppo del Capitale di Marca , specialmente negli ambienti di Internet .', u'Per raggiungere questo proposito , si e enunciato un corpo teorico basato nella revisione documentale delle caratteristiche che definiscono la Web Semantica e il Paradigma Relazionale come ponte per stabilire sfide per lo sviluppo di basi solide sulla relazione Consumatore Marca in Internet ; allo stesso modo si riconosce la natura interdipendente della creazione del valore da parte dei clienti che sono riconosciuti come co-sviluppatori delle loro proprie esperienze con la marca .', u'Si intravedono due future tendenze nelle relazioni Consumatore Marca in Internet ; da una parte , la natura in se stessa della relazione , dato che nel mondo virtuale , lidentita del consumatore viene frammentata ed e cambiante .', u'Cio merita una redefinizione dei processi di segmentazione usati attualmente ; e , daltro canto , il processo stesso della suddetta relazione perche il consumatore percepisce le relazioni basate sulla web come un mezzo per raggiungere un fine e non un fine in se stesso come finora si era osservato considerando che queste fini sono motivazioni individuali dentro lambiente collaborativo di Internet .', u'Parole chiave : Web Semantica , Marca , Consumatore Marca , Marketing relazionale .']

sentences: [u"For the semantic service driven by user 's purpose , a personalized retrieval framework to its user is proposed.The weighted concept network ( WCN ) is adopted to represent the user profile.To express the actual requirements of users , conceptual graph is introduced to define the semantic relationship between concepts in query formally.The similarity algorithm between conceptual graph and WCN is proposed , too.The order of results is set twice before it is responded to users.The result set is more personalized.The experiment shows that the precision of the feedback has been improved efficiently ."]

entities: [[(u'ready-made software components', u'Method'), (u'systems', u'Generic')], [(u'software producers', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneous service environment', u'Method')], [(u'inconsistent service interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology-based approach', u'Method'), (u'semantic service annotation', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'ontology-based approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic service annotation')]]
sentences: [u'To develop a market for low-cost Smart Homes reuse of ready-made software components is an essential requirement to reduce the development costs of such systems .', u'Users will run services from a variety of different software producers , which will lead to a heterogeneous service environment .', u'Therefore one of the major challenges is to guarantee interoperability among inconsistent service interfaces .', u'In this paper we present an ontology-based approach to semantic service annotation , which we use for service matching and dynamic generation of service adapters .']

entities: [[(u'hierarchical semantic service case', u'Task'), (u'behavior restraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'similarity degree measurement', u'Method'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'interaction ontology', u'Method'), (u'Web service composition.The method', u'Method'), (u'Web service composition', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , a hierarchical semantic service case is outlined , which supports overall description of functionality , behavior restraints and features.An adaptable similarity degree measurement is proposed to retrieve a service case which is more similar to the target case and easier to be revised if necessary.Moreover , a method based on the interaction ontology is presented to realize dynamically revising service case to support Web service composition.The method of Web service composition proposed in this paper is proved to be feasible and effective by examinations .']

sentences: [u'Semantic service matchmaking plays an important role in web service discovery .', u'OWL-s provides rich annotations of web services and reasoning techniques to perform matchmaking on such annotations .', u'Due to open-world semantics of OWL-s , local closed-world reasoning can be introduced to the matchmaking process to improve the accuracy .', u'In this paper , we propose a matchmaking algorithm which combines both OWA and CWA and at the same time is able to handle inconsistent cases in the matching process , thus provide much flexibility .']

sentences: [u'So far , there have been few descriptions on creating structures capable of storing lexicographicdata , ISO 24613:2008 being one of the latest .', u'Another one is by Spohr ( 2012 ) , who designsa multifunctional lexical resource which is able to store data of different types of dictionaries in auser-oriented way .', u'Technically , his design is based on the principle of a hierarchical XML/OWL ( eXtensible Markup Language/Web Ontology Language ) representation model .', u'This article followsanother route in describing a model based on entities and relations between them ; MySQL ( usually referred to as : Structured Query Language ) describes a database system of tables containingdata and definitions of relations between them .', u"The model was developed in the context of theproject `` Scientific eLexicography for Africa '' and the lexicographic database to be built thereof willbe implemented with MySQL .", u"The principles of the ISO model and of Spohr 's model are adhered towith one major difference in the implementation strategy : we do not place the lemma in the centreof attention , but the sense description all other elements , including the lemma , depend on thesense description .", u'This article also describes the contained lexicographic data sets and how theyhave been collected from different sources .', u"As our aim is to compile several prototypical internetdictionaries ( a monolingual Northern Sotho dictionary , a bilingual learners ' XhosaEnglish dictionaryand a bilingual ZuluEnglish dictionary ) , we describe the necessary microstructural elementsfor each of them and which principles we adhere to when designing different ways of accessingthem .", u'We plan to make the model and the ( empty ) database with all graphical user interfaces thathave been developed , freely available by mid-2015 .', u"Keywords : African languages dictionaries , lexicographic model , macrostructure , microstructure , access structure , ISO24613:2008 , MySQL , multifunctional lexical resource 'n Algemene leksikografiese model vir 'n tipologiese verskeidenheid woordeboeke in Afrikatale Tot dusver bestaan daar min beskrywings oor hoe om strukture te skep wat daartoe in staat is om leksikografiese data te berg .", u'ISO 24613 2008 is een van die mees onlangse sodanige beskrywings .', u"Nog een , naamlik die van Spohr ( 2012 ) wat fokus op die ontwerp van 'n gebruikersgerigte multifunksionele leksikale bron , gebruik die voorstellingsmodel XML/OWL ( eXtensible Markup Language/Web Ontology Language ) wat in beginsel hierargies is .", u"In hierdie artikel word 'n ander roete gevolg om 'n model te beskryf wat gebaseer is op entiteite en hul onderlinge verhoudinge .", u"MySQL ( gewoonlik na verwys as Structured Query Language ) beskryf 'n databasisstelsel van tabelle wat data bevat en definisies van hulle onderlinge verhoudinge .", u"Die model is ontwikkel binne die konteks van die projek `` Scientific e-Lexicography for Africa '' en die databasis wat saamgestel word , sal met behulp van MySQL toegepas word .", u'Die beginsels van die ISO-model asook die van Spohr word gehandhaaf maar wel met een groot uitsondering in die implementeringstrategie : die lemma is naamlik nie sentraal in die bewerking nie , maar wel die beskrywing van betekenisonderskeidings alle ander elemente , met insluiting van die lemma , is afhanklik van die beskrywing van die betekenisonderskeidings .', u'Hierdie artikel bespreek ook die leksikografiese datastelle wat aangebied word en hoe hulle uit verskillende bronne versamel is .', u"Aangesien dit ons doel is om verskillende prototipiese internetwoordeboeke saam te stel ( 'n eentalige Noord-Sotho woordeboek , 'n tweetalige aanleerderswoordeboek Xhosa Engels en 'n tweetalige woordeboek ZoeloeEngels ) bespreek ons die noodsaaklike mikrostrukturele elemente vir elkeen van hierdie woordeboeke en watter beginsels gevolg word om verskillende maniere te ontwikkel om toegang tot hierdie woordeboeke te verkry .", u'Die plan is om die model en die ( lee ) databasis met al die grafiese koppelvlakke wat ontwikkel is teen die middel van 2015 gratis beskikbaar te stel .', sentences: [u'Since Sir Tim Berners-Lee announced the best practices to publish semantic data through the Web , Linked Data principles have been introduced into a wide variety of application domains .', u'This usage of Linked Data eases the enrichment of offered data in a grade that the semantic data that not applies the Linked Data principles never would achieve .', u'In this paper , we present LinkedQR , a tool to improve the collaboration between QR codes and Linked Data ; and a case study based on the tourism sector located into an art gallery .']

sentences: [u'This paper brings forward a novel semantic discovery approach based on the SEM ( Semantic Entropy Maximum ) .', u'This approach applies the entropy maximum algorithm to the matching and the recognizing of the semantic service , and meanwhile , it compares this algorithm with other related algorithms .', u'The results of those experiments show that the SEM ( semantic entropy maximum ) model has some preferable performances .', u'In a practical enterprise application of Chinese semantic recognition , the SEM model is proved to be useful and valuable in semantic recognition of Chinese .']

sentences: [u'First current semantic description languages which include OWL-S , WSDL-S and WSMO are introduced and compared in this paper .', u'Then the importance of the context for service description ( especially for a service requester ) is analyzed .', u'Based on the analysis we propose a new semantic service description ontology which aware context about a service request .', u'The match chart between requested service and provided service with context description is concluded .', u'Case study and applications in travel community show the effectiveness of this description and match in services discovery .']

sentences: [u'Background : Antimicrobial resistance has reached globally alarming levels and is becoming a major public health threat .', u'Lack of efficacious antimicrobial resistance surveillance systems was identified as one of the causes of increasing resistance , due to the lag time between new resistances and alerts to care providers .', u'Several initiatives to track drug resistance evolution have been developed .', u'However , no effective real-time and source-independent antimicrobial resistance monitoring system is available publicly .', u'Objective : To design and implement an architecture that can provide real-time and source-independent antimicrobial resistance monitoring to support transnational resistance surveillance .', u'In particular , we investigated the use of a Semantic Web-based model to foster integration and interoperability of interinstitutional and cross-border microbiology laboratory databases .', u'Methods : Following the agile software development methodology , we derived the main requirements needed for effective antimicrobial resistance monitoring , from which we proposed a decentralized monitoring architecture based on the Semantic Web stack .', u'The architecture uses an ontology-driven approach to promote the integration of a network of sentinel hospitals or laboratories .', u'Local databases are wrapped into semantic data repositories that automatically expose local computing-formalized laboratory information in the Web .', u'A central source mediator , based on local reasoning , coordinates the access to the semantic end points .', u'On the user side , a user-friendly Web interface provides access and graphical visualization to the integrated views .', u'Results : We designed and implemented the online Antimicrobial Resistance Trend Monitoring System ( ARTEMIS ) in a pilot network of seven European health care institutions sharing 70+ million triples of information about drug resistance and consumption .', u'Evaluation of the computing performance of the mediator demonstrated that , on average , query response time was a few seconds ( mean 4.3 , SD 0.110 2 seconds ) .', u'Clinical pertinence assessment showed that resistance trends automatically calculated by ARTEMIS had a strong positive correlation with the European Antimicrobial Resistance Surveillance Network ( EARS-Net ) ( = .86 , P < .001 ) and the Sentinel Surveillance of Antibiotic Resistance in Switzerland ( SEARCH ) ( = .84 , P < .001 ) systems .', u'Furthermore , mean resistance rates extracted by ARTEMIS were not significantly different from those of either EARS-Net ( = 0.130 ; 95 % confidence interval 0 to 0.030 ; P < .001 ) or SEARCH ( = 0.042 ; 95 % confidence interval 0.004 to 0.028 ; P = .004 ) .', u'Conclusions : We introduce a distributed monitoring architecture that can be used to build transnational antimicrobial resistance surveillance networks .', u'Results indicated that the Semantic Web-based approach provided an efficient and reliable solution for development of eHealth architectures that enable online antimicrobial resistance monitoring from heterogeneous data sources .', u'In future , we expect that more health care institutions can join the ARTEMIS network so that it can provide a large European and wider biosurveillance network that can be used to detect emerging bacterial resistance in a multinational context and support public health actions .', u'[ J Med Internet Res 2012 ; 14 ( 3 ) : e73 ]']

entities: [[(u'Big Data technologies', u'Method')], [(u'maximal value', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'datasets', u'Generic')], [], [(u'data representations', u'Method')], [(u'data', u'Generic'), (u'raw data', u'Material'), (u'large-scale analytics', u'Method')], [(u'Big Data environment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rich datasets', u'Material')], [(u'Big Data management infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'unified data access layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'analytic execution', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'domain models', u'Method'), (u'mutually relevant datasets', u'Material'), (u'graphical user interface', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain-model terms', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'prototype system', u'Generic'), (u'Power Generation Products Engineering Division', u'Method'), (u'gas turbine and component prototype test data', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'Big Data management infrastructure')], [(u'Semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'domain models'), (u'Semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'mutually relevant datasets'), (u'domain-model terms', u'USED-FOR', u'graphical user interface')], [(u'prototype system', u'USED-FOR', u'gas turbine and component prototype test data')], []]
sentences: [u'With the advent of Big Data technologies , organizations can efficiently store and analyze more data than ever before .', u'However , extracting maximal value from this data can be challenging for many reasons .', u'For example , datasets are often not stored using human-understandable terms , making it difficult for a large set of users to benefit from them .', u'Further , given that different types of data may be best stored using different technologies , datasets that are closely related may be stored separately with no explicit linkage .', u'Finally , even within individual data stores , there are often inconsistencies in data representations , whether introduced over time or due to different data producers .', u'These challenges are further compounded by frequent additions to the data , including new raw data as well as results produced by large-scale analytics .', u'Thus , even within a single Big Data environment , it is often the case that multiple rich datasets exist without the means to access them in a unified and cohesive way , often leading to lost value .', u'This paper describes the development of a Big Data management infrastructure with semantic technologies at its core to provide a unified data access layer and a consistent approach to analytic execution .', u'Semantic technologies were used to create domain models describing mutually relevant datasets and the relationships between them , with a graphical user interface to transparently query across datasets using domain-model terms .', u"This prototype system was built for GE Power & Water 's Power Generation Products Engineering Division , which has produced over 50TB of gas turbine and component prototype test data to date .", u'The system is expected to result in significant savings in productivity and expenditure .']

sentences: [u'The proliferation of Web Services ( WSs ) has given significant importance to the Quality of Service ( QoS ) in the discovery process .', u'This paper introduces a hybrid system which combines semantic technology and logic based reasoning ( i.e .', u'OpenCyc ) with numerical calculus to classify , evaluate and then recommend QoS aware WSs .', u'The system is able to answer high level composed functional and/or nonfunctional queries related to a real-life dataset containing 2500 WS , therefore enabling classification and recommendation of WSs .']

sentences: [u'The performance of ontology query has become one of the bottlenecks of the large-scale bulk applications .', u'Firstly OWL ontology files stored into the database in the form of triple table using Oracle 11g semantic technology .', u'And then we designed and implemented the ontology parting method based on horizontal segmentation .', u'Thirdly , several typical ontology query operations were achieved based on the multi-threading technology .', u'Experimental results show that the parallel query methods described herein significantly improve query performance .']

sentences: [u'The paper addresses the need for an ontology- and meaning-based approach for natural-language-understanding and information-processing computational systems .', u'After a discussion of an oft-ignored form/content dichotomy that offers an explicit understanding of what meaning is and is not , a specific approach , the Ontological Semantic Technology , is introduced and several aspects of meaning representation are addressed in its terms , including how the 1977 Tenerife fatal aircrash could have been prevented with its help .']

sentences: [u'We have considered the conceptual relations between different types of intelligence .', u'Thus , we define an unified intelligence environment within the organization , based on operational knowledge ( often inaccurate ) , called UIFOLOK ( Unified Intelligent Framework at Organizational Level based on Operational Knowledge ) stressing especially the connection between distributed AI ( the key element of semantic technology ) , collective intelligence and specific knowledge in the field , which is , according to the approach presented in this paper , the conceptual basis of Intelligent Systems in Economy ( ISE ) .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'large-scale phenomena'), (u'large-scale phenomena', u'CONJUNCTION', u'coarseresolution data sets')], [(u'high-performance analytics', u'USED-FOR', u'Tools'), (u'algorithms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Tools'), (u'algorithms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'high-performance analytics'), (u'network science', u'USED-FOR', u'algorithms'), (u'network science', u'CONJUNCTION', u'nonlinear dynamics'), (u'network science', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining'), (u'nonlinear dynamics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'statistics'), (u'nonlinear dynamics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining'), (u'nonlinear dynamics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'machine learning'), (u'statistics', u'USED-FOR', u'Tools'), (u'statistics', u'USED-FOR', u'algorithms'), (u'data mining', u'CONJUNCTION', u'machine learning'), (u'extreme events', u'CONJUNCTION', u'chaotic regimes')], [(u'end-user scientists', u'CONJUNCTION', u'computer and computational scientists'), (u'end-user scientists', u'CONJUNCTION', u'computing engineers'), (u'computer and computational scientists', u'CONJUNCTION', u'computing engineers'), (u'computer and computational scientists', u'CONJUNCTION', u'large-scale graph analytics'), (u'computing engineers', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic technologies'), (u'large-scale graph analytics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic technologies'), (u'large-scale graph analytics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge discovery algorithms'), (u'semantic technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge discovery algorithms')], [], [(u'data analytics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic technologies'), (u'semantic technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge discovery algorithms')], [(u'methods', u'CONJUNCTION', u'technologies')], []]
sentences: [u'Numerical simulation based science follows a new paradigm : its knowledge discovery process rests upon massive amounts of data .', u'Climate scientists generate data faster than can be interpreted and need to prepare for further exponential data increases .', u'Current analysis approaches are primarily focused on traditional methods , best suited for large-scale phenomena and coarseresolution data sets .', u'Tools that employ a combination of high-performance analytics , with algorithms motivated by network science , nonlinear dynamics and statistics , as well as data mining and machine learning , could provide unique insights into challenging features of the Earth system , including extreme events and chaotic regimes .', u"The breakthroughs needed to address these challenges will come from collaborative efforts involving several disciplines , including end-user scientists , computer and computational scientists , computing engineers , and mathematicians. # R # # N # # R # # N # The SC11 Climate Knowledge Discovery workshop at Supercomputing '11 brought together experts from various domains to investigate the use and application of large-scale graph analytics , semantic technologies and knowledge discovery algorithms in climate science .", u'The workshop was the second in a series of planned workshops , the first workshop being held in Hamburg in March 2011. # R # # N # # R # # N # The goal of the workshop was to provide more than a broad overview of the topic , but establish a platform for the ongoing discussions in this field .', u'It was designed to be highly interactive to concentrate on the challenges facing the climate community : `` What steps are required to realize the potential of data analytics , semantic technologies and knowledge discovery algorithms in climate science ?', u'Where methods and technologies already exist , how can they be leveraged ?', u"Where gaps are identified , what steps must be taken to address them ? ''"]

entities: [[(u'Web of Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'3D graphics capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'W3C technology stack', u'Method'), (u'3D content', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Web3D-based user interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'geospatial and encyclopedic data sources', u'Material'), (u'Web3D rendering', u'Task')], [(u'highlevel requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data-driven design pattern', u'Method'), (u'REST architecture principles', u'Method')], [(u'Web technologies', u'Method'), (u'distributed application', u'Task'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], []]
relations: [[], [], [(u'3D graphics capabilities', u'USED-FOR', u'eort')], [], [], [(u'REST architecture principles', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data-driven design pattern')], [(u'Web technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed application')], []]
sentences: [u'The Web of Data has grown to a size of several billion triples and provides human interface opportunities and challenges beyond those of the traditional Web .', u'Although Linked Data is now generated at a fast pace and very large scale , we observe that browsing and visualisation of Linked Data is still in its infancy .', u'In parallel to the enormous boost in Linked Data , recent work on integrating 3D graphics capabilities into the W3C technology stack provides fresh momentum for an eort to extend the Web with 3D content and technologies .', u'In light of the timid uptake and consumption of Linked Data by non-technical audiences , we make the case for Web3D-based user interfaces to the Web of Data and aim at promoting synergistic research in the Web3D and Web of Data communities .', u'To that end , we describe a scenario that requires the combination of Linked Data from geospatial and encyclopedic data sources and the transformation of the combined Linked Data into a format amenable to Web3D rendering .', u'Based on the scenario , we derive highlevel requirements and propose a Linked Data-driven design pattern based on REST architecture principles that satises the requirements .', u'Our prototypical implementation shows that a combination of current Web technologies is sucient to implement distributed application that ultimately arrive at Web3D renderings of Linked Data .', u'Based on the experiments , we identify and discuss areas which require further research .']

sentences: [u'Research on ontology is increasingly becoming widespread in the computer science community.But the manual construction of ontology is a time-consuming task and easily leads to the bottleneck of knowledge acquisition.Ontology learning aims at the integration of a multitude of disciplines such as ontology engineering techniques and machine learning techniques to construct the ontology ( semi ) automatically.There are different ontology learning approaches according to the type of input : ontology learning from text , from knowledge base , from structured-data , from semi-structured data and from unstructured data.Ontology learning from text is mainly introduced.The key technologies of ontology learning from text are presented , including learning content , learning approach , learning tool , learning process and system evaluation.Authors especially introduce the statistical method , lexico-syntactic pattern method and formal concept analysis method and simply analyze the advantage and disadvantage of these methods .']

entities: [[(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge discovery ( KD ) process', u'Task'), (u'CRISP-DM process model', u'Method')], [(u'OntoDM-KDD', u'Method'), (u'data mining investigations', u'Task'), (u'KD', u'Task'), (u'two-layered ontological structure', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'scientific investigations', u'Task'), (u'Information Artifact Ontology', u'Task'), (u'Ontology of Biomedical In- vestigations', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'pro- cesses', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'OntoDM-KDD', u'Method'), (u'annotation of DM investigations', u'Task')], [(u'ontol- ogy', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Method'), (u'domain resources', u'Material')], [(u'OntoDM-KDD', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'OntoDM-KDD', u'USED-FOR', u'data mining investigations'), (u'en- tities', u'USED-FOR', u'data mining investigations')], [(u'Information Artifact Ontology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'scientific investigations'), (u'Information Artifact Ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Ontology of Biomedical In- vestigations'), (u'Ontology of Biomedical In- vestigations', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'scientific investigations')], [], [(u'OntoDM-KDD', u'USED-FOR', u'annotation of DM investigations')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this article , we present an ontology for representing the knowledge discovery ( KD ) process based on the CRISP-DM process model ( OntoDM-KDD ) .', u'OntoDM-KDD defines the most essential en- tities for describing data mining investigations in the context of KD in a two-layered ontological structure .', u'The ontology is aligned and reuses state-of-the-art resources for representing scientific investigations , such as Information Artifact Ontology ( IAO ) and Ontology of Biomedical In- vestigations ( OBI ) .', u'It provides a taxonomy of KD specific actions , pro- cesses and specifications of inputs and outputs .', u'OntoDM-KDD supports the annotation of DM investigations in application domains .', u'The ontol- ogy has been thoroughly assessed following the best practices in ontology engineering , is fully interoperable with many domain resources and easily extensible .', u'OntoDM-KDD is available at http : //www.ontodm.com .']

entities: [[(u'Kali-ma NeOn Toolkit plugin', u'Method'), (u'C-ODO Light model', u'Method'), (u'plugins', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Kali-ma', u'Method'), (u'reasoning methods', u'Method'), (u'ontology design tools', u'Method'), (u'criteria', u'Generic'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Method'), (u'activities', u'Generic'), (u'NeOn Methodology', u'Method')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'Kali-ma support', u'Method'), (u'third-party plugins', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semiautomatic generation of C-ODO Lightbased plugin descriptions', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'This chapter presents the Kali-ma NeOn Toolkit plugin , which exploits the versatility of the C-ODO Light model to assist ontology engineers and project managers in locating , selecting , and accessing other plugins through a unified , shared interaction mode .', u'Kali-ma offers reasoning methods for classifying and categorizing ontology design tools with a variety of criteria , including collaborative aspects of ontology engineering and activities that follow the NeOn Methodology .', u'Furthermore , it provides means for storing selections of tools and associating them directly to development projects so that they can be shared and ported across systems involved in common engineering tasks .', u'In order to boost Kali-ma support for third-party plugins , we are also offering an online service for the semiautomatic generation of C-ODO Lightbased plugin descriptions .']

sentences: [u'This paper introduces the development of linked data , describes the 9 best practices of publishing and providing data recommended by W3C and LOD communities.It also concludes the necessity of knowledge discovery in linked data and the model to implement knowledge discovery in linked data , it discusses the works and objectives each step of the model in detail .']

sentences: [u'This is the second part of a large survey paper in which we analyze recent literature on Formal Concept Analysis ( FCA ) and some closely related disciplines using FCA .', u'We collected 1072 papers published between 2003 and 2011 mentioning terms related to Formal Concept Analysis in the title , abstract and keywords .', u'We developed a knowledge browsing environment to support our literature analysis process .', u'We use the visualization capabilities of FCA to explore the literature , to discover and conceptually represent the main research topics in the FCA community .', u'In this second part , we zoom in on and give an extensive overview of the papers published between 2003 and 2011 which applied FCA-based methods for knowledge discovery and ontology engineering in various application domains .', u'These domains include software mining , web analytics , medicine , biology and chemistry data .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge acquisition bottleneck', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'Light-weight processes', u'Task'), (u'collaborative knowledge engineering', u'Task')], [(u'HANNE', u'Method'), (u'holistic application', u'Method'), (u'Navigational Knowledge Engineering', u'Task'), (u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'expressive knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'navigation', u'Task')], [(u'HANNE', u'Method'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material')], [(u'formal OWL class expressions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'scalable Iterative Machine Learning approach', u'Method')], [(u'class expressions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'expressive OWL ontology', u'Method'), (u'navigation suggestions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hierarchy', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Light-weight processes', u'USED-FOR', u'collaborative knowledge engineering')], [(u'HANNE', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'holistic application'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'expressive knowledge'), (u'navigation', u'USED-FOR', u'expressive knowledge')], [(u'HANNE', u'USED-FOR', u'domain experts')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Although research towards the reduction of the knowledge acquisition bottleneck in ontology engineering is advancing , a central issue remains unsolved : Light-weight processes for collaborative knowledge engineering by a massive user base .', u'In this demo , we present HANNE , a holistic application that implements all necessary prerequisites for Navigational Knowledge Engineering and thus reduces the complexity of creating expressive knowledge by disguising it as navigation .', u'HANNE enables users and domain experts to navigate over knowledge bases by selecting examples .', u'From these examples , formal OWL class expressions are created and refined by a scalable Iterative Machine Learning approach .', u'When saved by users , these class expressions form an expressive OWL ontology , which can be exploited in numerous ways : as navigation suggestions for users , as a hierarchy for browsing , as input for a team of ontology editors .']

sentences: [u"Ontologies , since its formal definition in the 90 's up to its effective usage with the advent of methods and processes from the Ontology Engineering , have received important attention in projects that demand the formalization of shared knowledge among applications and users .", u'In this context , it is important to popularize and to make people able to create and use them .', u'This article presents an ontology capture method , providing apparatus to conceptualize and identify the treated domain .', u'The proposed method is capable to provide metrics and guidelines so that an ontology engineer can identify and organize the elements of a domain , finding fundamental ontological relations among them .', u'A descriptive algorithm is shown to formalize the wished process and some examples are given to better exemplify the utilization of the proposed ontology capture method .']

sentences: [u'Developing automated decision making systems means dealing with knowledge in every possible manner .', u'One of the most important points of developing artificial intelligent systems is developing a precise knowledge base with integrating self-learning mechanisms .', u'Moreover using knowledge in expert systems or decision support systems it is necessary to document knowledge and make it visible for managing it .', u'Main goal of this work is finding a suitable solution for modeling knowledge bases in automated decision making systems concerning both illustrating specific knowledge and learning mechanisms .', u'There are a lot of different terms describing this kind of research , such as knowledge modeling , knowledge engineering or ontology engineering .', u'For that reason this paper provides a comparison of the technical terms in this domain by illustrating similarities , specifics and how they are used in literature .']

entities: [[(u'Modularity', u'Method'), (u'collaborative ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'distributed ontology reuse', u'Task'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'Modern ontology languages', u'Material'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'semantics of ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'logic-based notion of modularity', u'Method'), (u'modeler', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'restrictions', u'Generic'), (u'external signature', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'syntactic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"`` black-box '' behavior", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Analysis of real-world ontologies', u'Task'), (u'restrictions', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'Modularity', u'USED-FOR', u'collaborative ontology engineering')], [], [(u'logic-based notion of modularity', u'USED-FOR', u'modeler')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Modularity is a key requirement for collaborative ontology engineering and for distributed ontology reuse on the Web .', u'Modern ontology languages , such as OWL , are logic-based , and thus a useful notion of modularity needs to take the semantics of ontologies and their implications into account .', u'We propose a logic-based notion of modularity that allows the modeler to specify the external signature of their ontology , whose symbols are assumed to be defined in some other ontology .', u"We define two restrictions on the usage of the external signature , a syntactic and a slightly less restrictive , semantic one , each of which is decidable and guarantees a certain kind of `` black-box '' behavior , which enables the controlled merging of ontologies .", u'Analysis of real-world ontologies suggests that these restrictions are not too onerous .']

sentences: [u'In this paper , we propose a series of applications that represent a system family for processing Research Data .', u"The whole system is a model of complete data flow of `` research '' , from data capturing , processing , until intelligent data analysis .", u'Data engineering , Software Engineering , Domain Engineering and Ontology Engineering are used for the development of the system .', u'We also described tools and technologies to be used in building the system .', u"The prototype of a small scale system has been built as a proof of concept of this family of system , for the domain of `` Research '' in Indonesian context .", u'The aim of building this prototype are : ( a ) to provide an architectural description prototype of a knowledge repository where Indonesian Context Research as a central domain ( b ) to comprehend a software engineering for software system family .']

sentences: [u'We propose a Parallel Class Expression Learning algorithm that is inspired by the OWL Class Expression Learner ( OCEL ) and its extension -- - Class Expression Learning for Ontology Engineering ( CELOE ) -- - proposed by Lehmann et al .', u'in the DL-Learner framework .', u'Our algorithm separates the computation of partial definitions from the aggregation of those solutions to an overall complete definition , which lends itself to parallelisation .', u'Our algorithm is implemented based on the DL-Learner infrastructure and evaluated using a selection of datasets that have been used in other ILP systems .', u'It is shown that the proposed algorithm is suitable for learning problems that can only be solved by complex ( long ) definitions .', u'Our approach is part of an ontology-based abnormality detection framework that is developed to be used in smart homes .']

entities: [[(u'ontology engineers', u'Method'), (u'domain expert', u'Method'), (u'OWL ontology', u'Method'), (u'knowledge model', u'Method')], [(u'task', u'Generic'), (u'ontology debugging systems', u'Method'), (u'reasoners', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering tools', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineers', u'Method'), (u'precision', u'Metric')], [(u'anti-patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology debugging', u'Task'), (u'debugging tools', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'ontology engineers', u'CONJUNCTION', u'domain expert')], [(u'ontology debugging systems', u'USED-FOR', u'task'), (u'ontology debugging systems', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology engineering tools'), (u'reasoners', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology engineering tools')], [(u'anti-patterns', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology debugging'), (u'debugging tools', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology debugging')]]
sentences: [u'Debugging of inconsistent OWL ontologies is normally a tedious and time-consuming task where a combination of ontology engineers and domain expert is often required to understand whether the changes to be performed in order to make the OWL ontology consistent are actually changing the intended meaning of the original knowledge model .', u'This task is aided by existing ontology debugging systems , incorporated in existing reasoners and ontology engineering tools , which ameliorate this problem but in complex cases are still far from providing adequate support to ontology engineers , due to lack of efficiency or lack of precision in determining the main causes for inconsistencies .', u'In this paper we describe a set of anti-patterns commonly found in OWL ontologies , which can be useful in the task of ontology debugging in combination with those debugging tools .']

relations: [[(u'holy Quran', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Holy Books of God')], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'Keyword search', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Information Retrieval ( IR ) methods')], [], [(u'topic modeling techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'framework'), (u'topic modeling techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search'), (u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search')], [], [(u'Holy Quran', u'USED-FOR', u'chapter Joseph')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The holy Quran is one of the Holy Books of God .', u'It is considered one of the main references for an estimated 1.6 billion of Muslims around the world .', u'The Holy Quran language is Arabic .', u'Specialized as well as non-specialized people in religion need to search and lookup certain information from the Holy Quran .', u'Most research projects concentrate on the translation of the holy Quran in different languages .', u'Nevertheless , few research projects pay attention to original text of the holy Quran in Arabic language .', u'Keyword search is one of the Information Retrieval ( IR ) methods but will retrieve what is called exact search .', u'Semantic search aims at finding deeper meanings of a text , and it is a hot field of study in Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) .', u'In this paper topic modeling techniques are explored to setup a framework for semantic search in the holy Quran .', u'As the Holy Quran is the word of God , its meanings are unlimited .', u'In this paper the words of chapter Joseph ( Peace Be Upon Him ( PBUH ) ) from the Holy Quran is analyzed based on topic modeling techniques as a case study .', u'Latent Dirichlet Allocation ( LDA ) topic modeling technique has been applied in this paper into two structures ( Hizb Quarters and verses ) of Joseph chapter as : words , roots and stems .', u'The log-Likelihood has been calculated for the two structures of the chapter .', u'Results show that the best structure to use is verses , which gives the least energy for data .', u'Some of the results of the attained topics are shown .', u'These results suggest that topic modeling techniques failed to capture in an accurate manner the coherent topics of the chapter .']

sentences: [u'People who collect content by human power and create criticism are called curators .', u'Recently , the number of music curators has been increasing .', u"However , it is often difficult to discover a music curator suited to the user 's personal taste .", u'Fortunately , linked data , which involve a large network structure to link data , exist .', u'Using a Linked Data Semantic Distance algorithm that utilized linked data , Passant calculated the distance between different pieces of music .', u"In this paper , we propose a method for recommending a music curator who suits the user 's taste using linked data .", u"A link structure is formed using the listening history of the user , the music curator 's musical criticism data , and music information data .", u'We calculate the distance between the user and the music curator using the linked data .']

sentences: [u'Publishing Linked Data is a process that involves several design decisions and technologies .', u'Although some initial guidelines have been already provided by Linked Data publishers , these are still far from covering all the steps that are necessary ( from data source selection to publication ) or giving enough details about all these steps , technologies , intermediate products , etc .', u'Furthermore , given the variety of data sources from which Linked Data can be generated , we believe that it is possible to have a single and unied method for publishing Linked Data , but we should rely on dierent techniques , technologies and tools for particular datasets of a given domain .', u'In this paper we present a general method for publishing Linked Data and the application of the method to cover dierent sources from dierent domains .']

sentences: [u'This paper treats methodology to build linked data from the relationships between facial action units and their states as emotional parameters for the facial emotion recognition .', u'In this paper , the authors are especially focusing on building action unit-based linked data because it will be possible not only to use the data for the facial emotion recognition but also to enhance the usefulness of the data by merging them with other linked data .', u'Although in general , the representation as linked data seems to make the accuracy of the facial emotion recognition lower than others , in practically the proposed method that uses action unit-based linked data has almost the same accuracy for the facial emotion recognition as those of other approaches like using Artificial Neural Network and using Support Vector Machine .']

sentences: [u'This study aims at developing a web service with Japanese Linked Data and evaluating the service .', u"In Japan , government sets Open Data as a new strategy in Information Technology field and focuses on `` Linked Open Data LOD '' [ 1 ] as a means to publish .", u'However , the number of dataset as Japanese Linked Data is small , and the effect by introducing Japanese Linked Data has not been shown yet .', u"Therefore , we created Linked Data in Japanese focused on geographical or positional data , and implemented a mobility service to reduce user 's cognitive load .", u'Moreover , we conducted verification experiment for using the service and compared with conventional services .', u'As a result , the possibilities of Linked Data to respond to various queries easily and to apply for information services by crossing some domains were explored .']

entities: [[(u'ontology development tools', u'Method'), (u'debugging support', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'entailments of OWL ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'minimal subsets', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'debugging and understanding tasks', u'Task')], [], [], [(u'biomedical ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'NCBO BioPortal', u'Material')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'structural features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user effort', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology engineering process', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'minimal subsets', u'USED-FOR', u'debugging and understanding tasks')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Current ontology development tools offer debugging support by presenting justifications for entailments of OWL ontologies .', u'While these minimal subsets have been shown to support debugging and understanding tasks , the occurrence of multiple justifications presents a significant cognitive challenge to users .', u'In many cases even a single entailment may have many distinct justifications , and justifications for distinct entailments may be critically related .', u'However , it is currently unknown how prevalent significant numbers of multiple justifications per entailment are in the field .', u'To address this lack , we examine the justifications from an independently motivated corpus of actively used biomedical ontologies from the NCBO BioPortal .', u'We find that the majority of ontologies contain multiple justifications , while also exhibiting structural features ( such as patterns ) which can be exploited in order to reduce user effort in the ontology engineering process .']

relations: [[(u'Natural language techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'Ontology Engineering')], [], [], [], [(u'natural language techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology evaluation')], [(u'natural language techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology evaluation process')], [(u'language-based enhancement', u'USED-FOR', u'pitfall detection process')]]
sentences: [u'Natural language techniques play an important role in Ontology Engineering .', u'Developing ontologies in a manual fashion is a complex and time consuming process , which implies the participation of domain experts and ontology engineers to build and evaluate them .', u'Natural language techniques traditionally help to ( semi ) automatically build ontologies and to populate them .', u'However , the general trends for evaluating ontologies are mainly expert reviewing , evaluating quality dimensions and criteria , and evaluating against existing ontologies and set of common errors .', u'That is , the use of natural language techniques in ontology evaluation is not widely spread .', u'Thus , in this paper we aim at the use of natural language techniques during the ontology evaluation process .', u'In particular , we propose a first attempt towards a language-based enhancement of the pitfall detection process within the ontology evaluation tool OOPS ! .']

sentences: [u'The paper introduces a new paradigm for Industrial Symbiosis by pioneering the use of ontology engineering in the field .', u'Semantics are used to model Industrial Symbiosis flows , to model enabling technologies and to systematise the development of a matching service .', u'Combined with a systems engineering approach , semantics further combine tacit knowledge from Industrial Symbiosis experts with explicit knowledge from Industrial Symbiosis participants .', u'The new approach promises systematic venues to discoveries , innovative solutions , and a holistic methodology in the development of Industrial Symbiosis networks .', u'The paradigm has been implemented as a multilingual web service to support Industrial Symbiosis communities and to embrace small and medium enterprises that are currently side-lined from developments .', u'The approach has been tested and validated using real-life data and its functions are demonstrated with illustrative examples .']

sentences: [u'An ontology is a formal description of concepts and relationships that can exist for a community of human and/or machine agents .', u'The notion of ontologies is crucial for the purpose of enabling knowledge sharing and reuse .', u'The Handbook on Ontologies provides a comprehensive overview of the current status and future prospectives of the field of ontologies considering ontology languages , ontology engineering methods , example ontologies , infrastructures and technologies for ontologies , and how to bring this all into ontology-based infrastructures and applications that are among the best of their kind .', u"The field of ontologies has tremendously developed and grown in the five years since the first edition of the `` Handbook on Ontologies '' .", u'Therefore , its revision includes 21 completely new chapters as well as a major re-working of 15 chapters transferred to this second edition .']

sentences: [u'Todo lo que dabamos por establecido esta cambiando de manera vertiginosa .', u'Un tema que parece estar especialmente agitado en estos dias es el vinculo entre las personas y los datos : the data .', u'Los ciudadanos empiezan a ser conscientes de que el conocimiento y tratamiento de datos publicos no es un privilegio limitado al uso exclusivo de las administraciones sino un derecho de todos , que puede permitir transformar el modelo de gobernanza publica y ademas , generar todo un nuevo sector economico en torno a el .', u'Necesitamos verdaderas plataformas de OpenData en la Web para mirar al futuro .', u'OpenData implica que se conecten los datos a nivel semantico y por lo tanto sera la semilla del nuevo paradigma de la Web , la Web Semantica .', u'Si somos capaces de aprovechar la oportunidad que las iniciativas OpenData y los desarrollos de web semantica nos brindan , se convertiran en una autentica oportunidad de transformacion social y economica .', u'All that we took for granted is changing dramatically .', u"One issue that seems to be especially interesting in these days is the link between people and data , `` the data '' .", u'Citizens are becoming aware that the knowledge and treatment of public data is not a privilege limited to the exclusive use of the governments but a right of everyone , which may allow transforming public governance model and also create a whole new industry around it .', u'We need effective OpenData platforms to face the future .', u'OpenData enables connection the data at the semantic level and therefore it will be the seed of the new paradigm of the Web , the Semantic Web .', u'If we can get the chance that OpenData initiatives and semantic web developments give us , it will become a huge opportunity for genuine social and economic transformation .']

entities: [[(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'news articles', u'Material')], [(u'event-centric information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'episodic situational knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'interoperable RDF format', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'unstructured text', u'Material'), (u'structured knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formal model', u'Method')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'skeleton', u'Generic'), (u'interoperable interpretation', u'Task')], [(u'multilingual and cross-lingual knowledge resources', u'Material')], [(u'knowledge resources', u'Material'), (u'episodic situational knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'NLP', u'Task')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'episodic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge acquisition', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'high-level components', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'tasks', u'Generic')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'news articles', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'In this article , we describe a system that reads news articles in four different languages and detects what happened , who is involved , where and when .', u'This event-centric information is represented as episodic situational knowledge on individuals in an interoperable RDF format that allows for reasoning on the implications of the events .', u'Our system covers the complete path from unstructured text to structured knowledge , for which we defined a formal model that links interpreted textual mentions of things to their representation as instances .', u'The model forms the skeleton for interoperable interpretation across different sources and languages .', u'The real content , however , is defined using multilingual and cross-lingual knowledge resources , both semantic and episodic .', u'We explain how these knowledge resources are used for the processing of text and ultimately define the actual content of the episodic situational knowledge that is reported in the news .', u'The knowledge and model in our system can be seen as an example how the Semantic Web helps NLP .', u'However , our systems also generate massive episodic knowledge of the same type as the Semantic Web is built on .', u'We thus envision a cycle of knowledge acquisition and NLP improvement on a massive scale .', u'This article reports on the details of the system but also on the performance of various high-level components .', u'We demonstrate that our system performs at state-of-the-art level for various subtasks in the four languages of the project , but that we also consider the full integration of these tasks in an overall system with the purpose of reading text .', u'We applied our system to millions of news articles , generating billions of triples expressing formal semantic properties .', u'This shows the capacity of the system to perform at an unprecedented scale .']

sentences: [u"The Federal Aviation Administration ( FAA ) is ob- serving an increasing number of incidents involving recreational drones , and imagining a future where every drone will be equipped with an Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast ( ADS-B ) transponder that communicates and cooperates with the FAA 's Next Generation ( NextGen ) Aviation Cyber-Physical System in order to help mitigate aerial collision risk ( 1 ) .", u'This exemplar application involves human or autonomous agents interacting within some sort of cyber-physical system where competition or cooperation between cyber-physical elements exist .', u"We anticipate that the use of higher-level abstractions will be required for modeling human or autonomous agent 's interactions within these type of systems in order to make sense of the observations derived from sensor-data .", u'In this paper , we articulate an approach that uses event semantics to represent the temporal , spatial , factor , and outcome features of activities generated by competing or cooperating agents functioning within a cyber-physical environment .', u'We use those semantics , along with observations of activity , to model higher-level activity abstractions and to help perform strategy recognition from a concrete , competition-oriented scenario reflected in a real-world , game data set comprised of more than a half million events involving nearly 8500 unique agents .', u'The strength of the approach is grounded in a specification of event semantics for our concrete multi-agent , competitive game ontology using Resource Description Frame- work Schema ( RDFS ) and Ontology Web Language ( OWL ) .', u'By leveraging these Semantic Web languages , we anticipate that the use of event semantics to describe cooperative or competitive agent interactions within cyber-physical systems will become more predominant in the future .', u'Index TermsAgent-Based Model , Human Agent , Au- tonomous Agent , Unmanned Aerial Vehicle , Gridiron Football , Semantic Web']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'outdated data', u'Material')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'domain', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'online education', u'Task')], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'up-to-date data', u'Material')], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic')]]
sentences: [u'Emergence of Linked Data has made it possible to make sense of huge data that is scattered all over the web , and link data from multiple heterogeneous sources .', u'This leads to the challenge of maintaining the quality and integrity of Linked Data , i.e. , ensuring outdated data is removed and latest data is included .', u'The focus of this paper is devising strategies to effectively integrate data from multiple sources , publish it as Linked Data , and maintain the quality of Linked Data .', u'The domain used in the study is online education .', u'We present the integration of data from various MOOC providers and algorithms for incrementally updating linked data to maintain their quality in order to constantly keep the users engaged with up-to-date data .', u'Experimental results of the evaluation of the algorithms are presented .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Linked Data Retrieval Model', u'Method')], [(u'MAiP score', u'Metric'), (u'SLDRM', u'Method')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'supplementary retrieval components', u'Method'), (u'query templates', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'INDRI Query Language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'logic mapping structure', u'Method'), (u'retrieving linked data', u'Task'), (u'linked data resources', u'Material')], [(u'INEX 2013 Linked Data Track', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'SLDRM', u'Method')], [(u'experiental system', u'Method'), (u'MAiP score', u'Metric'), (u'INEX 2013 Linked Data Track', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'In this paper we introduce some latest proposed methods to improve the performance of our Semantic Linked Data Retrieval Model ( SLDRM ) .', u'Continuing to our previous research , we actually aim to enhance the MAiP score of SLDRM .', u'The ideas of our improved methods are based on following processing : 1 ) adding supplementary retrieval components to variant types of query templates in INDRI Query Language , 2 ) defining logic mapping structure for retrieving linked data , and 3 ) extending linkages to several linked data resources .', u'The recommended data and evaluation method of INEX 2013 Linked Data Track are used in building and assessing our experimental system based on improved SLDRM .', u'Based on these improvements , new experiental system achieves a MAiP score higher than our old system and other published systems of INEX 2013 Linked Data Track .']

sentences: [u'Varias bibliotecas a nivel mundial usan tecnologias Linked Data para mejorar la visualizacion de sus datos y enlaces a fuentes externas .', u'Existe poca informacion integrada para facilitar la difusion de estas nuevas tecnologias en nuestro pais .', u'Contar con un curso en linea permitira una mejor difusion y uso de estas tecnologias entre los profesionales informaticos de habla hispana .', u'El estudio cubre el analisis de metodologias y estrategias de uso de Linked Data en bibliotecas digitales , el analisis , diseno e implementacion del curso sobre Linked Data y Bibliotecas Digitales esta dirigido a profesionales informaticos , y se cubrira en un tiempo estimado de dedicacion de 40 horas .', u'Se disenaran objetos de aprendizaje elaborados en 5 unidades didacticas que cubren principalmente los temas de : Modulo 1 : Fundamentos y Principios de Linked Data , Modulo 2 : Consultas Linked Data ( SPARQL ) , Modulo 3 : Produccion y Exposicion de Linked Data , Modulo 4 : Linked Data en bibliotecas digitales , Modulo 5 : Arquitectura de Aplicaciones de Linked .', u'Se realiza el desarrollo del proyecto usando herramientas como Moodle , Openshift , Open Refine entre otras y usando las metodologias ADDIE y SCRUM .', u'Finalmente se presentan los resultados de la ensenanza obtenidos mediante encuestas a los estudiantes y las calificaciones obtenidas por los mismos .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'linked data', u'USED-FOR', u'exploratory search')], [(u'methodological and empirical underpinning', u'USED-FOR', u'user study')], [(u'linked data browser', u'USED-FOR', u'user browsing'), (u'domain ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'datasets')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'It is becoming increasingly popular to expose government and citywide sensor data as linked data .', u'Linked data appears to offer a great potential for exploratory search in supporting smart city goals of helping users to learn and make sense of complex and heterogeneous data .', u'However , there are no systematic user studies to provide an insight of how browsing through linked data can support exploratory search .', u'This paper presents a user study that draws on methodological and empirical underpinning from relevant exploratory search studies .', u'The authors have developed a linked data browser that provides an interface for user browsing through several datasets linked via domain ontologies .', u'In a systematic study that is qualitative and exploratory in nature , they have been able to get an insight on central issues related to exploratory search and browsing through linked data .', u'The study identifies obstacles and challenges related to exploratory search using linked data and draws heuristics for future improvements .', u'The authors also report main problems experienced by users while conducting exploratory search tasks , based on which requirements for algorithmic support to address the observed issues are elicited .', u'The approach and lessons learnt can facilitate future work in browsing of linked data , and points at further issues that have to be addressed .']

sentences: [u"Le developpement rapide du Web semantique est lie a la specification de plus en plus d'ontologies .", u'Celles-ci permettent de modeliser des connaissances agreees par des communautes de personnes concernant des domaines ou des tches specifiques .', u'Le meme domaine decrit par deux communautes distinctes sera modelise de facon differente .', u'Les # N # systemes cooperatifs visent a rendre les informations provenant de differentes sources disponibles au-dela de leurs divergences .', u'Pour cela , ils doivent aligner , fusionner ou integrer ces ontologies .', u'La decouverte de mappings est un point cle dans la resolution efficace des heterogeneites entre ontologies .', u"Nous developpons une architecture qui connecte des systemes d'information via des ontologies , avec comme objectif la resolution de requetes complexes .", u'Le but de notre article est de decrire les grandes lignes de cette architecture , apres avoir presente la methodologie utilisee pour mettre en correspondance les diverses ontologies rencontrees .', u'The rapid development of the semantic Web is associated with the specification of various ontologies which formally represent agreements of communities of people on specific domains or tasks .', u'The same knowledge formalized by # N # different people leads to heterogeneous representations .', u'Cooperative systems , which aim to make knowledge from various sources available in spite of their heterogeneities , need to align , merge or integrate the ontologies used to model the information sources .', u'Furthermore , the resolution of differences among ontologies is necessary to process queries or use web services in distributed heterogeneous environments .', u'Mapping discovery is a key issue to allow efficient resolution of heterogeneity .', u'We develop an architecture for mapping different systems associated with ontologies .', u'In this paper we present # N # the key components and the underlying concepts of a framework and approach for comparing and matching different ontologies .', u"Keywords : Mappings , ontologies , web semantique , calcul de similarite estimation\\ ' Mappings , ontology , semantic web , similarity estimation .", u"Journal des Sciences Pour l\\'Ingenieur .", u'Vol .', u'7 2006 : pp .', u'64-71']

sentences: [u'Processing the excessive volumes of information on the Web is an important issue .', u'The Semantic Web paradigm has been proposed as the solution .', u'However , this approach generates several challenges , such as query processing and optimisation .', u'This paper proposes a novel approach for optimising SPARQL queries with different graph shapes .', u'This new method reorders the triple patterns using Ant Colony Optimisation ( ACO ) algorithms .', u'Reordering the triple patterns is a way of decreasing the execution times of the SPARQL queries .', u'The proposed approach is focused on in-memory models of RDF data , and it optimises the SPARQL queries by means of Ant System , Elitist Ant System and MAX-MIN Ant System algorithms .', u'The approach is implemented in the Apache Jena ARQ query engine , which is used for the experimentation , and the new method is compared with Normal Execution , Jena Reorder Algorithms , and the Stocker et al .', u'Algorithms .', u'All of the experiments are performed using the LUBM dataset for various shapes of queries , such as chain , star , cyclic , and chain-star .', u'The first contribution is the real-time optimisation of SPARQL query triple pattern orders using ACO algorithms , and the second contribution is the concrete implementation for the ARQ query engine , which is a component of the widely used Semantic Web framework Apache Jena .', u'The experiments demonstrate that the proposed method reduces the execution time of the queries significantly .', u'HighlightsAn approach for optimising SPARQL SELECT queries with different graph shapes and different number of triple patterns.Ant Colony Optimisation algorithms are used to optimise the queries.The approach is implemented in the Apache Jena ARQ query engine.Experiments are performed using the LUBM dataset for various shapes of queries.The experiments demonstrate that the proposed method reduces the execution time of the queries significantly .']
