sentences: [u"Functional programming techniques are becoming increasingly important in data-centric programming : languages like Haskell , Scala and C # draw heavily on a range of functional techniques and find application in numerous data-driven domains ; functional paradigms like map/reduce and its extensions lie at the core of modern scalable data processing ; and `` information-rich '' languages like Ur , F # and Gosu use metaprogramming to integrate type-safe queries , web-based APIs and scalable data sources along with associated semantically-rich metadata into the programming language .", u'In principle , the expressiveness , strong typing and core functional paradigm of these languages make them an ideal choice for expressing robust and scalable data-centric programming. # R # # N # # R # # N # However , many challenges remain .', u'We live in an information rich world .', u'Programming languages are not designed for this .', u'On the programming side , as the world moves into ubiquitous computing with devices and services , it is vital that developers can productively integrate information at internet-scale into their everyday programming environment .', u'On the information side , as the web continues to grow with linked data and open data resources being made available more broadly by government agencies ( e.g .', u'World Bank ) and communities ( e.g .', u'Freebase ) it becomes even more important to have the tools and mechanisms to make sense of the data. # R # # N # # R # # N # The goal of the Data Driven Functional Programming Workshop 2013 is to discuss , promote , and advance the use of functional programming in information-rich data spaces -- - including the development of new programming and data-manipulation systems and the extension of existing ones .', u"By devising methods for handling data from the programming level , we can promote the research and development of better functional programming technologies as a whole , as well as facilitate the shift towards both principled and effective data-centric computing. # R # # N # # R # # N # The papers included in the proceedings explore the area of data-centric programming in the light of today 's data challenges , particularly with a view to the application of functional programming and metaprogramming techniques .", u'Research projects and short papers explore the following topics : # R # # N # Formal systems that capture the essential theoretical elements of data-centric programming # R # # N # Experimental systems that demonstrate novel data-centric programming techniques # R # # N # Technology that demonstrate correctness , scalability , productivity , robustness or maintainability of data-centric programs # R # # N # Schema evolution , schema-type mapping , query languages , probabilistic programming , networkconnected programming or semi-structured data # R # # N # Programming-related aspects of knowledge representation techniques including the database theory , ontology techniques and linked data. # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # New views and opinions , coming from the functional programming and semantic web communities , address some of the following questions : # R # # N # How to effectively explore , navigate , understand , analyze and present data to the developer # R # # N # What are the necessary tools and language features needed to help streamline the developer experience # R # # N # How to easily access and query linked data # R # # N # How to seamlessly integrate and manipulate diverse datasets # R # # N # How to help humans make sense of semantically-rich data # R # # N # How to address schema evolution , schema-type mapping , query languages , probabilistic programming ? # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # In addition , the program includes a keynote , a tutorial on Information-rich Programming and a panel on Next Generation Data-Driven Programming .', u'We hope that these proceedings will help promote the discussion among the data-driven research and the functional programming communities .']

sentences: [u'EuropeanaConnect New Technologies for Europeana ( translation of the title ) .', u'The EU project EuropeanaConnect ( May 2009 October 2011 ) , a Best Practice Network co-funded by the European Commission as part of the eContentplus programme , unified 30 institutions from 14 Europeana countries and delivered technical key components for an improved and user-friendly Europeana .', u'Europeana is the innovative internet gateway offering access to Europes digital cultural heritage represented by millions of digitised books , writings , maps , videos , images and audio files .', u'By 2011 , 21 million digital objects from numerous national , local and thematic cultural institutions have been made accessible through this portal .', u'EuropeanaConnect together with its sister project Europeana v1.0 ( both ended in 2011 ) has been working on a series of back-end solutions for Europeana .', u'These include the implementation of a multilingual search , the development of user-friendly interfaces and the implementation of innovative services such as access from mobile devices .', u"A multimedia annotation service is available as prototype in the `` ThoughtLab '' of Europeana .", u'In addition , EuropeanaConnect worked on the integration of semantic search options .', u'The project held a leading role in the development of a new metadata schema called Europeana Data Model ( EDM ) .', u'This new schema facilitates semantic search in Europeana .', u'EuropeanaConnect also contributed largely to the Europeana Licensing Framework , which represents a milestone for the cooperation with content providers as it regulates main issues in terms of metadata provision , use and licensing .', u'Moreover EuropeanaConnect was the largest audio aggregator for Europeana .', u'By the end of the project 300,000 music files from more than 500 European audio archives were aggregated .', u'The article presents main achievements of the EuropeanaConnect project .']

entities: [[(u'Industrial Symbiosis', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Method')], [(u'Semantics', u'Method'), (u'Industrial Symbiosis flows', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'matching service', u'Task')], [(u'systems engineering approach', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'tacit knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'holistic methodology', u'Method'), (u'Industrial Symbiosis networks', u'Method')], [(u'paradigm', u'Generic'), (u'multilingual web service', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'real-life data', u'Material'), (u'illustrative examples', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'Industrial Symbiosis flows')], [], [(u'holistic methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'Industrial Symbiosis networks')], [(u'multilingual web service', u'USED-FOR', u'Industrial Symbiosis communities')], [(u'real-life data', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')]]
sentences: [u'The paper introduces a new paradigm for Industrial Symbiosis by pioneering the use of ontology engineering in the field .', u'Semantics are used to model Industrial Symbiosis flows , to model enabling technologies and to systematise the development of a matching service .', u'Combined with a systems engineering approach , semantics further combine tacit knowledge from Industrial Symbiosis experts with explicit knowledge from Industrial Symbiosis participants .', u'The new approach promises systematic venues to discoveries , innovative solutions , and a holistic methodology in the development of Industrial Symbiosis networks .', u'The paradigm has been implemented as a multilingual web service to support Industrial Symbiosis communities and to embrace small and medium enterprises that are currently side-lined from developments .', u'The approach has been tested and validated using real-life data and its functions are demonstrated with illustrative examples .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge modeling', u'Method'), (u'plant sciences', u'Task'), (u'phenotypic expression', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'crop- or clade-specific plant trait ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'plant traits', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'food security', u'Task')], [(u'trait related data', u'Material')], [(u'species-neutral and overarching Reference Plant Trait Ontology', u'Method'), (u'disparate knowledge domains', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data integration', u'Task'), (u'data mining', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontology engineering', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge modeling'), (u'Ontology engineering', u'USED-FOR', u'plant sciences'), (u'knowledge modeling', u'USED-FOR', u'plant sciences')], [(u'crop- or clade-specific plant trait ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'plant traits'), (u'food security', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'scientific challenges')], [], [(u'data integration', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining')]]
sentences: [u'Ontology engineering and knowledge modeling for the plant sciences is expected to contribute to the understanding of the basis of plant traits that determine phenotypic expression in a given environment .', u'Several crop- or clade-specific plant trait ontologies have been developed to describe plant traits important for agriculture in order to address major scientific challenges such as food security .', u'We present three successful species and/or clade-specific ontologies which address the needs of crop scientists to quickly access a wide range of trait related data , but their scope limits their interoperability with one another .', u'In this paper , we present our vision of a species-neutral and overarching Reference Plant Trait Ontology which would be the basis for linking the disparate knowledge domains and that will support data integration and data mining across species .']

entities: [[(u'geodata harmonisation', u'Task')], [(u'Geodata harmonisation', u'Method'), (u'over- coming heterogeneities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'syntactic , schematic and se-mantic levels', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user interaction', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic interoperability level', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u"domain 's conceptual schemas", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'visual analysis', u'Task'), (u'geospatial instances', u'Material'), (u'spe- cific interaction guidance processes', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'HUMBOLDT Alignment Editor', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'over- coming heterogeneities', u'USED-FOR', u'Geodata harmonisation')], [], [(u'geospatial instances', u'CONJUNCTION', u'spe- cific interaction guidance processes')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper gives an introduction to concepts for a better expert knowl- edge extraction for geodata harmonisation .', u'Geodata harmonisation involves over- coming heterogeneities on the syntactic , schematic and se-mantic levels , but user interaction is mostly required for the semantic interoperability level .', u"Conse- quently , the goal is to provide tools to geo-domain experts which allow them to use their knowledge to describe the conceptual schemas of their domain as well as alignments to other domain 's conceptual schemas in a sufficiently expressive way without be-coming experts in ontology engineering .", u'We describe an approach for this that includes both visual analysis on the basis of geospatial instances and spe- cific interaction guidance processes .', u'Based on this approach , a prototypical im- plementation of a tool called the HUMBOLDT Alignment Editor ( HALE ) is in- troduced .']

entities: [[(u'wiki-based collaborative environment', u'Method'), (u'semi-automatic incremental building of ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'platform', u'Generic'), (u'terminology extraction', u'Task'), (u'domain-specific textual corpora', u'Material'), (u'pre-existing structured and semi-structured information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'user-friendly wiki architecture', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge engineers', u'Method'), (u'ontology building process', u'Task')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'environmental ontology', u'Method')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge extraction', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'wiki-based collaborative environment', u'USED-FOR', u'semi-automatic incremental building of ontologies')], [(u'platform', u'USED-FOR', u'system'), (u'component', u'PART-OF', u'system')], [], [], [(u'knowledge extraction', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology engineering')]]
sentences: [u'We present a wiki-based collaborative environment for the semi-automatic incremental building of ontologies .', u'The system relies on an existing platform , which has been extended with a component for terminology extraction from domain-specific textual corpora and with a further step aimed at matching the extracted concepts with pre-existing structured and semi-structured information .', u'The system stands on the shoulders of a well-established user-friendly wiki architecture and it enables knowledge engineers and domain experts to collaborate in the ontology building process .', u'We have performed a task-oriented evaluation of the tool in a real use case for incrementally constructing the missing part of an environmental ontology .', u'The tool effectively supported the users in the task , thus showing its usefulness for knowledge extraction and ontology engineering .']

entities: [[(u'enology field', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'wine domain', u'Material'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fermentation process', u'Method'), (u'grape maturity state', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'wine characteristics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'classification system', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic')], [(u'knowledge acquisition', u'Task'), (u'conceptualization', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'phases', u'Generic')], [(u'enology field', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'wine domain')], [], [(u'knowledge acquisition', u'CONJUNCTION', u'conceptualization'), (u'conceptualization', u'CONJUNCTION', u'formalization')], [], [(u'features', u'USED-FOR', u'system')]]
sentences: [u'Several attempts have been made to structure and systematize the enology field .', u'This work proposes a new ontology for the wine domain according to several features : ( i ) maceration ; ( ii ) fermentation process ; ( iii ) grape maturity state ; ( iv ) wine characteristics ; ( v ) classification system according to country ; and ( vi ) region where the wine was produced .', u'This work describes how this ontology was built by non-ontology engineering experts from scratch .', u'The development process followed four phases : ( i ) knowledge acquisition ; ( ii ) conceptualization ; ( iii ) formalization ; and ( iv ) evaluation .', u'Some of these phases occurred simultaneously ( for example , evaluation was done in all phases ) .', u'The final outcome was an useful and comprehensive ontology in the enology field , which we plan to use in a system that allows searching for wines using any combination of features .']

sentences: [u'In 2001 Tim Berners-Lee revealed to the world what he # R # # N # wanted for the future of Web - man and machine working # R # # N # together to develop complex tasks , and that the Web could # R # # N # leverage the way human knowledge is acquired .', u'Since then # R # # N # researchers from different fields of knowledge have engaged # R # # N # in scientific and empirical research to make this dream come # R # # N # true .', u'In this context , the research problem of this article is # R # # N # established : What is the current situation of Semantic Web # R # # N # research in Brazil in Information Science ?', u'Who are the researchers of this theme in our country ?', u'What are the institutions that support these studies ?', u'The present study aimed at # R # # N # listing the most productive authors , institutions that support # R # # N # their research and the specific issues of their investigations. # R # # N # We conducted a literature review in Base de Dados Referencial de Artigos de Periodicos em Ciencia da Informacao # R # # N # ( BRAPCI ) .', u'We retrieved 41 articles , excluded five for not # R # # N # belonging to Brazilian authors and Brazilian institutions. # R # # N # From the analysis of this corpus , we realized the need to include additional keywords to better understanding of specific # R # # N # studies encompassed by the theme .', u'Thus , we included the # R # # N # keywords : SPARQL , SKOS , RDF and ontology .', u'It was concluded that the studies on the Semantic Web under the aegis # R # # N # of Information Science mostly perform theoretical and philosophical studies , while the computer science professionals # R # # N # seek practical applications of the topic .', u'It was also concluded # R # # N # that a study including other databases could reveal other authors and institutions relevant to the subject of study .']

sentences: [u'The goal of the present research is to define a Semantic Web framework for precedent modelling , by using knowledge extracted from text , metadata , and rules , while maintaining a strong text-to-knowledge morphism between legal text and legal concepts , in order to fill the gap between legal document and its semantics .', u'The framework is composed of four different models that make use of standard languages from the Semantic Web stack of technologies : a document metadata structure , modelling the main parts of a judgement , and creating a bridge between a text and its semantic annotations of legal concepts ; a legal core ontology , modelling abstract legal concepts and institutions contained in a rule of law ; a legal domain ontology , modelling the main legal concepts in a specific domain concerned by case-law ; an argumentation system , modelling the structure of argumentation .', u'The input to the framework includes metadata associated with judicial concepts , and an ontology library representing the structure of case-law .', u'The research relies on the previous efforts of the community in the field of legal knowledge representation and rule interchange for applications in the legal domain , in order to apply the theory to a set of real legal documents , stressing the OWL axioms definitions as much as possible in order to enable them to provide a semantically powerful representation of the legal document and a solid ground for an argumentation system using a defeasible subset of predicate logics .', u'It appears that some new features of OWL2 unlock useful reasoning features for legal knowledge , especially if combined with defeasible rules and argumentation schemes .', u'The main task is thus to formalize legal concepts and argumentation patterns contained in a judgement , with the following requirement : to check , validate and reuse the discourse of a judge - and the argumentation he produces - as expressed by the judicial text .']

sentences: [u'The efficient authoring of learning content is a central problem of courseware engineering .', u'Courseware authors will appreciate the benefits of tools which automate various authoring tasks .', u'We describe a system , OntAWare , which # R # # N # provides an environment comprising a set of software tools that support learning content authoring , management and delivery .', u'This system exploits an opportunity provided by the emerging technologies of the Semantic Web movement , most notably knowledge-representation standards and knowledge-processing techniques .', u'The system represents a combination of these newer developments with earlier work in # R # # N # areas such as artificial intelligence ( AI ) and intelligent tutoring systems ( ITS ) .', u'A key feature of the authoring environment is the semi-automatic generation of standard e-learning and other courseware elements ( learning objects ) .', u'Widely available standardised knowledge representations ( ontologies ) and ontology-structured content are used as source material .', u'Standard courseware elements are produced by the application of graph transformations to these ontologies .', u'The resulting products can be hosted by standards-compliant delivery environments .', u'Adaptivity is an important characteristic of the system as a whole .', u'Authors can select and customise new or existing subject ontologies and employ an appropriate teaching/learning strategy in the generation of learning objects .', u'Instructors can configure the delivery environment either to offer strictly sequenced presentations to students , or to allow also varying degrees of free student navigation , based on the the runtime incorporation of domain ontologies .', u"Students in turn can take the generated courses in the preconfigured delivery environment , and this delivery is dynamically customised to the individual student 's preferences and constantly monitored learning track .", u'The combination of the semi-automatic generation of learning objects with an adaptive delivery environment is a central feature of this new system .', u'Keywords : courseware generation , Semantic Web , ontology , learning object , adaptivity .']

relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'concept network', u'USED-FOR', u'web resources'), (u'concept network', u'USED-FOR', u'information resources')], [(u'Topic Maps ISO 13250', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ISO standard')], [], [(u'resources structure', u'USED-FOR', u'TM-Builder')], [], [], [(u'XML abstraction layer', u'USED-FOR', u'topic map')], [], [(u'topic maps', u'USED-FOR', u'XML documents'), (u'XSTM', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'XML documents')], [(u'XSL processor', u'USED-FOR', u'Extractor')]]
sentences: [u'Everyday a huge number of new information resources are linked to the web .', u'This way the web is growing very fast , making search tasks more and more difficult with worse results .', u'To solve the problem several initiatives were undertaken and a new area of research and development emerged : the one called Semantic Web .', u'When we refer to the semantic web we are thinking about a network of concepts .', u'Each concept has a group of related resources and can be related to other concepts ; we can then use this concept network to navigate among web resources or simply among information resources .', u'From the undertaken initiatives one became an ISO standard : Topic Maps ISO 13250 .', u'The aim of this paper is to introduce a Topic Map ( TM ) Builder , that is a processor that extracts topics and relations from instances of a family of XML documents .', u'A TM-Builder is strongly dependent on the resources structure .', u'So , to extract a topic map for different collections of information resources ( sets of documents with different structures ) we have to implement several TM-Builders , one for each collection .', u'This is not very easy !', u'To overcome this inconvenient we have created an XML abstraction layer for TM-Buildersthat enables us to specify the topic map we want to build from a concrete family of resources , in order to generate automatically the intended extractor .', u'To describe that process , i.e .', u'the extraction of knowledge from XML documents to produce a TM , we present a language to specify topic maps for a class of XML documents , that we call XSTM ( XML Specification for Topic Maps ) .', u'We also discuss a XSL processor that automatically generates the Extractor from its formal specification written in XSTM , the XSTM-P .']

sentences: [u'The article deals with and discusses two main approaches in building semantic structures for electrophysiological metadata .', u'It is the use of conventional data structures , repositories , and programming languages on one hand and the use of formal representations of ontologies , known from knowledge representation , such as description logics or semantic web languages on the other hand .', u'Although knowledge engineering offers languages supporting richer semantic means of expression and technological advanced approaches , conventional data structures and repositories are still popular among developers , administrators and users because of their simplicity , overall intelligibility , and lower demands on technical equipment .', u'The choice of conventional data resources and repositories , however , raises the question of how and where to add semantics that can not be naturally expressed using them .', u'As one of the possible solutions , this semantics can be added into the structures of the programming language that accesses and processes the underlying data .', u'To support this idea we introduced a software prototype that enables its users to add semantically richer expressions into a Java object-oriented code .', u'This approach does not burden users with additional demands on programming environment since reflective Java annotations were used as an entry for these expressions .', u'Moreover , additional semantics need not to be written by the programmer directly to the code , but it can be collected from non-programmers using a graphic user interface .', u'The mapping that allows the transformation of the semantically enriched Java code into the Semantic Web language OWL was proposed and implemented in a library named the Semantic Framework .', u'This approach was validated by the integration of the Semantic Framework in the EEG/ERP Portal and by the subsequent registration of the EEG/ERP Portal in the Neuroscience Information Framework .']

sentences: [u'Thousands of biochemical interactions are available from public sources in the Biological Pathways Exchange ( BioPAX ) format .', u'However , the current standard for exchange of simulation-ready biological models is System Biology Markup Language ( SBML ) .', u'This markup language is structurally and semantically different from BioPAX .', u'Some conversion schemes exist , using annotations and based on simple one-to-one mappings between SBML and BioPAX objects , which ignores semantic differences and therefore often leads to significant loss of information or meaning .', u'A comprehensive modeling framework capable of representing the complex relationships between SBML and BioPAX data is needed to take full advantage of existing pathway data in kinetic modeling , thus integrating these two formats by gluing them together.Here we describe such a framework that we are developing as a part of the Virtual Cell ( http : //vcell.org ) modeling and simulation environment .', u'Systems Biology Linker ( SyBiL , http : //vcell.org/biopax ) is a tool for analyzing and visualizing BioPAX data , and converting them to SBML .', u'Based on the Jena Semantic Web framework for Java , SyBiL supports handling of generic RDF/OWL data ( such as visualization and reasoning ) as well as functions specific to handling SBML and BioPAX data .', u'SyBiL uses Systems Biology Pathway eXchange , called SBPAX , as a generic approach to integrate model-centric formats similar to SBML with pathway-centric formats similar to BioPAX .', u'SBPAX is an OWL-based schema that serves as a glue to integrate different data formats , despite semantic differences .', u'Effectively , SBPAX provides a bridge between SBML and the Semantic Web world .', u'SyBiL offers various visualization modes showing reaction networks to varying degrees of details , including displaying nodes for reactions only as well as displaying Petri nets consisting of reaction nodes and reaction participants and catalysts .']

sentences: [u'The need for vocabularies such as ontologies , classification schemes and thesauri for information discovery and the Semantic Web has been well recognized and established .', u'Due to a large number of different vocabularies , related services , and a variety of potential applications and contexts , the need has appeared for terminology registries.A terminology registry lists , describes , identifies and points to sets of vocabularies available for use in information systems and services .', u'It can cover free and publicly available , fee-based and restricted , or organisation-internal vocabularies .', u'The registry allows discovery of suitable schemes for information or , potentially , use , by exposing rich metadata about them for navigation and retrieval .', u'Terminology registries can hold vocabulary level information only , or comprise the member terms , concepts and relationships as well , and also list services based on terminology such as automatic classification , term expansion , disambiguation , translation , semantic reasoning .', u'Registries should , if used as a digital infrastructure service , make their content available for both comfortable human inspection and for machine-to-machine ( m2m ) accessThere are several registries in its basic form , i.e. , only listing vocabularies , such as freely available HILTs ( HILT ) or commercial Taxonomy Warehouses ( Taxonomy Warehouse ) .', u"In the United States , National Science Digital Library Metadata Registry ( NSDL Registry ) started being developed to provide services to developers and consumers of controlled vocabularies and is one of the first production deployments of the RDF-based Semantic Web Community 's Simple Knowledge Organization System ( SKOS ) .This study was initiated by UKs Joint Information Systems Committee ( JISC ) and involves two partners , UKOLN , and University of Glamorgan .", u'Its purpose is to analyse issues related to the potential delivery of a terminology registry as a shared infrastructure service within the UKs further and higher educations information environment .', u'It will consider how a registry might support development of terminology and other services within the context of a services-oriented environment .']

sentences: [u'In this dissertation we design a system that allows Semantic Web agents to reason within what has come to be known as the Web of Trust .', u'We integrated reasoning about belief and trust , so agents can reason about information from different sources and deal with contradictions .', u'Software agents interact to support users who publish , share and search for documents in a distributed repository .', u'Each agent maintains an individualized topic taxonomy for the user it represents , updating it with information obtained from other agents .', u'Additionally , an agent maintains and updates trust relationships with other agents .', u'When new information leads to a contradiction , the agent performs a belief revision process informed by a degree of belief in a statement and a degree of trust an agent has for the information source .', u'# R # # N # The system described has several key characteristics .', u'First , we define a formal language with well-defined semantics within which an agent can express the relevant conditions of belief and trust , and a set of inference rules .', u'The language uses symbolic labels for belief and trust intervals to facilitate expressing inexact statements about subjective epistemic states .', u'Second , an agents belief set at a given point in time is modeled using a Dynamic Reasoning System ( DRS ) .', u'This allows the agents knowledge acquisition and belief revision processes to be expressed as activities that take place in time .', u'Third , we explicitly describe reasoning processes , creating algorithms for acquiring new information and for belief revision .', u'Fourth , we design a general architecture for system implementation .', u'An object-oriented model presents classes and methods implementing the formal model .', u'The database model is flexible and allows for future extensions .', u'Finally , an external representation for system data is presented based on open Semantic Web standards .']

sentences: [u'The projects essential objective is to develop a new ERP system , of homogeneous nature , based on XML structures , as a possible replacement for classic ERP systems .', u'The criteria that guide the objective definition are modularity , portability and Web connectivity .', u'This objective is connected to a series of secondary objectives , considering that the technological approach will be filtered through the economic , social and legislative environment for a validation-by-context study .', u'Statistics and cybernetics are to be used for simulation purposes .', u'The homogeneous approach is meant to provide strong modularity and portability , in relation with the n-tier principles , but the main advantage of the model is its opening to the semantic Web , based on a Small enterprise ontology defined with XML-driven languages .', u'Shockwave solutions will be used for implementing client-oriented hypermedia elements and an XML Gate will be de-fined between black box modules , for a clear separation with obvious advantages .', u'Security and the XMLTP project will be an important issue for XML transfers due to the conflict between the open architecture of the Web , the readability of XML data and the privacy elements which have to be preserved within a business environment .', u'The projects finality is oriented on small business but the semantic Web perspective and the surprising new conflict between hierarchical/network data structures and relational ones will certainly widen its scope .', u'The proposed model is meant to fulfill the IT compatibility requirements of the European environment , defined as a knowledge society .', u"The paper is a brief of the contributions of the team re-search at the project type A applied to CNCSIS `` Research on the Role of XML in Building Extensible and Homogeneous ERP Systems '' ."]

sentences: [u'We introduce period names , a new approach for quantitative and qualitative temporal representation and reasoning of resources in the Semantic Web .', u'Our work has been implemented into the Bremen University Semantic Translator for Enhanced Retrieval ( BUSTER ) .', u'This enables us to perform a query of the form concept @ location in time .', u'Motivation and requirements An important part of search in the Web is time-dependent .', u'The W3C recommends a standard that is machine oriented , limited to single points in time , and offers neither meaningful labels nor qualitative relations .', u'Humans however , make use of these features very often .', u'There is thus a need for the development of a new temporal representation scheme and a reasoning engine .', u'A small study of online news articles from BBC News and The New York Times revealed that the temporal terms can be classified into the following groups : ( a ) Qualitative vs. quantitative .', u'The qualitative altervative covers terms like now and for a long time , whereas the quantitative altervative covers terms like on 21 November and in the last year .', u'( b ) Absolute vs. relative .', u'The absolute altervative includes terms like in 2001 and beginning of November , whereas the relative altervative covers terms like earlier or in two months .', u'Taking this into account , requirements for temporal annotation ( and reasoning ) in the Semantic Web can be formulated : a ) Intuitive labelling : label time intervals with intuitive names .', u'b ) Boundaries : boundaries of time intervals should be flexible .', u'The required types are exact , fuzzy , persistent , and unknown .', u'c ) Structures : an interval can be based on another interval , can be self-defined or imported .', u'Functions ( e.g .', u'earliest beginning of ) are needed to extract the significant time points from the intervals .', u'd ) Explicit qualitative relations : relations between intervals are needed when using persistent or unknown boundaries .']

entities: [[(u'data semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Umesh Dayal', u'Material')], [], [(u'data semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'Databases', u'Material'), (u'data semantics problem', u'Task')], [(u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'data semantics problem', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'Data Semantics Revisited', u'Method')], [(u'Springer-Verlag LNCS', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u"Two panels , held at SIGMOD'98 ( Seattle , June 4 ) and CAiSE'98 ( Pisa , June 11 ) , discussed the topic of data semantics and its place in Databases research in the next millennium .", u"The first , titled Next Generation Database Systems Wo n't Work Without Semantics included as panelists Philip Bernstein , Umesh Dayal , John Mylopoulos ( chair ) , Sham Navathe and Marek Rusinkiewicz .", u"The second one , titled Data Semantics Ca n't Fail This Time !", u'included as panelists Michael Brodie , Stefano Ceri , John Mylopoulos ( chair ) , and Arne Solvberg. # R # # N # # R # # N # Atypically for panels , participants to both discussions generally agreed that data semantics will be the problem for Databases researchers to tackle in the near future .', u'Stefano Ceri summed up well the sentiments of the discussions by declaring that # R # # N # # R # # N # ...', u"The three most important research problems in Databases used to be Performance ' , Performance ' , and Performance ' ; in years to come , the three most important and challenging problems will be Semantics ' , Semantics ' , and Semantics ' ... # R # # N # # R # # N # What is the data semantics problem ?", u'In what sense did it fail in the past ?', u"... And why did the experts agree unanimously that the situation was about to change ? # R # # N # # R # # N # We review the data semantics problem and its long history in Databases research , noting the reasons why solutions of the past wo n't work in the future .", u'We then review recent work on the Semantic Web and the directions it is taking .', u'Finally , we sketch two new directions for research on data semantics. # R # # N # # R # # N # This presentation is based on : # R # # N # # R # # N # Borgida , A. , Mylopoulos , J. : Data Semantics Revisited .', u"In : Proceedings VLDB Workshiop on The Semantic Web and Databases ( SWDB'04 ) , Toronto , August , ( 2004 ) , Springer-Verlag LNCS , ( to appear . )"]

sentences: [u'The explosive growth of the World Wide Web ( WWW ) has resulted in intricate Web sites , demanding for tools and methods to complement user skills in the task of searching for the desired information .', u'In this context Web usage mining techniques have been developed for the discovery and analysis of frequent navigation patterns from Web server logs , which can be used as input for recommendation engines .', u'Web usage mining techniques have been associated with Web content mining approaches in order to increase the accuracy of recommendation mechanisms .', u'Existing approaches represent Web pages content essentially by means of keywords , N-grams or ontologies of concepts , being , therefore , incapable of capturing the semantic information and the relationships among pages at the semantic level .', u'Herein , we propose a method that combines usage patterns extracted from server logs with detailed semantic data that characterizes the content of the corresponding pages .', u'Thus , a method to extract and analyze frequent semantic navigation patterns which are fed into a recommendation engine is proposed .', u'We argue that by integrating usage and Web pages detailed semantic information in the personalization process we will be able to increase the recommendation accuracy .', u'The proposed method is an example of semantic Web mining that combines two fast developing research areas ; Semantic Web and Web Usage Mining .', u'We conducted an extensive experimental evaluation that provides strong evidence that the recommendation accuracy increases with the integration of semantic and usage data .', u'The results show that the proposed method is able to achieve 15-17 % better accuracy than a usage based model , 5-7 % better than a N-gram based model and 4-6 % better than a ontology based model .', u'Also the proposed method is able to address the new item problem of solely usage based techniques by augmenting navigation patterns with newly added pages in a Web site']

sentences: [u'Resumen En este articulo se presenta los resultados obtenidos en el proyecto de investigacion que tiene como objetivo la construccion de una ontologia sobre los trabajos de grado de los estudiantes de pregrado de la Universidad de Narino ( Colombia ) , utilizando la herramienta de software libre Protege .', u'Esta ontologia denominada Sawa , permite soportar la busqueda inteligente de informacion sobre trabajos de grado .', u'La metodologia contemplo cuatro fases .', u'En la primera fase se apropio el conocimiento sobre web semantica , Ontologias y la herramienta Protege .', u'En la segunda fase se diseno y definieron los diferentes componentes de la ontologia Sawa .', u'En la tercera fase , se implemento la ontologia Sawa con la herramienta libre Protege y finalmente en la ultima fase se realizaron pruebas y se evaluaron los resultados .', u'De acuerdo a los resultados obtenidos , la ontologia Sawa se podria ajustar al dominio de la biblioteca de la Universidad de Narino para ser utilizada como soporte a la busqueda inteligente de cualquier material bibliografico .', u'Palabras Clave : Web semantica , ontologia , Protege .', u'Abstract This paper presents the results of the research project that aims to build of ontology on the work of grade undergraduate students at the Universidad de Narino ( Colombia ) , using Free Software tool Protege .', u'This ontology called Sawa , allows intelligent search support information degree work .', u'The methodology contained four phases .', u'In the first phase appropriated knowledge on the semantic web , Ontologies and Protege tool .', u'In the second phase was designed and defined the different components of the ontology Sawa .', u'In the third phase , Sawa was implemented ontology with Protege free tool and finally in the last stage were tested and evaluated the results .', u'According to the results , the ontology Sawa was feasible to adjust to the domain of the library of the Universidad de Narino to be used as intelligent search support any library materials .', u'Keywords : Semantic Web , ontology , Protege .']

sentences: [u'The success and proliferation of the Semantic Web depends heavily on construction of Web ontologies .', u'However , classical ontology construction approaches are not sufficient for handling imprecise and uncertain information that is commonly found in many application domains .', u'Therefore , great efforts on construction of fuzzy ontologies have been made in recent years .', u'In particular , XML is imposing itself as a standard for representing and exchanging information on the Web , topics related to the modeling of fuzzy data have become very interesting in the XML data context .', u'Therefore , constructing fuzzy ontologies from fuzzy XML data resources may make the existing fuzzy XML data upgrade to Semantic Web contents , and the constructed fuzzy ontologies may be useful for improving some fuzzy XML applications .', u'This paper proposes a formal approach and an automated tool for constructing fuzzy ontologies from fuzzy XML data resources .', u'Firstly , we propose a formal definition of fuzzy XML models ( including the document structure fuzzy DTDs and the document content fuzzy XML documents ) .', u'On this basis , we propose a formal approach for constructing fuzzy ontologies from fuzzy XML models , i.e. , transforming a fuzzy XML model ( including fuzzy DTD and fuzzy XML document ) into a fuzzy ontology .', u'Also , we give the proof of correctness of the construction approach , and provide a detailed construction example .', u'Furthermore , we implement a prototype tool called FXML2FOnto , which can automatically construct fuzzy ontologies from fuzzy XML models .', u'Finally , in order to show that the constructed fuzzy ontologies may be useful for improving some fuzzy XML applications , we focus on investigating how to reason on fuzzy XML models ( e.g. , conformance , inclusion , and equivalence ) based on the constructed fuzzy ontologies , and it turns out that the reasoning tasks of fuzzy XML models can be checked by means of the reasoning mechanism of fuzzy ontologies .']

sentences: [u"Introduction : Both for curricular development and mapping , as well as for orientation within the mounting supply of learning resources in medical education , the Semantic Web ( `` Web 3.0 '' ) poses a low-threshold , effective tool that enables identification of content related items across system boundaries .", u'Replacement of the currently required manual with an automatically generated link , which is based on content and semantics , requires the use of a suitably structured vocabulary for a machine-readable description of object content .', u'# R # # N # # R # # N # Aim of this study is to compile the existing taxonomies and ontologies used for the annotation of medical content and learning resources , to compare those using selected criteria , and to verify their suitability in the context described above. # R # # N # # R # # N # Methods : Based on a systematic literature search , existing taxonomies and ontologies for the description of medical learning resources were identified .', u'Through web searches and/or direct contact with the respective editors , each of the structured vocabularies thus identified were examined in regards to topic , structure , language , scope , maintenance , and technology of the taxonomy/ontology .', u'In addition , suitability for use in the Semantic Web was verified. # R # # N # # R # # N # Results : Among 20 identified publications , 14 structured vocabularies were identified , which differed rather strongly in regards to language , scope , currency , and maintenance .', u'# R # # N # # R # # N # None of the identified vocabularies fulfilled the necessary criteria for content description of medical curricula and learning resources in the German-speaking world .', u'# R # # N # # R # # N # Discussion : While moving towards Web 3.0 , a significant problem lies in the selection and use of an appropriate German vocabulary for the machine-readable description of object content .', u'Possible solutions include development , translation and/or combination of existing vocabularies , possibly including partial translations of English vocabularies .']

sentences: [u'Producing a bill of quantity is a knowledge-based , dynamic and collaborative process , and evolves with variances and current evidence .', u'However , within the context of information system practice in BIM , knowledge of cost estimation has not been represented , nor has it been integrated into the processes based on BIM. # R # # N # # R # # N # This paper intends to establish an innovative means of taking data from the BIM linked to a project , and using it to create the necessary items for a bill of quantity that will enable cost estimation to be undertaken for the project .', u'Our framework is founded upon the belief that three components are necessary to gain a full awareness of the domain which is being computerised ; the information type which is to be assessed for compatibility ( syntax ) , the definition for the pricing domain ( semantics ) , and the precise implementation environment for the standards being taken into account ( pragmatics ) .', u'In order to achieve this , a prototype is created that allows a cost item for the bill of quantity to be spontaneously generated , by means of the semantic web ontology and a forward chain algorithm .', u'Within this paper , cost items signify the elements included in a bill of quantity , including details of their description , quantity and price .', u'As a means of authenticating the process being developed , the authors of this work effectively implemented it in the production of cost items .', u'In addition , the items created were contrasted with those produced by specialists .', u'For this reason , this innovative framework introduces the possibility of a new means of applying semantic web ontology and forward chain algorithm to construction professional practice resulting in automatic cost estimation .', u'These key outcomes demonstrate that , decoupling the professional practice into three key components of syntax , semantics and pragmatics can provide tangible benefits to domain user .']

sentences: [u'The success of the World Wide Web has caused the concepts of information system to change .', u'Web Information Systems ( WIS ) use from the Web its paradigm and technologies in order to retrieve information from sources on the Web , and to present the information in terms of a Web or hypermedia presentation .', u'Hera is a methodology that supports the design and engineering of WIS .', u'It is a model-driven methodology that distinguishes three parts in the design : integration , data retrieval , and presentation generation .', u'The integration part manages the gathering of data from different sources on the basis of source ontologies and mappings between those source ontologies and the conceptual model of the WIS .', u'The data retrieval part handles the user queries and produces the data that represents the query result .', u'In the presentation generation part this query result is trasformed into a Web presentation and that presentation is constructed to suit the user ( platform ) , e.g .', u'HTML , WML , or SMIL .', u'In this paper we address the Hera design methodology and specifically explain two models : the integration model that covers the different aspects of integration , and the adaptation model that specifies how the generated presentations can be adaptable ( e.g .', u'based on device capabilities , user preferences ) and adaptive ( e.g .', u'based on user browsing history ) .', u'This detailed description includes an explanation of how the Hera software is constructed .', u'This software provides a set of trasformations that allow a WIS to go from integration to presentation generation .', u'These transformations are based on RDF ( S ) , the foundation of the Semantic Web .', u'We show how RDF ( S ) has proven its value in combining all relevant aspects of WIS design , thus illustrating how Hera allows the engineering of Semantic Web Information Systems ( SWIS ) .']

sentences: [u'XBRL ( Extensible Business Reporting Language ) is a language for the electronic communication of business and financial data in XML ( Generalized Markup Language ) .', u'This technology has benefits in the preparation , analysis and business data informing compared with other methods of paper basis or hoc technologies of previous EDI ( Semantic Web ) .', u'These advantages include cases such as cost reduction , greater efficiency and effectiveness , accuracy and reliability for all activities involved in supplying or using financial data .', u'This article has an overview to XBRL technologies and how to employ them in decision-making in various financial areas and also considers the Semantic Web and Web Services as future challenges .', u"Normal 0 false false false RU X-NONE X-NONE # R # # N # / * Style Definitions * / # R # # N # table.MsoNormalTable # R # # N # # TAB # { mso-style-name : '' `` ; relations: [[], [], [(u'NCBI', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'government-funded institutions'), (u'NCBI', u'CONJUNCTION', u'UniProt'), (u'NCBI', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'topic-focused databases'), (u'UniProt', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'government-funded institutions'), (u'UniProt', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'topic-focused databases'), (u'ODB3 database of prokaryotic operons', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'government-funded institutions'), (u'ODB3 database of prokaryotic operons', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'topic-focused databases')], [], [], [(u'Wikidata', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic web compatible framework'), (u'semantic web compatible framework', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge representation')], [], [(u"Wikidata 's semantic web compatibility", u'USED-FOR', u'microbial specific data model'), (u'bacterial species', u'CONJUNCTION', u'strains')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The last 20 years of advancement in DNA sequencing technologies have led to the sequencing of thousands of microbial genomes , creating mountains of genetic data .', u'While our efficiency in generating the data improves almost daily , applying meaningful relationships between the taxonomic and genetic entities on this scale requires a structured and integrative approach .', u'Currently , the knowledge is distributed across a fragmented landscape of resources from government-funded institutions such as NCBI and UniProt to topic-focused databases like the ODB3 database of prokaryotic operons , to the supplemental table of a primary publication .', u'A major drawback to large scale , expert curated databases is the expense of maintaining and extending them over time .', u'No entity apart from a major institution with stable long term funding can consider this , and their scope is limited considering the magnitude of microbial data being generated daily .', u'Wikidata is an , openly editable , semantic web compatible framework for knowledge representation .', u'It is a project of the Wikimedia Foundation and offers knowledge integration capabilities ideally suited to the challenge of representing the exploding body of information about microbial genomics .', u"We are developing a microbial specific data model , based on Wikidata 's semantic web compatibility , that represents bacterial species , strains and the gene and gene products that define them .", u'Currently , we have loaded 1736 gene items and 1741 protein items for two strains of the human pathogenic bacteria Chlamydia trachomatis and used this subset of data as an example of the empowering utility of this model .', u'In our next phase of development , we will expand by adding another 118 bacterial genomes and their gene and gene products , totaling over 900,000 additional entities .', u'This aggregation of knowledge will be a platform for community-driven collaboration , allowing the networking of microbial genetic data through the sharing of knowledge by both the data and domain expert .']

sentences: [u'In recent years a huge research effort has been devoted to making information on the Web more accessible .', u'One strand concentrates on semantics ( the meaning of data ) ; within this is work on data description ( via metadata ) and research to develop tools for presenting and accessing information through metadata visualisation .', u'The book where this chapter appears is a collection exploring the emerging field bringing research on information visualisation together with research towards realising the semantic web ( Berners-Lee , 1998-1999 ) . # R # # N # # R # # N # This invited chapter concerns how the visualisation of metadata at paragraph level can support goal-directed searches within documents .', u'It describes a novel approach to document visualisation , claims are supported through an account of how a functional taxonomy of paragraph-level tags ( semantic metadata ) can be generated via systematic empirical methods .', u'An interactive tool for document visualisation ( GridVis ) , developed by Weiss-Lijn , which realises the proposals is described ; there is extensive discussion of user testing and formal , quantitative evaluation of system performance and how findings from these sources provided the rationale for the novel features of the visualisation tool. # R # # N # # R # # N # The chapter sets GridVis in the context of related pioneering attempts to visualise other document properties and to support goal-directed navigation within documents .', u'The research reported contributes to the agenda for realising the semantic web , although it can apply to any electronic documents .', u'The work was initially motivated by the needs of large organisations to better exploit information stored in documents .', u'The empirical aspects of the work were made possible through collaboration and sponsorship from JSainsbury plc ; the principal funding was via a postgraduate training partnership award from the DTI and EPSRC .', u'Early developments for this work were widely disseminated as was a method for testing based on theoretical best case performance devised to support this work but widely applicable to information visualisation tools .']

sentences: [u"We propose a framework to address an important issue in the context of the ongoing adoption of the `` Web 2.0 '' in science and research , often referred to as `` Science 2.0 '' or `` Research 2.0 '' .", u'A growing number of people are linked via acquaintances and online social networks such as Twitter 1 allows indirect access to a huge amount of ideas .', u'These ideas are contained in a massive human information flow [ 35 ] .', u'That users of these networks produce relevant data is being shown in many studies [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 28 ] [ 36 ] .', u'The problem however lies in discovering and verifying such a stream of unstructured data items .', u'Another related problem is locating an expert that could provide an answer to a very specific research question .', u'We are using semantic technologies ( RDF 2 , SPARQL 3 ) , common vocabularies ( SIOC 4 , FOAF 5 , SWRC 6 ) and Linked Data ( DBpedia 7 , GeoNames 8 , CoLinDa 9 ) [ 3 ] [ 4 ] [ 5 ] to extract and mine the data about scientific events out of context of microblogs .', u'Hereby we are identifying persons and organization related to them based on entities of time , place and topic .', u'The framework provides an API that allows quick access to the information that is analyzed by our system .', u'As a proof-of-concept we explain , implement and evaluate such a researcher profiling use case .', u'It involves the development of a framework that focuses on the proposition of researches based on topics and conferences they have in common .', u'This framework provides an API that allows quick access to the analyzed information .', u"A demonstration application : `` Researcher Affinity Browser '' shows how the API supports developers to build rich internet applications for Research 2.0 .", u"This application also introduces the concept `` affinity '' that exposes the implicit proximity between entities and users based on the content users produced .", u'The usability of a demonstration application and the usefulness of the framework itself are investigated with an explicit evaluation questionnaire .', u'This user feedback led to important conclusions about successful achievements and opportunities to further improve this effort .']

sentences: [u'Around the turn of the 18th century , the first integral pop- ulation enumeration was held in the Netherlands during the Batavian Republic .', u'It took over 30 years before the first official census was , by royal decree , organized and conducted in 1829 , and was meant to be held from then onwards every ten years .', u'The Dutch historical censuses are the only large scale , reliable statistical datasets available about the ( demo- graphic , social and economic ) history of the Netherlands , covering an all-encompassing geographical area for over two centuries ( 17951971 ) .', u'Not surprisingly , the currently preserved and digitized historical censuses are the most consulted historical statistics by researchers .', u'However , the 2 288 census tables are highly disconnected and scarcely integrated in their current form .', u'Meaningful information is still hidden in these miss- ing table-links , meaning that this wealth of information is not reaped to its full potential .', u'In this paper we describe the lessons learnt in CEDAR5 , a project of the Computational Humanities Programme6 , to provide so- lutions to these integration problems .', u'Our system leverages semantic technologies and Linked Data practices , which allow us to convert the census tables into a graph of fine-grained Linked Census Data .', u'Using the distributed architecture of the Web , we interlink this graph with other online historical socioeconomic and demographic Linked Datasets .', u'We use the information provided by these external links to guide the harmonization process in our dataset .', u'At the same time , we investigate which historical classifications are not online yet following Web stan- dards , and we use our census tables ( on demographic structures , housing types , occupational classes and statuses , and religious denominations ) to urge the need of publishing these historical classifications on the Web .', u'Such historical hubs could increase enormously the interoperability of other datasets .', u'Finally , we propose a querying pipeline on the resulting harmonized census dataset to enhance the data exploration work by his- torians and social scientists and help answering their research questions .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Government domain', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'data representation', u'Method')], [], [(u'Singapore Government data', u'Material'), (u'legacy systems', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data format', u'Material')], [(u'framework formulation', u'Generic'), (u'Singapore data ecosystem', u'Method')], [(u'migrational framework', u'Method')], [(u'Linked Data literature', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data researchers', u'Material')], [(u'iDA', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data system', u'Method'), (u'legacy systems', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'Proof of Concept ( POC ) application', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'data representation')], [], [], [(u'Singapore data ecosystem', u'USED-FOR', u'framework formulation'), (u'Infocomm Development Authority', u'USED-FOR', u'framework formulation'), (u'Infocomm Development Authority', u'USED-FOR', u'Singapore data ecosystem')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The subject area of this report is Linked Data and its application to the Government domain .', u'Linked Data is an alternative method of data representation that aims to interlink data from varied sources through relationships .', u'Governments around the world have started publishing their data in this format to assist citizens in making better use of public services .', u'This report provides an eight step migrational framework for converting Singapore Government data from legacy systems to Linked Data format .', u'The framework formulation is based on a study of the Singapore data ecosystem with help from Infocomm Development Authority ( iDA ) of Singapore .', u'Each step in the migrational framework has been constructed with objectives , recommendations , best practices and issues with entry and exit points .', u'This work builds on the existing Linked Data literature , implementations in other countries and cookbooks provided by Linked Data researchers .', u'iDA can use this report to gain an understanding of the effort and work involved in the implementation of Linked Data system on top of their legacy systems .', u'The framework can be evaluated by building a Proof of Concept ( POC ) application .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'W3C recommended approach', u'Method'), (u'World Wide Web', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'Public Sector', u'Material'), (u'web-scale identifiers', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'schema-defying Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Public Sector', u'Material')], [(u'state-of-the-art', u'Generic'), (u'linked data technologies', u'Method'), (u'technical framework', u'Method'), (u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'linked data', u'Material'), (u'interlinking capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data Paradigm', u'Method')], [(u'solutions', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'W3C recommended approach')], [], [], [(u'technical framework', u'USED-FOR', u'linked data'), (u'technical framework', u'USED-FOR', u'interlinking capabilities'), (u'Linked Data Paradigm', u'USED-FOR', u'interlinking capabilities')], []]
sentences: [u'Linked Data has become the current W3C recommended approach for publishing data on the World Wide Web as it is sharable , extensible , and easily re-usable .', u'An ecosystem of linked data hubs in the Public Sector has the potential to offer significant benefits to its consumers ( other public offices and ministries , as well as researchers , citizens and SMEs ) , such as increased accessibility and re-use value of their data through the use of web-scale identifiers and easy interlinking with datasets of other public data providers .', u'The power and flexibility of the schema-defying Linked Data , however , is counterbalanced by inborn factors that diminish the potential for cost-effective and efficient adoption by the Public Sector .', u'The paper analyzes these challenges in view of the current state-of-the-art in linked data technologies and proposes a technical framework that aims to hide the underlying complexity of linked data while maintaining and promoting the interlinking capabilities enabled by the Linked Data Paradigm .', u'The paper presents the innovations behind our proposed solutions as well as their advantages , especially for the non-expert users .']

entities: [[(u'dataset maintainers', u'Method'), (u'open standards', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method')], [(u'structured data', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'linked data', u'Material'), (u'hard-coded logic', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SWOWS', u'Method'), (u'declarative specification of applications', u'Task')], [(u'platform', u'Generic'), (u'browsing applications', u'Task'), (u'declarative paradigm', u'Method')], [(u'dynamic generation of SPARQL queries', u'Task')], [], [(u'HighlightsA platform', u'Method'), (u'interactive applications', u'Task'), (u'linked data', u'Material'), (u'semantic information retrieval.An interface', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'application', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'open standards'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SPARQL'), (u'SPARQL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'open standards')], [(u'Web', u'FEATURE-OF', u'structured data')], [(u'applications', u'USED-FOR', u'linked data')], [(u'SWOWS', u'USED-FOR', u'declarative specification of applications')], [], [], [], [(u'HighlightsA platform', u'USED-FOR', u'interactive applications'), (u'linked data', u'USED-FOR', u'HighlightsA platform'), (u'semantic information retrieval.An interface', u'USED-FOR', u'interactive applications')]]
sentences: [u'The linked data initiative is pushing dataset maintainers to publish data online in a highly reusable way through a set of open standards , such as RDF and SPARQL .', u'The variety and amount of structured data available on the Web are increasing , but their consumption is still quite limited .', u'In particular , applications that are used to explore linked data are usually generic linked data browsers or applications with hard-coded logic tailored for specific needs .', u'SWOWS is a platform for declarative specification of applications consuming linked data .', u'In this paper , we describe the use of the platform for creating browsing applications tailored to specific contexts , and show how the declarative paradigm supports the development of flexible applications .', u'To this end , the platform has been extended to support the dynamic generation of SPARQL queries .', u'An example of a linked data browser created with the platform is given .', u'HighlightsA platform for definining interactive applications based on linked data is proposed.A case study is presented in the field of semantic information retrieval.An interface for the composition of pipelines defining an application is presented .']

entities: [[(u'distributed database', u'Material'), (u'semantic facts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'knowledge-based systems', u'Method')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'KBS', u'Method')], [(u'KBS', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'problem-solving method', u'Method')], [(u'internal and public Linked Data sets', u'Material')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'KBS', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge-based systems')], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In simple terms , the Web of ( Linked ) Data is a distributed database with semantic facts about the world or any specific domain .', u'The integration of Linked Data in knowledge-based systems ( KBS ) has the potential to reduce the maintenance effort for the underlying knowledge base .', u'Using Linked Data in KBS leads to some new challenges that will be outlined in the paper .', u'An important step during the design phase of the KBS is the comparison of the required knowledge and knowledge that is available as Linked Data .', u'The required facts emerge from the problem-solving method and cover all facts that are necessary to conduct the intended decision .', u'Whereas the available knowledge represent all relevant facts in internal and public Linked Data sets .', u'Any remaining knowledge gap between required and available facts has to be closed primarily by rules and mash-ups to generate or transform the required facts automatically and keep everything up-to-date .', u'This is one major step of the presented procedure and architecture to design a KBS based on Linked Data .']

relations: [[(u'historical people', u'CONJUNCTION', u'places'), (u'places', u'CONJUNCTION', u'organizations'), (u'places', u'CONJUNCTION', u'events'), (u'organizations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'events')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Abstract # R # # N # # R # # N # Linked Data promises to facilitate the collaborative production and use of structured information about historical people , places , organizations , events , and ideas .', u'But few processes have been established to assess and improve the quality of Linked Data .', u'Documentary editors can potentially contribute to this effort by assessing Linked Data quality , publishing gold standard datasets that meet their high standards , and connecting assertions to bibliographic descriptions of evidential resources .', u"The Editors ' Notes project is exploring these possibilities by integrating tools for harvesting and editing Linked Data into the research processes of documentary editing projects ."]

sentences: [u'Platform Linked Data Nederland bestaat dit jaar 5 jaar en om dat te vieren is een lustrum boek gemaakt , waarin de resultaten van de afgelopen 5 jaar gedeeld worden en waarin een aantal interviews staan met een aantal personen die een belangrijke rol hebben gespeeld in de positieve ontwikkelingen rondom Linked Data projecten .', u'Frank Tierolff , bestuurder bij het Kadaster , is een van de personen , die geinterviewd is voor dit lustrumboek .', u'Wat Linked Data voor het Kadaster betekent en welke aspecten en ontwikkelingen verder een belangrijke rol spelen bij de ambities van het Kadaster in relatie tot Linked Data ,']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [], [(u'Linked Data usage', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'YASGUI', u'Method'), (u'feature rich web-based query editor', u'Method'), (u'measuring device', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data Cloud', u'Method')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data Cloud', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'complexity of queries', u'Metric'), (u'dataset statistics', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'YASGUI', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'feature rich web-based query editor'), (u'YASGUI', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'measuring device')], []]
sentences: [u'Existing studies of Linked Data focus on the availability of data rather than its use in practice .', u'The number of query logs available is very much restricted to a small number of datasets .', u'This paper proposes to track Linked Data usage at the client side .', u'We use YASGUI , a feature rich web-based query editor , as a measuring device for interactions with the Linked Data Cloud .', u'It enables us to determine what part of the Linked Data Cloud is actually used , what part is open or closed , the efficiency and complexity of queries , and how these results relate to commonly used dataset statistics .']

entities: [[(u'linked data', u'Material'), (u'HTTP-URIs', u'Method'), (u'RDF resources', u'Material')], [(u'URI', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data browser', u'Method')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'HTTP-URIs', u'Method')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Life Science Identifiers', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'HTTP-URIs', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF resources'), (u'identifiers', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF resources')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Amongst the best practices that constitute linked data , one of the foremost is to use only HTTP-URIs as identifiers for RDF resources .', u'This is so that the URI will resolve in a Linked Data browser to give information about the named resource .', u'At the same time , Linked Data takes a resource-centric , as opposed to page-centric , approach to resolution .', u'We argue that this approach can , in certain cases , obviate the need for insisting on HTTP-URIs .', u'As a use of our expanded notion of Linked Data , we present as an example Life Science Identifiers .']

sentences: [u'LInked Data Services ( LIDS ) denote the integration of data-providing services and Linked Data .', u'LIDS are parameterised and formally described web resources which return RDF when dereferenced via HTTP .', u'In this paper we present a general method for creating Linked Data Services ; LIDS consist of data access interface conventions that are compatible to Linked Data principles and a lightweight formal description model .', u'Our approach is based on established Web standards including HTTP , RDF and SPARQL .', u'Additionally , we announce several LIDS that we have created from existing real-life services , unlocking vast amounts of triples to the Web of Data .']

sentences: [u'Recently , Linked Data and Web APIs have emerged as the preferred means of exposing data and Web application functionality .', u'In this paper we argue that service systems should be adapted in the light of both trends .', u'In particular we believe that i ) common means for discovering and interacting with Web services and Web APIs are necessary , and that ii ) we should bridge the gap between services and linked data both by supporting the publication of services as linked data and by enabling the processing of linked data by services .', u'We show a set of technologies we have devised towards this goal .']

entities: [[(u'semantic data', u'Material'), (u'World Wide Web', u'Material'), (u'business models', u'Method')], [(u'Linked Data Business Cube', u'Method'), (u'business models', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data assets', u'Material')], [(u'OLAP Cube', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data Business Cube', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data assets', u'Material'), (u'revenue models', u'Generic'), (u'business models', u'Method'), (u'collaborative value creation', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'With the increasing availability of semantic data on the World Wide Web and its reutilization for commercial purposes , questions arise about the economic value of interlinked data and business models that can be built on top of it .', u'This paper introduces the Linked Data Business Cube , a systematic approach to model and analyze business models for Linked Data assets .', u'Similar to an OLAP Cube , the Linked Data Business Cube provides an integrated view on Linked Data assets , revenue models and stakeholders , thus allowing to investigate the specificities and interdependencies of business models under conditions of highly networked infrastructures and collaborative value creation .']

sentences: [u'In this paper , we present an image parsing to text description ( I2T ) framework that generates text descriptions of image and video content based on image understanding .', u'The proposed I2T framework follows three steps : 1 ) input images ( or video frames ) are decomposed into their constituent visual patterns by an image parsing engine , in a spirit similar to parsing sentences in natural language ; 2 ) the image parsing results are converted into semantic representation in the form of Web ontology language ( OWL ) , which enables seamless integration with general knowledge bases ; and 3 ) a text generation engine converts the results from previous steps into semantically meaningful , human readable , and query-able text reports .', u'The centerpiece of the I2T framework is an and-or graph ( AoG ) visual knowledge representation , which provides a graphical representation serving as prior knowledge for representing diverse visual patterns and provides top-down hypotheses during the image parsing .', u'The AoG embodies vocabularies of visual elements including primitives , parts , objects , scenes as well as a stochastic image grammar that specifies syntactic relations ( i.e. , compositional ) and semantic relations ( e.g. , categorical , spatial , temporal , and functional ) between these visual elements .', u'Therefore , the AoG is a unified model of both categorical and symbolic representations of visual knowledge .', u'The proposed I2T framework has two objectives .', u'First , we use semiautomatic method to parse images from the Internet in order to build an AoG for visual knowledge representation .', u'Our goal is to make the parsing process more and more automatic using the learned AoG model .', u'Second , we use automatic methods to parse image/ video in specific domains and generate text reports that are useful for real-world applications .', u'In the case studies at the end of this paper , we demonstrate two automatic I2T systems : a maritime and urban scene video surveillance system and a real- time automatic driving scene understanding system .']

sentences: [u'This article presents the details of a novel method for ontology-based waveform reconfigurability that allows radios of different hardware or software architectures , using different software APIs and even non-uniform waveform description schemas , to interoperate .', u'In this method cognitive radios share the same base software defined radio ontology , which allows the radios to understand the concepts in a uniform way , thus enabling transfer of more complex concepts from one node to another .', u'In the process of reconfiguration , nodes can receive specifications of waveforms expressed in Web Ontology Language ( OWL ) and rules and then automatically configure their processing according to the specification .', u'Such specifications contain both structural descriptions of software components and descriptions of finite state machines necessary to compose the waveform from simpler software modules .', u'The waveform configuration process encompasses , first , generating state machines and building a model of the waveform by generating OWL individuals and relationships between them using the inference engine and the specified rules .', u'The constructed model is then used to instantiate state machines and other software components and to connect them according to the model .', u'The result of the overall process is such that a cognitive radio is able to receive a description of a waveform it did not know before ( from another cognitive radio ) and construct the waveform from the description .', u'Then both radios can use the waveform for further communication .', u'A proof-of-concept system has been built confirming the feasibility of the proposed method .', u"In the process of this system 's evaluation three different waveforms ( BPSK31 , QPSK31 and RTTY ) have been described in OWL and rules , the descriptions were successfully transferred from one node to another and then used by the receiving node to construct fully functional software modules implementing the waveforms ."]
