sentences: [u"Keynote Speeches.- Rough Set Approach to Knowledge Discovery about Preferences.- Toward a Self-referential Collective Intelligence Some Philosophical Background of the IEML Research Program.- A-Teams and Their Applications.- Collective Decision Making.- Local Search Algorithms for Core Checking in Hedonic Coalition Games.- Information Foraging Theory as a Form of Collective Intelligence for Social Search.- SAM : Semantic Argumentation Based Model for Collaborative Knowledge Creation and Sharing System.- A Conception for Modification of Learning Scenario in an Intelligent E-learning System.- Firefly Algorithm for Continuous Constrained Optimization Tasks.- Distributed Data Mining Methodology with Classification Model Example.- A Token-Based Mutual Exclusion Approach to Improve Collaboration in Distributed Environments.- Discovering Medical Knowledge from Data in Patients ' Files.- Towards an Increase of Collective Intelligence within Organizations Using Trust and Reputation Models.- A New Ant Colony Optimization Algorithm with an Escape Mechanism for Scheduling Problems.- Recognizing Team Formations in Multiagent Systems : Applications in Robotic Soccer.- Semi-traces and Their Application in Concurrency Control Problem.- Design of the Directory Facilitator Supporting Fault-Tolerance in Multi-OSGi Agent System.- Multiagent Systems.- Agent-Based Provisioning of Group-Oriented Non-linear Telecommunication Services.- A Multi-agent Model of Deceit and Trust in Intercultural Trade.- Implementation of Epistemic Operators for Model Checking Multi-agent Systems.- Meta-game HOLOS as a Multi-agent Decision-Making Laboratory.- Agent-Based Computational Modeling of Emergent Collective Intelligence.- Fuzzy Cognitive and Social Negotiation Agent Strategy for Computational Collective Intelligence.- A Multi-agent Architecture for Multi-robot Surveillance.- Designing Social Agents with Empathic Understanding.- Multi-agent Systems in Pedestrian Dynamics Modeling.- Towards a Model for Extraction of Possible Worlds and Accessibility Relation from Cognitive Agent 's Experience.- Social Networks.- On Deriving Tagsonomies : Keyword Relations Coming from Crowd.- d 2 isco : Distributed Deliberative CBR Systems with jCOLIBRI.- Model of a Collaboration Environment for Knowledge Management in Competence-Based Learning.- PlWiki - A Generic Semantic Wiki Architecture.- Properties of Bridge Nodes in Social Networks.- Semantic Web.- Use of Semantic Principles in a Collaborative System in Order to Support Effective Information Retrieval.- Assessing Semantic Quality of Web Directory Structure.- Computer Aided Requirements Management.- BizKB : A Conceptual Framework for Dynamic Cross-Enterprise Collaboration.- A Simple Parallel Reasoning System for the Description Logic.- SemCards : A New Representation for Realizing the Semantic Web.- ExpTime Tableaux for Checking Satisfiability of a Knowledge Base in the Description Logic .- Semantically Enhanced Intellectual Property Protection System - SEIPro2S.- Semantic Knowledge Representation in Terrorist Threat Analysis for Crisis Management Systems.- Consensus Choice for Reconciling Social Collaborations on Semantic Wikis.- Ontology Management.- Ontology Mapping Composition for Query Transformation in Distributed Environment.- Algebra of Ontology Modules for Semantic Agents.- Grouping Results of Queries to Ontological Knowledge Bases by Conceptual Clustering.- Applying the c.DnS Design Pattern to Obtain an Ontology for Investigation Management System.- Ontology Applications for Achieving Situation Awareness in Military Decision Support Systems.- A Collaborative Ontology-Based User Profiles System.- Ontology-Based Intelligent Agent for Grid Resource Management.- Special Session : Dynamics of Real-World Social Networks.- The Norm Game on a Model Network : A Critical Line.- Model for Trust Dynamics in Service Oriented Information Systems.- Collective Prisoner 's Dilemma Model of Artificial Society.- Special Session : Nature-Inspired Collective Intelligence.- DES Control Synthesis and Cooperation of Agents.- Parameter Tuning for the Artificial Bee Colony Algorithm.- A Modified Ant-Based Approach to Edge Detection.- A Hybrid Evolutionary Approach for the Protein Classification Problem.- A Family of GEP-Induced Ensemble Classifiers.- Handling Dynamic Networks Using Ant Colony Optimization on a Distributed Architecture.- Modelling Shortest Path Search Techniques by Colonies of Cooperating Agents.- Natural Scene Retrieval Based on Graph Semantic Similarity for Adaptive Scene Classification.- Special Session : Web Systems Analysis.- A Hybrid Architecture for E-Procurement.- Localization by Wireless Technologies for Managing of Large Scale Data Artifacts on Mobile Devices.- Avoiding Threats Using Multi Agent System Planning for Web Based Systems.- Using WordNet to Measure the Similarity of Link Texts.- Mining Frequent Purchase Behavior Patterns for Commercial Websites.- Block Map Technique for the Usability Evaluation of a Website.- Global Distribution of HTTP Requests Using the Fuzzy-Neural Decision-Making Mechanism.- Deterministic Processing of WWW Pages by the Web Service.- Special Session : Collective Intelligence for Economic Data Analysis.- Comparative Analysis of Regression Tree Models for Premises Valuation Using Statistica Data Miner.- Electronic Trading on Electricity Markets within a Multi-agent Framework.- Comparative Analysis of Premises Valuation Models Using KEEL , RapidMiner , and WEKA.- A Multi-agent System to Assist with Real Estate Appraisals Using Bagging Ensembles.- Reputation Tracking Procurement Auctions.- Comparative Analysis of Evolutionary Fuzzy Models for Premises Valuation Using KEEL.- Hybrid Repayment Prediction for Debt Portfolio ."]

sentences: [u'Ontology Population from text is an interdisciplinary task that integrates Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) , Knowledge Representation , and Semantic Web techniques to extract assertional knowledge from texts according to specific ontologies .', u'As most information on the Web is available as unstructured text , Ontology Population plays an important role in bridging the gap between structured and unstructured data , thus helping realizing the vision of a ( Semantic ) Web where contents are equally consumable by humans and machines .', u'In this thesis we move beyond Ontology Population of instances and binary relations , and focus on ( what we call ) Frame-based Ontology Population , whose target is the extraction of semantic frames from text .', u'Semantic frames are defined by RDFS/OWL ontologies , such as FrameBase and the Event Situation Ontology derived from FrameNet , and consist in events , situations and other structured entities reified as ontological instances ( e.g. , a sell event ) and connected to related instances via properties specifying their semantic roles in the frame ( e.g. , seller , buyer ) .', u'This representation ( called neo-Davidsonian ) supports expressing n-ary and arbitrarily qualified relations , and permits leveraging complex NLP tasks such as Semantic Role Labeling ( SRL ) , which annotates frame-like structures in text consisting of predicates and their semantic arguments as defined by domain-general predicate models .', u'# R # # N # We contribute to the task of Frame-based Ontology Population from multiple directions .', u'We start with developing an extension of the Lemon lexicon model for ontologies ( PreMOn ) to represent predicate models -- - PropBank , NombBank , VerbNet , and FrameNet -- - and their mappings to FrameBase .', u'Based on this , our core contribution is a Frame-based Ontology Population approach ( PIKES ) where processing is decoupled in two phases : first , an English text is processed by a SRL-based NLP pipeline to extract mentions , i.e. , snippets of text denoting entities or facts ; then , mentions are processed by mapping rules to extract ontological instances aligned to DBpedia and Yago , and semantic frames aligned to FrameBase .', u'We represent all the contents involved in this process in RDF with named graphs , according to an ontological model ( KEM ) built on top of the semiotic notions of meaning and reference , aligned to DOLCE and the NLP Interchange Format ( NIF ) ontologies .', u'The model allows navigating from any piece of extracted knowledge to its mentions and back , and allows representing all the generated intermediate information ( e.g. , NLP annotations ) and associated metadata ( e.g. , confidence , provenance ) .', u'Based on this model , we propose a scalable system ( KnowledgeStore ) for storing and querying all the text , mentions , and RDF data involved in the population process , together with relevant RDF background knowledge , so that they can be jointly accessed by applications .', u'Finally , to support the necessary RDF processing tasks , such as rule evaluation , RDFS and owl : sameAs inference , and data filtering and integration , we propose a tool ( RDFpro ) implementing a simple , non-distributed processing model combining streaming and sorting techniques in complex pipelines , capable of processing billions of RDF triples on a commodity machine. # R # # N # We describe the application of these solutions for processing differently scoped/sized datasets within and outside the NewsReader EU Project , and for improving search performances in Information Retrieval , through an approach ( KE4IR ) that enriches the term vectors of documents and queries with semantic terms obtained from extracted knowledge .', u'All the proposed solutions were implemented and released open-source with demonstrators , and ontological models were published online according to Linked Data best practices .', u'The results obtained were validated via empirical performance evaluations and case studies .']

sentences: [u'An institution of higher education that develops research projects can learn and remember the knowledge generated by these projects .', u'In this paper we propose a framework for the management of organizational memory oriented research projects in higher education institutions .', u'This framework supports the capture , storage and retrieval of knowledge from research projects , which could provide access to documents or documentation thereof .', u'The construction of the framework is done using semantic technology that includes the development of an ontology and semantic retrieval engine .']

relations: [[(u'semantic inf ormation', u'USED-FOR', u'sensor networks')], [], []]
sentences: [u'To realize sharing and reuse of sensor data and improve interoperability , semantic sensor web ( SSW ) is proposed to add semantic inf ormation to existing sensor networks by utilizing domain , spatial and temporal anthologies and other related semantic technology .', u'This paper presents state of the art of SSW from various aspects from the basic concepts , characters of SSW and the core technologies of SSW to the representative real world applications .', u'Besides , it presents the challenges and the possible future research areas in SSW .']

entities: [[(u'Digital museum databases', u'Material'), (u'heterogeneous data structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mapping', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'digitally encoded cultural material', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'museum data', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'ontological models', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic')], [(u'method', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Digital museum databases have extremely heterogeneous data structures which require advanced mapping and vocabulary integration for them to benefit from the interoperability enabled by semantic technologies .', u'In addition to establishing ways of extracting and manipulating digitally encoded cultural material , there exists a need to make this material available and accessible to human users in different forms and languages that are available to them .', u'In this paper we describe a method to manage and access museum data by integrating it within a series of interlinked ontological models .', u'The method allows querying and generation of query results in natural language .', u'We report on the results of applying this method from experiments we have been pursuing .']

sentences: [u'microRNAs ( miRNAs ) are special non-coding RNAs that perform important roles through their target genes .', u"Biologists ' conventional miRNA knowledge discovery is time-consuming , labor-intensive , and error-prone .", u'Semantic technologies , which are created upon domain ontologies , can greatly enhance miRNA knowledge discovery .', u'Unfortunately , yet no specific miRNA domain ontologies currently exist .', u'It thus motivates the construction of a miRNA ontology .', u'In addition , a manual ontology development has many drawbacks .', u'We present in this paper a semi-automated ontology development methodology .', u'The developed ontology is the very first one of its kind that formally encodes miRNA domain knowledge .', u'It aims to provide data exchange standards and common data elements and thus help identify novel data connections among heterogeneous sources .']

entities: [[(u'copyright and intellectual property infringement problem', u'Task')], [(u'abuse of content', u'Task')], [(u'intellectual property', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Digital Right Management System', u'Method'), (u'Semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'copyrights rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'digital revolution', u'CONJUNCTION', u'TV channels')], [], []]
sentences: [u'According to the digital revolution and the dramatically increasing number of TV channels on different satellites thus a massive content being broadcasted , a copyright and intellectual property infringement problem is occurring due to piracy and misuse of content , especially in developing countries .', u'The abuse of content is leading to a significant money loss to content owners that may cause the collapse of the industry .', u'The paper in hand proposes an architecture that assists content owners to proof and protect their intellectual property via using Digital Right Management System ( DRM ) that depends on Semantic technologies , as well as fulfilling the needs of TV channels such that they can reuse the content while respecting copyrights rules .']

entities: [[(u'education', u'Task')], [], [(u'socio- semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'educational levels', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'JUCS issue', u'Task'), (u'education', u'Task')]]
sentences: [u'The volume 18 , issue 1 of Journal of Universal Computer Science was devoted to present the main outcomes of 12 international research projects regarding technology applied to education .', u'This special issue introduced a spread sample of educational projects around the world .', u'The success of the call and the quality of the selected contribution aimed us to organize a new issue regarding educational research projects , but this time with a special focus on socio- semantic technologies applied to teaching and learning processed at all the educational levels .', u'As result , we present the current JUCS issue including information and the main outcomes of 9 international research projects about technology socio-semantic applied to education .']

entities: [[(u'aging workforce', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'enterprise information systems', u'Method'), (u'industrial field service', u'Task')], [(u'Mobile and semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'semantic mobile applications', u'Task'), (u'industrial service processes', u'Task')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'semantic data federations', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneous information sources', u'Material'), (u'service process', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'aging workforce', u'CONJUNCTION', u'product information')], [], [(u'semantic mobile applications', u'USED-FOR', u'industrial service processes')], [(u'architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic data federations')]]
sentences: [u'The increasing complexity of industrial products , an aging workforce , and tremendous amount of product information from enterprise information systems as well as the emerging Internet of Things are some of the challenges that have to be faced in the area of industrial field service .', u'Mobile and semantic technologies may help to provide the right information , at the right time , in the right place to the right people .', u'In this paper , we describe in how far semantic mobile applications can be utilized to support industrial service processes .', u'The presented architecture for semantic data federations provides an integrated approach to deliver tailored information from very heterogeneous information sources , thus supporting various roles in the service process at the same time .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'historical research', u'Task')], [(u'quantifiable data', u'Material'), (u'social sciences', u'Material'), (u'humanities', u'Material'), (u'ones', u'Generic')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'historical and cultural data', u'Material'), (u'commercial trade system', u'Task'), (u'Roman Empire', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Ontology-Based Data Access ( OBDA ) paradigm', u'Method'), (u'datasets', u'Generic'), (u'conceptual layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conceptual view', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'historical research')], [(u'social sciences', u'CONJUNCTION', u'humanities')], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'historical and cultural data'), (u'food production', u'CONJUNCTION', u'commercial trade system')], [(u'Ontology-Based Data Access ( OBDA ) paradigm', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic technologies are rapidly changing the historical research .', u'Over the last decades , an immense amount of new quantifiable data have been accumulated , and made available in interchangeable formats , in social sciences and humanities , opening up new possibilities for solving old questions and posing new ones .', u'This paper introduces a framework that eases the access of scholars to historical and cultural data about food production and commercial trade system during the Roman Empire , distributed across different data sources .', u'The proposed approach relies on the Ontology-Based Data Access ( OBDA ) paradigm , where the different datasets are virtually integrated by a conceptual layer ( an ontology ) that provides to the user a clear point of access and a unified and unambiguous conceptual view .']

entities: [[(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'e-learning', u'Task'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'adaptation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'personalization', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u"student 's profile", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'personalized student data', u'Material'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'adaptation', u'Task'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'adaptation', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'systems', u'USED-FOR', u'e-learning'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'systems'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'e-learning'), (u'adaptation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'personalization'), (u'personalization', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dynamic adaptability of learning material')], [(u'architecture', u'USED-FOR', u"student 's profile")], [(u'personalized student data', u'USED-FOR', u'dynamic generation')], [], []]
sentences: [u'This paper describes the concepts of architecture of modern systems for e-learning based on semantic technologies with the aspects of adaptation , personalization and dynamic adaptability of learning material .', u"The proposed architecture is able to generate the student 's profile based on basic and historical data on the student which ensures the personalization of the system .", u'The personalized student data enable us to ensure dynamic generation of the course in the system according to individual needs of the student .', u'The effects of adaptation are achieved by adapting the system according to the categories of adaptation .', u'The paper also gives an overview and description of the operation of each individual component of the system .']

entities: [[(u'IRISPortal', u'Method'), (u'semantic portal', u'Method'), (u'management of industrial risk cases', u'Task'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'OWL 2 language', u'Material'), (u'OWLIM semantic repository', u'Material')], [(u'web-based management of risk cases', u'Task'), (u'risk ontology', u'Method'), (u'administrative tasks', u'Task'), (u'updating risk cases', u'Task')], [(u'portal', u'Generic'), (u'modeled risk cases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology model', u'Method'), (u'reasoning procedure', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'IRISPortal', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic portal'), (u'IRISPortal', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic technologies'), (u'semantic portal', u'USED-FOR', u'management of industrial risk cases'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic portal'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'management of industrial risk cases'), (u'OWL 2 language', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic technologies'), (u'OWL 2 language', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWLIM semantic repository'), (u'OWLIM semantic repository', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic technologies')], [(u'domain experts', u'USED-FOR', u'administrative tasks'), (u'deleting', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'administrative tasks')], [(u'reasoning procedure', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic relationships')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we describe the architecture and functionality of IRISPortal , a semantic portal that allows the management of industrial risk cases by exploiting state-of-the-art semantic technologies , such as the OWL 2 language and the OWLIM semantic repository .', u'The portal allows the web-based management of risk cases that are modeled in terms of a risk ontology , assisting the domain experts to perform administrative tasks , such as adding , deleting and updating risk cases .', u'Furthermore , the portal provides the functionality to the end-users for searching and browsing the modeled risk cases and their corresponding characteristics , based on the semantic relationships that derive from the ontology model after the reasoning procedure .']

entities: [[(u'smArt', u'Method'), (u'low-cost framework', u'Method'), (u'indoor exhibits', u'Material'), (u'smart navigation system', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'sensorized museum environment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'artworks', u'Generic')], [(u'knowledge-base', u'Material'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'multimedia insights', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'active and passive sensors advertisements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user interactions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'indoor environments', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'smArt', u'USED-FOR', u'indoor exhibits'), (u'low-cost framework', u'USED-FOR', u'indoor exhibits'), (u'low-cost framework', u'USED-FOR', u'smart navigation system'), (u'smart navigation system', u'USED-FOR', u'indoor exhibits')], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge-base'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'multimedia insights')], [(u'active and passive sensors advertisements', u'CONJUNCTION', u'user interactions')], []]
sentences: [u'In this demo we present smArt , a low-cost framework to quickly set up indoor exhibits featuring a smart navigation system for museums .', u'The framework is web-based and allows the design on a digital map of a sensorized museum environment and the dynamic and assisted definition of the multimedia materials and sensors associated to the artworks .', u'The knowledge-base uses semantic technologies and it is exploited by museum visitors to get directions and to have multimedia insights in a natural way .', u'Indoor localisation and routing is provided taking advantage of active and passive sensors advertisements and user interactions .', u'In this way we overcome the Global Positioning System ( GPS ) unavailability issue in indoor environments .']

entities: [[(u'distance learning', u'Task'), (u'institutional web portal', u'Method')], [(u'web accessibility guidelines', u'Method'), (u'content Word Wide Web Consortium', u'Material')], [(u'web portal', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'In order to enhance access to the web , Universidad Tecnica Particular de Loja ( UTPL ) , as a pioneer in distance learning in Ecuador and Latin America , and it committed with an inclusive quality education , it must ensure compliance with web accessibility standards on its institutional web portal .', u"This work aims at evaluating UTPL 's academic services web portal by checking compliance with web accessibility guidelines set by the content Word Wide Web Consortium at the recommendation WCAG 2.0 .", u'As a contribution to improving the conditions and quality of life , based on the analysis of accessibility , the improvement opportunities will be presented to provide an accessible web portal for all users and machines using semantic technologies .']

entities: [[(u'PACS/RIS systems', u'Method'), (u'clinical data', u'Material'), (u'patient identifier', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'semantics-based technology', u'Method'), (u'systems', u'Generic')], [(u'semantic approach', u'Method'), (u'clinical information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"clinician 's query", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'cloud-based systems', u'Method')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'classification and retrieval tasks', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'semantic approach', u'USED-FOR', u'clinical information'), (u'semantic approach', u'USED-FOR', u"clinician 's query")], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'classification and retrieval tasks')]]
sentences: [u'PACS/RIS systems store a huge volume of clinical data that are mostly accessed by the patient identifier .', u'However , clinicians would like to retrieve information about similar clinical cases .', u'In this paper , we claim that the semantics-based technology could improve the discovery and integration of information in this type of systems .', u"We propose a semantic approach that semantically annotates the clinical information and retrieves the resources relevant to the clinician 's query , independently of their language and format .", u'Moreover , cloud-based systems allow the integration with external resources .', u'In this paper , we present preliminary results that show that current semantic technologies can produce good enough results to perform classification and retrieval tasks .']

entities: [[(u'Wolftech News Hunter', u'Method'), (u'UiB', u'Material'), (u'Wolftech', u'Material'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'big data sources', u'Material'), (u'news editing', u'Task')], [(u'well-prioritised and -prepared background information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'media', u'Material'), (u'news services', u'Material'), (u'social media', u'Material')], [(u'News Hunter project', u'Method')], [(u'organising', u'Task'), (u'news graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'background information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'news stories', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'UiB', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Wolftech'), (u'big data sources', u'USED-FOR', u'news editing')], [(u'news services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social media')], [], [(u'background information', u'USED-FOR', u'news stories')]]
sentences: [u'Wolftech News Hunter is a collaboration between UiB and Wolftech that uses semantic technologies to harvest , organise and leverage traditional and social media streams and other big data sources for news editing .', u'The idea is to continuously analyse the story a journalist is writing , in order to continuously provide her or him with well-prioritised and -prepared background information that is continuously harvested from traditional media , news services , social media and other sources .', u'The News Hunter project is positioned in a rich research area with ample potential for further research , development and innovation .', u'Our most immediate focus is on organising , populating and lev e raging the news graph to provide background information for evolving news stories .']

sentences: [u'Every web user has several online profiles through which personal information is exchanged with many service providers .', u'This exchange of personal information happens at a pace difficult to fully comprehend and manage without a global view and control with obvious consequences on data control , ownership and , of course , privacy .', u'To tackle issues associated with current service-centric approaches , we propose a user-centric architecture where the interaction between a user and other agents is managed based on a global profile for the user , maintained in a profile management system and controlled by the user herself .', u'In this PhD , we will investigate research issues and challenges in realizing such a system based on semantic technologies .']

sentences: [u'The volumes of data in information systems are growing drastically .', u'The systems become increasingly complex in trying to handle heterogeneity of ubiquitous components , standards , data formats , etc .', u"According to the vision of Autonomic Computing , the complexity can be handled by introducing self-manageable components able to `` run themselves . ''", u'Agent Technology fits this vision , whereas interoperability among autonomic components can be tackled by Semantic Technologies .', u'The problem of efficient heterogeneous data sharing , exchange and reuse within such systems plays a key role .', u'We present an approach of constructing semantic capabilities ( self-descriptive functional components ) for software agents and a mechanism for distributed data management that applies these capabilities to build various industrial business intelligence systems .']

sentences: [u'Medical prescription has been touted as following an accurate approach to addressing particular health problems .', u'However , the importance of the process might demand considering a formal knowledge-driven procedure to ensure its correctness which can be achieved through Medical Decision Support Systems ( MDSS ) .', u'Semantic Technologies have emerged as a potential silver bullet to become the backbone of those particular Information Systems since it provides seamless integration and an underlying logical formalism .', u'This paper sheds light into using ontologies for drug prescription through the SemMed model , architecture and proof-of-concept implementation , being able to face challenges in these areas and solve day-to-day problems of health professionals in terms of drug prescription']

entities: [[(u'Cloud Computing technologies', u'Method'), (u'Software-as-a-Service ( SaaS ) paradigm', u'Task')], [(u'Cloud-deployed applications inter', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'operability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cross-integration', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Computer Science domains', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Platform-as-a-Service angle', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'CARL', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Technologies', u'Method')], [(u'formal model', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Complex Application management', u'Task'), (u'PaaS environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'CARL', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Cloud Computing technologies have recently gained momentum and moved from a hyped trend to a mature set of technological innovations providing an infrastructure for the Software-as-a-Service ( SaaS ) paradigm .', u'However , a number of questions about Cloud-deployed applications inter - operability and cross-integration , stemming from multiple areas of Computer Science domains , have also been raised from a Platform-as-a-Service angle .', u'In this paper , we present CARL , a novel , cutting-edge , interoperative and integration-oriented language based on Semantic Technologies .', u'We provide a formal model and semantics to enable Complex Application management and integration in PaaS environments , together with a thorough demonstration of the breakthroughs being provided by CARL .']

entities: [[(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'run-time adaptation', u'Task'), (u'user-centered smart environment', u'Task')], [(u'Context-sensitive services', u'Task'), (u'interoperation pretensions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'context models', u'Method'), (u'context-aware applications', u'Task')], [(u'context management systems', u'Method'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'context information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'external context models', u'Method')], [(u'web semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'context management systems', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[(u'semantics', u'PART-OF', u'run-time adaptation')], [], [], [], [(u'web semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'context management systems')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper exploits semantics to apply context in run-time adaptation , particularly for services in a user-centered smart environment .', u'Context-sensitive services are usually focused on their own information without interoperation pretensions .', u'It is necessary to enable common context models and systems in order to make context-aware applications interoperable .', u'Moreover , context management systems need to implement mechanisms to support the dynamic behavior of the users and their surroundings , including techniques to adapt the model to their future needs , to maintain the context information at run-time and to be interoperable with external context models .', u'By adapting web semantic technologies we can enable smarter and more proactive operation of context management systems .', u'Copyright 2010 John Wiley & Sons , Ltd .']

relations: [[], [(u'semantic technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'metadata management'), (u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'metadata management')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Team building plays a crucial role in many collaborative projects .', u'The use of semantic technologies and tools , like ontologies and metadata management proved to be a powerful approach to organize people competencies and support the formation of teams .', u'Although Knowledge Discovery in Databases ( KDD ) has inherent collaborative characteristics , team building in this domain has not been the subject of extensive work yet .', u'In this paper we start filling this gap by presenting TeamOnto , an ontology for the representation of project teams .', u'TeamOnto is part of a wide , modular and integrated Knowledge Base about KDD projects , of which we briefly illustrate some modules , showing their use to support team building in the KDD domain .']

sentences: [u'This paper describes the European Framework Seven CUBIST project , which ran from October 2010 to September 2013 .', u'The project aimed to combine the best elements of traditional BI with the newer , semantic , technologies of the Sematic Web , in the form of RDF and FCA .', u"CUBISTs purpose was to provide end-users with `` conceptually relevant and user friendly visual analytics '' to allow them to explore their data in new ways , discovering hidden meaning and solving hitherto difficult problems .", u'To this end , three of the partners in CUBIST were use-cases : recruitment consultancy , computational biology and the space industry .', u'Each use-case provided their own requirements and evaluated how well the CUBIST outcomes addressed them .']

entities: [[(u'Rexplore', u'Method'), (u'solutions', u'Generic'), (u'data mining', u'Task'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'visual analytics', u'Task'), (u'scholarly data', u'Material')], [(u'co-authorship relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multi-dimensional parameters', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'abstraction', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Rexplore leverages novel solutions in data mining , semantic technologies and visual analytics , and provides an innovative environment for exploring and making sense of scholarly data .', u'Rexplore allows users : 1 ) to detect and make sense of important trends in research ; 2 ) to identify a variety of interesting relations between researchers , beyond the standard co-authorship relations provided by most other systems ; 3 ) to perform fine-grained expert search with respect to detailed multi-dimensional parameters ; 4 ) to detect and characterize the dynamics of interesting communities of researchers , identified on the basis of shared research interests and scientific trajectories ; 5 ) to analyse research performance at different levels of abstraction , including individual researchers , organizations , countries , and research communities .']

sentences: [u'There are dramatically increasing interests from both academic and industry in the trend of cloud computing .', u'Cloud computing depends on the idea of computing on demand that provide , support and delivery of computing services with stable and large data space .', u'Our research concerns with improving the searching process in the cloud storage via avoiding the bottleneck in central ontology cloud storage system since all data chunks in the cloud must be indexed by a master ontology server.The contribution of this paper proposes new cloud storage architecture based distributed ontology as one of the main semantic technologies .', u'This architecture provides better scalability , fault tolerance and enhanced performance for searching in the cloud storage avoiding the central bottleneck']

entities: [[(u'Approaches', u'Generic'), (u'Web service composition', u'Task'), (u'service descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'service composition software', u'Method'), (u'highly-optimized and proprietary formats', u'Method'), (u'service descriptions', u'Material'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'standards-based service description repository', u'Method')], [(u'service description repository', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'topic maps', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'triple-spaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'annual software competition', u'Method'), (u'Web service discovery', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Approaches to Web service composition are dependent upon some form of repository to hold service descriptions .', u'Most service composition software relies upon highly-optimized and proprietary formats for representing service descriptions and storing them into a repository .', u'Unlike these approaches , this paper reports on the development and evolution of a standards-based service description repository .', u'The evolutionary aspect of the described service description repository is of interest as it provides insight into the rapidly changing landscape of semantic technologies and tools ; from topic maps to triple-spaces .', u'The work described in this paper is contextualized against the backdrop of the Web services challenge an annual software competition which fosters research in the realm of Web service discovery and composition .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Sensor Web', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneous sensor networks', u'Method')], [(u'Environmental monitoring applications', u'Task'), (u'change detection', u'Task'), (u'spatio-temporal context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'Complex Event Processing ( CEP ) techniques', u'Method')], [(u'CEP', u'Method'), (u'observable variables', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'event patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'event processing', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'time-series of observations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'inferred events', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'The Semantic Sensor Web provides a framework for the interoperable exchange and processing of observation data from heterogeneous sensor networks .', u'Environmental monitoring applications deal with change detection in a spatio-temporal context .', u'Here it is required to analyze vast amounts of sensor data in order to react to specific situations .', u'In the ENVISION project , we explore how to enhance this process of sense & respond by using Complex Event Processing ( CEP ) techniques .', u'CEP allows defining situations of change in observable variables using event patterns .', u'By combining event processing and semantic technologies we are able to process time-series of observations from different sources and communicate the inferred events to interested communities in near real-time .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'searching', u'Task')], [(u'image search', u'Task'), (u'bookmarking', u'Task'), (u'expert finder systems', u'Task')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'background knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'systems', u'Generic')], [], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic')], [(u'requirements', u'Generic'), (u'real world applications', u'Task'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'Ontology Maturing Process Model', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Semantic technologies are very helpful in improving existing systems for searching , managing and retrieving of resources , e.g .', u'image search , bookmarking or expert finder systems .', u'They enhance these systems through background knowledge stored in ontologies .', u'However , in most cases , resources in these systems change very fast .', u'In consequence , they require a dynamic and agile change of underlying ontologies .', u'Also , the formality of these ontologies must fit the users needs and capabilities and must be appropriate and usable .', u'Therefore , a continuous , collaborative and work or task integrated development of these ontologies is required .', u'In this paper , we present how these requirements occur in real world applications and how they are solved and implemented using our Ontology Maturing Process Model .']

entities: [[(u'workflow technology', u'Method'), (u'service oriented environment', u'Task'), (u'service composition', u'Task'), (u'composition model', u'Method'), (u'coordination protocols', u'Method'), (u'coordination protocols', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'splitting processes', u'Method'), (u'workflow technology', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'semantic processes', u'Method'), (u'creation of orchestrations', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'workflow technology', u'USED-FOR', u'service oriented environment'), (u'workflow technology', u'USED-FOR', u'service composition'), (u'workflow technology', u'USED-FOR', u'so-called orchestration'), (u'composition model', u'USED-FOR', u'service composition'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'workflow technology'), (u'semantic technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic technologies'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'creation of orchestrations'), (u'semantic processes', u'USED-FOR', u'creation of orchestrations')]]
sentences: [u'One of the most important roles of workflow technology in a service oriented environment is that of providing an easy to use technology for service composition ( so-called orchestration ) Another important composition model in this domain is based on the technology of coordination protocols We sketch the relation between orchestration and coordination protocols by describing two application areas of both technologies : the introduction of subprocesses to the service oriented world , and facilitating outsourcing by making splitting processes much easier Cooperation aspects of workflow technology are emphasized by sketching the inclusion of human tasks in orchestrations Finally , the benefit of combining semantic technologies with orchestrations is outlined ( semantic processes ) which aims in simplifying the creation of orchestrations .']

sentences: [u'The main goal of the OPEN IDEA Project is the development of a platform which efficiently manages the innovative ideas within an organization by using semantic technologies and natural language processing .', u'The main challenge of this system is to promote the concept of Open Innovation in the enterprise by making easier the interaction between the organization users and the innovative ideas proposed during the whole management process .', u'This project is being jointly developed by the Quality Objects Enterprise and the TECNOMOD resarch group from the University of Murcia , and it is funded by the Ministry of Industry , Energy and Tourism ( Research and Development programme Avanza Competitividad 2012 ) .', u'Keywords : semantic tagging , semantic indexing , open innovation , ontologies']

sentences: [u'Zusammenfassung .', u'In den letzten Jahren ist die Menge der verfugbaren Linked Data im Web stetig gestiegen .', u'Daher veroffentlichen immer mehr Provider ihre statistischen Datensatze als Linked Data , um sie mit weiteren Informationen anzureichern .', u'Wir mochten in diesem Kurzbeitrag zu einer laufenden Arbeit eine Extract-Transform-Load ( ETL ) Pipeline vorstellen , die extrem grose Mengen an Linked Data automatisiert in ein horizontal skalierbares Open Source OLAP-System bereitstellen kann .']

entities: [[(u'lipids', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cancer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'genesis', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'progression', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'lipidome of ovarian cancer', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'lipid ontology', u'Task'), (u'text mining', u'Task'), (u'aggregation and coordination of lipid literature', u'Task')], [(u'lipids', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ovarian cancer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mining of literature', u'Task'), (u'drug discovery targets', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'genesis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'progression')], [], [], [(u'lipid ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'text mining')], []]
sentences: [u'The role of lipids in cancer during the genesis , progression and subsequent metastasis stages is increasingly discussed in the scientific literature .', u'This information is discussed in a wide range of journals making it difficult for researchers to track the latest developments .', u'A comprehensive assessment and translation of the lipidome of ovarian cancer , originating from literature , has yet to be made .', u'We illustrate the deployment of semantic technologies ; lipid ontology and text mining , in the aggregation and coordination of lipid literature .', u'We provide the first report on the roles and types of lipids involved in ovarian cancer based on the mining of literature and identify key lipid-protein interactions that may point to potential drug discovery targets .']

entities: [[(u'military operations', u'Task')], [(u'plan development process', u'Method')], [(u'plan development process', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'adaptation of human experiences', u'Task'), (u'distributed , mixed-initiative , case-based planning system', u'Method')], [(u'semantic extensions', u'Method'), (u'Distributed Episodic Exploratory Planning project', u'Method'), (u'instantiation and adaptation of plans', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'plan development process', u'USED-FOR', u'adaptation of human experiences'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'plan development process'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'adaptation of human experiences'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed , mixed-initiative , case-based planning system')], []]
sentences: [u'Abstract : Advancements in technology have significantly impacted the methods and tactics of modern military operations , thereby significantly shortening the window of opportunity to act .', u'The plan development process takes up a significant portion of the available time and has a direct impact on effectiveness of the response .', u'We postulate that the plan development process can be improved and shortened by leveraging the semantic technologies to improve the adaptation of human experiences within a distributed , mixed-initiative , case-based planning system .', u'In particular , we present research that builds upon the semantic extensions of the Distributed Episodic Exploratory Planning project , where agents utilize the capabilities of actors and resources through the available taxonomies to improve the instantiation and adaptation of plans .']

entities: [[(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'e-assessment', u'Task')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'technology based educational process', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology network development', u'Method'), (u'AONet', u'Method'), (u'e-assessment domain', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'technology based educational process')], [(u'AONet', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology network development')]]
sentences: [u'The use of ontologies , as tools to guide the generation , organization and personalization of e-learning content including e-assessment has drawn attention since they can represent the knowledge of a given domain and have the capability of reasoning about it .', u'Although the use of these semantic technologies tend to enhance technology based educational process , the lack of validation to improve the quality of learning in their use , makes educator feel reluctant of using it .', u'This paper presents the progress in an ontology network development , AONet , that conceptualizes the e-assessment domain with the aim of supporting the semiautomatic generation of it , taking into account not only technical aspects but also pedagogical one .']

relations: [[(u'conceptual models', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic modeling approaches'), (u'conceptual models', u'CONJUNCTION', u'controlled vocabularies'), (u'controlled vocabularies', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic modeling approaches'), (u'controlled vocabularies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontologies'), (u'ontologies', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic modeling approaches')], [], [(u'modeling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantics'), (u'modeling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'scientific data provenance'), (u'scientific workflows', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantics'), (u'scientific workflows', u'CONJUNCTION', u'scientific data provenance'), (u'scientific data provenance', u'CONJUNCTION', u'observational data management')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic modeling approaches ( e.g. , conceptual models , controlled vocabularies , and ontologies ) are increasingly being adopted to help address a number of challenges in scientific data management .', u'While semantic information has played a considerable role within bioinformatics , semantic technologies can similarly benefit a wide range of scientific disciplines .', u'Here we focus on three main areas where modeling and semantics are playing an increasingly important role : scientific workflows , scientific data provenance , and observational data management .', u'Applications of these areas span a number of disciplines and provide both challenges and new opportunities for conceptual modeling research and development .', u'We provide a brief overview of each area , discuss the role that modeling plays within each , and present current research opportunities .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'fast harmonization of data')], [(u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'visual tools'), (u'alignment targets', u'CONJUNCTION', u'visual tools'), (u'visual tools', u'CONJUNCTION', u'natural language processing'), (u'visual tools', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic graphs')], [(u'prototype', u'USED-FOR', u'analysis')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Analysts are presented with a never ending stream of data sources .', u'Often , subsets of data sources to solve problems are easily identified but the process to align data sets is time consuming .', u'However , many semantic technologies do allow for fast harmonization of data to overcome these problems .', u'These include ontologies that serve as alignment targets , visual tools and natural language processing that generate semantic graphs in terms of the ontologies , and analytics that leverage these graphs .', u'This research reviews a developed prototype that employs all these approaches to perform analysis across disparate data sources documenting violent , extremist events .', u'( 2015 ) COPYRIGHT Society of Photo-Optical Instrumentation Engineers ( SPIE ) .', u'Downloading of the abstract is permitted for personal use only .']

entities: [[(u'ontology learning', u'Method'), (u'domain models', u'Method')], [(u'ontology learning system', u'Method'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'trend analysis', u'Task'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [], [(u'trends', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'evolution', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'fine-grained-level', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'ontology learning', u'USED-FOR', u'domain models')], [(u'ontology learning system', u'USED-FOR', u'domain ontologies')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The aim of ontology learning is to generate domain models ( semi- ) automatically .', u'We apply an ontology learning system to create domain ontologies from scratch in a monthly interval and use the resulting data to detect and analyze trends in the domain .', u'In contrast to traditional trend analysis on the level of single terms , the application of semantic technologies allows for a more abstract and integrated view of the domain .', u'A Web frontend displays the resulting ontologies , and a number of analyses are performed on the data collected .', u'This frontend can be used to detect trends and evolution in a domain , and dissect them on an aggregated , as well as a fine-grained-level .']

entities: [[(u'Sharing digital contents', u'Task'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [], [(u'social relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'access constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'content sharing', u'Task')], [(u'personalized and granular enough access control', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'access authorization model', u'Method'), (u'real life social relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'trust', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distance of relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'frequency of interactions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'formal knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'personalized access authorization policies', u'Method')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'model', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Sharing digital contents on the Web has become one of the most popular activities on the Internet .', u'When the contents are sensitive in nature , sharing them online has security implications .', u'Recently social relations are used extensively as access constraints to secure the content sharing .', u'However only relation can not provide personalized and granular enough access control .', u'To mitigate the problems , this paper proposes an access authorization model incorporating diverse real life social relations and associated attributes such as trust , distance of relations and frequency of interactions .', u'The model comprises of a formal knowledge base and personalized access authorization policies .', u'We implement the model using the capabilities of semantic technologies .', u'The paper also demonstrates practical applications of such model .']

entities: [[(u'information management', u'Method'), (u'problem solving', u'Task')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'enterprise social media applications', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Web 3L model', u'Method'), (u'3-layer structure of networks', u'Method'), (u'social and semantic networks', u'Method')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'corporate problem solving', u'Task')], [(u'distribution of urgent requests', u'Task'), (u'internal knowledge networking tool', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'social and semantic networks', u'CONJUNCTION', u'3-layer structure of networks')], [(u'model', u'USED-FOR', u'corporate problem solving')], []]
sentences: [u'The basic challenge of information management is to provide useful information to the right people in a given situation , such as for problem solving .', u'In a company , semantic technologies in combination with enterprise social media applications can be applied for the identification of experts in a required field of expertise .', u'Our approach uses the Web 3L model , a 3-layer structure of networks which includes relations from social and semantic networks .', u'It is shown how this model can be used to target the right crowd for corporate problem solving .', u'The distribution of urgent requests in an internal knowledge networking tool is described as a real world example that is used in a productive environment .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'data interoperability'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'Future Internet'), (u'open service frameworks', u'CONJUNCTION', u'information models'), (u'open service frameworks', u'USED-FOR', u'data interoperability'), (u'information models', u'USED-FOR', u'data interoperability'), (u'information models', u'USED-FOR', u'Future Internet')]]
sentences: [u'Internet of Things ( IoT ) is an emerging area that not only requires development of infrastructure but also deployment of new services capable of supporting multiple , scalable ( cloud-based ) and interoperable ( multi-domain ) applications .', u"In the race of designing the IoT as part of the Future Internet architecture , academic and ICT 's ( Information and Communication Technology ) industry communities have realized that a common IoT problem to be tackled is the interoperability of the information .", u'In this paper we review recent trends and challenges on interoperability , and discuss how semantic technologies , open service frameworks and information models can support data interoperability in the design of the Future Internet , taking the IoT and Cloud Computing as reference examples of application domains .']

entities: [[(u'medical diagnosis systems', u'Method'), (u'modeling of the knowledge base', u'Task')], [(u'high sensitivity systems', u'Method'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'accuracy', u'Metric'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'multi-level diagnosis', u'Task'), (u'pathology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'diagnostic element', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pathology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'concept', u'Generic'), (u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'rule inference techniques', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'multi-level diagnosis', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'modeling of the knowledge base', u'USED-FOR', u'medical diagnosis systems')], [(u'accuracy', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'system')], [], [(u'solution', u'USED-FOR', u'problem'), (u'rule inference techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'solution'), (u'multi-level diagnosis', u'USED-FOR', u'problem')]]
sentences: [u'The capability of medical diagnosis systems to provide results in different situations depends on the modeling of the knowledge base .', u'In the case of high sensitivity systems , the capability of having an adequate model allows to increase the accuracy of the system even in situations where the number of input elements is low .', u'In this context the concept of multi-level diagnosis emerges , where a pathology can be assumed as a diagnostic element of another pathology ( acting as a finding ) .', u'In this paper this concept is studied in depth from the modeling point of view , providing a solution based on rule inference techniques modeled with semantic technologies , and allowing solving the problem generated by multi-level diagnosis .']

sentences: [u'This book constitutes the refereed proceedings of the 20th International Conference on Automated Reasoning with Analytic Tableaux and Related Methods , TABLEAUX 2011 , held in Bern , Switzerland , in July 2011 .', u'The 16 revised research papers presented together with 2 system descriptions were carefully reviewed and selected from 34 submissions .', u'The papers cover many topics in the wide range of applications of tableaux and related methods such as analytic tableaux for various logics , related techniques and concepts , related methods , new calculi and methods for theorem proving in classical and non-classical logics , as well as systems , tools , implementations and applications ; all with a special focus on hardware and software verifications , semantic technologies , and knowledge engineering .']

relations: [[(u'Public Administrations', u'USED-FOR', u'eGovernment services'), (u'transactional operations', u'PART-OF', u'Web')], [], [(u'added-value services', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications'), (u'automatic service requests', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications')], []]
sentences: [u'The provision of eGovernment services by Public Administrations is currently evolving from services based on static information to more mature stages with support for transactional operations in the Web .', u'Nevertheless , there is still a step to be faced in that evolution : the use of semantic support in the context of social networks for the provision of advanced services .', u'By taking advantage of semantic technologies , it is possible to derive added-value services and applications such as advanced searching services , integration on the citizen profiles , and automatic service requests for actual and potential needs .', u'This paper presents how to fulfill this step in an open and interoperable manner that can be reused in further projects in the domain .']

sentences: [u'Resumen Antecedentes : El numero de usuarios que en la actualidad se apropia de practicas de consulta utilizando sistemas documentales crece de manera significativa , sin embargo el uso convencional de procesos de busqueda de manera textual o sintactica , produce una extensa cantidad de resultados con bajo nivel de pertinencia , obligando al usuario a emplear un gran numero de horas para acceder a los resultados proporcionados y determinar aquellos que presentan un alto grado de correspondencia con su area de interes .', u'Objetivo : El objetivo fundamental de este trabajo es obtener un conjunto de inferencias mediante la logica de predicados , a partir de un modelo ontologico de trabajos de grado en modalidad pasantia , las cuales permitan obtener informacion implicita a partir de las descripciones semanticas que representan a cada uno de los documentos referenciados .', u'Metodologia : El modelo ontologico se obtuvo consultando las normas y disposiciones acerca de pasantias , estableciendo los conceptos del dominio y las correspondientes relaciones entre conceptos ; la representacion computacional del modelo se realizo en lenguaje OWL y mediante logica de predicados de primer orden , se establecieron las sentencias que permiten la realizacion de inferencias para obtener informacion implicita contenida en la base de conocimiento .', u'Resultados : Entre las inferencias mas significativas que se obtuvieron estan : la tipificacion de documentos relacionados con un tema de interes y la identificacion de docentes por areas de experticia .', u'Conclusion : La aplicacion de la logica de predicados a esta modalidad de trabajos de grado permite realizar inferencias de manera dinamica sobre el contenido representado a nivel ontologico y puede utilizarse para complementar la informacion descrita explicitamente en el modelo , con respecto a tematicas y areas de experticia de los docentes , independientemente de la ubicacion de los repositorios de documentos .', u'Las sentencias utilizadas pueden ser aplicadas a otras modalidades de grado como investigacion y monografia .', u'Abstract Background : The number of users that currently appropriates query practices using document systems has grown significantly , however , the conventional use of textual or syntactical search processes produces a vast amount of low-relevant results , forcing the user to employ a large number of hours to access the results provided and to determine those with a high level of correspondence with their field of interest .', u'Objective : The mainobjective of this work was to obtain a set of inferences through predicate logic , from an internship documents ontological model , which allow to obtain implicit information from semantic descriptions representing each one of the referenced documents .', u'Methods : The ontological model was obtained by consulting standards and provisions about internships , setting the domain concepts and the corresponding relations between concepts ; the model computational representation was developed with OWL language and first-order predicate logic were used to establish the sentences that allow making inferences , to get implicit information in the knowledge base .', u'Results : Among the most significant inferences that were obtained are : the classification of documents related to a topic of interest and the identification of teachers by areas of expertise .', u'Conclusion : The application of predicate logic to internship documents allows to dynamically make inferences about the content represented at ontological level and can be used to complement the explicitly described information in the model , regarding issues and areas of expertise of the teachers , regardless of the location of document repositories .', u'The statements used can be applied to other types of degree as research and monography .', u'Palabras clave : Inferencia , logica de predicados , ontologia , pasantia .']

sentences: [u'basic noun , burning a basic verb ) .', u'D classifies adjectives , predominantly on semantic groundswith some syntactic confirmation for the differences-in terms of seven categories : dimension , physical property , color , human propensity , age , value , and speed .', u'Some syncretism and neutralization of category distinctions is allowed for .', u'D describes a range between strongly adjectival languages , where co-hyponyms of a basic adjective are adjectives , and strongly verbal languages , where co-hyponyms of a basic adjective are verbs .', u'This is an interesting exercise in the classification of adjectives , but there are no surprises-except for the title , the point of which escapes me .', u"' A method of semantic description ' ( 65-115 ) justifies distinguishing between nuclear and nonnuclear verbs in the Dyirbal language of Australia by comparing J [ aljuy ] , the 'mother-in-law language ' , with G [ uwal ] , the style used between other interlocutors .", u'Nuclear vocabulary items are supposedly defined in terms of semantic components , non-nuclear items in terms of nuclear ones ( cf .', u'Weinreich [ 1962 ] 1980:308-9 ) .', u'J has only about 25 % of the vocabulary of G ; its lexical items tend to be broadly denotative , with more specific identification achieved through circumlocution .', u'Consequently , one verb in J corresponds to many in G ; yet when asked for a G equivalent of a given J verb , only one G verb is typically given by speakers , and such a verb is semantically nuclear .', u"D claims that nuclear verbs have semantic correspondents across languages , and that they are defined in terms of semantic components ; thus he implies that a set of universal semantic components exists which includes , inter alia , the component 'not-water ' .", u"More evidence for such 'universal semantic components ' is needed .", u"Apparently D does not believe a semantic metalanguage needs syntactic structure ; otherwise , why should he say ( 113 ) that 'It appears that SOME syntactic bracketing must be retained in the semantic descriptions of phrases ' ?", u"D 's essay is an interesting exercise in semantic description , and the distinction between nuclear and non-nuclear terms for a small set of verbs is nicely justified on the basis of the comparative speech styles of G and J .", u'But could a similar analysis be made for the entire vocabulary of , say , English , where no such comparative method lies to hand ?', u"'The semantics of giving ' ( 117-39 ) takes give as a nuclear verb , and relates it to non-nuclear lend , sell , rent , pay , donate , award , and present .", u'D distinguishes nuclear give from its non-nuclear relatives on the grounds that it has no converse ; he does not explain why take should not be so counted .', u'He also claims that have is not in the English lexicon-a notion that had some currency in the mid sixties .', u'But if have is not in the lexicon , where is it ?', u'D offers an interesting discussion of give-related verbs , but there is no advance over Bendix 1966 .', u"'Syntactic orientation as a semantic property ' ( 141-55 ) looks at some of the effects which aspectual verbs and manner adverbs have on the verbs within their scope .", u'Little here is original , and there are many errors .', u"Thus D writes ( 151 ) : 'die is clearly related to finish living , rather than to cease living ' ( citing McCawley 1968 's 'cease to be alive ' ) ; this overlooks the fact that Max died can be paraphrased by Max ceased to be alive but not by ?", u'* Max finished living .', u'( The possibility of Max finished with living is not even hinted at . )', u'It is hard to justify the reprinting of this essay .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data proposals', u'Material'), (u'educational field', u'Material')], [(u'online bibliographic databases', u'Material')], [(u'TEL research areas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'personalization', u'Task'), (u'contextualized learning', u'Task')], [(u'learning object and repository research', u'Task'), (u'Linked Data practices', u'Method'), (u'integration of educational datasets', u'Task')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [], [(u'Linked Data model', u'Method'), (u'control of data sources', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data quality', u'Metric')], [(u'Linked Data- based proposals', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'federation and interlinking practices', u'Method'), (u'generation of learning artifacts', u'Task'), (u'en- richment of educational data', u'Task'), (u'educational applications', u'Task'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'educational field', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Linked Data proposals')], [], [(u'interoperability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'personalization'), (u'personalization', u'CONJUNCTION', u'contextualized learning')], [(u'Linked Data practices', u'USED-FOR', u'integration of educational datasets')], [], [], [], [(u'classification of vocabularies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'datasets'), (u'datasets', u'CONJUNCTION', u'technological products')], [(u'generation of learning artifacts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'en- richment of educational data'), (u'en- richment of educational data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'educational applications'), (u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'educational applications')]]
sentences: [u'This study critically reviews the recently published scientific literature on Linked Data proposals in the educational field .', u'After systematically searching online bibliographic databases , 33 original works satisfied the scope and quality criteria , and thus were included in this review .', u'Studies were classified with respect to TEL research areas ; interoperability , personalization and contextualized learning were the main areas addressed .', u'Many studies have a foundation on learning object and repository research , where Linked Data practices are applied to simplify the integration of educational datasets .', u'As learning institutions are gradually exposing their key datasets as Linked Data , an emergent educational data web is being constituted .', u'A number of the reviewed works consume these data for different purposes , reporting reusability and enrichment benefits .', u'Nevertheless , upcoming proposals should be aware of existing challenges , de- rived from the Linked Data model , such as the lack of control of data sources or varying degrees of data quality .', u'We also give some recommendations for delivering Linked Data- based proposals in education , including a classification of vocabularies , datasets and technological products .', u'Future research directions include the release of new datasets as Linked Data , federation and interlinking practices to improve the cohesion of the emergent educational Web of Data , generation of learning artifacts , curation and en- richment of educational data , novel educational applications consuming Linked Data , and performance improvements .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data datasets', u'Material')], [(u'unstructured plain text', u'Material'), (u'Entity Linking task', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'generic Linked Data datasets', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data datasets', u'Material'), (u'Entity Linking task', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'generic Linked Data datasets')], [(u'Linked Data datasets', u'USED-FOR', u'Entity Linking task')]]
sentences: [u'The number of available Linked Data datasets has been increasing over time .', u'Despite this , their use to recognise entities in unstructured plain text ( Entity Linking task ) is still limited to a small number of datasets .', u'In this paper we propose a framework adaptable to the structure of generic Linked Data datasets .', u'This adaptability allows a broader use of Linked Data datasets for the Entity Linking task .']

relations: [[(u'media production domain', u'USED-FOR', u'media assets')], [(u'Ontology-based applications', u'USED-FOR', u'problem')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic annotations')], [(u'SALERO Intelligent Media Annotation & Search system', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach')], [(u'free text tagging', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic technologies'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'It')], [(u'user interface techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'annotations')]]
sentences: [u'Currently the media production domain lacks efficient ways to organize and search for media assets .', u'Ontology-based applications have been identified as a viable solution to this problem , however , sometimes being too complex for non-experienced users .', u'We present a fast and easy to use approach to create semantic annotations and relationships of media resources .', u'The approach is implemented in the SALERO Intelligent Media Annotation & Search system .', u'It combines the simplicity of free text tagging and the power of semantic technologies and by that makes a compromise in the complexity of full semantic annotations .', u'We present the implementation of the approach in the system and an evaluation of different user interface techniques for creating annotations .']

entities: [[(u'Cyber Physical Test Bed', u'Method'), (u'Virtual Enterprise oriented approach', u'Method'), (u'assembly of micro devices', u'Task')], [(u'Micro Assembly', u'Method'), (u'VE functioning approach', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'micro assembly', u'Task'), (u'micro assembly resources', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Micro Assembly', u'Task')], [(u'domain', u'Generic'), (u'Virtual Enterprise oriented approach', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Cyber Physical Test Bed', u'USED-FOR', u'Virtual Enterprise oriented approach'), (u'Cyber Physical Test Bed', u'USED-FOR', u'assembly of micro devices'), (u'Virtual Enterprise oriented approach', u'USED-FOR', u'assembly of micro devices')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'VE functioning approach')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper , the creation of a Cyber Physical Test Bed ( CTB ) to support a Virtual Enterprise oriented approach for the assembly of micro devices is discussed .', u'The domain of Micro Assembly provides a natural context to develop products by adopting a VE functioning approach and using semantic technologies .', u'As each VE partner or engineering organization in the domain of micro assembly possesses different micro assembly resources , there is a need to form collaborative partnerships to address specific customer requests related to Micro Assembly .', u'This nature of the domain lends itself as an ideal ground to test the development of a Virtual Enterprise oriented approach using a range of software and other resources .']
