relations: [[], [(u'creation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'life-cycle'), (u'creation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'topics'), (u'creation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'discovery'), (u'creation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'selection'), (u'discovery', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'life-cycle'), (u'discovery', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'topics'), (u'discovery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'selection'), (u'discovery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ranking'), (u'selection', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'life-cycle'), (u'selection', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'topics'), (u'selection', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ranking'), (u'ranking', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'life-cycle'), (u'ranking', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'topics')], [(u'hyperlink relations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'hyperlink relations'), (u'hyperlink relations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'monitoring information')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'real-world service aspects')]]
sentences: [u'In the last years we see a clear trend in the Computer Science area to a move towards Service-Oriented Architectures ( SOAs ) .', u'Research in the service domain encompasses its whole life-cycle , including topics as creation , discovery , selection , ranking and composition .', u'This paper focuses on the ranking of discovered Web Services , proposing a novel approach based on non-functional properties of services : information that is available about services by analyzing their description that is available on the Web , their hyperlink relations , monitoring information , etc .', u'The approach is making use of semantic technologies , aggregating the various real-world service aspects as described above in a unified model and providing different rank values based on those aspects .']

entities: [[(u'Lithuanian ontology', u'Task'), (u'WordNet family', u'Material'), (u'LitWordNet', u'Material')], [(u'RDF/OWL standard', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'language and semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'lexical databases', u'Material'), (u'morphological-syntactic properties of words', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'LitWordNet', u'Material'), (u'lexical-semantic network', u'Method')], [(u'language resource', u'Material'), (u'Lithuanian language', u'Material'), (u'Lithuanian language technology', u'Method')], [(u'context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'enlargement', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'LitWordNet', u'Material')], []]
relations: [[(u'LitWordNet', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Lithuanian ontology'), (u'LitWordNet', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'WordNet family')], [], [], [(u'LitWordNet', u'USED-FOR', u'lexical-semantic network')], [], [(u'creation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'context'), (u'creation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'structure'), (u'context', u'CONJUNCTION', u'structure'), (u'context', u'CONJUNCTION', u'enlargement'), (u'structure', u'CONJUNCTION', u'enlargement')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper presents the first Lithuanian ontology in the WordNet family that is LitWordNet .', u'The resource that is visualized in RDF/OWL standard is very important for developing and applying language and semantic technologies .', u'Traditional lexical databases are limited to morphological-syntactic properties of words .', u'LitWordNet connects words into the lexical-semantic network .', u'The creation of such a language resource for the Lithuanian language marks a further step towards a breakthrough in the research and development of Lithuanian language technology .', u'The paper describes the creation , context , structure , enlargement , and links to related resources of LitWordNet .', u'The paper ends with an assessment of the current stage of LitWordNet development and presents guidelines for its further development .']

entities: [[(u'neXtProt', u'Method'), (u'human protein-centric knowledgebase', u'Method')], [(u'human proteins', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'neXtProt', u'Method'), (u'data', u'Generic'), (u'precise annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web interface', u'Method')], [(u'proteomics data', u'Material'), (u'search capability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'neXtProt update', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'neXtProt', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'human protein-centric knowledgebase')], [(u'data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'precise annotations')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'search capability')], []]
sentences: [u'neXtProt ( http : //www.nextprot.org ) is a human protein-centric knowledgebase developed at the SIB Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics .', u'Focused solely on human proteins , neXtProt aims to provide a state of the art resource for the representation of human biology by capturing a wide range of data , precise annotations , fully traceable data provenance and a web interface which enables researchers to find and view information in a comprehensive manner .', u'Since the introductory neXtProt publication , significant advances have been made on three main aspects : the representation of proteomics data , an extended representation of human variants and the development of an advanced search capability built around semantic technologies .', u'These changes are presented in the current neXtProt update .']

entities: [[(u'data-intensive astronomy', u'Task')], [(u'semantic infrastructure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'computer science', u'Task'), (u'deployment and performance details', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'AI abstractions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ideas', u'Generic'), (u'contextual data access', u'Task'), (u'distributed annotation', u'Task'), (u'heterogeneous sources', u'Material'), (u'intelligent data dissemination', u'Task'), (u'discovery', u'Material')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'astroinformatics', u'Task'), (u'SKUA', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'AstroCollation', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'semantic infrastructure', u'USED-FOR', u'computer science'), (u'deployment and performance details', u'CONJUNCTION', u'AI abstractions')], [(u'contextual data access', u'CONJUNCTION', u'distributed annotation'), (u'distributed annotation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'heterogeneous sources'), (u'distributed annotation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'intelligent data dissemination'), (u'heterogeneous sources', u'CONJUNCTION', u'intelligent data dissemination'), (u'heterogeneous sources', u'CONJUNCTION', u'discovery'), (u'intelligent data dissemination', u'CONJUNCTION', u'discovery')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'astronomy'), (u'SKUA', u'CONJUNCTION', u'AstroCollation')]]
sentences: [u'Many activities in the era of data-intensive astronomy are predicated upon some transference of domain knowledge and expertise from human to machine .', u'The semantic infrastructure required to support this is no longer a pipe dream of computer science but a set of practical engineering challenges , more concerned with deployment and performance details than AI abstractions .', u'The application of such ideas promises to help in such areas as contextual data access , exploiting distributed annotation and heterogeneous sources , and intelligent data dissemination and discovery .', u'In this talk , we will review the status and use of semantic technologies in astronomy , particularly to address current problems in astroinformatics , with such projects as SKUA and AstroCollation .']

sentences: [u"Keynote Papers.- What Does It Mean to `` Measure Performance '' ? .- Trustworthy Computing.- Towards Next Generation Web Information Retrieval.- Session 1 : Web Information System Modelling.- Making XML an Information Modeling Language.- Web Information Exchange Diagrams for UML.- A User Service Oriented Method to Model Web Information Systems.- The Power of Media Types.- Scenario Matching Using Functional Substitutability in Web Services.- Session 2 : Payment and Security.- Three Kinds of E-wallets for a NetPay Micro-Payment System.- Information Assurance in Federated Identity Management : Experimentations and Issues.- Query-Log Based Authority Analysis for Web Information Search.- XML Signature Extensibility Using Custom Transforms.- Session 3 : Information Extraction.- Extraction of Cognitively-Significant Place Names and Regions from Web-Based Physical Proximity Co-occurrences.- Query Based Chinese Phrase Extraction for Site Search.- Extracting Business Rules from Web Product Descriptions.- Wrapping HTML Tables into XML.- Vague Event-Based Related News Detection.- Session 4 : Advanced Applications.- A Web Based Platform for the Design of Administrational Reference Process Models.- Technologies for Online Issuing Service of Documents.- AutoDBT : A Framework for Automatic Testing of Web Database Applications.- Web-Based Surgical Simulation of Craniofacial CT Data.- Applications of Data Mining in Web Services.- Session 5 : Performance Issues.- A Framework for the Relational Implementation of Tree Algebra to Retrieve Structured Document Fragments.- An Efficient OLAP Query Processing Technique Using Measure Attribute Indexes.- Preserving Aggregation Semantic Constraints in XML Document Update.- Session 6 : Linkage Analysis and Document Clustering.- Exploiting PageRank at Different Block Level.- Multi-type Features Based Web Document Clustering.- Clustering Transactional XML Data with Semantically-Enriched Content and sentences: [u'We are surrounded by an ever increasing ocean of information , everybody will agree to that .', u'We build sophisticated strategies to govern this information : design data models , develop infrastructures for data sharing , building tool for data analysis .', u'Statistical datasets curated by National Statistical Offices ( NSO ) and international bodies like the OECD and Eurostat are being increasingly published on the Web , using Web standards , as Linked Open Data .', u'We call Linked Statistical Data ( LSD ) all statistical datasets published on the Web as Linked Open Data .', u'These datasets do not only consist of current statistics , but also an inheritage of such statistics conducted in the past by these NSO .', u'Of these , the most prominent statistics are the Historical Censuses [ 1,2,3,5 ] .', u'In designing the current research landscape , there seems to be little attention to one very basic inquiry prior to any research design , so basic that it almost seems to be a shame to mention is , and that is a baseline statistics on the size of the problem we encounter to tackle , its occurrence , and the the actual need to tackle it .', u'For our own research project [ 2 ] it was important to know all these baseline statistics , for instance , how much datasets , variables and values we have , and of which nature [ 12 ] .', u'In the context of harmonization we looked for other existing vocabularies to avoid reinventing the wheel .', u'The effort on trying to reuse these vocabularies was the immediate trigger for this exercise .', u'In this paper we pose the following questions : What kind of dimensions are used in LSD ?', u'How often do they occur on the Web ?', u'Hereby , dimensions stand for the variables ( and the categories used to encode their values ) used when describing statistical data inquired to monitor society .', u'Most of those statistical datasets published on the Web use the RDF Data Cube vocabulary [ 4 ] to describe the observations , dimensions , measures and attributes they contain .', u'It is the beauty of semantic web technologies which allow us to perform , once every hour , an ontheflight collection of data from those machinereadable publications of statistical information from almost 600 endpoints all across the Web .', u'Web visualization technologies allow us to build a user interface for this meta study almost without any efforts for all of those capable of playing with those tools of course .', u'We call it LSD Dimensions , and it is available online [ 6,7 ] .', u'The availability of baseline statistics about the usage of multidimensional data on the Web opens up multiple questions , especially regarding comparability and reusability of statistical data , metadata and concepts , and how these can be combined or mixed in a semantically meaningful way [ 8 ] .', u'But its implications are much bigger .', u'Insights into the amount of statistical data available allows to better place the need for efforts to build research infrastructure for them .', u'Baseline statistics as shown in this paper also highlight where research efforts are still needed , e.g .', u'on coding schemes that do not exist yet and for which automatic tools that assist knowledge experts on building and publishing them are highly demanded [ 13 ] .', u'At the end the innovativeness of this paper lies neither in the visualizations not in the data analytics , but in the smart use of existing technologies to gain overview about the problem space prior to entering into it .', u'This way of thinking about visualizing baseline statistics in very much in line with the goals of KnoweScape combining data analytics with visualizations to enhance the access to large information spaces .', u'This exercise has been inspired by numerous works from colleagues , which either use visualizations to advocate their own profound efforts of data integration and semantical referenceable data publishing [ 9,11 ] , or build pipelines of data harvest , analysis and visualization for all kind of other information [ 10 ] .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Open Data', u'Material'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'linked data usage', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'server access analysis', u'Method')], [(u'usage patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'access logs', u'Material'), (u'LOD datasets', u'Material')], [(u'usage patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'metrics', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data usage', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'human and the machine perspective', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'resource representations', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'linked data usage', u'USED-FOR', u'features')], [], [(u'access logs', u'USED-FOR', u'usage patterns')], [(u'usage patterns', u'USED-FOR', u'metrics'), (u'metrics', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data usage'), (u'dierent agent types', u'CONJUNCTION', u'resource representations')]]
sentences: [u'Although the cloud of Linked Open Data has been growing continuously for several years , little is known about the particular features of linked data usage .', u'Motivating why it is important to understand the usage of Linked Data , we describe typical linked data usage scenarios and contrast the so derived requirement with conventional server access analysis .', u'Then , we report on usage patterns found through an indepth analysis of access logs of four popular LOD datasets .', u'Eventually , based on the usage patterns we found in the analysis , we propose metrics for assessing Linked Data usage from the human and the machine perspective , taking into account dierent agent types and resource representations .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data corpus', u'Material'), (u'Linked Dataset', u'Material')], [(u'revenue models', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data publishing', u'Material'), (u'Linked Closed Data', u'Material')], [(u'practices', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'continuous Information Quality assessment', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'revenue models', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data publishing'), (u'revenue models', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Closed Data'), (u'Linked Data publishing', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Closed Data'), (u'Linked Closed Data', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data publishing')], [], [(u'model', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data')]]
sentences: [u'The growth of the Linked Data corpus will eventually pre- vent all but the most determined of consumers from including every Linked Dataset in a single undertaking .', u'In addition , we anticipate that the need for effective revenue models for Linked Data publishing will spur the rise of Linked Closed Data , where access to datasets is restricted .', u'We argue that these impeding changes necessitate an overhaul of our current practices for consuming Linked Data .', u'To this end , we propose a model for consuming Linked Data , built on the notion of continuous Information Quality assessment , which brings together a range of existing research and highlights a number of avenues for future work .']

relations: [[(u'Relational database', u'USED-FOR', u'bio-medical Linked Data Sets')], [(u'bio-medical Linked Data Sets', u'USED-FOR', u'problem')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'concept hierarchy'), (u'Linked Data Sets', u'USED-FOR', u'concept hierarchy')], [(u'Vector Space Model ( VSM )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'hierarchical clustering algorithm'), (u'Vector Space Model ( VSM )', u'CONJUNCTION', u"Jaccard 's Coefficient"), (u'Vector Space Model ( VSM )', u'CONJUNCTION', u"Jaccard 's Coefficient ( JC )"), (u"Jaccard 's Coefficient", u'HYPONYM-OF', u'hierarchical clustering algorithm'), (u"Jaccard 's Coefficient", u'USED-FOR', u'hierarchy structure'), (u"Jaccard 's Coefficient ( JC )", u'HYPONYM-OF', u'hierarchical clustering algorithm'), (u'pre-processing data', u'USED-FOR', u'hierarchy structure')], [(u'Linked Data Sets', u'USED-FOR', u'method'), (u'DrugBank', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Linked Data Sets'), (u'DrugBank', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Diseasome'), (u'DrugBank', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Linked Life Data'), (u'Diseasome', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Linked Data Sets'), (u'Linked Life Data', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data Sets')]]
sentences: [u'Since most bio-medical Linked Data Sets are simply extracted from the Relational database , lots of them are lack of ontology or concept hierarchy structure for user better understanding the data sets .', u'This problem also limited usage of bio-medical Linked Data Sets .', u'To resolve the problem , this paper introduced a method to dynamically generate the concept hierarchy from the Linked Data Sets .', u"Based on the hierarchical clustering algorithm , we applied Vector Space Model ( VSM ) and Jaccard 's Coefficient ( JC ) to formalize the hierarchy structure after pre-processing data .", u'We implemented our method using two Linked Data Sets : DrugBank and Diseasome from Linked Life Data and evaluated performance with the gold standard .']

entities: [[(u'Urban-related data', u'Material'), (u'geographic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Location-based Services', u'Task')], [(u'UrbanMatch game', u'Method'), (u'mobile gaming application', u'Task'), (u'data linkage', u'Task'), (u'data quality/trustworthiness assessment', u'Task')], [(u'Human Computation', u'Task'), (u'interaction paradigm', u'Method'), (u'location-specic linked data', u'Material')], [(u'UrbanMatch game', u'Material'), (u'linked data applications', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Urban-related data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'geographic information'), (u'geographic information', u'PART-OF', u'Linked Data community')], [(u'UrbanMatch game', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'mobile gaming application'), (u'mobile gaming application', u'USED-FOR', u'data quality/trustworthiness assessment'), (u'data linkage', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data quality/trustworthiness assessment')], [(u'Linked Data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Human Computation'), (u'interaction paradigm', u'USED-FOR', u'location-specic linked data')], [(u'Smart Cities', u'USED-FOR', u'linked data applications')]]
sentences: [u'Urban-related data and geographic information are becoming mainstream in the Linked Data community due also to the popularity of Location-based Services .', u'In this paper , we introduce the UrbanMatch game , a mobile gaming application that joins data linkage and data quality/trustworthiness assessment in an urban environment .', u'By putting together Linked Data and Human Computation , we create a new interaction paradigm to consume and produce location-specic linked data by involving and engaging the nal user .', u'The UrbanMatch game is also oered as an example of value proposition and business model of a new family of linked data applications based on gaming in Smart Cities .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'federated query processing', u'Task')], [(u'federated database systems', u'Method'), (u'static data integration', u'Task')], [(u'agent-based architecture', u'Method'), (u'flexible and decoupled solution', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data Management System', u'Method'), (u'LDMS )', u'Method')], [(u'LDMS', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'remote data', u'Material'), (u'local data store', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'remote data')], []]
sentences: [u'With the advent of the Web of Linked Data , new challenges to federated query processing are emerging .', u'Different from traditional federated database systems which do static data integration , this Web of Data is open and ever-changing .', u'In this paper , we present a agent-based architecture providing a flexible and decoupled solution for the federated queries over Linked Data .', u'Based on the presented architecture , a Linked Data Management System ( LDMS ) has been developed .', u'LDMS manages Linked Data in a virtual way , i.e. , it does not load remote data into a local data store .', u'With an application scenario , we demonstrate the scalability and extensibility of the presented architecture .']

entities: [[(u'Portals', u'Method')], [(u'online transactions', u'Material'), (u'customized information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic portals', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'search mechanism', u'Method')], [(u'search tool', u'Method'), (u'semantic portal', u'Method'), (u'PASS', u'Method')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'portal', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'search process', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'online transactions', u'CONJUNCTION', u'customized information')], [], [], [(u'PASS', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic portal')], [(u'domain ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'tool')]]
sentences: [u'Portals have become very popular on the Internet .', u'They allow users to access many online transactions and customized information .', u'More recently , semantic portals emerged as a natural extension of traditional portals and they have been attracting researchers and enterprise attention as a new way to provide information .', u'This paper covers these issues and shows how ontologies can improve results relevance in one of the most important component of a portal : the search mechanism .', u'It describes a search tool developed in the context of a semantic portal named PASS ( portal with access to semantic search ) .', u'this tool uses components of domain ontologies stored in the portal to expand terms during the search process .']

entities: [[(u'pervasive computing', u'Method')], [], [(u'resource constrained', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'sensor nodes/mobile devices', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'semantic search', u'Method'), (u'pervasive computing', u'Method')], [(u'mobile devices', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'sensor nodes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'minimal inexact matching', u'Task'), (u'service discovery', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search')], []]
sentences: [u'The main goal of pervasive computing is to provide services that can be used by the user in the given context with minimal user intervention .', u'To support such an environment services or the applications in the environment should be able to interact seamlessly , with the other devices or applications present in the environment , to gather relevant information in current context .', u'Main challenge is devices are resource constrained .', u'To support such systems , so that they can utilize resources of other sensor nodes/mobile devices , I propose a system that integrates semantic search in pervasive computing .', u'Information associated with mobile devices and sensor nodes is used in a way that results in minimal inexact matching , efficient and improved service discovery .']

entities: [[(u'semantic overlay network structure', u'Method'), (u'structured P2P routing mechanism', u'Method'), (u'topic partition', u'Task')], [(u'SSON', u'Method'), (u'nodes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cluster', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'cluster', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'structured P2P routing mechanism', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'cluster', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic overlay network', u'Method'), (u'unstructured P2P network', u'Method'), (u'structure', u'Generic'), (u'topic cluster', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'structured P2P network', u'Method'), (u'semantic search', u'Method'), (u'search recall', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'structured P2P routing mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic overlay network structure')], [], [], [(u'unstructured P2P network', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic overlay network')], []]
sentences: [u'A semantic overlay network structure , which is based on structured P2P routing mechanism and topic partition , is presented .', u'By assigning nodeid and key according to the topic , SSON collects the nodes with the similar topic into a cluster .', u'When searching content , it first finds the cluster with the structured P2P routing mechanism , and then it limits the query in the range of cluster .', u'Compared with the semantic overlay network based on unstructured P2P network , this structure provides more efficient search for topic cluster .', u'At the same time , it provides the structured P2P network with effective approach to search for content based on complicated queries , and it realizes the semantic search and dramatically increases the search recall .']

entities: [[(u'Web-based application', u'Task'), (u'News Tuner', u'Method'), (u'radio archives', u'Material')], [(u'search engines', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic and acoustic search', u'Method'), (u'retrieval of audio documents', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic search', u'Method'), (u'acoustic search', u'Method'), (u'random access', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'stored audio files', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic')], [(u'News Tuner paradigm', u'Method'), (u'news and talk radio programs', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'spoken word audio content', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'News Tuner', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Web-based application')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieval of audio documents'), (u'semantic and acoustic search', u'PART-OF', u'approach'), (u'semantic and acoustic search', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieval of audio documents')], [], [], [(u'News Tuner paradigm', u'USED-FOR', u'news and talk radio programs'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'spoken word audio content')]]
sentences: [u'We present in this paper a new Web-based application , called the News Tuner , for searching and browsing large radio archives .', u'While popular search engines provide means for finding text and images , our approach combines semantic and acoustic search for efficient retrieval of audio documents .', u'Semantic search allows the user to retrieve stories for a given concept , while acoustic search allows random access within stored audio files .', u'Our experiments on over 1700 programs show that our method is effective at quickly retrieving stories that would be difficult to find otherwise .', u'The News Tuner paradigm is intended primarily for news and talk radio programs , however it may be applied to browsing and searching any spoken word audio content']

entities: [[(u'Agent-mediated knowledge management', u'Method'), (u'knowledge sharing', u'Task')], [(u'paradigm', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic heterogeneity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'concept learning method', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'multiagent technology', u'Method'), (u'IBMpsilas UIMA', u'Method'), (u'semantic search application', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'agent', u'Generic'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'local ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Agent-mediated knowledge management', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge sharing')], [], [], [(u'multiagent technology', u'USED-FOR', u'concept learning method'), (u'multiagent technology', u'USED-FOR', u'it'), (u'IBMpsilas UIMA', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'multiagent technology')], []]
sentences: [u'Agent-mediated knowledge management is believed to be an efficient solution for knowledge sharing among different software systems .', u'In this paradigm , diverse systems can exchange information while keeping their own individual ontology to represent their domain knowledge .', u'However , overcoming semantic heterogeneity among diverse ontologies becomes a key issue .', u'We propose a new concept learning method to solve this problem and also implement it using multiagent technology together with the IBMpsilas UIMA ( Unstructured Information Management Architecture ) into a semantic search application .', u'In this method an agent in one system can learn a concept which it does not know by getting advices from agents in other systems and integrate the learnt concept into its local ontology .']

entities: [[(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'semantic similarity knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semi-structured sources', u'Material'), (u'WordNet', u'Material')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'structured information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hypernym relationship', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'natural language descriptions', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic corpus', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'graph', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'data', u'Generic'), (u'semantic corpus', u'Material'), (u'similarity between phrases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic search', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic similarity knowledge'), (u'semi-structured sources', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic similarity knowledge'), (u'WordNet', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semi-structured sources')], [(u'hypernym relationship', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'structured information')], [], [(u'graph', u'USED-FOR', u'It')], [(u'data', u'USED-FOR', u'similarity between phrases'), (u'semantic corpus', u'USED-FOR', u'similarity between phrases')]]
sentences: [u'We propose a novel methodology for extracting semantic similarity knowledge from semi-structured sources , such as WordNet .', u'Unlike existing approaches that only explore the structured information ( e.g. , the hypernym relationship in WordNet ) , we present a framework that allows us to utilize all available information , including natural language descriptions .', u'Our approach constructs a semantic corpus .', u'It is represented using a graph that models the relationship between phrases using numbers .', u'The data in the semantic corpus can be used to measure the similarity between phrases , the similarity between documents , or to perform a semantic search in a set of documents that uses the meaning of words and phrases ( i.e. , search that is not keyword-based ) .']

sentences: [u'In information retrieval , thesauri have increasingly become vital as an aid to effective retrieval .', u'However , the traditional way of incorporating one or more thesauri into an information retrieval system has its big limitation because it has to separately maintain the thesauri and develop access interfaces in individual systems.In recent years , terminology services become an ideal way to use thesauri in the networked environment.While calling terminology services in an information retrieval system , users need to interact with the system , which makes an information retrieval system become an interactive one .', u'Usefulness and usability are two different but closely related aspects of evaluating an interactive system .', u'The overall purpose of this study is to investigate the construction and usage of terminology services .', u'On the one hand , it explores how to construct terminology services with appropriate Web service architecture and emerging Semantic Web technologies ; on the other hand , it studies the usefulness and usability of terminology services in information retrieval systems and intends to find out the best usage mode.In this study , taking Chinese Thesaurus as a source vocabulary , a system was built with the use of the SKOS and RDF technologies and REST architecture , which consists of two parts : a terminology registry and a set of terminology services .', u'The terminology registry is to provide an authoritative , continually updated source of various vocabularies , and contains three components : metadata registration , vocabulary uploading and vocabulary validation .', u'Six basic terminology services , including Search Concept By Keyword , get Broader Concept , get Narrower Concept , getRelated Concept , get Synonym , and get English Translation , were built with Sun s Jersey , a reference implementation to develop RESTful Web Services based on JAX-RS .', u'To show the application of terminology services , two kinds of clients were developed : one is a Web client which provides a graphic interface for human users , and the other is an embedded client which can be integrated into a specific application system.Afterwards , this study investigated the usage of the constructed terminology services in information retrieval systems based on the embedded client .', u'Firstly , taking the get Synonym service as an example , we tested the usefulness of this terminology service with an experiment of 30 user queries to the library OPAC system and Baidu search engine .', u'OPAC s experiment results showed that the average recall increased 26 .', u'7 % while the average precision decreased 4 .', u'6 % , which means that using the get Synonym service to expand user queries can greatly improve the completeness of the retrieval results while there is a little reduction in recall.Baidu s experiment results showed that the P @ 5 precision increased 16 % , which means that there are more related items among the top retrieval results returned by the search engine .', u'Next , the way of using terminology services in information retrieval systems was studied .', u'Four usage modes were designed , includingmultiple choice for query expansion , single choice for query replacement , hybrid of query expansion and replacement , and automatic query expansion .', u'To evaluate their usability , a user testing was carried out in OPAC and Baidu with 24 human subjects based on four usability criteria ( effectiveness , efficiency , user satisfaction and learnability ) .', u'The evaluation results showed thatmultiple choice for query expansion was the best usage mode which is more effective , easier to use , easier to learn , and has higher user satisfaction.This study is one of few practical efforts on the construction of terminology services in China and thus has realistic significance .', u'Furthermore , it fills the research gap on the usage of terminology services and thus has an important role to facilitate their application in information retrieval .', u'In the future work , we plan to construct more complicated terminology services based on more vocabularies and expand them to other applications .', u'13 figs .', u'9 tabs .', u'34 refs .']

sentences: [u'Los servicios en red que conocemos actualmente estan basados en documentos y enlaces de hipertexto que los relacionan entre si sin aportar verdadera # R # # N # informacion acerca de los contenidos que representan .', u'Podria decirse que se trata de una red disenada por personas para ser interpretada por personas. # R # # N # El objetivo principal de los ultimos anos es encaminar esta red hacia una web de conocimiento , en la que la informacion pueda ser interpretada por agentes # R # # N # computerizados de manera automatica. # R # # N # Para llevar a cabo esta transformacion es necesaria la utilizacion de nuevas tecnologias especialmente disenadas para la descripcion de contenidos como son las ontologias. # R # # N # Si bien las redes convencionales estan evolucionando , no son las unicas que lo estan haciendo .', u'El rapido crecimiento de las redes de sensores y el importante aumento en el numero de dispositivos conectados a internet , hace necesaria la incorporacion de tecnologias de la web semantica a este tipo de redes. # R # # N # Para la realizacion de este Proyecto de Fin de Carrera se utilizara la ontologia SSN , disenada para la descripcion semantica de sensores y las redes de las que forman parte con el fin de permitir una mejor interaccion entre los dispositivos y los sistemas que hacen uso de ellos. # R # # N # El trabajo desarrollado a lo largo de este Proyecto de Fin de Carrera gira en torno a esta ontologia , siendo el principal objetivo la generacion semiautomatica de codigo # R # # N # a partir de un modelo de sistemas descrito en funcion de las clases y propiedades proporcionadas por SSN. # R # # N # Para alcanzar este fin se dividira el proyecto en varias partes .', u'Primero se realizara un analisis de la ontologia mencionada .', u'A continuacion se describira un sistema simulado de sensores y por ultimo se implementaran las aplicaciones para la generacion automatica de interfaces y la representacion grafica de los dispositivos del sistema a partir de la representacion del este en un fichero de tipo OWL. # R # # N # ABSTRACT. # R # # N # The web we know today is based on documents and hypertext links that relate these documents with each another , without providing consistent information about the contents they represent .', u'It could be said that its a network designed by people to be used by people. # R # # N # The main goal of the last couple of years is to guide this network into a web of knowledge , where information can be automatically processed by machines .', u'This transformation , requires the use of new technologies specially designed for content description such as ontologies. # R # # N # Nowadays , conventional networks are not the only type of networks evolving .', u'The use of sensor networks and the number of sensor devices connected to the Internet is rapidly increasing , making the use the integration of semantic web technologies to this kind of networks completely necessary. # R # # N # The SSN ontology will be used for the development of this Final Degree Dissertation .', u'This ontology was design to semantically describe sensors and the networks theyre part of , allowing a better interaction between devices and the systems that use them. # R # # N # The development carried through this Final Degree Dissertation revolves around this ontology and aims to achieve semiautomatic code generation starting from a system model described based on classes and properties provided by SSN. # R # # N # To reach this goal , de Dissertation will be divided in several parts .', u'First , an analysis about the mentioned ontology will be made .', u'Following this , a simulated sensor system will be described , and finally , the implementation of the applications will take place .', u'One of these applications will automatically generate de interfaces and the other one will graphically represents the devices in the sensor system , making use of the system representation in an OWL file .']

entities: [[(u'semantic markup capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'manually composed documents', u'Material')], [(u'semantic web vision', u'Task'), (u'manually produced documents', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'markup', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'COTS tools', u'Method'), (u'semantic markup', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'Briefing Associate', u'Method'), (u"Microsoft 's PowerPoint", u'Method'), (u'authoring of semantically grounded briefings', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'markup')], [(u'ideas', u'PART-OF', u'tool'), (u'Briefing Associate', u'USED-FOR', u'authoring of semantically grounded briefings'), (u"Microsoft 's PowerPoint", u'USED-FOR', u'authoring of semantically grounded briefings'), (u"Microsoft 's PowerPoint", u'USED-FOR', u'semantically grounded briefings')]]
sentences: [u'This paper identifies a set of semantic markup capabilities designed to benefit the author rather than the consumer of manually composed documents .', u'By doing so it addresses one of the major challenges facing the semantic web vision - the generation of ontologically encoded descriptions of the content of manually produced documents .', u'It also presents a novel approach to eliminating the currently large and tedious overhead required to produce such markup by augmenting the COTS tools that users already use to produce these documents so that the semantic markup is derived as a byproduct of composing the document .', u"These ideas are currently being implemented in a tool called the Briefing Associate that augments Microsoft 's PowerPoint to support the authoring of semantically grounded briefings ."]

entities: [[(u'UNICORE', u'Method'), (u'UNICORE', u'Method'), (u'Grid', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'homogenizing middleware layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Grid', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'HTTP', u'Method'), (u'RDF-based model', u'Method'), (u'loosely-coupled , global scale architecture', u'Method')], [(u'Grid', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web of data', u'Material')], [(u'UNICORE/w3', u'Task')], [(u'filtering', u'Method'), (u'searching functionality', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web syndication techniques', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Grid', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web'), (u'Web', u'USED-FOR', u'homogenizing middleware layer'), (u'homogenizing middleware layer', u'USED-FOR', u'Grid')], [], [], [(u'usability', u'FEATURE-OF', u'UNICORE/w3')], [(u'filtering', u'CONJUNCTION', u'searching functionality')]]
sentences: [u"Drawing on the core values of UNICORE - `` seamless , intuitive and secure access '' - in this paper we propose building the next generation of UNICORE by closely aligning the Grid and the Web , namely by using the Web as the homogenizing middleware layer for the Grid .", u'The RESTful use of HTTP coupled with a unified , RDF-based model , results in a loosely-coupled , global scale architecture .', u'Therefore the Grid as a very rich source of information contributes to the Semantic Web of data .', u'This is the foundation for the strong focus on usability in UNICORE/w3 .', u'Navigation of the linked resources , filtering , powerful searching functionality , the annotation and sharing of resources and monitoring using Web syndication techniques are some of the features proposed .']

entities: [[], [(u'Web information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'machine-understandable semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'HTML files', u'Material'), (u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web pages', u'Material')], [(u'Web pages', u'Material')], [(u'ANN', u'Method'), (u'Web pages', u'Material'), (u'hyperlinks', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'prototype system', u'Generic')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web shows us the potential infrastructure of the next generation Web .', u'Web information will be understandable to machines in this infrastructure .', u'Our research work has the aim of embedding machine-understandable semantic information in ordinary HTML files automatically given the domain ontology .', u'We focus on automatically acquiring the instances of concepts and relations defined in domain ontology from Web pages .', u'This paper describes how to recognize the relation between Web pages ( a kind of relation instance ) by using Artificial Neural Network ( ANN ) .', u"The input vector of ANN is determined by the type of Web pages , the number and type of hyperlinks between the Web pages , and the similarity in Web pages ' contents .", u'We also show the initial results got by our prototype system .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic retrieval', u'Task'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'Ontology', u'Task'), (u'concept hierarchy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'logic reasoning', u'Method'), (u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'semantic retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'semantic retrieval', u'Task'), (u'sports information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'WWW', u'Material')], [(u'domain ontology model', u'Method'), (u'sports ontology', u'Method')], [(u'semantic retrieval system of sports information', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL query language', u'Material'), (u'intelligent retrieval', u'Task'), (u'semantic level', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'sports concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'exploding increase of sports information', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic retrieval', u'USED-FOR', u'information retrieval'), (u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'information retrieval')], [], [(u'semantic retrieval', u'USED-FOR', u'sports information')], [], [(u'SPARQL query language', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic retrieval system of sports information')], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic retrieval becomes the hot topic in information retrieval on the Semantic Web .', u'Ontology , with the excellent concept hierarchy and appropriately supporting for logic reasoning , is the effective tool for semantic retrieval .', u'This paper pays attention to the semantic retrieval for sports information in WWW .', u'Firstly , based on the domain ontology model , we build the sports ontology which has the character of wide-cover and small information granularity .', u'Then we present the semantic retrieval system of sports information using SPARQL query language , which realizes the intelligent retrieval at semantic level according to the relations of synonymy of , kind of and part of between sports concepts .', u'For the trend of exploding increase of sports information , this research has practical significance to some extent .']

sentences: [u'This volume contains the proceedings of the 11th European Workshop on Natural Language Generation ( ENLG07 ) . # R # # N # # R # # N # The workshop takes place at Schloss Dagstuhl in Germany .', u'It continues a biennial series of workshops on natural language generation that has been running since 1987 .', u'Previous European workshops have been held at Toulouse , Budapest and Aberdeen .', u'The series provides a regular forum for presentation and discussion of research in this area , both for NLG specialists and for researchers from other areas. # R # # N # # R # # N # The 2007 workshop spans the interest areas of Natural Language Generation to Artificial Intelligence , Computational Linguistics and Semantic Web techniques .', u'One of the key themes is evaluation of NLG systems , including two sessions on recent activities in this area .']

entities: [[(u'strategic information appropriation', u'Task'), (u'geographi c data', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'geo-intelligence application', u'Method'), (u'geographic reporting', u'Task')], [(u'geographic information system', u'Method'), (u'datawarehouse', u'Material'), (u'cartographic form', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'hybrid referential', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'classic dimensional modeling', u'Method'), (u'relational modeling', u'Method'), (u'semantic web approach', u'Method'), (u'business indicators', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'geo-intelligence application', u'USED-FOR', u'geographic reporting')], [], [(u'classic dimensional modeling', u'PART-OF', u'hybrid referential'), (u'classic dimensional modeling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'relational modeling')]]
sentences: [u'We would like in this paper to solve the problem of strategic information appropriation , particularly for geographi c data .', u'Our approach is validated by a geo-intelligence application oriented towards geographic reporting .', u'The work carried out consists in the addition of a geographic information system to a datawarehouse to permit on one hand , to constitute a genuine geographic referential and on the other , to restitute information in a cartographic form .', u'We have chosen a method of resolution in layers passing by a modeling of the hybrid referential ( half way between the classic dimensional modeling and the relational modeling ) and using a semantic web approach to satisfy to the needs of a qualified cartographic semantic and permitting to browse through business indicators according to the understanding they convey .']

entities: [[(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'relational databases', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web compliant knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'DBOM', u'Method'), (u'impedance mismatch problem', u'Task'), (u'mapping language', u'Method')], [(u'DBOM', u'Method'), (u'uncertain mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'solution', u'Generic')], [(u'DBOM', u'Method'), (u'medical informatics application', u'Task'), (u'drug related information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL knowledge base', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'relational databases', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web compliant knowledge base')], [(u'mapping language', u'USED-FOR', u'impedance mismatch problem')], [], [], [(u'DBOM', u'USED-FOR', u'medical informatics application')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we present a system which enables the integration of data stored in relational databases into a Semantic Web compliant knowledge base .', u'In this context , our system , named DBOM , proposes a solution to the impedance mismatch problem by proposing a mapping language that allows to specify how to transform data retrieved from tuples of the databases into objects of the target knowledge base .', u'DBOM also handles inconsistencies that may be caused by the execution of uncertain mappings .', u'The proposed solution is based on setting preferences over the views and attributes of the views of the mappings .', u'We demonstrate DBOM in the context of a medical informatics application that requires the integration of drug related information into an OWL knowledge base .']

entities: [[(u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'machines', u'Generic')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web Intelligence', u'Task')], [(u'Web Intelligence', u'Task')], [(u'Cooperative Web', u'Material'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'ontological artifacts', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web Intelligence')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The Web is mainly processed by humans .', u'The role of the machines is just to transmit and display the contents of the documents , barely being able to do something else .', u'Nowadays there are lots of initiatives trying to change this situation ; many of them are related to fields like the Semantic Web [ 1 ] or Web Intelligence .', u'In this paper we describe the Cooperative Web [ 2 ] that can be seen as a new proposal towards Web Intelligence .', u'The Cooperative Web would allow us to extract semantics from the Web in an automatic way , without the need of ontological artifacts , with language independence and , besides of this , allowing the usage of browsing experience from individual users to serve the whole community of users .']

entities: [[(u'control mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'web resources', u'Material')], [(u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'content analysis', u'Task'), (u'quality labelling', u'Task'), (u'technologies', u'Generic'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'application', u'Generic'), (u'labelling process', u'Task'), (u'health-related web content', u'Material')], [(u'MedIEQ', u'Method'), (u'web', u'Material'), (u'unlabelled health web resources', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pre-defined labelling criteria', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'content collection', u'Task'), (u'English language', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'semantic web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'content analysis'), (u'content analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'quality labelling')], [(u'MedIEQ', u'USED-FOR', u'unlabelled health web resources')], []]
sentences: [u'As the number of health-related web sites in various languages increases , so does the need for control mechanisms that give the users adequate guarantee on whether the web resources they are visiting meet a minimum level of quality standards .', u'Based upon state-of-the-art technology in the areas of semantic web , content analysis and quality labelling , the MedIEQ project , integrates existing technologies and tests them in a novel application : the automation of the labelling process in health-related web content .', u'MedIEQ provides tools that crawl the web to locate unlabelled health web resources , to label them according to pre-defined labelling criteria , as well as to monitor them .', u'This paper focuses on content collection and discusses our experiments in the English language .']

entities: [[(u'Query formulation', u'Task'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'semantic applications', u'Task')], [(u'query languages', u'Material'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'editing of semantic queries', u'Task')], [(u'NITELIGHT', u'Method'), (u'graphical tool', u'Method'), (u'semantic query design', u'Task')], [(u'NITELIGHT', u'Method'), (u'Visual Query Language', u'Method'), (u'vSPARQL', u'Method'), (u'graphical formalisms', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL query specification', u'Task')], [(u'NITELIGHT', u'Method'), (u'reusable Web-based component', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'Web applications', u'Task')], [(u'NITELIGHT tool', u'Method'), (u'vSPARQL specification', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Query formulation', u'USED-FOR', u'information retrieval')], [(u'query languages', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web'), (u'SPARQL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'query languages')], [(u'NITELIGHT', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'graphical tool'), (u'NITELIGHT', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic query design'), (u'graphical tool', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic query design')], [(u'Visual Query Language', u'USED-FOR', u'NITELIGHT'), (u'vSPARQL', u'USED-FOR', u'graphical formalisms'), (u'graphical formalisms', u'USED-FOR', u'SPARQL query specification')], [(u'NITELIGHT', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'reusable Web-based component'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'Web applications')], [(u'NITELIGHT tool', u'CONJUNCTION', u'vSPARQL specification')]]
sentences: [u'Query formulation is a key aspect of information retrieval , contributing to both the efficiency and usability of many semantic applications .', u'A number of query languages , such as SPARQL , have been developed for the Semantic Web ; however , there are , as yet , few tools to support end users with respect to the creation and editing of semantic queries .', u'In this paper we present NITELIGHT , a graphical tool for semantic query design .', u'NITELIGHT uses a Visual Query Language ( VQL ) , called vSPARQL , which provides graphical formalisms for SPARQL query specification .', u'NITELIGHT is a highly reusable Web-based component , and it can be easily embedded in a variety of different Web applications .', u'This paper provides an overview of the NITELIGHT tool and the vSPARQL specification .']

entities: [[(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'Defeasible Logic', u'Method'), (u'nonmonotonic language', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Defeasible Logic', u'Method'), (u'Description Logics', u'Method'), (u'Description Defeasible Logic ( DDL )', u'Method')], [(u'DDL', u'Method'), (u'Defeasible Logic', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'Description Logic knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'DDL', u'Method'), (u'nonmonotonic reasoning', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'nonmonotonic reasoning', u'Method')], [(u'DDL', u'Method'), (u'DDL', u'Method'), (u'Description Logic', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Defeasible Logic', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'nonmonotonic language')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'Defeasible Logic')], [(u'DDL', u'COMPARE', u'Defeasible Logic')], [(u'DDL', u'USED-FOR', u'nonmonotonic reasoning')], []]
sentences: [u'The importance of integrating rules and ontologies for the Semantic Web has been well addressed by many researchers .', u'Defeasible Logic is a simple but efficient nonmonotonic language which can handle both defeasibility and priority .', u'In this paper we propose a novel approach to combining Defeasible Logic with Description Logics by introducing the Description Defeasible Logic ( DDL ) .', u'DDL is similar to Defeasible Logic but it also contains queries to the Description Logic knowledge base .', u'DDL allows nonmonotonic reasoning to be built on top of ontologies , and to a certain degree , allows ontologies to be built on top of nonmonotonic reasoning .', u'We give some basic properties of DDL , one of which shows that DDL is a tractable language provided that the underlying Description Logic is tractable .']

entities: [[(u'Model-theoretic semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'Web markup languages', u'Material'), (u'well-defined semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [], [(u'Web', u'Material')], [], [(u'model-theoretic semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web markup languages', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'It', u'USED-FOR', u'Web markup languages'), (u'well-defined semantics', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Web markup languages')], [], [], [], [], [(u'model-theoretic semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'Web markup languages')]]
sentences: [u'Model-theoretic semantics is a formal account of the interpretations of legitimate expressions of a language .', u'It is increasingly being used to provide Web markup languages with well-defined semantics .', u'But a discussion of its roles and limitations for the Semantic Web has not yet received a coherent and detailed treatment .', u'This paper takes the first steps towards such a treatment .', u'The major result is an introductory explication of key ideas that are usually only implicit in existing accounts of semantics for the Web .', u'References to more detailed accounts of these ideas are also provided .', u'The benefit of this explication is increased awareness among Web users of some important issues inherent in using model-theoretic semantics for Web markup languages .']

relations: [[], [(u'Wi-Fi', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'high speed wireless networks'), (u'Wi-Fi', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Bluetooth'), (u'Wi-Fi', u'CONJUNCTION', u'3G'), (u'Wi-Fi', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Internet based technologies'), (u'Wi-Fi', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web Services'), (u'Bluetooth', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'high speed wireless networks'), (u'Bluetooth', u'CONJUNCTION', u'3G'), (u'Bluetooth', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Internet based technologies'), (u'Bluetooth', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Agent based technologies'), (u'3G', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'high speed wireless networks'), (u'3G', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Internet based technologies'), (u'3G', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Agent based technologies'), (u'Semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'high speed wireless networks'), (u'Semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Internet based technologies'), (u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web Services'), (u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Agent based technologies'), (u'Web Services', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'high speed wireless networks'), (u'Web Services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'3G'), (u'Web Services', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Internet based technologies'), (u'Web Services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Agent based technologies'), (u'Web Services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Context Awareness'), (u'Agent based technologies', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'high speed wireless networks'), (u'Agent based technologies', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Internet based technologies'), (u'Agent based technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Context Awareness'), (u'Context Awareness', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'high speed wireless networks'), (u'Context Awareness', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Internet based technologies')], []]
sentences: [u'The vision of intelligent wireless web services , as discussed in this paper centres on the need to provide mobile construction workers highly specific data and services on an as-needed basis , with flexibility of use for the user .', u'With the emergence of high speed wireless networks , such as Wi-Fi , Bluetooth and 3G , and parallel advancements in Internet based technologies such as the Semantic Web , Web Services , Agent based technologies and Context Awareness , the realisation of the vision of the intelligent wireless web has become a possibility .', u'The paper presents a state-of-the-art review of the enabling technologies and discusses how , by exploiting the convergence and synergy between different technologies , it has become possible to deliver intelligent wireless web support to mobile construction workers .']

entities: [[(u'3D virtual environment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'limited information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Navigation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Navigation-Aid', u'Method')], [(u'Topic Maps', u'Method'), (u'semantic Web techniques', u'Method'), (u'navigation', u'Task'), (u'3D virtual environment', u'Task')], [(u'Topic Maps', u'Method'), (u'semantic linking maps', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Topic Map based Navigation-Aid', u'Method'), (u'Navigation-Aid', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'Topic Maps', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic linking maps')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Users in 3D virtual environment get limited information which contains mostly images .', u'It is the main reason for users getting lost during their Navigation .', u'Various studies of Navigation-Aid have been done in order to solve this problem .', u'In this study , we applied Topic Maps , which is one of semantic Web techniques , to the navigation in a 3D virtual environment .', u'Topic Maps construct semantic linking maps through defining the relations between topics .', u'Experiments in which Topic Map based Navigation-Aid was applied have shown that the Navigation-Aid was effective when the subjects find a detailed target rather than a highly represented one .', u'Also , offering information around the target helped the users to find the target when they navigated without having specific targets .']

sentences: [u'This paper presents a new constraint domain , where variables can be assigned values that are organised in a tree hierarchy .', u'The introduction of this new constraint domain is motivated by applications for the configuration of product and services , for instance , in the context of e-commerce .', u'The paper proposes a small constraint language , based on comparisons and the use of monotonic functions .', u'An approximation of domains as convex sets is detailed and propagation rules for achieving bound-consistency on the constraints are reviewed .', u'This new constraint domain is general , and the author hopes that it will be a useful tool not only for solving configuration problems but also for promoting constraint technology in new application domains related to content classification or the semantic web .']

sentences: [u'Debugging is an important prerequisite for the wide-spread application of ontologies , especially in areas that rely upon everyday users to create and maintain knowledge bases , such as the Semantic Web .', u'Recent approaches use diagnosis methods to identify sources of inconsistency .', u'However , in most debugging cases these methods return many alternative diagnoses , thus placing the burden of fault localization on the user .', u'This paper demonstrates how the target diagnosis can be identified by performing a sequence of observations , that is , by querying an oracle about entailments of the target ontology .', u'We exploit probabilities of typical user errors to formulate information theoretic concepts for query selection .', u'Our evaluation showed that the suggested method reduces the number of required observations compared to myopic strategies .']

sentences: [u'While new ways to use the Semantic Web are developed every week , which allow the user to find information on web more accurately - for example in search engines - some sophisticated pragmatic tools are becoming more important - for example in web interfaces known as Social Intelligence , or in the most famous Siri by Apple .', u'The work aims to analyze whether and where we can identify the boundary between semantics and pragmatics in the software used by analyzed systems .', u'examining how the linguistic disciplines are fundamental in their progress .', u'Is it possible to assume that the tools of social intelligence have a pragmatic approach to the questions of the user , or it is just a use of a very rich vocabulary , with the use of semantic tools ?']

entities: [[(u'interactive system', u'Method'), (u'semantic annotation of brain magnetic resonance images', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'numerical atlas', u'Material'), (u'symbolic knowledge of brain anatomical structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic Web standards', u'Method')], [(u'knowledge', u'Generic'), (u'graphical data', u'Material'), (u'images', u'Material'), (u'imaging tools', u'Method')], [(u'gyri', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'region of interest', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'constraint satisfaction problem solving', u'Method'), (u'description logics inferences', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'client-server architecture', u'Method'), (u'Web services', u'Method'), (u'visualization tool', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'annotations', u'Task'), (u'precision', u'Metric')]]

sentences: [u'This paper describes an interactive system for the semantic annotation of brain magnetic resonance images .', u'The system uses both a numerical atlas and symbolic knowledge of brain anatomical structures depicted using the semantic Web standards .', u'This knowledge is combined with graphical data , automatically extracted from the images by imaging tools .', u'The annotations of parts of gyri and sulci , in a region of interest , rely on constraint satisfaction problem solving and description logics inferences .', u'The system is run on a client-server architecture , using Web services and including a sophisticated visualization tool .', u'An evaluation of the system was done using normal ( healthy ) and pathological cases .', u'The results obtained so far demonstrate that the system produces annotations with high precision and quality .']

entities: [[], [(u'Semantic Web vision', u'Task'), (u'desktop data management', u'Task')], [(u'Apples Spotlight', u'Material')], [(u'W3Cs RDF formalism', u'Method')], [(u'RDF metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web data', u'Material'), (u'XML format', u'Material')], [(u'XML views', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF data', u'Material'), (u'query language Xcerpt', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'dierent approaches', u'Generic'), (u'RDF metadata processing', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'metadata', u'PART-OF', u'W3Cs RDF formalism')], [], [], [(u'dierent approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF metadata processing')]]
sentences: [u'The integral processing of data and metadata is starting to get recognized as a central challenge for the next decade ( e.g .', u'in Pat Selingers ICDE 2005 Keynote ) not only as part of realizing the Semantic Web vision , but also on a smaller scale as part of the next generation of desktop data management ( cf .', u'Apples Spotlight and Microsofts WinFS ) .', u'In this article , we focus on metadata represented in the W3Cs RDF formalism .', u'We illustrate first steps towards integrating access to RDF metadata and access to standard Web data in XML format .', u'For this , two XML views over RDF data are expressed in the query language Xcerpt and discussed .', u'These views illustrate two dierent approaches for integrating RDF metadata processing and current data processing techniques .']

relations: [[], [(u'definitions ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'semantics of data')], [(u'ontology concepts', u'USED-FOR', u'rules')], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy temporal information'), (u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'framework')], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'framework')], [(u'fuzzy temporal ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'domain ontology')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The concept of Semantic Web has introduced an important form of knowledge representation - ontology .', u'As a hierarchical structure of concepts together with their definitions ontology provides means for expressing semantics of data .', u'The ability to build rules with ontology concepts and to perform reasoning increases its attractiveness even further .', u'This paper proposes a framework for expressing fuzzy temporal information using ontology .', u'The framework is built based on ontology suitable for expressing facts and building rules that include fuzzy and temporal terms .', u'This proposed fuzzy temporal ontology can be imported to any domain ontology and used a knowledge base in variety of applications .', u'The paper includes description of build-in predicates needed for constructing fuzzy temporal rules .', u'Simple examples of application of the predicates are presented .']

entities: [[(u'human generation', u'Task'), (u'metadata', u'Generic')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'human production of good quality metadata', u'Task'), (u'structured vocabularies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'model', u'Generic')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'transferring vocabularies across communities', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'metadata specialists', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'This paper considers situations for which detailed metadata descriptions of learning resources are necessary , and focuses on human generation of such metadata .', u'It describes a model which facilitates human production of good quality metadata by the development and use of structured vocabularies .', u'Using examples , this model is applied to single and multiple communities of metadata creators .', u'The approach for transferring vocabularies across communities is related to similar work on the use of ontologies to support the development of the semantic web .', u'Notable conclusions from this work are the need to encourage collaboration between the metadata specialists , content authors and system designers , and the scope for using accurate and consistent metadata created for one context in another context by producing descriptions of the relationships between those contexts .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method')], [(u'Ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web documents', u'Material')], [(u'Ontology', u'Method'), (u'e-commerce application', u'Task')], [(u'Ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web documents', u'Material')], [(u'concepts', u'Generic'), (u'e-law application', u'Task')], [(u'E-laws ontology', u'Method')], [], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'domain knowledge expert', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'relationships', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Semantic Web provides tools for expressing information in a machine accessible form where agents ( human or software ) can understand it .', u'Ontology is required to describe the semantics of concepts and properties used in web documents .', u'Ontology is needed to describe products , services , processes and practices in any e-commerce application .', u'Ontology plays an essential role in recognizing the meaning of the information in Web documents .', u'This paper attempts to deploy these concepts in an e-law application .', u'E-laws ontology has been built using existing resources .', u'It has been shown that extracting concepts is less hard than building relationships among them .', u'A new algorithm has been proposed to reduce the number of relationships , so the domain knowledge expert ( i.e .', u'lawyer ) can refine these relationships .']

sentences: [u'In this paper we present a system which recognizes handwritten annotations on printed text documents and interprets their semantic meaning .', u'This system processes in three steps .', u'In the first step , document analysis methods are applied to identify possible gestures and text regions .', u'In the second step , the text and gestures are recognized using several state-of-the-art recognition methods .', u'In the fourth step , the actual marked text is identified .', u'Finally , the recognized information is sent to the Semantic Desktop , the personal Semantic Web on the Desktop computer , which supports users in their information management .', u'In order to assess the performance of the system , we have performed an experimental study .', u'We evaluated the different stages of the system and measured the overall performance .']

sentences: [u'The paper is devoted to knowledge logistics problems .', u'Knowledge logistics with regard to individual user requirements , available knowledge sources , and current situation analysis in an open information environment addresses problems of intelligent support of user activities .', u'Knowledge logistics is guided by the principles underlying both Web services and Semantic Web as understandability of knowledge representation both to humans and machines , enabling knowledge sharing and reuse , ensuring intellectual support , etc .', u'The paper describes an approach to knowledge logistics problem based on ontology- driven methodology and constraint satisfaction / propagation technology .', u'Compatibility of object-oriented constraint network notation with DAML+OIL formalism is considered .', u'Applicability of the approach to actual content is illustrated through a case study based on Binni scenario of humanitarian coalition-based operation .']

sentences: [u"In this paper we present ARNEIS , a framework for building `` intelligent '' web-based repositories of software solutions , aimed at exploiting Web Services and Semantic Web to support small-to-medium sized enterprises .", u'ARNEIS users are software houses that offer ICT-based solutions for business automation , and small companies that aim at finding software products or services supporting their business activity .', u'The exploitation of OWL-based ontologies enables ARNEIS to apply reasoning techniques to find the possible matches between business requirements and software solutions .', u'Being based on Web Service standards , ARNEIS can be accessed through either a standard web-based user interface , or an external Web Service client .', u'In the paper , we present the framework architecture and a prototype implementation aimed at validating it .']

entities: [[(u'medical systems', u'Method'), (u'multimodality and multimedia data', u'Material')], [(u'maximum flexibility', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'medical imaging', u'Task'), (u'bioinformatics', u'Task')], [(u'medical multimedia', u'Material')], [(u'characteristics', u'Generic'), (u'medical research and clinical therapy environments', u'Task')], [(u'subscribe networking', u'Method'), (u'medical multimedia architectures', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'multimodality and multimedia data', u'USED-FOR', u'medical systems')], [(u'medical imaging', u'CONJUNCTION', u'bioinformatics')], [(u'flexible systems', u'USED-FOR', u'medical multimedia')], [(u'characteristics', u'USED-FOR', u'medical research and clinical therapy environments')], [(u'semantic web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'publish and subscribe networking')]]
sentences: [u'The next generation of medical systems will integrate multimodality and multimedia data from a variety of sources to aid individual ysicians in providing the best treatment and care for their patients and to help researchers understand patterns of disease in collections of large databases .', u'We promote a principle of maximum flexibility for the design of these systems to accommodate new developments in medical imaging and bioinformatics .', u'We present several characteristics of flexible systems that support medical multimedia .', u'We illustrate how these characteristics can be applied within diverse medical research and clinical therapy environments through two in-depth case studies .', u'Within these examples , we describe how specific emerging technologies , including the semantic web and publish and subscribe networking , can enhance the flexibility of medical multimedia architectures .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'artificial intelligence', u'Task'), (u'automated reasoning', u'Task')], [(u'knowledge representation tools', u'Method')], [(u'one', u'Generic')], [(u'one', u'Generic'), (u'pragmatism', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'theoretical research', u'Method')], [], [(u'knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'knowledge representation systems', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'The issue of knowledge representation has been one of the main problems of artificial intelligence since its first attempts at automated reasoning .', u'Two streams of the evolution of knowledge representation tools may be observed .', u'The first one , developed mainly at academia , results in theoretically sound , but usually inefficient systems .', u'The second one , related to software developers , puts high emphasis on pragmatism and often remains resistant to adopting new results of the theoretical research .', u'None of them has achieved the goal of developing a satisfactory solution , yet .', u'Since over the last few years knowledge representation has gained more attention , particularly in the context of the Semantic Web , it seems reasonable to make a short review of the evolution of knowledge representation systems .']

entities: [[(u'library classifications', u'Task'), (u'subject heading systems', u'Method')], [(u'library knowledge organization tools', u'Method')], [(u'KO systems', u'Method'), (u'semantic interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'conceptual and data models', u'Method')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'this', u'Generic'), (u'methodological and technical developments', u'Task'), (u'ontology modelling', u'Task'), (u'lexicographic and terminological data interchange', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'This paper focuses on the need for knowledge organization ( KO ) tools , such as library classifications , thesauri and subject heading systems , to be fully disclosed and available in the open network environment .', u'The authors look at the place and value of traditional library knowledge organization tools in relation to the technical environment and expectations of the Semantic Web .', u'Future requirements in this context are explored , stressing the need for KO systems to support semantic interoperability .', u'In order to be fully shareable KO tools need to be reframed and reshaped in terms of conceptual and data models .', u'The authors suggest that some useful approaches to this already exist in methodological and technical developments within the fields of ontology modelling and lexicographic and terminological data interchange .']
