sentences: [u'The semantic web is an extension of the traditional web by introducing the meaning of the data and it adds new functionalities to machines which become able to understand and process the data , whereas now it simply displays the profile. # R # # N # The activities of selection , contextualization and rendering of unstructured content cant be obtained from any computer .', u'In other words , the information is readable but not understandable by the machine in order to make the meaning of the data web understandable by the computer , the data are combined with meta-information describing this content .', u'Could the adoption of a forum in a semantic learning environment clear the way for the evaluation of learning that reflects a knowledge management in new ways ?']

entities: [[(u'enterprise context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web-based educational system', u'Method'), (u'social network system', u'Method'), (u'enterprise context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'integration glue', u'Method'), (u'upper ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'upper ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'integration glue')]]
sentences: [u'In an enterprise context , competencies are often dispersed across different teams .', u'A specific need within the enterprise could not be satisfied only because of a lack of awareness about real competencies owned by employees .', u"The aforementioned problem involves two main critical aspects : the difficulty to manage employees ' competencies in order to constantly keep them up-to-date and the ability to agilely share employees ' profiles across the organization in order to support competency finding .", u'This work proposes an approach to relax the above critical points by integrating a semantic web-based educational system within a social network system applied to the enterprise context .', u'The integration glue is provided by using and harmonizing several existing upper ontologies also furthering semantic interoperability .']

entities: [[(u'Product Service System', u'Method'), (u'mass customization', u'Method'), (u'ontology-based modular modeling', u'Method'), (u'configuration method', u'Method'), (u'configuration-oriented total product modeling', u'Method'), (u'PSS', u'Method'), (u'PSS', u'Method'), (u'structural knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'meta-ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'customer requirement', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'configuration method', u'PART-OF', u'Product Service System'), (u'configuration-oriented total product modeling', u'USED-FOR', u'PSS')]]
sentences: [u'To satisfy product configuration requirements of Product Service System ( PSS ) under mass customization , and realize quick accurate product configuration , an ontology-based modular modeling and configuration method was proposed.In configuration-oriented total product modeling , reachable matrix was adopted to modularize service elements to support configuration process.A meta-ontology of total product configuration in PSS was set up to facilitate the sharing and reuse of the model.For total product configuration in a specific PSS , structural knowledge inheriting from meta-ontology was formalized in Ontology Web Language ( OWL ) .Constraints of total product configuration and customer requirement were formalized in Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) and Java Expert System Shell ( JESS ) programs.Finally , effectiveness of the proposed approach was demonstrated by an example of vehicle total product configuration .']

sentences: [u'Adaptive Information Extraction systems ( IES ) are currently used by some Semantic Web ( SW ) annotation tools as support to annotation ( Handschuh et al. , 2002 ; Vargas-Vera et al. , 2002 ) .', u'They are generally based on fully supervised methodologies requiring fairly intense domain-specific annotation .', u'Unfortunately , selecting representative examples may be difficult and annotations can be incorrect and require time .', u'In this paper we present a methodology that drastically reduce ( or even remove ) the amount of manual annotation required when annotating consistent sets of pages .', u'A very limited number of user-defined examples are used to bootstrap learning .', u'Simple , high precision ( and possibly high recall ) IE patterns are induced using such examples , these patterns will then discover more examples which will in turn discover more patterns , etc .']

sentences: [u"Mediators used to be developed as monolithic systems that envelop the data source 's information , such as its semantics and location .", u"Furthermore , its architecture based on wrappers involves a high degree of coupling among the mediator 's components .", u'This coupling does not allow sharing services with other organizations or the dynamic integration of new data sources .', u'We have proposed an architecture for conceptual mediation , which allow users to make more expressive queries and infer information from the ontology-explicit knowledge , enabling them to solve queries that a traditional mediator could not evaluate .', u'This architecture also provides a way to achieve not only dynamic integration , but also interoperability between users/applications in the Semantic Web context by means of Semantic Fields .', u'The latter is the focus of this paper .']

sentences: [u'A large portion of the Semantic Web is expected to be generated from the hidden Web of relational databases .', u'The methods to translate relational content to OWL/RDF are reasonably straightforward , however these methods tend to lose most , if not all , important integrity constraints that are present in the relational data .', u'In this paper , we present a para-consistent logic based method to maintain several important categories of relational integrity constraints while translating relational data into OWL .', u'In addition , we are able to further enforce OWL-like constraints on the resulting RDFs which are essential to fully exploit the expressiveness and logical inference power of OWL .', u'Most importantly , with our method , the problem of inconsistency checking of OWL instances reduces to simple instance matching within two classes .']

sentences: [u'Nowadays , high volumes of high-value data ( e.g. , semantic web data ) can be generated and published at a high velocity .', u'A collection of these data can be viewed as a big , interlinked , dynamic graph structure of linked resources .', u'Embedded in them are implicit , previously unknown , and potentially useful knowledge .', u'Hence , ecient knowledge discovery algorithms for mining frequent subgraphs from these dynamic , streaming graph structured data are in demand .', u'Some existing algorithms require very large memory space to discover frequent subgraphs ; some others discover collections of frequently co-occurring edges ( which may be disjoint ) .', u'In contrast , we propose|in this paper|algorithms that use limited memory space for discovering collections of frequently co-occurring connected edges .', u'Evaluation results show the eectiveness of our algorithms in frequent subgraph mining']

sentences: [u"With the outbreak of applications for smartphones , attempts to collect personal data without their user 's consent are multiplying and the protection of users privacy has become a major issue .", u'In this paper , an approach based on semantic web languages ( OWL and SWRL ) and tools ( DL reasoners and ontology APIs ) is described .', u"The proposed semantic firewall takes its decisions ( authorize or forbid some action ) on the basis of a set of privacy protection rules grounded on two ontologies respectively modeling identity of mobile phone 's users and privacy policies .", u'To validate this ontology-based approach , a proof of concept involving a real privacy threat scenario is implemented in Java and the porting of the semantic firewall to the Android platform is outlined .']

sentences: [u'The first Web information services were based on traditional information retrieval ( IR ) algorithms and techniques .', u'However , IR algorithms were developed for smaller and more coherent collections than the Web is .', u'Thus Web searching requires new techniques - exploiting linkage among Web pages or extensions of the old ones , for example .', u"This article offers an overview of today 's search engine architectures and techniques in the context of IR .", u'The authors introduce three such architectures and describe their basic components .', u'Then they discuss the most important feature of each Web search process : page importance and its use in retrieval .', u'Some issues and challenges in Web search engines are also summarized as well as considerations on the future of Web searching in terms of the so-called semantic Web .']

sentences: [u'Much data is published on the Web in XML format satisfying schemas , and to make the Semantic Web a reality , such data needs to be interpreted with respect to ontologies .', u'Interpretation is achieved through a semantic mapping between the XML schema and the ontology .', u'We present work on the heuristic construction of complex such semantic mappings , when given an initial set of simple correspondences from XML schema attributes to datatype properties in the ontology .', u'To accomplish this , we first offer a mapping formalism to capture the semantics of XML schemas .', u'Second , we present our heuristic mapping construction algorithm .', u'Finally , we show through an empirical study that considerable effort can be saved when constructing complex mappings by using our prototype tool .']

sentences: [u'In this paper we present and evaluate two approaches for the generation of Semantic Fields , which are used as a tool for resource discovery in the Semantic Web .', u'We mainly concern ourselves with semantic networks that describe their interests and resources by means of ontologies .', u'Semantic Fields are intended to help users to locate these resources by specifying a brief description ( also as an ontology ) .', u'We propose two ways to automatically build Semantic Fields .', u'The first one is used in the KREIOS approach , which is based on the pre-computation of distances between all the ontology pairs .', u'The second one is based on a fast incremental clustering algorithm , which groups together similar ontologies as they are published .', u'These groups constitute a pre-computed set of Semantic Fields .']

sentences: [u'MapReduce-based data processing platforms offer a promising approach for cost-effective and Web-scale processing of Semantic Web data .', u'However , one major challenge is that this computational paradigm leads to high I/O and communication costs when processing tasks with several join operations typical in SPARQL queries .', u'The goal of this demonstration is to show how a system RAPID+ , an extension of Apache Pig , enables more efficient SPARQL query processing on MapReduce using an alternative query algebra called the Nested TripleGroup Algebra ( NTGA ) .', u'The demonstration will offer opportunities for users to explore NTGA-Hadoop query plans for different SPARQL query structures as well as explore relationships between query plans based on relational algebra operators and those using NTGA operators .']

sentences: [u'The Sindice Semantic Web index provides search capabilities over 260 million documents .', u'Reasoning over web data enables to make explicit what would otherwise be implicit knowledge : it adds value to the information and enables Sindice to ultimately be more competitive in terms of precision and recall .', u'However , due to the scale and heterogeneity of web data , a reasoning engine for the Sindice system must ( 1 ) scale out through parallelisation over a cluster of machines ; and ( 2 ) cope with unexpected data usage .', u'In this paper , we report our experiences and lessons learned in building a large scale reasoning engine for Sindice .', u'The reasoning approach has been deployed , used and improved since 2008 within Sindice and has enabled Sindice to reason over billions of triples .']

sentences: [u'For their usage in the semantic Web valid ontologies are required for a given domain .', u'Here we focus on ontologies represented as concept maps .', u'We outline two methodological approaches for empirically validating concept maps .', u'One procedure is to validate a given concept map with concept maps generated systematically by others .', u'As a second method of validating a given concept map .', u'we suggest to observe the behaviour in a relevant situational context as a validation criterion .', u"In this scope , a method for predicting persons ' problem solving behaviour by using a given concept map is outlined .", u'In general , the purpose and ultimate use of a given concept map has to be taken into consideration for choosing a validation procedure and interpreting its results .']

sentences: [u'Static analysis technologies and tools have been widely adopted in detecting software bugs and vulnerabilities .', u'However , traditional approaches have their limitations on extensibility and reusability due to their methodologies , and are unsuitable to describe subtle vulnerabilities under complex and unaccountable contexts .', u'This paper proposes an approach of static analysis based on ontology model enhanced by program slicing technology for detecting software vulnerabilities .', u'We use Ontology Web Language ( OWL ) to model the source code and Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) to describe the bug and vulnerability patterns .', u'Program slicing criteria can be automatically extracted from the SWRL rules and adopted to slice the source code .', u'A prototype of security vulnerability detection ( SVD ) tool is developed to show the validity of the proposed approach .']

sentences: [u'Formal concept analysis ( FCA ) is based on a formalization of the philosophical understanding of a concept as a unit of thought constituted by its extent and intent .', u'The rough set philosophy is founded on the assumption that with every object of the universe of discourse we associate some information .', u'This paper deals with approaches to knowledge reduction in generalized consistent decision formal context .', u'Finally , a new system model of semantic web based on FCA and rough set is proposed , which preserve more structural and featural information of concept lattice .', u'In order to obtain the concept lattices with relatively less attributes and objects , we study the reduction of the concept lattices based on FCA and rough set theory .', u'The experimental results indicate that this method has great promise .']

sentences: [u'While the problem to find needed information on the Web is being solved by the major search engines , access to the information in large text documents ( e-books , conference proceedings , product manuals , etc ) is still very rudimentary .', u'Thus , keyword-search is often the only way to find the needle in the haystack .', u'There is abundance of relevant research results in the Semantic Web research community that offers more robust access interfaces compared to keyword-search .', u'Here we describe a new hybrid document browser that offers advanced user experience combining keyword-search with navigation over an automatically inferred hierarchical document index .', u'The internal representation of the browsing index as a collection of UFOs [ 23 ] yields more relevant search results and improves user experience .']

sentences: [u'Named Graphs is a simple , compatible extension to the RDF abstract syntax that enables statements to be made about RDF graphs .', u'This approach is in contrast to earlier attempts such as RDF reification , or knowledge-base specific extensions including quads and contexts .', u'In this paper we demonstrate the use of Named Graphs and our experiences developing new kinds of semantic web application that build on Named Graphs for digital signatures , provenance , and semantic reasoning .', u'We present a working example based on the Named Graphs for Jena ( NG4J ) API , from which we developed a semantic version control system for Software Engineering capable of reasoning about Named Graph-based provenance .', u'We go on to discuss the implications of Named Graphs for Description Logics and semantic inference strategies .']

sentences: [u'The main issue that currently faces research in the information society is the flood of information ; a problem exacerbated by the massive diversity of information on the World Wide Web .', u'It has given researchers access to millions of references , articles , news and services .', u'Regardless of geographic location and language used , much of this information is unstructured data .', u'There is a large body of research on mining unstructured Web data , but little effort for Web pages authored in Arabic .', u'This paper investigates the Semantic Web ( SW ) support for handling documents that are authored and/or annotated in Arabic , and how to bridge the gap between the SW and Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) .', u'Moreover , to improve the intelligent exploration of unstructured documents in the Arabic domain .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'public datasets', u'USED-FOR', u'Vast knowledge bases')], [], [], [(u'smartphones', u'USED-FOR', u'federated semantic datasets')], [(u'data integrator middleware', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Android-based client')]]
sentences: [u'An enormous amount of information stored in semantic format has become available nowadays .', u'In order to browse this huge data , the development of different browsers has become necessary .', u'Today , many browsers available , but these are typically desktop applications .', u'Vast knowledge bases have been created by means of linking the different public datasets .', u'The efficient query of these data is a difficult problem .', u'The currently available browsers typically do not allow browsing over the federated datasets , generally displaying only the information of a spec- ified dataset .', u'In this paper a mobile semantic web information system is presented , which allows smartphones to browse federated semantic datasets .', u'In addition , the details of data integrator middleware and the Android-based client and the evaluation are described .']

entities: [[(u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'them', u'Generic'), (u'application domains', u'Task')], [(u'RDF and OWL data', u'Material')], [(u'RDF triple based access authorization specification', u'Method'), (u'RDF security', u'Method')], [(u'authorization conflict', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF inference', u'Method'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'graph labeling techniques', u'Method')], [(u'authorization conflict', u'Task'), (u'RDF inference', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'upper concept', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDF inference', u'Method'), (u'lower concept', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'upper concept', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL'), (u'RDF', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic Web')], [], [], [(u'RDF security', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF triple based access authorization specification')], [(u'RDF inference', u'USED-FOR', u'authorization conflict'), (u'graph labeling techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'method')], [(u'RDF inference', u'USED-FOR', u'authorization conflict')], []]
sentences: [u'RDF and OWL are the primary base technologies for implementing semantic Web .', u'Recently , many researches related with them , or applying them into the other application domains , have been introduced .', u'However , relatively little work has been done for securing the RDF and OWL data .', u'In this paper , we introduce an RDF triple based access authorization specification related with RDF security .', u'Additionally , to efficiently find the authorization conflict by RDF inference , we introduce a method using graph labeling techniques .', u'The problem of authorization conflict by RDF inference is that although the lower concept is permitted to be accessed , it can be inaccessible due to the disapproval for the upper concept .', u'Because by the RDF inference , the lower concept can be interpreted into the upper concept .']

sentences: [u'RKB Explorer is a Semantic Web application that is able to present unified views of a significant number of heterogeneous data sources regarding a given domain .', u'We have developed an underlying information infrastructure which is mediated by ontologies and consists of many independent triplestores .', u'Our current dataset totals many tens of millions of triples , and is publicly available through both SPARQL endpoints and resolvable URIs .', u'To realise the synergy of disparate information sources , we have deployed tools to identify co-referent URIs , and devised an architecture to allow the information to be represented and used .', u'This paper provides a brief overview of the RKB Explorer application , the underlying infrastructure , and a number of associated tools for both knowledge acquisition and publishing .']

entities: [[(u'Service- Oriented Architectures', u'Method'), (u'business-tobusiness transactions', u'Task'), (u'Web services', u'Method'), (u'public functionalities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'internal systems', u'Method')], [(u'Web services', u'Task')], [(u'SOA', u'Method'), (u'semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'automated processing', u'Task')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'Web services', u'Method'), (u'peer-to-peer infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'service availability', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Service- Oriented Architectures', u'USED-FOR', u'business-tobusiness transactions'), (u'Web services', u'USED-FOR', u'public functionalities'), (u'internal systems', u'CONJUNCTION', u'business processes')], [], [(u'semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'automated processing')], []]
sentences: [u'With the development and maturity of Service- Oriented Architectures ( SOA ) to support business-tobusiness transactions , organizations are implementing Web services to expose their public functionalities associated with internal systems and business processes .', u'In many business processes , Web services need to provide is a high level of availability , since the globalization of the Internet enables business partners to easily switch to other competitors when services are not available .', u'Along with the development of SOA , considerable technological advances are being made to use the semantic Web to achieve the automated processing and integration of data and applications .', u'This paper describes the implementation and benchmarking of an architecture that semantically integrates Web services with a peer-to-peer infrastructure to increase service availability through fault-tolerance .']

sentences: [u'To resolve cooperation of multi-field , data integration and sharing of multidisciplinary model , a method to build collaborative design environment is proposed by combining multi-agent technology , ontology and OWL .', u'Multi-agent technology being used for collaborative design makes collaborative design system possess the advantages of multi-agent system , such as distribution , cooperation , intelligence ; OWL being used for collaborative design makes collaborative design system implement communication between agents and between multi-agent systems , and enhances problem of their semantic interoperation .', u'This paper constructs collaborative design environment based on multi-agent ( CDEMA ) and it can support cooperative work for distributed designers from multiple disciplines .', u'CDEMA uses the semantic Web languages ( OWL ) to specify the underlying domain ontologies , as a content language within the FIPA ACL messages .']

entities: [[(u'multimedia documents', u'Material')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'low level descriptors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dominant color', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'content dimension', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'software environment', u'Method')], [(u'M-OntoMat-Annotizer', u'Method'), (u'low level MPEG-7 visual descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'M-OntoMat-Annotizer', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'high-level domain concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'visual descriptors', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'high- and low-level multimedia concept descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multimedia content analysis', u'Task'), (u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'retrieval', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'dominant color', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'low level descriptors')], [], [(u'M-OntoMat-Annotizer', u'USED-FOR', u'low level MPEG-7 visual descriptions'), (u'Semantic Web ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'annotations')], [(u'M-OntoMat-Annotizer', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [(u'multimedia content analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reasoning'), (u'reasoning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'retrieval')]]
sentences: [u'Annotations of multimedia documents typically have been pursued in two different directions .', u'Either previous approaches have focused on low level descriptors , such as dominant color , or they have focused on the content dimension and corresponding annotations , such as person or vehicle .', u'In this paper , we present a software environment to bridge between the two directions .', u'M-OntoMat-Annotizer allows for linking low level MPEG-7 visual descriptions to conventional Semantic Web ontologies and annotations .', u'We use M-OntoMat-Annotizer in order to construct ontologies that include prototypical instances of high-level domain concepts together with a formal specification of corresponding visual descriptors .', u'Thus , we formalize the interrelationship of high- and low-level multimedia concept descriptions allowing for new kinds of multimedia content analysis , reasoning and retrieval .']

entities: [[(u'process executions', u'Task'), (u'Information Technology systems', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic Web methodologies', u'Method'), (u'reasoning services', u'Method')], [(u'ProMo', u'Method'), (u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'collaborative modeling and monitoring of Business Process executions', u'Task')], [(u'semantic modeling and reasoning', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'static and procedural aspects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'process executions', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'process executions')]]
sentences: [u'Data about process executions has witnessed a notable increase in the last decades , due to the growing adoption of Information Technology systems able to trace and store this information .', u"Meanwhile , Semantic Web methodologies and technologies have become more and more robust and able to face the issues posed by a variety of new domains , taking advantage of reasoning services in the `` big data '' era .", u'In this demo paper we present ProMo , a tool for the collaborative modeling and monitoring of Business Process executions .', u'Specifically , by exploiting semantic modeling and reasoning , it enables the reconciliation of business and data layers as well as of static and procedural aspects , thus allowing business analysts to infer knowledge and use it to analyze process executions .']

sentences: [u"The future of mobile telecommunications is aimed at creating a user- centric wireless world which takes into account user 's preferences , as well as communication context ( e.g. , network and terminal heterogeneity or user loca- tion ) .", u'In order to enable context-aware personalization of communication ser- vices offered by next-generation mobile networks , we propose an agent-based approach in combination with semantic reasoning techniques from the Semantic Web .', u"In particular , we use ontology-based user profiles to create an agent-based context-aware service which supports personalization according to user 's pref- erences .", u'An ontology is created which contains knowledge regarding terminal capabilities and user preferences , as well as a software agent which manages user personalization according to the context extracted from the user profile .']

sentences: [u'Conflicting and doubtful composer attributions are a common phenomenon in early musical repertories , but the problem is particularly acute with the output of Josquin des Prez ( c. 1450-1521 ) , the foremost musical authority figure of the 16th century.The matter is far from unambiguous ; the problems of determining which pieces really are authentic is a veritable scholarly minefield in which academic opinion changes constantly .', u'The Other Josquin has two goals : to contribute to musicological research and humanities computing by producing 40 online music editions of compositions dubiously ascribed to Josquin des Prez , using the CMME system for digital early music editions ; and the semantic enrichment of the CMME web dataset in accordance with semantic web standards such as RDF-XML .']

entities: [[(u'web applications', u'Task'), (u'discrete web application classes', u'Task')], [(u'web applications', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [], [(u'web applications', u'Task'), (u'Web 3.0', u'Material'), (u'application architecture', u'Method'), (u'Web 3.0 applications', u'Task'), (u'hybrid development process', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[], [(u'Semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'web applications'), (u'Semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'web applications nowadays'), (u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web 2.0'), (u'Web 2.0', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'web applications'), (u'Web 2.0', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'web applications nowadays')], [], [(u'Web 3.0', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'web applications'), (u'application architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'Web 3.0 applications'), (u'hybrid development process', u'USED-FOR', u'Web 3.0 applications')], []]
sentences: [u'In the last decade many development processes for web applications have been proposed , focusing on discrete web application classes .', u'In this work , we focus on the two most prominent classes of web applications nowadays : Semantic Web and Web 2.0 .', u'We attempt to clarify two generic but effective development processes for each one , based on their unique characteristics .', u'Furthermore , as the future web applications , namely Web 3.0 , are considered to be the combination of the above classes , we describe a suitable application architecture for Web 3.0 applications together with a proposed hybrid development process in which their specific requirements are taken into consideration .', u'Finally , our findings are presented on the effect of such a development process at the team management aspects of a Web 3.0 application development project .']

entities: [[(u'Debugging', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'diagnosis methods', u'Method'), (u'inconsistency', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'fault localization', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'user errors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information theoretic concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query selection', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'myopic strategies', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'knowledge bases')], [(u'diagnosis methods', u'USED-FOR', u'approaches')], [], [], [(u'information theoretic concepts', u'USED-FOR', u'query selection')], [(u'method', u'COMPARE', u'myopic strategies')]]
sentences: [u'Debugging is an important prerequisite for the wide-spread application of ontologies , especially in areas that rely upon everyday users to create and maintain knowledge bases , such as the Semantic Web .', u'Most recent approaches use diagnosis methods to identify sources of inconsistency .', u'However , in most debugging cases these methods return many alternative diagnoses , thus placing the burden of fault localization on the user .', u'This paper demonstrates how the target diagnosis can be identified by performing a sequence of observations , that is , by querying an oracle about entailments of the target ontology .', u'We exploit probabilities of typical user errors to formulate information theoretic concepts for query selection .', u'Our evaluation showed that the suggested method reduces the number of required observations compared to myopic strategies .']

entities: [[(u'modular representations of ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'Existing methods', u'Generic'), (u'models', u'Generic'), (u'modules', u'Generic'), (u'distributed reasoning', u'Method')], [(u'semantics-based P2P systems', u'Method'), (u'robustness', u'Metric')], [(u'structural criteria', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'modularized ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'criteria', u'Generic'), (u'robustness', u'Metric'), (u'maintainability', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'modularization approaches', u'Method')], [(u'quality measure', u'Metric'), (u'modular representations', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Recently , the benefits of modular representations of ontologies has been recognized by the semantic web community .', u'Existing methods for splitting up models into modules either optimize for completeness of local or for the efficiency of distributed reasoning .', u'In our work on semantics-based P2P systems , we are also concerned with the additional criteria of robustness or reasoning in cases where peers are unavailable and with ease of maintenance .', u'We define a number of structural criteria for modularized ontologies and argue why these criteria are suitable for estimating efficiency , robustness and maintainability .', u'We apply the criteria to a number of modularization approaches and discuss the trade-offs made .', u'Based on the discussion we propose a general quality measure for modular representations in the context of our use case .']

entities: [[(u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'rich description mechanism', u'Method'), (u'Web service information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'machine processing', u'Task')], [(u'P2P based approach', u'Method'), (u'Web services discovery', u'Task')], [(u'Web services information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data item descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data indexing structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'peer-to-peer data networks', u'Method'), (u'NIPPERS', u'Method')], [(u'communication cost', u'Metric'), (u'query and update operations scale', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'NIPPERS nodes', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'network', u'Generic'), (u'Web services requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Web services are becoming an important enabler of the semantic Web .', u'Besides the need for a rich description mechanism , Web service information should be made available in an accessible way for machine processing .', u'In this paper , we propose a new P2P based approach for Web services discovery .', u'Peers that store Web services information , such as data item descriptions , are efficiently located using a scalable and robust data indexing structure for peer-to-peer data networks , NIPPERS .', u'We present a theoretical analysis which shows that the communication cost of the query and update operations scale double-logarithmically with the number of NIPPERS nodes .', u'Furthermore , we show that the network is robust with respect to failures fulfilling quality of Web services requirements .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'user privacy protection'), (u'ontology inference', u'USED-FOR', u'approach'), (u'ontology inference', u'USED-FOR', u'user privacy protection')], [(u'privacy domain', u'USED-FOR', u'privacy ontology')], [], [(u'user privacy preference', u'CONJUNCTION', u'user privacy')], []]
sentences: [u'The phenomena of illegal disclosure of user privacy has become more serious considerably in the last years .', u'How to protect user privacy and prevent user privacy from illegal disclosure has become of great interest to researchers .', u'In this paper , we propose an approach of user privacy protection based on ontology inference .', u'We create privacy ontology through detailed analysis of privacy domain .', u'Then , we reason the privacy ontology with Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) rule of user privacy preference .', u'By creating ontology and SWRL rules , then reasoning logically , we can find adequate service whose privacy policy coincides with user privacy preference and protect user privacy effectively .', u'The result of experiment shows that the approach proposed in this paper is feasible and effective .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'knowledge acquisition bottleneck', u'Method')], [(u'RDF mark-up', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'annotation bottleneck', u'Task')], [(u'annotation', u'Task'), (u'manually constructed knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'IE', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'retrieval', u'Task'), (u'usage of annotation options', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Automatically generated annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'knowledge acquisition bottleneck', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The realization of the Semantic Web is constrained by a knowledge acquisition bottleneck , i.e .', u'the problem of how to add RDF mark-up to the millions of ordinary web pages that already exist .', u'Information Extraction ( IE ) has been proposed as a solution to the annotation bottleneck .', u'In the task based evaluation reported here , we compared the performance of users without access to annotation , users working with annotations which had been produced from manually constructed knowledge bases , and users working with annotations augmented using IE .', u'We looked at retrieval performance , overlap between retrieved items and the two sets of annotations , and usage of annotation options .', u'Automatically generated annotations were found to add value to the browsing experience in the scenario investigated .']

sentences: [u'Ontology defines a set of representational primitives with which a domain of knowledge is modeled .', u'Cloud-based computing is an emerging practice that offers significantly more infrastructure and financial flexibility than traditional computing models .', u'Ontologies are playing very important part in many areas such as intelligent information retrieval , knowledge management and organization , electroni c commerce .', u"Today , search engine crawlers are retrieving billions of unique URL 's or web page .", u'The main purpose of the Semantic web and ontology is to integrate heterogeneous data and enable interoperability among disparate systems .', u'As the ontology is a standard , explicit and formalized description for shared conceptual model , the educational enterprises can be integrated by applying semantic express , shared knowledge described by ontology and automatic inference mechanism in educational institute management .']

sentences: [u'Fuzzy ontology is a generalization of crisp ontology for modeling uncertain information and has been applied in recent years for supporting different activities of semantic web .', u'However , there are great collections of crisp ontologies developed so far in various domains which are not appropriate for decision making in fuzzy environment .', u'Accordingly , this paper aims at presenting an approach to automatically convert a crisp ontology to fuzzy ontology in the context of social networks .', u'Furthermore , this paper demonstrates that the combination of a learning process of crisp ontology with proposed approach , decreases computational complexity of fuzzy ontology learning due to breaking the task to two optimal steps .', u'Accordingly , the approach allows for an advantageous application of various crisp clustering techniques in fuzzy ontology context .']

entities: [[(u'blog platform', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'blogosphere', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'blog resources', u'Material')], [(u'OSEM', u'Method'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'OWL ontology', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web environment', u'Task')], [(u'inference method', u'Method'), (u'OWL ontology', u'Method')], [(u'mapping method', u'Method'), (u'SWRL inference', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL query', u'Material'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'inference method', u'USED-FOR', u'OWL ontology')], [(u'SWRL inference', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SPARQL query'), (u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'mapping method'), (u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'SPARQL query')]]
sentences: [u'As a new community forming environment , the blog platform enables sharing of the resources in blogosphere through active information exchange .', u'Many researches have been performed to recommend appropriate resources to users from vast amounts of blog resources .', u'As one of the solutions OSEM defines the knowledge base in the blogosphere with ontology for effectively modeling it .', u'In this paper , we propose a technique of converting the knowledge base into the OWL ontology for sharing it on the semantic web environment .', u'An inference method is then applied to the OWL ontology for recommending interest blog communities .', u'For this aim , a mapping method is offered and then SWRL inference and SPARQL query based on the ontology are employed to extract interest blog communities .']

entities: [[(u'RDF datasets', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'ontologies', u'Material'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'RDF triples', u'Material'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material'), (u'e-science', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'heterogeneous sources', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'trust mechanisms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'privacy policies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Managing provenance', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'implicit triples', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDFS inference rules', u'Method'), (u'declarative languages', u'Material'), (u'RDF graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'colored RDF triples', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'explicit provenance information', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'FEATURE-OF', u'RDF datasets')], [], [(u'digital rights', u'CONJUNCTION', u'privacy policies')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Recently , the W3C Linking Open Data effort has boosted the publication and inter-linkage of large amounts of RDF datasets on the Semantic Web .', u'Various ontologies and knowledge bases with millions of RDF triples from Wikipedia and other sources , mostly in e-science , have been created and are publicly available .', u'Recording provenance information of RDF triples aggregated from different heterogeneous sources is crucial in order to effectively support trust mechanisms , digital rights and privacy policies .', u'Managing provenance becomes even more important when we consider not only explicitly stated but also implicit triples ( through RDFS inference rules ) in conjunction with declarative languages for querying and updating RDF graphs .', u'In this paper we rely on colored RDF triples represented as quadruples to capture and manipulate explicit provenance information .']

entities: [[(u'they', u'Generic'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'clustering', u'Method')], [(u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hierarchical organization', u'Task'), (u'nodes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hierarchical manner', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'scale-free topology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'hierarchical networks', u'Method'), (u'clustering', u'Method'), (u'strict scaling law', u'Method'), (u'hierarchical organization', u'Task')], [(u'Worldwideweb , actor network', u'Method'), (u'domain level', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'scaling law', u'Method'), (u'hierarchy', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Worldwideweb', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'real networks'), (u'Worldwideweb , actor network', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'real networks'), (u'semantic web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'real networks')]]
sentences: [u'Abstract Many real networks in nature and society share two generic properties : they are scale-free and they display a high degree of clustering .', u'We show that these two features are the consequence of a hierarchical organization , implying that small groups of nodes organize in a hierarchical manner into increasingly large groups , while maintaining a scale-free topology .', u'In hierarchical networks , the degree of clustering characterizing the different groups follows a strict scaling law , which can be used to identify the presence of a hierarchical organization in real networks .', u'We find that several real networks , such as the Worldwideweb , actor network , the Internet at the domain level , and the semantic web obey this scaling law , indicating that hierarchy is a fundamental characteristic of many complex systems .']

sentences: [u'This volume constitutes the refereed proceedings of the 12th Pacific Rim Conference on Artificial Intelligence , PRICAI 2012 , held in Kuching , Malaysia , in September 2012 .', u'The 60 revised full papers presented together with 2 invited papers , 22 short papers , and 11 poster papers in this volume were carefully reviewed and selected from 240 submissions .', u'The topics roughly include AI foundations , applications of AI , cognition and intelligent interactions , computer-aided education , constraint and search , creativity support , decision theory , evolutionary computation , game playing , information retrieval and extraction , knowledge mining and acquisition , knowledge representation and logic , linked open data and semantic web , machine learning and data mining , multimedia and AI , natural language processing , robotics , social intelligence , vision and perception , web and text mining , web and knowledge-based system .']

sentences: [u'This paper presents a model to integrate CMS contents and a intelligent .', u'The proposed model acts on the problem of creating structured content to Semantic Web by the content publishers .', u'The model also contemplates the use of Semantic Content through a Conversational Agent .', u'For evaluation purposes will be dynamically integrated the contents of a Content Management System with a Communicational Intelligent Agent .', u'The evaluation will be done in two parts : first checking if the agent can generate the knowledge base for dialogue , accessing Web pages and representing their content in RDFa and AIML format .', u'In a second step , interaction tests will be carried out with users for usability evaluation in order to get their opinion on the use of Conversational Agent .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'knowledge sources', u'Material')], [(u'description logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'tolerating inconsistent or incomplete data', u'Task')], [(u'OWL', u'Material')], [(u'paraconsistent OWL', u'Method'), (u'quasi-classical OWL', u'Method'), (u'inconsistency', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'inference rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'modus tollens', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'modus ponens', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'disjunctive syllogism', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'paraconsistent reasoning', u'Task'), (u'quasi-classical OWL', u'Material')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'paraconsistent reasoning', u'Method'), (u'classical inference rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'modus tollens', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'inference rules'), (u'modus tollens', u'CONJUNCTION', u'modus ponens'), (u'modus ponens', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'inference rules'), (u'modus ponens', u'CONJUNCTION', u'disjunctive syllogism'), (u'disjunctive syllogism', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'inference rules')], [], [(u'approaches', u'COMPARE', u'approach'), (u'paraconsistent reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning')]]
sentences: [u'In Semantic Web , the knowledge sources usually contain inconsistency because they are constantly changing and from different view points .', u'As is well known , as based on the description logic , OWL is lack of the ability of tolerating inconsistent or incomplete data .', u'Recently , the research in handling inconsistency in OWL becomes more and more important .', u'In this paper , we present a paraconsistent OWL called quasi-classical OWL to handle inconsistency with holding important inference rules such as modus tollens , modus ponens , and disjunctive syllogism .', u'We propose a terminable , sound and complete tableau algorithm to implement paraconsistent reasoning in quasi-classical OWL .', u'In comparison with other approaches to handle inconsistency in OWL , our approach enhances the ability of reasoning by integrating paraconsistent reasoning with important classical inference rules .']

sentences: [u'Aims : Ontologies Languages and Tools have been becoming a hot research topic for the application in artificial intelligence , semantic web , Software Engineering and information Architecture .', u'Ontology is a formal representation of set of concepts within a domain and relationships between those concepts .', u'It is used to reason about the properties of that domain and may be used to define the domain .', u'An ontology language is a formal language used to encode the ontologies .', u'A number of research languages have been designed and released during the past few years by the research community .', u'They are both proprietary and standard based .', u'In this paper a comparative study has been reported on the different features and issues of these languages and its tools .']

relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'approaches', u'CONJUNCTION', u'techniques'), (u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'information extraction'), (u'techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'information extraction')], []]
sentences: [u'The World Wide Web represents a universe of knowledge and information .', u'Unfortunately , it is not straightforward to query and access the desired information .', u'Languages and tools for accessing , extracting , transforming , and syndicating the desired information are required .', u'The Web should be useful not merely for human consumption but additionally for machine communication .', u'Therefore , powerful and user-friendly tools based on expressive languages for extracting and integrating information from various different Web sources , or in general , various heterogeneous sources are needed .', u'The tutorial gives an introduction to Web technologies required in this context , and presents various approaches and techniques used in information extraction and integration .', u'Moreover , sample applications in various domains motivate the discussed topics and providing data instances for the Semantic Web is illustrated .']

entities: [[], [(u'software development process', u'Method')], [], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'web 2.0', u'Material'), (u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Social Global Repository ( SGR )', u'Method'), (u'software development teams', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'web 2.0', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web')], []]
sentences: [u'Software has become crucial for everyday matters .', u'In this context , the effective management of the software development process has become an essential issue for business survival in an ever more competitive industry .', u'In order to gain business strengths from the development process , organisations need to carry out software development in the most efficient manner possible , avoiding redundancy and time losses .', u'This paper presents an architecture which combines the strengths of two technologies , web 2.0 and the semantic web , as a solution to reuse and extrapolate knowledge and software products across projects and organisations .', u'The Social Global Repository ( SGR ) is a tool which incorporates the established methodological recommendations of Software Engineering ( SE ) in an environment which provides support , flexibility and up-to-date solutions to software development teams .']

sentences: [u'This paper basically provides information about diseases with the help of ontology .', u'The developed system uses disease and its relationship with symptoms and SWRL rules ( Semantic Web Rule Language ) for predicting diseases .', u'The architecture of the developed system provides the overall working of the system .', u'The system has contains two stages .', u'The first stage is defining the class hierarchy and defining the object and data properties .', u'The final stage is executing rules which give the disease name based on the symptoms given in the rule .', u'Finally the inferred axioms reflected in the ontology .', u'The various testing shows the successful execution of ontology.The analysis of the results obtained followed by their discussion gives the final risk value to the user of the system .']

entities: [[(u'open and shared source code', u'Material'), (u'collaborative development processes', u'Task')], [(u'source code analysis techniques', u'Method'), (u'global source code analysis techniques', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Method')], [(u'inference services', u'Method'), (u'data', u'Generic'), (u'search', u'Task'), (u'call graph construction', u'Task'), (u'clone detection', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'There has been an ongoing trend towards open and shared source code that is published on the Internet in large software repositories to support collaborative development processes .', u'While traditional source code analysis techniques perform well in single project contexts , new types of global source code analysis techniques are slowly introduced to address the analysis of global distributed and often incomplete source code .', u'In this article , we discuss how the Semantic Web , an enabling technology for these emerging source code analysis domains , can support a standardized , formal , and semantic rich representation to model these corpora .', u'We also illustrate how inference services can be used to provide support for emerging source code analysis approaches on this data , such as search , call graph construction , and clone detection .']

sentences: [u"The web is the world 's most valuable information resource .", u'How- ever , a wide gap has emerged between the information available for software applications vis-a-vis human consumption .', u'In response to this problem , new research initiatives have focused on extracting information available on the web with machine-processable semantics .', u'Ontologies play a large role in informa- tion extraction , particularly in the context of semantic web , and applications should be able to find appropriate ontologies on the fly .', u'However , existing tools do not adequately support information extraction and ontology selection .', u'This research-in-progress paper presents the architecture for an information extraction system which relies on domain ontologies and lexical resources .', u'We also provide an approach for easy identification of appropriate ontologies for a particular task .']

sentences: [u'This article introduces a hybrid ontology mediation approach for the Semantic Web .', u'It combines both syntactic and semantic matching measures to provide better results for matching data labels .', u'Although ontologies are meant to provide a shared conceptualization of the world , the development practices , lack of standards , and subjective naming conventions today , create data heterogeneity problems among ontologies .', u'This is a significant problem particularly for ontologies of similar domains .', u'Mediation techniques at present focus mainly on syntactic matching and our premise is that a hybrid approach would be a better solution to this problem .', u'We provide empirical evidence with hypothesis tests and also provide several new measures such as relevance , reliability , and precision to validate our approach .', u'We also introduce a detailed mapping algorithm .']

entities: [[(u'Intelligent mobile advertising', u'Material')], [(u'growth', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Intelligent Mobile Advertising Service ( iMAS ) ontology', u'Task'), (u'Mobile Semantic Advertising Model', u'Method')], [(u'iMAS location based service', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'prototype', u'Generic'), (u'MSAM ontology', u'Method')], [(u'formal approach', u'Method'), (u'iMAS model ontology', u'Method')], [(u'retail and marketing ontologies', u'Task'), (u'iMAS model ontology', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[], [(u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'growth')], [], [], [], [(u'formal approach', u'USED-FOR', u'iMAS model ontology')], [(u'retail and marketing ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'iMAS model ontology')], []]
sentences: [u'Intelligent mobile advertising is an important area for business growth .', u'The foundation of this growth is largely dependent on the semantic web that relies on ontologies to provide various taxonomies .', u'The Intelligent Mobile Advertising Service ( iMAS ) ontology is developed from its roots in marketing , enabling the development of the Mobile Semantic Advertising Model ( MSAM ) .', u"However , the dynamic nature of marketing in today 's world of the web has led to the work done on the iMAS location based service .", u'The prototype was tested and the results were applied to the development of MSAM ontology .', u'This paper introduces a formal approach to the iMAS model ontology .', u'An overview of retail and marketing ontologies and the iMAS model ontology is discussed .', u'The final section covers challenges and future work .']

entities: [[(u'hierarchical taxonomies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'loosely defined concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'graded membership', u'Material')], [(u'Fuzzy categories', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'taxonomy definitions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Knowledge of relations', u'Task'), (u'association rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'fuzzy confidences', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'association rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy categories', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hierarchies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'web-based sources', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'hierarchical taxonomies', u'USED-FOR', u'information'), (u'hierarchical taxonomies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web')], [], [], [(u'association rules', u'USED-FOR', u'Knowledge of relations')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy confidences'), (u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'association rules'), (u'fuzzy confidences', u'USED-FOR', u'association rules')], [(u'web-based sources', u'USED-FOR', u'system')]]
sentences: [u'The use of hierarchical taxonomies to organise information ( or sets of objects ) is essential to the semantic web and is also fundamental to many aspects of web 2.0 .', u'In most cases , the seemingly crisp granulation of a taxonomy disguises the fact that categories are based on loosely defined concepts which are better modelled by allowing graded membership .', u'Fuzzy categories may also arise when integrating information from multiple sources which do not conform to precisely the same taxonomy definitions .', u'Knowledge of relations between categories can be summarised by association rules .', u'In this paper , we outline a new method to calculate fuzzy confidences for association rules between fuzzy categories from different hierarchies .', u'We illustrate with examples drawn from a system that integrates information from web-based sources .']

entities: [[(u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'semantics based enterprise modeling', u'Method'), (u'automated service discovery', u'Task'), (u'service composition', u'Task')], [(u'architecture driven modeling approach', u'Method'), (u'semantic enterprise model', u'Method')], [(u'Business pattern', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'business components', u'Method')], [(u'Business component', u'Method'), (u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'component relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'automated service discovering', u'Task'), (u'composing', u'Task')], [(u'Business patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web services', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Most research focuses on the open standards of Web services and semantic Web but pays less attention to semantics based enterprise modeling , and automated service discovery and service composition are difficult .', u'This paper applies architecture driven modeling approach to constructing semantic enterprise model .', u'Business pattern is the main modeling block that is represented as business components and relationships among them .', u'Business component is attached with semantic information , and component relationships are semantically defined , a primary benefit is that they facilitate automated service discovering , composing , and testing .', u'Business patterns are used to guide service composition by which business goal is mapped into Web services , when business goal is changed , the affected scope of the modifications can be determined by means of component relationships .']

sentences: [u'Representation is a uent .', u'A mismatch between the real world and an agents representation of it can be signalled by unexpected failures ( or successes ) of the agents reasoning .', u'The real world may include the ontologies of other agents .', u'Such mismatches can be repaired by rening or abstracting an agents ontology .', u'These renements or abstractions may not be limited to changes of belief , but may also change the signature of the agents ontology .', u'We describe the implementation and successful evaluation of these ideas in the ORS system .', u'ORS diagnoses failures in plan execution and then repairs the faulty ontologies .', u'Our automated approach to dynamic ontology repair has been designed specically to address real issues in multi-agent systems , for instance , as envisaged in the Semantic Web .']

entities: [[(u'Durante unos cinco anos', u'Material')], [(u'Asi mismo', u'Material')], [(u'Web 2.0', u'Material'), (u'university archives', u'Material')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Web 2.0', u'CONJUNCTION', u'university archives')], []]
sentences: [u'Durante unos cinco anos , el grupo de trabajo de la CAU-CRUE encargado de observar la evolucion de los archivos universitarios en el entorno de la Web 2.0 , ha concluido que , en general , la falta de fondos , tiempo y personal , ha dificultado este proceso .', u'Asi mismo , ha sido testigo de la llegada imparable de la Web semantica o 3.0 , sin que su antecesora haya llegado a implantarse .', u'For about five years , the CAU-CRUEs working group responsible of the analysis of the evolution of the relation between the Web 2.0 and the university archives , concluding that , in general , lack of funds , time and personnel , has hampered this process .', u'Likewise , it has witnessed the unstoppable advent of the Semantic Web or 3.0 , despite its predecessor hasnt reached implanted .']

entities: [[(u'archiving', u'Task'), (u'semantic Web data', u'Material')], [(u'archiving systems', u'Method'), (u'benchmarking RDF archives', u'Task'), (u'storage space efficiency', u'Metric'), (u'retrieval operations', u'Task')], [(u'RDF archiving systems', u'Method')], [(u'real-world evolving dataset', u'Material')], [(u'archiving techniques', u'Method'), (u'querying strategies', u'Method')], [(u'RDF data archives', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'archiving techniques', u'CONJUNCTION', u'querying strategies')], []]
sentences: [u'There is an emerging demand on efficiently archiving and ( temporal ) querying different versions of evolving semantic Web data .', u'As novel archiving systems are starting to address this challenge , foundations/standards for benchmarking RDF archives are needed to evaluate its storage space efficiency and the performance of different retrieval operations .', u'To this end , we provide theoretical foundations on the design of data and queries to evaluate emerging RDF archiving systems .', u'Then , we instantiate these foundations along a concrete set of queries on the basis of a real-world evolving dataset .', u'Finally , we perform an empirical evaluation of various current archiving techniques and querying strategies on this data .', u'Our work comprises -- to the best of our knowledge -- the first benchmark for querying evolving RDF data archives .']

entities: [[(u'wireless environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'frequent disconnections', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'service technologies', u'Generic'), (u'Web Services', u'Task'), (u'Mobile Agents', u'Task')], [(u'semantically enriched Web Services', u'Material')], [(u'Service registries', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web framework', u'Method')], [(u'registries', u'Generic'), (u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic matching', u'Task'), (u'service queries', u'Material'), (u'published service descriptions', u'Material')], [(u'framework', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Web Services', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'service technologies'), (u'Web Services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Mobile Agents'), (u'Mobile Agents', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'service technologies')], [], [], [(u'registries', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic matching'), (u'semantic information', u'USED-FOR', u'registries'), (u'service queries', u'CONJUNCTION', u'published service descriptions')], []]
sentences: [u'The requirement for ubiquitous service access in wireless environments presents a great challenge in light of well-known problems like high error rate and frequent disconnections .', u'In order to satisfy this requirement , we propose the integration of two modern service technologies : Web Services and Mobile Agents .', u'This integration allows wireless users to access and invoke semantically enriched Web Services without the need for simultaneous , online presence of the service requestor .', u'Moreover , in order to improve the capabilities of Service registries , we exploit the advantages offered by the Semantic Web framework .', u'Specifically , we use enhanced registries enriched with semantic information that provide semantic matching to service queries and published service descriptions .', u'Finally , we discuss the implementation of the proposed framework and present our performance assessment findings .']

sentences: [u'Epidemic Analyzer : an intelligent query processor and health support model accepts Layman health information as input and tells the Layman about the percentage of chance for him/her to have an epidemic .', u'This paper is an approach towards integrating knowledge acquisition and reasoning in Web based Epidemic Analysis .', u'The information about allergic medicines for the patient , the environment which the patient resides , list of recently affected diseases is always useful in proper diagnosis of an epidemic .', u'Immediate notification of possible emergency and health artifacts to nearest and possible communication with the personal medical assistant via medical language are always helpful in disease diagnosis at right time .', u'We take the advantage of distributed space architecture and semantic web to achieve these goals .']

entities: [[(u'web sites', u'Material')], [(u'navigational patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'recommendation method', u'Method'), (u'usage data', u'Material'), (u'web logs', u'Material'), (u'web documents', u'Material')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'usage-oriented URI representation of web pages', u'Method'), (u'content-based semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain-ontology terms', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'automatic method', u'Method'), (u"web site 's documents", u'Material')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web personalization system SEWeP', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u"The amounts of information residing on web sites make users ' navigation a hard task .", u"To address this problem , web sites provide recommendations to the end users , based on similar users ' navigational patterns mined from past visits .", u'In this paper we introduce a recommendation method , which integrates usage data recorded in web logs , and the conceptual relationships between web documents .', u"In the proposed framework , the usage-oriented URI representation of web pages and users ' behavior is augmented with content-based semantics expressed using domain-ontology terms .", u"Since the number of multilingual web sites is constantly increasing , we also propose an automatic method for uniformly characterizing a web site 's documents using a common vocabulary .", u'Both methods are integrated in the semantic web personalization system SEWeP .']

sentences: [u'Today , search engine has become a very necessary tool on the Web .', u'But current information search models does not support semantic query .', u'In this paper , we propose a share knowledge system model based on ISMBDI model supported by theories and technologies of semantic Web and ontology .', u'This model takes XML sources as the object of data processing , XML/RDF as the description language of knowledge , and ontology as the design mode of concepts .', u'We then discuss query reconstruction methods and query algorithms in this model .', u'The experiments and analysis show that ISMBDI model can solve the some problems existed in current search method , such as half-baked answer or redundant answer , a great deal of hash , conflicting data pattern and so on .']

sentences: [u"Cloud manufacturing is a service oriented , high efficient , low consumption and knowledge-based intelligent manufacture new network model put forward in recent years.It is a blend of the existing informatization manufacturing , cloud computing , Internet of things , the semantic Web , and high-performance computing technology , Cloud manufacturing service platform can help small and medium enterprises solve problems such as lack of funds , small scale and low enterprise informationization.It studied the system integrated enterprises ' traditional new product development design process.The parts design selection mode based on cloud manufacturing was constructed.The relevant parts trading mode was put forward.The cloud manufacturing service platform 's subject of operation , service contents and profit mechanism and operation mechanism was designed.These could lay the foundation for the implementation and promotion of cloud manufacturing service platform ."]

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic social networks', u'Method'), (u'collective intelligence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'collaborative interactions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'tools', u'Generic'), (u'models', u'Generic'), (u'anonymized dataset', u'Material'), (u'Ipernity.com', u'Material'), (u'multimedia sharing', u'Task')], [(u'dataset', u'Generic')], [(u'online social networks', u'Method')], [(u'socially produced information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'social applications', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic social networks'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'collective intelligence')], [(u'tools', u'CONJUNCTION', u'models')], [], [], [(u'socially produced information', u'USED-FOR', u'social applications')]]
sentences: [u'In this chapter we present our approach to analyzing such semantic social networks and capturing collective intelligence from collaborative interactions to challenge requirements of Enterprise 2.0 .', u'Our tools and models have been tested on an anonymized dataset from Ipernity.com , one of the biggest French social web sites centered on multimedia sharing .', u'This dataset contains over 60,000 users , around half a million declared relationships of three types , and millions of interactions ( messages , comments on resources , etc . ) .', u'We show that the enriched semantic web framework is particularly well-suited for representing online social networks , for identifying their key features and for predicting their evolution .', u'Organizing huge quantity of socially produced information is necessary for a future acceptance of social applications in corporate contexts .']

entities: [[(u'semantics-enabled layered policy architecture', u'Method'), (u'policies', u'Generic'), (u'policy languages', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'layers', u'Generic'), (u'Unifying Logic', u'Method'), (u'UNL )', u'Metric'), (u'Policy Interchange Format', u'Method'), (u'PIF )', u'Method'), (u'Privacy Protection/DRM', u'Method'), (u'Domain Specific Applications', u'Task')], [(u'meta-Policy Interchange Format ( meta-PIF ) layer', u'Method'), (u'PIF layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'facilitator', u'Generic'), (u'uniform services of interchange', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reconciliation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SemPIF architecture', u'Method'), (u"W3C 's Semantic Web architecture", u'Method')], [(u'facilitator', u'Method'), (u'SemPIF', u'Method'), (u'privacy protection policies', u'Method'), (u'digital library subscription services', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Web', u'FEATURE-OF', u'policy languages')], [(u'layers', u'PART-OF', u'architecture'), (u'Unifying Logic', u'PART-OF', u'architecture'), (u'Unifying Logic', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'layers'), (u'Unifying Logic', u'CONJUNCTION', u'UNL )'), (u'Unifying Logic', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Policy Interchange Format'), (u'Unifying Logic', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Privacy Protection/DRM'), (u'UNL )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'layers'), (u'UNL )', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Policy Interchange Format'), (u'Policy Interchange Format', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'layers'), (u'Policy Interchange Format', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Privacy Protection/DRM'), (u'Privacy Protection/DRM', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'layers'), (u'Privacy Protection/DRM', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Domain Specific Applications')], [(u'uniform services of interchange', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reconciliation')], [], []]
sentences: [u'We propose a semantics-enabled layered policy architecture for the exchange and management of multiple policies created by different policy languages on the Web .', u'This architecture consists of four layers : Unifying Logic ( UNL ) , Policy Interchange Format ( PIF ) , Privacy Protection/DRM ( PPD ) , and Domain Specific Applications ( DSA ) .', u'A meta-Policy Interchange Format ( meta-PIF ) layer is also introduced , side by side with the corresponding PIF layer , allowing agents in the facilitator to provide uniform services of interchange , reconciliation , and combination of policies .', u"This SemPIF architecture extends W3C 's Semantic Web architecture to permit the reuse of earlier work .", u'A scenario of agents in the facilitator employing SemPIF for Digital Rights Management ( DRM ) and privacy protection policies on digital library subscription services will be demonstrated .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'expressive power of ontology languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy and distributed cases', u'Material')], [], [(u'E-connection', u'Method'), (u'extended fuzzy description logics', u'Method'), (u'logical approach distributed EFDLs', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy and distributed features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'description logics', u'Method')], [(u'DEFDLs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cut links', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed EFDLs knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'global DEFDLs knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'reasoning issues', u'Task'), (u'DEFDLs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy reasoning technique', u'Method'), (u'restricted DEFDLs knowledge bases', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'E-connection', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'extended fuzzy description logics'), (u'logical approach', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy and distributed features')], [(u'cut links', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy relations')], [(u'restricted DEFDLs knowledge bases', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy reasoning technique')]]
sentences: [u'By development of the Semantic Web , demands for increasing expressive power of ontology languages has triggered a mass of extending description logics in fuzzy and distributed cases .', u'However , current solutions are proposed respectively on one of these two aspects .', u'By integrating E-connection into extended fuzzy description logics ( EFDLs ) , this paper proposes a novel logical approach distributed EFDLs ( DEFDLs ) to couple both fuzzy and distributed features within description logics .', u'In DEFDLs , cut links are introduced to describe fuzzy relations among various fuzzy areas , hence connecting distributed EFDLs knowledge bases to construct a global DEFDLs knowledge base .', u'We make a primitive discussion about reasoning issues within DEFDLs , where some current fuzzy reasoning technique can be reused in restricted DEFDLs knowledge bases .']
