sentences: [u'RDF ontology can represent semantic information in semantic Web .', u'Ontologies are often too large to be used in a single application .', u'Extracting sub-ontology from large-scale ontology can solve this problem .', u'RDF ( S ) ontologies are abstracted as graph models .', u'According to the RDFS inference rules , the closure of RDFS ontology graph model can be constructed .', u'To decrease the time of generating closure , a parallel closure algorithm is presented .', u'We also present an algorithm based on the graph theory to extract a sub-graph with the concepts in the domain term lexicon as nodes .', u'This sub-graph is regarded as the required domain ontology .', u'The method is applicable to RDF ( S ) domain ontology extraction .', u'Applying the method , domain ontology can be built fast and effectively .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'ready-to-use linked open data sources', u'Material')], [], [(u'property-based typing', u'Task'), (u'paradigm', u'Generic')], [(u'property-based typing', u'Task'), (u'linked open data cloud', u'Material')], [(u'transparency', u'Metric')], [(u'iterative approach', u'Method'), (u'human feedback', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'human feedback', u'USED-FOR', u'iterative approach')]]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web has matured from a mere theoretical vision to a variety of ready-to-use linked open data sources currently available on the Web .', u'Still , with respect to application development , the Web community is just starting to develop new paradigms in which data as the main driver of applications is promoted to first class status .', u'Relying on properties of resources as an indicator for the type , property-based typing is such a paradigm .', u'In this paper , we inspect the feasibility of property-based typing for accessing data from the linked open data cloud .', u'Problems in terms of transparency and quality of the selected data were noticeable .', u'To alleviate these problems , we developed an iterative approach that builds on human feedback .']

entities: [[(u'multimedia documents', u'Material')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'low level descriptors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dominant color', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'content dimension', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'software environment', u'Method')], [(u'M-OntoMat-Annotizer', u'Method'), (u'low level MPEG-7 visual descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'M-OntoMat-Annotizer', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'high-level domain concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'visual descriptors', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'high- and low-level multimedia concept descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multimedia content analysis and reasoning', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'dominant color', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'low level descriptors')], [], [(u'M-OntoMat-Annotizer', u'USED-FOR', u'low level MPEG-7 visual descriptions'), (u'Semantic Web ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'annotations')], [(u'M-OntoMat-Annotizer', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], []]
sentences: [u'Annotations of multimedia documents typically have been pursued in two different directions .', u'Either previous approaches have focused on low level descriptors , such as dominant color , or they have focused on the content dimension and corresponding annotations , such as person or vehicle .', u'In this paper , we present a software environment to bridge between the two directions .', u'M-OntoMat-Annotizer allows for linking low level MPEG-7 visual descriptions to conventional Semantic Web ontologies and annotations .', u'We use M-OntoMat-Annotizer in order to construct ontologies that include prototypical instances of high-level domain concepts together with a formal specification of corresponding visual descriptors .', u'Thus , we formalize the interrelationship of high- and low-level multimedia concept descriptions allowing for new kinds of multimedia content analysis and reasoning .']

entities: [[(u'structured and unstructured data', u'Material')], [(u'They', u'Generic'), (u'global dataset', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Web field', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'structured data', u'Material'), (u'unstructured data', u'Material')], [(u'RDF format', u'Material')], [(u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'strategy', u'Generic'), (u'RDF format', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'Recently , sources of structured and unstructured data have been made available on the web , and gained attention among researchers from several areas .', u'They are become more interested in using this global dataset due to its size and variety of information .', u'In the Semantic Web field , many studies have translated structured data into unstructured data , and vice-versa , to make them comprehensible to machines and humans .', u'However , we argue that we can take advantage of the existing information , in both text and RDF format .', u'In this paper we focus on finding a way to compare them , and discovering which available text can represent an existing RDF .', u'Hence , we propose a strategy to check whether a text represents the same knowledge that is shown in RDF format .']

sentences: [u'We present our ongoing work on user data and contextual privacy preservation in mobile devices through semantic reasoning .', u'Recent advances in context modeling , tracking and collaborative localization have led to the emergence of a new class of smart phone applications that can access and share embedded sensor data .', u'Unfortunately , this also means significant amount of user context information is now accessible to applications and potentially others , creating serious privacy and security concerns .', u'Mobile OS frameworks like Android lack mechanisms for dynamic privacy control .', u'We show how data flow among applications can be successfully filtered at a much more granular level using semantic web driven technologies that model device location , surroundings , application roles as well as context-dependent information sharing policies .']

entities: [[(u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'programmable substrate', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Web 2.0', u'Method')], [], [(u'programmable Web', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed computing', u'Method'), (u'software engineering', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web 2.0')], [], [], [(u'distributed computing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'software engineering')]]
sentences: [u'Web services , the semantic Web , and Web 2.0 are three somewhat separate movements trying to make the Web a programmable substrate .', u'While each has achieved some level of success on their own right , it is becoming apparent that the grassroot approach of the Web 2.0 is gaining greater success than the other two .', u'In this paper we analyze each movement , briefly describing its main traits , and outlining its primary assumptions .', u'We then frame the common problem of achieving a programmable Web within the context of distributed computing and software engineering and then attempt to show why Web 2.0 is closest to give a pragmatic solution to the problem and will therefore likely continue to have the most success while the other two only have cursory contributions .']

sentences: [u'This manuscript reviews a developed software application i.e .', u'I-SOAS , providing conceptual as well as partial prototype support in implementing an intelligent semantic oriented solution towards the problems of multirole user interface , meta data modeling and efficient information extraction in ( Desktop and Web based ) Product Data Management ( PDM ) Systems .', u'Going from a more general overview of the proposed approach , this manuscript presents the developed desktop and web graphical user interface of I-SOAS in detail .', u'Going into the details , this manuscript presents each components of the developed prototype to help user in getting familiar in shortest possible time .', u'Furthermore the information about tools and technologies ( e.g .', u'Rich Internet Application , Semantic Web , Object Oriented Programming Languages and Database etc . )', u'used during the software development is briefly described .']

entities: [[(u'Ontology technology', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'anatomy', u'Task')], [(u'anatomy research', u'Task')], [(u'FMA', u'Method'), (u'complexity', u'Metric')], [(u'method', u'Generic')], [], [(u'repair', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'FMA', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontology technology', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Ontology technology is widely used in various areas because of the development of Semantic Web , especially in the field of anatomy .', u'Foundation Model of Anatomy ( FMA ) is one of the most popular knowledge bases in the anatomy research .', u'FMA consists of 75,000 classes and 130,000 anatomy terms , due to the complexity derived from such large amount of detailed information , it will slow down the execution of the application .', u'So a method of extracting and generalising is investigating and quantified .', u'The worth of the experiment is to abstract a smaller and less detailed version which is easier to manage .', u'To implement this , four steps are proposed as repair , clear up repair , abstract and split .', u'Preliminary experimental evaluation will choose a small portion of FMA , the finger and hand .']

entities: [[(u'database community', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'database problems', u'Task'), (u'Knowledge Representation ( KR ) aspects', u'Task')], [(u'ILP perspective', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'database problems', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ILP problems', u'Task'), (u'KR framework', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'PART-OF', u'database community')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper we address an issue that has been brought to the attention of the database community with the advent of the Semantic Web , i.e. , the issue of how ontologies ( and semantics conveyed by them ) can help solving typical database problems , through a better understanding of Knowledge Representation ( KR ) aspects related to databases .', u'In particular , we investigate this issue from the ILP perspective by considering two database problems , ( i ) the definition of views and ( ii ) the definition of constraints , for a database whose schema is represented also by means of an ontology .', u'Both can be reformulated as ILP problems and can benefit from the expressive and deductive power of the KR framework $ \\mathcal { DL } +log } ^ { \\neg\\vee } $ .', u'We illustrate the application scenarios by means of examples .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'web documents'), (u'natural language analysis technique', u'USED-FOR', u'web documents')], [(u'tool', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic document model'), (u'semantic document model', u'USED-FOR', u'search session'), (u'search engine', u'USED-FOR', u'search session')], []]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web vision offers the potential to express queries in a more semantic way .', u'However , the unstructured nature of existing web documents , which lack semantics , proves to be a difficult task for such a query .', u'To support this , the semantic information content of web documents needs to be specified in order to make the tangled information more structured and accessible .', u'In this paper , we propose an approach meant to semantically query web documents using a natural language analysis technique and a domain specific ontology .', u'Using both techniques , the tool gradually constructs the semantic document model of the documents retrieved from an existing search engine for each search session , which is represented as XML .', u'The semantic model can then be semantically refined and browsed by the user .']

sentences: [u'Many relations existing in DBpedia are missing in Wikipedia yielding up an information gap between the semantic web and the social web .', u'Inserting these missing relations requires to automatically discover Wikipedia conventions .', u'From pairs linked by a property p in DBpedia , we find path queries that link the same pairs in Wikipedia .', u'We make the hypothesis that the shortest path query with maximal containment captures the Wikipedia convention for p. We computed missing links and conventions for different DBpedia queries .', u'Next , we inserted some missing links according to computed conventions in Wikipedia and evaluated Wikipedians feedback .', u'Nearly all contributions has been accepted .', u'In this paper , we detail the path indexing algorithms , the results of evaluations and give some details about social feedback .']

sentences: [u'The World Wide Web has had an huge influence on the computing field in general as well as simulation in particular ( e.g .', u', Web-Based Simulation ) .', u'A new wave of development based upon XML has started .', u'Two of the most interesting aspects of this development are the Semantic Web and Web Services .', u'This paper examines the synergy between Web service technology and simulation .', u'In one direction , Web service processes can be simulated for the purpose of correcting/improving the design .', u'In the other direction , simulation models/components can be built out of Web services .', u'Work on seamlessly using simulation as a part of Web service composition and process design , as well as on using Web services to re-build the JSIM Web-based simulation environment is highlighted .']

sentences: [u'With the expansion of semantic web , there is an increasing number of heterogeneous information data such as RDF .', u'Nowadays , most of solutions operating RDF are centralized and have limitations of scalability .', u'In this paper , we propose a method to solve the problem by storing and querying RDF data based on HBase and Hadoop .', u'A storage model classified by class and predicate is used in HBase to support efficient queries .', u'For multi-join queries of typical triangular pattern or linear structure , we put forward a method of reverse predicate encoding to reduce intermediate results of join operations which can improve the query efficiency to a certain extent .', u'Our experiments on LUBM datasets verify the feasibility and effectiveness of the storage and query method .']

sentences: [u'The article describes the evolution of digital libraries from text repositories to second-generation libraries .', u'This kind of library uses service-oriented architecture , P2P networks , and Grid , and is characterized by the integration of documents coming from different institutions , as well as by the possibility of federated search within multiple digital libraries .', u'The author then takes into consideration the peculiarities of last generation digital semantic libraries , i.e .', u'the application of the fundamentals of the Semantic Web RDF and ontologies and the use of collaborative filtering systems .', u'In the final part , the article outlines some critical issues in the DELOS digital library reference model , and the need for semantically rich metadata to support the research needs of users , especially the ones in the field of the Human Sciences .']

sentences: [u'This paper discusses architectural aspects of a software library for unified metadata management in audio processing applications .', u'The data incorporates editorial , production , acoustical and musicological features for a variety of use cases , ranging from adaptive audio effects to alternative metadata based visualisation .', u'Our system is designed to capture information , prescribed by modular ontology schema .', u'This advocates the development of intelligent user interfaces and advanced media workflows in music production environments .', u'In an effort to reach these goals , we argue for the need of modularity and interoperable semantics in representing information .', u'We discuss the advantages of extensible Semantic Web ontologies as opposed to using specialised but disharmonious metadata formats .', u'Concepts and techniques permitting seamless integration with existing audio production software are described in detail .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'defeasible knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Dual Theory of Concepts', u'Method')], [(u'metaontology', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'annotating OWL axioms', u'Task')], [(u'annotated OWL axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'logic program', u'Method'), (u'answer set semantics', u'Method')], [(u'answer set solver Smodels', u'Method'), (u'reasoner', u'Method'), (u'annotated ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'monotonic and nonmonotonic reasoning', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'annotating OWL axioms')], [(u'answer set semantics', u'PART-OF', u'logic program')], [(u'answer set solver Smodels', u'USED-FOR', u'annotated ontologies'), (u'reasoner', u'USED-FOR', u'annotated ontologies')]]
sentences: [u'There is an ongoing discussion whether reasoning in the Semantic Web should be monotonic or not .', u'However , it seems that the problem concerns not only reasoning over knowledge but knowledge itself , where apart from nondefeasible knowledge the defeasible knowledge can be distinguished .', u'In the current paper we rely on the Dual Theory of Concepts , according to which concepts are dually structured into defeasible and nondefeasible parts .', u"We develop a metaontology for representing both types of a concept 's structure and apply it for annotating OWL axioms .", u'The translation of annotated OWL axioms into a logic program under answer set semantics is provided .', u'Hence the answer set solver Smodels may be used as reasoner for annotated ontologies , handling properly the distinction between monotonic and nonmonotonic reasoning .']

sentences: [u'The potential of truly large scale Grids can only be real- ized with Grid architectures and deployment strategies that lower the need for human administrative intervention , and therefore open the Grid to wider participation from resources and users .', u'Self-Organizing Grids ( SOGs ) was proposed to address this issue .', u'Current general solutions for Grid authorization are not scalable enough , inflexible , inefficient , coarse- grained , or require too much administrative work , thus do not fit for the needs of SOGs .', u'The arising Semantic Web can contribute to a solution .', u'In this paper , we propose SOGA , a fine-grained authorization architecture for SOG environment .', u'Its characteristics includes , policy based autho- rization , fine-grained access control , dynamic environment monitor and ontology driven access rights reasoning .']

sentences: [u"A web data extraction model facing HTML or XML Web pages is provided.First , the Web document is read from the web server with STOCK , and the format of the Web document is checked , the existing HTML web page is transformed into XML or XHTML ( a subset of XML ) .An `` operation '' on a Web page can generate a series of XML documents.Integrating these documents will lead to data storing.The absolute path in Xpath and the anchors can extract interest data with the tools of XML data format , and retrieve the data and construct XML output.The experiment shows that implementing Web data extract with the model is available , but its limitations and defects also exist , an improved semantic web data extraction model is provided by the author ."]

sentences: [u'This paper describes the role natural language processing ( NLP ) can play for multimedia applications .', u'As an example of such an application , we present an approach dealing with the conceptual indexing of soccer videos which the help of structured information automatically extracted by NLP tools from multiple sources of information relating to video content , consisting in a rich range of textual and transcribed sources covering soccer games .', u'This work has been investigated and developed in the EU funded project MUMIS .', u'As a second example of such an application , we describe briefly ongoing work in the context of the Esperonto project dealing with upgrading the actual web towards the Semantic Web ( SW ) , including the automatic semantic indexing of web pages containing a combination of text and images .']

sentences: [u'Information integration develops toward semantic integration on the Semantic Web .', u'Ontology facilitates the integration of heterogeneous data sources by resolving semantic heterogeneity among them .', u'In this paper , we propose the system architecture of integrated information platform for digital city based on ontology , including three main layers : distributed heterogeneous data source layer , information integration layer , and application system layer .', u'Its core is the information integration layer including the ontology server and the integrated database .', u'Then , the domain ontology model for digital city is presented .', u'Furthermore , we realize the semantic information retrieval according to the relations of `` synonymy of , `` kind of and `` part of between concepts .', u'At the end we conclude that ontology is a good tool to integrate information among various heterogeneous urban management systems on semantic level .']

sentences: [u'Ontologies are formal specifications of shared conceptualizations of a domain .', u'Important applications of ontologies include distributed knowledge-based systems , such as the semantic web , and the evaluation of modelling languages , e.g .', u'for business process or conceptual modelling .', u'These applications require formal ontologies of good quality .', u'The quality of a formal ontology requires both a good conceptualization of a domain and a good specification of the conceptualization .', u'In this paper , we focus on the latter aspect , and present a method to test how well a specification of a formal ontology corresponds to a conceptualization of a domain held by ontology users .', u'Our experimental method is based on principles of cognitive psychology .', u'We present two experiments to demonstrate our method using upper-level ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'models', u'Generic'), (u'Product Lifecycle Management', u'Task')], [(u'industrial context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'power plant design', u'Method'), (u'ontology- based models', u'Method')], [(u'power plants', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules expression', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'validation', u'Task')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'safety', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'collaboration constrains', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web Rule Language', u'Material'), (u'ontological language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL- DL', u'Method'), (u'rules expression', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SWRL rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'industrial applications', u'Task'), (u'PLM applications', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'rules languages', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Current standard models have improved interoperability in Product Lifecycle Management .', u'But the increase of constrains surround- ing information management in an industrial context , and notably for power plant design , like the increase of data , actors , systems and the need of automation and collaboration leads to an increasing use of ontology- based models .', u'However , the design of power plants presents a specific issue , which is rules expression and validation .', u'This need of rules is gener- ated by safety , interoperability or collaboration constrains .', u'The Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) is an ontological language based on OWL- DL that allows in addition rules expression .', u'This paper presents SWRL rules and their industrial applications but also limits of this language in PLM applications .', u'It proposes in consequence other rules languages .']

sentences: [u'Description Logics are a family of logics used to represent and reason about conceptual and terminological knowledge .', u'Recently , its importance has been increased since they are used as a basis for the Ontology Web Language ( OWL ) used for the Semantic Web .', u'In previous work , we have developed in PVS a generic framework for reasoning in the ALC description logic , proving its termination , soundness and completeness .', u'In this paper we present the construction , from the generic framework , of a formally verified generic tableau-based algorithm for checking satisfiability of ALC-concepts .', u'We do it using a methodology of refinements to transfer the properties from the framework to the algorithm .', u'We also obtain some verified reasoners from the algorithm by a process of instantiation .']

sentences: [u'For constructing semantically rich service descriptions in Grid services , emerging ontologies are being used .', u"To generate ontologies , an issue named `` ontology bottleneck '' , the lack of efficient ways to build ontologies , has been coming up .", u'Therefore , it is an urgent task to improve the methodology for rapid development of more detailed and specialized domain ontologies .', u'However , it has been a hard task because domain concepts have highly-specialized semantics and the number of concepts is fairly large .', u'In order to reduce the cost , DODDLE II ( a domain ontology rapid development environment II ) has been developed in our research group .', u'In this paper , we confirm the significance of DODDLE II .', u'In addition , we introduce our plan for further extension for the Semantic Web as a future work .']

relations: [[], [(u'ABAC', u'USED-FOR', u'authentication and authorization infrastructures')], [], [], [(u'architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'access control process')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In highly open systems like the Internet , attributebased access control ( ABAC ) has proven its appropriateness .', u'This is reflected in the utilization of ABAC in authentication and authorization infrastructures ( AAIs ) .', u'However , specification and maintenance of ABAC policies has turned out to be complex and error-prone even in federations of limited size , especially if heterogeneous attribute schemes are involved .', u'Here , the arising Semantic Web can contribute to a solution .', u'This paper describes an architecture for embedding the access control process into a semantic context employing external knowledge in form of ontologies .', u'We base our proposal on extensions of established open standards .', u'Using the approach presented , policy management at the different sites of a federation is simplified by a semantic attribute management facility .']

sentences: [u'To support the realisation of semantic web - as well as digital library , the semantic information content of web documents need to be specified in order to make the tangled information more accessible to search engines and other applications .', u'A number of efforts to support the semantic representation of web documents have been proposed .', u'One such effort is the semantic document modelling of which existing web documents are classified and organised to form a semantic document model representing the contents of respective web documents .', u'In this paper we propose a tool meant to assist in constructing semantic document models using natural language analysis technique and a domain specific ontology .', u'Together with users involvement and participation the tool gradually construct the semantic document model which is represented as XML .']

sentences: [u'We present the approach and prototype of a system that supports the acquisition of bilingual knowledge .', u'In this paper we focus on the domain of vocabulary acquisition for Chinese .', u'Mapping visualizations , especially Bilingual Knowledge Maps [ 1 ] , can be used to foster acquisition of word knowledge , dictionary navigation , and testing .', u'We developed style sheets that map between knowledge representation and visualization tailored for Chinese-English bilingual data .', u'This is on the one hand used to generate maps that visualize knowledge in a pedagogically reasonable way .', u'On the other hand , user input and knowledge base can be queried .', u'This more sophisticated functionality is enabled by using Semantic Web techniques .', u'These techniques further allow us to integrate different ( possibly distributed ) data sources that contain relevant relationships .']

sentences: [u'You could consider mash-ups as dynamicsoftware compositions that combine compo-nents into a larger functionality .', u'Whereas tra-ditional software composition spans bothfunctional and data composition , the chal-lenges of composing Web applications are pri-marily in integrating their data sources .', u'Consider , for example , the development of asocial networking application on the Web.Such an application would let users define theirpersonal profile ( such as their name , address , interests , and education ) , and then search forand add people to their list of friends .', u'Otherusers could browse the social network , dis-cover links between people , and calculate de-grees of separation .', u'The Semantic Web is a web of data that canbe processed by machines , enabling data reuseand integration on top of the existing Web .']

entities: [[(u'Ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conceptual backbone', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'static resource', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'data migration', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'migration specification', u'Task'), (u'migration algorithm', u'Method')], [(u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'migrating RDF data', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'conceptual backbone')], [], [], [(u'data migration', u'USED-FOR', u'method')], [(u'separation of ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'migration specification'), (u'separation of ontology and data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'migration specification'), (u'migration specification', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'method'), (u'migration specification', u'CONJUNCTION', u'migration result'), (u'migration specification', u'CONJUNCTION', u'migration algorithm'), (u'migration result', u'CONJUNCTION', u'migration algorithm')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Ontology is the conceptual backbone that provides meaning to data on the semantic web .', u'However , ontology is not a static resource and may evolve over time , which often leaves the meaning of data in an undefined or inconsistent state .', u'It is thus very important to have a method to preserve the data and its meaning when ontology changes .', u'This paper proposed a general method that solves the problem using data migration .', u'It analyzed some of the issues in the method including separation of ontology and data , migration specification , migration result and migration algorithm .', u'The paper also instantiates the general mothod in RDF ( S ) as an example .', u'The RDF ( S ) example itself is a simple but complete method for migrating RDF data when RDFS ontology changes .']

entities: [[(u'Clinical Narrative Temporal Relation Ontology', u'Method'), (u'temporal information of clinical data', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'temporal features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic assertions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'CNTRO', u'Method'), (u'semantic-web techniques', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'operational rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'time domain', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'CNTRO 2.0', u'Method'), (u'time ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'top-level ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'clinical research', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'semantics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'operational rules')], [(u'time ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'top-level ontologies')]]
sentences: [u'The Clinical Narrative Temporal Relation Ontology ( CNTRO ) has been developed for the purpose of allowing temporal information of clinical data to be semantically annotated and queried , and using inference to expose new temporal features and relations based on the semantic assertions and definitions of the temporal aspects in the ontology .', u'While CNTRO provides a formal semantic foundation to leverage the semantic-web techniques , it is still necessary to arrive at a shared set of semantics and operational rules with commonly used ontologies for the time domain .', u'This paper introduces CNTRO 2.0 , which tries to harmonize CNTRO 1.0 and a list of existing time ontologies or top-level ontologies into a unified modelan OWL based ontology of temporal relations for clinical research .']

entities: [[(u'digital preservation', u'Task')], [(u'digital dark age', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'golden ambient intelligence environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'information management metaphor', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information container', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'digital preservation', u'Task'), (u'information context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'ambient intelligence context sensitive environment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'digital information', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'hindsight is perfect , yet looking forward to 2020 the future is not yet so clear as to what it holds for digital preservation .', u'Will we look back to now from 2020 and see a digital dark age or the beginning of a golden ambient intelligence environment ?', u'This paper will look at a classic information management metaphor , the information container and extend it to identify the challenges facing digital preservation as we move from managing information containers , through content to information context .', u'This paper will then discuss the research agenda and challenges that need soon to be faced and resolved to move our community forward , navigating through the Semantic Web towards the ambient intelligence context sensitive environment : where digital information becomes a ubiquitous process of perception and communication .']

sentences: [u'Currently in the application level of Internet of Things ( IoT ) , relevant data format standards are very complicated and every relational subject goes his own way .', u'To solve this problem , this paper , from the view of XML and ontology , started with the relationship among Internet , Semantic Web and IoT and then put forward the way of building the IoT data format standardization system .', u'The IoT data format standardization should be based on XML for syntax and on standard ontology for semantic consensus.The standardization system should be based on top-level ontology , supported by vertical domain ontology and horizontal task ontology , and establish a variety of application ontology standards .', u'Finally , the system with a specific application is illustrated and some key points for the development are analyzed .']

entities: [[(u'Europeana', u'Method'), (u'service', u'Generic'), (u'European Commission', u'Material'), (u'on-line cultural heritage of Europe', u'Material')], [(u'Metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cultural heritage objects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'libraries', u'Material'), (u'museums', u'Material'), (u'archives and audio-visual collections', u'Material')], [(u'Europeana Data Model', u'Method'), (u'cross-domain data model', u'Method')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'library data', u'Material'), (u'model', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Europeana is a service , largely funded by the European Commission , that aggregates and gives access to the on-line cultural heritage of Europe .', u'Metadata relating to cultural heritage objects is harvested from libraries , museums , archives and audio-visual collections many of whom are aggregators themselves .', u'This has necessitated the development of the Europeana Data Model , a cross-domain data model that will accommodate the specific requirements of these different domains .', u'It has been developed with the principles of the semantic web as a fundamental requirement to allow enrichment of the data by extensive linking .', u'This presentation explains the model that has been developed and the looks briefly at the work undertaken in the Europeana Libraries project to apply library data to the model .']

entities: [[(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'ontological concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'personalized presentation and/or navigation', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u"user 's interests", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'documents', u'Material'), (u'ontological concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'similarity metrics', u'Metric'), (u'object type attributes', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'personalization point of view', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]
relations: [[(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'personalized presentation and/or navigation')], [], [], [(u'ontology structure', u'CONJUNCTION', u'similarity metrics'), (u'similarity metrics', u'USED-FOR', u'object type attributes')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper we present a novel method of comparing instances of ontological concepts in regard to personalized presentation and/or navigation in large information spaces .', u"It is based on the assumption that comparing attributes of documents which were found interesting for a user can be a source for discovering information about user 's interests .", u'We consider applications for the Semantic Web where documents or their parts are represented by ontological concepts .', u'We employ ontology structure and different similarity metrics for data type and object type attributes .', u"From personalization point of view we impute reasons that might have caused user 's interest in the content .", u"Moreover , we propose a way to enumerate similarity for the particular user while taking into account individual user 's interests and preferences ."]

sentences: [u'XSLT is a language for transforming XML documents into other XML documents .', u'Despite its 16 years long life , the RDF Semantic Web language still waits its transformation language .', u'Some propositions have been done , relying on and extending XSLT , but none of them became widely used .', u'In this paper , we present a radically new transformation language for RDF , called STTL .', u'It enables to transform RDF into RDF as well as any other text format .', u'The originality and power of STTL is that it is based on SPARQL .', u'We designed it as a lightweight extension to SPARQL and we compile it into standard SPARQL .', u"We present a generic transformation rule engine implementing STTL and several RDF transformers we defined for various output languages , showing STTL 's expressive power ."]

entities: [[(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies fromglossaries of terms', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'anevolutionary life cycle', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'successive transformations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'glossary', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ofintermediate knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'dictionary', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'taxonomy', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'products', u'Generic'), (u'semantic expressiveness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'thismethod', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'glossary of anyknowledge domain', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'Method'), (u'information resources anddocuments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'This paper describes a method to generate ontologies fromglossaries of terms .', u'The proposed method presupposes anevolutionary life cycle based on successive transformations of the original glossary that lead to products ofintermediate knowledge representation ( dictionary , taxonomy , and thesaurus ) .', u'These products are characterizedby an increase in semantic expressiveness in comparisonto the product obtained in the previous transformation , with the ontology as the end product .', u'Although thismethod has been applied to produce an ontology fromthe IEEE Standard Glossary of Software EngineeringTerminology , it could be applied to any glossary of anyknowledge domain to generate an ontology that may beused to index or search for information resources anddocuments stored in libraries or on the Semantic Web .']

entities: [[(u'functional Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'practical methods', u'Method'), (u'controlled vocabularies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'MEDLINE', u'Material'), (u'UMLS', u'Method'), (u'medical domain', u'Material'), (u'information retrieval system', u'Method'), (u'MeSH terminology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hierarchical categories', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information-gathering tasks', u'Task'), (u'system', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'With a functional Semantic Web on the horizon , practical methods to take advantage of controlled vocabularies should be investigated Due to the maturity of MEDLINE and UMLS , we have an opportunity , within the medical domain , to begin exploration of ideas which may in the near future be applied to the web in general. # R # # N # # R # # N # We present an implemented information retrieval system which uses the MeSH terminology as a basis to present MEDLINE results to the user in a hierarchically-browseable way This demonstrates how to use hierarchical categories to represent a large number of results in manageable way , which is required in many information-gathering tasks , particularly in research of published literature A pilot evaluation gives evidence of usability of such a system .']

sentences: [u'The focus of this chapter is on the progressive adaptation of database techniques to Web usage in a way quite similar to the evolution from integrated file management systems to database management systems .', u'We review related and open issues , such as the semi-structured data and XML , integrity problem , query optimization problem , and integration issues in both the Web and Semantic Web environments .', u'The representation of meta-information along with data opens up a new way to automatically process Web information due to the use of explicit semantic information .', u'We hope that researchers will take into account traditional database techniques and how they can assist new Web technologies .', u'In this sense , the amalgamation of Web and database technology appears to be very promising .']

sentences: [u'Semantic web data formalisms such as RDF and OWL allow us to represent data in a language independent manner .', u'However , so far there is no principled approach allowing us to query such data in multiple languages .', u'We present CLOVA , an architecture for cross-lingual querying that aims to address this gap .', u'In CLOVA , we make a distinction between a language independent data layer and a language independent lexical layer .', u'We show how this distinction allows us to create modular and extensible cross lingual applications that need to access semantic data .', u'We specify the search interface at a conceptual level using what we call a semantic form specication abstracting from specic languages .', u'We show how , on the basis of this conceptual specication ,']

sentences: [u'Data-to-decision systems must fuse information from heterogeneous sources to infer a high-level understanding of a situation .', u'A high degree of confidence in the inferred knowledge is necessary for appropriate actions to be taken based upon the assessment of a situation .', u'This paper presents an extensible Semantic Web compatible framework that uses rich ontological descriptions for the autonomous and human-aided fusion of heterogeneous sensors and algorithms to create evidence-based hypotheses of a situation under persistent surveillance .', u'Raw data acquired from profiling sensors is combined with the output of visualization and classification algorithms , yielding information with a higher degree of confidence than what would be obtained without the fusion process .', u'The framework can readily accommodate other data sources and algorithms into the fusion process .']

relations: [[(u'ontology', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web')]]
sentences: [u'Because there is a lack of effective and unite method of establishing ontology in the Semantic Web , the paper integrate the traditional method of establishment on ontology , import the object-orient thinking to the establishment of the ontology , advances a new method of establishing ontology , namely the object-oriented method.The class and its hiberarchy , the relation of the class and the property of class is mapped in the ontology system respectively.This method have combined to the application of retrieval system.The practice proved as follows , firstly the method is easily learned and easily used , secondly it decreased the participant of the domanial experts and the workload of developing system , and thirdly it makes the semiautomatic and the automatic establishment of ontology becoming impossible .']

sentences: [u'Here we present work on using spatial knowledge in conjunction with information extraction ( IE ) .', u'Considerable volume of location data was imported in a knowledge base ( KB ) with entities of general importance used for semantic annotation , indexing , and retrieval of text .', u'The Semantic Web knowledge representation standards are used , namely RDF ( S ) .', u'An extensive upper-level ontology with more than two hundred classes is designed .', u'With respect to the locations , the goal was to include the most important categories considering public and tasks not specially related to geography or related areas .', u'The locations data is derived from number of publicly available resources and combined to assure best performance for domain-independent named-entity recognition in text .', u'An evaluation and comparison to high performance IE application is given .']

sentences: [u'The Electronic Government is a new field of applications for the semantic web where ontologies are becoming an important research technology .', u'The e-Government faces considerable challenges to achieve interoperability given the semantic differences of interpretation , complexity and width of scope .', u'In this paper we present the initial state of an e-Government ontology model called EGO .', u'First as a part of a project commissioned by the Spanish government that seeks strategies for the e-Government and second for an ongoing project commissioned by the Mexican government .', u'A set of ontologies ( component of EGO ) , are used to illustrate this paper .', u'Brief applications of this model on an Information Retrieval and on a Semantic Peer-to-Peer within the e-Government context are shown']

sentences: [u'The Electronic Government is an emerging field of applications for the Semantic Web where ontologies are becoming an important research technology .', u'The e-Government faces considerable challenges to achieve interoperability given the semantic differences of interpretation , omplexity and width of scope .', u'This paper addresses the importance of providing an infrastructure capable of dealing with issues such as : communications between public administrations across government and retrieval of official and non official documents in a timely , secure and accurate way at the back office .', u'A semantic peer-to-peer approach is proposed to enhance the information management at the e-Government domain ; this approach is integrated with a Government Information Retrieval system and it reuses the EGO Model which can be deployed within the e-Government context .']

entities: [[(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'automated inference', u'Task'), (u'event assertions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Conceptual Structure Theory', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'real-life event assertions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'event type', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'event relation type', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'event types', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'event meta-relation type', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'formalization', u'Generic'), (u'search engines', u'Method'), (u'query-answering systems', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'automated inference'), (u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'method')], [], [(u'event relation type', u'CONJUNCTION', u'event meta-relation type')], [(u'search engines', u'USED-FOR', u'formalization')]]
sentences: [u'This article proposes a method to perform automated inference from event assertions through the use of an ontology formalized under Conceptual Structure Theory .', u'An upper event ontology is first presented as an example of how the ontology is built and how real-life event assertions and their relations are modeled into its hierarchies of type .', u'Three different types are distinguished : an event type as a basic classification of events of similar nature , an event relation type as a predicate on event types , and an event meta-relation type as a predicate of predicates on event types , with formal relationships between them and their properties elicited .', u'The proposed formalization could be leveraged by search engines on the Semantic Web and query-answering systems in specific domains of discourse .']

entities: [[(u'semantic criteria', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL-based ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'problem domain', u'Material'), (u'verification rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'verification', u'Task'), (u'SWRL rule atoms', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'verification rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'procedure', u'Generic'), (u'Open World Assumption', u'Method'), (u'modeling process', u'Method')], [(u'SCs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SWRL rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"rules ' content", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'railway infrastructure planning', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'verification rules', u'USED-FOR', u'OWL-based ontologies'), (u'verification rules', u'USED-FOR', u'problem domain')], [], [], [], [(u'SWRL rules', u'USED-FOR', u'SCs')], [(u'railway infrastructure planning', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')]]
sentences: [u'For the purpose of verifying given data sets with respect to semantic criteria , OWL-based ontologies from the problem domain can be combined with verification rules expressed in the Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) .', u'Whenever a verification fails the user needs support for identifying the SWRL rule atoms leading to the observed failure .', u'We present an approach that derives so-called Semantic Constraints ( SCs ) from the verification rules in order to spot the errors within the given data set .', u'This procedure has the advantage of continuously retaining the Open World Assumption ( OWA ) within the entire modeling process .', u"SCs are derived from SWRL rules by a stepwise reduction of the rules ' content .", u'Though our approach is generic , we draw our examples from the domain of railway infrastructure planning .']

entities: [[(u'clustering method', u'Method'), (u're- lational knowledge bases', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'semantic ) annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'stan- dard languages', u'Material'), (u'modeling concepts', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'language-independent ) semi-distance measure', u'Metric')], [(u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concept descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'Bisecting k-Means', u'Method'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'medoids', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'relational representations', u'Method')], [(u'complexity', u'Metric')]]

sentences: [u'A clustering method is presented which can be applied to re- lational knowledge bases .', u'It can be used to discover interesting groupings of resources through their ( semantic ) annotations expressed in the stan- dard languages employed for modeling concepts in the Semantic Web .', u'The method exploits a simple ( yet effective and language-independent ) semi-distance measure for individuals , that is based on the resource se- mantics w.r.t .', u'a number of dimensions corresponding to a committee of features represented by a group of concept descriptions ( discriminating features ) .', u'The algorithm is an fusion of the classic Bisecting k-Means with approaches based on medoids since they are intended to be applied to relational representations .', u'We discuss its complexity and the potential applications to a variety of important tasks .']

entities: [[(u'methodologies', u'Generic'), (u'multi-user editing of semantic web ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'description logic ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multi-user editing', u'Task')], [(u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'ontology editing', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineers', u'Method')], [(u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'multi-user interactions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'wide-open anything-goes editing paradigm', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'description logic ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-user editing')], [(u'technique', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology editing'), (u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology editing')], []]
sentences: [u'Current tools , techniques and methodologies for multi-user editing of semantic web ontologies are inadequate .', u'The vast majority of ontologies are maintained by single individuals .', u'However , single user access is increasingly becoming a bottleneck as these ontologies grow in size .', u'We therefore suggest a technique and for locking segments of description logic ontologies for multi-user editing .', u'This technique fits into a methodology for ontology editing in which multiple ontology engineers concurrently lock , extract , modify , error-check and re-merge individual segments of a large ontology .', u'The technique aims to provide a pragmatic compromise between a very restrictive approach that might offer complete error protection but make useful multi-user interactions impossible and a wide-open anything-goes editing paradigm which offers little to no protection .']

sentences: [u'Translating XML data into ontologies is the problem of finding an instance of an ontology , given an XML document and a specification of the relationship between the XML schema and the ontology .', u'Previous study [ 8 ] has investigated the ad hoc approach used in XML data integration .', u'In this paper , we consider to translate an XML web document to an instance of an OWL-DL ontology in the Semantic Web .', u'We use the semantic mapping discovered by our prototype tool [ 1 ] for the relationship between the XML schema and the ontology .', u'Particularly , we define the solution of the translation problem and develop an algorithm for computing a canonical solution which enables the ontology to answer queries by using data in the XML document .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Material'), (u'people sharing knowledge', u'Task')], [(u'rapid updating webs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'websites', u'Material'), (u'web archive', u'Material')], [(u'web archive system', u'Method')], [], [(u'web archive system', u'Method'), (u'systems', u'Generic')], [(u'design tool', u'Method'), (u'selective capture approach', u'Method'), (u'software', u'Generic'), (u'SCI Web Archive system', u'Method'), (u'system testing', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'In current world , the semantic web is not just a medium for information and records carrying , but growing communities for people sharing knowledge .', u'With rapid updating webs , many websites or pages died away due to lack for awareness of importance of web archive .', u'The demand of establishing web archive system is pressing for .', u'This paper is concerning the construction of an NTU ( Nanyang Technological University of Singapore ) web archiving system .', u'We aim to discuss the value of the web archive system , mainly from a technical point of view , to evaluate the feasibility of such systems , and to realize the basic functions .', u'The design tool is the selective capture approach , and certain software is used to realize this SCI Web Archive system based on system testing .']

sentences: [u'The backwardness of the Mongolian network teaching resources results in its low reuse rates and utilization .', u'For this situation , a retrieval method of semantic web based on Mongolian curriculum areas was set up .', u'Firstly , the method established the Mongolian ontology of course Artificial Intelligence in area of teaching , it uses a relationship database MySQL to record ontology information , on the top of that , it uses semantic similarity calculation and reasoning rules established to do the semantic information reasoning , in the end , it builds a query and retrieval prototype system based on the field of Mongolian teaching .', u'Experimental results show that this method can effectively improve the information retrieval recall and precision rates , and it established Mongolian teaching resources which can be shared and interoperable knowledge hierarchy .']

entities: [[(u'graph-based knowledge representation formalism', u'Method'), (u'manipulation', u'Task'), (u'linguistic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic web formalisms', u'Method'), (u'Conceptual Graphs Formalism', u'Method'), (u'Unit Graphs framework', u'Method')], [(u'formalism', u'Generic'), (u'hierarchy of unit types', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'actantial structure', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'deep semantic representation level', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'MTT', u'Method'), (u'specialization of conveyed meanings', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'representation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'manipulation'), (u'representation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'query'), (u'manipulation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'query')], [(u'semantic web formalisms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Conceptual Graphs Formalism')], [(u'hierarchy of unit types', u'FEATURE-OF', u'formalism'), (u'actantial structure', u'USED-FOR', u'hierarchy of unit types')], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper we are interested in the choice of a graph-based knowledge representation formalism that would allow for the representation , manipulation , query , and reasoning over linguistic knowledge of the Explanatory Combinatorial Dictionary of the Meaning-Text Theory ( MTT ) .', u'We show that neither the semantic web formalisms nor the Conceptual Graphs Formalism are suitable for this task , and we justify the introduction of the new Unit Graphs framework .', u'We then detail the core of this formalism which is a hierarchy of unit types driven by their actantial structure .', u'Finally we define the new deep semantic representation level for the MTT , where the specialization of actantial structures of deep semantic unit types may correspond to a specialization of conveyed meanings .']

entities: [[(u'web information resources', u'Material'), (u'formal semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'W3C', u'Method'), (u'formal semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'SW application', u'Task')], [(u'SW applications', u'Task')], [(u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'ontology design', u'Task'), (u'SW application engineering process', u'Task')], [(u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'web applications design methods', u'Method'), (u'SW applications', u'Task')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'OWL standards', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology development tool Protege', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'W3C online ontology validation service', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'W3C', u'USED-FOR', u'formal semantics')], [], [(u'technique', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology design')], [(u'web applications design methods', u'USED-FOR', u'SW applications')], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web ( SW ) is an extension of current web in which web information resources are accompanied with their formal semantics , understandable by machine .', u'The ontology is the recommended mechanism by W3C for these formal semantics and it is considered as a backbone of every SW application .', u'Its design is remained lack of attention during engineering process of SW applications .', u'In this paper we propose a technique for ontology design during SW application engineering process .', u'By incorporating this technique , existing web applications design methods may easily be upgraded for SW applications .', u'We illustrate proposed technique using a case study , formalize resultant specification it in OWL standards through ontology development tool Protege , and then validate it using W3C online ontology validation service .']

sentences: [u'The battle for pre-eminence between search engines seems to have reached a point where a few systems and techniques dominate the market .', u'As more careful evaluations have been carried out , our level of understanding of which techniques work for the Web environment has increased significantly .', u'Does this mean that researchers should declare victory and move on to other areas ?', u'In fact , substantial opportunities for improving the performance of Web search still exist , and research in this field continues to expand rather than shrink .', u'Areas such as question answering , the Semantic Web , the Hidden Web , cross-lingual search , personalized search , and peer-to-peer search are generating considerable interest .', u'This talk will describe some of this research and discuss its potential .']

entities: [[(u'Web service annotation', u'Task'), (u'services', u'Generic'), (u'those', u'Generic')], [(u'services', u'Generic')], [(u'Automated processe', u'Task')], [(u'Manual processes', u'Task')], [], [(u'user friendly wizard', u'Method'), (u'seekda Web services portal', u'Material'), (u'crowd sourcing', u'Method'), (u'Amazon mechanical turk', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web promise', u'Task'), (u'acquisition of annotation', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'acquisition of annotation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web promise')]]
sentences: [u'Web service annotation is of crucial importance to enable efficient search and discovery of such services , especially for those that are REST based .', u'However , the process of annotating such services has several drawbacks , whether automated or not .', u'Automated processe are quite inaccurate and do not in general provide quality annotations .', u'Manual processes are very expensive , both in time , effort and consequently financially .', u'This work focuses on easing - and thus reducing the cost of - manually providing annotations .', u'This is done using a user friendly wizard on the seekda Web services portal in combination with crowd sourcing on Amazon mechanical turk .', u'The approach turned out to be very promising in solving one of the crucial problems of the Semantic Web promise , namely , the acquisition of annotation .']

sentences: [u'The paper is interested in indexing lecture videos for semantic search of learning material .', u'We present a comparative study between DCT , Grayscale and Marginal space using classical k-means technique .', u'For stable segmentation we propose to introduce an automatic threshold based on moment preservation .', u'We discuss the suitability of each space on different images and then focus on educational video frames that are not so predominant in color and present the best transformation technique for segmentation of lecture video frame .', u'We also present a technique to localize the slide based on some heuristics .', u'( 2014 ) COPYRIGHT Society of Photo-Optical Instrumentation Engineers ( SPIE ) .', u'Downloading of the abstract is permitted for personal use only .']

entities: [[(u'integrated methodology', u'Method'), (u'knowledge reuse and sharing', u'Task'), (u'aeronautics domain', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'central modelling strategy', u'Method'), (u'legacy documents', u'Material'), (u'automated means', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge workers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user-defined , web-based forms', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge capture', u'Task'), (u'retrieval of the knowledge', u'Task'), (u'semantic search system', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'aerospace domain', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'integrated methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge reuse'), (u'integrated methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge reuse and sharing')], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'It'), (u'user-defined , web-based forms', u'USED-FOR', u'It'), (u'user-defined , web-based forms', u'USED-FOR', u'systems')], [(u'domain ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge capture'), (u'domain ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieval of the knowledge'), (u'semantic search system', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieval of the knowledge')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper details an integrated methodology to optimise knowledge reuse and sharing , illustrated with a use case in the aeronautics domain .', u'It uses ontologies as a central modelling strategy for the capture of knowledge from legacy documents via automated means , or directly in systems interfacing with knowledge workers , via user-defined , web-based forms .', u'The domain ontologies used for knowledge capture also guide the retrieval of the knowledge extracted from the data using a semantic search system that provides support for multiple modalities during search .', u'This approach has been applied and evaluated successfully within the aerospace domain , and is currently being extended for use in other domains on an increasingly large scale .']

sentences: [u'The paper introduces the challenges in modern workflow management in distributed environments spanning multiple cluster , grid and cloud systems .', u'Recent developments in cloud computing infrastructures are presented and are referring how clouds can be incorporated into distributed workflow management , aside from local and grid systems considered so far .', u'Several challenges concerning workflow definition , optimisation and execution are considered .', u'These range from configuration , integration of business and scientific services , data management , dynamic monitoring and tracking , reusable workflow patterns , semantic search and distributed execution of distributed services .', u'Finally , the author recommends a solution to these challenges based on the BeesyCluster middleware for distributed management of services with static and dynamic rescheduling within a market of services .']

sentences: [u'The coexistence of Western and Eastern languages and cultures poses a true challenge for global mobility and communication in business and personal life .', u'In this paper , we will describe mobile software applications that are built on top of multilingual and crosslingual technologies for overcoming language barriers , e.g. , between English and Chinese , or German and Chinese .', u'The mobile applications are interactive language guides , culture guides and country guides .', u'They support automatic translation and dialogues between people and link the language part with information needed in a specific situation .', u'Furthermore , users can integrate pictures into their phrases for extending the descriptive capabilities of the dialogue component .', u'Semantic search facilitates access to words , phrases and information content .']

relations: [[(u'expressive knowledge representation formalisms', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic querying of relational databases'), (u'full first-order logic', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'expressive knowledge representation formalisms')], [(u'first-order logic ( FOL ) reasoner', u'USED-FOR', u'computing schematic answers'), (u'relational DBMS', u'USED-FOR', u'schematic answers')], [(u'abstractions of databases', u'USED-FOR', u'technique')], [], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'Web-scale semantic search technology')]]
sentences: [u'We address the problem of semantic querying of relational databases ( RDB ) modulo knowledge bases using very expressive knowledge representation formalisms , such as full first-order logic or its various fragments .', u'We propose to use a first-order logic ( FOL ) reasoner for computing schematic answers to deductive queries , with the subsequent instantiation of these schematic answers using a conventional relational DBMS .', u'In this research note , we outline the main idea of this technique -- using abstractions of databases and constrained clauses for deriving schematic answers .', u'The proposed method can be directly used with regular RDB , including legacy databases .', u'Moreover , we propose it as a potential basis for an efficient Web-scale semantic search technology .']

entities: [[(u'Contract Search Tool', u'Method'), (u'semantic search platform', u'Method'), (u'machines', u'Generic'), (u'gas turbines', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'legal concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics model', u'Method')], [(u'semantic text analysis', u'Method'), (u'implicitly-stated provisions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'legal review', u'Task'), (u'legal knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'service managers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'contract review process', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Contract Search Tool', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic search platform'), (u'gas turbines', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'machines')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'paragraphs of text'), (u'paragraphs of text', u'USED-FOR', u'legal concepts')], [], [(u'semantic text analysis', u'USED-FOR', u'implicitly-stated provisions')], [(u'legal risk', u'PART-OF', u'contract review process')]]
sentences: [u'The Contract Search Tool is a semantic search platform that enables effective analysis of complex , long-term contractual service agreement for machines such as gas turbines .', u'The approach we developed can effectively identify paragraphs of text for specific legal concepts .', u'Then the key content can be decomposed and organized by the semantics model that captures key elements of the concepts and links to specific paragraphs .', u'This is achieved by performing semantic text analysis to capture implicitly-stated provisions and the definitions of provisions , and relevant information is returned in an organized manner .', u'The tool can be applied to increase productivity of legal review , share legal knowledge with service managers , and reduce legal risk in contract review process .']

sentences: [u'Due to the mass-market of file sharing , majority of existing P2P systems are based on unstructured overlay networks , where P2P search still remains challenging issues .', u'In this paper , we propose a small-world based semantic search architecture in P2P Networks , called CommuSearch , which has three distinguished features : 1 ) grouping peers into hierarchical class by exploiting heterogeneity ; 2 ) constructing overlapped semantic communities according to small-world characteristics ; and 3 ) parallel and hierarchical routing based on results caching .', u'We conduct extensive simulation experiments and the numerical results show that the performance of CommuSearch substantially outperforms existing architectures in terms of average search latency , search success ratio and recall ratio , while the overhead incurred for maintaining the community is reasonably low .']

sentences: [u'We in this paper proposed a distinction method to compare objects in the Korean medicine ontology .', u'Comparing same and different information between two objects , two scenarios to use our system were designed and implemented .', u'One is the distinction of formulas , medicinal materials , and acupuncture points and the other is the distinction of effects , treatments , and symptoms .', u'To compare objects easily , the decomposition of effects and treatments and the processing of medicinal materials were provided .', u'Also , information of each object was shown through the link to the semantic search system .', u'Our distinction method and system could be helpful to compare and distinct two objects in the diagnosis systems or search systems of Korean medicine information .']

sentences: [u'Systems and methods for enhanced advertising using semantic search are disclosed .', u'In one aspect , embodiments of the present disclosure include a method , which may be implemented on a system , of identifying a semantic group with which content of a search result relates , further determining a facet of the semantic group with which the content of the search result relates , identifying an advertisement based on the facet of the semantic group , assigning an index to the advertisement as being associated with the facet of the semantic group , storing the index of the advertisement in a machine-readable storage medium , and/or presenting the advertisement to the user for viewing in a user interface in conjunction with the search result .']

sentences: [u'A method of developing sematic search engine is used for searching adverse event report from literature articles , references or abstracts .', u'The algorithm of the method comprises web-based semantic search system ; medical terminology dictionaries including MedDRA , ICD-10 dictionaries , and others represented as reported medical event ; product including drug , medical device , herbal medicine , and/or nutritional food dictionaries such as WHO Drug Dictionary ; identifiable patient or animal ; identifiable reporter ( author ) ; and a vast amount of medical/scientific literature databases .', u'The search engine is widely used to monitor literature adverse event case report , safety related animal and human study report from abstracts and/or articles for product safety signal detection and regulatory reporting purposes worldwide .']

sentences: [u'This paper describes the comparison of ontology development tools for development of academic information search system that assists inexperienced research students at a local university in Malaysia to search for academic resources in the local language context ( Bahasa Malaysia ) .', u'The cohort of inexperienced research students faces two main problems when using current system comprises of keyword search .', u'Firstly the language barrier-limiting students capabilities to conduct keyword search in foreign language ( such as English ) .', u'Secondly limited research experience in querying often results in obtaining irrelevant search results .', u'The proposed semantic search system aims to apply ontology-based search to overcome the above two problems .', u'The paper presents the first phase of system development ; ontology design and ontology development tool .']

entities: [[(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'language oriented tools', u'Method'), (u'non-compilation manipulations', u'Task')], [(u'semantic representation', u'Method')], [(u'SR', u'Method'), (u'information structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'program semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic representation of C++ programs', u'Method')], [(u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SemantiC++ representation', u'Method'), (u'SR generation', u'Method'), (u'SR', u'Method'), (u'semantic search feature', u'Method'), (u'semantic queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SR', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'non-compilation manipulations'), (u'language oriented tools', u'USED-FOR', u'non-compilation manipulations')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The evolution of approaches to the design of advanced language oriented tools for non-compilation manipulations on programs is discussed .', u'The notion of semantic representation ( SR ) as the basis of such tools is introduced .', u'SR is considered as a composition of information structures together with corresponding functionality which holds the comprehensive knowledge about the program semantics .', u'The major components of the semantic representation of C++ programs ( project SemantiC++ ) are considered and discussed .', u'The most important and novel features of the SemantiC++ representation are the support for SR generation incorporated into the SR and the semantic search feature which enables powerful and sophisticated semantic queries to the SR in an easy and elegant way .']

entities: [[(u'retrieving images', u'Task'), (u'visual content', u'Material'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'Image Retrieval Systems', u'Method'), (u'prototypes', u'Generic'), (u'visual similarity retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'content-based retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'visual content-based image retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'Images', u'Material'), (u'keyword matching', u'Method'), (u'manually indexed images', u'Material'), (u'visual content matching', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'partially indexed databases', u'Material'), (u'semi-automatic indexing tool', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'This paper addresses the issue of retrieving images based on visual content , according a particular attention to the semantic dimension of information retrieval .', u"A brief review of existing Image Retrieval Systems is provided , hilighting a major drawback of these prototypes , namely the lack of integration between classical `` semantic search '' , and visual similarity retrieval ( i.e .", u'content-based retrieval ) .', u"A new approach is proposed , that tries to integrate a real `` semantic '' dimension into visual content-based image retrieval .", u'Images may be retrieved either by keyword matching ( for manually indexed images ) , or by visual content matching .', u'This approach is then particularly adapted to partially indexed databases , and may be used in a semi-automatic indexing tool .']

sentences: [u'This paper presents WikiNer , a snapshot of the Catalan Wikipedia processed with # N # different NLP tools ( POS tagger , NERC , dependency parsers ) .', u'The article focuses on the analysis of different NERC annotations using 3 taggers : JNET , YamCha and SST .', u'Although Wikipedia text ( specially in tables , lists , references ) differs significantly in distributional properties from the corpora used to train the taggers , we believe that results of automatically # N # annotating the semantic space of the Catalan Wikipedia point to the quick availability of a resource containing massive text annotated with a degree of reliability that is enough for some # N # research tasks as well as for applications , such as simple Q & A , ontology enrichment and semantic search .']
