sentences: [u'main challenge in the area of Information Retrieval ( IR ) and Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) is the characteristics of synonymy and polysemy that exist in words of natural language .', u'The capability of natural language interfaces to the semantic search engine can be improved by both the knowledge extraction and semantic data .', u'The combining of information can make the integration and sharing of distributed data sources easily .', u'This will assist the user to have the required information efficiently and easily .', u'In this paper , some concerns of evolving algorithm to capture the semantic similarity among sentences based on WordNet semantic dictionaryis presented .', u'The proposed algorithm will be relying on a number of resources including Ontology and WordNet .']

entities: [[(u'Peer-to-peer ( P2P ) systems', u'Method')], [(u'P2P systems', u'Method'), (u'resource searches', u'Task'), (u'keyword matching', u'Task'), (u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'hierarchical semantic overlay network', u'Method'), (u'content-based full-text search', u'Task'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'network management', u'Task')], [(u'semantic overlay network', u'Method'), (u'semantic cluster of objects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'node', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'P2P DHT', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic search', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'P2P systems', u'USED-FOR', u'resource searches'), (u'keyword matching', u'USED-FOR', u'P2P systems')], [(u'hierarchical semantic overlay network', u'USED-FOR', u'content-based full-text search'), (u'semantics', u'PART-OF', u'network management')], [(u'semantic cluster of objects', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic overlay network')], []]
sentences: [u'Peer-to-peer ( P2P ) systems have many important advantages .', u'However , most existing P2P systems are limited to providing resource searches based on simple keyword matching , and do not provide any semantic information about the content of the objects stored and the relationships between those objects .', u'This paper proposes the design of a hierarchical semantic overlay network that can be used for content-based full-text search , and is part of our work to use semantics in network management .', u'Our semantic overlay network is based on creating a semantic cluster of objects that is associated with each node in the P2P DHT to provide semantic search .', u'We validate some research questions in our approach by conducting simulations .']

entities: [[(u'life science publication search', u'Task'), (u'PubMed )', u'Method'), (u'key-words', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'abstract concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'expressive relations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'expressive semantic search', u'Method'), (u'biomedical articles', u'Material')], [(u'semantic publication search engine', u'Method')], [(u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'oncological literature data', u'Material'), (u'domain experts', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'PubMed )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'life science publication search')], [], [], [], [], [(u'oncological literature data', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'tool')]]
sentences: [u'Using the current state of the art in life science publication search ( e.g. , PubMed ) , one can efficiently search for resources containing particular key-words or their combinations .', u'It is impossible to search for abstract concepts and expressive relations between them ( e.g. , type of , different from or part of ) , though .', u'Nevertheless , such a more expressive semantic search could largely reduce the efforts related to finding appropriate answers in biomedical articles .', u'In this paper we identify challenges related to building a semantic publication search engine .', u'Then we describe the architecture and usage principles of a tool tackling them .', u"Eventually , we report on the tool 's deployment on oncological literature data and preliminary tests with domain experts ."]

entities: [[(u'distributed open semantic elaboration platform', u'Method'), (u'modular multilingual enabled architecture', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'lexical entities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'search functions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'platform', u'Generic'), (u'services', u'Generic'), (u'semantic annotations', u'Method'), (u'document substructures', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'external annotation repository', u'Method'), (u'XPath and XPointer technologies', u'Method'), (u'known ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'lexical representation of concept classes', u'Method'), (u'semantic search engine', u'Method'), (u'document fragments', u'Material')], [(u'Annotated resources', u'Material'), (u'dynamic documents', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'The paper proposes a distributed open semantic elaboration platform based on a modular multilingual enabled architecture , which includes ontology , annotations , lexical entities and search functions .', u'The platform is implemented as a distributed set of services including : semantic annotations for document substructures ( e.g .', u'chapters , sections , paragraphs ) , an external annotation repository ( based on XPath and XPointer technologies ) that is automatically populated starting from a known ontology and a lexical representation of concept classes , and a semantic search engine used to extract and recombine relevant document fragments .', u'Annotated resources may be XML or XHTML static or dynamic documents , and need not be stored nor modified .', u'Preliminary experimental results are presented to show the feasibility and the advantages of the proposed approach .']

entities: [[], [(u'geographic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed Spatial Data Infrastructures', u'Material')], [(u'this', u'Generic'), (u'semantic heterogeneity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'users query', u'Material'), (u'semantic referencing', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Geographic Information ( GI ) metadata', u'Material')], [(u'ontology based semantic enhanced model', u'Method'), (u'GI metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'semantic search', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'Task'), (u'spatial information retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'integrated model', u'Method'), (u'domain information extraction', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'A lot of information on the web is geographically referenced .', u'Discovering and retrieving this geographic information to satisfy various users needs across both open and distributed Spatial Data Infrastructures ( SDI ) poses eminent research challenges .', u'However , this is mostly caused by semantic heterogeneity in users query and lack of semantic referencing of the Geographic Information ( GI ) metadata .', u'To addressing these challenges , this paper discusses ontology based semantic enhanced model , which explicitly represents GI metadata , and provides linked RDF instances of each entity .', u'The system focuses on semantic search , ontology , and efficient spatial information retrieval .', u'In particular , an integrated model that uses specific domain information extraction to improve the searching and retrieval of ranked spatial search results .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'guided route', u'USED-FOR', u'search space')], [(u'Linked Open Data', u'USED-FOR', u'exploratory semantic search'), (u'Linked Open Data', u'USED-FOR', u'video data')], [(u'Linked Open Data', u'USED-FOR', u'keyword-based search')]]
sentences: [u'Keyword-based search in general is particularly applicable if the searcher really knows what she is looking for and how to find it .', u'But in many cases either the objectives of the searcher are intrinsically fuzzy or she has no idea of the appropriate keywords .', u'One way to solve this problem is to navigate and explore the search space along a guided route .', u'In this paper we show , how Linked Open Data can be adopted to facilitate an exploratory semantic search for video data .', u'We present a prototype implementation of exploratory video search and give first results that show how traditional keyword-based search can be augmented by the use of Linked Open Data .']

sentences: [u'One of the core aims of semantic search is to directly present users with information instead of lists of documents .', u'Various entity-oriented tasks have been or are being considered , including entity search and related entity finding .', u'In the context of digital libraries for computational humanities , we consider another task , network extraction : given an input entity and a document collection , extract related entities from the collection and present them as a network .', u'We develop a combined approach for entity network extraction that consists of a co-occurrence- based approach to association finding and a machine learning-based approach to relation extraction .', u'We evaluate our approach by comparing the results on a ground truth obtained using a pooling method .']

sentences: [u'Establishing an appropriate semantic overlay on Peer-to-Peer networks to obtain both semantic ability and scalability is a challenge .', u'Current DHT-based P2P networks are limited in their ability to support semantic search .', u'This paper proposes the DST ( Distributed Suffix Tree ) overlay as the intermediate layer between the DHT overlay and the semantic overlay .', u'The DST overlay supports search of keyword sequences .', u'Its time cost is sub-linear with the length of the keyword sequences .', u'Using a common interface , the DST overlay is independent of the variation of the underlying DHT overlays .', u'Analysis and experiments show that DST-based search is fast , load-balanced , and useful in realizing accurate content search on large networks .']

entities: [[(u'language technology-based e-science', u'Task'), (u'humanities', u'Material'), (u'text-based research', u'Task'), (u'historical sciences', u'Material')], [(u'lexical and morphological toolbox', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantically oriented text search applications', u'Task'), (u'Swedish text', u'Material')], [(u'semantic search prototype', u'Method'), (u'REST web services', u'Method'), (u'digitized 19th century novels', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'historical sciences', u'FEATURE-OF', u'text-based research')], [(u'lexical and morphological toolbox', u'USED-FOR', u'semantically oriented text search applications'), (u'semantically oriented text search applications', u'USED-FOR', u'historical research'), (u'Swedish text', u'USED-FOR', u'semantically oriented text search applications')], [(u'REST web services', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search prototype')]]
sentences: [u'We present our ongoing work on language technology-based e-science in the humanities , with a focus on text-based research in the historical sciences .', u'Currently , we are working on the adaptation and integration of lexical resources representing different historical stages of Swedish into a lexical and morphological toolbox that will allow us to develop semantically oriented text search applications for historical research on Swedish text .', u'We describe a semantic search prototype which was built using REST web services from this toolbox as components , and which has been evaluated by historians interested in using digitized 19th century novels as primary data for an historical investigation of the emerging consumer society in 19th century Sweden .']

entities: [[(u'Embodiments', u'Task'), (u'targeted advertising', u'Task'), (u'indexed semantic user profiles', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic user profiles', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'extraction of online user behavior data', u'Task'), (u'user search queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'page views', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user interest information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user behavior', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic user profiles', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic search terms', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic profiles', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ranking model', u'Method'), (u'machine learning', u'Method')], [(u'indexing of semantic profiles', u'Task'), (u'ranking model', u'Method'), (u'online processing of queries', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'extraction of online user behavior data', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic user profiles'), (u'user search queries', u'CONJUNCTION', u'page views')], [], [(u'machine learning', u'USED-FOR', u'ranking model')], []]
sentences: [u'Embodiments facilitate greater flexibility in definition of user segments for targeted advertising , by employing indexed semantic user profiles .', u'Semantic user profiles are built through extraction of online user behavior data such as user search queries and page views , and include user interest information that is inferred based on user behavior .', u'Semantic user profiles are then indexed to facilitate search for a set of users that fit specified semantic search terms .', u'Search results for semantic profiles are ranked according to a ranking model developed through machine learning .', u'In some embodiments , building and indexing of semantic profiles and learning of the ranking model is performed offline to facilitate more efficient online processing of queries .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Complex querying', u'CONJUNCTION', u'enhanced semantic search'), (u'Complex querying', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic search'), (u'semantic search', u'USED-FOR', u'image retrieval systems')], [(u'ontology driven framework', u'USED-FOR', u'image retrieval')], []]
sentences: [u'Ontology based retrieval is gaining popularity due to the limitation posed by the conventional bag-of-words retrieval system .', u'To semantically search for images , textual descriptions are usually used since low level features provide little meaningful information .', u'As such conventional searching and retrieving of images are currently being employed .', u'Complex querying and enhanced semantic search still remain the issues to be solved in image retrieval systems .', u'We proposed an ontology driven framework for supporting image retrieval with particular emphasis on the sport news domain .', u'Furthermore , we look into the possibility how multimodality ontology can be integrated in the framework and shows how open knowledge-bases such as the DBpedia play an important role in this area .']

entities: [[(u'PORTAL-DOORS system', u'Method'), (u'resource metadata management system', u'Method'), (u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'automated searches of online resources', u'Task')], [(u'PDS', u'Method')], [(u'PDS-compliant concept-validating registry', u'Method'), (u'hypothesis-exploring ontology', u'Method'), (u'focal-onset dementias', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic search of resources', u'Task'), (u'neurodegeneration', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SOLOMON', u'Method'), (u'PDS registries', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'BrainWatch', u'Material'), (u'ManRay', u'Material'), (u'GeneScene', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'automated searches of online resources', u'CONJUNCTION', u'meta-analyses of published literature')], [], [(u'PDS-compliant concept-validating registry', u'CONJUNCTION', u'hypothesis-exploring ontology'), (u'PDS-compliant concept-validating registry', u'USED-FOR', u'focal-onset dementias')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search of resources')], [(u'GeneScene', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'PDS registries'), (u'GeneScene', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontologies')]]
sentences: [u'The PORTAL-DOORS system ( PDS ) has been designed as a resource metadata management system intended to support applications such as automated searches of online resources and meta-analyses of published literature .', u'PDS comprises a network of Problem Oriented Registry of Tags and Labels ( PORTAL ) lexical registries and Domain Ontology Oriented Resource System ( DOORS ) semantic directories .', u'Here we introduce a PDS-compliant concept-validating registry and hypothesis-exploring ontology that organizes focal-onset dementias including Sensory-Onset , Language-Onset and Motor-ONset ( SOLOMON ) dementias with novel classifying and relating concepts .', u'This approach facilitates semantic search of resources and exploration of hypotheses related to neurodegeneration .', u'SOLOMON interoperates with other PDS registries and ontologies including BrainWatch , ManRay and GeneScene .']

sentences: [u'In this paper we present a mobile application based on a hybrid multi-objective genetic algorithm and Natural Language Processing that can be used by tourists to smartly generate itineraries .', u'Besides allowing users to find interesting Points of Interest based on highly detailed information , the semantic search approach is also capable of providing recommendation without requiring a lot of information regarding the current user .', u'A multi-objective genetic algorithm has been used in order to find Pareto-optimal solutions in near real-time for the itinerary problem .', u'The proposed system requires minimum input from the user and it is easy to use , thus we can state that our solution is both complex and at the same time user-oriented .']

entities: [[(u'Collaborative filtering', u'Method'), (u'CF )', u'Method'), (u'recommender systems', u'Method'), (u'RS )', u'Method')], [(u'CF', u'Method'), (u'data sparseness', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u"CF ca n't", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Web applications', u'Task'), (u'urban computing', u'Task'), (u'schedule planning', u'Method'), (u'recommendation framework', u'Method'), (u'CF', u'Method'), (u'case-based reasoning', u'Method'), (u'CBR', u'Method'), (u'RS', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'semantic search demo systemMyVisit', u'Method'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'recommendation model', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Collaborative filtering ( CF ) as an effective method of recommender systems ( RS ) has been widely used in online stores .', u'However , CF suffers some weaknesses : problems with new users ( cold start ) , data sparseness , difficulty in spotting malicious or unreliable users and so on .', u"Additionally CF ca n't recommend different type items at the same time .", u'So in order to make it adaptive new Web applications , such as urban computing , visit schedule planning and so on , the authors introduce a new recommendation framework , which combines CF and case-based reasoning ( CBR ) to improve performance of RS .', u'Based on this framework , the authors have developed a semantic search demo systemMyVisit , which shows that our proposed framework is an effective recommendation model .']

entities: [[(u'VENIS', u'Method'), (u'Small/Medium Enterprise', u'Task'), (u'Micro Enterprise ( ME )', u'Task')], [(u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'enterprise search', u'Task'), (u'enterprise interoperability', u'Task'), (u'lightweight semantic approach', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'SMEs', u'Method'), (u'MEs', u'Method'), (u'LEs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'hidden knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'enterprise ecosystem', u'Task'), (u'emails', u'Material'), (u'CMS', u'Material')], [(u'Lightweight Semantics approach', u'Method'), (u'semantic search and recommendation', u'Task'), (u'business workflows', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'interoperability tasks', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'In this paper we present an ongoing FP7 project VENIS , where we are focusing on interoperability problems between Large Enterprise ( LE ) and Small/Medium Enterprise ( SME ) as well as Micro Enterprise ( ME ) .', u'We are proposing a solution for the enterprise search and enterprise interoperability , which follows the lightweight semantic approach .', u'This approach is more suitable for SMEs and MEs , which are not always able to adopt heavy and more expensive solutions used by LEs .', u'We are trying to discover hidden knowledge stored in every of the involved enterprise ecosystem , mainly in emails and CMS ( documents ) .', u'Our Lightweight Semantics approach ( LWS ) is able to provide a semantic search and recommendation to support users inside business workflows to fulfill interoperability tasks .']

sentences: [u'Through the study on semantic similarity in e-commerce semantic search , this paper comes up with an approach for construction of upper-level ontology structure in the field of e-commerce and a new method for computation of semantic similarity between information content and concept node link distance .', u'Semantic feature vectors of information from web pages are extracted by making use of the upper-level ontology structure and relevant feedback-based retrieval approaches .', u'The semantic similarity relation between query conditions and document information is determined through the semantic feature vectors of documents and the similarity function which is based on the upper-level ontology structure , and this approach is applied in commercial information search .']

sentences: [u'Changes are taking place in scientific research .', u'In particular , there is a greater collaboration among groups of researchers , which leads to an increase use of information processing techniques , and a need to share results .', u'Using peer-to-peer networks and semantic web , we create an access point to share distributed knowledge and scientific applications , where scientists can work with heterogeneous information in scientific communities according to their interests .', u'This paper presents the e-ScienceNet , an architecture to creation of scientific communities in the context of semantic e-Science , facilitating the creation and sharing of scientific data and services .', u'Beyond of presents the e-ScienceNet prototype .', u'2013 Published by Elsevier Ltd .', u'Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of CENTERIS/ProjMAN/HCIST .']

relations: [[], [(u'medical personnel', u'USED-FOR', u'backend services')], [(u'personal data inclusion', u'PART-OF', u'healthcare system')], [], [(u'generic health services', u'FEATURE-OF', u'personal mobile data')], [], [(u'smart spaces paradigm', u'USED-FOR', u'service intelligence')]]
sentences: [u"Mobile health ( m-Health ) scenarios form an important direction for enhancing `` traditional '' healthcare systems .", u'The latter implement backend services for use primarily by medical personnel and typically at hospitals .', u"Current development meets with the challenge of personal data inclusion to the whole healthcare system with subse- quent `` smart '' service construction and delivery .", u'This paper makes a step towards the concept development of intelligence support in person- alized m-Health systems .', u'We study a reference architectural model that aims at intelligent utilization of personal mobile data in generic health services .', u"Each personalized m-Health system contains the patient 's med- ical sensor network ( MSN ) .", u'To support the service intelligence we employ the smart spaces paradigm with its prominent technologies adopted from the Internet of Things ( IoT ) and Semantic Web .']

sentences: [u'To promote the collaborative assembly the degree of intelligence and automation , a collaborative assembly relation model based on ontology is proposed .', u'By ontology definitions of domain concepts and property relationships , the hierarchical composition intent of joint feature , mating feature and space constraint relationship intent in assembly design was formally represented .', u'The assembly automatic inference is realized by Ontology Web Language ( OWL ) and Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) .', u'The assembly information is dynamically acquired based on collaborative assembly relation model , and implicit constraint relation is acquired too .', u'The collaborative assembly relation model based on ontology provides a uniform framework for collaborative assembly .', u'The example shows that , the collaborative assembly of parts and components are realized among heterogeneous CAD systems in this framework .']

sentences: [u'Semantic Web is envisioned as semantic description of data and services enabling unambiguous computerized interpretation .', u'Thanks to semantic description , computers can perform demanding tasks such as automation of discovery and access to heterogeneous data sources .', u'Although this is possible with the existing technologies , combination of web services technology , ontologies and generative programming methods makes this simpler and more efficient .', u'This paper presents the model for dynamic generation of web services for data retrieval from heterogeneous data sources using ontologies .', u'Emphasis is on dynamic generation of web services customized to a particular user based on the request defined by ontology .', u'The paper also describes a prototype of the model implementation .', u'Some advantages of our approach over other approaches are also provided .']

entities: [[(u'context-aware system', u'Task'), (u'ontology concept', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge sharing', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'syntactic and semantic interoperability', u'Task')], [(u'Context-Aware Service Engine', u'Method'), (u'Ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'hierarchies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'context ontology context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'post web', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'To offer a semantically suitable service for user in context-aware system , ontology concept is needed .', u'By using the ontology , it is possible to provide knowledge sharing and support for syntactic and semantic interoperability .', u'In this paper , we propose the Context-Aware Service Engine based on Ontology .', u'As we use ontology , our system has the following useful aspects .', u'First , our system can describe types , hierarchies , relations of contexts , so that any context instance can be accommodated into the system with no additional effort .', u"Seconds , as we design two level 's ontology , any system which uses ontology could reuse our context ontology context in pervasive environment .", u'Three , our system could be applied to semantic web which is called a revolution of a post web and could provide interoperability .']

sentences: [u'AAAI presented the AAAI-04 workshop program on July 25-26 , 2004 in San Jose , California .', u'This program included twelve workshops covering a wide range of topics in artificial intelligence .', u'The titles of the workshops were as follows : ( 1 ) Adaptive Text Extraction and Mining ; ( 2 ) Agent Organizations : Theory and Practice ; ( 3 ) Anchoring Symbols to Sensor Data ; ( 4 ) Challenges in Game AI ; ( 5 ) Fielding Applications of Artificial Intelligence ; ( 6 ) Forming and Maintaining Coalitions in Adaptive Multiagent Systems ; ( 7 ) Intelligent Agent Architectures : Combining the Strengths of Software Engineering and Cognitive Systems ; ( 8 ) Learning and Planning in Markov Processes -- Advances and Challenges ; ( 9 ) Semantic Web Personalization ; ( 10 ) Sensor Networks ; ( 11 ) Spatial and Temporal Reasoning ; and ( 12 ) Supervisory Control of Learning and Adaptive Systems .']

sentences: [u'Aligning ontology is the process that aims to make various sources of interoperable knowledge .', u'This process is much needed in applications of the semantic web .', u'The algorithms alignment design ( mapping , matching ) is a relatively new area of research .', u'Manually , determining terms that are semantically close in different ontology is a laborious and error-prone process .', u'The automatic generation of correspondence between two ontologies is extremely delicate .', u'This difficulty results from the conceptual differences that come from several developments of communities .', u'Our goal in this work is to propose an alignment algorithm of two ontologies for the same domain based on different techniques with the use of WordNet as a complementary resource and the introduction of a new structural measure outcome of related work .']

sentences: [u'This paper reviewed the proposition , development and implementation of the model composition function in decision support systems ( DSS ) .A survey of distributed model management and model composition was given , and multiple model composition methods were compared.Due to the emergence of Web Service technology , and the innovative application of both of the semantic Web and AI planning fields , the automatic composition of DSS models is possible.But some problems also exist.The distributed model composition methods mainly learn from the automatic Web service composition , and models are encapsulated into Web services.The problem of model composition is converted to Web service composition.However , model composition has its own characteristics that the traditional automatic Web service composition methods are not fully applicable , for example the direct composition of qualitative and quantitative models .']

sentences: [u'We present RDF On the Go , a full-fledged RDF storage and SPARQL query processor for mobile devices .', u"Implemented by adapting the widely used Jena and ARQ Semantic Web Toolkit and query engine , it uses Berkeley DB for storing the RDF data , R-Trees for indexing spatial data indexing and a query processor that supports both standard and spatial queries. # R # # N # # R # # N # By storing and querying RDF data locally at the user 's mobile device , RDF On the Go contributes to improving scalability , decreasing transmission costs , and controlling access to user 's personal information .", u'It also enables the development of a next generation of mobile applications .', u'RDF On the Go is available for the Android platform and can be downloaded at http : //rdfonthego.googlecode.com/ .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Question Answering', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'formal query language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'natural language', u'Material'), (u'SQA', u'Method')], [], [(u'SQA systems', u'Method'), (u'predefined inclusion and exclusion criteria', u'Metric')], [(u'structure solutions', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[(u'SPARQL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'formal query language')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic Question Answering ( SQA ) removes two major access requirements to the Semantic Web : the mastery of a formal query language like SPARQL and knowledge of a specific vocabulary .', u'Because of the complexity of natural language , SQA presents difficult challenges and many research opportunities .', u"Instead of a shared effort , however , many essential components are redeveloped , which is an inefficient use of researcher 's time and resources .", u'This survey analyzes 62 different SQA systems , which are systematically and manually selected using predefined inclusion and exclusion criteria , leading to 70 selected publications out of 1960 candidates .', u'We identify common challenges , structure solutions , and provide recommendations for future systems .', u'This work is based on publications from the end of 2010 to July 2015 and is also compared to older but similar surveys .']

sentences: [u'The semantic sensor Web is an integration of sensor network techniques , distributed computation techniques , database management techniques and semantic Web techniques.They can be used for sensing , collecting , integrating information , deriving additional knowledge and providing enhanced meaning for sensor observations so as to enable situation awareness.Users can conveniently access this information by visiting the Web interface.The semantic sensor Web is a new research area of computer science and technology with a wide application prospects.Both academia and industries are very interested in it.The concepts and characteristics of the semantic sensor Web were introduced , and the issues of the data management of the semantic sensor Web were discussed.The advance of the research on the semantic sensor Web , especially the data management , was also presented .']

entities: [[(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology stream', u'Task'), (u'fixed ontology', u'Method'), (u'time-evolving ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'anomaly', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'evolution of diagnoses representations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'graph-based representation', u'Method'), (u'scalable exploration', u'Task')], [(u'real and live data', u'Material'), (u'Dublin City', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'graph-based representation', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], []]
sentences: [u'Diagnosis , or the process of identifying the nature and cause of an anomaly in an ontology , has been largely studied by the Semantic Web community .', u'In the context of ontology stream , diagnosis results are not captured by a unique fixed ontology but numerous time-evolving ontologies .', u'Thus any anomaly can be diagnosed by a large number of different explanations depending on the version and evolution of the ontology .', u'We address the problems of identifying , representing , exploiting and exploring the evolution of diagnoses representations .', u'Our approach consists in a graph-based representation , which aims at ( i ) efficiently organizing and linking time-evolving diagnoses and ( ii ) being used for scalable exploration .', u'The experiments have shown scalable diagnoses exploration in the context of real and live data from Dublin City .']

entities: [[(u'Relational database', u'Material'), (u'agricultural information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'Web , relational database', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'XML format', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'agriculture animal disease information database', u'Material'), (u'XML document structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Java design mapping algorithm', u'Method'), (u'poultry disease relational database', u'Material'), (u'XML data format', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Relational database', u'USED-FOR', u'information retrieval'), (u'agricultural information', u'USED-FOR', u'information retrieval')]]
sentences: [u'Relational database is now the main form of agricultural information stored.But complexity of information retrieval becomes more complex with the development of Web , relational database need to be better understood by Web , which needs more semantic supports.To solve the problem , XML format can be used to express and store data documents.This paper takes common agriculture animal disease information database for example , by comparing the two kinds of data forms to find out the advantages of XML document structure and use the Java design mapping algorithm , maps some parts of the contents of the existing poultry disease relational database to the XML data format , shows the superiority of this way , lay the foundation for the future semantic Web construction of agriculture animal and vegetation diseases .']

sentences: [u'A design pattern is a general reusable solution to a commonly occurring problem in software design .', u'It provides a template for solving a problem and can be used in many different situations .', u'Design patterns help designers to reuse successful designs by basing new designs on prior experience .', u'This research proposes a framework for generating UML sequence diagrams from requirements specified in the form of operation contracts , using design patterns as expert knowledge .', u'Design patterns are represented using Ontology Web Language ( OWL ) and Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) .', u'From input operation contracts and class diagrams , which are also represented in OWL , Jess Rule Engine is used for execution of SWRL rules to derive output sequence diagrams .', u'An application of the framework is demonstrated .']

entities: [[(u'reasoning paradigms', u'Method'), (u'artificial intelligence', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'expressive knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'paradigms', u'Generic'), (u'Description Logics', u'Method'), (u'Logic Programming', u'Method')], [], [(u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'( function-free non-disjunctive ) Datalog', u'Method'), (u'DLP', u'Method')], [(u'DLP', u'Method'), (u'Description Logic syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Datalog syntax', u'Material'), (u'paradigms', u'Generic')], [(u'mal forms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DLP', u'Method'), (u'teaching and dissemination purposes', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'knowledge representation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reasoning paradigms')], [(u'expressive knowledge representation', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web'), (u'Logic Programming', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'paradigms')], [], [], [(u'Description Logic syntax', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Datalog syntax')], [(u'mal forms', u'USED-FOR', u'DLP'), (u'DLP', u'USED-FOR', u'teaching and dissemination purposes')]]
sentences: [u'The relationship and possible interplay between different knowledge representation and reasoning paradigms is a fundamental topic in artificial intelligence .', u'For expressive knowledge representation for the Semantic Web , two different paradigms - namely Description Logics ( DLs ) and Logic Programming - are the two most successful approaches .', u'A study of their exact relationships is thus paramount .', u'An intersection of OWL with ( function-free non-disjunctive ) Datalog , called DLP ( for Description Logic Programs ) , has been described in ( 1 , 2 ) .', u'We provide normal forms for DLP in Description Logic syntax and in Datalog syntax , thus providing a bridge for the researcher and user who is familiar with either of these paradigms .', u'We argue that our nor- mal forms are the most convenient way to define DLP for teaching and dissemination purposes .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'tasks', u'Generic'), (u'visual interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'interfaces', u'Generic'), (u'interaction support', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'analytical degrees of freedom', u'Metric')], [(u'SemLens', u'Method'), (u'visual tool', u'Method'), (u'scatter plots', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic lenses', u'Method'), (u'RDF data', u'Material')], [(u'scatter plots', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'object collection', u'Task'), (u'visual discovery of correlations', u'Task')], [(u'semantic lenses', u'Method'), (u'local analysis of subsets of the objects', u'Task')], [(u'illustration', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'interfaces', u'USED-FOR', u'interaction support')], [(u'SemLens', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'visual tool'), (u'scatter plots', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic lenses')], [], [(u'semantic lenses', u'USED-FOR', u'local analysis of subsets of the objects')], [(u'accessing DBpedia data', u'USED-FOR', u'illustration')]]
sentences: [u'Querying the Semantic Web and analyzing the query results are often complex tasks that can be greatly facilitated by visual interfaces .', u'A major challenge in the design of these interfaces is to provide intuitive and efficient interaction support without limiting too much the analytical degrees of freedom .', u'This paper introduces SemLens , a visual tool that combines scatter plots and semantic lenses to overcome this challenge and to allow for a simple yet powerful analysis of RDF data .', u'The scatter plots provide a global overview on an object collection and support the visual discovery of correlations and patterns in the data .', u'The semantic lenses add dimensions for local analysis of subsets of the objects .', u'A demo accessing DBpedia data is used for illustration .']

sentences: [u'Integration process of data is recently recognized like a significant visualization of the Semantic Web explore for which researchers focus on numerous areas , such as integration of information , ontologies and databases .', u'Objectives : Users generally requires an incorporated analysis of information accessible from various data and it was proposed to grant users with this view of data .', u'Methods : The Meta data is created from different data sets like excel data set , RDF data set and XML data set .', u'Findings : In this work a survey was made for integrating databases using ontology and a new approach for integration of databases is devised for finding correspondence between ontologies .', u'Applications : View and Search functionality was provided by filtering data from Meta data .', u'This provides easy access to the integrated data .']

sentences: [u'The object of the research is the model of information exchange between potential users of the system such as employers and potential employees .', u'Purposes of the work is public web service prototype which would provide an easy and understandable way of information exchange between potential users of the system such as employers and employees .', u'The main aim of the project in concern is a thorough analysis of methods and technologies available as a part of the semantic web concept .', u'Other goals include application of the investigated techniques to a-real-world-task of information sharing system in the particular area of labour market .', u'It is supposed to develop a public web service prototype .', u'Results of the research can be used for integration of automatic informational analytical systems .']

sentences: [u'Abstract .', u'In the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations ( FAO ) , the need to revamp its popular agriculture vocabulary AGROVOC using Semantic Web knowledge representation standards combined with the need to provide a collaborative environment for development and maintenance purposes , pushed forward the realization of a dedicated AGROVOC thesaurus maintenance tool .', u'With the progressive standardization of the AGROVOC knowledge model , following recent Simple Knowledge Organization System ( SKOS ) recommendations by the World Wide Web Consortium ( W3C ) and with the addition of more FAO-maintained vocabularies , the former AGROVOC Concept Server Workbench has become a general-purpose framework for thesauri and vocabulary development and is now reborn as VocBench .', u'In this paper , we describe the path which led to its realization and its main features']

sentences: [u'A new generation of intelligent technologies such as Semantic Web , multi-agent systems , and Web ontologies are emerging rapidly as the next force for change , innovation , and opportunity in the information-technology realm .', u'Intelligent Information Technologies : Concepts , Methodologies , Tools , and Applications compiles more than 240 chapters from the world s leading experts to provide a foundational body of research to drive further evolution and innovation of these next-generation technologies and their applications , of which the scientific , technological , and commercial communities have only begun to scratch the surface .', u'Comprehensively covering leading-edge developments such as artificial intelligence , virtual environments , and multi-media information processing , this vast , four-volume collection is an essential reference acquisition for any library seeking to cover the leading edge of technological innovations .']

sentences: [u'Recently semantic web is an important issue in many areas .', u'Ontology specifies the knowledge in a specific domain and defines the concepts of knowledge and the relationships between concepts .', u'To specify and define the knowledge in a specific domain , it is required to generate the ontology which conceptualizes the knowledge .', u'Accordingly , to search the information of potential customers for home-delivery marketing of post office , we design a specific domain to generate the ontology in this paper .', u'And we propose how to retrieve the information , using the generated ontology .', u'We also implement the data search robot which collects the information based on the generated ontology .', u'Therefore we confirm that the ontology and the search robot perform the information retrieval exactly .']

sentences: [u'We describe a new smart meeting room system called EasyMeeting that explores the use of FIPA agent technologies , Semantic Web ontologies , logic reasoning , and security and privacy policies .', u'Building on a pervasive computing system that we have developed previously , EasyMeeting can provide relevant services and information to meeting participants based on their situational needs .', u'Our system exploits the context-aware support provided by the Context Broker Architecture ( CoBrA ) .', u'Central to CoBrA is an intelligent broker agent that maintains a shared model of context for all computing entities in the space and enforces the privacy policies defined by the users .', u'We also describe the use of CoBrA ontologies , logic reasoning , and privacy protection mechanisms , and evaluate our initial user experience studies .']

sentences: [u'Representing knowledge with the use of ontology description languages offers several advantages arising from knowledge reusability , possibilities of carrying out reasoning processes and the use of existing concepts of knowledge integration .', u'In this work we are going to present an environment for the integration of knowledge expressed in such a way .', u'Guaranteeing knowledge integration is an important element during the development of the Semantic Web .', u'Thanks to this , it is possible to obtain access to services which offer knowledge contained in various distributed databases associated with semantically described web portals .', u'We will present the advantages of the multi-agent approach while solving this problem .', u'Then , we will describe an example of its application in systems supporting company management knowledge in the process of constructing supply-chains .']

relations: [[(u'OWL', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic Web'), (u'OWL.It', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'rule description language'), (u'rule markup', u'USED-FOR', u'plane geometry'), (u'SWRL rules', u'USED-FOR', u'plane geometry'), (u'SWRL rules.At', u'USED-FOR', u'plane geometry')]]
sentences: [u'OWL has now become a major modeling-building language of semantic Web because of its strong ability of knowledge representation.Nevertheless , there are a lot of inadequate in its reasoning.Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) is developed to compensate for the lack of OWL.It is a rule description language based on OWL DL , an OWL sublanguage , and other rule markup languages.Applying SWRL rules to OWL DL can improve the reasoning ability of OWL DL dramatically.Introduces an application of SWRL rules and Jess reasoner in the proof in plane geometry.It solves a given proving problem of plane geometry by using the reasoner.The result verifies the validity of SWRL rules.At the same time , also found some problems of SWRL in practice , pending further research in the future .']

sentences: [u'In order to support effective and smooth recognition of the intentions embedded within texts shared by multiple knowledge agents ( e.g .', u'humans or knowledge systems ) , this paper systematizes knowledge about performative verbs , which is considered as a verb to indicate speaker intentions , and proposes an intention reference system .', u'The system enables two kinds of references ; ( a ) a reference of the cognitive elements of intention and ( b ) a reference of intentions with cognitive elements .', u"Consequently , it becomes easy to share the text addressor 's intention at least in the group even in the text-based communications on the Web .", u'In addition to semantic web that tags the semantic content of the text , tagging the action of the text expects to realize more smoothly text communication with less misunderstanding .']

sentences: [u'With the proliferation of Web services and the evolution towards the Semantic Web comes the opportunity to automate various Web services tasks .', u'A number of approaches have been proposed to tackle the problem of automatic web service composition .', u'Most of them are inspired by the researches in AI planning .', u'As heuristics plays a key role in the promotion of planning efficiency , the selection of heuristic mechanism is very important .', u'In this paper , we propose the conception of composition distance , and propose a heuristic bidirectional search algorithm based on composition distance .', u'The most contribution of this paper is : ( 1 ) propose the conception of composition distance ; ( 2 ) a heuristic bidirectional search algorithm .', u'The algorithm we proposed is effective and efficiency when applied in web service composition engine .']

sentences: [u'Currently , we use many definitions with diffuse boundaries : Web 2.0 ( Social Networks ) , Web 3.0 ( Semantic Web ) , Web 3D ( Metaverses , Virtual Worlds , Mirror Worlds ) , Recommendation Systems , Augmented Reality , Geo-location ...', u'In this paper we explore the possibilities of the combined use of these concepts , we introduce the concept of VARD ( Virtual Augmented Reality Device ) and show interoperability between recommendation systems and Virtual Worlds .', u'We have developed a Recommendation System which have two ways of interaction with the virtual world of Second Life in connection with context spatial-temporal information : an active recommendation system , called TESLAR , that interacts with avatars by a 2D HUD VARD object , and a passive and automatic recommendation system , called MarvinBot , that interacts with avatars by a Metabot VARD .']

sentences: [u'Producing reliable information is the ultimate goal of data processing .', u'The ocean of data created with the advances of science and technologies calls for integration of data coming from heterogeneous sources that are diverse in their purposes , business rules , underlying models and enabling technologies .', u'Reference models , Semantic Web , standards , ontology , and other technologies enable fast and efficient merging of heterogeneous data , while the reliability of produced information is largely defined by how well the data represent the reality .', u'In this paper , we initiate a framework for assessing the informational value of data that includes data dimensions ; aligning data quality with business practices ; identifying authoritative sources and integration keys ; merging models ; uniting updates of varying frequency and overlapping or gapped data sets .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic query optimization', u'Method'), (u'SQO )', u'Method'), (u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'data integration', u'Task'), (u'graphical query generators', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'caching', u'Task')], [], [(u'SQO', u'Method')], [(u'sound and complete algorithms', u'Method')], [(u'RDF/S query fragments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pattern matching', u'Task'), (u'schema level', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'logic framework', u'Method'), (u'RDF/S data model', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'techniques', u'Generic'), (u'relational context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Chase and Backchase algorithms', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Semantic query optimization ( SQO ) has been proved to be quite useful in various applications ( e.g. , data integration , graphical query generators , caching , etc . )', u'and has been extensively studied for relational , deductive , object , and XML databases .', u'However , less attention to SQO has been devoted in the context of the Semantic Web .', u'In this paper , we present sound and complete algorithms for the containment and minimization of RDF/S query patterns .', u'More precisely , we consider two widely used RDF/S query fragments supporting pattern matching at the data , but also , at the schema level .', u'To this end , we advocate a logic framework for capturing the RDF/S data model and semantics and we employ well-established techniques proposed in the relational context , in particular , the Chase and Backchase algorithms .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'syntactic and semantic levels', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'digital content components', u'Method'), (u'Software Engineering software component', u'Method'), (u'components', u'Generic'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'composition', u'Task'), (u'application domains', u'Generic'), (u'education', u'Task'), (u'agro-environmental planning', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'interoperability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'composition'), (u'composition', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'application domains'), (u'education', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'application domains'), (u'education', u'CONJUNCTION', u'agro-environmental planning'), (u'agro-environmental planning', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'application domains')]]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web pursues interoperability at syntactic and semantic levels , to face the proliferation of data files with different purposes and representation formats One challenge is how to represent such data , to allow users and applications to easily find , use and combine them The paper proposes an infrastructure to meet those goals The basis of the proposal is the notion of digital content components that extends the Software Engineering software component The infrastructure offers tools to combine and extend these components , upon user request , managing them within dynamic repositories The infrastructure adopt XML and RDF standards to foster interoperability , composition , adaptation and documentation of content data This work was motivated by reuse needs observed in two specific application domains : education and agro-environmental planning .']

entities: [[(u"Individual Patient 's File", u'Material')], [(u'IPF', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'IPFs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'collections', u'Generic'), (u'medical Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'analysis', u'Generic'), (u'Bernoulli variables', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'medical hypotheses', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reliabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'They', u'Generic'), (u'production rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'medical Rule-Based Systems', u'Method'), (u'automatic reasoning', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'medical Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'collections')], [], [], [(u'production rules', u'USED-FOR', u'They'), (u'medical Rule-Based Systems', u'USED-FOR', u'automatic reasoning')]]
sentences: [u"An Individual Patient 's File ( IPF ) includes information about a patient and the course of his illness over many years .", u'During this period , the doctor , taking permanent care of the patient , puts various data and observations into his IPF .', u'In the paper we propose a kind of probabilistic and statistical analysis of the data stored in collections of IPFs .', u'The collections can be made accessible by means of a medical Semantic Web .', u'The proposed analysis requires the data to be expressed in the form of Bernoulli variables .', u'As a result , it gives us medical hypotheses , with their premises-facts , conclusions and reliabilities .', u'They can be presented in the form of production rules , used in medical Rule-Based Systems for automatic reasoning .']

sentences: [u'Future services on converged heterogeneous networks are expected to increase the demand for code distribution on fly installment and dynamic management .', u'Component discovery , download , installation , revocation , and profiling are critical in supporting next-generation enabling technologies and application evolvement .', u'We present here the architecture of an active component manager and discuss metadata that should be used to describe components and their capabilities .', u'Furthermore , we elaborate on XML digital signatures as an integral part of secure component distribution .', u'Finally we investigate topologies for component distribution and how emerging technologies like peer-to-peer could be used in the context of active component manager .', u'This paper is motivated by the vision of Google-like code discovery , and flexible management of it , within the future semantic web context .']

relations: [[], [(u'geographical information systems', u'USED-FOR', u'big spatiotemporal data')], [], [(u'Semantic Web techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [(u'RDF vocabulary', u'USED-FOR', u'data sources'), (u'RDF vocabulary', u'USED-FOR', u'spatiotemporal observations')]]
sentences: [u'The recent technological advances in geospatial data collection have created massive data sets with better spatial and temporal resolution than ever .', u'To properly deal with these data sets , geographical information systems ( GIS ) must evolve to represent , access , analyze and visualize big spatiotemporal data in an efficient and integrated way .', u'In this paper , we highlight challenges in temporal GIS development and present a proposal to overcome one of them : how to access spatiotemporal data sets from distinct kinds of data sources .', u'Our approach uses Semantic Web techniques and is based on a data model that takes observations as basic units to represent spatiotemporal information from different application domains .', u'We define a RDF vocabulary for describing data sources that store or provide spatiotemporal observations .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web tool', u'Method'), (u'Global Health Explorer ( GHX )', u'Method'), (u'public health surveillance', u'Task'), (u'Twitter', u'Method')], [(u'controlled vocabulary', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Twitter', u'Material'), (u'hypothesis formation', u'Task'), (u'visual analysis', u'Method')], [(u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'term usage', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'temporal and spatial dimensions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'GHX', u'Method'), (u'qb.js framework', u'Method')], [(u'GHX', u'Method'), (u'pre-existing ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'public health surveillance', u'Task')], [(u'GHX', u'Method'), (u'NCI Thesaurus', u'Material'), (u'uenza-like illnesses', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Global Health Explorer ( GHX )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic web tool')], [(u'controlled vocabulary', u'USED-FOR', u'Twitter')], [], [(u'qb.js framework', u'USED-FOR', u'GHX')], [(u'GHX', u'USED-FOR', u'public health surveillance')], []]
sentences: [u'We demonstrate an early version of a semantic web tool , Global Health Explorer ( GHX ) , that can be used to conduct public health surveillance using Twitter .', u'Our infrastructure can use any controlled vocabulary to extract term uses in Twitter and supports hypothesis formation and exploration of data sets using visual analysis .', u'The resulting data , gathered in RDF , makes it possible to analyze term usage through both temporal and spatial dimensions .', u'GHX uses the qb.js framework to visualize and explore these data across dimensions , intially time and location .', u'This allows users of GHX to monitor terms from pre-existing ontologies to conduct public health surveillance .', u'We have prototyped the use of GHX to monitor terms from the NCI Thesaurus related to in uenza-like illnesses .']

sentences: [u"The Semantic Web is currently best known for adding metadata to web pages to allow computers to 'understand ' what they contain .", u'This idea has been applied to people by the Friend of a Friend project which builds up a network of who people know through their descriptions placed on web pages in RDF .', u'It is here proposed to use RDF to describe a person and to have their RDF document follow them around the Internet .', u"The proposed technique , dubbed Semantic Cookies , will be implemented by storing a user 's RDF in a cookie on their own computer through the browser .", u'This paper considers the concept of Semantic Cookies and investigates how far existing technology can be pushed to accommodate the idea .']

sentences: [u'Semantic web is a research project of the world wide web consortium ( W3C ) , which aims to solve the problem that the web data is hard to process automatically because ofthe lack of semantic.The objective of this project is to implement the intelligent reasoning and to process automatically for the information published in the web.As an intelligent object , agent is particularly suitable for lots of applications which are implemented in the semantic web.Based on the research of WWW and intelligent agent , combined with some technologies , such as information search , knowledge representation , modeling of Ontology , a multi-agent system framework is proposed and implemented on the basis of Ontology semantic information retrieval , which includes four parts : Information collecting , storing , querying and semantic reasoning .']

sentences: [u'The Semantic Web is an extension of the current web in which information is given well-defined meaning , better enabling computersr and people to work in cooperation .', u'Recently , different applications based on this vision have been designed , e.g .', u'in the fields of knowledge management , community web portals , e-learning , multimedia retrieval , etc .', u'It is obvious that the complex metadata descriptions generated on the basis of pre-defined ontologies serve as perfect input data for machine learning techniques .', u'In this paper we propose an approach for clustering ontology-based metadata .', u'Main contributions of this paper are the definition of a set of similarity measures for comparing ontology-based metadata and an application study using these measures within a hierarchical clustering algorithm .']

sentences: [u'Concept lattices have been widely used for various purposes in many different applications since the 1980s .', u'Recent applications of Formal Concept Analysis include extensions of traditional FCA applications such as data and text mining , machine learning and knowledge management .', u'Progress has also recently been made in software engineering , Semantic Web and databases .', u'New applications have also emerged in the fields of healthcare , ecology , biology , agronomy , business and social networks .', u'This article presents example of successful applications of FCA for Social Networks Analysis .', u'We show the benefit of FCA solutions , as well as their combination with semantics and topology-based approaches .', u'We conclude by presenting FCA-based visualization solutions and open challenges for FCA in the context of large and dynamic data .']

sentences: [u'In a distributed environment , non-technical stakeholders are required to write down requirement statements by themselves .', u'Nature language is the first choice for them .', u'In order to alleviate the burden of reading free-text requirement documents by requirements engineers , we extract goals and relevant stakeholders from requirement statements automatically by a computer-assisted way .', u'In this paper , requirements are divided into system level requirements and instance level requirements .', u'Methods are proposed to solve two types of requirements by analyzing the characteristics of requirement expressions , and combining techniques of nature language processing with semantic web .', u'Semantic-enhanced segment and domain sentence pattern are two novel techniques utilized in our methods .', u'Our approach accelerates goal extraction from text-based requirements and alleviates the burden of requirements engineers significantly .']

sentences: [u'Thesauri and other knowledge organization systems have been adapted to the technological environment .', u'Currently , this represents an essential aspect of knowledge organization on the semantic web .', u'After a long period in which thesaurus guidelines and standards were not updated , some have been revised by the governing organisations within the past five years .', u'Consensus among international experts has resulted in publication of the first part of an ISO standard for thesauri , which provides a data model and emphasizes the interoperability process .', u'This paper compiles the most relevant guidelines for thesauri published between the 80s and the ISO 25964 document .', u'We reflect on the most relevant characteristics in this evolution and explore the most recent applications of knowledge organization systems on the Web .']

sentences: [u'As a kind of modelling tool of describing knowledge framework based on semantics and knowledge , ontology provides a standardized description of concepts and lays a foundation for the sharing of knowledge .', u'This paper constructs a tourist information knowledge base body via ontology tools , and meanwhile makes s series of reasoning based on the constructed knowledge base .', u"Furthermore , one can manually construct inference rules to probe into the field of knowledge and complete the key objectives of the Semantic Web- '' machine-understandable . ''", u'For the uncertainty which can not be described by descriptive logic , this paper recommends the introduction of Bayesian networks , which can not only easily construct conditional probability tables , but can conduct a rapid reasoning of probability and finally provides people with a reasonable travel plan .']

sentences: [u'Ontology rule editing , testing , debugging and validation are still hand- crafted and painful tasks .', u'Nowadays , there is a lack of tools that take these tasks into consideration in order to ease the work of the developer .', u'This paper is devoted to explain how we have come to a new tool , ORE ( Ontology Rule Editor ) , which signifi- cantly eases these tasks .', u'It rests on a Semantic Web framework together with reasoning engines , which operate with semantic representations .', u'Its design maintains a loosely coupling from the framework and from rule engines .', u'Collaborative functionalities have been tackled in order to enable a real integration of the rule authoring across different tools and/or users .', u'A practical validation of the approach by instantiating our tool with']

entities: [[(u'RDF knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'EvoPat', u'Method'), (u'pattern-based approach', u'Method'), (u'evolution and refactoring of knowledge bases', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'evolution and refactoring operations', u'Task'), (u'data and schema levels', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'domain-specific evolution and refactorings', u'Task'), (u'evolution patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'evolution patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'combinatorial analysis', u'Method'), (u'usable evolution patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'extension', u'Generic'), (u'OntoWiki semantic collaboration platform and framework', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Facilitating the seamless evolution of RDF knowledge bases on the Semantic Web presents still a major challenge .', u'In this work we devise EvoPat - a pattern-based approach for the evolution and refactoring of knowledge bases .', u'The approach is based on the definition of basic evolution patterns , which are represented declaratively and can capture simple evolution and refactoring operations on both data and schema levels .', u'For more advanced and domain-specific evolution and refactorings , several simple evolution patterns can be combined into a compound one .', u'We performed a comprehensive survey of possible evolution patterns with a combinatorial analysis of all possible before/after combinations , resulting in an extensive catalog of usable evolution patterns .', u'Our approach was implemented as an extension for the OntoWiki semantic collaboration platform and framework .']

sentences: [u'In recent years , semantic similarity measure has a great interest in Semantic Web and Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) .', u'Several similarity measures have been developed , being given the existence of a structured knowledge representation offered by ontologies and corpus which enable semantic interpretation of terms .', u'Semantic similarity measures compute the similarity between concepts/terms included in knowledge sources in order to perform estimations .', u'This paper discusses the existing semantic similarity methods based on structure , information content and feature approaches .', u'Additionally , we present a critical evaluation of several categories of semantic similarity approaches based on two standard benchmarks .', u'The aim of this paper is to give an efficient evaluation of all these measures which help researcher and practitioners to select the measure that best fit for their requirements .']

sentences: [u'In ontology , domain knowledge is formally expressed by concepts that both human and machine can understand .', u'These concepts include entity , attribute , relation and truth , etc .', u'It is used as a standard knowledge representation for the Semantic Web .', u'Nowadays , most of ontology is used to describe concepts and relations quantitatively .', u'However , the concepts and relations are fuzzy and uncertain in many application areas .', u'The classical ontology could not represent information effectively .', u'A feasible solution of this problem is to introduce Fuzzy Logic into ontology to process uncertain information .', u'In this paper , the structural description and building process of fuzzy ontology and the reasoning method based on fuzzy ontology are proposed .', u'The application of the method in the traditional Chinese medicine ( TCM ) field is given .']

sentences: [u'SPARQL is today the standard access language for Semantic Web data .', u'In the recent years XML databases have also acquired industrial importance due to the widespread applicability of XML in the Web .', u'In this paper we present a framework that bridges the heterogeneity gap and creates an interoperable environment where SPARQL queries are used to access XML databases .', u'Our approach assumes that fairly generic mappings between ontology constructs and XML Schema constructs have been automatically derived or manually specified .', u'The mappings are used to automatically translate SPARQL queries to semantically equivalent XQuery queries which are used to access the XML databases .', u'We present the algorithms and the implementation of SPARQL2XQuery framework , which is used for answering SPARQL queries over XML databases .']

relations: [[], [(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic mappings'), (u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'hierarchical classifications'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'algorithm'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic mappings'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'hierarchical classifications'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic coordination')], [], [(u'approach', u'CONJUNCTION', u'algorithm'), (u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'schemas'), (u'hierarchical classifications', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'schemas')], []]
sentences: [u'The problem of finding an agreement on the meaning of heterogeneous schemas is one of the key issues in the development of the Semantic Web .', u'In this paper , we propose a new algorithm for discovering semantic mappings across hierarchical classifications based on a new approach to semantic coordination .', u'This approach shifts the problem of semantic coordination from the problem of computing linguistic or structural similarities ( what most other proposed approaches do ) to the problem of deducing relations between sets of logical formulas that represent the meaning of nodes belonging to different schemas .', u'We show how to apply the approach and the algorithm to an interesting family of schemas , namely hierarchical classifications .', u'Finally , we argue why this is a significant improvement on previous approaches .']

entities: [[(u'RDF-based languages', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'OWL', u'Material'), (u'SWRL', u'Method'), (u'uncertain or inconsistent descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SPARQL queries', u'Material')], [], [(u'descriptive queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reasoning capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'reasoning framework', u'Method'), (u'context-dependent rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'recommender-type front-end applications', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'RDF-based languages', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'RDF-based languages'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web'), (u'OWL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SWRL'), (u'SWRL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'RDF-based languages'), (u'SWRL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [], [(u'reasoning framework', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF triples'), (u'reasoning framework', u'USED-FOR', u'recommender-type front-end applications'), (u'context-dependent rules', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning framework')]]
sentences: [u'Current RDF-based languages for the Semantic Web , such as OWL and SWRL , are not intended to work with uncertain or inconsistent descriptions .', u'This limitation does not undermine their enormous power when it comes to navigating the web to collect information in response to SPARQL queries .', u"But the web being an `` open world '' inevitably contains contradictions and not always the relevant information can be found , even if it is present on the web .", u'To address complex descriptive queries requiring an advice rather than information , we need more flexible notations and reasoning capabilities especially on the application site .', u'In this paper , we discuss how a reasoning framework based on context-dependent rules can be adapted to process RDF triples in recommender-type front-end applications .']

sentences: [u'The description logic EL has been used to support ontology design in various domains , and especially in biology and medecine .', u'EL is known for its efficient reasoning and query answering capabilities .', u'By contrast , ontology design and query answering can be supported and guided within an FCA framework .', u'Accordingly , in this paper , we propose a formal transformation of ELI ( an extension of EL with inverse roles ) ontologies into an FCA framework , i.e .', u'KELI , and we provide a formal characterization of this transformation .', u'Then we show that SPARQL query answering over ELI ontologies can be reduced to lattice query answering over KELI concept lattices .', u'This simplifies the query answering task and shows that some basic semantic web tasks can be improved when considered from an FCA perspective .']

entities: [[(u'philosophical principle', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Ockhams Razor', u'Method')], [(u'accessible data', u'Material'), (u'uncontrolled multiplication of identifiers', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'OKKAM', u'Method'), (u'Identity Crisis', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'usage scenarios', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Ockhams Razor', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'philosophical principle')], [], [], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'Identity Crisis'), (u'requirements', u'CONJUNCTION', u'usage scenarios')]]
sentences: [u'Already in the early 14th century , the philosopher William of Ockham created the philosophical principle known as Ockhams Razor , which can be translated from Latin as entities should not be multiplied beyond necessity .', u'Today , one of the big - and yet unresolved - issues in integrating information distributed over a network of accessible data is the uncontrolled multiplication of identifiers which are used to refer to the same entity ( e.g .', u'a person , an event , an organization , a location , a product ) across multiple heterogeneous sources .', u'In this paper we propose a system called OKKAM that is currently under development to tackle this Identity Crisis on the Semantic Web ; we discuss requirements , architecture , usage scenarios and services and experiments we have developed so far .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'technologies', u'Generic')], [(u'EdHibou', u'Method'), (u'semantic portal', u'Method')], [(u'EdHibou', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'OWL reasoning capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'intelligent features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decision support', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'EdHibou', u'Method'), (u'medical decision support', u'Task'), (u'clinical guidelines', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'ontology of graphical components', u'Method')]]
