sentences: [u'The Semantic Web is becoming more and more a reality , as the required technologies have reached an appropriate level of maturity .', u'However , at this stage , it is important to provide tools facilitating the use and deployment of these technologies by end-users .', u'In this paper , we describe EdHibou , an automatically generated , ontology-based graphical user interface that integrates in a semantic portal .', u'The particularity of EdHibou is that it makes use of OWL reasoning capabilities to provide intelligent features , such as decision support , upon the underlying ontology .', u'We present an application of EdHibou to medical decision support based on a formalization of clinical guidelines in OWL and show how it can be customized thanks to an ontology of graphical components .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge discovery methods', u'Method'), (u'data representations', u'Method')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'expressive , hybrid languages', u'Material'), (u'relational component', u'Method'), (u'terminological ( description logics ) component', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'language', u'Generic'), (u'description logics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL-safe rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web Rule Language', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'conjunctive DL-safe queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hybrid knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'financial dataset', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'knowledge discovery methods', u'USED-FOR', u'data representations')], [(u'relational component', u'USED-FOR', u'methods')], [], [(u'conjunctive DL-safe queries', u'FEATURE-OF', u'hybrid knowledge base')], [(u'financial dataset', u'USED-FOR', u'method')]]
sentences: [u'This paper follows the research direction that has received a growing interest recently , namely application of knowledge discovery methods to complex data representations .', u'Among others , there have been methods proposed for learning in expressive , hybrid languages , combining relational component with terminological ( description logics ) component .', u'In this paper we present a novel approach to frequent pattern discovery over the knowledge base represented in such a language , the combination of the basic subset of description logics with DL-safe rules , that can be seen as a subset of Semantic Web Rule Language .', u'Frequent patterns in our approach are represented as conjunctive DL-safe queries over the hybrid knowledge base .', u'We present also an illustrative example of our method based on the financial dataset .']

entities: [[], [(u"L'attivita di selezione", u'Material')], [(u'altre parole', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], []]
sentences: [u"Il `` Semantic Web `` , non separato dal Web `` tradizionale '' , ma introducendo il significato dei dati , e un'estensione che aggiunge nuove funzionalita a macchine , che diventano in grado di comprendere ed elaborare i dati , che fino ad ora ne visualizza semplicemente il profilo .", u"L'attivita di selezione , contestualizzazione e l'interpretazione dei contenuti non strutturati non puo essere ottenuta da qualsiasi computer .", u"In altre parole , l'informazione e leggibile ma non comprensibile dalla macchina .", u"Perche il `` significato '' dei dati trasmessi sul web sia `` compreso '' dal computer , e necessario che essi siano associati con le meta- informazioni che descrivono questo contenuto .", u"L'adozione di un forum in un ambiente di apprendimento semantico puo aprire la strada ad una valutazione dell'apprendimento che riflette una gestione della conoscenza in modi nuovi ?"]

sentences: [u'Modeling of the existing virtual environment ( such as VRML/X3D ) mainly concentrated in the geometric description , the show of virtual scenes is understandable for people , while is not for computer , so it is difficult to make meaningful automatic processing.Designed a semantic virtual environment ( mainly includes semantic virtual scene and semantic virtual human ) based on semantic Web , and designed the engine of semantic virtual human animation based on semantic virtual environment.Semantic virtual environments allows computer to understand and automate the semantic information of virtual environment , and makes the virtual environment system can be reused , extended and integrated.Finally , based on the semantic virtual environments and virtual human animation engine , developed an action reasoning system of intelligent virtual human in the office scene , and achieved very good results .']

entities: [[(u'VIVO Semantic Web software suite', u'Method'), (u'geodesy and polar science communities', u'Material')], [(u'ontology selection', u'Task'), (u'consolidation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'EarthCollab', u'Method')], [(u'EarthCollabs ontology design approach', u'Method'), (u'ontology reuse', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic')], [(u'local ontology', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'geoscience-relevant connections', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic application dependencies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'external ontology characteristics', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'The EarthCollab project is using the VIVO Semantic Web software suite to support the discovery of information , data , and potential collaborators within the geodesy and polar science communities .', u'This paper discusses the ontology selection , consolidation , and reuse efforts of EarthCollab .', u'EarthCollabs ontology design approach heavily emphasizes ontology reuse , bringing together existing ontologies to support diverse use cases related to the discovery of geoscience information and resources .', u'We developed a small local ontology to tie these existing ontologies together and to build appropriate geoscience-relevant connections .', u'Five key ontology decision drivers are presented to outline EarthCollabs ontology design process and decision points : use cases , existing systems and metadata , semantic application dependencies , external ontology characteristics , and community recommendations for good ontological modeling practices .']

entities: [[(u'Service Selection', u'Task'), (u'semantic web mining research', u'Task')], [(u'QoS parameters', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reliability', u'Metric'), (u'service selection', u'Task'), (u'Genetic Algorithm', u'Method'), (u'GA', u'Method'), (u'ontology repository', u'Method'), (u'search heuristic', u'Method'), (u'natural evolution', u'Task'), (u'domain and search problems', u'Task')], [(u'service selection', u'Task'), (u'ontology repository', u'Method'), (u'parameters', u'Generic'), (u'execution time', u'Metric'), (u'memory processing time', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reliability evaluation', u'Metric'), (u'ontology-based search', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'In this paper , our focus is based on the study of similar Service Selection which is a challenging task to discover and deliver services prevails in semantic web mining research .', u'Here , we enhance the QoS parameters like reliability , availability and consistency of service selection by implementing Genetic Algorithm ( GA ) in ontology repository , which is a search heuristic that mimics the process of natural evolution is used to generate useful solutions to optimize the number of similar services related to domain and search problems .', u'We also evaluate reliability of service selection from ontology repository by considering two various parameters such as execution time and memory processing time and the reliability evaluation has been done by comparing a normal search and ontology-based search .']

entities: [[(u'e-Maintenance', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'remote maintenance of devices', u'Task')], [(u'Maintenance operators', u'Method')], [], [(u'maintenance procedures', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web standards', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], []]
sentences: [u'The issue of e-Maintenance , i.e .', u'the remote maintenance of devices , is more and more important as the loose-coupling between center of competencies and productions sites is increasing .', u'Maintenance operators have to know procedures for all devices they are in charge of .', u'Whispering possible interactions to operators when they operate could ease their task and increase their productivity .', u'In this paper , we propose to model maintenance procedures ( therefore sequences of actions of human operators ) using the Semantic Web standards .', u'The system can infer the possible next actions from the human operator , and assist him by suggesting the next operation steps .', u"An analysis of the use 's trace is also proposed in order to hint operators on improvements in his processes ."]

entities: [[(u'smart home systems', u'Method'), (u'semantic level', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'ontology-based services mapping model', u'Method'), (u'home environment ontology', u'Method'), (u'physical devices', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'virtual smart home platform', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OSMM', u'Method'), (u'decision semantic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'service mapping', u'Method'), (u'OSMM', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'home environment ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'smart home systems')]]
sentences: [u'Current smart home systems cant understand the services in the semantic level and pre-defined service invoke mode causes the poor system scalability.By learning from the successful experiences of semantic web , an ontology-based services mapping model ( OSMM ) has been proposed to solve these problems.OSMM is based on home environment ontology while Jess as the core of the reasoner.It inputs decision semantic and outputs a service invoke interface which can be used to control the physical devices after service mapping.The result comes from the simulation in the virtual smart home platform ( VSM ) shows that OSMM understands the decision semantic very well and the service mapping result is reasonable as well as short time delay.This makes OSMM meets the demands of common smart home system .']

sentences: [u'Ontology is the conceptual backbone that provides meaning to data on the semantic web .', u'However , ontology is not a static resource and may evolve over time , which often leaves the meaning of data in an undefined or inconsistent state .', u'It is thus very important to have a method to preserve the data and its meaning when ontology changes .', u'This paper proposed a general method that solves the problem using data migration .', u'It analyzed some of the issues in the method including separation of ontology and data , migration specification , migration result and migration algorithm .', u'The paper also instantiates the general mothod in RDF ( S ) as an example .', u'The RDF ( S ) example itself is a simple but complete method for migrating RDF data when RDFS ontology changes .']

sentences: [u'Word Sense Disambiguation is a challenging technique in Natural Language Processing .', u'There are some words in the natural languages which can cause ambiguity about the sense of the word.WSD identifies the correct sense of the word in a sentence or a document .', u'The paper summarizes about the history of WSD .', u'We have discussed about the knowledge - based and machine learning - based approaches for WSD .', u'Various supervised learning and unsupervised learning techniques have been discussed .', u'WSD is mainly used in Information Retrieval ( IR ) , Information Extraction ( IE ) , Machine Translation ( MT ) , Content Analysis , Word Processing , Lexicography and Semantic Web .', u'Finally , we have discussed about WSD for Indian languages ( Hindi , Malayalam , and Kannada ) and other languages ( Chinese , Mongolian , Polish , Turkish , English , Myanmar , Arabic , Nepali , Persian , Dutch , and Italian ) .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web ( SW )', u'Method'), (u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'HTML Web Pages', u'Material')], [(u'domain model', u'Method'), (u'domain ontology', u'Method')], [(u'automatic generation of metadata', u'Task'), (u'SW', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'relation extraction techniques', u'Method')], [(u'web pages', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'relation extraction', u'Task')], [(u'Relation extraction', u'Task'), (u'hyperlink structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'relation extraction', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'metadata')], [(u'domain ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'domain model')], [], [], [], [(u'hyperlink structure', u'USED-FOR', u'relation extraction'), (u'Web', u'USED-FOR', u'relation extraction')]]
sentences: [u'The idea of the Semantic Web ( SW ) is based on metadata .', u'We have proposed an architecture needed to generate metadata for the SW. Our proposed architecture is designed to generate metadata from HTML Web Pages from the domain of our interest .', u'The domain model is represented by using domain ontology .', u'The focus of the paper is to investigate the automatic generation of metadata for the SW by relation extraction techniques .', u'Our assumption is that any two web pages that have some kind of relationship must be connected by a link or a path .', u'Our algorithm exploits the link structure of web using breadth first search for relation extraction .', u'Relation extraction results show that hyperlink structure of the Web can be used for relation extraction .']

sentences: [u'The use of folksonomies involves several problems due to its lack of semantics associated with them .', u'The nature of these structures makes difficult the process to enrich them semantically by the association of meaningful terms of the Semantic Web .', u'This task implies a phase of disambiguation and another of expansion of the initial tagset , returning an increased contextualised set where synonyms , hyperonyms , gloss terms , etc .', u'are part of it .', u'In this novel proposal a technique based on confidence and similarity degrees is applied to weight this extended tagset in order to allow the user to obtain a customised resulting tagset .', u'Moreover a comparision between the two main thesaurus , WordNet and Wikipedia , are presented due to their great influence in the disambiguation and expansion process .']

sentences: [u'Web 3.0 is a term used to describe the future of the World Wide Web .', u'Following the introduction of the phrase Web 2.0 as a description of the recent evolution of the Web , many technologists , journalists , and industry leaders have used the term Web 3.0 to hypothesize about a future wave of Internet innovation .', u'Views on the next stage of the World Wide Webs evolution vary greatly .', u'Some believe that emerging technologies such as the Semantic Web will transform the way the Web is used , and lead to new possibilities in artificial intelligence .', u'Other visionaries suggest that increases in Internet connection speeds , modular web applications , or advances in computer graphics will play the key role in the evolution of the World Wide Web .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web languages', u'Material'), (u'vague or uncertain information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'crisp model-theoretic seman- tics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'first-order logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy logic', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDF graph', u'Method'), (u'RDF Schema ontology', u'Method'), (u'real-life knowledge management', u'Task')], [(u'unmodified RDF triples', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'extended syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy membership values', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'extended graph', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Reasoning', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy languages', u'Material'), (u'cur- rent inferencers', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web languages can not currently represent vague or uncertain information .', u'However , their crisp model-theoretic seman- tics can be extended to represent uncertainty in much the same way first-order logic was extended to fuzzy logic .', u'We show how the inter- pretation of an RDF graph ( or an RDF Schema ontology ) can be a matter of values , addressing a common problem in real-life knowledge management .', u'While unmodified RDF triples can be interpreted accord- ing to the new semantics , an extended syntax is needed in order to store fuzzy membership values within the statements .', u'We give conditions an extended interpretation must meet to be a model of an extended graph .', u'Reasoning in the resulting fuzzy languages can be implemented by cur- rent inferencers with minimal adaptations .']

sentences: [u'Named Entity Recognition or NER is one of the sub-research field of Information Extraction which can be used for machine translation , question answering , semantic web , etc .', u'One of the biggest challenge of NER is the adversity to construct a manually labeled training data .', u'In this work , we present a semi-supervised approach for Indonesian language NER which is capable of creating high quality training data automatically .', u'Semi-supervised approach works by utilizing unlabeled data made from Wikipedia and DBPedia to form high accuracy and non-redundant additional training data for each iteration of semi-supervised process .', u'We show that our system manages to generate new training data and gain an increasing F1 score as the iteration of semi-supervised process goes .']

sentences: [u'This paper presents a novel approach for Web Services discovery on the envisioned Semantic Web .', u'At first it proposes ontology based four-layer Web Services description model which is helpful for data-independence and concept-sharing .', u"And then a users ' services preferences and constrains model upon the description is described .", u'SBWSDF ( Semantic Based Web Services Discovery Framework ) is a framework to implement Web Services discovery using these models .', u'Using the prototype of this framework , we set up a services ontology base and a rules base about flight booking .', u'This prototype integrates the services description , the preferences and constrains rules and the request information to select proper services by using an inference engine .', u"The result proves it 's a new approach of Web Services discovery with intelligence ."]

sentences: [u'The semantic web , which has been evolving continuously , has focused into the conceptualization and semantic relationships of data to enable the web of data rather than human-readable web .', u'E-learning also has been evolving through incorporating various web technologies like information representation and retrieval , social networking , and cooperative communication .', u'There are many ontological approaches that have been suggested to construct the semantic relationships between learning materials .', u'In this paper , we consider the semantic representation of the fundamental information of learning domains like curriculum and syllabus .', u'We propose a layered structure of learning ontologies , which are composed of curriculum ontology , syllabus ontology , learning subject ontology and learning concept ontology .', u'In addition , we define a semantic structure of syllabus to support adaptive learning sequencing based on the syllabus .']

sentences: [u'Metadata , Linked ( open ) Data and ontologies are a part of the complex galaxy of communication languages for web .', u'Being supported by modern information technologies , these languages aimed at reassuring greater visibility , dissemination and sharing of content and , consequently , optimization and rationalization of services such as , for example , digital libraries and archives .', u'Metadata , ontologies and Linked ( open ) Data , combined together , represent a fundamental starting point for determining the new search methods of the semantic web .', u"Reviewing some existing experiences and initiatives of 'new performance ' of data in the digital environment , the paper tries to lead the reader to discover a new way of knowledge creation that can be operated at different levels in every field of human action and , especially , in the scientific and socio-cultural fields ."]

sentences: [u'Creating Web processes using Web service technology gives us the opportunity for selecting new services , which best suit our need at the moment .', u'Doing this automatically requires us to quantify our criteria for selection .', u'In addition , there are challenging issues of correctness and optimality .', u'We present a constraint driven Web service composition tool in METEOR-S , which allows the process designers to bind Web services to an abstract process , based on business and process constraints and generate an executable process .', u'Our approach is to reduce much of the service composition problem to a constraint satisfaction problem .', u'It uses a multiphase approach for constraint analysis .', u'This work was done as part of the METEORS framework , which aims to support the complete lifecycle of semantic Web processes .']

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'e-government schemas', u'Task')], [(u'federation-wide harmonization and cooperation', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'light-weight Semantic Web approach', u'Method'), (u'namespace descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'namespace descriptions', u'Material'), (u'RDF data', u'Material'), (u'e-government schemas', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'In this paper we present an approach to organize e-government schemas in Switzerland .', u'On the political side , Switzerland is a challenging environment for any federation-wide harmonization and cooperation , because many authorities are organized independently .', u'On the technical side , we describe an approach which aims at increasing the federation-wide cooperation through providing interested parties with a low barrier-to-entry , and with clearly visible benefits through the continuous evolution of a directory of e-government schemas .', u'This paper describes a light-weight Semantic Web approach , enabling schema authors to create namespace descriptions that provide a minimal semantic description of the namespaces subject .', u'Using these namespace descriptions , RDF data is extracted and serves as source for a highly interlinked directory of e-government schemas in Switzerland .']

entities: [[(u'source taxonomy', u'Method'), (u'master taxonomy', u'Method')], [(u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'web', u'Material'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'classifier', u'Method'), (u'source taxonomy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'master taxonomy', u'Method')], [(u'source taxonomy data', u'Material'), (u'classifiers', u'Method'), (u'master taxonomy', u'Method'), (u'semantic overlap', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'co-bootstrapping', u'Method'), (u'classification', u'Task'), (u'implicit knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'real-world web data', u'Material'), (u'taxonomy integration', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'We address the problem of integrating objects from a source taxonomy into a master taxonomy .', u'This problem is not only currently pervasive on the web , but also important to the emerging semantic web .', u'A straightforward approach to automating this process would be to learn a classifier that can classify objects from the source taxonomy into categories of the master taxonomy .', u'The key insight is that the availability of the source taxonomy data could be helpful to build better classifiers for the master taxonomy if their categorizations have some semantic overlap .', u'In this paper , we propose a new approach , co-bootstrapping , to enhance the classification by exploiting such implicit knowledge .', u'Our experiments with real-world web data show substantial improvements in the performance of taxonomy integration .']

sentences: [u'Relevant biomedical advances happen daily , and the medical profession relies on this evolution to deliver an improved patient care .', u'In addition , the growing magnitude of data generated by biomedical software and hardware since the initial discovery of the human genome is remarkable in size and variety .', u'Hence , best-of-breed software solutions are at best a couple years behind clinical practice demands .', u'In this paper we detail an innovative Semantic Web interoperability framework , which provides developers with a complete software stack for semantic application deployment .', u'Interoperability is the defining feature of this framework .', u'On the one hand , new instances are able to integrate several types of distributed and heterogeneous data .', u'On the other hand , collected data are made available through a public SPARQL endpoint .']

sentences: [u'This research study aims at detecting topics and extracting themes ( subtopics ) from the blogospheres content while bridging the gap between the Social Web and the Semantic Web .', u'The goal is to detect certain types of information from collections of blogs and microblogs narratives that lack explicit semantics .', u'The approach presented introduces a novel approach that blends together two young paradigms : Ontology-Based Information Extraction ( OBIE ) and Reservoir Computing ( RC ) .', u'The novelty of the work lies in integrating ontologies and RC as well as the pioneering use of RC with social media data .', u'Experiments with retrospect data from blogs and Twitter microblogs provide valuable insights into the BBC Backstage initiative and prove the viability of the approach presented in terms of scalability , computational complexity , and performance .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic web techniques', u'Method'), (u'planning methods', u'Method'), (u'automated service composition', u'Task')], [(u'abstract concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'concrete data structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'service interaction', u'Task')], [(u'matching method', u'Method'), (u'planning methods', u'Method'), (u'concrete data structures', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'two-phase matching process', u'Method'), (u'abstract level', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'data structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'planning process', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Semantic web techniques have been leveraged in planning methods for automated service composition .', u'Typically , inputs and outputs of services are described in abstract concepts for efficient and meaningful matching between output of one service and input of another .', u'However , existing methods have not examined concrete data structures , which are essential for successful service interaction in common implementation architectures .', u'To address the problem , this paper proposes a matching method that can be incorporated into existing planning methods to ensure consistency in concrete data structures .', u'The proposed method applies a two-phase matching process to efficiently filter out services that do not match at the abstract level .', u'It also applies a data structure to organize similar services according to their relationships for efficient matching during the planning process .']

relations: [[(u'Thesauri', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge organization systems')], [(u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge organization')], [], [(u'ISO standard', u'USED-FOR', u'thesauri')], [], [(u'Web', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge organization systems')]]
sentences: [u'Thesauri and other knowledge organization systems have been adapted to the technological environment .', u'Currently , this represents an essential aspect of knowledge organization on the semantic web .', u'After a long period in which thesaurus guidelines and standards were not updated , some have been revised by the governing organisations within the past five years .', u'Consensus among international experts has resulted in publication of the first part of an ISO standard for thesauri , which provides a data model and emphasizes the interoperability process .', u'This paper compiles the most relevant guidelines for thesauri published between the 80s and the ISO 25964 document .', u'We reflect on the most relevant characteristics in this evolution and explore the most recent applications of knowledge organization systems on the Web .']

sentences: [u'Clinical decision support systems ( CDSSs ) have been hailed for their potential to reduce medical errors and improve the quality and safety of health care .', u'CDSSs aim to assist clinicians in their decision making and take over some routines including diagnostic support .', u'This paper presents a design of a generic medical platform to assist clinicians in their clinical reasoning process .', u'Our platform aims to guide clinicians in the process of gathering relevant information and to help them in their decision making .', u'It exploits two sources of knowledge namely : theoretical knowledge ( clinical rules ) and practical knowledge ( clinical experiences ) by relying on Rule-Based Reasoning and Case-Based Reasoning , respectively .', u'moreover , we utilize the semantic web and ontologies for knowledge modeling in order to reuse and to share knowledge .']

sentences: [u'Integrating data from multiple heterogeneous sources entail dealing with different data models , schemas and query languages .', u'The burgeoning Semantic Web has provided several new methods for data integration .', u'This paper focuses on integration of relational database and XML data .', u'To solve the problem we propose an ontology-based approach .', u'A semantic integration infrastructure for heterogeneous data sources is presented .', u'In this infrastructure , ontology is used as the mediated schema for the representation of the data source semantics .', u'To model different source schemas , we propose a describing method based on RDF graph patterns .', u'The semantic mappings between source schema and RDF ontology are described declaratively using SPARQL queries .', u'The semantic of query rewriting is further discussed and a query rewriting algorithm is presented .']

sentences: [u'This paper illustrates a model metadata element set called the Indian e-Governance Metadata Set that is a derivative drawn from the study of the globally accepted e-Governance metadata standards .', u'It considers the needs for e-Governance Information Management also in the context of India .', u'The model metadata element set is applicable in the sector of information management and interoperability of e-governance information in our domestic scenario .', u'The proposal of metadata framework can be described as a mode of e-Governance information meant to be useful for electronic machines/computers and intelligent agents that infer or interpret the data using semantic web concepts to achieve semantic interoperability .', u'This study also suggests an appropriate number of authority lists for assigning values to the proposed element set .']

sentences: [u'Information systems incorporating complex networkstructured information spaces with a semantic underpinning such as hypermedia networks , semantic networks , topic maps , and concept maps are being deployed to solve some of NASAs critical information management problems .', u'This paper describes some of the human interaction and navigation problems associated with complex semantic information spaces and describes a set of new visual interface approaches to address these problems .', u'A key strategy is to leverage semantic knowledge represented within these information spaces to construct abstractions and views that will be meaningful to the human user .', u'Human-computer interaction methodologies will guide the development and evaluation of these approaches , which will benefit deployed NASA systems and also apply to information systems based on the emerging Semantic Web .']

sentences: [u'Folksonomy , a system for social tagging or collaborative tagging , is popular in Semantic Web research .', u'Folksonomy is applied to items , such as music pieces , which their personalized tags can be annotated by users .', u'Recommendation systems can use these tags to produce meaningful information .', u'Clustering methods , such as the Agglomerative Hierarchical Clustering ( AHC ) method , can be applied in the context of recommendation system .', u'This paper proposes the Intuitionistic Fuzzy Agglomerative Hierarchical Clustering ( IFAHC ) algorithm for recommendation using social tagging .', u'The Intuitionistic Fuzzy Set ( IFS ) concept is used to represent tag values which are vague and uncertain .', u'IFAHC can cluster items represented by using IFS into different groups .', u'The application of IFAHC to music recommendation is used to demonstrate the usability of the proposed method .']

entities: [[(u'semantic Web progress', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Information retrieval applications', u'Task'), (u'knowledge organization', u'Method'), (u"user 's query", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'fuzzy information retrieval model', u'Method'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'fuzzy relations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge organization', u'Method'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'user initial query', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'classical fuzzy-based approach', u'Method'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'With the semantic Web progress , encoding of knowledge bases as ontologies has increased .', u"Information retrieval applications are employing this knowledge organization to enhance quality of results by returning documents semantically related and relevant to initial user 's query .", u'The proposed fuzzy information retrieval model retrieves information providing a framework to encode a knowledge base composed of multiple related ontologies whose relationships are expressed as fuzzy relations .', u'This knowledge organization is used in a novel method to expand the user initial query and to index the documents in the collection .', u'The model allows the ontologies , as well as the relationships among their concepts , to be represented independently .', u'Experimental results show that the proposed model presents better overall performance when compared with another classical fuzzy-based approach for information retrieval .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'updates', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data models', u'Method'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'relational structure', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'semantics', u'Generic'), (u'erase operator', u'Method')], [(u'sound semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF updates', u'Material'), (u'maximal RDF graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'erase operation', u'Task'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'erase operator')], [(u'sound semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF updates'), (u'maximal RDF graph', u'USED-FOR', u'erase operation')]]
sentences: [u'The basic data model for the Semantic Web is RDF .', u'In this paper we address updates in RDF .', u'It is known that the semantics of updates for data models becomes unclear when the model turns , even slightly , more general than a simple relational structure .', u'Using the framework of KatsunoMendelzon , we define a semantics for updates in RDF .', u'Particularly we explore the behavior of this semantics for the erase operator ( which in general is not expressible in RDF ) .', u'Our results include a proposal of sound semantics for RDF updates , a characterization of the maximal RDF graph which captures exactly all consequences of the erase operation expressible in RDF , and complexity results about the computation of this graph and updates in RDF in general .']

entities: [[(u'multi-relational clustering method', u'Method'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web languages', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'language-independent dissim- ilarity measures', u'Metric'), (u'discriminating features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concept descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'clustering algorithm', u'Method'), (u'tuples of central el- ements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'medoids', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'variable length', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'centers', u'Generic'), (u'fuzzy clustering approach', u'Method')], [(u'cluster', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'unit interval', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'clustering validity indices', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'language-independent dissim- ilarity measures', u'USED-FOR', u'It')], [(u'clustering algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'clusterings'), (u'clustering algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'tuples of central el- ements')], [], [], [], [(u'clustering validity indices', u'USED-FOR', u'method')]]
sentences: [u'A multi-relational clustering method is presented which can be ap- plied to complex knowledge bases storing resources expressed in the standard Semantic Web languages .', u'It adopts effective and language-independent dissim- ilarity measures that are based on a finite number of dimensions corresponding to a committee of discriminating features ( represented by concept descriptions ) .', u'The clustering algorithm expresses the possible clusterings in tuples of central el- ements ( medoids , w.r.t .', u'the given metric ) of variable length .', u'It iteratively adjusts these centers following the rationale of fuzzy clustering approach , i.e .', u'one where the membership to each cluster is not deterministic but rather ranges in the unit interval .', u'An experimentation with some ontologies proves the feasibility of our method and its effectiveness in terms of clustering validity indices .']

entities: [[(u'multi-relational clustering method', u'Method'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web languages', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'language-independent dissimilarity measures', u'Method'), (u'discriminating features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concept descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'clustering algorithm', u'Method'), (u'clusterings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'tuples of central elements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'medoids', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'variable length', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'centers', u'Generic'), (u'fuzzy clustering approach', u'Method')], [(u'cluster', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'unit interval', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'clustering validity indices', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'A multi-relational clustering method is presented which can be applied to complex knowledge bases storing resources expressed in the standard Semantic Web languages .', u'It adopts effective and language-independent dissimilarity measures that are based on a finite number of dimensions corresponding to a committee of discriminating features ( represented by concept descriptions ) .', u'The clustering algorithm expresses the possible clusterings in tuples of central elements ( medoids , w.r.t .', u'the given metric ) of variable length .', u'It iteratively adjusts these centers following the rationale of fuzzy clustering approach , i.e .', u'one where the membership to each cluster is not deterministic but rather ranges in the unit interval .', u'An experimentation with some ontologies proves the feasibility of our method and its effectiveness in terms of clustering validity indices .']

sentences: [u'Provenance , or information about the sources , derivation , custody or history of data , has been studied recently in a number of contexts , including databases , scientific workflows and the Semantic Web .', u'Many provenance mechanisms have been developed , motivated by informal notions such as influence , dependence , explanation and causality .', u'However , there has been little study of whether these mechanisms formally satisfy appropriate policies or even how to formalize relevant motivating concepts such as causality .', u'We contend that mathematical models of these concepts are needed to justify and compare provenance techniques .', u'In this paper we review a theory of causality based on structural models that has been developed in artificial intelligence , and describe work in progress on using causality to give a semantics to provenance graphs .']

entities: [[(u'Ontology learning', u'Task'), (u'Artificial Intelligence', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'ontology learning', u'Task')], [(u'incremental clustering approach', u'Method'), (u'unknown group names', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'concept abstractness', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'metric learning module', u'Method'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous semantic evidence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learning process', u'Task')], [(u'metric-based learning framework', u'Method'), (u'components', u'Generic')], [(u'WordNet and Open Directory Project data', u'Material'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'baseline algorithm', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Ontology learning is an important task in Artificial Intelligence , Semantic Web and Text Mining .', u'This paper presents a novel framework for , and solutions to , three practical problems in ontology learning .', u'An incremental clustering approach is used to solve the problem of unknown group names .', u'Learned models at each level of an ontology address the problem of no control over concept abstractness .', u'A metric learning module moves beyond the limitation of traditional use of features and incorporates heterogeneous semantic evidence into the learning process .', u'The metric-based learning framework integrates these separate components into a single , unified solution .', u'An extensive evaluation with WordNet and Open Directory Project data demonstrates that the method is more effective than a state-of-the-art baseline algorithm .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'semi-automatic procedure', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Ontology construction of a certain domain is an important step in applying # R # # N # the Semantic web .', u'A number of software tools adapted for building domain # R # # N # ontologies of most wide-spread natural languages are available , but # R # # N # accomplishing that for any given natural language presents a challenge .', u'Here # R # # N # we propose a semi-automatic procedure to create ontologies for different # R # # N # natural languages .', u'Our approach utilizes various software tools available on # R # # N # the Internet most notably DODDLE-OWL - a domain ontology development tool # R # # N # implemented for English and Japanese languages .', u'By using this tool , WordNet , # R # # N # Protege and XSLT transformations , we propose a general procedure to # R # # N # construct domain ontology for any natural language .']

relations: [[(u'CSML', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic markup language'), (u'CSML', u'USED-FOR', u'publishing and sharing of conceptual spaces'), (u'semantic markup language', u'USED-FOR', u'publishing and sharing of conceptual spaces'), (u'conceptual level', u'FEATURE-OF', u'semantics')], [(u'CSML', u'USED-FOR', u'semantics'), (u'ontology languages', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [(u'conceptual spaces', u'USED-FOR', u'operations')], []]
sentences: [u'CSML is a semantic markup language created for the publishing and sharing of conceptual spaces , which are geometric structures that represent semantics at the conceptual level .', u'CSML can be used to describe semantics that are not captured well by the ontology languages commonly used in the Semantic Web .', u'Measurement of the semantic similarity of concepts as well as the combination of concepts without shared properties are common human cognitive tasks .', u'However , these operations present sources of difficulty for tools reliant upon set-theoretic and syllogistic reasoning on symbolic ontologies .', u'In contrast , these operations can be modeled naturally using conceptual spaces .', u'This paper describes the design decisions behind CSML , introduces the key component elements of a CSML document , and presents examples of its usage .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'e-assessment', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'automated design of assessments', u'Task')], [(u'assessment domain', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology network', u'Method'), (u'AONet', u'Method'), (u'e-assessment domain', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'approaches')], [], [], [(u'ontology network', u'USED-FOR', u'e-assessment domain'), (u'AONet', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology network')]]
sentences: [u'With the advance in the Semantic Web and the technologies for its realization , approaches that use ontologies for different purposes in the context of e-assessment have emerged .', u'One of these purposes is the use of ontologies as a mean of providing a structure to guide the automated design of assessments .', u'Despite of the effort done in this direction , there is still a lot of work to be done due to the most of the approaches have proposed individual ontologies that model only a part of the assessment domain .', u'This paper presents an ontology network , called AONet , that conceptualizes the e-assessment domain with the aim of supporting the semiautomatic generation of it , taking into account not only technical aspects but also pedagogic .']

relations: [[(u'Semantc Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Ontology ABSTRACT')], [], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'Ontology approach', u'USED-FOR', u'method'), (u'Ontology approach', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')]]
sentences: [u'Keyword : CRM , Semantc Web , Ontology ABSTRACT With the development of information technology today , the nature of this information is also experiencing growth .', u'This encourages the development of information resources become more dynamic , autonomous , diverse and large .', u'Diversity that occurs not only at the technical level but also at the level of representation of information .', u'This difference can occur in syntactic , schematic and semantic level .', u'In CRM systems , complaint data contained in a data warehouse is one example of the diversity of data , to view a customer can give more than one complaint .', u'Because of this diversity , it is for the exchange of information between various sources will become an obstacle .', u'To overcome that then developed a method .', u'That method is the Semantic Web using Ontology approach .']

entities: [[(u'Pragmatic Web', u'Material')], [(u'Pragmatic Web', u'Material')], [(u'Pragmatic Web', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'linguistic metaphor', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'central features', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Pragmatic Web', u'Method'), (u'collaborative technology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'it', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web')], [], [(u'Pragmatic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'collaborative technology')]]
sentences: [u'In recent years interests towards the Pragmatic Web have been increasing .', u'Since the preliminary sketches and initial ideas in the first years of this decade , some attempts at defining and characterizing the Pragmatic Web has emerged .', u'Building upon the initial characterizations , the aim of this paper is to develop some of the key issues concerning the Pragmatic Web , especially those that distinguish it from the semantic web .', u'By drawing ideas from the linguistic metaphor and from research conducted in technology studies , the paper aims at characterizing certain central features that make the web a pragmatic one .', u'The central argument of this paper is that the Pragmatic Web is a collaborative technology , dependent on communities of users and the practices of use of the community .']

entities: [[(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ones', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'knowledge structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information retrieval systems', u'Task')], [(u'educational research', u'Task')], [(u'query expansion', u'Task'), (u'recall', u'Metric')], [(u'thesaurus and ontology-based query expansion', u'Task'), (u'ontological relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'educational research', u'Task'), (u'ontological relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query expansion modes', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge structures')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'This thesis investigates the question whether and how ontologies such as the ones currently evolving in the Semantic Web can serve as knowledge structures for the generation of query expansion terms in information retrieval systems .', u'This issue is examined using a specific example domain , namely educational research .', u'Initial results support the already well-researched finding that query expansion can increase recall .', u'Subsequent experiments will focus on comparing the effectiveness of thesaurus and ontology-based query expansion , on identifying ontological relationships which are especially useful for the generation of query expansion terms in the domain of educational research , and on evaluating the usefulness of different ontological relationships as expansion terms for different types of queries , as well as for different query expansion modes .']

entities: [[(u'service discovery mechanism', u'Method'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'automatic services recommendation', u'Task'), (u'service discovery.The model', u'Method'), (u'QoS', u'Method'), (u'semantic Web and agent technology', u'Method'), (u'UDDI', u'Method'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'QoS', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'model', u'USED-FOR', u'automatic services recommendation'), (u'model', u'USED-FOR', u'service discovery.The model'), (u'QoS', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic Web and agent technology')]]
sentences: [u'The discovery and integration of services are critical problems while developing a large platform based on Web services.After the research on the available service discovery mechanism , this paper proposes a model for automatic services recommendation to extend the service discovery.The model involves notions of QoS and artificial intelligence.With the combination of semantic Web and agent technology and use of UDDI , the model automatically searches and executes services or service processes that match users demands.After that , the execution results return to the users with which they may make decisions.Meanwhile , for the sake of the reliability of the results , the model filters the running services and services flow according to QoS , and ranks results so that the quality of recommendation will be enhanced .']

sentences: [u'Description Logics are a family of class based knowledge representation formalisms characterised by the use of various constructors to build complex classes from simpler ones , and by an emphasis on the provision of sound , complete and ( empirically ) tractable reasoning services .', u'They have a wide range of applications , but their use as ontology languages has been highlighted by the recent explosion of interest in the Semantic Web , where ontologies are set to play a key role .', u'DAML+OIL is a description logic based ontology language specifically designed for use on the web .', u'The logical basis of the language means that reasoning services can be provided , both to support ontology design and to make DAML+OIL described web resources more accessible to automated processes .']

entities: [[(u'Polysemy', u'Metric'), (u'linguistic phenomenon', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'information management', u'Task'), (u'knowledge repositories', u'Material')], [(u'polysemy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'DOLCE+ foundational ontology', u'Method')], [], [(u'conceptual foundations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'natural language expressions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'artificial or human ) agents', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Polysemy', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'linguistic phenomenon')], [], [], [], [(u'natural language expressions', u'USED-FOR', u'artificial or human ) agents')]]
sentences: [u'Polysemy is the linguistic phenomenon by which a term has more than one meaning .', u'It is not a negligible issue in information management , since an effective and unambiguous sharing of the semantic content of data among different databases or knowledge repositories is needed .', u'The paper illustrates a case of polysemy ( concerning inflammation ) , and puts it within the framework provided by the DOLCE+ foundational ontology .', u'This solution enables us to formally represent several senses of inflammation , and their interrelationships .', u'This we take as a demonstration of how ontologies play an essential role in providing precisely the conceptual foundations that are needed in order to make the intended meaning of natural language expressions available to all the ( artificial or human ) agents that could be involved in the semantic web']

sentences: [u'The emergence of Semantic Web ( SW ) and the related technologies promise to make the web a meaningful experience .', u'Yet , high level modeling , design and querying techniques proves to be a challenging task for organizations that are hoping utilize the SW paradigm for their industrial applications , which are still using traditional database techniques .', u'To address such an issue , in this paper , we propose a view model for the SW ( SW-View ) , to SW-enable traditional solutions .', u'First we outline the view model , its properties and some modeling issues , followed by some discussions on modeling such views ( at the conceptual level ) .', u'We also provide a brief discussion on how this view model is utilized in the design and construction of materialized ontology views to support extraction of sub-ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'Ontology-based Data Access', u'Task'), (u'accessed data', u'Material'), (u'classical database', u'Material')], [(u'Web applications', u'Task'), (u'information extraction', u'Task'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'benchmark', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'accessed data', u'COMPARE', u'classical database')], [(u'information extraction', u'USED-FOR', u'Web applications')]]
sentences: [u'Ontology-based Data Access has intensively been studied as a very relevant problem in connection with semantic web data. # R # # N # Often it is assumed , that the accessed data behaves like a classical database , i.e .', u'it is known which facts hold for certain. # R # # N # Many Web applications , especially those involving information extraction from text , have to deal with uncertainty about the truth of information. # R # # N # In this paper , we introduce an implementation and a benchmark of such a system on top of relational databases. # R # # N # Furthermore , we propose a novel benchmark for systems handling large probabilistic ontologies. # R # # N # We describe how the benchmark is designed and show its characteristics based on the evaluation of our implementation .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge discovery methods', u'Method'), (u'data representations', u'Method')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'expressive , hybrid languages', u'Material'), (u'relational component', u'Method'), (u'terminological ( description logics ) component', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'language', u'Generic'), (u'description logics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'D-safe rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web Rule Language', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'conjunctive D-safe queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hybrid knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'financial dataset', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'knowledge discovery methods', u'USED-FOR', u'data representations')], [(u'relational component', u'USED-FOR', u'methods')], [], [(u'conjunctive D-safe queries', u'FEATURE-OF', u'hybrid knowledge base')], [(u'financial dataset', u'USED-FOR', u'method')]]
sentences: [u'This paper follows the research direction that has received a growing interest recently , namely application of knowledge discovery methods to complex data representations .', u'Among others , there have been methods proposed for learning in expressive , hybrid languages , combining relational component with terminological ( description logics ) component .', u'In this paper we present a novel approach to frequent pattern discovery over the knowledge base represented in such a language , the combination of the basic subset of description logics with D-safe rules , that can be seen as a subset of Semantic Web Rule Language .', u'Frequent patterns in our approach are represented as conjunctive D-safe queries over the hybrid knowledge base .', u'We present also an illustrative example of our method based on the financial dataset .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'open-world based ontology languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'closed-world rules paradigms', u'Method')], [(u'combination', u'Generic'), (u'Hybrid MKNF knowledge bases', u'Method'), (u'stable model semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'ontology axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'well-founded semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'OWL-based semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'well-founded semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'logic programs', u'Method'), (u'well-founded semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'inconsistency handling', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'open-world based ontology languages')], [(u'ontology axioms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rules'), (u'rules', u'PART-OF', u'stable model semantics')], [(u'well-founded semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge bases'), (u'OWL-based semantics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'well-founded semantics'), (u'well-founded semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'logic programs')]]
sentences: [u'With the advent of the Semantic Web , the question becomes important how to best combine open-world based ontology languages , like OWL , with closed-world rules paradigms .', u'One of the most mature proposals for this combination is known as Hybrid MKNF knowledge bases [ 11 ] , which is based on an adaptation of the stable model semantics to knowledge bases consisting of ontology axioms and rules .', u'In this paper , we propose a well-founded semantics for such knowledge bases which promises to provide better efficiency of reasoning , which is compatible both with the OWL-based semantics and the traditional well-founded semantics for logic programs , and which surpasses previous proposals for such a well-founded semantics by avoiding some issues related to inconsistency handling .']

sentences: [u'A method includes performing a lookup using a key into a root node of a multi-tier data structure , to find a partition for performing an insert .', u'A lookup for the key is performed on a first level index that is part of a linked data structure .', u'A payload or reference is added to the linked data structure based on data structure criterion , otherwise the key and the payload are added to the linked data structure if the key is not found .', u'A new first level index is created and added to the linked data structure upon the linked data structure remaining unchanged .', u'The key and the payload or reference are added to the new index .', u'Based on merge criterion , a new second level index is created and a portion of content from selected first level and second level indexes are merged for combining into the new second level index .']

sentences: [u'The amount of available Linked Data on the Web is increasing , and data providers start to publish statistical datasets that comprise numerical data .', u'Such statistical datasets differ significantly from the currently predominant network-style data published on the Web .', u'We explore the possibility of integrating statistical data from multiple Linked Data sources .', u'We provide a mapping from statistical Linked Data into the Multidimensional Model used in data warehouses .', u'We use an extract-transform-load ( ETL ) pipeline to convert statistical Linked Data into a format suitable for loading into an open-source OLAP system , and thus demonstrate how standard OLAP infrastructure can be used for elaborate querying and visualisation of integrated statistical Linked Data .', u'We discuss lessons learned from three experiments and identify areas which require future work to ultimately arrive at a well-interlinked set of statistical data from multiple sources which is processable with standard OLAP systems .']

sentences: [u'The evolution of multimedia technology and the Internet boost the multimedia sharing and searching activities among social networks .', u'The requirements of semantic multimedia retrieval goes far beyond those provided by the text-based search engines technology .', u'Here , we present an collaborative approach that enables the semantic search of the multimedia objects by the collective discovery and meaningful indexing of their semantic concepts .', u"Through the successive use of our model , semantic concepts can be discovered and incorporated by analyzing the users ' search queries , relevance feedback and selection patterns .", u'Eventually , through the growth and evolution of the index hierarchy , the semantic index can be dynamically constructed , validated , and naturally built-up towards the expectation of the social network .']

sentences: [u'The central problem of automatic retrieval from unformatted text is that computational devices are not adequately trained to look for associated information .', u'However for complete understanding and information retrieval , a complete artificial intelligence would have to be built .', u'This paper describes a method for achieving significant information retrieval by using a semantic search engine .', u'The underlying semantic information is stored in a network of clarified words , linked by logical connections .', u'We employ simple scoring techniques on collections of paths in this network to establish a degree of relevance between a document and a clarified search criterion .', u'This technique has been applied with success to test examples and can be easily scaled up to search large documents .']

sentences: [u'The Royal Institute Elcano ( Real Instituto Elcano ) in Spain is a prestigious independent political institute whose mission is to comment on the political situation in the world focusing on its relation to Spain .', u'As part of its dissemination strategy it operates a public website .', u"In this paper we present and evaluate the application of a semantic search engine to improve access to the Institute 's content : instead of retrieving documents based on user queries of keywords , the system accepts queries in natural language and returns answers rather than links to documents .", u'Topics that will be discussed include ontology construction , automatic ontology population , semantic access through a natural language interface and a failure analysis .']

sentences: [u'Semantic search service is generally considered to include text search , audio search , and video search .', u'The annotation of a video is crucial to the success of video search and retrieval .', u'With the precise annotation of video files and their semantic reasoning , more accurate search results according to the users query intention can be obtained .', u'In this paper , a prototype of such a video annotation system , called Semantic Video Annotation System ( SVAS ) , is presented .', u'SVAS uses a three-level annotation architecture and a semantic video search language called Semantic Query Description Language for Video ( SQDL-V ) .', u'SQDL-V engine based on SVAS is able to return more accurate search results in comparison to the formal video search method .']

sentences: [u'Many design considerations must be addressed in order to provide researchers with full text and semantic search of unstructured healthcare data such as clinical notes and reports .', u'Institutions looking at providing this functionality must also address the big data aspects of their unstructured corpora .', u'Because these systems are complex and demand a non-trivial investment , there is an incentive to make the system capable of servicing future needs as well , further complicating the design .', u'We present architectural best practices as lessons learned in the design and implementation NLP-PIER ( Patient Information Extraction for Research ) , a scalable , extensible , and secure system for processing , indexing , and searching clinical notes at the University of Minnesota .']

entities: [[(u'QEF', u'Method'), (u'query evaluation framework', u'Method'), (u'grid', u'Task')], [(u'QEF', u'Method'), (u'scientific visualization', u'Task'), (u'web service semantic search engine', u'Method')], [(u'algebraic operators', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'schedule grid nodes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query evaluation', u'Task'), (u'grid environment conditions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'epfl', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ch', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'This paper describes QEF a query evaluation framework designed to support complex applications on the grid .', u'QEF has been extended to support querying within a number of different applications , including supporting scientific visualization and implementing a web service semantic search engine .', u'Application requests take a form of a workflow in which tasks are represented as algebraic operators and specific data types are enveloped into a common tuple structure .', u'The implemented system is automatically deployed into schedule grid nodes and autonomously manages query evaluation according to grid environment conditions .', u'The generality of our approach has been tested with a number of applications leading to a full grid web service implementation available at http : //codims .', u'epfl .', u'ch .']

sentences: [u"Popular techniques used in today 's Web search engines and digital libraries for retrieving and ranking scientific publications have foundations in modern information retrieval .", u'Information and users in the scientific research communities have their own characteristics , however , they have not been sufficiently exploited in existing retrieval and ranking methods .', u'We present a semantic search engine , IRIS2 , which represents the semantic entities and their relations using ontologies and knowledge bases .', u"It utilises a ranking method based on the `` rational research '' model , which restores an elegant idea that a researcher does rational research in an academic environment .", u'We explain in detail the design and implementation of the IRIS2 prototype and compare its retrieving and ranking performance with existing methods .']

entities: [[(u'distributed system', u'Method')], [(u'search techniques', u'Method'), (u'content based image retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'newel image retrieval framework', u'Method'), (u'content similarity search', u'Task'), (u'semantic search', u'Task'), (u'distributed environment', u'Task')], [(u'image feature vectors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed hash tables', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'locality sensitive hashing', u'Method')], [(u'node', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'global information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'recall rate', u'Metric'), (u'load balance', u'Metric')]]

sentences: [u'Since lots of data is stored in datacenters , it is difficult to locate data in such a distributed system .', u'However , traditional search techniques can not satisfy the requirements of content based image retrieval ( CBIR ) .', u'In this paper , we present the newel image retrieval framework which can efficiently support content similarity search and semantic search in the distributed environment .', u'Its key idea is to integrate image feature vectors into distributed hash tables ( DHTs ) by exploiting the property of locality sensitive hashing ( LSH ) .', u'Thus , the similar images are more likely gathered into the same node without the knowledge of any global information .', u'We show that our approach yields high recall rate , keeps load balance and only requires a few number of hops .']

relations: [[(u'precision', u'CONJUNCTION', u'recall'), (u'recall', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'semantic search engine')], [(u'scheme/ algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology based indexing'), (u'scheme/ algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieval'), (u'ontology based indexing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'retrieval')], [(u'indexing algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies'), (u'precision', u'CONJUNCTION', u'recall')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Various researchers have recognized that ontology based retrieval is one of the best in terms of precision and recall for semantic search engine .', u'However , they did not specify explicitly any scheme/ algorithm for ontology based indexing and retrieval .', u'This motivates us to conceive a proposal that includes ( a ) suggesting indexing algorithm to effectively maintain ontologies , ( b ) suggesting retrieving algorithm to process user query and produce results with better precision and recall .', u'The proposed indexing algorithm has been tested manually considering a sample of ten OWL ontologies of mammal domain but presented only a result of two ontologies due to space constraint .', u'Finally , the proposed retrieval algorithms have also been validated against three user queries .']

sentences: [u'Abstract # R # # N # # R # # N # ActiveMath is a complex web-based adaptive learning environment with a number of components and interactive learning tools .', u'The basis for handling semantics of learning content is provided by its semantic ( mathematics ) content markup , which is additionally annotated with educational metadata .', u'Several components , tools and external services can make use of that content markup , eg , a course generator , a semantic search engine and user input evaluation services .', u'The components and services have to communicate , pass content and state changes , actions , etc including mathematical semantics and educational markup .', u'The novel event infrastructure supports this communication .', u"This paper focuses on the usage of the content 's semantics by selected novel components and sketches the communication ."]

sentences: [u"WebSphere Information Integrator OmniFind Edition is IBM 's platform for enterprise search and text analysis .", u"An important part of IBM 's efforts in this area is the Unstructured Information Management Architecture ( UIMA ) , an open architecture that streamlines and simplifies the development and deployment of text analysis technology .", u'The article describes the OmniFind approach to semantic search , which allows using concepts and relationships detected by UIMA components for enterprise search users .', u'A network of partners is building solutions like Automotive Quality Early Warning or Public Image Monitoring on top of OmniFind and UIMA .', u'The article describes approaches , technologies and processes that help to build up and use the domain knowledge necessary for these kinds of solutions .']

sentences: [u'With the rapid growth of resources , how to make massive literature retrieval effectively has become a problem to be solved .', u'In this paper , we mainly introduced and analyzed the retrieval methods , such as the parallel retrieval , the distributional retrieval , the semantic retrieval and the parallel massive data retrieval .', u'In addition , we also gave the advantages and disadvantages of them .', u'Through the analysis and research , we find that the semantic search based on cloud computing has advantages in terms of accuracy , but the distributed retrieval and the parallel massive retrieval based on Map/Reduce can have higher efficiency .', u'We hope to find a method that can balance the accuracy with efficiency through combine the existing methods .']

sentences: [u'This vision paper describes an effort to develop Onto TEMAS , an Ontology-based TEaching MAterials Search engine .', u'This special purpose search engine combines statistical and semantic search methods to provide a central search interface and directory for educators who wish to distribute , share and find curriculum and course preparation materials .', u'Onto TEMAS uses an educational materials ontology to crawl the Web for relevant teaching materials and then asks authors for permission to make the materials available to others .', u'It also allows authors to register and publish materials that might not be available through the Web .', u'This proactive approach makes it possible for authors to share their content in an intuitive environment for maximized productivity .']

sentences: [u'Unified Financial Portfolio is a financial application that applies concepts of information retrieval and Web 2.0 to provide a better understanding of the market trends taking into account the users information needs .', u'It integrates and retrieves non-structured content related to the financial domain , from social networks , Stock Exchange and newspapers .', u'The main contributions of this work are the software architecture , the content based semantic search model and the use of Big Data technology .', u'The model is based on the vector-space model , including a retrieval weighting algorithm using domain specific considerations .', u'This paper presents the application evaluation , using a large amount of unstructured content from dynamic and social web content sources .']

sentences: [u'Objective : To facilitate the integration and retrieval of information in Traditional Chinese Medicine ( TCM ) pharmaceutics , a semantic search system named TCMSearch was designed and implemented.To enable the semantic integration and consistent access of distributed and heterogeneous databases , semantic views were proposed to define the mappings between relational databases and ontologies.Guided by semantic views , the system translated user-posed semantic queries into SQL queries against source databases , and generated the semantic encapsulation of SQL results.The system constructed semantic index for textual content , to enable concept-based content retrieval.By using these ontology-driven methods , the system achieved better performance in precision and recall than keyword-based search systems.After its deployment , the system provided intelligent search services to domain experts .']

sentences: [u'Embodiments facilitate greater flexibility in definition of user segments for targeted advertising , by employing indexed semantic user profiles .', u'Semantic user profiles are built through extraction of online user behavior data such as user search queries and page views , and include user interest information that is inferred based on user behavior .', u'Semantic user profiles are then indexed to facilitate search for a set of users that fit specified semantic search terms .', u'Search results for semantic profiles are ranked according to a ranking model developed through machine learning .', u'In some embodiments , building and indexing of semantic profiles and learning of the ranking model is performed offline to facilitate more efficient online processing of queries .']

sentences: [u'In the constantly expanding Semantic Web , the domain of describing offers and concepts related to them plays an important role .', u'The use of ontologies provides a means for automated processing of knowledge , which is expressed in a standardized representation language .', u'We argue that the M 3 model can be repre- sented in OWL , a standard ontology language .', u'We show the benefits of such a rep- resentation .', u'Several ontologies are shown , which can complement the descriptions made in M 3 .', u'We propose a translation of the M 3 model and the M3-XML data for- mat into an OWL-based ontology .', u'We also show exemplary reasoning tasks , which could be accomplished with standard description logic reasoners .', u'Some problems with using ontologies for expressing offers are also described .']

sentences: [u"Most tools for visualizing Semantic Web data structure the representation according to the concept definitions and interrelations that constitute the ontology 's vocabulary .", u'Instances are often treated as somewhat peripheral information , when considered at all .', u'The visualization of instance-level data poses different but significant challenges as instances will often be orders of magnitude more numerous than the concept definitions that give them machine-processable meaning .', u'We present a visualization technique designed to visualize large instance sets and the relations that connect them .', u'This visualization uses both node-link and adjacency matrix representations of graphs to visualize different parts of the data depending on their semantic and local structural properties , exploiting ontological knowledge to drive the layout of , and navigation in , the visualization .']

sentences: [u'In order to search the deep data and use it in the web resources , based on the analyses of the question in using the search engine to get web resources , to build an ontology model of web resource to mark the web resources is presented by using the technology of semantic web and web service , and to build a mediation data services application model which used web service to implement the web resource mediation data services by combined with the web service management agent.Finally , the validity and the feasibility of the web resource mediation data services are validated by experimentation , so it will help user to get and share web resources data more effectively than ever in the multiform and great deal of web resources environment .']
