sentences: [u'Nowadays , we can observe that finding answers on social networks is a hard and time-consuming task .', u'The main contribution of this article is the creation of a model and algorithm that allows users to find answers to their questions using a spontaneous social network called Mingle .', u'This algorithm uses the Mingle ontology-based knowledge base to find expert users .', u'To achieve this , two important steps are taken : Mingle ontology is updated to support user-oriented expertise and a detailed model is created for the given algorithm .', u'This model was created considering other three similar applications and algorithms .', u'Moreover , we used a semantic web framework .', u'In the end , an evaluation using real-life scenarios is applied to evaluate if the created algorithm meets the initial goals .']

entities: [[(u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'ontology language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'ontology models', u'Method')], [(u'knowledge base system', u'Method')], [(u'RDF models', u'Method'), (u'structural differences', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDFS entailment rules', u'Method')], [(u'RDF models', u'Method'), (u'data size', u'Metric'), (u'upload time', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'change detection', u'Method'), (u'RDF reasoning', u'Method'), (u'backward chaining strategy', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'real-life RDF datasets', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'RDF', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology language')], [], [], [], [], [(u'data size', u'CONJUNCTION', u'upload time')], [(u'RDF reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'change detection'), (u'backward chaining strategy', u'USED-FOR', u'change detection')], []]
sentences: [u'RDF is widely used as the ontology language for representing metadata on the semantic web .', u'Since ontology models the real-world , ontology changes overtime .', u'Thus , it is very important to detect and analyze changes in knowledge base system .', u'Earlier studies on detecting changes between RDF models focused on the structural differences .', u'Some techniques which reduce the size of the delta by considering the RDFS entailment rules have been introduced .', u'However , inferencing with RDF models increases data size and upload time .', u'In this paper , we propose a new change detection using RDF reasoning that only computes a small part of the implied triples using backward chaining strategy .', u'We show that our approach efficiently detects changes through experiments with real-life RDF datasets .']

relations: [[(u'ontology evolution', u'USED-FOR', u'real world applications')], [(u'enrichment manner', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology evolution')], [], [], [(u'ontology spectrum', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology stability')], [(u'semantic similarity measures', u'USED-FOR', u'method'), (u'semantic similarity measures', u'CONJUNCTION', u'global measure'), (u'global measure', u'USED-FOR', u'method'), (u'ontology spectrum', u'USED-FOR', u'method'), (u'ontology spectrum', u'CONJUNCTION', u'global measure')]]
sentences: [u'the context of ontology evolution in real world applications , particularly in the field of semantic web , ontologies are called to change in their structure as well as their semantic .', u'It is necessary to evaluate the quality based on stability to make analysis to get appropriate enrichment manner for ontology evolution .', u'In this paper , we introduce a new approach with that aims making three contributions .', u'First , we present a new aspect of ontology quality based on its stability .', u'Second , we present a new notion called ontology spectrum which can be used for analyzing ontology stability .', u'Third , we provide an experimental method to evaluate this new aspect of quality within two processes : individual measure based on semantic similarity measures and global measure based on ontology spectrum .']

entities: [[(u'web documents', u'Material'), (u'markup languages', u'Material'), (u'WWW', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'WWW', u'Method'), (u'human consumption', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'WEB', u'Method'), (u'web documents', u'Material'), (u'human intervention', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'layered architecture', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web Layered cake', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'interface layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Layered cake', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'WWW', u'USED-FOR', u'human consumption')], []]
sentences: [u'The WWW ( World Wide Web ) containing volumes of web documents developed in HTML and other markup languages does provides us feature of browsing through interlinked documents and exploring the entire WWW .', u'However the entire WWW is appropriate for human consumption , but the other associated features need the WEB to be made Semantic where the web documents are interpreted by the machines and thus minimizing the need for human intervention .', u'Addressing the above need Tim Berners-Lee and W3C consortium has suggested a layered architecture .This paper proposes to critically evaluate the functional aspects of the Semantic Web Layered cake and suggests inclusion of an interface layer to interchange data in an interoperable format amongst the layers of the Semantic Layered cake .']

sentences: [u'The main technical objectives of work package 1 are to develop a first version of a Legal Knowledge Interchange Format ( LKIF ) , building upon emerging XML-based standards of the Semantic Web , including RDF and OWL , and Application Program Interfaces ( APIs ) for interacting with legal knowledge systems .', u'The LKIF will apply the state of the art in the field of Artificial Intelligence and Law , taking into account business and application requirements .', u'This deliverable reports on the specification of syntax and semantics of the LKIF language , and should be read in conjunction with deliverable D1.4 on the LKIF ontologies .', u'The proposed LKIF adds a terminology for deontic statements , and a special LKIF rule language to existing fragments of OWL and the rule language SWRL .']

sentences: [u'The widespread welcome to the social web in recentyears has led to the emergence of a new source of userinformation which is a result of users everydayactivities and contributions on social networks.Leveraging this information within learningenvironments bears beneficial opportunities that cani ) bring the educational ( what learners learn ineducational settings ) and social ( what they performwithin their social networks ) worlds closer , and ii ) support further recommendation and personalizationservices based on more real data about learners.This information , however , is neither explicitlyavailable nor formally represented on the social webparadigm , an attribute of the social web regarded asbeing a walled garden .', u'In this paper , we propose aframework that leverages semantic web technologiesto locate and extract such data , originating frommultiple resources on the social web , to supportadvanced learning services such as personalized peerrecommendation .']

sentences: [u'an audience driven approach to website design , the requirements of the different audiences are modeled as separated tiny conceptual schemas comparable to views .', u'We present a new approach to integrate these conceptual views .', u'The preparation for the integration is already done during the design phase itself .', u'Semantic information about the concepts used during concep tual modeling is stored in an ontology .', u'Later on , the ontology is used to do the actual integration .', u'This approach has several advantages .', u'The role of an overall domain expert is limited ; the ontology can be used to assist the designer during the modeling process ; the ontology can be reused in other designs ; and the use of an ontology paves the way for the semantic web .']

sentences: [u"Many web search engines retrieve enormous amounts of irrelevant information in answer to users 'queries .", u'The semantic web provides a promising approach to improve search operation .', u'This paper is to show how to measure the closeness ( relevancy ) of retrieved web sites to user query-concepts and re-rank them accordingly .', u'Therefore paper proposed a new relevancy measure to re-rank retrieved documents .', u"We termed the approach `` ontology concepts '' and it on the domain of electronic commerce .", u'Results suggested that we could re-rank the retrieved documents ( web sites ) according to their relevancy to the search query .', u"This paper proposed a method depends on the frequency of the `` ontology concepts '' in the retrieved documents and uses this to compute their relevancy"]

sentences: [u'A typical user , when learning , annotates text , figures and other contents , so as to better highlight , memorize , and retrieve relevant information .', u'A few annotation programs exist but either change the contents of the document , or do not support distance learning through the web .', u'We report work-in-progress on a u ser- c entered a nnotation t ool ( UCAT ) which allows students to annotate , following their personal styles , ( using different icons , colors and signed versions ) any document belonging to authorware within a course .', u'We have chosen Amaya as the working environment since , belonging to the World Wide Web Consortium ( W3C ) , it complies with the semantic web specifications on document formats , like RDF .', u'An example of the deployment of UCAT will be shown in the paper .']

sentences: [u'Pervasive or ubiquitous computing enlarged traditional computing setting into the human layer of the earth .', u'World Wide Web is the biggest digital information layer , hence it is unavoidable to stretch and integrate such an information layer over this new enlarged computing setting .', u'It is reasonable to call such enlarged Web environment as uWeb , UbiquitousWeb .', u'In this paper we propose an approach and a service oriented model for exploiting the vast amount of knowledge contained by the World Wide Web for context-aware pervasive computing environments.Machine understandability of web information is the key challenge for our purpose , since a typical pervasive computing setting covers variety of applications and devices with different characteristics.Our approach and model is based on the semantic web activities , particularly on embedded semantics .']

sentences: [u'Learning object repositories play a key role in the vision of reusable learning contents and learning designs , serving as providers for learning-oriented artefacts .', u'Nevertheless , current metadata creation practices result in artefact collections that lack machine-understandable metadata , which seriously hampers opportunities for reuse .', u'Semantic Web ontologies can be used to improve the quality of learning object metadata records , but they are not enough by themselves .', u'In order to respond to requests by returning adequate resources , the repository is required to be aware of the amount , type and quality of the metadata records it stores .', u"The design of a learning object repository approach to `` semantic lifecycle '' is described and illustrated through the concrete architecture of the prototype of the SLOR ( semantic learning object repository ) ."]

sentences: [u'Available code search engines provide typically coarse-grained lexical search .', u'To address this limitation we present SE-CodeSearch , a Semantic Web-based approach for Internet-scale source code search .', u'It uses an ontological representation of source code facts and analysis knowledge to complete missing information using inference engine .', u'This approach allows us to reason and search across project boundaries containing often incomplete code fragments extracted in a one-pass and no-order manner .', u'The infrastructure provides a scalable approach to process and query across large code bases mined from software repositories and code fragments found online .', u'We have implemented our SE-CodeSearch as part of SE-Advisor framework to demonstrate the scalability and applicability of our Internet-scale code search in a software maintenance context .']

sentences: [u'Description logics have emerged as one of the most successful formalisms for knowledge representation and reasoning .', u'They are now widely used as a basis for ontologies in the Semantic Web .', u'To extend and analyse ontologies , automated methods for knowledge acquisition and mining are being sought for .', u'Despite its importance for knowledge engineers , the learning problem in description logics has not been investigated as deeply as its counterpart for logic programs. # R # # N # # R # # N # We propose the novel idea of applying evolutionary inspired methods to solve this task .', u'In particular , we show how Genetic Programming can be applied to the learning problem in description logics and combine it with techniques from Inductive Logic Programming .', u'We base our algorithm on thorough theoretical foundations and present a preliminary evaluation .']

sentences: [u'With the development of computer science and the technology of PC , the traditional desktop searching and ranking method could not satisfy the requirement of user .', u'This paper provides a ranking model for the desktop resource searching based on metadata in the environment of semantic desktop , then after the study of PageRank algorithm and the theory of authority transfer graph , a new index ranking algorithm is provided .', u'The experiment proves that this ranking method could effectively reflect the priority of the researching results and the relationship between the query and the results .', u'The time and space efficiency of this method could also meet the capability of todays normal computers .', u'This method could work for semantic Web , desktop searching and other correlative domains .']

sentences: [u'Ontologies are presently considered one of the semantic web columns due to the benefits they provide in representing formal knowledge .', u'At the same time , while the ontologies field develops so does the amount of non-experts users in tag languages .', u'Thus , emerges the need of tools to allow simple interaction with the user , in order to facilitate the creation and design of specified domain ontologies .', u'OntoACTION is presenting in this work which is a software that allows the users to define active ontologies by means of graph and tag languages , translating them into axioms that a reazoner engine of ACTION ontologies can process .', u'To test OntoACTION the climate phenomenal ontologies of the Servicio de Meteorologia de la Aviacion Militar Bolivariana de Venezuela was specify']

sentences: [u'Information and communication infrastructures underwent a rapid and extreme decentralization process over the past decade : From a world of statically and partially connected central servers rose an in- tricate web of millions of information sources loosely connecting one to another .', u'Today , we expect to witness the extension of this revolution with the wide adoption of meta-data standards like RDF or OWL un- derpinning the creation of a semantic web .', u'Again , we hope for global properties to emerge from a multiplicity of pair-wise , local interactions , resulting eventually in a self-stabilizing semantic infrastructure .', u'This pa- per represents an effort to summarize the conditions under which this revolution would take place as well as an attempt to underline its main properties , limitations and possible applications .']

sentences: [u'This project describes the creation of a software tool that allows to create web pages that are equipped with semantic content by utilizing and combining current technologies , giving users who are unfamiliar with technologies of representation of semantic information a system to abstract the process of inclusion of this information using a conceptual model that is easiest to understand .', u'This system will constitute an important contribution to the set of existing tools related to Semantic Web .', u'Although there are various systems and languages to publish semantic data on the web , a common drawback of these systems is that they work in an asylum mode and are not integrated as part of the current process of content creation for the web .']

sentences: [u'Ontology is an effective conceptualism commonly used for the semantic Web .', u'Fuzzy logic can be incorporated to ontology to represent uncertainty information .', u'Typically , fuzzy ontology is generated from a predefined concept hierarchy .', u'However , to construct a concept hierarchy for a certain domain can be a difficult and tedious task .', u'To tackle this problem , this paper proposes the FOGA ( fuzzy ontology generation framework ) for automatic generation of fuzzy ontology on uncertainty information .', u'The FOGA framework comprises the following components : fuzzy formal concept analysis , concept hierarchy generation , and fuzzy ontology generation .', u'We also discuss approximating reasoning for incremental enrichment of the ontology with new upcoming data .', u'Finally , a fuzzy-based technique for integrating other attributes of database to the ontology is proposed']

sentences: [u'With the development of semantic web , ontology inconsistent problem has been one of the most important research directions of ontology alliance .', u'Based on the difference of research method and problem domain , there are a serial of solutions , among which , Model-based Diagnosis has been widely used in the domain of constructive knowledge description .', u'To obtain efficient methods of diagnosis , local diagnosis technology uses information about the structural knowledge of domain to contract problem reasoning space .', u'On the basis of local diagnosis technology , this paper proposes an innocent diagnosis method , which ulteriorly contract problem reasoning space through deleting the truth assumables proved by new observation , presents an E_DAG figure representation method of inconsistent problem and shows its working principle through the MadCows ontology example at the end .']

sentences: [u'The exchange of semantically rich digital content over distributed applications facilitates knowledge exchanges in mixed human / machine environments as envisaged by scenarios within the scope of Ambient Intelligence and Semantic Web .', u'For this class of domain , we introduce a semantically annotated data structure ( KCO ) and a distributed , layered protocol-based system architecture ( KCCA , KCTP ) that is designed for loosely coupled , semantically rich content applications .', u'We relate this to requirements of commercial companies for sharing , exchanging and trading knowledge and content .', u'Characteristics of the distributed system architecture are outlined .', u'The argument is that by defining a reasonable set of semantics for manipulating the content objects in question , one offers a stage at which a market of providers and consumers can develop and is facilitated']

sentences: [u'Capturing and exploiting knowledge is at the heart of several important problems such as decision making , the semantic web , and intelligent agents .', u'The captured knowledge must be accessible to subject matter experts so that the knowledge can be easily extended , queried , and debugged .', u'In our previous work to meet this objective , we created a knowledge-authoring system based on graphical assembly from components that allowed acquisition of an interestingly broad class of axioms .', u'In this paper , we explore the question : can we expand the axiom classes acquired by building on our existing graphical methods and still retain simplicity so that people with minimal training in knowledge representation can use it ?', u'Specifically , we present techniques used to capture ternary relations , classification rules , constraints , and if-then rules .']

sentences: [u'Semantic query optimization ( SQO ) has been proved to be quite useful in various applications ( e.g. , data integration , graphical query generators , caching , etc . )', u'and has been extensively studied for relational , deductive , object , and XML databases .', u'However , less attention to SQO has been devoted in the context of the Semantic Web .', u'In this paper , we present sound and complete algorithms for the containment and minimization of RDF/S query patterns .', u'More precisely , we consider two widely used RDF/S query fragments supporting pattern matching at the data , but also , at the schema level .', u'To this end , we advocate a logic framework for capturing the RDF/S data model and semantics and we employ well-established techniques proposed in the relational context , in particular , the Chase and Backchase algorithms .']

entities: [[(u'e-learning system', u'Method'), (u'online uniform material', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'intelligent e-learning', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'curriculum sequence technology', u'Method')], [(u'Technologies', u'Generic'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'web mining', u'Task'), (u'adaptive information filtering', u'Task'), (u'intelligent collaborative learning', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Current e-learning system is still in the form collection of online uniform material for individual access without guidance on how to learn from it effectively .', u'Such condition will not challenge smart students to learn deeper that force them to abandon the system .', u'To increase the quality of the system , intelligent e-learning must be used .', u'In this kind of system , it can personalize its users that the learning materials recommended to a student will be different from the ones recommended to others students based on their profiles .', u'Such system also offers curriculum sequence technology which enables the students to plan their own learning sequence .', u'Technologies that can be used to develop such system include : web mining , adaptive information filtering , intelligent collaborative learning , and semantic web']

entities: [[(u'semantic web models', u'Method'), (u'expert knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'detailed domain information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'natural language interface', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic')], [(u'NLION', u'Method'), (u'Natural Language Interface', u'Method'), (u'querying ONtologies', u'Task'), (u'natural language query', u'Material'), (u'SPARQL query', u'Material')], [(u'semantic relation tagging', u'Method')], [(u'NLION effectiveness', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic web models', u'USED-FOR', u'expert knowledge')], [], [], [(u'NLION', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Natural Language Interface'), (u'Natural Language Interface', u'USED-FOR', u'querying ONtologies'), (u'Natural Language Interface', u'USED-FOR', u'natural language query')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Use of semantic web models for representing expert knowledge about a domain as an ontology is becoming increasingly common .', u'However , since these ontologies contain detailed domain information in a formal specification , it can not be easily understood by a casual user .', u'Providing a natural language interface to ontologies will help such users to retrieve the required information and will further enable use of these ontologies in sophisticated applications .', u'This paper presents NLION , a Natural Language Interface for querying ONtologies , which accepts a natural language query and outputs a SPARQL query .', u'For achieving this , we use semantic relation tagging to recognize the meaning of the user query with respect to the target ontology .', u'NLION effectiveness was analyzed and it was found to be 61.60 % .']

entities: [[(u'domain-specific languages', u'Material')], [(u'languages', u'Generic')], [(u'Generic features of languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'special-purpose languages', u'Material')], [(u'feature', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'partial programs', u'Method'), (u'encapsulated entities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'language-independent approach', u'Method')], [(u'Reuseware Composition Framework', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'reuse conceptmodules', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'language-independent approach', u'USED-FOR', u'constructs')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The trend toward domain-specific languages leads to an ever-growing plethora of highly specialized languages .', u'Developers of such languages focus on their specific domains rather than on technical challenges of language design .', u'Generic features of languages are rarely included in special-purpose languages .', u'One very important feature is the ability to formulate partial programs in separate encapsulated entities , which can be composed into complete programs in a well-defined manner .', u'This paper presents a language-independent approach for adding useful constructs for defining components .', u'We discuss the underlying concepts and describe a composition environment and tool supporting these ideas the Reuseware Composition Framework .', u'To evaluate our approach we enrich the ( Semantic ) Web query language Xcerpt with an additional useful reuse conceptmodules .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'Techniques', u'Generic'), (u'semantic wiki systems', u'Method'), (u'social tagging of weblogs', u'Method'), (u'web 2.0 applications', u'Task')], [(u'metainformation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'social system', u'Method')], [(u'semantic wiki system', u'Method'), (u'TaOPis', u'Method'), (u'knowledge management', u'Task'), (u'dynamic knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'unwanted behavior', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic social web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web 3.0')], [(u'semantic wiki systems', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social tagging of weblogs'), (u'social tagging of weblogs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web 2.0 applications')], [(u'social system', u'USED-FOR', u'metainformation'), (u'social system', u'USED-FOR', u'systems')], [(u'TaOPis', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic wiki system')], []]
sentences: [u'The semantic social web or web 3.0 is the movement of integrating popular social web ( web 2.0 ) applications with ideas from the semantic web .', u'Techniques like semantic wiki systems , social tagging of weblogs and other web 2.0 applications as well as FOAF ( Friend of a Friend ) specifications are some of the results of this movement .', u'Since metainformation acquired by such systems depends mostly on the social system interacting with them it is almost certain that inconsistencies will emerge .', u'We analyze the case of a semantic wiki system ( TaOPis ) dealing mostly with knowledge management and show how this inconsistencies can yield problems for eventual agents searching the dynamic knowledge base .', u'In the end we give some guidelines and possible solutions for avoiding such unwanted behavior .']

entities: [[(u'query languages', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method')], [(u'query language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query engine', u'Method'), (u'evaluation strategy', u'Method')], [(u'RDF repositories', u'Method'), (u'query capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'manual interaction', u'Material'), (u'query execution time', u'Metric'), (u'SPARQL query graph model', u'Method'), (u'query processing', u'Task')], [(u'SQGM', u'Method'), (u'transformations rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heuristics', u'Method'), (u'query execution plan', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'SPARQL query graph model', u'USED-FOR', u'query processing')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web community has proposed several query languages for RDF before the World Wide Web Consortium started to standardize SPARQL .', u'Due to the declarative nature of the query language , a query engine should be responsible to choose an efficient evaluation strategy .', u'Although all RDF repositories provide query capabilities , some of them require manual interaction to reduce query execution time by several orders of magnitude. # R # # N # # R # # N # In this paper , we propose the SPARQL query graph model ( SQGM ) supporting all phases of query processing .', u'On top of the SQGM we defined transformations rules to simplify and to rewrite a query .', u'Based on these rules we developed heuristics to achieve an efficient query execution plan .', u'Experiments illustrate the potential of our approach .']

entities: [[(u'formal mathematical knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'XML', u'Method'), (u'mathematical documents', u'Material'), (u'web-publishing mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'stylesheets', u'Material'), (u'notational and stylistic issues', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'XML technology', u'Method'), (u'structured , content oriented information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Logical Frameworks', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'central authority', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'The eXtensible Markup Language ( XML ) opens the possibility to start anew , on a solid technological ground , the ambitious goal of developing a suitable technologyf or the creation and maintenance of a virtual , distributed , hypertextual library of formal mathematical knowledge .', u'In particular , XML provides a central technology for storing , retrieving and processing mathematical documents , comprising sophisticated web-publishing mechanisms ( stylesheets ) covering notational and stylistic issues .', u'By the application of XML technology to the large repositories of structured , content oriented information offered by Logical Frameworks we meet the ultimate goal of the Semantic Web , that is to allow machines the sharing and exploitation of knowledge in the Web way , i.e .', u'without central authority , with few basic rules , in a scalable , adaptable , extensible manner .']

entities: [[(u'Community web sites', u'Material')], [(u'portal', u'Generic')], [], [(u'framework', u'Generic')], [(u'Semantic Web standards', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'OntoWeb com- munity portal', u'Material')], [(u'web site management system', u'Method')], [], [(u'Ontologies', u'Material'), (u'sophistication', u'Metric'), (u'web information integration', u'Task'), (u'web site management', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'Ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'web information integration')]]
sentences: [u'Community web sites exhibit the property that multiple content providers exist .', u'Of course , any portal is only as useful as the quality and amount of its content .', u'Developing original content is time consuming and expensive .', u'To offset the cost , we present a novel framework , viz .', u'SEAL ( SEmantic portAL ) , that builds on Semantic Web standards .', u'We illustrate our approach with examples from the OntoWeb com- munity portal .', u'Community web sites exhibit two dominating properties : They often need to integrate many different information sources and they require an adequate web site management system .', u'SEAL exploits ontologies for fulfilling the requirements set forth by these two properties .', u'Ontologies provide a high level of sophistication for web information integration as well as for web site management .']

sentences: [u'In the Semantic Web , metadata and ontology for representing semantics and conceptual relationships of information resources are essential factors .', u'RDF and RDF Schema are the W3C standard models for describing metadata and ontology .', u'In this paper , we focus on a result of analyzing available query patterns considering both RDF and RDF Schema .', u'And we propose a structure to store and query using path information in graph models of RDF and RDF Schema .', u'The proposed structure supports whole query patterns fairly .', u'We can retrieve entities that are reached from a certain class , property , resource , or literal in RDF and RDF Schema without a loss of performance because of multiple joins with tables .', u'And , through encoding schemes , we determine easily hierarchical relationships between classes or properties .']

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'web pages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'posterior extraction', u'Task'), (u'SCORM Packages', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'manual metadata markup', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'automatic metadata markup', u'Task'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'context information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'linguistics rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'prototype implementation', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'linguistics rules', u'USED-FOR', u'context information')], []]
sentences: [u'This work describes an approach for the semi-automatic learning object metadata markup of course ? s web pages and their posterior extraction into SCORM Packages .', u'This is identified as the first step to recycle course ? s web pages with the full potential of the semantic web .', u'The key issue of this approach is to avoid as much as possible manual metadata markup .', u'To achieve this goal , the process of automatic metadata markup is provided with : ( i ) an ontology of course descriptions in OWL that will basically provide a sound specification of the diverse elements in a course and ( ii ) context information explicitly set up by linguistics rules .', u'A prototype implementation has been developed in Java for Spanish course ? s web pages .']

entities: [[(u'heterogeneous sources', u'Material'), (u'database research field', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'data integration research', u'Task')], [(u'semantic-based approach', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic-based Heterogeneous Relational Data Integration System', u'Method'), (u'SHRDIS', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mediated schema', u'Method'), (u'data source semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'global schema', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'local SQL queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous relational databases', u'Material')], [(u'SHRDIS', u'Method')], [(u'SHRDIS system', u'Method'), (u'scalability', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'SHRDIS', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic-based Heterogeneous Relational Data Integration System')], [(u'mediated schema', u'USED-FOR', u'data source semantics')], [], [], [(u'scalability', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'SHRDIS system')]]
sentences: [u'Integrating and querying data from heterogeneous sources is a hot research topic in database research field .', u'The emergence of the Semantic Web brings new paradigm shift of computing in data integration research where data is heterogeneous and distributed .', u'To solve the problem this paper proposes a semantic-based approach .', u'A Semantic-based Heterogeneous Relational Data Integration System , called SHRDIS , is presented .', u'In this system , ontology is used as the mediated schema for the representation of the data source semantics .', u'SPARQL queries over global schema are rewritten into local SQL queries that can be executed on heterogeneous relational databases .', u'The architecture and implementation of SHRDIS is illustrated in detail .', u'The experiment results show that the SHRDIS system has nice performance and scalability .']

entities: [[(u'information ecosystem', u'Task'), (u'scientometric indicators', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'web technologies', u'Method'), (u'scientometric indicators', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'scientometrics indicators', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information environment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'scientometric indicators', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'bibliometric indicators', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'web technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'scientometric indicators')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Purpose The purpose of this paper is to encourage recognition of the potential impact of an increasingly complicated information ecosystem on scientometric indicators .', u'Design/methodology/approach The paper considers how new web technologies have impacted the role of time in scientometric indicators .', u'Findings The paper suggests that it is important to be aware of the limitations of scientometrics indicators in an increasingly complicated information environment , although without a more developed semantic web there is little that can be done .', u'Practical implications Users of scientometric indicators should refrain from claiming too much confidence in them .', u'Originality/value The paper considers scientometric indicators at a finer granularity that usual , and will be of interest to anyone concerned the application of bibliometric indicators and the changing nature of scientific discourse .']

entities: [[(u'Information retrieval mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'web', u'Material')], [(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'data sources', u'Material'), (u'information flow', u'Material')], [(u'search system', u'Method')], [(u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'Method'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'semantic retrieval of information', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'web', u'USED-FOR', u'Information retrieval mechanisms')], [], [(u'Integrated Case And Relation Based Page Rank Algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'search system')], [(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic retrieval of information')]]
sentences: [u'Information retrieval mechanisms from the web become tedious as the amount of content is growing dynamically every day .', u'The semantic web has an idea of connecting , integrating and analyzing data from various data sources and forming a new information flow , hence a web of databases connected with each other and machines interacting with other machines to yield results which are user oriented and precise .', u"A New Integrated Case And Relation Based Page Rank Algorithm have been proposed to rank the results of a search system based on a user 's topic or query .", u'This paper proposes an optimized semantic searching of keywords represent by simulation an ontology with a proposed algorithm which ramifies the effective semantic retrieval of information which is easy to access and time saving .']

entities: [[(u'Problem statement', u'Task'), (u'IT industry', u'Task'), (u'impo rtance of ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'intelligent and personalized service system', u'Task')], [(u'wetlands', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'systematic management', u'Method'), (u'financial or professional management personnel', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'wetland environment context awareness data model', u'Method'), (u'lexical meaning', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology techniques', u'Method'), (u'application of wetland environment', u'Task'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'systematic management of the wetland environment', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'ontology techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'wetland environment context awareness data model'), (u'ontology techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'lexical meaning'), (u'ontology techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'application of wetland environment'), (u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'systematic management of the wetland environment')]]
sentences: [u'Problem statement : Due to recent advances in the IT industry , the impo rtance of ontology has increased as a tool of knowledge representation at home or abroad for implementation of intelligent and personalized service system such as next generation semantic web environment and ubiquitous computing environment .', u'But , although the importance of wetlands are being recognized , systematic management is still not enough due to in sufficiency of financial or professional management personnel .', u'Conclusion/Recommendations : Therefore , this study aims to analyze the information on the wetlands environment which provides a variety of human comfort , designs wetland environment context awareness data model by detecting lexical meaning and relationship between words using ontology techniques for the application of wetland environment and presents methods for systematic management of the wetland environment .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'personal information management', u'Task')], [(u'historical archive', u'Material'), (u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'search tasks', u'Task'), (u'storage and presentation of historical data', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'digitized archive documents', u'Material'), (u'text format', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'user-centric methodological approach', u'Method'), (u'historical archive', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web'), (u'Ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'personal information management')], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'search tasks')], [], [(u'user-centric methodological approach', u'USED-FOR', u'historical archive')], [(u'University of Athens Historical Archive', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach')]]
sentences: [u'Ontologies have been proven invaluable tools both for the semantic web and for personal information management .', u'In the context of a historical archive an ontology may provide meaningful and efficient support for search tasks as well as be used as a tool for storage and presentation of historical data .', u'The creation however of such an ontology is complex , since the digitized archive documents are not in text format and the concepts that must be captured may vary among different time periods .', u'This work presents a user-centric methodological approach for extracting the ontology of an historical archive focusing on the evaluation issues related to this process .', u'The approach is exemplified through cases from its application in the University of Athens Historical Archive .']

entities: [[(u'EEG/ERP ( Electroencephalography/Even-Related Potentials ) Portal', u'Method'), (u'storage and management of ERP experiments', u'Task')], [(u'protocols', u'Generic'), (u'software applications and/or hardware devices', u'Method')], [(u'protocols', u'Generic'), (u'XML files', u'Material'), (u'EEG/ERP portal database', u'Material')], [(u'ERP protocols', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'XML files', u'Material'), (u'LOB data', u'Material'), (u'semantic web output', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Oracle 11g database system', u'Method')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'ERP protocols', u'Method')], [(u'model', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'model', u'USED-FOR', u'ERP protocols')], []]
sentences: [u'The EEG/ERP ( Electroencephalography/Even-Related Potentials ) Portal serves for storage and management of ERP experiments .', u'The protocols describing these experiments are designed and implemented using various software applications and/or hardware devices .', u'Some protocols are kept in XML files and stored in the EEG/ERP portal database as LOB ( Large Object ) data types .', u'Since it is important for researchers to directly find details about design of the ERP protocols in the related XML files and it is also hard to use LOB data for generating the semantic web output , storage types provided by the Oracle 11g database system were investigated and compared .', u'Therefore a new model of storage of ERP protocols is introduced .', u'This model is finally simplified after analysis of results of performance tests .']

entities: [[(u'DF-ALC', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'DF-ALC', u'Method'), (u'decomposing ontology', u'Method'), (u'sub-ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'local reasoning algorithm', u'Method'), (u'gateways', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'local TBox', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'A DF-ALC ( Decomposing fuzzy ALC ) is proposed in this paper to satisfy the need for representing and reasoning with fuzzy ontologies in the context of semantic Web .', u'A DF-ALC is also proposed to satisfy the need for seeing the necessity of decomposing ontology into several sub-ontologies in order to optimize the fuzzy reasoning process. # R # # N # # R # # N # The main contribution of this work is to decompose the axioms of the ontology into sub-axioms according to a degree of certainty which is assigned to the fuzzy concepts and roles .', u'It is also to define the syntax and semantics and to propose a local reasoning algorithm and a way of using gateways to infer between local TBox .']

sentences: [u'This research explores relations between software artefacts and explicitly represented ( domain ) knowledge .', u'More specifically , we investigate ways in which domain knowledge ( represented as ontologies ) can support software engineering activities and , conversely , how software artefacts ( e.g. , programs , methods , and UML diagrams ) can support the creation of ontologies .', u'In our approach , class names , and class properties are the principal entities which are extracted from both sources .', u'We implemented a tool , called Facilitator , to support programmers and knowledge engineers when they develop ontologies or programs .', u'This tool provides a list of connections between the ontology and Java project , and provides reasons why these connections have been identified .', u'These connections are created by matching names , types , and superclass-subclass relationships .', u'Facilitator provides a range of semantic web enabled functionalities .']

entities: [[(u'SUMMARY', u'Method'), (u'global Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'Library name and subject authority files', u'Material'), (u'IFLA', u'Method'), (u'Universal Bibliographic Control', u'Task'), (u'virtual international authority file', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'bibliographic and authority records', u'Material'), (u'AACR2', u'Method')], [(u'records', u'Generic'), (u'Dublin Core metadata', u'Material')], [(u'Electronic Resources', u'Material')], [(u'changes', u'Generic'), (u"Library of Congress ' rule interpretations", u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'AACR2', u'USED-FOR', u'bibliographic and authority records')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'SUMMARY Explores the opportunities for libraries to contribute to the proposed global Semantic Web .', u'Library name and subject authority files , including work that IFLA has done related to a new view of Universal Bibliographic Control in the Internet environment and the work underway in the U.S. and Europe , are making a reality of the virtual international authority file on the Web .', u'The bibliographic and authority records created according to AACR2 reflect standards for metadata that libraries have provided for years .', u'New opportunities for using these records in the digital world are described ( interoperability ) , including mapping with Dublin Core metadata .', u'AACR2 recently updated Chapter 9 on Electronic Resources .', u"That process and highlights of the changes are described , including Library of Congress ' rule interpretations ."]

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'semantic interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'building domain-specific OWL ontology', u'Task'), (u'relational database', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'mapping rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'relational database schema', u'Method')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'ontology learning', u'Task'), (u'knowledge base building', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic interoperability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge base')], [], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'building domain-specific OWL ontology'), (u'relational database', u'USED-FOR', u'method')], [(u'relational database schema', u'USED-FOR', u'mapping rules')], [], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology learning'), (u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge base building'), (u'ontology learning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge base building')]]
sentences: [u'With the development of the Semantic Web , ontology is playing an increasingly important role in many research areas such as semantic interoperability and knowledge base .', u'However , building ontology manually is time-consuming and error-prone .', u'In such a case , this paper proposes a method of building domain-specific OWL ontology from relational database automatically .', u'This method establishes three mapping rules from relational database schema to ontology class and property .', u'Based on these rules , an initial ontology of material science that can be modified later is built and ontology instances can be generated .', u'At the end of this paper , a prototype of this method is implemented and the experimental result shows this method is effective and useful in ontology learning and knowledge base building .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'Web information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic techniques', u'Method')], [(u'Web of Data', u'Material'), (u'unknown concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'Web information')], [], []]
sentences: [u'While the Semantic Web and its underlying technologies since their inception have been mainly focused on processing Web information by machines , it is increasingly recognized that users could also benefit more directly from semantic techniques .', u'Users must be provided with suitable means to interact with the immensely growing Web of Data , to satisfy their information needs in a more targeted and efficient manner , to explore unknown concepts or relationships , and to obtain personalized and context-adaptive access to relevant resources and services .', u'In this talk , we will address visual search and exploration of semantic data , discuss the role of ontologies in modeling users and context , and highlight some research directions that might make semantic data and techniques more beneficial for human users .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web vision', u'Method')], [(u'web service location', u'Task')], [(u'contracting', u'Task'), (u'semantic level', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'policies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Policies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'behavioural interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'reasoning procedure', u'Method'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'abductive logic programming SCIFF proof-procedure', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'policies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SCIFF', u'Method'), (u'proof-theoretic semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'operational level', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic level')], [], [], [(u'reasoning procedure', u'USED-FOR', u'framework'), (u'abductive logic programming SCIFF proof-procedure', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning procedure'), (u'abductive logic programming SCIFF proof-procedure', u'USED-FOR', u'framework')], []]
sentences: [u'The semantic web vision will facilitate automation of many tasks , including the location and dynamic reconfiguration of web services .', u'In this article , we are concerned with a specific stage of web service location , called , by some authors , contracting .', u'We address contracting both at the operational level and at the semantic level .', u'We present a framework encompassing communication and reasoning , in which web services exchange and evaluate goals and policies .', u'Policies represent behavioural interfaces .', u'The reasoning procedure at the core of the framework is based on the abductive logic programming SCIFF proof-procedure .', u'We describe the framework , show by examples how to formalise policies in the declarative language of SCIFF , and give the framework a model-theoretic and a sound proof-theoretic semantics .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Method')], [(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'relational databases', u'Material')], [(u'relational databases', u'Material'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web of data', u'Material')], [(u'mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'relational database schemas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'relational database schema', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'mappings', u'Method'), (u'virtual documents', u'Material'), (u'incorrect mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mapping consistency', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic mappings', u'Method'), (u'contextual mappings', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'data sets', u'Material'), (u'real world domains', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'relational database schemas', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontologies')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'mappings'), (u'relational database schema', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology'), (u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [(u'virtual documents', u'USED-FOR', u'It'), (u'virtual documents', u'USED-FOR', u'mappings')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic mappings'), (u'contextual mappings', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic mappings')], [(u'data sets', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach'), (u'real world domains', u'FEATURE-OF', u'data sets')]]
sentences: [u'Ontologies proliferate with the growth of the Semantic Web .', u'However , most of data on the Web are still stored in relational databases .', u'Therefore , it is important to establish interoperability between relational databases and ontologies for creating a Web of data .', u'An effective way to achieve interoperability is finding mappings between relational database schemas and ontologies .', u'In this paper , we propose a new approach to discovering simple mappings between a relational database schema and an ontology .', u'It exploits simple mappings based on virtual documents , and eliminates incorrect mappings via validating mapping consistency .', u'Additionally , it also constructs a special type of semantic mappings , called contextual mappings , which is useful for practical applications .', u'Experimental results demonstrate that our approach performs well on several data sets from real world domains .']

entities: [[(u'annotation of knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'disagreement', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web approaches', u'Method')], [(u'Scholarly Ontologies', u'Material')], [(u'ClaimSpotter', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic')]]
sentences: [u'We are interested in the annotation of knowledge which does not necessarily require a consensus .', u'Scholarly debate is an example of such a category of knowledge where disagreement and contest are widespread and desirable , and unlike many Semantic Web approaches , we are interested in the capture and the compilation of these conflicting viewpoints and perspectives .', u'The Scholarly Ontologies project provides the underlying formalism to represent this meta-knowledge , and we will look at ways to lighten the burden of its creation .', u"After having described some particularities of this kind of knowledge , we introduce ClaimSpotter , our approach to support its 'capture ' , based on the elicitation of a number of recommendations which are presented for consideration to our annotators ( or analysts ) , and give some elements of evaluation ."]

entities: [[(u'Web data extraction', u'Task'), (u'web scraping', u'Task'), (u'collecting unstructured or semi-structured information', u'Task'), (u'World Wide Web', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'web reuse', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'structured data', u'Material')], [(u'DEiXTo', u'Method'), (u'web data extraction suite', u'Method'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'well-engineered extraction tasks', u'Task')], [(u'core pattern matching algorithm', u'Method'), (u'custom-made solutions', u'Method'), (u'hard extraction tasks', u'Task')], [(u'DEiXTo', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Web data extraction', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web scraping')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'web reuse')], [(u'DEiXTo', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'web data extraction suite')], [(u'custom-made solutions', u'USED-FOR', u'hard extraction tasks')], [(u'freeware and open source components', u'PART-OF', u'DEiXTo'), (u'open source components', u'PART-OF', u'DEiXTo')]]
sentences: [u'Web data extraction ( or web scraping ) is the process of collecting unstructured or semi-structured information from the World Wide Web , at different levels of automation .', u'It is an important , valuable and practical approach towards web reuse while at the same time can serve the transition of the web to the semantic web , by providing the structured data required by the latter .', u'In this paper we present DEiXTo , a web data extraction suite that provides an arsenal of features aiming at designing and deploying well-engineered extraction tasks .', u'We focus on presenting the core pattern matching algorithm and the overall architecture , which allows programming of custom-made solutions for hard extraction tasks .', u'DEiXTo consists of both freeware and open source components .']

entities: [[(u'Description Logics', u'Method'), (u'class based knowledge representation formalisms', u'Method')], [(u'ontology languages', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'DAML+OIL', u'Method'), (u'description logic based ontology language', u'Method')], [(u'reasoning services', u'Method'), (u'ontology design', u'Task'), (u'web resources', u'Material'), (u'automated processes', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Description Logics', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'class based knowledge representation formalisms')], [], [(u'DAML+OIL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'description logic based ontology language')], []]
sentences: [u'Description Logics are a family of class based knowledge representation formalisms characterised by the use of various constructors to build complex classes from simpler ones , and by an emphasis on the provision of sound , complete and ( empirically ) tractable reasoning services .', u'They have a wide range of applications , but their use as ontology languages has been highlighted by the recent explosion of interest in the Semantic Web , where ontologies are set to play a key role .', u'DAML+OIL is a description logic based ontology language specifically designed for use on the web .', u'The logical basis of the language means that reasoning services can be provided , both to support ontology design and to make DAML+OIL described web resources more accessible to automated processes .']

entities: [[(u"`` laid-back '' social interactions", u'Task'), (u'television', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic web techniques', u'Method'), (u'interactive television', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'shared characteristics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Communication between spectators', u'Task'), (u'direct communication', u'Material'), (u'instant messaging', u'Material'), (u'indirect communication', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'television format', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'television shows', u'Material'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'group interaction', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'television', u'USED-FOR', u"`` laid-back '' social interactions")], [(u'semantic web techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'smart applications')], [(u'shared characteristics', u'USED-FOR', u'Groups')], [(u'direct communication', u'CONJUNCTION', u'indirect communication'), (u'instant messaging', u'CONJUNCTION', u'indirect communication')], []]
sentences: [u"In this paper we report on our work to enable `` laid-back '' social interactions using television as a primary interaction medium .", u'By integrating semantic web techniques with interactive television we were able to create smart applications that can run as extensions of television shows and stimulate groups of users to communicate .', u'Groups are based on the shared characteristics that can be found for subsets of spectators .', u'Communication between spectators is brought about at two levels : direct communication like instant messaging and indirect communication like cooperating in a team to win a quiz .', u"Our system does not necessarily require a new television format , but is able to reuse existing television shows and to `` socialize '' them so they can be re-broadcasted with support for group interaction ."]

entities: [[(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'structural changes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'removal of concept definitions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'reasoning tasks', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'ones', u'Generic')], [(u'changes', u'Generic'), (u'human intervention', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'OWL ontology', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'Changes in an ontology may have a disruptive impact on any system using it .', u'This impact may depend on structural changes such as introduction or removal of concept definitions , or it may be related to a change in the expected performance of the reasoning tasks .', u'As the number of systems using ontologies is expected to increase , and given the open nature of the semantic Web , introduction of new ontologies and modifications to existing ones are to be expected .', u'Dynamically handling such changes , without requiring human intervention , becomes crucial .', u'This paper presents a framework that isolates groups of related axioms in an OWL ontology , so that a change in one or more axioms can be automatically localised to a part of the ontology .']

entities: [[(u'Graph databases', u'Material'), (u'social networks', u'Method')], [(u'path patterns in graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'graph databases', u'Material')], [(u'SPARQL 1.1', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'property paths', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RPQs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'visual query systems', u'Method'), (u'RPQs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SWARMGUIDE', u'Method'), (u'framework', u'Generic')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'RPQs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'execution plan', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'VQSs )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'visual query systems')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Graph databases have become increasingly important with the rise of social networks , and with the growth of the Semantic Web and characterization of biological networks .', u'Regular path queries ( RPQs ) are a way to explore path patterns in graphs which have become a standard method to explore graph databases .', u'SPARQL 1.1 includes property paths , and so now encompasses RPQs as a fragment .', u'In many environments , such as visual query systems ( VQSs ) , the RPQs are generated visually which may contain many commonalities that can be optimized globally .', u'We introduce SWARMGUIDE , a framework for optimizing multiple regular path queries .', u'The framework detects commonalities among the RPQs , in order to find an execution plan that is globally optimized over the plan spaces of the constituent RPQs .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web extension', u'Method')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge management', u'Task'), (u'acquisition', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Turkey', u'Method'), (u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'domain experts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge engineers', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web extension', u'USED-FOR', u'web browser Firefox')], [(u'knowledge management', u'CONJUNCTION', u'acquisition')], []]
sentences: [u'Born four years ago as a Semantic Web extension for the web browser Firefox , Semantic Turkey pushed forward the traditional concept of links & folders-based bookmarking to a new dimension , allowing users to keep track of relevant information from visited web sites and to organize the collected content according to standard or personally defined ontologies .', u'Today , the tool has broken the boundaries of its original intents and can be considered , under every aspect , an extensible platform for knowledge management and acquisition .', u'The semantic bookmarking and annotation facilities of Semantic Turkey are now supporting just a part of a whole methodology where different actors , from domain experts to knowledge engineers , can cooperate in developing , building and populating ontologies while navigating the Web .']

entities: [[(u'XML data', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'procedure', u'Generic'), (u'XML documents', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'RDF schema', u'Method')], [(u'XML document', u'Material'), (u'XML DTD', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'XML data', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'RDF schema', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'XML documents', u'Material'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'procedure', u'Generic'), (u'XML documents', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'procedure', u'USED-FOR', u'XML documents')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Interpreting the XML data in a current web into sources that can be used by the Semantic Web has received great attention in recent years .', u'In this paper , we propose a procedure for transforming valid XML documents into RDF by using vocabularies of RDF schema .', u'The first objective here is to obtain classes and properties from labels in XML document exactly by accessing the XML DTD .', u'After that , we can interpret XML data as RDF triples by using some vocabularies of RDF schema .', u'The main advantage of our approach is that it ensures the integrity of the structure and meaning of the original XML documents while transforming them into RDF .', u'This procedure can be used for any kind of valid XML documents .']

sentences: [u'This symposium contribution examines the disintermediating and reintermediating roles played by Creative Commons licenses on the Internet .', u'Creative Commons licenses act as a disintermediating force because they enable end-to-end transactions in copyrighted works .', u'The licenses have reintermediating force by enabling new services and new online communities to form around content licensed under a Creative Commons license .', u'Intermediaries focused on the copyright dimension have begun to appear online as search engines , archives , libraries , publishers , community organizers , and educators .', u'Moreover , the growth of machine-readable copyright licenses and the new intermediaries that they enable is part of a larger movement toward a Semantic Web .', u'As that effort progresses , we should expect new kinds of intermediaries that rely on machine-readable law to emerge .']

relations: [[], [(u'Recommender systems', u'USED-FOR', u'information overload problem'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'information overload problem')], [], [(u'Infonorma', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'multi-agent recommender system'), (u'multi-agent recommender system', u'USED-FOR', u'legal domain')], [(u'Infonorma', u'USED-FOR', u'legal normative instruments')], [], [(u'Semantic Web standards', u'USED-FOR', u'information source')], [(u'MAAEM', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'software development methodology'), (u'MAAEM', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-agent application engineering'), (u'software development methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-agent application engineering')]]
sentences: [u'Legal information sources are characterized by their growth and dynamism since new laws are written every day .', u'Recommender systems are used as an approach to the information overload problem .', u'Thus they can help professionals of the legal area to deal with legal information sources .', u'This paper describes the architectural design of Infonorma , a multi-agent recommender system for the legal domain .', u'Infonorma monitors a repository of legal normative instruments and classifies them into legal branches .', u'Each user specifies his/her interests for certain legal branches and receives recommendations of instruments they might be interested in .', u'The information source is entirely written according to Semantic Web standards .', u'Infonorma was developed under the guidelines of MAAEM , a software development methodology for multi-agent application engineering .']

entities: [[(u'internet and organizational networks', u'Method')], [(u'accuracy', u'Metric')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'web', u'Material'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'W3C', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Wiki', u'Method'), (u'knowledge management system', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Semantic Wiki', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge management system')]]
sentences: [u'Information on the internet and organizational networks can be overwhelming , therefore organizations have to commit with the people and systems they interact to , offering information services that meet their requirements and help its evolving environment , assisting the information , to be produced , managed , and shared .', u'The current web has shown some problems when it comes to structure and formatting data itself , likewise the accuracy of search results .', u'Developing the Semantic Web aims to solve that problem through standardization of data relying on the web , this is made plausible thanks to ontologies , and the standards defined by the W3C , to make possible the use of ontologies on the web .', u'This article illustrates an example of an application of a Semantic Wiki as an effective knowledge management system .']

entities: [[(u'Peer', u'Method'), (u'peer information integration', u'Task'), (u'internetworking systems', u'Method'), (u'consumed information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'peer system', u'Task')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'multi-agent epistemic logic frameworks', u'Method')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'integration strategies', u'Method')], [(u'formal framework', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'peer mappings', u'Method'), (u'direct knowledge transfers', u'Material'), (u'knowledge construction axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concrete integration', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Peer', u'USED-FOR', u'peer information integration')], [(u'semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'peer system')], [(u'multi-agent epistemic logic frameworks', u'USED-FOR', u'systems')], [], [], [(u'knowledge construction axioms', u'USED-FOR', u'concrete integration')]]
sentences: [u'Peer to peer information integration takes place when , within internetworking systems , a dependency between provided and consumed information is maintained .', u'At large , the semantic Web could be seen as a semantically integrated peer to peer system .', u'These systems have been thoroughly studied by means of multi-agent epistemic logic frameworks .', u'Most of the proposed approaches , however , in seek of generality , fail to provide means to implement the vast array of integration strategies that peers could adopt .', u'We propose here a formal framework to overcome these limitations .', u'Our approach resorts on a logic that prevents peer to peer mappings from causing direct knowledge transfers , and introduces a class of specific knowledge construction axioms to model concrete integration in a flexible way .']

sentences: [u"The problem that the current sensor search methods can not use the important character of sensors and semantic information efficiently leads to the search result can not satisfy the user 's actual demand , Context-aware Sensor Search Framework ( CASSF ) in Semantic Web of Things is proposed .", u'In the framework , sensor information is stored as RDF graph to preserve the semantic information to the maximum extent , user requirements are transformed to structured query language in order to search sensor entity according to the pattern information of sensor related context ontology , an approximate query method called Threshold Algorithm for Sensor Information ( TASI ) is put forward to reduce query scope thus improves the overall search efficiency .', u'By contrasting , CASSF is better satisfied with user requirement than other sensor search methods .']

sentences: [u'Service discovery in ubiquitous environment , as well as adding semantics to the data is quite established now .', u'But , still there is no uniform framework for the identification of devices .', u'A uniform identity mechanism which would help existing architectures interoperate , allow agents to roam autonomously and leverage the World Wide Web to its full potential .', u'Here we have tried to achieve this by proposing a URI based architecture for the identification of ubiquitous objects and human .', u'We have materialized our perspective by presenting a conceptual architecture .', u'We argue that by using URIs for physical objects we could leverage the existing architectures of semantic Web and ubiquitous system to their highest potential .', u"Our case studies at the end , second our argument , `` A Semantically Ubiquitous Web '' ."]

entities: [[], [(u'die Bedurfnisse der Nutzer angepasst werden', u'Method')], [], [], [], [], [(u'dieser Arbeit untersucht', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'Die Zunahme von elektronischen Informationsobjekten aller Art fur immer komplexere Vorgange in Unternehmen sowie im privaten Bereich erfordert neue , innovative Konzepte im Umgang mit Informationen .', u'Die grundlegendsten Eigenschaften , die Informationsobjekte uberhaupt besitzen , mussen neu uberdacht und an die Bedurfnisse der Nutzer angepasst werden .', u'Die Rede ist von der Sammlung , Ordnung , Speicherung und Suche von Informationsobjekten .', u"Eine neue Bewegung innerhalb der `` Informations-Community '' beschaftigt sich seit geraumer Zeit mit dem Konzept des Semantic Web .", u'Hinter diesem Begriff verbergen sich semantische Verfahren , die , im Unterschied zu den herkommlichen Verfahren , Bedeutungen maschinenlesbar machen sollen und dem Nutzer einen verbesserten Zugang zu einer grosen Informationsmenge bieten .', u'Eines dieser Verfahren ist das Konzept der Topic Maps .', u'Welche Nutzenpotenziale und Einsatzgebiete sich fur dieses Verfahren eroffnen , wird in dieser Arbeit untersucht .']

entities: [[(u'Web service technology', u'Method'), (u'Web service', u'Task'), (u'Web service', u'Task'), (u'Web service', u'Task'), (u'OWL-s', u'Method'), (u'QoS', u'Method'), (u'QoS restriction matching process', u'Method'), (u'Web services', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u"With the development of Web service technology , the application of Web service is becoming more and more popular.So the matching and looking up problem of Web service is becoming a hotspot.In the paper , describe the semantic of Web service using OWL-s and also add QoS to it.Then change the description of semantic Web service 's input and output matching to the computing of semantic distance in domain ontology base and propose computing formula of concept similarity.The paper also described algorithms of matching.In the QoS restriction matching process , chose Web services of high performance using cost performance , and users also can choose Web services that met their needs.The paper can sort the matched results as the desire of requestor in order to meet different demand from requestor ."]

entities: [[], [(u'proliferation of ontologies', u'Task'), (u'knowledge-rich and labour-intensive structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed environment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [], [(u'semantic integration', u'Task'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'syntactic integration', u'Task')], [(u'semantic integration', u'Task'), (u'channel theory', u'Method'), (u'semantic interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'distributed environment'), (u'Semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'distributed environment')], [], [(u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'syntactic integration')], [(u'channel theory', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic interoperability')]]
sentences: [u"We observe an ever growing need for integration in today 's research agendas across a variety of organisations .", u'The proliferation of ontologies and other similar knowledge-rich and labour-intensive structures as well as their exposure to a distributed environment like the Web , and eventually its successor , the Semantic Web , justifies the need .', u'Although a plethora of solutions have been proposed and used , there are many issues which remain unclear .', u'The most striking one is the antithesis in the availability of solutions for semantic integration as opposed to the abundance of techniques and methods for syntactic integration .', u'In this paper we make the first step towards semantic integration by proposing a mathematically sound application of channel theory to enable semantic interoperability of separate ontologies representing similar domains .']

sentences: [u'Internet of Things ( IoT ) connects sensors and devices to their adaptive Internet applications .', u'However , these applications are usually designed for specific intentions , which lead to a poor interoperability between them .', u'Semantic Web of Things ( SWoT ) is an effective means to improve IoT , based on SWoT , an intelligent and scalable architecture called Gatewaybased Semantic Collaboration Service Framework ( GSCSF ) is required to provide semantic interconnection between these applications .', u'In this paper , GSCSF is proposed to provide semantic collaboration , where protocol proxy technology is used to collect data from sensors that use different protocols , semantic reasoning technology is used to get high-level knowledge , rule-based reasoning is utilized to filter out invalid sensor data , and the superiority of GSCSF is examined and illustrated through a practical application scenarios .']

sentences: [u'A spatial component for health data can support spatial analysis and visualization in the investigation of health phenomena .', u'Therefore , the utilization of spatial information in a Semantic Web environment will enhance the ability to query and to represent health data .', u'In this paper , a semantic health data query and representation framework is proposed through the formalization of spatial information .', u'We include the geometric representation in RuleML deduction , and apply ontologies and rules for querying and representing health information .', u'Corresponding geospatial built-ins were implemented as an extension to OO jDREW .', u'Case studies were carried out using geospatial-enabled RuleML queries for respiratory disease information .', u'The paper thus demonstrates the use of RuleML for geospatial-semantic querying and representing of health information .']
