sentences: [u'The development of airborne network is conducive to resource sharing , flight management and interoperability in civilian and military aviation fields .', u'To enhance the integrated ability of airborne network , the paper focuses on dynamic network management and service integration architecture for airborne network ( DNMSIAN ) .', u'Adaptive routing based on the mapping mechanism between connection identification and routing identification can provide diversified network access , and ensure the credibility and mobility of the aviation information exchange .', u'Dynamic network management based on trustworthy cluster can ensure dynamic airborne network controllable and safe .', u'Service integration based on semantic web and ontology can meet the customized and diversified needs for aviation information services .', u'The DNMSIAN simulation platform demonstrates that our proposed methods can effectively perform dynamic network management and service integration .']

entities: [[(u'graph-based knowledge representation formalism', u'Method'), (u'manipulation', u'Task'), (u'linguistic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic web formalisms', u'Method'), (u'Conceptual Graphs Formalism', u'Method'), (u'Unit Graphs framework', u'Method')], [(u'formalism', u'Generic'), (u'hierarchy of unit types', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'actantial structure', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'deep semantic representation level', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'MTT', u'Method'), (u'specialization of conveyed meanings', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'In this paper we are interested in the choice of a graph-based knowledge representation formalism that would allow for the representation , manipulation , query , and reasoning over linguistic knowledge of the Explanatory Combinatorial Dictionary of the Meaning-Text Theory ( MTT ) .', u'We show that neither the semantic web formalisms nor the Conceptual Graphs Formalism are suitable for this task , and we justify the introduction of the new Unit Graphs framework .', u'We then detail the core of this formalism which is a hierarchy of unit types driven by their actantial structure .', u'Finally we define the new deep semantic representation level for the MTT , where the specialization of actantial structures of deep semantic unit types may correspond to a specialization of conveyed meanings .']

sentences: [u"Now , because of the fastly developerment of e-government , the count of e-government documents increases year by year.How to offer user a better search way about e-government documents which was good at both accuracy and full-overlay becomed an hot problem.The article offer an organizing of the e-government documentmetadata base on semantic , including creating the RDF model of the e-government documentmet , the union of RDF models and the calculate of the search word 's comparability of the e-government documentmet.To implement the e-government document 's capacity search , an search way based on the semantic web was offered which combined with the semantic web 's virtue that is easily comprehended by computer , and improved the finally result set 's both accuracy and full-overlay ."]

sentences: [u'The hypertext visionaries foresaw the potential of richly interlinked global information systems for advancing human knowledge .', u'The Web provided the infrastructure to enable those ideas to become a reality , and it quickly became a platform for collaborative research and data sharing .', u'As the Web has evolved , new ways of using it for eResearch have emerged , such as the social networking facilities enabled by Web 2.0 technologies .', u'The next generation of the Web-the so-called Semantic Web-is now on the horizon , which will again enable new types of collaborative research to emerge .', u'If we are to understand and anticipate these new modes of collaboration , we need a discipline that studies the Web as a whole .', u'Web science is this discipline .']

sentences: [u'The paper analyzes the relationship between the economic interests and the scientific research using as intepretative key the genesis and the aims of the evaluation systems used in scholarly fields .', u'It gives a particular attention to bibliometric indices - such as the hindex and the journal impact factor - now used to judge the scientific nature of a paper , but which in reality were developed by publishing companies for directing the purchases by university libraries .', u'Afterward it shows how the commercial nature of the indices provokes distortions of the research , depriving it of its freedom and reducing its potential innovation .', u"Finally the paper indicates the clever use of the semantic web ( institutional repositories in open access ) as a possible way out of this `` impasse '' ."]

entities: [[(u'web', u'Material')], [(u'information retrieval systems', u'Method')], [(u'this', u'Generic'), (u'indexing techniques', u'Method'), (u'key words', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'ontology-based approach', u'Method'), (u'OBIREX', u'Method')], [(u'OBIREX', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'e-learning of computer science', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], []]

sentences: [u'Nowadays , resources on the web increase considerably .', u'In this immense data warehouse , current information retrieval systems do not allow users to obtain results to their requests that meet exactly their needs .', u'Mainly this is due to indexing techniques used ( key words , thesaurus ) .', u'In order to improve the relevance of information retrieval , an ontology-based approach called OBIREX is proposed in this paper .', u'OBIREX is based on the use of ontology of the domain for indexing a collection of documents and the use of semantic links between documents to allow the inference of all relevant documents .', u'This approach is tested on the domain of e-learning of computer science in the context of the semantic web .', u'Some results obtained are also presented .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web journal', u'Material'), (u'Linked Dataset description track', u'Material')], [], [(u'citations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'publication', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]
sentences: [u'Since 2012 , the Semantic Web journal has been accepting papers in a novel Linked Dataset description track .', u'Here we motivate the track and provide some analysis of the papers accepted thus far .', u'We look at the ratio of accepted papers in this time-frame that fall under this track , the relative impact of these papers in terms of citations , and we perform a technical analysis of the datasets they describe to see what sorts of resources they provide and to see if the datasets have remained available since publication .', u'Based on a variety of such analyses , we present some lessons learnt and discuss some potential changes we could apply to the track in order to improve the overall quality of papers accepted .']

entities: [[(u'search of maritime data', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'ship registries', u'Method')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'rule', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'flying of flags', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'flags', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u"ship 's flag search", u'Task'), (u'ship registration requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic web', u'FEATURE-OF', u'search of maritime data')], [], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'flying of flags'), (u'tax payment', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rule'), (u'rule', u'CONJUNCTION', u'regulation enforcement')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we discuss issues on the representation and search of maritime data on the semantic web .', u"In particular , we are concerned with data related to the requirements put forward by ship registries and should be met in view of a ship 's flag acquisition .", u"The choice of a ship 's flag is a matter of crucial importance since it is the basis of tax payment and rule and regulation enforcement for the flying of flags .", u'In our approach , flags and corresponding requirements are represented in the form of a ontology .', u"Data `` opening '' and linking with the use of the ontology in question , will facilitate a ship 's flag search based on its particular characteristics and will provide useful information on ship registration requirements ."]

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'Material'), (u'computer-accessible representation of key semantics', u'Task'), (u'data life cycle', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology dynamics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data management', u'Task'), (u're-use', u'Task')], [(u'geosciences', u'Task'), (u'ontology dynamics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heavy reworking of data', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic heterogeneity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'error propagation', u'Method'), (u'cross-discipline data discovery', u'Task'), (u're-use', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data collection', u'Task'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'reworking of data', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web context', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'computer-accessible representation of key semantics'), (u'data management', u'CONJUNCTION', u're-use')], [(u'heavy reworking of data', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology dynamics'), (u'error propagation', u'USED-FOR', u're-use'), (u'cross-discipline data discovery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'error propagation'), (u'cross-discipline data discovery', u'CONJUNCTION', u're-use')], [(u'them', u'USED-FOR', u'reworking of data'), (u'Semantic Web context', u'FEATURE-OF', u'reworking of data')]]
sentences: [u'Ontologies are increasingly deployed as a computer-accessible representation of key semantics in various parts of a data life cycle and , thus , ontology dynamics may pose challenges to data management and re-use .', u'By using examples in the field of geosciences , we analyze challenges raised by ontology dynamics , such as heavy reworking of data , semantic heterogeneity among data providers and users , and error propagation in cross-discipline data discovery and re-use .', u'We also make recommendations to address these challenges : ( 1 ) communities of practice on ontologies to reduce inconsistency and duplicated efforts ; ( 2 ) use ontologies in the procedure of data collection and make them accessible to data users ; and ( 3 ) seek methods to speed up the reworking of data in a Semantic Web context .']

sentences: [u'The Semantic Web needs ontologies as an integral component .', u'Current methods for learning and enhancing ontologies , need to be further improved to overcome the knowledge acquisition bottleneck .', u'The identification of concepts and relations with only minimal user interaction is still a challenging objective .', u'Current approaches performed to extract semantics often use association rules or clustering upon regular flat text .', u'In this paper we describe an approach on extracting semantics from Web Document collections which takes advantage of the semi structured content within XHTML ( an XML dialect which can be obtained from traditional HTML documents ) Web Documents. # R # # N # # R # # N # The XTREEM ( Xhtml TREE Mining ) method uses structural information , the mark-up in Web content , as indicators of term boundaries and for co-hyponymy relations .']

sentences: [u'RSS/Atom feeds are XML-based contents in semantic Web and can be used as data sources by client-side parser.Microformats are semantic micorcontents embedded in HTML.Web feeds include RSS/Atom feeds and microformat feeds.RSS/Atom standardization leads to widely adoption by various applications and Web sites.Extensions for RSS/Atom are used in specific domains.The S/C mode and HTTP protocol are implemented between syndication providers and syndication consumers.RSS/Atom feeds as a list enable updating and deleting client-side cache.Aotudiscovery is the best choice for Web sites informing their visitors about their RSS/Atom feeds.The Microsoft SSE specification is used for two sites mutually subscribing to the RSS/Atom feeds of their counterparts , enabling the bi-directional , asynchronous synchronization of new and changed items .']

sentences: [u'Evolution of Web technologies has made e-learning a popular common way of education and training .', u'As an outcome , learning content adaptation has been the subject of many research projects lately .', u'This paper suggests a framework for building an adaptive Learning Management System ( LMS ) .', u'The proposed architecture is based upon multi-agent systems and uses both Sharable Content Object Reference Model ( SCORM ) 2004 and semantic Web ontology for learning content storage , sequencing and adaptation .', u'This system has been implemented upon a well known open-source LMS and its functionalities are demonstrated through the simulation of a scenario mimicing the real life conditions .', u'The result reveals the system effectiveness for which it appears that the proposed approach may be very promising .']

sentences: [u'Ontologies are at the heart of the semantic web .', u'They define the concepts and relationships that make global interoperability possible .', u'However , as these ontologies grow in size they become more and more difficult to create , use , understand , maintain , transform and classify .', u'As ontologies become common in more applications and as those applications become larger and longer-lived , it is becoming increasingly common for ontologies to be developed in different area of public sector of economics .', u'Ontologies present special challenges to the problem of conceptual modeling .', u'This paper describes the process of the implementation of a subontology of forecasting and evaluations for business analysis domain in order to develop an easy and correct way to find the needed statistical information in a knowledge base .']

sentences: [u'The study reported on here converts records of National Archives of Korea to linked data , and connects archives data to library and museum data in order to show how linked data are actually used in MLA ( Museum-Library-Archives ) .', u'This research analyzed the data structure of the National Archives of Korea and ontologized data into linked data .', u'To produce RDF/OWL data from the data sources , this research used Dublin Core and SKOS ( Simple Knowledge Organization System ) .', u'TopBraid Composer was utilized as the ontology design tool .', u'The linked data for the National Library of Archives enabled search by collocation , and free search between archival records through visualization and SPARQL .', u'A flexible linking from archival data to authority data was shown .', u'The interlinking with library and museum data enabled users to find information from various datasets .', u'Limitations in the existing records search system were addressed and improved through linking .', u'Linked data established in this way actualized empirical studies that prove the benefit of libraries , museums and archives data integration .', u'It will contribute to increasing the possibility of reusing data in the National Archives of Korea .', u'In addition , the modeling provided by this research can be used for modeling linked data .']

sentences: [u'In the last decades , the oil , gas and petrochemical industries have registered a series of huge accidents .', u'Information flow can be an important tool to minimize hazards to health and environment .', u'This paper proposes the use of the ontology concept as a tool to improve the knowledge management in a refinery , through the representation of a DEA plant , mixing many pieces of information associated with its descriptive documentation and also given by a specialist in operation of that plant .', u'This kind of application is challenging due to the complexity of applying knowledge about Semantic Web to a petrochemical process .', u'The created ontology can be applied as one of the elements to develop tools to navigate through the plant , simulate its behavior , and diagnose faults , among other possibilities .']

entities: [[(u'annotation of place names', u'Task'), (u'literary texts', u'Material'), (u'literary criticism', u'Material')], [(u'encoding spatial information', u'Task'), (u'digital editions', u'Material'), (u'TEI format', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'manual annotation', u'Task')], [(u'semantic web resources', u'Material'), (u'toponym mark-up', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'precise geo-referencing', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'automatic annotation', u'Task'), (u'evolution of literary life', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'spatial and geographical point of view', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'DOI', u'Metric')]]

sentences: [u'This paper aims to discuss the challenges and benefits of the annotation of place names in literary texts and literary criticism .', u'We shall first highlight the problems of encoding spatial information in digital editions using the TEI format by means of two manual annotation experiments and the discussion of various cases .', u'This will lead to the question of how to use existing semantic web resources to complement and enrich toponym mark-up , in particular to provide mentions with precise geo-referencing .', u'Finally the automatic annotation of a large corpus will show the potential of visualizing places from texts , by illustrating an analysis of the evolution of literary life from the spatial and geographical point of view .', u'DOI : http : //dx.doi.org/10.14195/2182-8830_4-2_3']

sentences: [u'Ontology is a component of Semantic Web .', u'Ontology can be built from scratch ( manually ) , semi-automatic or automatic .', u'Manually developed ontology usually gain knowledge from domain experts .', u'Then the knowledge is transform into ontology by ontology engineers .', u'Since it is been done manually , the process can contain human mistake .', u'Therefore the manual ontology needs to undergo validation process .', u'In this paper , we are going to present validations technique on durian ontology also called DuriO .', u'DuriO has been built priory using Modified Methodology .', u'The validation technique use feature-based approach on competency questions and Agrovoc alignment .', u'As the result , DuriO are able to answer all competency questions .', u'Meanwhile in Agrovoc concept alignment validation , only match 10.34 % from DuriO class to Agrovoc concept .']

sentences: [u'The existence of on-line social networks that include person specific information creates interesting opportunities for various applications ranging from marketing to community organization .', u'On the other hand , security and privacy concerns need to be addressed for creating such applications .', u'Improving social network access control systems appears as the first step toward addressing the existing security and privacy concerns related to on-line social networks .', u'To address some of the current limitations , we propose an extensible fine grained access control model based on semantic web tools .', u'In addition , we propose authorization , admin and filtering policies that depend on trust relationships among various users , and are modeled using OWL and SWRL .', u'Besides describing the model , we present the architecture of the framework in its support .']

sentences: [u'One way to remedy the gap that evidently exists between the image element on the web and the web user who is visually blind is by redefining connection between the image and the abundant element of the web itself i.e .', u'text .', u'Studies on the exploitation are done largely related to the fields like the HCI , the semantic web , the information retrieval or even a new hybrid approach .', u'However , often many see the problem from the perspective of the third party .', u"This position paper posits that the problem can also be seen from the fundamental reasons for an image being on a web page without neglecting the connection that develops from the web user 's perspective .", u'Effective and appropriate image tagging may consider this view .']

entities: [[(u'Unified Medical Language System', u'Method'), (u'biomedical knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'biomedical applications', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Network', u'Method'), (u'UMLS', u'Method'), (u'core biomedical knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'well defined semantic types', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'DAML+OIL', u'Method'), (u'markup language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Network', u'Method')], [(u'Requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Network', u'Method'), (u'polymorphic relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'blocking relationship inheritance', u'Task'), (u'DAML+OIL', u'Method')], []]

sentences: [u'The Unified Medical Language System ( UMLS ) , an extensive source of biomedical knowledge developed and maintained by the US National Library of Medicine ( NLM ) is being currently used in a wide variety of biomedical applications .', u'The Semantic Network , a component of the UMLS is a structured description of core biomedical knowledge consisting of well defined semantic types and relationships between them .', u'We investigate the expressiveness of DAML+OIL , a markup language proposed for ontologies on the Semantic Web , for representing the knowledge contained in the Semantic Network .', u'Requirements specific to the Semantic Network , such as polymorphic relationships and blocking relationship inheritance are discussed and approaches to represent these in DAML+OIL are presented .', u'Finally , conclusions are presented along with a discussion of ongoing and future work .']

entities: [[(u'encyclopedia Wikipedias categorial system', u'Method')], [(u'Wikipedias categorial system', u'Method'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material')], [(u'Wikipedias categorial system', u'Method')], [(u'Wikipedias categorial system', u'Method'), (u'Wikipedias categorial system', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'Wikipedia', u'Material')]]
sentences: [u'Presentation from Wikiconference focuses on the most important characteristics and possibilities of usage of encyclopedia Wikipedias categorial system ( folksonomy ) .', u'The first section provides basic similarities and differences between Wikipedias categorial system and Wikipedia as a whole .', u'The following part provides a list of important similarities and differences between Wikipedias categorial system and systems of classification of information created by experts .', u'The final part of the presentation deals with the differences in the usage of Wikipedias categorial system and systems of classification of information created by experts with focus on the importance of Wikipedias categorial system for the purpose of building the semantic web .', u'Some problematic issues of categorization of content in Czech and English versions of Wikipedia are demonstrated through concrete examples of screen shots .']

entities: [[], [(u'business-related supporting data', u'Material'), (u'multidimensional space', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'automatic data acquisition framework', u'Method'), (u'IoT )', u'Method'), (u'complext event processing', u'Method'), (u'CEP ) technology', u'Method')], [(u'SCEP prototype system', u'Method'), (u'real-time detecting complex business events', u'Task'), (u'goods sorting line', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'detection method', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'data support', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multidimensional space', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'multidimensional space', u'FEATURE-OF', u'business-related supporting data')], [(u'complext event processing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'CEP ) technology')], [(u'SCEP prototype system', u'USED-FOR', u'real-time detecting complex business events'), (u'detection method', u'USED-FOR', u'real-time detecting complex business events')], [(u'multidimensional space', u'FEATURE-OF', u'data support')]]
sentences: [u'The express delivery industry of China is relatively backward in the automation degree of critical business processes .', u'The basic reason is that the business-related supporting data , which is scattered in the multidimensional space , is difficult to utilize and process .', u'This paper proposes an automatic data acquisition framework to resolve such difficulty , which synthetically utilize intelligent inernet of things ( IoT ) , semantic web and complext event processing ( CEP ) technology .', u'We also implement a SCEP prototype system with the capability of real-time detecting complex business events on the goods sorting line , which adopts a detection method consisting of four stages .', u'The simulation results show that the system has good performance and feasible enough to deal with the complex business which need data support from multidimensional space .']

sentences: [u'Yorick Wilks is a central figure in the fields of Natural Language Processing and Artificial Intelligence .', u'His influence has extends to many areas of these fields and includes contributions to Machine Translation , word sense disambiguation , dialogue modeling and Information Extraction .', u'This book celebrates the work of Yorick Wilks from the perspective of his peers .', u'It consists of original chapters each of which analyses an aspect of his work and links it to current thinking in that area .', u'His work has spanned over four decades but is shown to be pertinent to recent developments in language processing such as the Semantic Web .', u'This volume forms a two-part set together with Words and Intelligence I , Selected Works by Yorick Wilks , by the same editors .']

entities: [[], [(u'tools', u'Generic'), (u'multi-aspect workflows', u'Task'), (u'creative , procedural and computational properties', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'components', u'Generic'), (u'electrical or digital signal-based representation of content', u'Method')], [(u'workflows', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'content management', u'Task'), (u'educational purposes', u'Task')], [(u'ontological model', u'Method'), (u'workflows', u'Task'), (u'audio production', u'Task'), (u'model', u'Generic')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'production', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'tools', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-aspect workflows'), (u'components', u'USED-FOR', u'electrical or digital signal-based representation of content')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'workflows'), (u'content management', u'CONJUNCTION', u'educational purposes')], [(u'ontological model', u'USED-FOR', u'workflows'), (u'ontological model', u'USED-FOR', u'audio production'), (u'workflows', u'FEATURE-OF', u'audio production')], [(u'model', u'USED-FOR', u'domain knowledge')]]
sentences: [u'Modern environments for creating , editing or managing multimedia content involve increasingly complex tools and components .', u'These tools are typically used in multi-aspect workflows exhibiting creative , procedural and computational properties , while most components deal with the underlying electrical or digital signal-based representation of content .', u'Collecting and sharing information about these workflows on the Semantic Web can be beneficial for content management or educational purposes .', u'In this paper , we describe an ontological model for the representation of workflows in audio production , and show how this model facilitates capturing and sharing information about the production process .', u'We then examine how this model can be used in a larger framework for representing domain knowledge about production and outline why this information is beneficial .']

sentences: [u'Ontologies are currently emerging as representation techniques for overlapping compatibility context domains .', u'The continuing need for more effective information retrieval has lead to the creation of the notions of the semantic web and personalized information management .', u'Subsequently , the need for effective ontology visualization for design , management and browsing has arisen .', u"Several ontology visualization tools have come out to strengthen the users ' cognitive support .", u"The primary goal of this paper is to present a survey on recently implemented ontology visualization tools and their contributions in the enrichment of users ' cognitive support .", u'This work also presents the preliminary results of an evaluation of three visualization tools to determine the suitability of each method for end user applications where ontologies are used as browsing aids .']

sentences: [u'Adaptive learning ( AL ) systems have long been one of the promising solutions to web-based personalized learning .', u'This paper proposes a framework to solve the problem of integrating knowledge resources on the Web based on Semantic Web languages .', u'As a consequence , knowledge modules of an AL system can be shared and reused on the Internet , resulting a service-based approach to developing distributed AL systems .', u'Based on this framework , a prototype AL system was implemented to demonstrate how the knowledge modules of an AL system can be developed and integrated .', u'Finally , a preliminary prototype evaluation result shows that the performance of the service-based approach is acceptable under light to middle traffics of requests based on current web service implementations .']

entities: [[(u'semantic Web-based search method', u'Method'), (u'disparate and widely diverse Web-sources', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'search methods', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'Natural Language Processing', u'Method'), (u'grounded theory', u'Method'), (u'Dempster-Shafer theory', u'Method'), (u'Web-sourced intelligence', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'mathematical models', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'Web-search approaches', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic Web-based search method', u'USED-FOR', u'topic-related content')], [(u'method', u'COMPARE', u'search methods')], [(u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'method'), (u'Natural Language Processing', u'USED-FOR', u'method'), (u'grounded theory', u'USED-FOR', u'method'), (u'grounded theory', u'USED-FOR', u'algorithms'), (u'grounded theory', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Dempster-Shafer theory'), (u'Dempster-Shafer theory', u'USED-FOR', u'method'), (u'Dempster-Shafer theory', u'USED-FOR', u'algorithms')], [], []]
sentences: [u'A semantic Web-based search method is introduced that automates the correlation of topic-related content for discovery of hitherto unknown intelligence from disparate and widely diverse Web-sources .', u'This method is in contrast to traditional search methods that are constrained to specific or narrowly defined topics .', u'The method is based on algorithms from Natural Language Processing combined with techniques adapted from grounded theory and Dempster-Shafer theory to significantly enhance the discovery of related Web-sourced intelligence .', u'This paper describes the development of the method by showing the integration of the mathematical models used .', u'Real-world worked examples demonstrate the effectiveness of the method with supporting performance analysis , showing that the quality of the extracted content is significantly enhanced comparing to the traditional Web-search approaches .']

entities: [[(u'Teaching information literacy', u'Task'), (u'subject/liaison librarians', u'Task'), (u'information-retrieval systems', u'Method'), (u'natural language searching', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'information literacy', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'scientific information and research data', u'Material'), (u'instruction formats', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'student learning', u'Task')], [(u'library instruction', u'Task')], [(u'digital culture', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Teaching information literacy', u'USED-FOR', u'subject/liaison librarians'), (u'natural language searching', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'information-retrieval systems'), (u'natural language searching', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web'), (u'Semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'information-retrieval systems')], [(u'it', u'COMPARE', u'approaches'), (u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'student learning')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Teaching information literacy is a major responsibility for subject/liaison librarians , but advances in information-retrieval systems , such as improved natural language searching and Semantic Web , could significantly change the role librarians play in this area .', u'This chapter examines the future of information literacy and how librarians could redefine their role by expanding it to include management of scientific information and research data , different instruction formats , and new approaches for assessing student learning .', u'This will make library instruction a much more appealing , engaging , and useful experience for students and researchers .', u'Responding to the needs of a generation born into a digital culture will require that librarians learn new skills and play new roles in supporting the educational and research goals of their institutions be redefined .']

sentences: [u'The semantic Web initiates new , high level access schemes to online content and applications .', u'One area of superior need for a redefined content exploration is given by on-line educational applications and their concepts of interactivity in the framework of open hypermedia systems .', u'In the present paper we discuss aspects and opportunities of gaining interactivity schemes from semantic notions of components .', u'A transition from standard educational annotation to semantic statements of hyperlinks is discussed .', u'Further on we introduce the concept of semantic link contexts as an approach to manage a coherent rhetoric of linking .', u'A practical implementation is introduced , as well .', u'Our semantic hyperlink implementation is based on the more general Multimedia Information Repository MIR , an open hypermedia system supporting the standards XML , Corba and JNDI .']

entities: [[(u'socioeconomic problem', u'Task')], [(u"ICT 's evolution", u'Method'), (u'ad-hoc telemedicine solutions', u'Method')], [(u'ad-hoc solutions', u'Method')], [(u'heterogeneity of relevant information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'out-of-hospital instrumentation', u'Method'), (u'person-centric healthcare systems', u'Method'), (u'shared and open source interoperability component', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web data model', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'ad-hoc solutions', u'USED-FOR', u'healthcare cycle')], [(u'semantic web data model', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')], []]
sentences: [u'The need for high-quality out-of-hospital healthcare is a known socioeconomic problem .', u"Exploiting ICT 's evolution , ad-hoc telemedicine solutions have been proposed in the past .", u'Integrating such ad-hoc solutions in order to cost-effectively support the entire healthcare cycle is still a research challenge .', u'In order to handle the heterogeneity of relevant information and to overcome the fragmentation of out-of-hospital instrumentation in person-centric healthcare systems , a shared and open source interoperability component can be adopted , which is ontology driven and based on the semantic web data model .', u"The feasibility and the advantages of the proposed approach are demonstrated by presenting the use case of real-time monitoring of patients ' health and their environmental context ."]

entities: [[(u'weak signal detection', u'Task'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'detection of weak signal', u'Task'), (u'semantic Web mining', u'Method')], [(u'Internet information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'latent semantic indexing', u'Method'), (u'textual patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'weak signal maximization approach', u'Method'), (u'weak signals', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'singular value decomposition', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SVD ) dimensions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'weak signal', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'weak signal', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'network', u'Generic'), (u'weak signal detection approaches', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'detection of weak signal')], [(u'Internet information', u'USED-FOR', u"organization 's environment")], [(u'latent semantic indexing', u'USED-FOR', u'textual patterns')], [(u'weak signal maximization approach', u'USED-FOR', u'weak signals')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'weak signal'), (u'network', u'USED-FOR', u'weak signal')]]
sentences: [u'For the problem that the quality of results is low due to traditional methods need too much human intervention in weak signal detection and assessment of wide range scanning environment , a method for detection of weak signal based on semantic Web mining is proposed .', u"Internet information is used to represent organization 's environment at first .", u'Then , latent semantic indexing ( LSI ) is used to identify similar textual patterns in different contexts .', u'Finally , a new weak signal maximization approach is applied to calculate the largest number of relevant weak signals represented by singular value decomposition ( SVD ) dimensions , by which weak signal can be realized efficiently .', u'Experimental results indicate that proposed method can more efficiently identify weak signal from the network comparing with the latest weak signal detection approaches .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'automatic transformation of SQL DDL schemas')], [], [], [(u'Datalog interpreter', u'USED-FOR', u'system')]]
sentences: [u'The content of most Web pages is dynamically derived from an underlying relational database .', u'Thus , the success of the Semantic Web hinges on enabling access to relational databases and their content by semantic methods .', u'We define a system for automatic transformation of SQL DDL schemas into OWL DL ontologies .', u'This system goes further than earlier efforts in that the entire system is expressed in first-order logic .', u'We leverage the formal approach to show the system is complete with respect to a space of the possible relations that can be formed among relational tables as a consequence of primary and foreign key combinations .', u'The full set of transformation rules is stratified , thus the system can be executed directly by a Datalog interpreter .']

sentences: [u'This paper presents an approach to design an interface for document retrieval , based on techniques from the semantic web combined with interactive graphical features .', u"The purpose of this study is to enhance the user 's knowledge while he/she browses the information through a graphical interface .", u'In this paper , two aspects are considered : Fist , interactive features such as object movability , animation , etc .', u'are discussed .', u'Second , a method for visually integrating the search queries and the query outputs is addressed in order to retrieve documents .', u'The visual features and the querying method are combined taking account the semantical relations among extracted information from the documents .', u'This combination is evaluated as a means to determine the most suitable location for the results inside the interface .']

sentences: [u'The use of one-size-fits-all approach is getting replaced by the adaptive , personalized perspective in recently developed learning environments .', u'This study takes a look at the need of personalization in e-learning systems and the adaptivity and distribution features of adaptive distributed learning environments .', u'By focusing on how personalization can be achieved in e-learning systems , the technologies used for establishing adaptive learning environments are explained and evaluated briefly .', u'Some of these technologies are web services , multi-agent systems , semantic web and AI techniques such as case-based reasoning , neural networks and Bayesian networks used in intelligent tutoring systems .', u'Finally , by discussing some of the adaptive distributed learning systems , an overall state of the art of the field is given with some future trends .']

sentences: [u'Using domain knowledge and semantics to conduct effective information retrieval ( IR ) is one of the major challenges in IR .', u'In this paper we introduce a framework that can facilitate information retrieval based on a sharable domain ontology .', u'Specifically we conduct semantic annotation on the descriptive metadata of images or articles and convert metadata automatically into machine readable format in terms of semantic Web representation .', u'The retrieval of an image instance or information extraction of an historic question can then be conducted by matching the semantic and structural descriptions of the user query based on those of the annotated descriptive metadata .', u'We show that with aid of domain ontology , an IR system can achieve a better performance than the keyword-based information retrieval systems .']

sentences: [u'Rule-based programming experiences renaissance due to its applications in areas such as Business Rules , Semantic Web , Computational Biology , Verification and Security .', u'Executable rules are used in declarative programming languages , in program transformation and analysis , and for reasoning in artificial intelligence applications .', u'Constraint Handling Rules ( CHR ) [ 6 , 8 , 11 ] is a concurrent committed-choice constraint logic programming language consisting of guarded rules that transform multi-sets of atomic formulas ( constraints ) into simpler ones until exhaustion .', u'CHR was initially developed for solving constraints , but has matured into a general-purpose concurrent constraint language over the last decade , because it can embed many rule-based formalisms and describe algorithms in a declarative way .', u'The clean semantics of CHR facilitates non-trivial program analysis and transformation']

entities: [[(u'ambiguity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fields', u'Task'), (u'argumentation', u'Task'), (u'computing', u'Task')], [(u'argumentation', u'Task'), (u'fallacies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ambiguity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'equivocation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'computing', u'Task'), (u'agent communication languages', u'Material'), (u'conversation policies', u'Method'), (u'dialogue', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'persuasion', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'negotiation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ambiguity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ambiguity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'those', u'Generic'), (u'vagueness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'obscurity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'indeterminacy', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'problems', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'This investigation joins recent research on problems with ambiguity in two fields , argumentation and computing .', u'In argumentation , there is a concern with fallacies arising from ambiguity , including equivocation and amphiboly .', u'In computing , the development of agent communication languages is based on conversation policies that make it possible to have information exchanges on the internet , as well as other forms of dialogue like persuasion and negotiation , in which ambiguity is a problem .', u'Because it is not possible to sharply differentiate between problems arising from ambiguity and those arising from vagueness , obscurity and indeterminacy , some study of the latter is included .', u'The semantic web is based on what are called ontologies , or systems of classification of concepts , shown to be useful tools for dealing with these problems .']

sentences: [u'Semantic retrieval is believed to be a primary motivation for building the semantic Web .', u'However , existing information retrieval technologies alone , e.g. , user input processing , have been insufficient to meet the requirements of the semantic retrieval tasks ( ontology query and inference etc . )', u'due to the loss of semantics of the user input .', u'In this paper , user input processing is incorporated with the ontology-based semantic analysis .', u'A new approach of user input processing is presented to get search expression which is a specific structure of the user input .', u'Search expression is then analyzed semantically through ontology searching and the results are used to form the enriched queries for resources .', u'A prototype is implemented to show the results of the proposed semantic analysis mechanism .']

entities: [[(u'data sharing', u'Task'), (u'electrophysiology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'terminologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data models', u'Method')], [(u'data', u'Material'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web resources', u'Material')], [(u'classic technologies', u'Method'), (u'models', u'Generic')], [(u'data models', u'Method'), (u'models', u'Generic')], [(u'data modeling', u'Task')], [(u'data models', u'Method')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'relational and object oriented model', u'Method'), (u'emerging concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'hierarchical metadata model', u'Method'), (u'expressive power', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'terminologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data models')], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'data'), (u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web resources')], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Increasing requirements on data sharing in the domain of electrophysiology lead to proposing new terminologies and data models .', u'A current trend is to describe data by ontologies and semantic web resources .', u'However , classic technologies and models can not be replaced in a short time .', u'Due to this , dependencies between various data models should be explicitly described and properties , which the models have in common , should be unified .', u'This work summarizes the current state in data modeling .', u'It describes various ways to model and store data and transformation mechanisms between data models .', u'It deals with well-known concepts ( relational and object oriented model ) as well as with emerging concepts ( ontologies ) .', u'Finally , the hierarchical metadata model consisting of levels with different expressive power is introduced .']

entities: [[(u'Knowledge', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web standards', u'Method'), (u'Open World Assumption', u'Method')], [], [(u'rich relational structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'missing knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Statistical Relational Learning system', u'Method'), (u'terminological naive Bayesian classifiers', u'Method'), (u'Description Logic concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'learning process', u'Task'), (u'Open World Assumption', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Statistical Relational Learning system', u'USED-FOR', u'terminological naive Bayesian classifiers')], []]
sentences: [u'Knowledge available through Semantic Web standards can easily be missing , generally because of the adoption of the Open World Assumption ( i.e .', u'the truth value of an assertion is not necessarily known ) .', u'However , the rich relational structure that characterizes ontologies can be exploited for handling such missing knowledge in an explicit way .', u'We present a Statistical Relational Learning system designed for learning terminological naive Bayesian classifiers , which estimate the probability that a generic individual belongs to the target concept given its membership to a set of Description Logic concepts .', u'During the learning process , we consistently handle the lack of knowledge that may be introduced by the adoption of the Open World Assumption , depending on the varying nature of the missing knowledge itself .']

sentences: [u'Discovery of an appropriate learning object according to the needs and interests of a client is one of the major challenges .', u'Although SCORM presents some approaches for content reusability but efficient searching process is a significant problem yet .', u'Under SCORM definition a learning content is packed as a Sharable Content Object ( SCO ) .', u'Some approaches like Semantic Web and Ontology were proposed for resource searching in the web .', u"In this work , we would introduce ontology for discovering learning objects with emphasizing on the SCO 's .", u'Focusing on Learning Objectives is the significant innovation of this work .', u'In this research , we assessed related works and centred our attention on their most significant common concepts .', u'Then , some new concepts were added to complete our proposed ontology .']

sentences: [u'Web services are self contained and self described modular applications that can be published , discovered and employed on the Web .', u'Many standard protocols supporting Web services have been adopted and more are being proposed .', u'We study the issue on providing intelligent Web services .', u'We propose the enhancement of Web service functionalities by deploying software agents on both server side and/or client side .', u'Our goal of designing the WISE Web service architecture is to provide a working middle ground between the current Web service standards and the semantic Web architecture .', u'The WISE software agent architecture for Web services is presented .', u'We discuss the design issues of WISE .', u'We also present the QoS management protocol and algorithm that can be used by WISE servers .']

sentences: [u'Formal Concept Analysis ( FCA ) is revealing interesting in supporting difficult activities that are becoming fundamental in the development of the Semantic Web .', u'Assessing concept similarity is one of such activities since it allows the identification of different concepts that are semantically close .', u'In this paper , a method for measuring the similarity of FCA concepts is presented , which is a refinement of a previous proposal of the author .', u'The refinement consists in determining the similarity of concept descriptors ( attributes ) by using the information content approach , rather than relying on human domain expertise .', u'The information content approach which has been adopted allows a higher correlation with human judgement than other proposals for evaluating concept similarity in a taxonomy defined in the literature .']

sentences: [u'The state-of-the-art and some existing problems of intuitionistic fuzzy rough Description Logics ( DLs ) for the Semantic Web are analyzed .', u'An integration between the theories of intuitionistic fuzzy DLs and rough DLs , i .', u'e. , intuitionistic fuzzy rough DLs , has been provided based on ( `` , # ) -intuitionistic fuzzy rough set theory .', u'Concretely , the intuitionistic fuzzy rough DL IFRSROIQ ( D ) is presented , which is the extension of the expressive DL SROIQ ( D ) behind OWL 2 .', u'It is proved that the reasoning tasks ( knowledge base satisfiability , concept satisfiability , subsumption , logical consequence , ABox consistency , BTCB , and BSB reasoning ) in the intuitionistic fuzzy rough DL IFRSROIQ ( D ) may be reduced to the corresponding reasoning in the fuzzy DL over complete lattices L * -SROIQ ( D ) , respectively .']

sentences: [u'In this paper we present and evaluate two approaches for the generation of Semantic Fields , which are used as a tool for resource discovery in the Semantic Web .', u'We mainly concern ourselves with semantic networks that describe their interests and resources by means of ontologies .', u'Semantic Fields are intended to help users to locate these resources by specifying a brief description ( also as an ontology ) .', u'We propose two ways to automatically build Semantic Fields .', u'The first one is used in the KREIOS approach , which is based on the pre-computation of distances between all the ontology pairs .', u'The second one is based on a fast incremental clustering algorithm , which groups together similar ontologies as they are published .', u'These groups constitute a pre-computed set of Semantic Fields .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'Material')], [], [(u'ontology', u'Task'), (u'ontology development process', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology integration', u'Task')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic')]]
sentences: [u'Ontologies are the building block of the Semantic Web and a diverse range of ontologies of different domains have been constructed and shared by the ontology community .', u'In this regard it is not impractical to reuse existing ontologies that are available publicly instead of constructing ontology from scratch each time .', u'This paper proposes and develops guidelines on how to select ontology merging and integration in an ontology development process .', u'The paper aims to address the gap in literature where little information and guidance are available in determining how to reuse ontology through the process of ontology merging and integration .', u'In addition the paper also proposes a semi-automatic way of performing ontology integration .', u'An application scenario has been presented to illustrate how the proposed methodology is applied .']

sentences: [u'This paper presents a new kind of retrieval and clustering solution for multiple disciplines design knowledge during complex product development .', u'The main contributions of this study can be focused on four points : The first is to distinguish the concepts and contents of ontology theories and semantic web .', u'The second is to map the distinction and relationship between concepts to similarity and correlation of product design knowledge .', u'The substances of conceptual hierarchy are introduced and their formal descriptions are given in the article .', u'The third is to explore the specific calculation methods for semantic similarity and relevancy using the above theories and approaches .', u'Finally , a model for design knowledge retrieval if proposed , and the tactics for knowledge retrieval and clustering are given .']

sentences: [u'Nowadays , ontology has been backbone of Semantic web .', u'However , the current ontologies are based on traditional logic such as first-order logic and description logic .', u'The conceptual formalism of the ontologies can not be fully representative for imprecise and vague information ( e.g .', u"`` rainfall is very heavy '' ) in many application domains .", u'In this paper , a domain fuzzy ontology is defined clearly , and its components such as fuzzy relation , concrete fuzzy concept , and fuzzy domain concept as well as similarity measures between the components are addressed .', u'Fuzzy ontology integration on concept level using consensus method to solve conflicts among the ontologies is proposed .', u'In particular , the postulates for integration are specified and algorithms for reconciling conflicts among fuzzy concepts in ontology integration are proposed .']

sentences: [u'Diese Arbeit soll eine Moglichkeit aufzeigen , aufbauend auf dem Sesame Framework Datenbestande von nicht-semantischen Web-Diensten im Sinne des Semantic Web auszuwerten .', u'Konkret wird ein Sail ( Webservice-Sail ) entwickelt , das einen solchen Web-Dienst wie eine RDF-Quelle abfragen kann , indem es SPARQL-Ausdrucke in Methodenaufrufe des Dienstes ubersetzt und deren Ergebnisse entsprechend auswertet und zuruckgibt .', u'Um eine moglichst grose Anzahl von Webservices abdecken zu konnen , muss die Losung entsprechend generisch gehalten sein .', u'Das bedeutet aber insbesondere auch , dass das Sail auf die Modalitaten konkreter Services eingestellt werden muss .', u'Es muss also auch eine geeignete Konfigurationsreprasentation gefunden werden , um eine moglichst gute Unterstutzung eines zu verwendenden Web-Dienstes durch das Webservice-Sail zu gewahrleisten .', u'Die Entwicklung einer solchen Reprasentation ist damit auch Bestandteil dieser Arbeit .']

entities: [[(u'Assistive Technologies', u'Method'), (u'minor-to-moderate impairments', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'user profiling', u'Method'), (u'machine-oriented capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conspicuous ATs', u'Method')], [], [(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'capability-based approach', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'delivery gap')]]
sentences: [u'The continuing proliferation of mobile devices , content and applications presents barriers to the mainstreaming of Assistive Technologies ( ATs ) , despite their potential utility for users in demanding situations or with minor-to-moderate impairments .', u'We have previously proposed that user profiling based on human rather than machine-oriented capabilities , coupled with a shift from conspicuous ATs to considering a broader range of adaptations presents opportunities for platform and AT vendors to support many more users .', u'However there has not been a standard , consistent and , most importantly , straightforward way to deliver these benefits .', u'We propose that this delivery gap can be bridged by using the semantic web and related technologies , so the potential benefits of the capability-based approach may be realised .']

entities: [[(u'Ontology', u'Task'), (u'domain of interest', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'intractability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data complexity', u'Metric'), (u'heterogeneous sources', u'Material')], [(u'knowledge representation and reasoning processes', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'Building query systems', u'Task')], [(u'ontology methods', u'Method'), (u'data complexity', u'Metric')], [(u'Conjunctive queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'first-order logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conjunction', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'existential quantification', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'database atomic formulae', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'meteorological and oceanographic domain', u'Material')], [(u'querying method', u'Method'), (u'logical systems', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Ontology is an explicit representation of a particular domain of interest .', u'This paper focuses on the inherent problem of intractability ( data complexity ) due to data capturing for heterogeneous sources .', u'We proposed to follow the tradition of knowledge representation and reasoning processes to develop a Semantic Web .', u'Building query systems is the ultimate goal for this study .', u'Conjunctive queries were adopted over ontology methods to address the data complexity .', u'The Conjunctive queries are the form of queries in first-order logic that deal with conjunction ( ) and existential quantification ( ) in database atomic formulae .', u'State of the art meteorological and oceanographic domain provides the motivation for this work .', u'We found that the querying method facilitates the tractability in reasoning and logical systems .']

entities: [[(u'Persistent Organic Pollutants', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'epidemiological data', u'Material'), (u'POPs', u'Method')], [(u'task', u'Generic'), (u'models discovery capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'monitoring networks', u'Method'), (u'web resources', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Discovery Framework', u'Method'), (u'semantic web solution', u'Method'), (u'web resources', u'Material')], [(u'TaToo tools', u'Method'), (u'software GENASIS', u'Method'), (u'SVOD', u'Method'), (u'TaToo validation scenario', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'POPs trajectory', u'Material')], [(u'POPs', u'Method'), (u'cancer domain ontology', u'Method'), (u'TaToo framework', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'The synthesis of existing Persistent Organic Pollutants ( POPs ) pollution monitoring databases with epidemiological data is considered for identifying some impacts of POPs on human health .', u'This task requires new , rich , data , services and models discovery capabilities from a multitude of monitoring networks and web resources .', u'The FP7 project TaToo ( Tagging Tool based on a Semantic Discovery Framework ) is setting up a semantic web solution to close the discovery gap that prevents a full and easy access to web resources .', u'The use of TaToo tools together with software GENASIS and SVOD is discussed as TaToo validation scenario for anthropogenic impact and global climate change influence on POPs trajectory .', u'This paper contains the first propose of POPs and cancer domain ontology intended for TaToo framework .']

sentences: [u'The Semantic Web is a vision for the future of the Web in which information is given explicit meaning , making it easier for machines to automatically process and integrate information available on the Web .', u'An ontology defines the terms used to describe and represent an area of knowledge .', u'Ontologies are used by people , databases , and applications that need to share domain information ( a domain is just a specific subject area or area of knowledge , like medicine , tool manufacturing , real estate , automobile repair , financial management , etc . ) .', u'In this paper we combine this two concepts to annotate models with meta-data according to the corresponding domain ontology with all the new extracted information in order to improve the performance of the entire system .']

sentences: [u'The learner modeling is a cornerstone of the personalized interaction in any Technology Enhanced Learning ( TEL ) .', u"Based on ontology 's , the development of the Semantic Web offers new opportunities and challenges in the design of a new generation of adaptive systems , It 's in this context that is situated the scope of our research works , with the aim of integrating a new modeling vision and learner pattern management in open and distributed environments .", u'We so propose a semantic modeling of the learner by turning to an approach said by skills , and it by means an ontology based on results of the works of the cognitive theories for the description of the profiles learners more exactly for the representation of the knowledge and the skills of learning .']

sentences: [u'In several domains such as linguistics , molecular biology or social sciences , holistic effects are hardly well-defined by modeling with single units , but more and more studies tend to understand macro structures with the help of meaningful and useful associations in fields such as social networks , systems biology or semantic web .', u'A stochastic multi-agent system offers both accurate theoretical framework and operational computing implementations to model large-scale associations , their dynamics and patterns extraction .', u'We show that clustering around a target object in a set of associations of object prove some similarity in specific data and two case studies about gene-gene and term-term relationships leading to an idea of a common organizing principle of cognition with random and deterministic effects .']

sentences: [u'One of the main items on the eHealth agenda of the European Community is the design and promotion of electronic patient summaries as an instrument to guarantee the continuity of healthcare across national boundaries and to facilitate the pervasive delivery of healthcare , thus ensuring the right to patient mobility and increasing the productivity and quality of health service delivery .', u'From a technical point of view , this objective requires middleware technology which is able to cope with the stringent interoperability , multi-lingualism , distribution , and privacy requirements arising in eHealth settings .', u'This paper presents triplespace computing , a coordination middleware for the Semantic Web , and demonstrates its relevance to the realization of the European Patient Summary , an infrastructure for sharing and coordinating access to patient summaries at the European level .']

sentences: [u'In the beginning World Wide Web was syntactic and the content itself was only readable by humans .', u'The modern web combines existing web technologies with knowledge representation formalisms .', u'In this sense , the Semantic Web proposes the mark-up of content on the web using formal ontology that structure essential data for the purpose of comprehensive machine understanding .', u'On the syntactical level , standardization is an important topic .', u'Many standards which can be used to integrate different information sources have evolved .', u'Beside the classical database interfaces like ODBC , web-oriented standard languages like HTML , XML , RDF and OWL increase in importance .', u'As the World Wide Web offers the greatest potential for sharing information , we will base our paper on these evolving standards .']

sentences: [u'Query answering is a key reasoning task for many ontology based applications in the Semantic Web .', u'Unfortunately for OWL , the worst case complexity of query answering is very high .', u'That is why , when the schema of an ontology is written in a highly expressive language like OWL 2 DL , currently used query answering systems do not find all answers to queries posed over the ontology , i.e. , they are incomplete .', u'In this paper optimizations are discussed that may make query answering over expressive languages feasible in practice .', u'These optimizations mostly focus on the use of traditional database techniques that will be adapted to be applicable to knowledge bases .', u'Moreover , caching techniques and a form of progressive query answering are also explored .']

entities: [[(u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'information fusion', u'Task')], [(u'information fusion', u'Task'), (u'instancelevel ( extensional ) information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fusion process', u'Method')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'schemalevel structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information fusion', u'Task'), (u'instancelevel information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'geospatial landcover data', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic')], [(u'fusion method', u'Method'), (u'software prototype', u'Method')], [(u'spatialdata mining', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'This paper presents a new technique for information fusion .', u'Unlike most previous work on information fusion , this paper explores the use of instancelevel ( extensional ) information within the fusion process .', u'This paper proposes an algorithm that can be used automatically to infer the schemalevel structure necessary for information fusion from instancelevel information .', u'The approach is illustrated using the example of geospatial landcover data .', u'The method is then extended to operate under uncertainty , such as in cases where the data are inaccurate or imprecise .', u'The paper describes the implementation of the fusion method within a software prototype .', u'Finally , the paper discusses several key topics for future research , including applications of this work to spatialdata mining and the semantic web .']

sentences: [u'In this paper we propose a method to analyse contextual perspectives in information search and retrieval process in the Semantic Web framework .', u'We start with definitions of context in different computer science applications .', u'We discuss our specific purpose of context-aware information representation and then describe utilising the context confidence factor for ranking the relationships .', u'A confidence factor specifies relevancy degree of an entity to a context in a particular domain .', u'We demonstrate how the uncertainty and Bayesian rule are taken in to account to compute the confidence factor for the results of a query .', u'The main goal is providing a context-aware ranking method which defines degree of relevancy between resources in a set of related information to a particular query .']

sentences: [u'Information services provided via Internet are gaining relevance in many fields .', u'Semantically based access to documentary information resources seems necessary in order to increase the accuracy that decision makers expect .', u'This is becoming a necessity in domains where information resources increase exponentially and exhibit an inherent diversity .', u'Information producers will recognize and register the contents of their products for semantically based treatment purposes in the near future .', u'This paper describes an approach for managing heterogeneous information resources repositories using as case study the forestry domain in Mexico .', u'A repository is a store or memory built on semantic web concepts .', u'We developed an initial version of such a memory which we have described here , together with the approach we took towards building a prototype for validation of ideas .']

sentences: [u'Before undertaking new biomedical research , identifying concepts that have already been patented is essential .', u'Traditional keyword based search on patent databases may not be sufficient to retrieve all the relevant information , especially for the biomedical domain .', u'More sophisticated retrieval techniques are required .', u'This paper presents BioPatentMiner , a system that facilitates information retrieval from biomedical patents .', u'It integrates information from the patents with knowledge from biomedical ontologies to create a Semantic Web .', u'Besides keyword search and queries linking the properties specified by one or more RDF triples , the system can discover Semantic Associations between the resources .', u'The system also determines the importance of the resources to rank the results of a search and prevent information overload while determining the Semantic Associations .']

relations: [[], [(u'databases', u'USED-FOR', u'method')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In recent years , a number of Semantic Web databases have been actively open to public as common resources on the Web by the effort of Linked Open Data community project .', u'Due to this , we need a good method to search necessary data from those databases , depending on various purposes .', u'In this study , we propose two methods to rank the results retrieved by a SPARQL query especially , a SELECT query , using the information about the frequency of each property in a data set and the links between RDF resources .', u'In order to evaluate our proposed methods , we set two cases for using SPARQL queries , and then rank the query results in each case .', u'The usefulness of our proposed method has been confirmed by subject experiments .']

sentences: [u'We present in this paper a tool that supports the collec- tion of user preferences within the set of components developed in the i2web project to enable UI adaptability of web 2.0 applications .', u'The tool ( called Model Management System , MMS ) is based upon a semantic web modelling framework to describe user preferences and device capa- bilities , combined with state-of-the-art models of web applications .', u'This work builds upon previous efforts of the authors ( 1 ) leveraged with the use of the semantic framework Composite Capability/Preference Profiles ( CC/PP ( 2 ) ) .', u'The MMS gathers information on user preferences and sup- ports user and application providers in discovering the characteristics of the device utilized by the user when accessing the application .']

sentences: [u'Within the Esperonto project , an integration of NLP , ontologies and other knowledge bases , is being performed with the goal to implement a semantic annotation service that upgrades the actual Web towards the emerging Semantic Web .', u'Research is being currently conducted on how to apply the Esperonto semantic annotation service to text material associated with still images in web pages .', u'In doing so , the project will allow for semantic querying of still images in the web , but also ( automatically ) create a large set of text-based semantic annotations of still images , which can be used by the Multimedia community in order to support the task of content indexing of image material , possibly combining the Esperonto type of annotations with the annotations resulting from image analysis .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'visualization technique', u'USED-FOR', u'large instance sets')], [(u'node-link and adjacency matrix representations of graphs', u'USED-FOR', u'visualization')]]
sentences: [u"Most tools for visualizing Semantic Web data structure the representation according to the concept definitions and interrelations that constitute the ontology 's vocabulary .", u'Instances are often treated as somewhat peripheral information , when considered at all .', u'The visualization of instance-level data poses different but significant challenges as instances will often be orders of magnitude more numerous than the concept definitions that give them machine-processable meaning .', u'We present a visualization technique designed to visualize large instance sets and the relations that connect them .', u'This visualization uses both node-link and adjacency matrix representations of graphs to visualize different parts of the data depending on their semantic and local structural properties , exploiting ontological knowledge to drive the layout of , and navigation in , the visualization .']

sentences: [u'In this paper , based on a web page to determine similarity is proposed which is based on semantic web similarity judgments .', u'First on the web page of text extraction , is text segmentation , also taking stop words to go out , Similarity judgments for the Web page provides a basis .', u'Then based on Vector Space Model using TF-IDF method similar to the Chinese website text judgment , In the process of judging , We are adopting a dictionary Words of Synonyms thesaurus , the unity of the key words on the page synonymous , And replacement of pages without the text a synonym for comparison , Experimental results show , The text on the page replacing the unity of synonyms significantly improved the accuracy of the web page similarity judgments .']

sentences: [u'The semantic Web offers new opportunities to integrate desktop applications seamlessly with one another , but most software applications currently still rely on proprietary RDBMS systems for data storage , and application logic is typically expressed only through general-purpose programming languages without being formally defined .', u'In this article we propose an alternative approach to designing simple applications , using an OWL-DL ontology to define ECA rules for a domain and then use a novel software framework to transform these into a functional Java API that can execute these rules according to the ontology specification .', u'We use the simple case of a turn based word-game to illustrate the framework in action .', u'The project methodology and framework design are discussed and suggestions for further work are proposed .']

relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'recursive method', u'USED-FOR', u'similarity of ontological concepts')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u"Characteristics in the user model can be acquired and maintained in several ways , namely by means of implicit or explicit feedback , observation of user 's actions , log analysis , etc .", u'We use analysis of the content that is presented to a user .', u"We assume that comparing documents and analyzing their common and different aspects can lead to information about user 's interests .", u'We work in the Semantic Web environment where ontologies are used as a mean for content representation .', u'We proposed a recursive method to evaluate similarity of ontological concepts .', u"But computed similarities do not take into account user 's individuality , i.e .", u'the same results are computed for each user .', u"User 's perception of the similarity measure is subjective .", u'Therefore , we extend the method to compute similarity with regard to the user .']

sentences: [u'The creation of ontology data on web sites and proper management of them would help the growth of the semantic web .', u'This paper proposes a semantic wiki approach to tackle this issue .', u'Desirable functions that a semantic wiki approach should implement to offer a better solution to this issue are discussed .', u'Along with that , some key problems such as usability , data reliability and data quality are identified and analyzed .', u'Based on that , a system framework is presented to show how such functions are designed .', u'These functions are further explained along with the description of our implemented prototype system .', u'By addressing the identified key problems , our semantic wiki approach is expected to be able to create and manage web ontology data more effectively .']

sentences: [u'Automation of smart home for ambient assisted living is currently based on a widespread use of sensors .', u'As efficient as it seems to be , this solution can sometimes be problematic when one focus on user acceptability intimately related to cost and intrusivity .', u'In this paper , we propose a context-aware system based on the semantic analysis of each user request at runtime .', u'Our goal is to infer user data usually sensored by using advanced semantic web tools to adapt home automation services to people with special needs .', u'To take up this challenge , an ontology , automatically derived from a model-driven process , firstly defines user-system interactions .', u'Then , the use of rules allows an inference engine to deduce user location and intention leading to adapted service delivery .']

sentences: [u'In this paper , I will show how a controlled natural language can be used to describe knowledge for the Semantic Web and discuss the formal properties of this language .', u'At the first glance , the proposed controlled natural language looks like full English and can therefore be easily written and understood by non-specialists .', u'However , its built-in grammatical and lexical restrictions , which are enforced by an intelligent authoring tool , guarantee that the language can be directly translated into description logic programs , i.e .', u'the intersection of an expressive description logic with function-free logic programs .', u'The controlled natural language can be used to make assertional and terminological statements as well as to specify rules for reasoning with the resulting assertional and terminological knowledge .']

sentences: [u'Failures in safety-critical software will lead to catastrophic consequences .', u'Software failure modes and effect analysis ( SFMEA ) is a safety analysis method which is commonly used in industry .', u'However , the SFMEA method relies on manual analysis , thus it has poor reusability and low accuracy .', u'To solve these problems , this paper proposes a creative SFMEA method combined with ontology and rule reasoning .', u'Firstly , the SFMEA ontology is developed to accurately describe the software failure knowledge .', u'Secondly , rules are built to describe the failure analysis processes using semantic web rule language ( SWRL ) .', u'According to the failure causes , the reasoning engine can analyze the failure effects automatically .', u'At last , a case study of engine flameout-state module analysis confirms the feasibility and practicality of the research .']
