sentences: [u'Managing ubiquitous scientific knowledge is a part of daily life for scholars , while it also becomes a hot topic in the Semantic Web research community .', u'In this paper , we propose a SKO Types framework aiming to facilitate managing ubiquitous Scientific Knowledge Objects ( SKO ) driven by semantic authoring , modularization , annotation and search .', u'SKO Types framework comprises SKO Metadata Schema , SKO Patterns and SKO Editor corresponding to metadata layer , ontology layer and interface layer respectively .', u'SKO Metadata Schema specifies sets of attributes describing SKOs individually and relationally .', u'SKO Patterns is a three-ontology based model in order to modularize scientific publications syntactically and semantically , while SKO Editor supplies a LaTex-like mark-up language and editing environment for authoring and annotating SKOs concurrently .']

sentences: [u'The instructional knowledge generated by the use of a learning management system , and the search processes and the development of resources for learning , can be used to improve the environments in which instruction is designed .', u'Our current project is concerned to the need to develop a knowledge-based architecture that may assist teachers in their e-learning design practices .', u'Instructional design methods , learning theories , efficient searching methods and tools and metadata managing , are examples of the necessary knowledge and abilities .', u'In this document we are centred in presenting the overall system architecture and describing their main parts .', u'We are also reporting current results .', u'Due to its wide conception , this project involves knowledge engineering , software engineering , machine learning , semantic web searching and data mining models and tools .']

entities: [[(u'AbstractSemantic web service ( SWS ) composition', u'Method')], [(u'SWS composition approach', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'Taxonomical Classification System', u'Method'), (u'TCS )', u'Method'), (u'Technique Recommendation System', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'SWS composition approaches', u'Method'), (u'composition approach', u'Method'), (u'condition parameters', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'composition approach', u'Method'), (u'semantic web based systems', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'AbstractSemantic web service ( SWS ) composition increases the capability of an application to satisfy users requests by theoretically generating an unlimited number of new services from the composition of limited service components .', u'The performance of a SWS composition approach highly depends upon the situation of its use .', u'In this paper , a framework called Technique Classification and Recommendation Framework has been proposed .', u'It is composed of two systems : Taxonomical Classification System ( TCS ) and Technique Recommendation System ( TRS ) .', u'This framework presents a novel classification of various SWS composition approaches and provides recommendations to the user regarding the composition approach to use under given condition parameters .', u'The framework can be of immense use for the selection of appropriate composition approach during the development of semantic web based systems .']

sentences: [u'The internet of things promises to embed objects within internet , by providing location and search services , by integrating sensor data , user input and stored information .', u'All this is going to be implemented with the support of a processing layer , which is distributed over the network and assures a smart behaviour , exhibited at a global and a local level .', u'Given these premises , this paper explores different aspects connected to smartness , such as identification , representation and intelligence , both individual and collective .', u'Contact points of the internet of things with semantic web and other initiatives , coming from the social web and business and research activities , are explored in a sort of journey through open challenges and achievements from related areas which are worth to be exploited .']

sentences: [u'A dramatic increase of demand for provided treatment quality has occurred during last decades .', u'The main hallenge to be confronted , so as to increase treatment quality , IS the personalization of treatment , since each patient constitutes a unique case .', u'Healthcare provision encloses a complex environment since healthcare provision organizations are highly multidisciplinar y .', u'In this paper , we present the conceptualizatio n of the domain of Clinical Pathways .', u'The SEMPATH Ontology comprises three main parts : a ) the Clinical Pathway part , b ) the Business & Finance part and c ) the Quality Assurance part .', u'Our implementation achieves the conceptualizatio n of the multidisciplinar y domain of healthcare provision , in order to be further utilized for the implementation of a Semantic Web Rules ( SWRL rules ) repository .']

sentences: [u'Software has become crucial for everyday matters .', u'In this scenario , the effective management of the software development process has become an essential issue for business survival in an ever more competitive industry .', u'In order to gain business strengths from the development process , organizations need to carry out software development in the most efficient manner possible , avoiding redundancy and time losses .', u'This paper presents an architecture which combines the strengths of two technologies , Web 2.0 and the Semantic Web , as a solution to reuse and extrapolate knowledge and software products across projects and organizations .', u'Social Global repository is a tool which incorporates established methodological recommendations of Software Engineering in an environment which provides support , flexibility and up-to- date solutions to software development teams .']

sentences: [u'The domain of traditional web is gradually evolving with the adaptation of newer techniques , which includes semantic web .', u'Integration of web content using ontologies in a language independent manner is a required feature in this process .', u'For better utilization of the resources , it is necessary that the ontology , which is working as a central knowledge repository , to be language independent as well .', u'This paper will propose a framework that will augment the domain of multilingual ontology and provide a universal technique to integrate infinite number of languages to the understanding of the multilingual ontology .', u'Augmenting the Wikipedia entries in Bengali language using the English language entries has been used as an example to demonstrate the validity of the proposed process .']

sentences: [u'Although ontology has strong ability to express knowledge , it is difficult to express uncertain or imprecise information using the language of ontology .', u'In order to improve the ability to express uncertain information , this paper extends the Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) and gives the extension of reasoning rules .', u'According to the rough ontology and the rules of SWRL , it updates the knowledge base .', u'Firstly , the concept of rough ontology and the extension of rough relationship of ontology are put forward ; secondly , it gives the extension method for concepts , relationships , axioms , examples , and rules of SWRL .', u'Finally , a psychological counseling case shows that the method can well express the uncertainty of knowledge , and it is able to well express the reasoning rules .']

sentences: [u'Although web sites have started to embed semantic metadata within their documents , it remains a challenge for non-technical end-users to exploit that markup to extract and store information of interest .', u'To address this challenge , we show how tools can be developed that allow users to identify extractable information while browsing and then control how that information should be extracted and stored in a personal library .', u'The proposed approach is based on an extensible framework capable of using different kinds of markup to aid the extraction process and a unique fusion of several well-established techniques from areas such as the semantic web , data warehousing , web scraping and web feeds .', u'We present the Sift tool which is a proof-of-concept implementation of the approach .']

sentences: [u'Short context messages ( like tweets and SMSs ) are a potentially rich source of continuously and instantly updated information .', u'Shortness and informality of such messages are challenges for Natural Language Processing tasks .', u'Most efforts done in this direction rely on machine learning techniques which are expensive in terms of data collection and training .', u'In this paper we present an unsupervised Semantic Web-driven approach to improve the extraction process by using clues from the disambiguation process .', u'For extraction we used a simple Knowledge-Base matching technique combined with a clustering-based approach for disambiguation .', u'Experimental results on a self-collected set of tweets ( as an example of short context messages ) show improvement in extraction results when using unsupervised feedback from the disambiguation process .']

sentences: [u'The success of Semantic Web will heavily rely on the availability of formal ontologies to structure machine understanding data .', u'However , there is still a lack of general methodologies for ontology automatic learning and population , i.e .', u'the generation of domain ontologies from various kinds of resources by applying natural language processing and machine learning techniques In this paper , the authors present an ontology learning and population system that combines both statistical and semantic methodologies .', u'Several experiments have been carried out , demonstrating the effectiveness of the proposed approach .', u'HighlightsA graph of terms can be effectively used for ontology building.Such a graph is extracted from documents thanks to a LDA based methodology.Ontology learning involves the use of annotated lexicons ( WordNet ) .Proposed method achieves good performances on standard datasets .']

relations: [[], [(u'CPU cycles', u'CONJUNCTION', u'storage capacity'), (u'storage capacity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'software licenses')], [(u'Semantic Grid', u'PART-OF', u'Grid computing'), (u'Semantic Web-based technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'Grid computing')], [(u'Semantic Grid', u'USED-FOR', u'grid management data'), (u'machine-understandable format', u'FEATURE-OF', u'grid management data')], [(u'collaborative awareness model', u'USED-FOR', u'virtual organizations'), (u'Semantic Grid environments', u'FEATURE-OF', u'virtual organizations')], [(u'CAM', u'USED-FOR', u'resource interaction and management'), (u'awareness models', u'USED-FOR', u'CAM'), (u'awareness models', u'USED-FOR', u'resource interaction and management')]]
sentences: [u'Grid computing environments are set up mainly to encourage the shared use of different resources based on business/scientific needs .', u'The way these resources are shared in terms of CPU cycles , storage capacity , software licenses etc. , is normally dictated by the availability of these resources outside the local administration context .', u'The Semantic Grid is the extension of Grid computing with Semantic Web-based technologies .', u'The Semantic Grid represents grid management data in a machine-understandable format , and reasoning can handle complicated situations in virtual organization management .', u'This paper presents the extension of the collaborative awareness model ( CAM ) to manage virtual organizations in Semantic Grid environments .', u'CAM applies some theoretical principles of awareness models to promote resource interaction and management , as well as task delivery .']

relations: [[(u'subscriber profile', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'subscriber data'), (u'subscriber profile', u'CONJUNCTION', u'location data'), (u'location data', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'subscriber data'), (u'location data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'presence information'), (u'presence information', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'subscriber data')], [(u'data', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'telecommunication network operators')], [], [(u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'architecture'), (u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge base'), (u'subscriber data', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Telecommunication networks already store a large amount of subscriber data ( e.g. , subscriber profile , location data , presence information ) , and even more data could be captured .', u'Although this data is a key asset of telecommunication network operators , it is seldom fully exploited .', u'This article proposes a novel architecture to enable the provisioning of new value-added services , based on subscriber data .', u'This architecture uses semantic web to build a knowledge base from the subscriber data available in individual telecommunication networks .', u'KBs are then federated across telecommunication networks to provide a single and unified interface to service providers for accessing the different KBs .', u'The article also illustrates the use of the proposed architecture in a concrete scenario , and presents a proof-of-concept prototype .']

entities: [[], [(u'Wikipedia', u'Material'), (u'encyclopedia', u'Material')], [(u"Wikipedia 's En- glish articles", u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web meta data', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'syntactic and semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'relation extraction', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material')], [(u'hyperthesis', u'Generic'), (u'description', u'Task'), (u'relation extraction', u'Task'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'text understanding', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'The exponential growth of Wikipedia recently attracts the attention of a large number of researchers and practitioners .', u'One of the current challenge on Wikipedia is to make the encyclopedia processable for machines .', u"In this paper , we deal with the problem of extracting relations between entities from Wikipedia 's En- glish articles , which can straightforwardly be transformed into Semantic Web meta data .", u'We propose a method to exploit syntactic and semantic information for relation extraction .', u'In addition , our method can utilize the nature of Wikipedia to automatically obtain training data .', u'The preliminary results of our experiments strongly support our hyperthesis that using information in higher level of description is better for relation extraction on Wikipedia and show that our method is promising for text understanding .']

sentences: [u'The present invention relates to the field of system architecture of an Internet of Things , and particularly , to a semantics-based system architecture model of an Internet of Things .', u'Based on researches on frameworks such as a semantic Web , a sensor network and a sensor Web , the present invention provides system architecture of an Internet of Things .', u'The architecture is divided into seven layers : an entity layer , a sensing layer , a gateway layer , a data layer , a semantic layer , and an application layer .', u'By performing semantization processing of sensor data and constructing a sensor entity , the architecture can automatically discover a heterogeneous resource , improve an expression capability of data , effectively share , reuse , integrate and access data , improve the interoperability of resources , and implement an intelligent service .']

sentences: [u'Backgrounds : The increase in the amount of structured data published using the principles of Linked Data , means that now it is more likely to find resources in the Web of Data that describe real life concepts .', u'However , discovering resources related to any given resource is still an open research area .', u'This thesis studies Recommender Systems ( RS ) that use Linked Data as a source for generating recommendations exploiting the large amount of available resources and the relationships among them .', u'Aims : The main objective of this study was to propose a recommendation tech- nique for resources considering semantic relationships between concepts from Linked Data .', u'The specific objectives were : ( i ) Define semantic relationships derived from resources taking into account the knowledge found in Linked Data datasets .', u'( ii ) Determine semantic similarity measures based on the semantic relationships derived from resources .', u'( iii ) Propose an algorithm to dynami- cally generate automatic rankings of resources according to defined similarity measures .', u'Methodology : It was based on the recommendations of the Project management Institute and the Integral Model for Engineering Professionals ( Universidad del Cauca ) .', u'The first one for managing the project , and the second one for developing the experimental prototype .', u'Accordingly , the main phases were : ( i ) Conceptual base generation for identifying the main problems , objectives and the project scope .', u'A Systematic Literature Review was conducted for this phase , which highlighted the relationships and similarity measures among resources in Linked Data , and the main issues , features , and types of RS based on Linked Data .', u'( ii ) Solution development is about designing and developing the experimental prototype for testing the algorithms studied in this thesis .', u'Results : The main results obtained were : ( i ) The first Systematic Literature Re- view on RS based on Linked Data .', u'( ii ) A framework to execute and an- alyze recommendation algorithms based on Linked Data .', u'( iii ) A dynamic algorithm for resource recommendation based on on the knowledge of Linked Data relationships .', u'( iv ) A comparative study of algorithms for RS based on Linked Data .', u'( v ) Two implementations of the proposed framework .', u'One with graph-based algorithms and other with machine learning algorithms .', u'( vi ) The application of the framework to various scenarios to demonstrate its feasibility within the context of real applications .', u"Conclusions : ( i ) The proposed framework demonstrated to be useful for develop- ing and evaluating different configurations of algorithms to create novel RS based on Linked Data suitable to users ' requirements , applications , domains and contexts .", u'( ii ) The layered architecture of the proposed framework is also useful towards the reproducibility of the results for the research community .', u'( iii ) Linked data based RS are useful to present explanations of the recommen- dations , because of the graph structure of the datasets .', u'( iv ) Graph-based algo- rithms take advantage of intrinsic relationships among resources from Linked Data .', u'Nevertheless , their execution time is still an open issue .', u'Machine Learn- ing algorithms are also suitable , they provide functions useful to deal with large amounts of data , so they can help to improve the performance ( execution time ) of the RS .', u'However most of them need a training phase that require to know a priory the application domain in order to obtain reliable results .', u'( v ) A log- ical evolution of RS based on Linked Data is the combination of graph-based with machine learning algorithms to obtain accurate results while keeping low execution times .', u'However , research and experimentation is still needed to ex- plore more techniques from the vast amount of machine learning algorithms to determine the most suitable ones to deal with Linked Data .']

sentences: [u'Only a few media companies have so far ( as of April 2012 ) publicly declared engagement in the area of Linked Data .', u'Nevertheless among the chosen few are BBC Online , the New York Times , The Guardian and Reuters who utilize Linked Data to add significant value to the news production process .', u'This paper discusses achievements and challenges in utilizing semantic metadata in the news production process .', u'By discussing a BBC use case it illustrates how Linked Data can be integrated into the content value chain and provide added value to content-related workflows without necessarily disrupting them .', u'This is insofar critical as publishing companies react very sensitively to radical changes in their working settings and are often very suspicious of technologically induced innovations .', u'Given the fact that from the perspective of media professionals Linked Data is a highly technology driven phenomenon that incrementally incorporates the culture , speech and logic of the engineering discipline , it is necessary to translate the benefits of Linked Data into the thinking and understanding of the publishing sector by illustrating the intersections between the traditional editorial content value chain and Linked Data as a complementary resource to innovate existing products and services .']

sentences: [u'Linked data consist of both node attributes , e.g. , Preferences , posts and degrees , and links which describe the connections between nodes .', u'They have been widely used to represent various network systems , such as social networks , biological networks and etc .', u'Knowledge discovery on linked data is of great importance to many real applications .', u'One of the major challenges of learning linked data is how to effectively and efficiently extract useful information from both node attributes and links in linked data .', u'Current studies on this topic either use selected topological statistics to represent network structures , or linearly map node attributes and network structures to a shared latent feature space .', u'However , while approaches based on statistics may miss critical patterns in network structure , approaches based on linear mappings may not be sufficient to capture the non-linear characteristics of nodes and links .', u'To handle the challenge , we propose , to our knowledge , the first deep learning method to learn from linked data .', u'A restricted Boltzmann machine model named LRBM is developed for representation learning on linked data .', u'In LRBM , we aim to extract the latent feature representation of each node from both node attributes and network structures , non-linearly map each pair of nodes to the links , and use hidden units to control the mapping .', u'The details of how to adapt LRBM for link prediction and node classification on linked data have also been presented .', u'In the experiments , we test the performance of LRBM as well as other baselines on link prediction and node classification .', u'Overall , the extensive experimental evaluations confirm the effectiveness of the proposed LRBM model in mining linked data .']

sentences: [u'Linked Data relies on one central concept : Typed links connect entities stored within data sets published by dierent individuals .', u'Manual input and mapping are common techniques to create these links .', u'We propose a novel method , where HTTP Referer information is used to create new links between Linked Data entities stored in dierent data sets .', u'We evaluate our method using 27.86 million real-world log entries from web servers hosting Linked Data .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge-linked form', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information resources integration model', u'Method'), (u'SOA', u'Method'), (u'information resources integration', u'Task'), (u'university libraries', u'Material'), (u'heterogeneous data resources', u'Material'), (u'medical libraries', u'Material')]]
sentences: [u'In order to simplify the maintenance of linked data and provide an intelligent information access model for users in a simple and clear knowledge-linked form , an information resources integration model was put forward according to the linked data and SOA for the information resources integration in medical college and university libraries , which can shield the heterogeneous data resources and unify the linked data generating software platforms in medical libraries .']

sentences: [u'Organisations have realized that effective development and management of their organisational knowledge base is critical to survival in todays competitive business environment .', u'Employees , as a special knowledge asset , also attract the interest of many researchers because only through people communicating with one another can they really share their tacit knowledge and skills , which are often more valuable than sharing explicit documentations .', u'The need to be able to quickly locate experts among the heterogeneous data sources stored in the organisational memory has been recognized by many researchers .', u'This paper examines the advantages of using RDF ( resource description framework ) for expertise matchingthe process of finding an individual with the required knowledge and skills .', u'The major challenge is to semantically integrate multiple expertise indications from heterogeneous data sources stored in the organisational memory in order to facilitate users to locate the right expert ( s ) .', u'To understand the issues , a case study has been performed that involves building a RDF-based expertise broker that helps Ph.D. applicants locate potential supervisors before they formally apply to a university .', u'An evaluation of the brokering system has been conducted through an experiment and the key results are presented .', u'An extended brokering system that would support expertise matching in a multidisciplinary context is also described and further research identified .']

sentences: [u'We propose an electronic marketplace archi- tecture , called MOPPET , where the commerce processes in the marketplace are modeled as adaptable agent-based workflows .', u'The higher level of abstraction provided by the workflow technologymakes the customization of elec- tronic commerce processes for different users possible .', u'Agent-based implementation , on the other hand , provides for a highlyreusable component-based workflow archi- tecture as well as negotiation abilityand the capability to adapt to dynamic changes in the environment .', u'Agent communication is handled through Knowledge Queryand Manipulation Language ( KQML ) .', u'A workflow-based ar- chitecture also makes it possible for complete modeling of electronic commerce processes byallowing involved parties to be able to invoke alreadyexisting applica- tions or to define new tasks and to re-structure the con- trol and data flow among the tasks to create custom built process definitions .', u'In the proposed architecture all data exchanges are realized through Extensible Markup Language ( XML ) providing uniformity , simplicity and a highlyopen and interoperable architecture .', u'Metadata of activities are expressed through Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) .', u'Common Business Library ( CBL ) is used for achieving interoperabilityacross business do- mains and domain specific Document Type Definitions ( DTDs ) are used for vertical industries .', u'We provide our own specifications for missing DTDs to be replaced bythe original specifications when theybecome available .']

entities: [[(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'mining association rules', u'Task'), (u'adaptive search engine', u'Method')], [(u'resource description framework model', u'Method'), (u'association rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'metadata-based search engine', u'Method')], [(u'document repository', u'Material'), (u'adaptive hybrid search engine', u'Method'), (u'method', u'Generic')], [(u'repository', u'Generic'), (u'document registration module', u'Method'), (u'hybrid search engine', u'Method'), (u'reasoning base', u'Material')], [(u'document registration module', u'Method'), (u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hybrid search engine', u'Method'), (u'full-text search', u'Method'), (u'metadata-based search engine', u'Method')], [(u'reasoning base', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'association rule mining method', u'Method'), (u'precision', u'Metric'), (u'recall', u'Metric'), (u'hybrid search engine', u'Method')], [(u'virtual user model', u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'method', u'Generic')], [(u'technologies', u'Generic'), (u'humatronics', u'Task'), (u'computer networks', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'A method for mining association rules that reflect the behaviors of past users is proposed for an adaptive search engine .', u"The logs of the users ' retrieving behaviors are described with the resource description framework model , from which association rules that reflect successful retrieving behaviors are extracted .", u'The extracted rules are used to improve the performance of a metadata-based search engine .', u'The document repository with adaptive hybrid search engine is also developed based on the proposed method .', u'The repository consists of a document registration module , hybrid search engine , and reasoning base .', u'The document registration module is designed to reduce the cost of adding metadata to documents , and the hybrid search engine combines full-text search with metadata-based search engine to improve the recall of retrieval result .', u'The reasoning base is implemented based on the association rule mining method , which contributes to improve both precision and recall of the hybrid search engine .', u'Experiments are performed with a virtual user model , of which results show that appropriate rules can be extracted with the proposed method .', u'The proposed technologies will contribute to realize the concept of humatronics in terms of establishing symmetric relation between humans and systems , as well as sharing information , knowledge , and experiences via computer networks']

sentences: [u'SPARQL is the standard query language for Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) data .', u'RDF was designed with the initial goal of developing metadata for the Internet .', u"While the number and the size of the generated RDF datasets are continually increasing , most of today 's best RDF storage solutions are confined to a single node .", u'Working on a single node has significant scalability issues , especially considering the magnitude of modern day data .', u'In this paper we introduce Rya , a scalable RDF data management system that efficiently supports SPARQL queries .', u'We introduce storage methods , indexing schemes , and query processing techniques that scale to billions of triples across multiple nodes , while providing fast and easy access to the data through conventional query mechanisms such as SPARQL .', u'Our performance evaluation shows that in most cases , our system outperforms existing distributed RDF solutions , even systems much more complex than ours .', u'HighlightsWe build a scalable RDF data management system in a cloud environment.Rya is based on Accumulo columnar store and OpenRDF Sesame framework.We used 3 indexed tables , SPO , POS , OSP , with triple data stored in the row ID.We implemented performance enhancements to scale to billions of triples and milliseconds query time for most queries.Rya provides fast and easy access to the data through SPARQL .']

entities: [[(u'procedure', u'Generic'), (u'Open DATA METI', u'Material')], [(u'data catalog site', u'Material'), (u'searching linked open data', u'Task')], [(u'former', u'Generic')], [], [(u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'activities', u'Generic')], [(u'LOD searching site', u'Method'), (u'LOD', u'Method'), (u'Resource Description Framework', u'Method')], [], [(u'missing information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'LOD', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'LOD', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'We describe a procedure for constructing a website for publishing open data by focusing on the case of Open DATA METI , a website of the Ministry of Economy , Trade , and Industry of Japan .', u'We developed two sites for publishing open data : a data catalog site and one for searching linked open data ( LOD ) .', u'The former allows users to find relevant data they want to use , and the latter allows them to utilize the found data by connecting them .', u'To implement the data catalog site , we constructed a site tailored to the needs of the organization .', u'Then we extracted a large amount of metadata from the individual open data and put it on the site .', u'These activities would have taken a lot of time if we had used the existing methods , so we devised our own solutions for them .', u'To implement the LOD searching site , we converted the data into LOD in the Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) .', u'We focused on converting statistical data into tables , which are widely used .', u'Regarding the conversion , there were several kinds of missing information that we needed to associate with the data in the tables .', u'We created a template for incorporating the necessary information for LOD in the original table .', u'The conversion into LOD was automatically done using the template .']

entities: [[(u'Relational Databases', u'Material')], [(u'RDB-RDF mapping process', u'Method')], [(u'RDB-RDF Management Framework', u'Method'), (u'mapping process', u'Task'), (u'semantic data', u'Material')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'Data Handlers', u'Material'), (u'Web services', u'Method'), (u'Web environment interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reliability', u'Metric')], [(u'mapping process', u'Task')], [(u'intelligent agent', u'Method'), (u'relational data storage side', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'schema', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'relation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'RDB-RDF Management Framework', u'USED-FOR', u'mapping process')], [(u'Data Handlers', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web services'), (u'Web services', u'PART-OF', u'framework')], [], [(u'schema', u'CONJUNCTION', u'relation'), (u'relation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data')], []]
sentences: [u'Recently , the mapping from Relational Databases ( RDB ) into Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) becomes an essential demand for most of the people who are consuming the Web in their daily activities and businesses due to the need for getting complete integrated , trustworthy and understandable data that achieving their requirements and wishes .', u'However , management and controlling the RDB-RDF mapping process is a challengeable task because of the rapid change in the massive amount of data which is collected from a diverse huge number of providers and vendors .', u'In this work , a RDB-RDF Management Framework is suggested to automatically manage and monitor the mapping process from relational to semantic data .', u'The proposed framework includes a set of Data Handlers and Web services ( WSs ) in order to improve the Web environment interoperability and reliability .', u'Specifically , three sets of services are established and consumed to handle and organize the mapping process .', u'One set of the three suggested services is operating and acting like an intelligent agent to continuously sensing the change that might occur at the relational data storage side with respect to three different levels : schema , relation and data .', u'Finally , the implementation and particular case study of the suggested framework are introduced and discussed .']

relations: [[(u'protocolos', u'CONJUNCTION', u'interfaces y vocabularios controlados')], [], [], [(u'Por consiguiente', u'CONJUNCTION', u'cuando comunidades comparten metadatos')], [], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Interoperabilidad entre sistemas de informacion distribuidos requiere acuerdos de estandares de metadatos , protocolos , interfaces y vocabularios controlados .', u'Tales acuerdos se basan en adopciones de estandares publicados por organizaciones como la Organizacion Internacional para la Estandarizacion ( International Organization for Standardization - ISO ) y el Open Geospatial Consortium ( OGC ) .', u'Estos estandares son generales y no regulan en totalidad los vocabularios controlados que se utilizan para anotar metadatos .', u'Por consiguiente , cuando comunidades comparten metadatos , se encuentran con conflictos semanticos resultado de las heterogeneidades de los vocabularios controlados .', u'Por ejemplo elevacion del agua , nivel del agua y altura del agua , son distintos conceptos que semanticamente son equivalentes .', u'Pare poder resolver estas heterogeneidades semanticas , se creo el programa VINE , Entorno de Integracion de Vocabularios .', u'Esta herramienta fue utilizada exitosamente en el taller Avanzando Vocabularios Controlados ( Advancing Domain Vocabularies ) , organizado por el proyecto Interoperabilidad de Metadatos Marinos ( MMI ) en 2005 .', u'Esta herramienta se especializa en crear relaciones de tipo tesauros para mapear vocabularios controlados representados en grafos de Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) .', u'VINE tambien permite busquedas de texto libre en los grafos .', u'VINE es un plugin de Eclipse desarrollado en JAVA , siguiendo el paradigma de Modelo Vista Controlador ( MVC ) .', u'Se discutira la arquitectura de la herramienta y el concepto de busqueda inteligente profunda en grafos']

relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'evaluation model', u'CONJUNCTION', u'meta-document structure'), (u'meta-document structure', u'USED-FOR', u'users trust evaluations')], [(u'decentralized information structure', u'USED-FOR', u'document design')], [(u'RDF )', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDF Schema')], [(u'RDF Schema', u'USED-FOR', u'meta-document structure')], [], []]
sentences: [u'It is believed that trust will be the primary mental force in the electronic environment as it is in the current physical environment .', u'At the core trust is impacted by users propensity to trust ( internal mental state ) , reliance on the trustee and external direct and indirect factors .', u'Decentralization of publication is one of the great advantages of the internet infrastructure .', u'Web 2.0 applications aim to promote and assist online users to publish and contribute freely for Collective Intelligence .', u'They resolve around the notion that people can add contents for Collective Intelligence and enterprises can also use the contents to reduce costs and increase profits through Social Network Analysis .', u'This paper proposes a conceptual mental trust recognition and evaluation model and meta-document structure to represent , distribute and store users trust evaluations .', u'The proposed document design is based on decentralized information structure that semantically represents contributed contents and the contributor .', u'The contents are represented and distributed by using Atom , Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) and RDF Schema .', u'The proposed meta-document structure uses RDF Schema to semantically represent users internal ( inner ) online trust evaluation model within Web 2.0 environment .', u'It can be used as a blueprint to develop new vocabularies for any e-domain .', u'However , trust recognition model is selected due to its importance in electronic environment .']

sentences: [u'Bilginin zihinde somut ve gorsel olarak duzenlenmesini saglayan kavram haritalarinin yapisi , kavramlar arasi iliskilerin grafiksel bir yolla ifade edilmesine dayanmaktadir .', u'Kavram haritasi , egitim alaninda anlamli ogrenmeyi saglamasi bakimindan onemli bir yontemdir .', u'Cunku ogrenilecek temel fikirleri ve bunlar arasindaki iliskileri acik hle getirme ve onceki bilgilerle yeni bilgiler arasinda baglanti kurulmasina yardimci olmaktadir .', u'Anlamsal Web , iyi tanimlanmis bilgilerin ve servislerin kolay bir sekilde makineler tarafindan anlasilabilir olmasini saglayan web ortamidir .', u'Anlamsal Webin temel bileseni olan ontolojiler , bir alana ait kavramlar kumesini ve kavramlar arasindaki iliskileri bicimsel olarak tanimlamaktadir .', u'Ontolojilerin yapisi , kavram haritalarinin yapisina benzemektedir .', u'Bu calismanin amaci ; dersi planlama , uygulama ve degerlendirme araci olarak kullanilan kavram haritalarinin ontoloji tabanli olarak olusturulmasini saglamaktir .', u'Ontoloji tabanli kavram haritalarinin modellenecegi ve hazirlanacagi ontoloji dili RDF ( Resource Description Framework-Kaynak Tanim Cercevesi ) tabanlidir .', u'Bu amac icin Protege ontoloji gelistirme editoru kullanilmistir .', u'Protege ontoloji gelistirme editorunun grafik arayuzu sayesinde ilkogretim fen bilimleri dersi 6-7-8. siniflar programinda var olan mekanik konularinda kavram haritasi , gorsel olarak tanimlanmakta ve boylelikle tanimlanmak istenilen alan modellenebilmektedir .', u'Calisma kapsaminda kavram haritasi olusturma asamalarinin sahip oldugu ustunlukler ve sinirliliklar tartisilarak ilkogretim fen bilgisi egitimi alanindaki derslere iliskin egitim ontolojisi olusturularak ornekler sunulmustur .', u'Gelecek calismalarda ; bir web tabanli uygulama gerceklestiriminde bu calismada gelistirilen ontolojinin kullanilmasi amaclanmaktadir. # R # # N # Anahtar sozcukler : kavram haritasi , fen egitimi , ontoloji , RDF']

entities: [[(u'World Wide Web', u'Material'), (u'data explosion', u'Task'), (u'data representation methodologies', u'Method')], [(u'Resource Description Framework', u'Method'), (u'RDF )', u'Method'), (u'W3C', u'Method')], [(u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'data storage paradigm', u'Method'), (u'RDF Graph Model', u'Method'), (u'data storage methodology', u'Method'), (u'data modeling', u'Method'), (u'visualization tools', u'Method'), (u'data management', u'Task')], [(u'R2D ( RDF-to-Database )', u'Method'), (u'relational wrapper', u'Method'), (u'RDF Data Stores', u'Method'), (u'semi-structured RDF data', u'Material'), (u'domain-specific relational schema', u'Method'), (u'RDBMS concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'relational tools', u'Method'), (u'RDF Stores', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'R2D functionalities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mapping constructs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'high-level system architecture', u'Method'), (u'deployment flowchart', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'relational visualization tool', u'Method'), (u'R2D', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'data modeling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'visualization tools'), (u'visualization tools', u'USED-FOR', u'data management')], [(u'relational wrapper', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF Data Stores'), (u'relational wrapper', u'USED-FOR', u'semi-structured RDF data'), (u'relational wrapper', u'USED-FOR', u'domain-specific relational schema'), (u'semi-structured RDF data', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF Data Stores'), (u'relational tools', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF Stores')], [(u'R2D functionalities', u'CONJUNCTION', u'mapping constructs'), (u'high-level system architecture', u'CONJUNCTION', u'deployment flowchart'), (u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'mapping constructs'), (u'algorithms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'deployment flowchart'), (u'R2D', u'USED-FOR', u'relational visualization tool')]]
sentences: [u'The astronomical growth of the World Wide Web has resulted in data explosion that in turn has given rise to a need for data representation methodologies and standards to present required information in a rapid and automated manner .', u'The Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) is one such standard proposed by W3C to address the above need .', u'The ubiquitous acceptance of RDF on the Internet has resulted in the emergence of a new data storage paradigm , the RDF Graph Model , which , as with any data storage methodology , requires data modeling and visualization tools to aid with data management .', u'This paper presents R2D ( RDF-to-Database ) , a relational wrapper for RDF Data Stores , which aims to transform , at run-time , semi-structured RDF data into an equivalent domain-specific relational schema , thereby bridging the gap between RDF and RDBMS concepts and making the abundance of relational tools currently in the market available to the RDF Stores .', u'The primary R2D functionalities and mapping constructs , the high-level system architecture , and deployment flowchart are presented along with algorithms and performance graphs for every stage of the transformation process and screenshots of a relational visualization tool using R2D as evidence of the feasibility of the proposed work .']

entities: [[(u'electronic marketplace architecture', u'Method'), (u'MOPPET', u'Method'), (u'commerce processes', u'Method'), (u'marketplace', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'agent-based workflows', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'workflow technology', u'Method'), (u'electronic commerce processes', u'Task')], [(u'Agent-based implementation', u'Task'), (u'reusable component-based workflow architecture', u'Method'), (u'negotiation ability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dynamic changes in the environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Agent communication', u'Task'), (u'Knowledge Query', u'Method'), (u'Manipulation Language', u'Material')], [(u'workflow-based architecture', u'Method'), (u'electronic commerce processes', u'Task'), (u'custom built process definitions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'data exchanges', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Extensible Markup Language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'uniformity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Metadata of activities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Resource Description Framework', u'Method')], [(u'Common Business Library', u'Material'), (u'business domains', u'Material'), (u'vertical industries', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'missing DTDs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'specifications', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'MOPPET', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'electronic marketplace architecture')], [(u'workflow technology', u'USED-FOR', u'electronic commerce processes')], [], [(u'Knowledge Query', u'USED-FOR', u'Agent communication'), (u'Knowledge Query', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Manipulation Language'), (u'Manipulation Language', u'USED-FOR', u'Agent communication')], [(u'workflow-based architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'electronic commerce processes')], [(u'Extensible Markup Language', u'USED-FOR', u'data exchanges'), (u'uniformity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'simplicity')], [(u'Resource Description Framework', u'USED-FOR', u'Metadata of activities')], [(u'business domains', u'CONJUNCTION', u'domain specific Document Type Definitions')], [(u'specifications', u'USED-FOR', u'missing DTDs')]]
sentences: [u'We propose an electronic marketplace architecture , called MOPPET , where the commerce processes in the marketplace are modeled as adaptable agent-based workflows .', u'The higher level of abstraction provided by the workflow technology makes the customization of electronic commerce processes for different users possible .', u'Agent-based implementation , on the other hand , provides for a highly reusable component-based workflow architecture as well as negotiation ability and the capability to adapt to dynamic changes in the environment .', u'Agent communication is handled through Knowledge Query and Manipulation Language ( KQML ) .', u'A workflow-based architecture also makes it possible for complete modeling of electronic commerce processes by allowing involved parties to be able to invoke already existing applications or to define new tasks and to re-structure the control and data flow among the tasks to create custom built process definitions .', u'In the proposed architecture all data exchanges are realized through Extensible Markup Language ( XML ) providing uniformity , simplicity and a highly open and interoperable architecture .', u'Metadata of activities are expressed through Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) .', u'Common Business Library ( CBL ) is used for achieving interoperability across business domains and domain specific Document Type Definitions ( DTDs ) are used for vertical industries .', u'We provide our own specifications for missing DTDs to be replaced by the original specifications when they become available .']

entities: [[(u'broadcasting video clips', u'Material')], [(u'education', u'Task'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material')], [], [(u'videos', u'Material')], [(u'video clips', u'Material'), (u'motions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'Concept Tag', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'Task')], [(u'Concept Tag', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDF triples', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DBpedia entries', u'Material')], [(u'RDF store', u'Method'), (u'videos', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'RDF ( Resource Description Framework ) store', u'USED-FOR', u'video clips')], [(u'Concept Tag', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')], [], [], [(u'videos', u'PART-OF', u'demonstration applications')]]
sentences: [u'The purpose of this study is to examine how to combine broadcasting video clips with other contents offered by a third party .', u"To this end , this paper focused on the field of education , particularly the study of `` animals , '' and verified methods of collaboration between videos and other contents such as Wikipedia .", u'When it comes to considering collaboration , it is well-known that metadata are absolutely necessary , however what kinds of metadata will be required ?', u'This depends on their usage or methods of combining certain resources , such as videos with other texts .', u'In order to solve this , this paper constructed an RDF ( Resource Description Framework ) store to describe video clips from various viewpoints which cover themes to explain animals , motions about animals and so on .', u'Accordingly , this paper extracted metadata commonly used to describe animals from Wikipedia and defined it as Concept Tag for the ontology to explain animals .', u'We also analyzed which Concept Tag should be tagged in each video based on the degree of association with metadata from the ontology .', u'In addition , we extracted RDF triples regarding the animals , which are linked to their DBpedia entries .', u'By using this RDF store , we developed three demonstration applications that combine videos with other services .']

relations: [[(u'investment risks', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reduced market opportunities')], [(u'Web technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'W3C')], [(u'Shared semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'discovery'), (u'Shared semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'interoperability'), (u'discovery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'interoperability'), (u'discovery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'scaling'), (u'interoperability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'scaling'), (u'interoperability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'layering'), (u'scaling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'layering')], [(u'things', u'CONJUNCTION', u'security'), (u'security', u'CONJUNCTION', u'communications')], [(u"W3C 's resource description framework", u'USED-FOR', u'Thing descriptions')], [(u'data models', u'USED-FOR', u'events')], [], [(u'lightweight representations of metadata', u'USED-FOR', u'W3C')], []]
sentences: [u'The Internet of Things ( IoT ) is being held back by divergent approaches that result in data silos , high costs , investment risks and reduced market opportunities .', u'To realize the potential and unleash the network effect , W3C is focusing on the role of Web technologies for a platform of platforms as a basis for services spanning IoT platforms from microcontrollers to cloud-based server farms .', u'Shared semantics are essential for discovery , interoperability , scaling and layering on top of existing protocols and platforms .', u'For this purpose , metadata can be classified into : things , security , and communications , where things are considered to be virtual representations ( software objects ) for physical or abstract entities .', u"Thing descriptions are modeled in terms of W3C 's resource description framework ( RDF ) .", u'This includes the semantics for what kind of thing it is , and the data models for its events , properties and actions .', u'The underlying protocols are free to use whichever communication patterns are appropriate to the context according to the constraints described by the given metadata .', u'W3C is exploring the use of lightweight representations of metadata that are easy to author and process , even on resource constrained devices .', u"The aim is to evolve the web from a web of pages to a `` Web of Things . ''"]

sentences: [u'Knowledge-based systems have become ubiquitous in recent years .', u'Knowledge-base developers need to be able to share and reuse knowledge bases that they build .', u'Therefore , interoperability among different knowledge-representation systems is essential .', u'The Open Knowledge-Base Connectivity protocol ( OKBC ) is a common query and construction interface for frame-based systems that facilitates this interoperability .', u'ProtEgE-2000 is an OKBC-compatible knowledge-base-editing environment developed in our laboratory .', u'We describe ProtEgE-2000 knowledge model that makes the import and export of knowledge bases from and to other knowledge-base servers easy .', u'We discuss how the requirements of being a usable and configurable knowledge-acquisition tool affected our decisions in the knowledge-model design .', u'ProtEgE-2000 also has a flexible metaclass architecture which provides configurable templates for new classes in the knowledge base .', u'The use of metaclasses makes ProtEgE-2000 easily extensible and enables its use with other knowledge models .', u'We demonstrate that we can resolve many of the differences between the knowledge models of ProtEgE-2000 and Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) -- a system for annotating Web pages with knowledge elements -- by defining a new metaclass set .', u'Resolving the differences between the knowledge models in declarative way enables easy adaptation of ProtEgE-2000 as an editor for other knowledge-representation systems .']

sentences: [u'Abstract : Peace Operations include Peace Making , Peace Building , and Peace Support .', u'Although information-sharing systems may exist within individual organizations , to date no interoperable information regime exists that can link all players who participate in providing aid during a Complex Humanitarian Emergency .', u'Effective information sharing between civilian and military organizations is needed to enhance operational efficiencies , therefore saving lives , resources , and promoting rapid recuperation and reconstruction .', u'An off-the-shelf collaborative software package with a common architecture and common templates , standard protocols , and centralized database might initially serve as a collaboration platform .', u'Extensible Markup Language ( XML ) , XML-based languages , and Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) are important technologies that must be utilized extensively to enable this environment .', u'Additionally , WebDAV ( Web-based Distributed Authoring and Versioning ) integration can provide an infrastructure for platform-neutral asynchronous collaborative authoring via the Internet .', u'Internationalization ( I18N ) and localization ( L10N ) addresses differences in language requirements and local expectations that reflect our differences in cultures .', u'Existing collaboration COTS architectures form a basis with which developers can integrate XML technologies .', u"The `` ideal '' collaborative environment must include asynchronous and synchronous collaboration capabilities , as well as capabilities that will enable users to rapidly locate personnel , organize and conduct virtual teams and meetings , provide information delivery to personnel , and provide sufficient security mechanisms ."]

entities: [[(u'data provenance', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'group-centric secure collaboration environment', u'Method')], [(u'shared data', u'Material')], [(u'data provenance', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'group collaboration environment', u'Method'), (u'provenance information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'shared data', u'Material')], [(u'operation information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'provenance data', u'Material'), (u'formal representation', u'Method'), (u'provenance system', u'Method')], [(u'group collaboration application', u'Task'), (u'provenance utilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'Open Provenance Model', u'Method'), (u'group collaboration operations', u'Task'), (u'provenance system', u'Method'), (u'group collaboration environment', u'Method'), (u'GLEEN-enabled SPARQL query language', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'In this paper , we explore data provenance in a group-centric secure collaboration environment .', u'In collaborations , participating organizations are likely to want certain trustworthiness on the data that are shared from other organizations and some assurance on how the shared data are used by users regardless of their organizations .', u'By utilizing data provenance in group collaboration environment , we can provide the participating organizations with various provenance information that can establish trustworthiness and assurance on the shared data .', u'To achieve this , we first identify what kind of operation information can be and should be captured as provenance data and how this information can be expressed in a formal representation which can be queried via the provenance system for certain utilities .', u'We show the identified provenance data for a group collaboration application can provide some unique provenance utilities such as ability to trace the origins or usages of a shared data object even if it was created in a different organization .', u'We utilize Open Provenance Model ( OPM ) [ 13 ] to capture various group collaboration operations identified in [ 12 ] and introduce a provenance system for a group collaboration environment that utilizes Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) data representations [ 10 ] and GLEEN-enabled SPARQL query language [ 7 ] .']

relations: [[(u'Internet and Intranet knowledge bases', u'USED-FOR', u'digitized resources')], [(u'metadata maps', u'CONJUNCTION', u'crosswalks')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The proliferation of digitized resources accessible via Internet and Intranet knowledge bases , and a pressing need to develop more sophisticated tools for the identification and retrieval of electronic resources , both general purpose and domain-specific metadata schemes have assumed a particular prominence .', u'While recent work emanating from the World Wide Web Consortium ( W3C ) has focused on the Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) , and metadata maps or crosswalks have been created to support the interoperability of metadata standards -- thus converting metatags from diverse domains from simply machine-readable to machine-understandable -- the next iteration , to human-understandable , remains a challenge .', u'This apparent gap provides a framework for three-phase research ( Howarth , 2000 , 1999 ) to develop a tool which will provide a human-understandable front-end search assist to any XML-compliant metadata scheme .', u'Findings from phase one , the analyses and mapping of eight metadata schemes , identify the particular challenges of designing a common namespace , populated with element tags which are appropriately descriptive , yet readily understood by a lay searcher , when there is little congruence within , and a high degree of variability across , the metadata schemes under study .', u'Implications for the subsequent design and testing of both the proposed metalevel ontology ( phase two ) , and the prototype search assist tool ( phase three ) are examined .']

sentences: [u'Publisher Summary # R # # N # This chapter highlights the standards and protocols associated with the digital library .', u'A digital library is a collection of resources that includes a database , a shopping catalog , an atlas , a File transfer protocol ( FTP ) site , and a list of e-mail addresses .', u'There are countless collections of resources , and people often need to describe them in terms of information they contain .', u'A standard way of doing this has been devised and is called the resource description framework and it is being used to describe digital library collections and also it is based on the Extensible Markup Language ( XML ) family .', u'XML is a flexible framework for describing document structure and metadata .', u'In fact , there are other developments centered upon XML that probably also have far-reaching effects on digital libraries of the future .', u'The standard modus operandi of Web usage is to reach a new document by clicking on a button or hyperlinkand this is the classical form for a digital library too .', u'Two prominent protocols used in digital libraries are the Z39.50 protocol and the Open Archives Initiative ( OAI ) protocol .', u'These are separated historically by a decade and a half , culturally by the communities in which they arose , and ideologically by the approach taken .']

sentences: [u'Tabular datasets are common in many domains , for example science and engineering .', u'These are often not very well specified , and are therefore hard to understand and use .', u'Semantic standards are available to express the meaning and context of the data .', u'However , present standards have their limitations in expressing heterogeneous datasets with several types of measurements , missing data , and irregular structures .', u'Such datasets are abundant in everyday life .', u'We propose the RDF ( Resource Description Framework ) Record Table vocabulary for semantically modelling tabular data , as a supplement to the existing RDF Data Cube standard .', u'RDF Record Table has a nested structure of records that contain self-describing observations , and is able to cope with irregular , missing and unexpected data .', u'This allows it to escape the constraints of RDF Data Cube and to model complex data , such as that occurring in science and engineering .', u'We demonstrate our Excel add-in for transforming data into the Record Table format .', u'We propose a general approach to integrating tabular data in RDF , and confirm this approach by implementing integration support in the add-in and evaluating this in industrial use cases .', u'This semantic support for tables helps researchers and data analysts to get the most out of available quantitative data with a minimum of effort .']

sentences: [u'A method and a system of controlling application devices simultaneously .', u'The application devices can be a Web tablet , a set-top box , a VCR , a TV , and PDA , a lamp , a coffee machine , a radio , a telephone , a background wall , a DVD player or an electronic information panel .', u'The method includes four steps controlled by a server : retrieving first documents ( 501 ) from a first set of application devices ; retrieving identification ( 502 ) of a user ; generating ( 505 ) second documents , each comprising an instruction , on the basis of at least a part of the retrieved identification of the user and at least a part of the first documents ; simultaneously sending ( 506 ) at least one of the second documents to each device of a second set of the application devices ; and performing ( 507 ) for a given device of the second set one instruction from at least one of the second documents received in the given device .', u'The step of retrieving identification by the server includes the steps of retrieving user profile ( 503 ) information based on the user identification , and retrieving context profile information ( 504 ) relating to present surroundings of the user .', u'The said documents include Hyper Text Markup Language , Scalable Vector Graphics , Resource Description Framework and Extensible Markup Language ( XML ) .']

sentences: [u'Presentation for the Linked Data : An Emerging Trend Panel at the Texas Library Association ( TLA ) 2015 Annual Conference .', u"This presentation discusses linked data in the UNT Libraries ' digital collections ."]

entities: [[(u'structured data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Open Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Open Data', u'Material')], [(u'LOD datasets', u'Material'), (u'loading', u'Task')], [(u'consumption obstacle', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'classical Extract-Transform-Load ( ETL ) paradigm', u'Method')], [(u'selection and extraction steps', u'Task')], [(u'SPARQL Protocol', u'Method'), (u'RDF Query Language', u'Method'), (u'SliceSPARQL', u'Method')], [(u'SliceSPARQL', u'Method'), (u'graph patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'subgraph pattern', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Internationalized resource identifier', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'sequential dataset dump stream', u'Material')], [(u'slicing approach', u'Method'), (u'optimization strategies', u'Method')], [(u'dataset slices', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'dataset', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'loading', u'CONJUNCTION', u'querying')], [], [], [(u'SPARQL Protocol', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDF Query Language')], [], [], [(u'optimization strategies', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'slicing approach')], []]
sentences: [u'Over the last years , a considerable amount of structured data has been published on the Web as Linked Open Data ( LOD ) .', u'Despite recent advances , consuming and using Linked Open Data within an organization is still a substantial challenge .', u'Many of the LOD datasets are quite large and despite progress in Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) data management their loading and querying within a triple store is extremely time-consuming and resource-demanding .', u'To overcome this consumption obstacle , we propose a process inspired by the classical Extract-Transform-Load ( ETL ) paradigm .', u'In this article , we focus particularly on the selection and extraction steps of this process .', u'We devise a fragment of SPARQL Protocol and RDF Query Language ( SPARQL ) dubbed SliceSPARQL , which enables the selection of well-defined slices of datasets fulfilling typical information needs .', u'SliceSPARQL supports graph patterns for which each connected subgraph pattern involves a maximum of one variable or Internationalized resource identifier ( IRI ) in its join conditions .', u'This restriction guarantees the efficient processing of the query against a sequential dataset dump stream .', u'Furthermore , we evaluate our slicing approach on three different optimization strategies .', u'Results show that dataset slices can be generated an order of magnitude faster than by using the conventional approach of loading the whole dataset into a triple store .']

sentences: [u"RDF ( `` Resource Description Framework '' ) is now a widely used World Wide Web Consortium standard .", u'However , methods to index large volumes of RDF data are still in their infancy .', u'In this paper , we focus on providing a very lightweight indexing mechanism for certain kinds of RDF queries , namely graph-based queries where there is a need to traverse edges in the graph determined by an RDF database .', u"Our approach uses the idea of drawing circles around selected `` center '' vertices in the graph where the circle would encompass those vertices in the graph that are within a given distance of the `` center '' vertex .", u"We come up with methods of finding such `` center '' vertices and identifying the radius of the circles and then leverage this to build an index called GRIN .", u'We compare GRIN with three existing RDF indexex : Jena , Sesame .', u'and RDFBroker .', u'We compared ( i ) the time to answer graph based queries , ( ii ) memory needed to store the index , and ( iii ) the time to build the index .', u'GRIN outperforms Jena , Sesame and RDFBroker on all three measures for graph based queries ( for other types of queries , it may be worth building one of these other indexes and using it ) , at the expense of using a larger amount of memory when answering queries .']

sentences: [u'In this paper we propose KOIOS++ , which automatically processes natural language queries provided by handwritten input .', u'The system integrates several recent achievements in the area of handwriting recognition , natural language processing , information retrieval , and human computer interaction .', u'It uses a knowledge base described by the resource description framework ( RDF ) .', u'Our generic approach first generates a lexicon as background information for the handwritten text recognition .', u'After recognizing a handwritten query , several output hypotheses are sent to a natural language processing system in order to generate a structured query ( SPARQL query ) .', u'Subsequently , the query is applied to the given knowledge base and a result graph visualizes the retrieved information .', u'At all stages , the user can easily adjust the intermediate results if there is any undesired outcome .', u'The system is implemented as a web-service and therefore works for handwritten input on digital paper as well as on input on Pen-enabled interactive surfaces .', u'Furthermore , we build on the generic RDF-representation of semantic knowledge which is also used by the linked open data ( LOD ) initiative .', u'As such , our system works well in various scenarios .', u'We have implemented prototypes for querying company knowledge bases , the DBPedia1 , the DBLP computer science bibliography2 , and a knowledge base of the DAS 2012 .']

sentences: [u'As peer-to-peer dissemination of custom data products evolves among Earth science research groups , investigators and data managers must consider how to compose appropriate metadata for their research computing activities .', u'Because workflows may span multiple groups , it is critical that lineage ( provenance ) metadata also be assembled to document and preserve the origins and processing history of constituent data products and transformations for future data consumers .', u'To demonstrate methods for composing lineage metadata for custom processing , we introduce our terminology for workflow and employ a case study for the creation of satellite-derived ocean color data products .', u'Our example contributes to a general metadata model for workflow that incorporates lineage .', u'We then discuss metadata requirements for remote sensing-related data products .', u'We propose two techniques for composing lineage metadata , both based on accessory XML metadata documents that are paired with the data products and versioned data transformations they describe .', u'The first technique , implemented as a prototype , features a dedicated lineage server that introduces the indirection and flexibility necessary for Web-based lineage navigation .', u'The second , more promising technique involves defining a simple Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) vocabulary for lineage metadata , and using extant RDF/XML tools for query and navigation .', u'These methods provide guidelines for composing lineage metadata that are applicable to other domains .']

sentences: [u'Semantic video Annotation is an active research zone within the field of multimedia content understanding .', u'With the stable increase of videos published on the famous video sharing platforms such as YouTube , more efforts are spent to automatically annotate these videos .', u'In this paper , we propose a novel framework to annotating subtitled YouTube videos using both textual features such as all of portions extracted from web natural language processors in relation to subtitles , and temporal features such as the duration of the media fragments where particular entities are spotted .', u'We implement SY-VSE ( Subtitled YouTube Video Search Engine ) as an efficient framework to cruising on the subtitled YouTube videos resident in the Linked Open Data ( LOD ) cloud .', u'For realizing this purpose , we propose Unifier Module of Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) Tools Results ( UM-NLPTR ) for extracting main portions of the 10 NLP web tools from subtitles associated to YouTube videos in order to generate media fragments annotated with resources from the LOD cloud .', u"Then , we propose Unifier Module of Popular API 's Results ( UM-PAR ) containing the seven favorite web APIs to boost results of Named Entities ( NE ) obtained from UM-NLPTR .", u'We will use dotNetRDF as a powerful and flexible API for working with Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) and SPARQL in .Net environments .']

sentences: [u'Summary Several standard formats have been proposed that can be used to describe models , simulations , data or other essential information in a consistent fashion .', u'These constitute various separate components required to reproduce a given published scientific result .', u'The Open Modeling EXchange format ( OMEX ) supports the exchange of all the information necessary for a modeling and simulation experiment in biology .', u'An OMEX file is a ZIP container that includes a manifest file , an optional metadata file , and the files describing the model .', u'The manifest is an XML file listing all files included in the archive and their type .', u'The metadata file provides additional information about the archive and its content .', u'Although any format can be used , we recommend an XML serialization of the Resource Description Framework .', u'Together with the other standard formats from the Computational Modeling in Biology Network ( COMBINE ) , OMEX is the basis of the COMBINE Archive .', u'The content of a COMBINE Archive consists of files encoded in COMBINE standards whenever possible , but may include additional files defined by an Internet Media Type .', u'The COMBINE Archive facilitates the reproduction of modeling and simulation experiments in biology by embedding all the relevant information in one file .', u'Having all the information stored and exchanged at once also helps in building activity logs and audit trails .']

relations: [[(u'layer', u'USED-FOR', u'handwriting recognition')], [], [(u'RDF knowledge bases', u'USED-FOR', u'HWR process')], [], [(u'RDF knowledge-bases', u'USED-FOR', u'system')], [], [], [], [(u'recognition rate', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'HWR system')], [], [(u'k-best word recognition alternatives', u'USED-FOR', u'OBIE system')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper we introduce a new layer for the task of handwriting recognition ( HWR ) , i.e. , the use of semantic information in form of Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) knowledge bases .', u'In particular , two novel processing stages are proposed for the first time in literature .', u"The first stage is the inclusion of RDF knowledge bases into the HWR process , where we make use of a person 's mental model .", u'This process can be extended to use other ontological resource .', u'The second stage is the transition from pure handwriting recognition to understanding the handwritten notes , i.e. , the system extracts knowledge employing RDF knowledge-bases .', u'This is also called ontology-based information extraction ( OBIE ) .', u'The task of our recognizer therefore is not only to recognize the ASCII transcription of the handwritten document , but also to identify the semantic concepts which appear in the text .', u'For both novel approaches we performed a set of experiments on various data .', u'First , the recognition rate of the HWR system is increased on several documents .', u'Second , the performance of information extraction is also remarkable .', u'By using the k-best word recognition alternatives in form of a lattice as an input for the OBIE system , the performance reaches a level which is very close to OBIE applied on pure ASCII text .']

entities: [[(u'ontology of Japanese lexical properties', u'Task'), (u'conceptual framework', u'Method'), (u'Japanese lexicon', u'Material'), (u'JLP-O', u'Method')], [(u'lexical and psycholinguistic properties', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'variables', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Japanese lexicon', u'Material')], [(u'lexical entries classes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'JLP-O', u'Material')], [(u'multifunctional LR', u'Task')], [(u'Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) representation', u'Method'), (u'JLP-O', u'Method'), (u'corpus-based lexicon', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Balanced Corpus of Contemporary Written Japanese', u'Material')], [(u'orthographic variant and decomposition information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'BCCWJ-based lexicon', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'large-scale LR', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'lexical entries classes', u'PART-OF', u'JLP-O')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Regarding the construction of an ontology of Japanese lexical properties ( JLP-O ) as fundamental in terms of establishing a conceptual framework to guide and facilitate the construction of a large-scale lexical resource ( LR ) database of the Japanese lexicon , this paper primarily focuses on two major concerns for the construction of the JLP-O .', u'The first is to map out and appropriately structure the numerous lexical and psycholinguistic properties , or variables , associated with the Japanese lexicon .', u'The second concern is to specify an appropriate range of lexical entries classes within the JLP-O .', u'Both concerns have far-reaching implications for effectively capturing the rich patterns of interconnections among lexical entries and lexical properties and thus for realizing a multifunctional LR .', u'After discussing the solutions integrated into the current Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) representation of the JLP-O , the paper also briefly describes the extraction of a corpus-based lexicon from the recently released Balanced Corpus of Contemporary Written Japanese ( BCCWJ ; Maekawa et al. , 2013 ) , an authoritative sampling of the contemporary Japanese lexicon .', u'Categorized according to the JLP-Os range of lexical entry classes , and supplemented with orthographic variant and decomposition information , the BCCWJ-based lexicon represents a key reference LR for constructing the large-scale LR .']

sentences: [u'This paper relies on the resource-oriented architecture ( ROA ) to propose a middleware that shares resources ( sensors , actuators and services ) of one or more robots through the TCP/IP network , providing greater efficiency in the development of software applications for robotics .', u'The proposed middleware consists of a set of web services that provides access to representational state of resources through simple and high-level interfaces to implement a software architecture for autonomous robots .', u'The benefits of the proposed approach are manifold : i ) full abstraction of complexity and heterogeneity of robotic devices through web services and uniform interfaces , ii ) scalability and independence of the operating system and programming language , iii ) secure control of resources for local or remote applications through the TCP/IP network , iv ) the adoption of the Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) , XML language and HTTP protocol , and v ) dynamic configuration of the connections between services at runtime .', u'The middleware was developed using the Linux operating system ( Ubuntu ) , with some applications built as proofs of concept for the Android operating system .', u'The architecture specification and the open source implementation of the proposed middleware are detailed in this article , as well as applications for robot remote control via wireless networks , voice command functionality , and obstacle detection and avoidance .']
