relations: [[], [(u'sequencing technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'community diversity')], [(u'community surveys', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'targeted gene surveys')], [(u'identification of specific genomic regions', u'USED-FOR', u'genetic distance')], [], [], [], [(u'tabular template', u'USED-FOR', u'microbial diversity'), (u'Resource Description Framework', u'USED-FOR', u'microbial diversity'), (u'community agreed-upon knowledge representation patterns', u'USED-FOR', u'Resource Description Framework')]]
sentences: [u'The advent of affordable sequencing technology provides for a new generation of explorers who probe the worlds microbial diversity .', u'Projects such as Tara Oceans , Moorea Biocode Project and Gut Microbiome rely on sequencing technologies to probe community diversity .', u'Either targeted gene surveys ( also known as community surveys ) or complete metagenomes are evaluated .', u'The former , being the less costly of the two methods , relies on the identification of specific genomic regions , which can be used as a proxy to estimate genetic distance between related species in a Phylum .', u'For instance , 16 S ribosomal RNA gene surveys are used to probe bacterial communities while internal transcribed spacer surveys , for example , can be used for probing fungal communities .', u'With the explosion of projects and frenzy to explore new domains of life , scientists in the field have issued guidelines to report minimal information ( following a checklist ) , ensuring that information is contextualized in a meaningful way .', u'Yet the semantics of a checklist are not explicit .', u'We demonstrate here how a tabular template can be used to collect information on microbial diversity using an explicit representation in the Resource Description Framework that is consistent with community agreed-upon knowledge representation patterns found in the Ontology for Biomedical Investigations .']

sentences: [u'Nowadays , more than ever , it is evident that we need a series of technological and methodological techniques in order to improve on the systems analysis and design ( SAD ) of any informational system .', u'Recently , there is a huge demand to create domain vocabularies and semantics that along with cognition are to describe the information of any domain in the form of Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) and ontologies ( OWL ) , both types of data models , resulting into relational and directed graphs and as a result both humans and machines simultaneously can understand the information offered , with machines using online links and pattern matching in order to interpret the meaning of it in a consistent and meaningful way .', u'Ontologies are great ensuring interopirability and consistency of data , however in order to improve on current Information Systems ( IS ) such as Hospital Information Systems ( HIS ) , there are many other methodologies that need to be invoked .', u'This could be achieved with the waterfall approach and multiple deployment of systems analysis and design methodologies and of course detailed computational ontologies that will be used as a basis to represent and share domain specific knowledge and data structures ensuring the interoperability of systems and the quality of information within that domain .', u'This multimethodological systems analysis and design framework , named OntoDrive is presented here .']

sentences: [u'Embodied conversational agents ( ECAs ) are cartoon-like characters which interact with users through conversation and gestures on a computer screen .', u'ECA makes human computer interactions more friendly because we can use most human-like communication skills such as natural conversation .', u'ECAs are useful as Web guides by incorporating them into Web browsers .', u'They guide us around Web pages chatting with us .', u'To build such an agent , we need to describe a scenario to explain Web pages .', u'Conventionally such scenarios are written manually by developers or programmers using a dialogue description language such as AIML ( Artificial Intelligence Markup Language ) , so it is difficult to update them when Web pages are updated .', u'In this paper , we propose a scheme to automatically generate utterances of Web guide agents depending on Web pages .', u'To this end , we need to make agents understand the contents of Web pages and to make them talk according to the contents , so we utilize RDF ( Resource Description Framework ) to present the semantic contents of Web pages .', u'To make agents talk according to the contents , we utilize a RDF query language SPARQL ( Simple Protocol And RDF Query Language ) and extend the AIML language to incorporate SPARQL query in it .', u'As a prototype , we developed a Web guide system employing an ECA .']

sentences: [u'This second edition of the FCA4AI workshop ( the first edition was associated to the ECAI 2012 Conference , see http : //www.fca4ai.hse.ru/ ) , shows again that there are many AI researchers interested in FCA .', u'Formal Concept Analysis ( FCA ) is a mathematically well-founded theory aimed at data analysis and classification .', u'FCA allows one to build a concept lattice and a system of dependencies ( implications ) which can be used for many AI needs , e.g .', u'knowledge processing involving learning , knowledge discovery , knowledge representation and reasoning , ontology engineering , as well as information retrieval and text processing .', u'Thus , there exist many natural links between FCA and AI .', u'Accordingly , the focus in this workshop was on how can FCA support AI activities ( knowledge processing ) and how can FCA be extended in order to help AI researchers to solve new and complex problems in their domains .']

relations: [[], [(u'measurement methods', u'USED-FOR', u'cost estimation process'), (u'measurement methods', u'USED-FOR', u'inaccuracies')], [(u'measurement methods', u'USED-FOR', u'BIM software'), (u'ontologically and machine readable format', u'USED-FOR', u'BIM software')], [(u'New Rules of Measurement', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology'), (u'New Rules of Measurement ( NRM )', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')], [(u'methontology', u'USED-FOR', u'methodology')], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology'), (u'descriptive logic-based reasoners', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology'), (u'4D BIM modelling software', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')]]
sentences: [u'For generations , the process of cost estimation has been manual , time-consuming and error-prone .', u'Emerging Building Information Modelling ( BIM ) can exploit standard measurement methods to automate cost estimation process and improve inaccuracies .', u'Structuring standard measurement methods in an ontologically and machine readable format for a BIM software can greatly facilitate the process of improving inaccuracies in cost estimation .', u'This study explores the development of an ontology based on New Rules of Measurement ( NRM ) for cost estimation during the tendering stages .', u'The methodology adopted is methontology , one of the most widely used ontology engineering methodologies .', u'To ensure the ontology is fit for purpose , cost estimation experts are employed to check the semantics , descriptive logic-based reasoners are used to syntactically check the ontology and a leading 4D BIM modelling software is used on a case study building to test/validate the proposed ontology .']

entities: [[(u'Concept representation', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'knowledge representation', u'Method')], [(u"`` non classical '' concepts", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'cognitive psychology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concept representation', u'Method'), (u'unitary phenomenon', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'concept representation', u'Method'), (u'psychological research', u'Method')], [(u'prototype-based and exemplar-based representations', u'Method'), (u'non classical concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'hybrid prototype-exemplar based approach', u'Method'), (u'knowledge representation technology', u'Method')], [(u'conceptual spaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'Concept representation is still an open problem in the field of ontology engineering and , more generally , of knowledge representation .', u"In particular , the issue of representing `` non classical '' concepts , i.e .", u'concepts that can not be defined in terms of necessary and sufficient conditions , remains unresolved .', u'In this paper we review empirical evidence from cognitive psychology , according to which concept representation is not a unitary phenomenon .', u'On this basis , we sketch some proposals for concept representation , taking into account suggestions from psychological research .', u'In particular , it seems that human beings employ both prototype-based and exemplar-based representations in order to represent non classical concepts .', u'We suggest that a similar , hybrid prototype-exemplar based approach could also prove useful in the field of knowledge representation technology .', u'Finally , we propose conceptual spaces as a suitable framework for developing some aspects of this proposal .']

relations: [[(u'online social messages', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology learning'), (u'emergent events', u'FEATURE-OF', u'online social messages')], [(u'data-cluster slicing approach', u'USED-FOR', u'real-time event detection system'), (u'social data analysis', u'USED-FOR', u'real-time event detection system'), (u'social data analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data-cluster slicing approach'), (u'social data analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'early warning algorithms'), (u'early warning algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'real-time event detection system'), (u'early warning algorithms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data-cluster slicing approach')], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'ranked temporal , spatial and topical keywords'), (u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'event ontologies'), (u'structured node', u'USED-FOR', u'event-entity extraction'), (u'structured node', u'USED-FOR', u'event ontologies'), (u'event ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'fast response of emergent events')], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'prediction of possible evolution')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we describe our work on extracting entities from the online social messages regarding emergent events for ontology learning , which can contribute to a solution for quick response of emerging disastrous events .', u'Our work started with the development of a real-time event detection system using a data-cluster slicing approach which combines social data analysis and early warning algorithms , allowing for quickly detecting emerging large-scale events from collected tweets .', u'Subsequently , our system computes the energy of each collected event dataset , and then encapsulates ranked temporal , spatial and topical keywords into a structured node for event-entity extraction , in order to learn and update event ontologies for fast response of emergent events .', u'The preliminary experimental results demonstrate that our developed system is workable , allowing for prediction of possible evolution for early warning of critical incidents with a dynamic ontology engineering .']

sentences: [u'Business modelling research is increasingly interested in exploring how domain ontologies can be used as reference models for business models .', u'The Resource Event Agent ( REA ) ontology is a primary candidate for ontology-driven modelling of business processes because the REA point of view on business reality is close to the conceptual modelling perspective on business models .', u'In this paper Ontology Engineering principles are employed to reengineer REA in order to make it more suitable for ontology-driven business modelling .', u'The new conceptual representation of REA that we propose uses a single representation formalism , includes a more complete domain axiomatization ( containing definitions of concepts , concept relations and ontological axioms ) , and is proposed as a generic model that can be instantiated to create valid business models .', u'The effects of these proposed improvements on REA-driven business modelling are demonstrated using a business modelling example .']

relations: [[], [(u'ontological knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'software applications')], [], [], [], [(u'Client access code', u'USED-FOR', u'object oriented programming language')], []]
sentences: [u'Recently , ontology engineering has become ever more important when it comes to conceptualize knowledge .', u'However , writing software applications that operate on ontological knowledge still suffers from a lack of connectivity provided by available ontology management systems .', u'Interfaces of ontology management systems are either based on error prone programming language agnostic remoting protocols or they are restricted to one particular programming language .', u'We implemented an ontological Knowledge Base Server , which can expose the functionality of arbitrary off-the-shelf ontology management systems via arbitrary remoting protocols .', u'Based on XML Schema Definition , we defined a full-fledged API for processing OWL ontologies .', u'Client access code can be generated automatically for virtually any object oriented programming language .', u'Using Description Logics terminology , the Knowledge Base Server API was formally specified , such that it could be used to validate implementations based on three different adapted ontology management systems .']

sentences: [u'Business modelling research is increasingly interested in exploring how domain ontologies can be used as reference models for business models .', u'The Resource Event Agent ( REA ) ontology is a primary candidate for ontology-driven modelling of business processes because the REA point of view on business reality is close to the conceptual modelling perspective on business models .', u'In this paper Ontology Engineering principles are employed to reengineer REA in order to make it more suitable for ontology-driven business modelling .', u'The new conceptual representation of REA that we propose uses a single representation formalism , includes a more complete domain axiomatization ( containing definitions of concepts , concept relations and ontological axioms ) , and is proposed as a generic model that can be instantiated to create valid business models .', u'The effects of these proposed improvements on REA-driven business modelling are demonstrated using a business modelling example .']

entities: [[(u'biomedical data', u'Material')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'pruning methods', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering field', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'bio-ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'pruning methods', u'Method'), (u'bio-ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'pruning methods', u'Method'), (u'gene ontology', u'Method'), (u'sub-ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'systematic identification of relevant concepts')], [(u'pruning methods', u'USED-FOR', u'bio-ontologies')], []]
sentences: [u'The explosive growth of biomedical data makes researchers and professionals recognize the need of developing large ontologies .', u'However as the size of data increases and knowledge evolves , ontologies tend to grow big and large , and hence , retrieving manageable amount of information from large ontologies becomes a difficult and costly task .', u'The purpose of this paper is to find and apply pruning methods from ontology engineering field to bio-ontologies as well as evaluate the results .', u'These methods support systematic identification of relevant concepts and deletion of irrelevant part of an ontology .', u'The paper shows how different pruning methods can be applied in bio-ontologies .', u'To show the usefulness of pruning methods , a large bio-ontology called gene ontology is pruned to obtain a sub-ontology that contains only the relevant information a user is interested in']

entities: [[(u'Probabilistic Description Logics', u'Method'), (u'DISPONTE semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'DISPONTE', u'Method'), (u'distribution semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Probabilistic Logic Programming', u'Method'), (u'assertional and terminological axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'EDGE', u'Method'), (u'DISPONTE knowledge base KB', u'Material'), (u'positive and negative examples', u'Material'), (u'concept assertions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'LEAP', u'Method'), (u'DISPONTE KBs', u'Method'), (u'EDGE', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'LEAP', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'search strategy', u'Method')], [(u'LEAP', u'Method'), (u'CELOE', u'Method'), (u'KB', u'Material')], [(u'EDGE', u'Method'), (u'LEAP', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'DISPONTE semantics', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Probabilistic Description Logics')], [(u'distribution semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'DISPONTE'), (u'distribution semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'Probabilistic Logic Programming')], [], [(u'EDGE', u'USED-FOR', u'DISPONTE KBs')], [(u'LEAP', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology engineering'), (u'system CELOE', u'USED-FOR', u'LEAP'), (u'system CELOE', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology engineering'), (u'CELOE', u'USED-FOR', u'LEAP'), (u'CELOE', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology engineering'), (u'CELOE', u'USED-FOR', u'search strategy')], [(u'axioms', u'USED-FOR', u'LEAP'), (u'CELOE', u'USED-FOR', u'LEAP'), (u'CELOE', u'USED-FOR', u'KB')], [(u'EDGE', u'CONJUNCTION', u'LEAP')]]
sentences: [u'We consider the problem of learning both the structure and the parameters of Probabilistic Description Logics under the DISPONTE semantics .', u'DISPONTE is based on the distribution semantics for Probabilistic Logic Programming and assigns a probability to assertional and terminological axioms .', u'The system EDGE , given a DISPONTE knowledge base KB and sets of positive and negative examples in the form of concept assertions , returns the value of the probabilities associated with axioms .', u'We present the system LEAP that learns both the structure and the parameters of DISPONTE KBs explotiting EDGE .', u'LEAP is based on the system CELOE for ontology engineering and exploits its search strategy in the space of possible axioms .', u'LEAP uses the axioms returned by CELOE to build a KB so that the likelihood of the examples is maximized .', u'We present experiments showing the potential of EDGE and LEAP .']

entities: [[(u'ontology engineering methodologies', u'Method')], [(u'Distinct methodologies', u'Method')], [(u'concept mapping technique', u'Method')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'concept mapping', u'Method'), (u'automatic term extraction process', u'Method'), (u'evaluation procedures', u'Generic'), (u'ontology designs', u'Task'), (u'concept maps', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'concept mapping technique', u'Method'), (u'term extraction engine', u'Method')], [(u'engine', u'Generic')], [(u'robust evaluation procedure', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'graphical level', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'A number of ontology engineering methodologies have been proposed to date .', u'Distinct methodologies rely on different techniques and activities for developing ontologies .', u'The concept mapping technique has been recently used for developing ontologies related to different domains .', u'However , the existing approaches using concept mapping do not make use of any automatic term extraction process to ease the overall ontology development process and their evaluation procedures are not robust to specifically meet the need for ontology designs emerging from concept maps .', u'This paper proposes a new approach which uses the concept mapping technique coupled with a term extraction engine .', u'The engine automatically extracts the candidate terms from the competency questions which reduces ontology development time and efforts .', u'Furthermore , considering the importance of evaluation , a robust evaluation procedure is proposed which validates the ontologies at both the formal level and the graphical level .']

entities: [[(u'transboundary water governance', u'Task'), (u'Lake Victoria Basin East Africa', u'Material')], [(u'well-designed ontology', u'Method')], [(u'sustainability science perspective', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Method'), (u'problem solving approach', u'Method'), (u'supportive thinking', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'transboundary water regimes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'public order', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'human dignity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Lake Victoria basin regime', u'Method')], [], [(u'basin regime creation process', u'Task')], [(u'process factors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'problem factors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'basin regime', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'ontology engineering', u'USED-FOR', u'sustainability science perspective'), (u'problem solving approach', u'USED-FOR', u'sustainability science perspective')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'This paper provides insights into effective transboundary water governance by considering a case study of the Lake Victoria Basin East Africa .', u'We argue that the construction of a well-designed ontology presents an explicit understanding of the target world shared among people .', u'The paper adopts a sustainability science perspective based on ontology engineering : a problem solving approach focusing on knowledge structuring of problem and process factors accompanied by supportive thinking .', u'Its premise is that transboundary water regimes ought to fashion a public order that advances human dignity .', u'The results indicate that the Lake Victoria basin regime is an interplay of international and regional activities .', u'Activities at the international level had greater influence on regional activities .', u'This analysis identifies gaps in the basin regime creation process .', u'The findings suggest that process factors rather than problem factors dominated the creation of the basin regime .']

entities: [[(u'ontology integration', u'Task'), (u'Water Resources domain', u'Material'), (u'Ontology Engineering', u'Task')], [(u'well-formed ontology', u'Method'), (u'Water Resources domain', u'Material'), (u'ontology integration process', u'Task')], [(u'knowledge management', u'Method'), (u'information systems', u'Method'), (u'hydrological domain', u'Material'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous systems', u'Method'), (u'tasks inter-mediation', u'Task'), (u'knowledge storage', u'Task'), (u'semantic enriched documents', u'Material')], [(u'ontology', u'Task'), (u'ontology re-use', u'Task')], [(u'tool support', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'groupware support', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology integration')], [(u'well-formed ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'Water Resources domain')], [(u'knowledge management', u'CONJUNCTION', u'information systems'), (u'knowledge management', u'USED-FOR', u'hydrological domain'), (u'information systems', u'USED-FOR', u'hydrological domain'), (u'information systems', u'USED-FOR', u'tasks inter-mediation')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper we discuss groupware support for ontology integration and present an experiment carried out with a group of specialists in the Water Resources domain and in Ontology Engineering .', u'The main goals of this experiment are to create , in a collaborative way , a well-formed ontology for a Water Resources domain and evaluate the ontology integration process .', u'The motivation of our work came from the development of knowledge management and information systems for the hydrological domain , where ontologies can be used as a broker between heterogeneous systems , to facilitate tasks inter-mediation and to help in knowledge storage , being used to publish semantic enriched documents .', u'Since the development of a great ontology has a high cost , ontology re-use becomes an important activity ; and consequently , so does the integration process .', u'For this reason , tool support is essential .']

entities: [[(u'Software Project Management', u'Method'), (u'knowledge intensive process', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task')], [(u'Ontology development', u'Task'), (u'knowledge management', u'Task'), (u'software and artefacts reusability', u'Method'), (u'project management processes', u'Method'), (u'software life cycle', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'software engineering aspects', u'Task'), (u'requirements engineering', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'components reuse', u'Task'), (u'domain modelling', u'Task')], [(u'systematic literature review', u'Method'), (u'software project management ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'terminology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'systematic domain modelling', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'prototype ontology systems', u'Method'), (u'software project management processes', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Software Project Management', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'knowledge intensive process'), (u'ontology development', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology engineering')], [(u'Ontology development', u'USED-FOR', u'software development process'), (u'knowledge management', u'USED-FOR', u'software development process')], [(u'requirements engineering', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'software engineering aspects'), (u'requirements engineering', u'CONJUNCTION', u'components reuse'), (u'components reuse', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'software engineering aspects'), (u'components reuse', u'CONJUNCTION', u'domain modelling'), (u'domain modelling', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'software engineering aspects')], [], [(u'ontologies', u'PART-OF', u'prototype ontology systems')]]
sentences: [u'Software Project Management is a knowledge intensive process that can benefit substantially from ontology development and ontology engineering .', u'Ontology development could facilitate or improve substantially the software development process through the improvement of knowledge management , the increase of software and artefacts reusability , and the establishment of internal consistency within project management processes of various phases of software life cycle .', u'A large number of ontologies have been developed attempting to address various software engineering aspects , such as requirements engineering , components reuse , domain modelling , etc .', u'In this paper , we present a systematic literature review focusing on software project management ontologies .', u'The literature review , among other , has identified lack of standardization in terminology and concepts , lack of systematic domain modelling and use of ontologies mainly in prototype ontology systems that address rather limited aspects of software project management processes .']

entities: [[(u'clinical pathway ontology.Methods Engineering methodology', u'Method'), (u'clinical pathway knowledge base', u'Task'), (u'knowledge source identification', u'Task'), (u'iterative knowledge abstraction', u'Method'), (u'grounded theory', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Method'), (u'Model-based Incremental Knowledge Engineering approach', u'Method'), (u'ontology evaluation', u'Task'), (u'clinical pathway', u'Task'), (u'electronic medical records', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'knowledge source identification', u'CONJUNCTION', u'iterative knowledge abstraction'), (u'knowledge source identification', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology engineering'), (u'patient type', u'CONJUNCTION', u'outcome'), (u'grounded theory', u'USED-FOR', u'iterative knowledge abstraction')]]
sentences: [u'Objective To abstract practice-oriented knowledge from a cohort of real clinical pathways and to represent this knowledge as a clinical pathway ontology.Methods Engineering methodology was adopted to construct clinical pathway knowledge base , which included ( 1 ) knowledge source identification and classification of clinical pathways according to variations in setting , stage of care , patient type , outcome and specialty ; ( 2 ) iterative knowledge abstraction using grounded theory ; ( 3 ) ontology engineering as adapted from the Model-based Incremental Knowledge Engineering approach ; and ( 4 ) ontology evaluation through encoding a sample of real clinical pathways.Results The clinical pathway ontology knowledge base was developed , which included 58 class diseases , and was applied in real clinical setting.Conclusion Clinical pathway ontology knowledge base has significant function in the electronic application of clinical pathway , which will be a reference for developing a new generation of electronic medical records .']

sentences: [u'Finding the right semantic distance to be used for information research , classification or text clustering using Natural Language Processing is a problem studied in several domains of computer science We focus on measurements that are real distances : i.e that satisfy all the properties of a distance This paper presents one isa-distance measurement that may be applied to taxonomies This distance , combined with a distance based on relations other than isa , may be a step towards a real semantic distance for ontologies After presenting the purpose of this work and the position of our approach within the literature , we formally detail our isa-distance It is extended to other relations and used to obtain a MDS projection of a musical ontology in an industrial project The utility of such a distance in visualization , navigation , information research and ontology engineering is underlined .']

sentences: [u'A new generation of intelligent applications can be enabled by broad-coverage repositories of knowledge .', u'One emerging approach to constructing such repositories is proactive knowledge collection from large numbers of volunteer contributors .', u'In this paper , we study the coverage and quality of a representative collection of part-of information contributed by volunteers .', u'We analyze growth of coverage over time , redundancy of the collected knowledge , and the effect of the coverage and redundancy on the quality of the collection .', u'We also present initial comparisons with collections created by ontology engineering and text extraction approaches .', u'Our analysis reveals that redundancy of contribution helps identify high quality statements , but that some of the statements also have overly high redundancy , drawing contributor effort away from areas where they are needed more .', u'We suggest possible ways to address these issues in future collection efforts .']

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Ubiquitous Computing', u'Task'), (u'geo-referenced information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Public Places', u'Material')], [], [(u"`` semantics of place '' problem", u'Task')], [], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Ontology Engineering techniques', u'Method')], [(u'KUSCO system', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'Ontology Engineering techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'approach'), (u'Ontology Engineering techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'network of semantic associations')], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we present an approach to a challenge well known from the area of Ubiquitous Computing : extracting meaning out of geo-referenced information .', u'We believe that Public Places can also be an environment where users can be confronted with intelligent services depending on their needs .', u'To make this a reality we need firstly an intelligent way to represent places .', u"The importance of this `` semantics of place '' problem is proportional to the number of available services and data that are common nowadays .", u"Having rich knowledge about a place , we open up a new realm of `` Location Based Services '' that can behave more intelligently .", u'Our approach builds on Ontology Engineering techniques in order to build a network of semantic associations between a place and related concepts .', u'We briefly describe the KUSCO system and present some preliminary results .']

sentences: [u'ORM ( Object Role Modeling ) is a rich and popular conceptual modeling method .', u'ORM has been used for data modeling , ontology engineering , modeling business rules , XML-Schemes and data warehouses , requirements engineering and web forms .', u'Automated reasoning like satisfiability testing allows developers to detect modeling mistakes in the early stages of development .', u'In this paper we propose a lightweight formalization of the ORM meta-model in Alloy .', u'Using this meta-model as a toolkit one can easily specify ORM models in Alloy and verify various properties on them using the Alloy Analyzer .', u'In order to achieve scalability , we use the cardinality of concepts to model their population .', u'This increases the scalability of the approach dramatically .', u'To show an application of the meta-model we formalize some unsatisfiability patterns and check them on the Alloy representation of the ORM model .']

sentences: [u'Ontology plays an essential role in the formalization of business information ( e.g. , products , services , relationships of businesses ) for effective human-computer interactions .', u'However , engineering of domain ontologies turns out to be very labor intensive and time consuming .', u'Recently , some machine learning methods have been proposed for automatic discovery of domain ontologies .', u'Nevertheless , the accuracy and computational ef ciency of the existing methods need to be improved to support large scale ontology construction for real-world business applications .', u'This paper illustrates a novel fuzzy domain ontology discovery algorithm for supporting real-world business ontology engineering .', u'By combining lexico-syntactic and statistical learning methods , the accuracy and the computational ef ciency of the ontology discovery process is improved .', u'Empirical studies have con rme d that the proposed method can discover high quality fuzzy domain ontology which leads to signi cant improvement in information retrieval performance .']

sentences: [u'Abstract # R # # N # Abstract : If the International Standard Serial Number ( ISSN ) did not exist , someone would have to invent it .', u'Its that simple .', u'In the current environment where databases contain many millions of records , unique identifiers are crucial .', u'Most databases , indexes , and registries of journals require the use of the ISSN .', u'ISSN is now a key element of OpenURL link resolution services that connect users to article content .', u'New types of resources that require ISSN for identification continue to be created .', u'New needs for ISSN , such as its role in identifying titles for print and digital archiving , continue to emerge .', u'In a future world of linked data for libraries , identifiersincluding the ISSNwill play an essential role .', u'Dodds and Davis , authors of Linked Data Patterns , state that the single most important part of the Linked Data approach is the adoption of web-scale identifiers ( URIs ) to identify things of interest .', u'This case study will provide background on the ISSN ; describe ISSN traditional uses in the library , publishing , and information communities ; discuss the enlarging scope of resources that are assigned ISSN ; and elaborate on ISSN uses in the current digital environment including ROAD , a new ISSN database of open access scholarly resources .', u'The case study will conclude with an exploration of ISSN potential in the future linked data environment. # R # # N # Keywords : ISSN .', u'Digital environment .', u'Data environment .', u'Linked data .', u'Semantic web. # R # # N # # R # # N # Tudo velho e novo outra vez : o ISSN no ambiente digital # R # # N # # R # # N # Resumo # R # # N # Se o Numero Internacional Normalizado para Publicacoes Seriadas ( ISSN ) nao existisse , alguem teria que inventa-lo .', u'Simples assim .', u'No atual ambiente onde bases de dados contem muitos milhoes de registros , identificadores unicos sao cruciais .', u'A maioria das bases , indices e registros de periodicos exigem o uso do ISSN .', u'O ISSN e hoje um elemento-chave nos servicos de resolucao de links OpenURL que conectam usuarios ao conteudo dos artigos .', u'Novos tipos de recursos que exigem o ISSN para identificacao continuam a ser criados .', u'Novas necessidades para o ISSN , como seu papel na identificacao de titulos para arquivamento impresso e digital , continuam a surgir .', u'Em um mundo futuro de dados conectados para bibliotecas , identificadores incluindo o ISSN terao um papel essencial .', u'Dodds e Davis , autores de Padroes de Dados Conectados , afirmam que a parte mais importante da abordagem de Dados Conectados e a adocao de identificadores em escala Web ( URIs ) para identificar coisas de interesse .', u'Este estudo de caso oferece um historico do ISSN ; descreve os usos tradicionais do ISSN em bibliotecas , publicacoes e comunidades informacionais ; discute o escopo crescente de recursos que recebem atribuicao de ISSN ; e elabora nos usos do ISSN no ambiente digital atual , incluindo ROAD , uma nova base de dados do ISSN de recursos academicos de acesso aberto .', u'Conclui com uma exploracao do potencial do ISSN em ambientes futuros de dados conectados. # R # # N # # R # # N # Palavras-chave : ISSN .', u'Ambiente digital .', u'Ambiente de dados. # R # # N # # R # # N # Todo lo viejo es nuevo otra vez : el ISSN en el ambiente digital # R # # N # Resumen # R # # N # Si no existiera el Numero Internacional Normalizado para Publicaciones Seriadas ( ISSN ) , alguien tendria que inventarlo .', u'Es asi de simple .', u'En el ambiente actual donde bases de datos contiene muchos millones de registros , identificadores unicos son cruciales .', u'La mayoria de bases , indices y registros de periodicos requieren el uso del ISSN .', u'El ISSN es hoy un elemento clave en servicios de resolucion de enlaces OpenURL que conectan usuarios al contenido de los articulos .', u'Nuevos tipos de recursos que requieren el ISSN para identificacion continuan a ser creados .', u'Nuevas necesidades para el ISSN , como su papel en la identificacion de titulos para archivamiento impreso y digital , continuan a aparecer .', u'En un mundo futuro de datos conectados para bibliotecas , identificadores incluyendo el ISSN tendran un papel fundamental .', u'Dodds y Davis , autores de Linkded Data Patterns , afirman que la parte mas importante del abordaje de Datos Conectados es la adopcion de identificadores en escala Web ( URIs ) para identificar cosas de interes .', u'Este estudio de caso ofrece un historico del ISSN ; describe los usos tradicionales del ISSN en bibliotecas , publicaciones y comunidades informacionales ; discute el alcance creciente de recursos que reciben asignacion de ISSN ; y elabora en los usos del ISSN en el ambiente digital actual , incluyendo ROAD , una nueva base de datos del ISSN de recursos academicos de acceso abierto .', u'Concluye con una exploracion del potencial del ISSN en ambientes futuros de datos conectados. # R # # N # # R # # N # Palabras clave : ISSN .', u'Ambiente digital .', u'Ambiente de dados .']

sentences: [u'Collaborative design in dispersed groups of engineers creates various kinds of challenges to technology , organization and social environment .', u'This paper presents an approach to description and representation of the competences needed for a planned collaborative design project .', u'The most important competence areas are identified starting from the nature of design work , problem solving in design teams , and working in distributed groups .', u'The competence model is built structuring these areas according to three perspectives : general , cultural , and occupational competences .', u'An ontological representation is proposed to implement the described model for collaborative design competence .', u'Using an ontology language for representation of collaborative design competence models makes it possible to identify those individuals who are best suited for the collaboration by ontology matching .', u'Finally , a software design team consisting of two persons was interviewed and two competence profiles were created using the developed ontological representation of the model .', u'The modeling of the team members has proved that the proposed approach can be applied to modeling competences needed for collaborative design in engineering fields .']

entities: [[(u'VESTIGIUM', u'Method')], [(u'Para ello', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'bibliotecas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'archivos y museos', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'LAM', u'Metric'), (u'Libraries', u'Material')], [(u'Se tratan', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'El metodo de trabajo', u'Material'), (u'tanto tecnicas de revision bibliografica', u'Method')], [], [(u'Asimismo', u'Method'), (u'facilitan el intercambio de informacion', u'Task')], [(u'cumple con los cuatro principios basicos', u'Method')], []]

sentences: [u'La tesis tiene por objeto el diseno de un apartado de informacion biografica de una biblioteca digital interoperable , VESTIGIUM .', u'Para ello , se ha estudiado en profundidad la normativa , tecnologia y proyectos actuales que tratan sobre informacion de personas , lo que denominamos informacion biografica o de autoridades .', u'Se plantea el estado actual del control de autoridades personales , desde las primeras conceptualizaciones en el siglo XIX y los escenarios habituales en los que aparece este tipo de informacion : bibliotecas , archivos y museos ( LAM , Libraries , Archives and Museums ) .', u'Se tratan , a continuacion , los aspectos actuales del nuevo universo en el que operan estas entidades abstractas , ya que en el mundo web pueden aparecer en multiples entornos de uso .', u'Es por este motivo , por lo que resulta complejo su estudio y limitacion , visto que en cada contexto y utilizacion , las autoridades son tratadas de diferentes formas .', u'El metodo de trabajo incluye tanto tecnicas de revision bibliografica , como trabajo de campo para la localizacion de sistemas de informacion que utilizan control de autoridades de personas en internet y casos de uso linked data ( en adelante LD ) .', u'La creacion del marco normativo en materia de informacion de autoridades personales en el area de archivos -Norma Internacional sobre los Registros de Autoridad de Archivos relativos a Instituciones , Personas y Familias ( ISAAR ( CPF ) ) y Encoded Archival Context - Corporate Bodies , Persons and Families ( EAC-CPF ) - , bibliotecas y documentacion -Requisitos Funcionales de los Datos de Autoridad ( FRAD ) , Directrices para Registros de Autoridad y Referencias ( GARR ) , MARC 21 Conciso para Datos de Autoridad , Resource Description and Access ( RDA ) , MARCXML , Metadata Authorities Description Schema ( MADS ) - , y en el mundo de la aplicacion de recomendaciones de metadatos del World Wide Web Consortium ( W3C ) -Dublin Core Metadata Iniciative ( DCMI ) , Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) , Friend to Friend ( FOAF ) , RELATIONSHIP y BIO- , nos ha permitido crear un prototipo que actua como germen para la interoperabilidad de datos biograficos , asegurando la visibilidad a escala internacional .', u'Asimismo , los formatos de exportacion propuestos segun las normas y estandares de aplicacion , facilitan el intercambio de informacion , teniendo en cuenta que el uso de tecnologias de la web semantica permite integrar informacion procedente de varios sistemas .', u'El modelo de datos propuesto en la tabla autor , con informacion biografica contextualizada , cumple con los cuatro principios basicos , definidos por Tim Berners Lee para la publicacion de LD .', u'Los beneficios de utilizar la normativa semantica en la tabla son mejorar el proceso de obtencion de enlaces entre entidades semanticamente similares o relacionadas , asi como de vocabularios de valores y conjuntos de elementos de metadatos o conjuntos de datos , que provienen de diferentes fuentes y , a su vez , difunden este tipo de datos .']

entities: [[(u'Software engineering', u'Method'), (u'learning process', u'Method')], [(u'Responsiveness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user-centered design', u'Task')], [(u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'collective knowledge maturing process', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'social media based competence management', u'Method'), (u'career guidance', u'Task'), (u'ontology-centered reflection', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multi-professional environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'palliative care', u'Task'), (u'pratice networks of General Practitioners', u'Method')], [], [(u'tool-mediated knowledge development processes', u'Method'), (u'workplace learning analytics', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Responsiveness', u'CONJUNCTION', u'user-centered design')], [(u'knowledge', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology engineering'), (u'collective knowledge maturing process', u'USED-FOR', u'they')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Software engineering has been transformed in recent years by understanding the interaction with customers and the target context as an ongoing learning process .', u'Responsiveness to change and user-centered design have been the consequences .', u'In a similar way , knowledge and ontology engineering are undergoing fundamental changes to acknowledge the fact that they are part of a collective knowledge maturing process .', u'We explore three examples : ( i ) social media based competence management in career guidance , ( ii ) ontology-centered reflection in multi-professional environments in palliative care , and ( iii ) aligning individual mindlines in pratice networks of General Practitioners .', u'Based on these , we extract four levels of designing for knowledge maturing and associated technical implementations .', u'This shows that future technology support should especially target facilitation of self-organized , but tool-mediated knowledge development processes , where , e.g. , workplace learning analytics can play a prominent role .']

sentences: [u'Use of ontology in Information Systems and Knowledge Sharing Systems are increasing that gives more importance to proper maintenance of these ontologies in use .', u'Ontology change management is a collaborative process that incorporate areas like ; ontology engineering , evolution versioning , merging , integration , and maintenance .', u'As experts develop better understanding of the domain , incorporate changes accordingly to the body of knowledge , as a result the body of knowledge evolves from one state to another .', u'Preserving consistency while accommodating changes is a crucial task that needs special attention .', u'In this paper we provide a brief review of state of the art in the field of ontology evolution that set the stage for the unfolded challenges in ontology evolution to complete the process automatically .', u'Then we also discuss very important issues that need special attention to minimize the after effects of ontology evolution .']

sentences: [u'The analysis of changes between OWL ontologies ( in the form of a diff ) is an important service for ontology engineering .', u'A purely syntactic analysis of changes is insufficient to distinguish between changes that have logical impact and those that do not .', u'The current state of the art in semantic diffing ignores logically ineffectual changes and lacks any further characterisation of even significant changes .', u'We present a diff method based on an exhaustive categorisation of effectual and ineffectual changes between ontologies .', u'In order to verify the applicability of our approach we apply it to 88 versions of the National Cancer Institute ( NCI ) Thesaurus ( NCIt ) , and demonstrate that all categories are realized throughout the corpus .', u'Based on the outcome of the NCIt study we argue that the devised categorisation of changes is helpful for ontology engineers and their understanding of changes carried out between ontologies .']

sentences: [u'We investigate the current extent of term reuse and overlap among biomedical ontologies .', u'We use the corpus of biomedical ontologies stored in the BioPortal repository , and analyze three types of reuse constructs : ( a ) explicit term reuse , ( b ) xref reuse , and ( c ) Concept Unique Identifier ( CUI ) reuse .', u'While there is a term label similarity of approximately 14.4 % of the total terms , we observed that most ontologies reuse considerably fewer than 5 % of their terms from a concise set of a few core ontologies .', u'We developed an interactive visualization to explore reuse dependencies among biomedical ontologies .', u'Moreover , we identified a set of patterns that indicate ontology developers did intend to reuse terms from other ontologies , but they were using different and sometimes incorrect representations .', u'Our results suggest the value of semi-automated tools that augment term reuse in the ontology engineering process through personalized recommendations .']

relations: [[], [(u'hierarchically organized items', u'CONJUNCTION', u'generalized association rules')], [(u'them', u'COMPARE', u'hierarchical pruning methods')], [], [], [(u'measures', u'COMPARE', u'performance measures'), (u'relation learning recall', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'measures'), (u'relation learning recall', u'CONJUNCTION', u'precision'), (u'precision', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'measures')]]
sentences: [u'In the literature about association analysis , many interestingness measures have been proposed to assess the quality of obtained association rules in order to select a small set of the most interesting among them .', u'In the particular case of hierarchically organized items and generalized association rules connecting them , a measure that dealt appropriately with the hierarchy would be advantageous .', u'Here we present the further developments of a new class of such hierarchical interestingness measures and compare them with a large set of conventional measures and with three hierarchical pruning methods from the literature .', u'The aim is to find interesting pairwise generalized association rules connecting the concepts of multiple ontologies .', u'Interested in the broad empirical evaluation of interestingness measures , we compared the rules obtained by 37 methods on four real world data sets against predefined ground truth sets of associations .', u'To this end , we adopted a framework of instance-based ontology matching and extended the set of performance measures by two novel measures : relation learning recall and precision which take into account hierarchical relationships .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'MPRT ) framework', u'USED-FOR', u'traceability relationships of multiperspective requirements artifacts')], [(u'Requirements ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'multiperspective requirements artifacts'), (u'knowledge management mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'multiperspective requirements artifacts')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In a software development process , different stakeholders may deal with different pieces of software requirements depending on their perspectives or perception of their problems .', u'Each of the stakeholders may define his/her requirements in his/her own point of view using different terminologies .', u'However , a variety of stakeholders will need to interoperate , collaborate or trace requirements among each other in order to achieve a common goal of their development .', u'In this situation , ontology can play an essential role in communication among diverse stakeholders in the course of an integrating system.In this paper , we propose an alternative multiperspective requirements traceability ( MPRT ) framework to automatically generate traceability relationships of multiperspective requirements artifacts .', u"Requirements ontology is designed and built as a knowledge management mechanism to represent multiperspective requirements artifacts in a common way , which intervene mutual `` understanding '' among various stakeholders .", u'Ontology matching takes two ontologies and produces correspondences ( i.e. , equivalence , more general , less general , mismatch and overlapping ) between the concepts of ontologies that correspond semantically to each other .', u'The traceability relationships are automatically generated when a match is found in the ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'Cyber-Physics System', u'Method'), (u'physical systems', u'Method'), (u'cyber ( IT ) systems', u'Task')], [(u'systems', u'Generic')], [(u'sensor-based and customer needs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'actuators', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'CPSs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'communication', u'Method'), (u'computation and control infrastructures', u'Method')], [(u'Logistics-as-a-Service ( LaaS )', u'Method'), (u'organizations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'people', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'service-oriented cyber-physical systems', u'Method')], [(u'Intelligent multimodal logistics network', u'Method'), (u'worldwide logistics', u'Task')], [(u'generic architecture', u'Method'), (u'LaaS', u'Method'), (u'logistics networks', u'Method')], [(u'ontology matching', u'Task'), (u'multi-lingual logistics network', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Cyber-Physics System ( CPS ) is a relatively new term assuming tight integration of physical systems and cyber ( IT ) systems interacting in real time .', u'Such systems aim at providing a flexible and extensible infrastructure supporting a variety of inputs ( e.g .', u'sensor-based and customer needs ) and outputs ( actuators or indicators/displays ) .', u'CPSs rely on communication , computation and control infrastructures to provide for efficient utilization of logistics infrastructure resources .', u'In this context , Logistics-as-a-Service ( LaaS ) is a logistics network of organizations , people , information and resources supported by service-oriented cyber-physical systems .', u'Intelligent multimodal logistics network is an important node in the worldwide logistics , involved in moving a product from supplier to customer or providing an accompanying service .', u'The paper presents a generic architecture for LaaS , which is based on representing elements of the logistics networks as services .', u'In this environment , the role of an application ontology and integration of individual and organizational competences is investigated and the use of ontology matching for finding suitable resources in a multi-lingual logistics network is discussed .']

entities: [[(u'Schema and ontology matching', u'Task'), (u'schema attributes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data integration', u'Task')], [(u'commercial and academic tools', u'Method')], [(u'tools', u'Generic')], [(u'matching', u'Task'), (u'heuristic techniques', u'Method')], [], [(u'post-matching phase', u'Task')], [(u'human-assisted phase', u'Method'), (u'matching reconciliation', u'Task')], [(u'network', u'Generic'), (u'declarative formalism', u'Method'), (u'Answer Set Programming', u'Method'), (u'user input', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'reasoning and heuristic techniques', u'Method'), (u'human involvement', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'schema attributes', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology concepts')], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Schema and ontology matching is a process of establishing correspondences between schema attributes and ontology concepts , for the purpose of data integration .', u'Various commercial and academic tools have been developed to support this task .', u'These tools provide impressive results on some datasets .', u'However , as the matching is inherently uncertain , the developed heuristic techniques give rise to results that are not completely correct .', u'In practice , post-matching human expert effort is needed to obtain a correct set of correspondences .', u'We study this post-matching phase with the goal of reducing the costly human effort .', u'We formally model this human-assisted phase and introduce a process of matching reconciliation that incrementally leads to identifying the correct correspondences .', u'We achieve the goal of reducing the involved human effort by exploiting a network of schemas that are matched against each other.We express the fundamental matching constraints present in the network in a declarative formalism , Answer Set Programming that in turn enables to reason about necessary user input .', u'We demonstrate empirically that our reasoning and heuristic techniques can indeed substantially reduce the necessary human involvement .']

sentences: [u'Service discovery and composition are challenging issue of service computing to provide value-added service .', u'Existing approaches by keyword or ontology matching have limitations for locating realistic services discovery and composition considering non-functionality or sociality .', u'On main reason in that approaches are based on isolated services .', u'The isolation hinders efficient discovery and composition of services .', u'Therefore , in the past research , they suggest social linked service network considering relationships of functional and nonfunctional properties , and social interaction based on complex network theory , where they can locate related services through sociability .', u'However , it would be difficult to create social linked service network because services portable devices and sensors has been increasing with progress of Big Data technology .', u'In this paper , we propose creating social linked service network to improve performance of network construction as considering distributed process on Big Data infrastructure .', u'First , we propose an algorithm that creation network graph using Map Reduce parallel programming model .', u'Finally , experimental results show that our creating network using Map Reduce approach can solve the heavy computation load for many calculations of network elements .']

sentences: [u'Ontology mappings are used in data integration , query answering , and comparative analysis tasks of ontologies .', u'Ontology mappings are often obtained by using a matching tool .', u'Ontology merging is the creation of a new ontology from at least two source ontologies .', u'In Ontology merging , establishing map-pings between source ontologies is the primitive step .', u'Ontology matching tools can be used for establishing mappings , but different matching tools often give dissimilar ontology mappings .', u'Human intervention may not solve the problem because distinct perspectives and understandings also lead to different mappings .', u'Attempts to face the problems have been studied in the literature .', u'All these attempts focus on finding erroneous mappings and finding one consensual mapping .', u'In this paper , we suggest that under some conditions , mappings can be combined to get benefits from each of them .', u'Mappings satisfying those conditions are name compatible mappings , we argue that the conditions mentioned above are based on Galois connections .', u'Opposed to compatible mappings , incompatible mappings can not be combined because their combination results in erroneous mappings .', u'We discussed our method in the context of ontology merging .']

sentences: [u'Abstract The prevalence of the World Wide Web in modern industries has turned web-based systems and internet applications into the main platforms for improving and supporting the completion of users tasks .', u'Developments in web programming are necessary to reduce the working time and to enhance the reliability of web-based systems .', u'In this paper , we developed a web-based catalog system that applies the AJAX technique and semantic technology .', u'The new system is compared with conventional web programming systems in terms of page response time .']

sentences: [u'ABSTRACT # R # # N # # R # # N # Knowledge organization systems ( KOS ) are the key elements for interlinking the values of Linked Data datasets .', u'Existing KOS products ( including well-known thesauri and classification systems ) need to be transformed into the constructs of Linked Data services , much more beyond what a traditional thesaurus or classification were/are developed , but how ?', u'What can these Linked Data KOS bring to various information services ?', u'The panelists will share their experiences and lessons learned .', u'The presentation starts from the processes that have been developed to build , maintain , and publish a newly derived taxonomy using W3C SKOS standard , to make it extensible and scalable to support new information services in scholarly publishing workflow .', u'The next presentation will share experiences and lessons learned from the implementation of a platform built for publishing and distribution of multiple KOS and for automatic indexing using these KOS .', u'The third case is a Linked Data bibliographic service , a RDF-aware system and a mash up application which relies on the use of a multilingual thesaurus that has been published and maintained as a Linked Data dataset , and has been mapped to more than ten KOS .', u'For the datasets that have not used standardized KOS , the panel will present methods that can be applied when generating or deriving project-focused micro-thesauri from the Linked Data KOS and give an overview of the use cases of Linked Data KOS in information services .']

entities: [[(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge models', u'Method')], [(u'matching problem', u'Task'), (u'real situations', u'Task')], [(u'Google Similarity Distance', u'Method')], [(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'Google search engine', u'Method'), (u'text expressions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'software application', u'Method'), (u'schema and ontology matching tools', u'Method')], [(u'Google', u'Material'), (u'search engines', u'Method'), (u'similarity distance', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'web search engines', u'Method'), (u'semantic correspondences', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'web search engines', u'Method')], [(u'web search engines', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'solutions', u'USED-FOR', u'real situations')], [], [(u'Google search engine', u'USED-FOR', u'text expressions')], [], [], [], [(u'web search engines', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic correspondences')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The problem of matching schemas or ontologies consists of providing corresponding entities in two or more knowledge models that belong to a same domain but have been developed separately .', u'Nowadays there are a lot of techniques and tools for addressing this problem , however , the complex nature of the matching problem make existing solutions for real situations not fully satisfactory .', u'The Google Similarity Distance has appeared recently .', u'Its purpose is to mine knowledge from the Web using the Google search engine in order to semantically compare text expressions .', u'Our work consists of developing a software application for validating results discovered by schema and ontology matching tools using the philosophy behind this distance .', u'Moreover , we are interested in using not only Google , but other popular search engines with this similarity distance .', u'The results reveal three main facts .', u'Firstly , some web search engines can help us to validate semantic correspondences satisfactorily .', u'Secondly there are significant differences among the web search engines .', u'And thirdly the best results are obtained when using combinations of the web search engines that we have studied .']

entities: [[], [(u'Communication', u'Task')], [(u'agent', u'Generic'), (u'local ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'interaction model', u'Method')], [(u'recall', u'Metric')], [(u'dynamic ontology matching', u'Task')]]
sentences: [u'Agents need to communicate in order to accomplish tasks that they are unable to perform alone .', u'Communication requires agents to share a common ontology , a strong assumption in open environments where agents from different backgrounds meet briefly , making it impossible to map all the ontologies in advance .', u'An agent , when it receives a message , needs to compare the foreign terms in the message with all the terms in its own local ontology , searching for the most similar one .', u'However , the content of a message may be described using an interaction model : the entities to which the terms refer are correlated with other entities in the interaction , and they may also have prior probabilities determined by earlier , similar interactions .', u'Within the context of an interaction it is possible to predict the set of possible entities a received message may contain , and it is possible to sacrifice recall for efficiency by comparing the foreign terms only with the most probable local ones .', u'This allows a novel form of dynamic ontology matching .']

entities: [[(u'Emotions', u'Material'), (u'cues', u'Generic'), (u'speech facial expressions', u'Material')], [(u'Emotions', u'Material')], [(u'hybrid model', u'Method'), (u'detecting emotion', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'keywords semantic similarity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ekman emotion categories', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'object extraction algorithm', u'Method'), (u'ontology matching process', u'Method'), (u'ontology base', u'Material')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology base', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'keyword semantic similarity approach', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic analysis of the context', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'speech facial expressions', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'cues'), (u'actions', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'cues')], [], [(u'hybrid model', u'USED-FOR', u'detecting emotion'), (u'keywords semantic similarity', u'FEATURE-OF', u'ontology')], [], [(u'it', u'COMPARE', u'ontology base')], [(u'ontology base', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology matching process')], [], [(u'ontology base', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')], [(u'syntax', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic analysis of the context')]]
sentences: [u'Emotions can be judged by a combination of cues such as speech facial expressions and actions .', u'Emotions are also articulated by text .', u'This paper shows a new hybrid model for detecting emotion from text which depends on ontology with keywords semantic similarity .', u'The text labelled with one of the six basic Ekman emotion categories .', u'The main idea is to extract ontology from input sentences and match it with the ontology base which created from simple ontologies and the emotion of each ontology .', u'The ontology extracted from the input sentence by using a triplet subject , predicate , and object extraction algorithm , then the ontology matching process is applied with the ontology base .', u'After that the emotion of the input sentence is the emotion of the ontology which it matches with the highest score of matching .', u"If the extracted ontology does n't match with any ontology from the ontology base , then the keyword semantic similarity approach used .", u'The suggested approach depends on the meaning of each sentence , the syntax and semantic analysis of the context .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic relations')], [], [], [(u'curiosity score', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'baseline method'), (u'serendipity score', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'baseline method')], [(u'approach', u'COMPARE', u'baseline method')], [(u'Linked Data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'News Recommen- dation')]]
sentences: [u"In recent years , `` News Curation Services '' that rec- ommend news articles on the Internet to users are getting attention .", u"In this paper , we propose a news curation service that collects and recommends `` news articles '' that users feel interested by using semantic relationships between terms in the articles .", u"We define `` interested '' news articles as articles that users have curiosity and serendipity .", u'The semantic relations between events terms are represented by Linked Data .', u"We create News Articles Linked Data ( candidates for recommendation to users ) and User 's preferences Linked Data ( users ' preferences ) .", u'In order to recommend news articles to users , we first search common subgraphs between two kinds of Linked Data .', u'The experiment showed that the curiosity score is 3.30 ( min:0 , max:4 ) , and the serendipity score is 2.93 in our approach , although a baseline method showed the curiosity score is 3.03 , and the serendipity score is 2.79 .', u'Thus , we confirmed that our approach is more effective than the baseline method .', u'Keywords-Semantic Relation ; Linked Data ; News Recommen- dation .']

entities: [[(u'IBM', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'architectural style', u'Method')], [(u'W3C Recommendation', u'Method'), (u'HTTP-based ( RESTful ) application integration patterns', u'Task'), (u'read/write Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data Platform Recommendation', u'Method')], [(u'enterprise solutions', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'type definition language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF data', u'Material')], [(u'language', u'Generic'), (u'RDFS', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Material'), (u'OSLC Resource Shapes', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'W3C Linked Data Platform Working Group', u'USED-FOR', u'W3C Recommendation')], [], [(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'enterprise solutions')], [], [(u'RDFS', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL')]]
sentences: [u'IBM has for several years been employing a read/write usage of Linked Data as an architectural style for integrating a suite of applications .', u'( 1 ) We are encouraged by the work done by the W3C Linked Data Platform Working Group which is chartered to produce a W3C Recommendation for HTTP-based ( RESTful ) application integration patterns using read/write Linked Data .', u'The Linked Data Platform Recommendation will provide the industry with a solid foundation to build on .', u'Yet , more work will need to be done to address in a standard way the needs of enterprise solutions that use Linked Data as an application integration platform .', u'One such need is a type definition language that can be used to communicate and validate constraints on RDF data .', u'This paper explains the need for such a language , why standards like RDFS and OWL are not suitable answers and , finally , introduces OSLC Resource Shapes as a proposed solution .']

entities: [[], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'domain specific scripting languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'background processes', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'scripting language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'type system', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'local data', u'Material'), (u'external data', u'Material'), (u'type system', u'Method'), (u'static', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'The Web of Linked Data is the cumulation of over a decade of work by the Web standards community in their effort to make data more Web-like .', u'We provide an introduction to the Web of Linked Data from the perspective of a Web developer that would like to build an application using Linked Data .', u'We identify a weakness in the development stack as being a lack of domain specific scripting languages for designing background processes that consume Linked Data .', u'To address this weakness , we design a scripting language with a simple but appropriate type system .', u'In our proposed architecture some data is consumed from sources outside of the control of the system and some data is held locally .', u'Stronger type assumptions can be made about the local data than external data , hence our type system mixes static and dynamic typing .', u'Throughout , we relate our work to the W3C recommendations that drive Linked Data , so our syntax is accessible to Web developers .']

sentences: [u'The data the government has in RDF format has been opened to the public on the Web in the USA and the UK .', u"Meanwhile , `` Linked Open Data ( LOD ) '' has received a lot of attention supported by that trend .", u'However , there are few Japanese datasets as Linked Data .', u'In addition , few studies about method of applying for information services have been conducted .', u'The objective of this study is to implement a mobility service based on Japanese Linked Data .', u'We focus on the modifiability of data , the frequency of update for the data on the websites , and separate the treatments for the datasets depend on the degree of frequency of update to show the possibilities for management of data as Linked Data that consists of various kinds of data .', u'As a practical matter , we created Linked Data in Japanese focused on geographical or positional data and developed a mobility service application to support driving and planning to go for a drive based on using the Linked Data .']

entities: [[(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'ontology learning', u'Task')], [(u'text representation', u'Method'), (u'term weighting', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'unnecessary noise', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'generated model', u'Method'), (u'learning', u'Task')], [(u'semi-automatic approach', u'Method'), (u'variables selection', u'Method'), (u'clustering', u'Method')], [(u'ontological artifacts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'candidate changes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alignment process', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'natural language processing', u'Task'), (u'indexation and machine learning techniques', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering task', u'Task'), (u'conceptual model', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'In recent years , several approaches have been proposed to solve the problem of ontology learning .', u'In most approaches , the text representation is only based on the information contained in term weighting and does therefore not process the semantic contained in the sequence in which the words appear .', u'Moreover , the use of many dimensions adds unnecessary noise in the generated model and affects the quality of learning ( generalization ) .', u'Hence , in the present study , we propose a semi-automatic approach that uses the variables selection and clustering to find the candidate changes .', u'In order to identify the correspondence between the ontological artifacts and candidate changes , we used an alignment process .', u'Our approach exploits natural language processing , indexation and machine learning techniques to increase the productivity of ontology engineering task during the enrichment of conceptual model .', u'Good experimental studies demonstrate the multidisciplinary applications of our approach .']

sentences: [u'Ontology selection is an important challenge in the field of ontology engineering .', u'A feasible solution of ontology selection is to measure and evaluate the candidate ontologies , and further select and reuse the high-quality ontologies from them according to some measurement criteria .', u'In this paper , we designed an ontology measurement system ( ONTOM ) for measuring the quality of candidate ontologies by integrating our semantic ontology metrics into ONTOM .', u'The experiments show that ONTOM can effective measure the semantic quality of ontologies for ontology reuse .', u'Streszczenie .', u'W artykule przedstawiono system pomiaru ontologii ONTOM , realizujcy dwie glowne funkcje : pomiar semantyk ontologii oraz okrelenie parametru jakociowego ontologii .', u'W pierwszym punkcie dokonany jest dobor czynnikow , ktore nalezy uwzglednic w pomiarze .', u'W drugim kroku dzialan chodzi o okrelenie parametru odzwierciedlajcego ontologie danego kandydata .', u'Przedstawiono wyniki badan eksperymentalnych .', u'( Opracowanie metody pomiaru semantycznego w systemie ontologicznym ) .']

sentences: [u'In this paper we give an account of the current state of practice in ontology engineering ( OE ) based on the findings of a 6 months empirical survey that analyzed 148 OE projects .', u'The survey focused on process-related issues and looked into the impact of research achievements on real-world OE projects , the complexity of particular ontology development tasks , the level of tool support , and the usage scenarios for ontologies .', u'The main contributions of this survey are twofold : 1 ) the size of the data set is larger than every other similar endeavor ; 2 ) the findings of the survey confirm that OE is an established engineering discipline w.r.t the maturity and level of acceptance of its main components , methodologies , etc .', u'whereas further research should target economic aspects of OE and the customization of existing technology to the specifics of vertical domains .']

entities: [[(u'merging ontologies', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task')], [(u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'anatomical ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'bioinformatics', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'transfer of data', u'Task'), (u'model organisms toother model', u'Method')], [], [(u'species-specific AOs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'procedures', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'ACM Computing Classification System', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'The problem of mapping and merging ontologies in general is an important one in the area of ontology engineering .', u'The same problem considered within the narrower area of anatomical ontologies ( AOs ) is important in bioinformatics because solving it could enable the transfer of data and the application of knowledge obtained from various model organisms toother model and non-model organisms , and even to research areas such as those of human health and medicine .', u'This paper presents a detailed summary of the authors PhD researchdone in the period 20072013 .', u'The papers main topic is the problem of mapping and merging of multiple species-specific AOs and the related approaches , methods , and procedures that can be used for solving it .', u'ACM Computing Classification System ( 1998 ) : J.3 , E.1 , G.2.2 , G.2.3 , I.2.1 , I.2.4 .']

relations: [[(u'Ontology Design Patterns', u'USED-FOR', u'Reusing knowledge resources')], [], [], [], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'ODPs'), (u'context ontology network', u'USED-FOR', u'context-related knowledge'), (u'user context', u'USED-FOR', u'method')], []]
sentences: [u'Reusing knowledge resources , specifically Ontology Design Patterns ( ODPs ) , has became a popular technique within the ontology engineering field .', u'Such a reuse allows speeding up the ontology development process , saving time and money , and promoting the application of good practices .', u'Recently methods and tools to support the reuse of ODPs have emerged .', u'In addition , the existence of detailed examples of real use cases that reuse ODPs favours the adoption and application of such methods .', u'Thus , our objective in this paper is to show an example of how to apply a method for reusing ODPs during the development of a context ontology network to model context-related knowledge that allows adapting applications based on user context .', u'Besides , in this paper we present the main drawbacks found during the application of the reuse method as well as some proposals to overcome them .']
