relations: [[(u'BPM )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'business process management')], [(u'process modeling', u'USED-FOR', u'process knowledge')], [(u'semantic completeness', u'FEATURE-OF', u'models')], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'models'), (u'semantic quality', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'models'), (u'semantic quality', u'CONJUNCTION', u'model efficiency')], [(u'ontology engineering', u'USED-FOR', u'discourse of universe'), (u'models', u'USED-FOR', u'discourse of universe')], [(u'semantic quality', u'CONJUNCTION', u'model effectiveness'), (u'model effectiveness', u'CONJUNCTION', u'-efficiency'), (u'data modeling', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [(u'precision deficit', u'CONJUNCTION', u'complexity')]]
sentences: [u'In contrast to the increasing meaning of business process management ( BPM ) , there is a lack of knowledge about processes that impedes their analysis , implementation , and execution in business process management systems ( BPMS ) .', u'In this context , process modeling is an opportunity to capture process knowledge .', u'Nevertheless , models are incomplete concerning semantic completeness .', u'Therefore , ontologies as explicit and formal specification are used to enrich models semantically to achieve a high degree of semantic quality , model efficiency and effectiveness .', u'But also ontology engineering needs models to describe the underlying discourse of universe .', u'For this reason , it is the papers goal to examine and compare the Resource Event Agent Model ( REA ) with respect to semantic quality , model effectiveness , and -efficiency in data modeling for ontologies .', u'Moreover , the paper addresses the research question , if REA enables an effective modeling to reduce the precision deficit and complexity in BPM .']

entities: [[(u'ontological specifications', u'Method'), (u'deployed ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'methodologies', u'Generic'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task')], [(u'negative constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u"ontology 's deductive potential", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'cognitively advantageous methodology', u'Method'), (u'missing negative constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Possible World Explorer ( PEW )', u'Method'), (u'navigation paths', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pizza ontology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'methodologies', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology engineering')], [(u'they', u'USED-FOR', u"ontology 's deductive potential")], [(u'cognitively advantageous methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'missing negative constraints')], [], [(u'pizza ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'navigation paths')]]
sentences: [u'With the persistent deployment of ontological specifications in practice and the increasing size of the deployed ontologies , methodologies for ontology engineering are becoming more and more important .', u"In particular , the specification of negative constraints is often neglected by the human expert , whereas they are crucial for increasing an ontology 's deductive potential .", u'We propose a novel , arguably cognitively advantageous methodology for identifying and adding missing negative constraints to an existing ontology .', u'To this end , a domain expert navigates through the space of satisfiable class expressions with the aim of finding absurd ones , which then can be forbidden by adding a respective constraint to the ontology .', u'We give the formal foundations of our approach , provide an implementation , called Possible World Explorer ( PEW ) and illustrate its usability by describing prototypical navigation paths using the example of the well-known pizza ontology .']

entities: [[(u'company-specific terminology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'corporate ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology engineering techniques', u'Method'), (u'conceptual mismatch', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'folksonomies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'flat bottom-up taxonomies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'lightweight corporate ontology', u'Method'), (u'corporate folksonomy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'folksonomy dataset', u'Material'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'company-specific terminology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'corporate folksonomy', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'folksonomies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'flat bottom-up taxonomies')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'lightweight corporate ontology')]]
sentences: [u'Companies use company-specific terminology that may differ from the terminology used in existing corporate ontologies ( e.g .', u'Tove ) and therefore need their own ontology .', u'However , the current ontology engineering techniques are time-consuming and there exists a conceptual mismatch among developers and users .', u"In contrast , folksonomies or the flat bottom-up taxonomies constituted by web users ' tags are rapidly created .", u'In this paper , ( 1 ) we present an approach that cost-efficiently derives a lightweight corporate ontology from a corporate folksonomy , ( 2 ) by means of a folksonomy dataset from a European company , we provide preliminary evidence that our suggested approach reflects the company-specific terminology , ( 3 ) we detect a number of possible applications for the company when implementing the presented methodology on a corporate folksonomy and ( 4 ) as an additional evaluation , we asked the company to briefly evaluate the results and possible applications .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'design semantics'), (u'product models', u'USED-FOR', u'design semantics'), (u'data semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'heterogeneous information sharing')], [(u'STEP based interoperability standard', u'PART-OF', u'method'), (u'STEP based interoperability standard', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology engineering'), (u'ontology engineering', u'PART-OF', u'method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'CONJUNCTION', u'object-oriented product modeling'), (u'object-oriented product modeling', u'PART-OF', u'method')], [(u'semantics', u'FEATURE-OF', u'object-based representations'), (u'object-based representations', u'USED-FOR', u'modeling of product data'), (u'supplementary design information', u'CONJUNCTION', u'supplementary design information'), (u'supplementary design information', u'CONJUNCTION', u'domain ontology development'), (u'domain ontology development', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantics-driven schema mapping')], [(u'software prototype', u'USED-FOR', u'method')]]
sentences: [u'A challenge in effective sharing of product information in collaborative design is the lack of explicit and compatible semantics in the product digital content .', u'Substantial difficulties arise in understanding and interpreting the intended meaning of product data across collaborating design teams and applications .', u'This paper presents a method to capture design semantics with product models for more consistent representation , understanding and interpretation of data semantics to support heterogeneous information sharing .', u'The method incorporates the STEP based interoperability standard , ontology engineering , and object-oriented product modeling to capture and share the semantically interoperable product information .', u'It focuses on : modeling of product data with additional semantics in object-based representations ; extension of STEP with supplementary design information ; domain ontology development ; and semantics-driven schema mapping .', u'A software prototype has been implemented to validate the method and tested with case studies.Copyright 2006 by ASME']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Desktop paradigm', u'Method'), (u'cold-start problem', u'Task')], [(u'empty models', u'Method'), (u'semantic technology', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'world-known concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'personal models', u'Method')], [(u'email database', u'Material'), (u'empty PIMO', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Stiftung Rheinland-Pfalz fur Innovation', u'Method')], []]
sentences: [u'Although the Semantic Desktop paradigm has great potential , new users have to face the cold-start problem .', u'Having to start with empty models is a barrier to any semantic technology and filling them with world-known concepts does not work for personal models .', u'We propose to analyze the email database of a user and extract concepts of multiple types to fill the empty PIMO .', u'The paper presents results of the research project Semopad funded by the Stiftung Rheinland-Pfalz fur Innovation under contract no .', u'961-386261/1001 .']

sentences: [u'The concept of Linked Data has appeared recently in order to allow publishing data on the Web in a more suitable form enabling automated processing by programs and not only by human users .', u'Linked Data are based primarily on RDF triples , which are also modeled as graph data .', u'Despite the research effort in recent years , several questions in the area of Linked Data indexing and querying remain open , not only since the amount of Linked Data globally available significantly increases each year .', u'Our ongoing research effort should result in a proposal of a new querying system dealing with several disadvantages of the existing approaches identified in our previous work .', u'They are especially related to data scaling , dynamicity and distribution .']

sentences: [u'This paper contributes to the understanding of challenges related to publishing and consuming public sector information using Linked Data tools .', u'Linked Data paradigm has opened new possibilities and perspectives for the process of collecting and monitoring socio-economic indicators .', u'Due to multi- dimensionality of the statistical data , in order to ensure efficient exploration and analysis , hierarchical data structures are needed for modeling the space and time dimensions .', u'This paper presents several illustrative examples of modeling , analyzing and visualization of Linked Data from Serbian government bodies .', u'The approach utilizes tools from the Linked Data stack , as well as the first pro- totype of the Exploratory Spatio-Temporal Analysis component that has been developed in the GeoKnow project framework .']

sentences: [u"Systems , methods , and apparatus are herein disclosed for prefetching node data of a linked data structure into a processor 's cache so as to decrease linked data structure traversal latency .", u'In particular , as the linked data structure is created or modified , forward and reverse prefetch nodes are identified and links identifying locations of these nodes are written to nodes that will be traversed N nodes prior to the prefetch nodes .', u"Once the linked data structure has been created , traversals of the structure use the prefetch links to prefetch node data into the processor cache , so that when traversal reaches a node , that node 's data is read from processor cache rather than from memory ."]

entities: [[(u'Linked Data technologies', u'Method'), (u'databases', u'Generic'), (u'global data space', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data technologies', u'Method'), (u'media and pharmaceutical industry', u'Material'), (u'global Web of Data', u'Material')], [(u'theWeb of Data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data applications', u'Task'), (u'data space', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'data integration costs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data publishers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data consumers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'global-scale data integration', u'Task')], []]
relations: [[], [(u'US and UK governments', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'data providers')], [(u'theWeb of Data', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data applications')], [(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'data integration costs'), (u'data publishers', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data consumers'), (u'data consumers', u'CONJUNCTION', u'third parties')], []]
sentences: [u'Linked Data technologies provide for setting links between records in distinct databases and thus to connect these databases into a global data space .', u'Over the last years , Linked Data technologies have been adopted by an increasing number of data providers , including the US and UK governments as well as mayor players in the media and pharmaceutical industry , leading to the creation of a global Web of Data .', u'In his talk , Prof. Christian Bizer will give an overview of theWeb of Data as well as the architecture of Linked Data applications that work on top of this data space .', u'Afterwards , he will discuss how the openness and self-descriptiveness of Linked Data provide for splitting data integration costs between data publishers , data consumers and third parties and thus might enable global-scale data integration in an evolutionary , pay-as-yougo fashion .', u'He will close with an overview of the research challenges that the Linked Data community currently faces .']

entities: [[(u'controlled vocabularies of linked data', u'Material'), (u'archive catalogues', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'AIM25 aggregation service', u'Task'), (u'historical mapping specialists', u'Method'), (u'Historypin', u'Material'), (u'widespread professional adoption of linked data', u'Task')], [(u'linked data', u'Material'), (u'archivists', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'archivists', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'AIM25 aggregation service', u'CONJUNCTION', u'historical mapping specialists')], [(u'linked data', u'USED-FOR', u'archivists')]]
sentences: [u'This chapter explores the latest trends in the use of linked data in archives , reviewing recent projects that over the last two years have sought to build reliable controlled vocabularies of linked data and develop robust editing and mark-up tools for archive catalogues .', u'It draws on first-hand experience of managing the Step Change project and of collaboration between the AIM25 aggregation service , the historical mapping specialists , Historypin , and the leading archive catalogue software vendor , Axiell , and provides a critical appraisal of the opportunities and challenges of such public-private partnership to facilitate widespread professional adoption of linked data .', u'It argues that the true potential of linked data for archivists lies less in its role as a technology for handling data and more as a renewed opportunity for archivists to flourish both as custodians of their collections and as storytellers , using linked data to build a new relationship of trust and engagement with users and fellow professionals .']

entities: [[(u'multilingual application', u'Task'), (u'linked data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked data', u'Material'), (u'Web of Data', u'Material'), (u'language barrier', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'multilingual application', u'Task'), (u'prototype application', u'Generic'), (u'multilingual knowledge sources', u'Material'), (u'parallel translations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'spreadsheet format', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'application', u'Generic')], [(u'multilingual application', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'linked data', u'USED-FOR', u'multilingual application')], [(u'Linked data', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Web of Data'), (u'Linked data', u'USED-FOR', u'language barrier'), (u'Web of Data', u'USED-FOR', u'language barrier'), (u'data', u'USED-FOR', u'it')], [(u'multilingual knowledge sources', u'USED-FOR', u'prototype application'), (u'parallel translations', u'USED-FOR', u'multilingual knowledge sources'), (u'parallel translations', u'PART-OF', u'spreadsheet format')], [], [(u'linked data', u'USED-FOR', u'multilingual application')]]
sentences: [u'This paper describes development of a multilingual application using the concept of linked data .', u'Linked data is a basis of Web of Data , which has the potential to overcome the language barrier since it focuses on data , not documents described in a natural language .', u'To investigate how the linked data can be applied in a multilingual application , we have developed a prototype application where multilingual knowledge sources are extracted from existing parallel translations represented in the spreadsheet format .', u'This application provides information in four languages in the domain of apartments rented to international students living in Japan .', u'We discuss how the linked data can be made use of in the development of a multilingual application .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'semantic applications', u'Task'), (u'enterprise environment', u'Task'), (u'data integration', u'Task')], [(u'Linked Data integration', u'Task'), (u'integration process', u'Method')], [(u'Linked Data integration', u'Task')], [(u'data fusion', u'Task'), (u'conflict resolution', u'Task'), (u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data fusion', u'Task'), (u'provenance tracking', u'Task'), (u'quality assessment', u'Task'), (u'fused data', u'Material')], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'ODCleanStore framework', u'Method'), (u'real Linked Open Data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'data fusion', u'CONJUNCTION', u'conflict resolution'), (u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'data fusion'), (u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'conflict resolution'), (u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data fusion'), (u'provenance tracking', u'CONJUNCTION', u'quality assessment')], [(u'ODCleanStore framework', u'USED-FOR', u'algorithms')]]
sentences: [u'Linked Data have emerged as a successful publication format and one of its main strengths is its fitness for integration of data from multiple sources .', u'This gives them a great potential both for semantic applications and the enterprise environment where data integration is crucial .', u'Linked Data integration poses new challenges , however , and new algorithms and tools covering all steps of the integration process need to be developed .', u'This paper explores Linked Data integration and its specifics .', u'We focus on data fusion and conflict resolution : two novel algorithms for Linked Data fusion with provenance tracking and quality assessment of fused data are proposed .', u'The algorithms are implemented as part of the ODCleanStore framework and evaluated on real Linked Open Data .']

entities: [[(u'RDFS', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'inconsistency', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'coreferent identifiers', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'scalability', u'Metric'), (u'robustness', u'Metric'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'open-domain corpus', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data documents', u'Material'), (u'reasoning methods', u'Method'), (u'scenarios', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'RDFS', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL')], [(u'scalability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'robustness')], [(u'open-domain corpus', u'USED-FOR', u'methods')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we summarise the lessons learnt from the PhD Thesis Exploiting RDFS and OWL for Integrating Heterogeneous , Large-Scale , Linked Data Corpora where we looked at three use-cases for reasoning over Linked Data : ( i ) translating data between different vocabulary terms ; ( ii ) identifying and repairing noise in the form of inconsistency ; and ( iii ) detecting and processing coreferent identifiers ( identifiers which refer to the same thing ) .', u'We summarise how we overcome the challenges of scalability and robustness faced when reasoning over Linked Data .', u'We validate our methods against an open-domain corpus of 1.1 billion quadruples crawled from 4 million Linked Data documents , discussing the applicability and utility of our reasoning methods in such scenarios .']

entities: [[], [(u'scientific workflows', u'Task'), (u'metadata', u'Generic'), (u'tasks', u'Generic')], [(u'provenance data', u'Material'), (u'scientific workflow executions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'provenance data', u'Material')], [(u'flexibility', u'Metric'), (u'scientific experimentation scenarios', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'declarative models', u'Method')], [(u'declarative model', u'Method'), (u'provenance data', u'Material'), (u'scientific workflows', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain specialist', u'Method')], [(u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'ontology matching', u'Task'), (u'data-intensive strategy', u'Method'), (u'information integration', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Data provenance is the process of managing a collection of metadata that catalogs the origin and history of data .', u'In scientific workflows , this metadata assists scientists and domain specialists in several tasks , including the reproduction of scientific experiments and planning of new scenarios to be experimented .', u'However , the amount of provenance data generated from scientific workflow executions can grow through time , becoming infeasible for scientists to manually evaluate them .', u'Thus , mechanisms for automatically extracting knowledge from provenance data and presenting them to the user are demanding .', u'Due to the diversity and flexibility inherent to scientific experimentation scenarios , declarative models are potentially adequate .', u'In this work , we propose to apply techniques for learning a declarative model from provenance data generated by scientific workflows , from which the domain specialist will be able to plan future scenarios for his/her scientific experiment .', u'The proposed solution is illustrated in a case study of a scientific experiment on ontology matching , which is a data-intensive strategy that is required to solve the problem of information integration in several areas of knowledge .']

entities: [[(u'heterogeneous systems', u'Method')], [(u'Healthcare standards', u'Task'), (u'Electronic Health Record ( EHR ) system', u'Task')], [(u'problems', u'Generic'), (u'data interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'EHR system', u'Method')], [(u'semantic data interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data level heterogeneity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'accuracy', u'Metric'), (u'mapping', u'Task'), (u'heterogeneous healthcare standards model', u'Method')], [(u'data interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology matching', u'Method'), (u'accurate mapping file', u'Material'), (u'clinical message conversion', u'Task')], [(u'HL7 and openEHR standards ontological mappings', u'Method')], [(u'HL7 and openEHR models', u'Method'), (u'realization level', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'mappings', u'Method'), (u'health information sharing', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Healthcare standards', u'USED-FOR', u'Electronic Health Record ( EHR ) system')], [], [], [(u'accuracy', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'system')], [(u'accurate mapping file', u'USED-FOR', u'clinical message conversion')], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'health information sharing')]]
sentences: [u'Resolving heterogeneities between data and processes paves the way for interoperability between different heterogeneous systems .', u'Healthcare standards provide the base for interoperability between different Electronic Health Record ( EHR ) system .', u"The problems related to data interoperability arise when two EHR system 's are complaint to heterogeneous healthcare standards and want to communicate with each other .", u'To achieve semantic data interoperability , there is need to resolve data level heterogeneity .', u'In this paper , we propose system that enable high level of accuracy of mapping between heterogeneous healthcare standards model .', u'The broader goal of data interoperability is achieved when these heterogeneities are resolved through ontology matching and generation of accurate mapping file , that helps in clinical message conversion from one standard to another .', u'To justify claim we investigate HL7 and openEHR standards ontological mappings .', u'We will discuss transformation of HL7 and openEHR models at high level and instance transformation at the realization level .', u'The proposed approach provides accurate mappings that enables timely health information sharing among different healthcare systems to provide better healthcare to patients .']

entities: [[(u'automatic ontology matching', u'Task')], [(u'precision', u'Metric'), (u'recall', u'Metric')], [], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'machine learning techniques', u'Method')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic')], []]
relations: [[], [(u'precision', u'CONJUNCTION', u'recall')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Despite serious research efforts , automatic ontology matching still suffers from severe problems with respect to the quality of matching results .', u'Existing matching systems trade-off precision and recall and have their specific strengths and weaknesses .', u'This leads to problems when the right matcher for a given task has to be selected .', u'In this paper , we present a method for improving matching results by not choosing a specific matcher but applying machine learning techniques on an ensemble of matchers .', u'Hereby we learn rules for the correctness of a correspondence based on the output of different matchers and additional information about the nature of the elements to be matched , thus leveraging the weaknesses of an individual matcher .', u'We show that our method always performs significantly better than the median of the matchers used and in most cases outperforms the best matcher with an optimal threshold for a given pair of ontologies .', u'As a side product of our experiments , we discovered that the majority vote is a simple but powerful heuristic for combining matchers that almost reaches the quality of our learning results .']

entities: [[(u'semantic data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Open Data', u'Material'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'automated exploration of data sets', u'Task')], [(u'visualization techniques', u'Method')], [(u'automated ontology matching techniques', u'Method'), (u'LOD visualization platforms', u'Method')], [(u'integrated approach', u'Method'), (u'LOD exploration', u'Task')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Existing visualization techniques', u'Method')], [(u'time and space efficient techniques', u'Method'), (u'unknown LOD data', u'Material'), (u'automated visualization', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'As the size of semantic data available as Linked Open Data ( LOD ) increases , the demand for methods for automated exploration of data sets grows as well .', u'A data consumer needs to search for data sets meeting his interest and look into them using suitable visualization techniques to check whether the data sets are useful or not .', u'In the recent years , particular advances have been made in the field , e.g. , automated ontology matching techniques or LOD visualization platforms .', u'However , an integrated approach to LOD exploration is still missing .', u'On the scale of the whole web , the current approaches allow a user to discover data sets using keywords or manually through large data catalogs .', u'Existing visualization techniques presume that a data set # R # # N # # R # # N # is of an expected type and structure .', u'The aim of this position paper is to show the need for time and space efficient techniques for discovery of previously unknown LOD data sets on the base of a consumers interest and their automated visualization which we address in our ongoing work']

entities: [[(u'ontology matching', u'Task')], [(u'graph representation', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'node', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'lexical similarity of the ancestors', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'lexical similarity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'lexical analysis', u'Method')], [(u'graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'fast response time', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'graph representation', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies'), (u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'schemas')], [], [(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'graphs')], [], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'algorithm')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we present a new way towards ontology matching .', u'Using the graph representation for ontologies and schemas we proceed to calculate the weights for each node of the graph using the lexical similarity of the ancestors .', u'With the guiding intuition that , if the parent nodes match then their children are likely to match as well .', u'This simple observation helps on to build a fast and efficient algorithm for matching different graphs ( which represent ontology or schema ) .', u'Since the algorithm is very fast it can be used as a quickly and dirty method to do initial matching of a large dataset and then drill down to the exact match with other algorithms .', u'The algorithm is not dependent on the method used for calculating the lexical similarity so the best lexical analysis can be used to derive the weights .', u'Once the weights are in place we can calculate the matching in just a single traversal of the graphs .', u'No other algorithm that we know of can give such fast response time .']

entities: [[(u'P2P systems', u'Method'), (u'query initiators', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information providers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology matching', u'Method'), (u'schema mappings', u'Method')], [(u'Information exchange', u'Task')], [(u'information exchange', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic vectors', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'query expansion step', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"query initiator 's side", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query interpretation step', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'unshared concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'documents wrt', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'method', u'Generic')], []]
relations: [[(u'query initiators', u'CONJUNCTION', u'information providers'), (u'ontology matching', u'CONJUNCTION', u'schema mappings'), (u'schema mappings', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic interoperability')], [], [], [(u'semantic vectors', u'USED-FOR', u'queries')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In P2P systems where query initiators and information providers do not necessarily share the same ontology , semantic interoperability generally relies on ontology matching or schema mappings .', u"Information exchange is then not only enabled by the established correspondences ( the `` shared '' parts of the ontologies ) but , in some sense , limited to them .", u"Then , to what extent the `` unshared '' parts can also contribute to and improve information exchange ?", u'In this paper , we address this question by considering a system where documents and queries are represented by semantic vectors .', u"We propose a specific query expansion step at the query initiator 's side and a query interpretation step at the document provider 's .", u'Through these steps , unshared concepts contribute to evaluate the relevance of documents wrt .', u'a given query .', u'Our experiments show that our method enables to correctly evaluate the relevance of a document even if concepts of a query are not shared .', u'In some cases , we are able to find up to 90 % of the documents that would be selected when all the central concepts are shared .']

entities: [[(u'structured data', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'practices', u'Generic'), (u'global data space', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web of Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'these', u'Generic')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'Web of Data', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'The term Linked Data refers to a set of best practices for publishing and connecting structured data on the Web .', u'These best practices have been adopted by an increasing number of data providers over the last three years , leading to the creation of a global data space containing billions of assertions the Web of Data .', u'In this article , the authors present the concept and technical principles of Linked Data , and situate these within the broader context of related technological developments .', u'They describe progress to date in publishing Linked Data on the Web , review applications that have been developed to exploit the Web of Data , and map out a research agenda for the Linked Data community as it moves forward .']

sentences: [u'The Linked Data effort has been focusing on how to publish open data sets on the Web , and it has had great results .', u'However , mechanisms for updating linked data sources have been neglected in research .', u'We propose a structure for Linked Data resources into named graphs , connected through hyperlinks and self described with light metadata , that is a natural match for using standard HTTP methods to implement application-specific ( high-level ) public update APIs .']

entities: [[(u'information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'semantic search', u'Task')], [(u'semantic meanings', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web documents', u'Material')], [(u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'smart semantic search engine', u'Task')], [(u'keyword allocation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data model', u'Method')], [(u'smart search engine', u'Method'), (u'efficiency problem', u'Task'), (u'web searching', u'Task'), (u'statistical method', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic level', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'joint keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'keyword list', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'meaning structure', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'data model', u'Method'), (u'keyword list', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'smart search engine', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'This project addresses the main research problem in information retrieval and semantic search .', u'It proposes the smart search theory as new theory based on hypothesis that semantic meanings of a document can be described by a set of # R # # N # keywords .', u'With two experiments designed and carried out in this project , the experiment result demonstrates positive evidence that meet the smart search theory. # R # # N # # R # # N # In the theory proposed in this project , the smart search aims to determine a set of keywords for any web documents , by which the semantic meanings of the documents can be uniquely identified .', u'Meanwhile , the size of the set of keywords is supposed to be small enough which can be easily managed .', u'This is the fundamental assumption for creating the smart semantic search engine .', u'In this project , the rationale of the assumption and the theory based on it will be discussed , as well as the processes of how the theory can be applied to the keyword allocation and the data model to be # R # # N # generated .', u'Then the design of the smart search engine will be proposed , in order to create a solution to the efficiency problem while searching among huge amount of increasing information published on the web. # R # # N # # R # # N # To achieve high efficiency in web searching , statistical method is proved to be an effective way and it can be interpreted from the semantic level .', u'Based on the frequency of joint keywords , the keyword list can be generated and linked to each other to form a meaning structure .', u'A data model is built when a proper keyword list is achieved and the model is applied to the design of the smart search engine .']

entities: [[(u'browsable RDF data', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'editor', u'Method'), (u'graph view', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'table- and outline-based Linked Data browsers', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'A wealth of information has recently become available as browsable RDF data on the Web , but the selection of client applications to interact with this Linked Data remains limited .', u'We show how to browse Linked Data with Fenfire , a Free and Open Source Software RDF browser and editor that employs a graph view and focuses on an engaging and interactive browsing experience .', u'This sets Fenfire apart from previous table- and outline-based Linked Data browsers .']

sentences: [u'ABSTRACT Objectives To describe : ( 1 ) a stepwise guide to the use of linked data in the development of individual healthcare performance metrics ; and ( 2 ) the application of these metrics in comprehensive performance assessment efforts at a system , regional and hospital level of analysis .', u'Approach A stepwise guide to the definition and validation of linked-data based indicators was developed following a rapid review of peer reviewed and grey literature and a series of semi-structured interviews with international subject experts .', u'The review and interviews adopted a snowball approach to collect information on the ways in which linked data are currently used in performance measurement efforts .', u'Data collection continued until indicator type saturation was reached .', u'Details about existing applications of linked data in performance reporting were mapped , and used to inform the development of the guide .', u'Indicators were aligned within a conceptual framework that is used to assess healthcare performance in New South Wales , on the basis of accessibility , appropriateness , effectiveness , efficiency , equity and sustainability .', u'Results The guide to indicator development considers the use and contribution of linked data in four stages : defining a cohort ; capturing outcomes of interest ; risk adjustment ; and attribution .', u'A series of vignettes illustrate the various contributions that linked data can make to performance measurement efforts highlighting the ways in which those data can enhance understanding of complexity and dynamic relationships , and help build a comprehensive picture of performance .', u'# R # # N # Conclusion In performance measurement efforts internationally , linked data are used to strengthen the reliability , accuracy and precision of individual metrics and to inform efforts to assess various dimensions of healthcare performance .', u'In New South Wales , linked data underpin publicly reported performance measures and have the potential to provide in the future whole-of-government and whole-of-system perspectives on health .']

sentences: [u'Keris is a typical traditional weapon from Indonesian culture that has # N # been recognized by UNESCO ( United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural # N # Organization ) as Masterpiece of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity. # N # Many museums in Indonesia also collect various kinds of keris , but information # N # about keris is still quite difficult to be obtained , because many discussions about # N # keris are generally written in book , or spreading through word of mouth , there # N # were also some webs or blogs talking about some keris but the information data is # N # unstructured and represented in hypertext form so it is difficult to reuse the data # N # The method used in this research to build kerisiologi data is using the # N # linked data model , where data are presented not only just from one source but # N # from various relevant sources linked on kerisologi .', u'In publishing the kerisiologi # N # data as the linked data was conducted mapping to the existing data in # N # database and data available from other sources by linking URI in any data has # N # been determined .', u'To represent each data and relation in mapping was established # N # vocabularies that appropriate with kerisologi topic .', u'In the mapping process was # N # used D2RQ Mapping to implement mapping becomes the linked data form. # N # The results of tests was performed to the kerisiologi linked data in # N # addition to successfully publish the data as linked data was also capable of # N # integrating a relevant data of kerisologi data from various linked data # N # sources .', u'Besides that the system can display data of kerisiologi linked data in # N # web applications along with data has been linked to various sources. # N # Keywords : Linked data , Kerisologi , metadata , RDF , D2R Server , D2RQ # N # Mapping .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Tim Berners-Lees 4 rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'World Wide Web', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'architectural style', u'Method'), (u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'technology', u'Generic')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'application integration architectural styles', u'Method')], [(u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'IBM', u'Method'), (u'Application Lifecycle Management', u'Task'), (u'Integration System Management', u'Task'), (u'read/write Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'application integration problems', u'Task')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'World Wide Web infrastructure', u'Material'), (u'application integration approaches', u'Method')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'enterprise applications', u'Task')], [(u'usage patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'W3C standards', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data Basic Profile', u'Material')], [(u'techniques', u'Generic'), (u'linked data', u'Material'), (u'HTTP POST', u'Method'), (u'HTTP GET', u'Method'), (u'Atom Publishing Protocol', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Application Lifecycle Management', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Integration System Management'), (u'read/write Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'application integration problems')], [(u'Linked Data', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'World Wide Web infrastructure')], [(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'enterprise applications')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Linked Data , as defined by Tim Berners-Lees 4 rules [ 1 ] , has enjoyed considerable well-publicized success as a technology for publishing data in the World Wide Web [ 2 ] .', u'The Rational group in IBM has for several years been employing a read/write usage of Linked Data as an architectural style for integrating a suite of applications , and we have shipped commercial products using this technology .', u'We have found that this read/write usage of Linked Data has helped us solve several perennial problems that we had been unable to successfully solve with other application integration architectural styles that we have explored in the past .', u'The applications we have integrated in IBM are primarily in the domains of Application Lifecycle Management ( ALM ) and Integration System Management ( ISM ) , but we believe that our experiences using read/write Linked Data to solve application integration problems could be broadly relevant and applicable within the IT industry .', u'This paper explains why Linked Data , which builds on the existing World Wide Web infrastructure , presents some unique characteristics , such as being distributed and scalable , that may allow the industry to succeed where other application integration approaches have failed .', u'It discusses lessons we have learned along the way and some of the challenges we have been facing in using Linked Data to integrate enterprise applications .', u'Finally , we discuss several areas that could benefit from additional standard work and discuss several commonly applicable usage patterns along with proposals on how to address them using the existing W3C standards in the form of a Linked Data Basic Profile .', u'This includes techniques applicable to clients and servers that read and write linked data , a type of container that allows new resources to be created using HTTP POST and existing resources to be found using HTTP GET ( analogous to things like Atom Publishing Protocol ( APP ) [ 3 ] ) .']

sentences: [u'We present an ODCleanStore framework ( 1 ) enabling management of Linked Data on the Web and ( 2 ) providing web applications with a possibility to consume cleaned and integrated Linked Data according to their needs .']

sentences: [u'To meet the demand of the higher precision ratio and recall ratio of service search , a method of Web service discovery is proposed based on ontology evolution and Web service migration .', u'According to the developed cloud service platform and the existed service repository and domain ontology list , a service migration process is proposed which migrate to the cloud platform and implement unified management for Web service .', u'This process effectively achieves that Web services migrate in and out of the cloud platform .', u'In order to realize the self-evolution of domain ontology , an ontology alignment mechanism is designed to automatic extend and replace of ontology concept .', u'This mechanism achieves the integration of different keywords with the same meaning and ensures the consistency of ontology concept .', u'In this paper , the method not only enables efficient service discovery and dynamic service management , but also can achieve high concurrency support of services and supply or billing on demand .', u'The experiments show that the proposed method solves the search problem of low efficiency based on keyword , and it effectively improves the precision ratio and recall ratio of service discovery .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Life Sciences', u'Task'), (u'interoperable data commons', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'discovery', u'Task')], [(u'Minimum Information Checklists', u'Method'), (u'Life Sciences', u'Method')], [(u'Existing tooling', u'Generic'), (u'checklists', u'Generic')], [(u'checklists', u'Generic')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'minimum information checklists', u'Method')], [(u'MIM framework', u'Method'), (u'minimum information checklists', u'Method'), (u'RDF', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'checklists', u'Generic'), (u'wild Linked Data', u'Material')], [], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'checklist', u'Generic'), (u'Chemical Structure Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'Life Sciences'), (u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'interoperable data commons')], [(u'Minimum Information Checklists', u'PART-OF', u'Life Sciences')], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Linked Data holds great promise in the Life Sciences as a platform to enable an interoperable data commons , supporting new opportunities for discovery .', u'Minimum Information Checklists have emerged within the Life Sciences as a means of standardising the reporting of experiments in an effort to increase the quality and reusability of the reported data .', u'Existing tooling built around these checklists is aimed at supporting experimental scientists in the production of experiment reports that are compliant .', u'It remains a challenge to quickly and easily assess an arbitrary set of data against these checklists .', u'We present the MIM ( Minimum Information Model ) vocabulary and framework which aims to provide a practical , and scalable approach to describing and assessing Linked Data against minimum information checklists .', u'The MIM framework aims to support three core activities : ( 1 ) publishing well described minimum information checklists in RDF as Linked Data ; ( 2 ) publishing Linked Data against these checklists ; and ( 3 ) validating existing in the wild Linked Data against a published checklist .', u'We discuss the design considerations of the vocabulary and present its main classes .', u'We demonstrate the utility of the framework with a checklist designed for the publishing of Chemical Structure Linked Data using data extracted from Wikipedia as an example .']

sentences: [u'Linked Data brings the promise of incorporating a new dimension to the Web where the availability of Web-scale data can determine a paradigmatic transformation of the Web and its applications .', u'However , together with its opportunities , Linked Data brings inherent challenges in the way users and applications consume the available data .', u'Users consuming Linked Data on the Web , or on corporate intranets , should be able to search and query data spread over potentially a large number of heterogeneous , complex and distributed datasets .', u'Ideally , a query mechanism for Linked Data should abstract users from the representation of data .', u'This work focuses on the investigation of a vocabulary independent natural language query mechanism for Linked Data , using an approach based on the combination of entity search , a Wikipediabased semantic relatedness measure and spreading activation .', u'The combination of these three elements in a query mechanism for Linked Data is a new contribution in the space .', u'Wikipedia-based relatedness measures address existing limitations of existing works which are based on similarity measures/term expansion based on WordNet .', u'Experimental results using the query mechanism to answer 50 natural language queries over DBPedia achieved a mean reciprocal rank of 61.4 % , an average precision of 48.7 % and average recall of 57.2 % , answering 70 % of the queries .']

sentences: [u'Facilitating information exchange is a crucial service for ontology-based knowledge systems .', u'This can be achieved by the mapping of two heterogenous ontologies .', u'Many mapping frameworks utilize language-based knowledge resources such as WordNet .', u'By coupling all ontology concepts to a corresponding entry in WordNet , one can quantify the lexical relatedness of any two ontology concepts .', u'However , coupling the correct entry is a difficult task due to the ambiguous nature of names .', u'Coupling the wrong entries hence yields similarity values that do not correctly express the relatedness of two given concepts , resulting in a poor performance of the overall mapping framework .', u'This paper proposes an approach for the more accurate coupling of ontology concepts with their corresponding WordNet entries .', u'The basis of the proposed approach is the creation of separate virtual documents representing the different ontology concepts and WordNet entries and coupling these according to their document similarities .', u'The extent of improvements using this approach are evaluated using a data set originating from the Ontology Alignment Evaluation Initiative ( OAEI ) .', u'Furthermore , the performance of a framework using our approach is demonstrated using the results of the OAEI 2011 competition .']

relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'unsatisfiable concepts', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic defects'), (u'unsatisfiable concepts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'inconsistent ontologies'), (u'inconsistent ontologies', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic defects')], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Developing ontologies is not an easy task and often the resulting ontologies are not consistent or complete .', u'Such ontologies , although often useful , also lead to problems when used in semantically-enabled applications .', u'Wrong conclusions may be derived or valid conclusions may be missed .', u'To deal with this problem we may want to repair the ontologies .', u'Up to date most work has been performed on finding and repairing the semantic defects such as unsatisfiable concepts and inconsistent ontologies .', u'In this paper we tackle the problem of repairing modeling defects and in particular , the repairing of structural relations ( is-a hierarchy ) in the ontologies .', u'We study the case where missing is-a relations are given .', u'We define the notion of a structural repair and develop algorithms to compute repairing actions that would allow deriving the missing is-a relations in the repaired ontology .', u'Further , we define preferences between repairs .', u'We also look at how we can use external knowledge to recommend repairing actions to a domain expert .', u'Further , we discuss an implemented prototype and its use as well as an experiment using the ontologies of the Anatomy track of the Ontology Alignment Evaluation Initiative .']

sentences: [u'An ontology is a formal representation of a domain modeling the entities in the domain and their relations .', u'When a domain is represented by multiple ontologies , there is a need for creating mappings among these ontologies in order to facilitate the integration of data annotated with and reasoning across these ontologies .', u'The objective of this paper is to present our experience in aligning two medium-size anatomical ontologies and to reflect on some of the issues and challenges encountered along the way .', u'The anatomical ontologies under investigation are the Adult Mouse Anatomy ( MA ) and the anatomy subset of the NCI Thesaurus ( NCI ) .', u'We also use the Foundational Model of Anatomy as a reference ontology .', u'We present a hybrid alignment strategy for anatomical entities , combining direct and indirect alignment techniques , both supported by the NLM Anatomy Ontology Alignment System ( AOAS ) .', u'Overall , the hybrid strategy combining direct and indirect alignment techniques identified 1,338 matches between MA and NCI , accounting for about 49 % of all MA concepts and 41 % of all NCI concepts .', u'1,007 matches are shared by both alignments , leaving 277 matches specific to the direct alignment and 54 specific to the indirect alignment .']

sentences: [u'Normal 0 false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE This paper describes a novel approach to realize symbiotic ecologies within Next Generation Ambient Intelligent Environments ( NGAIEs ) .', u'The proposed approach comprises novel ontology and agent technologies allowing for adaptation on a variety of levels .', u'The metaphor of symbiotic ecologies reflects a meaningful integration of relevant entities ( i.e. , services , devices , agents ) and information within NGAIEs to accomplish a specific users task by relying on the symbiotic relationship of the user and his/her intelligent environment .', u'We adopt a service-oriented architecture , combined with ( a ) intelligent agents that support task realization and enhanced human-machine interaction and ( b ) ontologies that provide knowledge representation , management of heterogeneity at user and device level , semantically rich resource discovery and adaptation using ontology alignment mechanisms .', u'In this article , we analyse heterogeneity concerning user behaviour and adaptive user interaction modelling .', u'Furthermore , we focus on heterogeneity regarding the representation of the states of entities and their availability over different networks .', u'The paper will also report on the deployment of a system prototype in a real world AIE which is the intelligent flat ( iSpace ) at the University of Essex .']

entities: [[(u'heterogeneity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'multi- viewpoints ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'application domain', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'multi-viewpoints ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed and heterogeneous knowledge re- sources', u'Material')], [(u'techniques', u'Generic'), (u'heterogeneity problems', u'Task'), (u'multi-viewpoints ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'multi-viewpoints ontology alignment', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic')], [(u'lit- erature', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alignment systems', u'Method'), (u'systems', u'Generic')], [(u'alignment process', u'Task')], [(u'multi- viewpoints ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multi- viewpoints ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'description logics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'stamping mechanism', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'heterogeneity', u'FEATURE-OF', u'ontology')], [(u'multi- viewpoints ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'heterogeneous organizations')], [], [(u'techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'heterogeneity problems')], [], [], [], [(u'stamping mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'multi- viewpoints ontology'), (u'stamping mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'description logics')]]
sentences: [u'In the last few years , a lot of effort has been paid to support both consensus and heterogeneity in the same ontology .', u'As a result , multi- viewpoints ontologies have become essential for heterogeneous organizations and for diverse user communities that need to share and exchange information in an application domain .', u'The development of multi-viewpoints ontologies by different communities makes distributed and heterogeneous knowledge re- sources not accessible .', u'So , to solve this problem and in order to support users in sharing and reusing vocabularies and knowledge , we need for techniques for solving heterogeneity problems between different multi-viewpoints ontologies .', u'In this case , multi-viewpoints ontology alignment is required to provide a con- sensual understanding of that domain represented by these ontologies .', u'In the lit- erature , there are much alignment systems , but existing systems are not capable to support multiple viewpoints .', u'So , our challenge is to introduce the notion of multiple viewpoints in the alignment process .', u'Therefore , in order to align multi- viewpoints ontologies , we present in this paper first , the definition of multi- viewpoints ontology in description logics extended by a stamping mechanism , and then we deal with their alignment problems and definitions .']

sentences: [u'Background : With the increased use of ontologies and ontology mappings in semantically-enabled applications such as ontology-based search and data integration , the issue of detecting and repairing defects in ontologies and ontology mappings has become increasingly important .', u'These defects can lead to wrong or incomplete results for the applications .', u'Results : We propose a unified framework for debugging the is-a structure of and mappings between taxonomies , the most used kind of ontologies .', u'We present theory and algorithms as well as an implemented system RepOSE , that supports a domain expert in detecting and repairing missing and wrong is-a relations and mappings .', u'We also discuss two experiments performed by domain experts : an experiment on the Anatomy ontologies from the Ontology Alignment Evaluation Initiative , and a debugging session for the Swedish National Food Agency .', u'Conclusions : Semantically-enabled applications need high quality ontologies and ontology mappings .', u'One key aspect is the detection and removal of defects in the ontologies and ontology mappings .', u'Our system RepOSE provides an environment that supports domain experts to deal with this issue .', u'We have shown the usefulness of the approach in two experiments by detecting and repairing circa 200 and 30 defects , respectively .']

entities: [[(u'ArchiMate modelling language', u'Method'), (u'business processes', u'Material'), (u'actors', u'Material'), (u'business units', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'software applications', u'Task')], [(u'value exchange perspective', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'business processes', u'Method'), (u'value perspective', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'value modelling', u'Task'), (u'transaction patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DEMO methodology', u'Method')], [(u'ontology alignment techniques', u'Method'), (u'meta models', u'Method'), (u'DEMO', u'Material')], [(u'step-wise approach', u'Method'), (u'model transformation', u'Generic'), (u'transformation', u'Generic')], [(u'DEMO', u'Method')], [(u'software tool', u'Method'), (u'transformation approach', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'The ArchiMate modelling language provides a coherent and a holistic view of an enterprise in terms of its products , services , business processes , actors , business units , software applications and more .', u'Yet , ArchiMate currently lacks ( 1 ) expressivity in modelling an enterprise from a value exchange perspective , and ( 2 ) rigour and guidelines in modelling business processes that realize the transactions relevant from a value perspective .', u'To address these issues , we show how to connect e $ $ ^ { 3 } $ $ value , a technique for value modelling , to ArchiMate via transaction patterns from the DEMO methodology .', u'Using ontology alignment techniques , we show a transformation between the meta models underlying e $ $ ^ { 3 } $ $ value , DEMO and ArchiMate .', u'Furthermore , we present a step-wise approach that shows how this model transformation is achieved and , in doing so , we also show the of such a transformation .', u'We exemplify the transformation of DEMO and e $ $ ^ { 3 } $ $ value into ArchiMate by means of a case study in the insurance industry .', u'As a proof of concept , we present a software tool supporting our transformation approach .', u'Finally , we discuss the functionalities and limitations of our approach ; thereby , we analyze its and practical applicability .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic-based tools')], [(u'solution', u'USED-FOR', u'XML-RDF semantic integration'), (u'solution', u'USED-FOR', u'Ontology Alignment'), (u'semantic similarity measure', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF'), (u'semantic similarity measure', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF labelled directed graphs')], [(u'restricted web interfaces', u'USED-FOR', u'autonomous data sources')]]
sentences: [u'Data integration is the process of facilitating the access to data residing at multiple heterogeneous data sources , and providing users and applications with a unified view of these data .', u'Data integration is crucial in enterprises that store and exchange data in disparate and incompatible formats , and is one of the big challenges of the World Wide Web , where millions of heterogeneous data sources are available .', u'This book contributes to different aspects of the design of modern data integration systems in the context of the Web .', u'On one hand , the work contributes to the Semantic Integration research trend , which refers to the problem of reconciling data from autonomous sources using ontologies and other semantic-based tools .', u'The work suggests a novel solution to XML-RDF semantic integration and also contributes to the problem of Ontology Alignment , defining a rigorous and scalable semantic similarity measure for RDF labelled directed graphs .', u'On the other hand , the book suggests a novel solution to the problem of translating a user query ( targeting a logical mediated schema ) , into queries over a set of autonomous data sources provided with restricted web interfaces .']

entities: [[(u'information sharing', u'Task'), (u'geospatial applications', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'fully automatic alignment methods', u'Method'), (u'graph structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alignment', u'Task'), (u'semantic correspondences', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'geospatial ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'precision', u'Metric'), (u'recall', u'Metric'), (u'Similarity Flooding Algorithm', u'Method')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'greedy approach', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'runtime', u'Metric')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'OAEI competition', u'Metric')]]

sentences: [u'Abstract # R # # N # # R # # N # We consider the problem of enabling interoperability and information sharing among geospatial applications that use ontologies to describe their concepts and the relationships among them .', u'We present two fully automatic alignment methods that use the graph structures of a pair of ontologies to establish their alignment , that is , the semantic correspondences between their concepts .', u'We have tested our methods on geospatial ontologies pertaining to wetlands and four other pairs that belong to a repository that has been used in the Ontology Alignment Evaluation Initiative ( OAEI ) .', u'Using these ontologies , we have compared the effectiveness ( precision and recall ) of our methods against the Similarity Flooding Algorithm that was proposed by others and show that for each of the tested ontologies one of our methods is at least as effective as their method .', u'We have tuned the performance of our methods by introducing a greedy approach that reduces the number of concepts that get compared .', u'This approach reduces runtime by approximately 30 % with a minor compromise to the effectiveness of the results .', u'To further validate our approach , we participated in the OAEI competition to align a pair of ontologies , each with a few thousand concepts .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic relatedness measures', u'Metric')], [(u'ontology alignment', u'Task'), (u'lexical-based relatedness measures', u'Method'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'alignment initiative', u'Metric')], [(u'relatedness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'meronomy-based', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'lexical ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'relatedness measures', u'Metric')], [(u'Key features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'weighted edge measure', u'Metric'), (u'edge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concept probability algorithm', u'Method'), (u'multiset composed of ontology property ranges', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'case-studies', u'Generic'), (u'camera ontology', u'Method'), (u'wine ontology', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Semantic relatedness measures provide a means to determine how closely related two concepts may or may not be .', u'In the area of ontology alignment , many lexical-based relatedness measures have been successfully applied within the realm of domain ontologies .', u'The alignment initiative , however , has not included all measures of relatedness .', u'More generic measures of relatedness , such as meronomy-based , have yet to be established beyond lexical ontologies .', u'This paper introduces an algorithm for measuring meronomic relatedness between concepts within a domain ontology .', u'Specifically , a new method is proposed for measuring how much one concept is part of another in a domain ontology .', u'This is accomplished by utilizing inherent attributes of these ontologies in concert with protocols currently applied in established relatedness measures .', u'Key features of this method include a unique approach to the weighted edge measure , one in which each edge is weighted based on applying a concept probability algorithm to a multiset composed of ontology property ranges .', u'The application of this method is then illustrated with the aid of two case-studies , namely a camera ontology and a wine ontology , and the results are discussed .']

sentences: [u'Temporal features , such as date and time or time of an event , employ concise semantics for any kind of information retrieval , and therefore for linked data information retrieval .', u'However , we have found that most linked data information retrieval techniques pay little attention on the power of temporal feature inclusion .', u'We propose a keyword-based linked data information retrieval framework , called TLDRet , that can incorporate temporal features and give more concise results .', u'Preliminary evaluation of our system shows promising performance .']

sentences: [u'A system and computer program product for transforming a Linked Data graph into a corresponding anonymous Linked Data graph , in which semantics is preserved and links can be followed to expand the anonymous graph up to r times without breaching anonymity ( i.e. , anonymity under r-dereferenceability ) .', u'Anonymizing a Linked Data graph under r-dereferenceability provides privacy guarantees of k-anonymity or l-diversity variants , while taking into account and preserving the rich semantics of the graph .']

sentences: [u'Pervasive environments are characterized by the presence of wireless devices ranging from sensors to mobile PDA-phones to laptops .', u'Peer-to-Peer ( P2P ) information sharing in such environments presents a tremendous opportunity for people and devices to exchange information such as music , pictures , documents and stock tickers with peers .', u'Information that has a monetary value introduces a whole new set of problems for P2P interaction in pervasive environments .', u'In this work , we present the design of a middleware that attempts to solve these problems using concepts of the Contract Net Protocol , Semantic Service Discovery and secure transaction protocols .']

sentences: [u'Information and communication technologies offer great potential for society to quickly adopt e-services for economic and social development .', u'Healthcare activities based on these technologies ( e-health ) are probably the most prominent of these e-services .', u'However , e-health is evolving into such entities as m-health ( mobile ) or u-health ( ubiquitous ) , which focus on applications that provide healthcare to people anywhere , anytime using broadband and wireless mobile technologies .', u"This semantic-service-discovery mechanism considers relevant parts of the organizational context in which e-health services are used , to improve a service-discovery system 's usability in medical emergencies"]

sentences: [u'Many new-style medical treatment systems have been developed .', u'Due to employing various incompatible methods respectively , the most of existing medical systems lack abilities to collaborate with each other .', u'To break the technical barriers and build an open and collaborative medical treatment system , a distributed model , named DM4MTS is represented in this paper .', u'Combining multiple techniques , such as Web service , agent and ontology , the DM4MTS model overcomes difficulties of the dynamic service join , semantic service discovering and matching and medical data transmission .', u'A simulation experiment based on jadex is fulfilled .', u'The results show the feasibility and flexibility of the DM4MTS model .']

sentences: [u'myGrid supports in silico experiments in the life sciences , enabling the design and enactment of workflows as well as providing components to assist service discovery , data and metadata management .', u'The myGrid ontology is one component in a larger semantic discovery framework for the identification of the highly distributed and heterogeneous bioinformatics services in the public domain .', u'From an initial model of formal OWL-DL semantics throughout , we now adopt a spectrum of expressivity and reasoning for different tasks in service annotation and discovery .', u'Here , we discuss the development and use of the myGrid ontology and our experiences in semantic service discovery .']

sentences: [u'Establishing the compatibility of services is an essential prerequisite to service composition .', u'By formally defining the similarity of semantic services , useful information can be obtained about their compatibility .', u'In this paper we propose a metric for measuring the similarity of semantic services annotated with OWL ontology .', u'Similarity is calculated by defining the intrinsic information value of a service description based on the inferencibility of each of OWL Lite constructs .', u'We apply this technique to OWL-S , an emerging standard for defining semantic service metadata and demonstrate how to measure the similarity of OWL-S annotated services .']

sentences: [u'When linked data applications communicate , they commonly use messaging technologies in which the message exchange itself is not represented as linked data , since it takes place on a different architectural level .', u'When a message can not be verified and traced on the linked data level , trust in data is moved from message originators to service providers .', u'However , there are use cases in which the actual message exchange and its verifiability are of importance .', u'In such situations , the separation between application data and communication data is not desirable .', u'To address this , we propose messaging based on linked data , where communicating entities and their messages are represented as interconnected Web resources , and we show how conversations can be made verifiable using digital signatures .']

sentences: [u'This paper describes a mapping of linked data vocabularies in the area of person-related information .', u'Aligning vocabulary terms may help curb the problem of property proliferation that occurs in linked data environments .', u'It also facilitates the process of choosing semantics for vocabulary extensions and integration in the context of linked data applications .', u'Although a work in progress , this investigation would provide support for semantic integration and for knowledge sharing and reuse in the area of personal information representation .', u'It also offers an opportunity to reflect on a new generation of knowledge organization systems such as linked data vocabularies that have started to populate the web and are converging with new representation models and discovery tools in libraries and other cultural heritage institutions .']

sentences: [u'A computer program product includes instructions operable to cause a data processing apparatus to receive a packed data structure , receive a linked data assemblage , identify a discrepancy between the packed data structure and the linked data assemblage , and update one of the packed data structure and the linked data assemblage to remove the discrepancy .', u'In the packed data structure , a description of a relationship to a second element is included with a description of a first element .', u'In the linked data assemblage , a description of the relationship between the first element and the second element is separate from the description of the first element and a description of the second element .', u'The computer program product can be tangibly stored on a computer-readable medium .']

entities: [[(u'shared geospatial information spaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Spa- tial Data Infrastructures', u'Task'), (u'heterogeneity of legacy systems', u'Method')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data approach', u'Method'), (u'principles', u'Generic')], [(u'Linked Data representation', u'Method'), (u'SDIs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Shared information spaces', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'linked data', u'Material')], [(u'UNUSED POTENTIAL OF GEOSPATIAL DATA ENCODING', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Linked Data approach', u'USED-FOR', u'geospatial community')], [], [(u'linked data', u'USED-FOR', u'Shared information spaces')], []]
sentences: [u'There is increasing interest in shared geospatial information spaces .', u'In the context of Spa- tial Data Infrastructures ( SDI ) , heterogeneity of legacy systems and variety in existing standards are central challenges .', u'Linked Data has been suggested as a potential solution in both cases .', u'In this paper , we explain why the Linked Data approach provides no novelty to the geospatial community , as the principles are isomorphic to structures which were introduced to SDI standards ten years ago .', u'How- ever , while transformation from these to conventional Linked Data representation is trivial , key ele- ments of the standards have not been widely implemented in the SDIs .', u'Shared information spaces based on linked data can provide a motivation for implementation of the principles .', u'THE UNUSED POTENTIAL OF GEOSPATIAL DATA ENCODING']

sentences: [u'Services in the ubiquitous computing are heterogeneous in nature .', u'To be pervasive , these services should be defined in terms of their functionality and capabilities rather than the meaningless UUIDs or types of services .', u'Thus , clients can access the proper service based on semantic requests .', u'In this paper , we study the demand of semantic query in service discovery processes .', u'Current discovery protocols and the concept of semantics are bringing together to construct a framework to realize the semantic service discovery for ubiquitous computing .', u'Many issues are discussed in relation to service discovery topologies , ontology languages , and semantic query languages .']

sentences: [u'The increasing number of infrastructure services requires the existence of mechanisms to discover and select services and resources , called service broker , based on customer requirements .', u'This mechanism should improve the interoperability among customer-provider and be a backward compatible and light weight approach .', u'The introduction of semantic annotations in service description ( both functional and non-functional properties ) as well as a conceptual model for business Grid can help to achieve them .', u'Finally , the extension of the semantic Open Grid Service Architecture ( S-OGSA ) with the incorporation of the semantic service broker can incorporate the required capabilities to the Grid middleware .']

relations: [[(u'flow-sensitive algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'interprocedural definition-use chains of dynamic pointer-linked data structures')], [], [], [], [(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'definition-use chaining problem'), (u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'definition-use chaining problem'), (u'backward iterative data flow analysis', u'USED-FOR', u'definition-use chaining problem')], [(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'parallelism'), (u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'parallelism in programs'), (u'cyclic pointer-linked data structures', u'FEATURE-OF', u'programs')]]
sentences: [u'This paper presents a flow-sensitive algorithm to compute interprocedural definition-use chains of dynamic pointer-linked data structures .', u'The goal is to relate the statements that construct links of dynamic pointer-linked data structures ( i.e .', u'definitions ) to the statements that might traverse the structures through the links ( i.e .', u'uses ) .', u'Specifically , for each statement S that defines links of pointer-linked data structures , the algorithm finds the set of statements that traverse the links which are defined by S. This algorithm solves the definition-use chaining problem by performing backward iterative data flow analysis to compute the set of upward exposed uses at each statement .', u'The results of this algorithm can be used to identify parallelism in programs even with cyclic pointer-linked data structures .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data design issues page', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'star rating', u'Method'), (u'clarity', u'Metric')], [(u'querying', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data', u'Generic')], [(u'datasets', u'Generic'), (u'provenance information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'co-reference resolution tools', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data vocabulary use', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
