sentences: [u'In 2010 Tim Berners-Lee introduced a 5 star rating to his Linked Data design issues page to encourage data publishers along the road to good Linked Data .', u'What makes the star rating so effective is its simplicity , clarity , and a pinch of psychology -- is your data 5 star ?', u'While there is an abundance of 5 star Linked Data available today , finding , querying , and integrating/interlinking these data is , to say the least , difficult .', u"While the literature has largely focused on describing datasets , e.g. , by adding provenance information , or interlinking them , e.g. , by co-reference resolution tools , we would like to take Berners-Lee 's original proposal to the next level by introducing a 5 star rating for Linked Data vocabulary use ."]

sentences: [u'The purpose of this research is to make various interactive systems which can understand human emotions .', u'Such systems should have a database defining what a human emotion is .', u'The authors introduce linked data as a data model to make the database .', u'This paper explains the method to build the linked data which especially focus on relationships between a Japanese emotion word and its emotional intensity .', u'As an example application , the authors also introduce a facial expression system using the linked data .', u'The system analyses his/her voice messages by referring to the linked data , and determines what kind of emotion the user feels .', u'This paper also shows several evaluation results about how much the facial expression system can understand emotions of its users .']

sentences: [u'In todays scenario , the quantity of linked data is growing rapidly .', u'The data includes ontologies , governmental data , statistics and so on .', u'With more and more sources publishing the data , the amount of linked data is becoming enormous .', u'The task of obtaining the data from various sources , integrating and fine-tuning the data for desired statistical analysis assumes prominence .', u'So there is need of a good model with ecient UI design to perform the Linked Data Mining .', u'We proposed a model that helps to eectively interact with linked data present in the web in structured format , retrieve and integrate data from dierent sources , shape and fine-tune the so formed data for statistical analysis , perform data mining and also visualize the results at the end .']

sentences: [u'While we witness an explosion of exploration tools for simple datasets on Web 2.0 designed for use by ordinary citizens , the goal of a usable interface for supporting navigation and sense-making over arbitrary linked data has remained elusive .', u'The purpose of this paper is to analyse why - what makes exploring linked data so hard ?', u'Through a user-centered use case scenario , we work through requirements for sense making with data to extract functional requirements and to compare these against our tools to see what challenges emerge to deliver a useful , usable knowledge building experience with linked data .', u'We present presentation layer and heterogeneous data integration challenges and offer practical considerations for moving forward to effective linked data sensemaking tools .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'linked data', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'English', u'Material'), (u'linked data', u'Material')]]
sentences: [u'Purpose This paper aims to provide a report for the seminar on Global Interoperability and Linked Data which was held at the University of Florence in Italy from 1819 July 2012.Design/methodology/approach The paper goes beyond a report by introducing the concept of linked data and how it is beneficial to libraries .', u'It is derived mainly from papers presented at the seminar in English as well as other complementary sources.Findings The paper reports that linked data in libraries has become a subject of interdisciplinary interest as evidenced by the diversity of participants and presentations at this conference.Originality/value Based on the experiences presented at the conference , this report concludes by encouraging libraries to build from each other in adopting linked data .']

sentences: [u'Vast amounts of information is available in structured forms like spreadsheets , database relations , and tables found in documents and on the Web .', u'We describe an approach that uses linked data to interpret such tables and associate their components with nodes in a reference linked data collection .', u'Our proposed framework assigns a class ( i.e .', u'type ) to table columns , links table cells to entities , and inferred relations between columns to properties .', u'The resulting interpretation can be used to annotate tables , confirm existing facts in the linked data collection , and propose new facts to be added .', u'Our implemented prototype uses DBpedia as the linked data collection and Wikitology for background knowledge .', u'We evaluated its performance using a collection of tables from Google Squared , Wikipedia and the Web .']

sentences: [u'UDDI is not capable of handling semantic markups for Web services due to its flat data model and limited search capabilities .', u'The present invention provides semantic service description and matchmaking with registries that conforms to UDDI specification .', u'Specifically , the present invention stores complex semantic markups in UDDI data model and uses that information to perform semantic query processing .', u'The present invention does not require any modification to the existing UDDI registries .', u'The add-on modules reside only on clients who wish to take advantage of semantic capabilities .', u'This approach is completely backward compatible and can integrate seamlessly into existing UDDI infrastructure .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'top-down ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'extension')], [(u'ontologys bottom-up build process', u'USED-FOR', u'emergent semantics')], [], [], [(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'extraction of fuzzy grassroots ontologies'), (u'Web data', u'USED-FOR', u'extraction of fuzzy grassroots ontologies'), (u'inductive fuzzy classification', u'USED-FOR', u'Web data')]]
sentences: [u'Traditionally , ontologies describe knowledge representation in a denotational , formalized , and deductive way .', u'In addition , in this paper , we propose a semiotic , inductive , and approximate approach to ontology creation .', u'We define a conceptual framework , a semantics extraction algorithm , and a first proof of concept applying the algorithm to a small set of Wikipedia documents .', u'Intended as an extension to the prevailing top-down ontologies , we introduce an inductive fuzzy grassroots ontology , which organizes itself organically from existing natural language Web content .', u'Using inductive and approximate reasoning to reflect the natural way in which knowledge is processed , the ontologys bottom-up build process creates emergent semantics learned from the Web .', u'By this means , the ontology acts as a hub for computing with words described in natural language .', u'For Web users , the structural semantics are visualized as inductive fuzzy cognitive maps , allowing an initial form of intelligence amplification .', u'Eventually , we present an implementation of our inductive fuzzy grassroots ontology Thus , this paper contributes an algorithm for the extraction of fuzzy grassroots ontologies from Web data by inductive fuzzy classification .']

sentences: [u'UDDI is a standard registry for Web services , but so far its search functionality has been limited to keyword search .', u'These authors propose a UDDI enhancement called Matchmaker , which supports semantic service capability discovery .', u'Since September 2003 , they have deployed Matchmaker in one of four official UDDI registries operated by NTT-Communications .', u'In this article , they introduce Matchmaker and illustrate client tools that lower the threshold for using semantics in service discovery .', u'Experiments show that Matchmaker search consumes about 5 seconds more time than a typical keyword-based search .', u'The authors also collected user information through questionnaires and by observation of search behavior .']

sentences: [u'In this paper , we present a novel approach , named RS2D , to risk driven semantic service query routing in unstructured , so called pure P2P networks .', u'Following the RS2D protocol , each peer dynamically learns about the query answering behavior of its direct neighbours .', u'without prior knowledge on the semantic overlay .', u'The decision to whom to forward a given service request is then driven by the estimated mixed individual Bayes conditional risk of routing failure in terms of both semantic loss and high communication costs .', u'The results of our experimental evaluation of retrieval performance and robustness show that RS2D top performs compared to other relevant systems .']

sentences: [u'Lots of previous researches use ontology to give semantics to e-learning system .', u'These researches are classified into curriculum or syllabus ontology creation , ontology-based learning object organization , and ontology-based learning contents retrieval .', u'Our e-learning project aims to make of creation , integration and interfacing of multiple ontologies on different layers , i.e .', u'Curriculum ontology , Syllabus ontology , and Subject ontology .', u'The primary objective of our project is to develop ontology-based e-learning support system which allows learners to build adaptive learning paths through understanding curriculum , syllabuses , and subjects of courses deeply .', u'In this paper , we introduce our ontology model and propose an effective method for enhancing learning effect of students through construction of subject ontology .', u'The subject ontology of a certain course is composed of an ontology made by a teacher and many ontologies made by students .', u'It is used in discussion , visual presentation , and knowledge sharing between instructor and students .', u'We used the subject ontology in two lectures in practice and found that the subject ontology enhances learning effect of students in according to the analysis of feedbacks of students .']

sentences: [u'The purpose of this session will be to assist DCMI in setting an agenda for the possible extension of its publishing activities .', u"The session will explore DCMI 's existing and future publication needs , opportunities and mechanisms .", u"Part of this session will explore how expanding the formal publication activities of DCMI through the Open Journal System ( OJS ) and Open Conference System platforms might effectively support DCMI 's mission .", u'In addition to the OJS , DCMI is also shifting from its current wiki infrastructure to MediaWiki to better serve its communities and task groups .', u'However , MediaWiki also provides DCMI the opportunity to extend its reach beyond the working context of communities and task groups to a larger global community interested in metadata design , vocabulary management and best practices .', u'This session will accommodate a discussion of the current and future roles of DCMI MediaWiki -- e.g. , can we envision uses of the MediaWiki evolving into a sort of Wikipedia for metadata and ontology creation and management ?', u'How might such new uses be woven into the DCMI mission ?']

sentences: [u'The array of devices , networks and resources available in pervasive computing environments , or smart spaces , will require effective self-management systems controlled via user-level policies .', u'However , the local nature of smart spaces means that they present a potentially huge increase in the number of and nature of management domains , e.g .', u'representing individual homes , shops , businesses , schools , hospitals etc .', u'However , differences in local domain models and local resource models means that policies relevant to one smart space will often use different semantics for subject and target objects compared to other pervasive computing domains .', u'To allow users to capture personal preferences in terms of policies that can be consistently applied as they roam between smart spaces , the semantic interoperability problem resulting from different models for policy subjects and targets must be overcome .', u'In this paper we present a framework where the use of ontology-based semantics for policy elements allows dynamic ontology mapping capabilities to support policy mobility .', u'We demonstrate its operation with a case study showing policy mobility in a policy-driven smart space management system .']

sentences: [u'In this paper , we propose a novel approach for automatic generation of visualizations from domain-specific data available on the web .', u'We describe a general system pipeline that combines ontology mapping and probabilistic reasoning techniques .', u'With this approach , a web page is first mapped to a Domain Ontology , which stores the semantics of a specific subject domain ( e.g. , music charts ) .', u'The Domain Ontology is then mapped to one or more Visual Representation Ontologies , each of which captures the semantics of a visualization style ( e.g. , tree maps ) .', u'To enable the mapping between these two ontologies , we establish a Semantic Bridging Ontology , which specifies the appropriateness of each semantic bridge .', u'Finally each Visual Representation Ontology is mapped to a visualization using an external visualization toolkit .', u'Using this approach , we have developed a prototype software tool , SemViz , as a realisation of this approach .', u'By interfacing its Visual Representation Ontologies with public domain software such as ILOG Discovery and Prefuse , SemViz is able to generate appropriate visualizations automatically from a large collection of popular web pages for music charts without prior knowledge of these web pages .']

relations: [[], [(u'first-order logic', u'USED-FOR', u'representation standards'), (u'first-order logic', u'CONJUNCTION', u'syllogistic reasoning')], [], [], [], [(u'FOL-based ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'hybrid knowledge representation approach'), (u'CS-based representations', u'USED-FOR', u'hybrid knowledge representation approach')], [(u'distance metrics', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic similarity')], [(u'automatic similarity detection', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology integration')]]
sentences: [u'The widespread use of ontologies raises the need to integrate distinct conceptualisations .', u'Whereas the symbolic approach of established representation standards based on first-order logic ( FOL ) and syllogistic reasoning does not implicitly represent semantic similarities , ontology mapping addresses this problem by aiming at establishing formal relations between a set of knowledge entities which represent the same or a similar meaning in distinct ontologies .', u'However , manually or semi-automatically identifying similarity relationships is costly .', u'Hence , we argue , that representational facilities are required which enable to implicitly represent similarities .', u'Whereas Conceptual Spaces ( CS ) address similarity computation through the representation of concepts as vector spaces , CS rovide neither an implicit representational mechanism nor a means to represent arbitrary relations between concepts or instances .', u'In order to overcome these issues , we propose a hybrid knowledge representation approach which extends FOL-based ontologies with a conceptual grounding through a set of CS-based representations .', u'Consequently , semantic similarity between instances represented as members in CS is indicated by means of distance metrics .', u'Hence , automatic similarity detection across distinct ontologies is supported in order to facilitate ontology integration .']

sentences: [u'Accessing or integrating data lexicalized in different languages is a challenge .', u'Multilingual lexical resources play a fundamental role in reducing the language barriers to map concepts lexicalized in different languages .', u'In this paper we present a large-scale study on the effectiveness of automatic translations to support two key cross-lingual ontology mapping tasks : the retrieval of candidate matches and the selection of the correct matches for inclusion in the final alignment .', u'We conduct our experiments using four different large gold standards , each one consisting of a pair of mapped wordnets , to cover four different families of languages .', u'We categorize concepts based on their lexicalization ( type of words , synonym richness , position in a subconcept graph ) and analyze their distributions in the gold standards .', u'Leveraging this categorization , we measure several aspects of translation effectiveness , such as word-translation correctness , word sense coverage , synset and synonym coverage .', u'Finally , we thoroughly discuss several findings of our study , which we believe are helpful for the design of more sophisticated cross-lingual mapping algorithms .']

sentences: [u'Language understanding is one of the most important characteristics for human beings .', u'As a pervasive phenomenon in natural language , metaphor is not only an essential thinking approach , but also an ingredient in human conceptual system .', u'Many of our ways of thinking and experiences are virtually represented metaphorically .', u'With the development of the cognitive research on metaphor , it is urgent to formulate a computational model for metaphor understanding based on the cognitive mechanism , especially with the view to promoting natural language understanding .', u'Many works have been done in pragmatics and cognitive linguistics , especially the discussions on metaphor understanding process in pragmatics and metaphor mapping representation in cognitive linguistics .', u'In this paper , a theoretical framework for metaphor understanding based on the embodied mechanism of concept inquiry is proposed .', u'Based on this framework , ontology is introduced as the knowledge representation method in metaphor understanding , and metaphor mapping is formulated as ontology mapping .', u'In line with the conceptual blending theory , a revised conceptual blending framework is presented by adding a lexical ontology and context as the fifth mental space , and a metaphor mapping algorithm is proposed .']

sentences: [u'Coumestrol is a naturally occurring plant estrogen .', u'As estrogen influences cellular and humoral immunity , and has known effects on murine models of lupus , we investigated the effect of coumestrol on disease expression in the NZB/W F1 mouse .', u'Female NZB/W F1 mice were fed a standard rodent diet including soy proteins , a non-soy diet , or a non-soy diet with 0.01 % coumestrol .', u'Outcome measures included survival , autoantibody expression , immunoglobulin levels , proteinuria , renal histology and B cell immunohistochemistry , and renal mRNA expression .', u'At 24 weeks , the treatment group had decreased prevalence of autoantibodies detected by immunofluorescence and less splenomegaly .', u'At 39 weeks , the prevalence of autoantibodies was similar but the treatment group had less proteinuria .', u'Overall , there was little effect of treatment on renal mRNA levels as assessed by gene array analysis , but functional ontology mapping revealed that genes encoding proteins involved in the immune response were most often affected .', u'These results suggest that treatment with coumestrol may ameliorate some aspects of disease progression in this model of systemic autoimmunity .']

sentences: [u'One of the most important research subjects germane to knowledge management in collaborative manufacturing is the integration of heterogeneous product knowledge distributed among different collaborative enterprises .', u'To deal with the problem of optimization of knowledge integration in collaborative manufacturing , an ontology-based framework of knowledge integration is presented to transform the problem of knowledge integration into a problem of ontology integration .', u'First of all , a collaborative business process for collaborative enterprises is described , and then an ontology-based framework of knowledge integration is established .', u'Under the condition of analyzing the structure of knowledge ontology , an ontology schema of knowledge concept is discussed .', u'Aiming at the ontology schema , a method of ontology integration based on ontology similarity is improved .', u'The method is composed of ontology mapping and ontology merging , which is based on calculated result of ontology similarity between local ontology and global ontology .', u'Finally , the implementation of the framework of knowledge integration is described , and the application results meet the requirement of the knowledge integration to ensure that validity of the ontology integration method was proved .']

relations: [[(u'information management', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [], [], [], [(u'alignment', u'CONJUNCTION', u'integration')], [(u'trust-based approach', u'USED-FOR', u'ranking reasoning')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Abstract : As ontologies become more prevalent for information management the need to manage the ontologies increases .', u'Multiple organizations , within a domain , often combine to work on specific projects .', u'When separate organizations come together to communicate , an alignment of terminology and semantics is required .', u'Ontology creation is often privatized for these individual organizations to represent their view of the domain .', u'This creates problems with alignment and integration , making it necessary to consider how much each ontology should influence the current decision to be made .', u'To assist with determining influence a trust-based approach on authors and their ontologies provides a mechanism for ranking reasoning results .', u'A representation of authors and the individual resources they provide for the merged ontology becomes necessary .', u'The authors are then weighted by trust and trust for the resources they provide the ontology is calculated .', u'This is then used to assist the integration process allowing for an evolutionary trust model to calculate the level of credibility of resources .', u"Once the integration is complete semantic agreement between ontologies allows for the revision of the authors ' trust ."]

sentences: [u"The term `` ontology '' comes from the field of philosophy that is concerned with the study of being or existence .", u"In general computer science defines ontology as an `` explicit specification of a conceptualization , '' which is , `` the objects , concepts , and other entities that are presumed to exist in some area of interest and the relationships that hold among them '' .", u'Ontologies hold a great importance to modern knowledge based systems .', u'They enable shared knowledge and reuse where information resources can be communicated between human or software agentsand should be machine readable .', u'Manual construction of ontologies is an expensive and time consuming task .', u'An answer to this problem is to provide an automatic or semi- automatic tool for ontology construction .', u'Over the past years , this field of research has not yet reached the goal of fully automating the ontology development process .', u'In this paper we will review the ontology creation process with the help of ontology learning ( OL ) and extend our previous OL framework .', u'We will examine OL applications with respect to the extensions of our framework .', u'And last we will define a roadmap for future work .']

sentences: [u'This paper presents an intelligent agent-based control for real-time operation of a hybrid microgrid in both islanded and interconnected modes .', u'The proposed control architecture contains different types of agents such as Photovoltaic agent , Fuel cell agent , Distributed Generator agent , Power Converter Building Block agent , Composite Energy Storage System agent and Load agent , which represent each major components in the microgrid .', u"In this paper , the control system implementation will be discussed in details by describing each agent 's and the control algorithm associated with ontology creation .", u'The proposed control system is developed as a Multi Agent System ( MAS ) in JADE platform and the microgrid is implemented in Real Time Digital Simulator ( RTDS ) .', u'A real-time communication interface between MAS and RTDS is presented via TCP/IP .', u'To demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed control architecture , simulation studies have been performed on the developed hybrid microgrid .', u'The simulation results indicate that the proposed agent-based control system effectively coordinates the distributed energy resources in real-time for operation of both islanded and grid connected modes .']

sentences: [u'We propose LexOnt , a semi-automatic ontology creation tool for a high-level service classification ontology .', u'LexOnt uses the Programmable Web directory as the corpus , although it can evolve to use other corpora as well .', u'The main contribution of LexOnt is its novel algorithm which generates and ranks frequent terms and significant phrases within a PW category by comparing them to external domain knowledge such as Wikipedia , Wordnet and the current state of the ontology .', u'First it matches terms to the Wikipedia page description of the category and ranks them higher , since these indicate domain descriptive words .', u'Synonymous words from Wordnet are then matched and ranked .', u'In a semi-automated process , the user chooses the terms it wants to add to the ontology and indicates the properties to assign these values to and the ontology is automatically generated .', u'In the next iteration , terms within the current state of the ontology are compared to terms in the other categories and automatic property assignments are made for these API instances as well .']

sentences: [u'The term maritime affairs means in general the shipping ( Maritime Services ) and all things related to the sea , such as navigation , shipbuilding , surveying , maritime law , and processing the maritime accidents ( including the navigation and berthing incidents ) .', u'And the 71 percents of the earths surface is covered with ocean , while the shipping is a low-cost , high-volume , long-distance transport .', u'With the explosive growth of information and globalization , it highlights the importance of collecting the maritime information and digging out the useful information .', u'To create a professional and systematic maritime ontology , it will enhance the efficiency and accuracy of excavation .', u'Considering the lack of context-semantics for the constructing Chinese ontology , the paper proposed a new method which combines with context-semantics .', u'This paper will be divided into four stages .', u'The first stage is extracting the terminology of special area , the second is relationship definition , then ontology creation and the last is ontology evaluation and .', u'On the first stage , it introduced Xtracts algorithms to extract compound words , which can integrate context-semantic into ontology construction .']

relations: [[(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'BPM lifecycle')], [], [(u'process ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'SBPM business process models'), (u'sup- port of reasoning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'querying capabilities')], [], [(u'Integrated Rule Inference System', u'USED-FOR', u'solution'), (u'storage mechanism', u'CONJUNCTION', u'query proc- essing')], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic Business Process Management ( SBPM ) utilizes semantic technologies to achieve more automation throughout the BPM lifecycle .', u'An in- tegral part of the SBPM infrastructure is a semantic business process repository , which is used for storage and management of business process modeling arti- facts .', u'As in SBPM business process models are based on process ontologies , the semantic business process repository has additional requirements towards sup- port of reasoning and querying capabilities .', u'In this paper , we first describe the functionalities the semantic business process repository has to provide .', u'We then introduce a solution based on the Integrated Rule Inference System ( IRIS ) on top of a relational database for realizing the storage mechanism and query proc- essing .', u'Finally , we present the overall architecture of the semantic business process repository .']

sentences: [u'Industrial robotics is a complex domain , not easily amenable to formalization using semantic technologies .', u'It involves such disparate aspects of the real world as geometry , dynamics , constraint-satisfaction , planning and scheduling , real-time control , robot-robot and human-robot communication and , finally , intentions of the robot user .', u'To represent so different kinds of knowledge is a challenge and the research on combining those topics is only in its infancy .', u'This paper describes our attempts to combine descriptions of robot tasks using natural language together with their realizations using robot hardware involving force sensing , ultimately leading to a potential of learning new robot skills employing force-based assembly .', u'We believe it is a novel approach opening possibilities of semantic anchoring for learning from demonstration .', u'( Less )']

entities: [[], [(u'classification', u'Task'), (u'retrieval of iconography repositories', u'Task'), (u'systemized ontological structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'description of iconographical art objects', u'Task')], [(u'East-Christian iconographical art', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'content annotation', u'Task'), (u'Virtual encyclopedia of Bulgarian iconography multimedia digital library', u'Material')], [(u'ontologys main classes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'facts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'learning analysis', u'Task'), (u'iconography domain', u'Material'), (u'SINUS project Semantic Technologies', u'Material'), (u'Web Services', u'Task'), (u'Technology Enhanced Learning', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'systemized ontological structure', u'USED-FOR', u'description of iconographical art objects')], [(u'East-Christian iconographical art', u'USED-FOR', u'content annotation'), (u'Virtual encyclopedia of Bulgarian iconography multimedia digital library', u'USED-FOR', u'content annotation')], [(u'relations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'facts'), (u'relations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rules'), (u'facts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rules')], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'learning analysis'), (u'SINUS project Semantic Technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'Web Services'), (u'Web Services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Technology Enhanced Learning')]]
sentences: [u'In the recent years the East-Christian iconographical art works have been digitized providing a large volume of data .', u'The need for effective classification , indexing and retrieval of iconography repositories was the motivation of the design and development of a systemized ontological structure for description of iconographical art objects .', u'This paper presents the ontology of the East-Christian iconographical art , developed to provide content annotation in the Virtual encyclopedia of Bulgarian iconography multimedia digital library .', u'The ontologys main classes , relations , facts , rules , and problems appearing during the design and development are described .', u'The paper also presents an application of the ontology for learning analysis on an iconography domain implemented during the SINUS project Semantic Technologies for Web Services and Technology Enhanced Learning .']

entities: [[(u'scientific and business IT infrastructures', u'Task'), (u'middleware layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'life-cycle phases', u'Generic'), (u'infrastructures', u'Generic'), (u'inception', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'deployment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'execution', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dissolution', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Virtual Organization', u'Task')], [(u'IT infrastructure management', u'Method'), (u'Service Level Agreement', u'Task'), (u'Virtual Organization', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'middleware components', u'Method'), (u'organizations', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Current trends in modern scientific and business IT infrastructures pose certain requirements in the middleware layer in order to maximize the automation of all life-cycle phases of such infrastructures including inception , deployment , execution , and dissolution .', u'In case this infrastructure is composed of resources of different organizations , for instance in form of a Virtual Organization , the management of these resources is especially needed for achieving new quality in business .', u'In this paper we deal with a specific aspect of the IT infrastructure management related to autonomous enforcement of Service Level Agreement between organizations sharing their resources within a Virtual Organization .', u'The presented framework utilizes semantic technologies in order to virtualize the heterogeneity of underlying middleware components and to allow integration of services between these organizations .']

entities: [[(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'user friendly interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'literary texts', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Content Elicitation', u'Method'), (u'hierarchical and associative relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'visual structuring of knowledge', u'Task')], [(u'knowledge', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Babylonian Talmud', u'Material'), (u'historical , linguistic , semantic and structural richness', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'user friendly interfaces', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic technologies')], [], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge')], [(u'Babylonian Talmud', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach'), (u'historical , linguistic , semantic and structural richness', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper we show how semantic technologies can be exploited , with the help of user friendly interfaces , to identify and structure the knowledge embedded in literary texts .', u'The proposed approach , that we have called Content Elicitation , supports the experts in defining hierarchical and associative relationships between semantically annotated chunks of text denoting relevant entities , allowing visual structuring of knowledge , which can be edited by different experts in a collaborative way .', u'This knowledge , formally coded as an ontology , can then be used by scholars and students as a guide for the analysis of the text and for the discovery of potential novel interpretations .', u'We are testing and evaluating this approach on the Babylonian Talmud , due to its historical , linguistic , semantic and structural richness .']

sentences: [u'Users of mobile devices can nowadays easily create large quantities of mobile multimedia documents tracing significant events attended , places visited or , simply , moments of their everyday life .', u'However , they face the challenge of organizing these documents in order to facilitate searching through them at a later time and sharing them with other users .', u'We propose using context awareness and semantic technologies in order to improve and facilitate the organization , annotation , retrieval and sharing of personal mobile multimedia documents .', u"Our approach combines metadata extracted and enriched automatically from the users ' context with annotations provided manually by the users and with annotations inferred by applying user-defined rules to context features .", u'These new contextual metadata are integrated into the processes of annotation , sharing and keyword-based retrieval .']

entities: [[(u'semantic infras- tructure', u'Method')], [(u'eort', u'Generic'), (u'automatic curation of knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fungal enzymes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'genomics', u'Material')], [(u'ontological NLP pipelines', u'Method'), (u'Web-based interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'curated data', u'Material')], [(u'manual curation time', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Web-based interfaces', u'USED-FOR', u'ontological NLP pipelines')], [], []]
sentences: [u'We present our ongoing development of a semantic infras- tructure supporting biofuel research .', u'Part of this eort is the automatic curation of knowledge from the massive amount of information on fungal enzymes that is available in genomics .', u'Working closely with biologists who manually curate the existing literature , we developed ontological NLP pipelines , integrated through Web-based interfaces , to help them in two main tasks : spending less time to mine the literature for facts , while also being provided with richer and semantically linked information .', u'An ongoing challenge is to measure precisely how much the developed semantic technologies benet the end users and what their overall impact on the quality of the curated data is .', u'We present preliminary evaluation results that show a signicant reduction in manual curation time .']

sentences: [u'The emergence of new repositories of learning resources based on semantic technology raises the problem of ontologies interoperability .', u'Learning resources are described by a set of metadata which may use different ontologies as referential .', u'To handle the increasing number of heterogeneous ontologies it becomes necessary to develop automatic mapping approach .', u'In this paper we propose to study technical solutions for ontologies handling through two use cases : ( 1 ) the comparison between a current learner profile and a target profile and ( 2 ) the search of learning resources among distributed repositories .']

sentences: [u'With the popularity and the increasing of web services , how to composite automatically web services by request of user has become a challenge.Presents a way of dynamic composition of web services based on domain ontology.This way generates a web services composition graphics that is based on domain ontology by using domain ontology and semantic technology , according to graphics can support automatic discovery , dispatch , composition of web services.This way considers synthetically semantic support , domain characteristic and automatic composition of web services.In the last , validates the availability of this way .']

sentences: [u'A new method to carry out automatic sharing synthesis of Petri nets based on semantic technology was proposed.On the basis of domain ontology , semantic markups were added to all place elements of each Petri net.According to the given rules , place elements that could be integrated were located through ontology querying and reasoning.And then the synthesis of Petri nets could be realized.At last , the method to automatically get Petri net model of web services composition was discussed with online book-shopping service composition , and its correctness and feasibility were also verified .']

sentences: [u'A novel user-centred approach to evaluation of semantic knowledge management applications is described .', u'Application of the approach to two case studies - fully functional prototypes for digital library users , and support for legal decision making - is discussed .', u'The results show that users appreciate the enhance- ment to their working environment provided by semantic technology , improving both the efficiency of work , and the quality of the result .', u'Estimation of cost and benefits Indicates that semantic knowledge management systems can be highly cost-effective for large and medium-size organizations .']

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'question answering', u'Task'), (u'heterogeneous knowledge sources', u'Method'), (u'ontology management components', u'Method'), (u'digital library application', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'structured queries', u'Material'), (u'natural language', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'application scenario', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], []]

sentences: [u'In this paper we present an approach to question answering over heterogeneous knowledge sources that makes use of different ontology management components within the scenario of a digital library application .', u'We present a principled framework for integrating structured metadata and unstructured resource content in a seamless manner which can then be flexibly queried using structured queries expressed in natural language .', u'The novelty of the approach lies in the combination of different semantic technologies providing a clear benefit for the application scenario considered .', u'The resulting system is implemented as part of the digital library of British Telecommunications ( BT ) .', u'The original contribution of our paper lies in the architecture we present allowing for the nonstraightforward integration of the different components we consider .']

entities: [[(u'connected objects', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'functionalities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'virtual sensor services', u'Method'), (u'services', u'Generic'), (u'social network sites', u'Method'), (u'service registries', u'Material')], [(u'lightweight ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'sensor capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'IoS space', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'policy based service execution approach', u'Method'), (u'sensor node', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'sensor node battery life', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'electrical vehicle', u'Method'), (u'proof-of-concept', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'Sun SPOT sensor platform', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'This paper proposes a virtualized Internet of Services ( IoS ) space framework for connected objects .', u'The framework allows to expose the connected objects sensor capabilities , functionalities and data as virtual sensor services and advertise these services to social network sites in addition to service registries for the enablement of a connected people IoS space .', u'In this regard , we develop lightweight ontologies both for sensor capabilities and functionalities and the IoS space .', u'The paper also offers a policy based service execution approach to abate the traffic to and from a sensor node which in turns increases the sensor node battery life .', u'We select an electrical vehicle as case study and implement a proof-of-concept by using semantic technologies and Sun SPOT sensor platform .']

sentences: [u'The new strategies for technology-enhanced learning point to the investigation and deployment of workable learning methods for creative thinking and learning-by-authoring , engaging learners in active participation while acquiring knowledge .', u"In the SINUS project `` Semantic Technologies for Web Services and Technology Enhanced Learning '' , a scenario for performing a learning analysis of the Orthodox iconographic art is proposed .", u'The analysis will be completed in a learning environment using resources of the Bulgarian Iconographical Digital Library .', u"For that purpose , an ontological structure of the learning method `` Analysis '' is developed .", u"It is used in conjunction with a set of Web Services for providing knowledge and assisting the user to creatively exploit library 's resources .", u'This paper presents this ontological model and its usage .']

sentences: [u'The evolution of manufacturing technologies has allowed for rapid prototype development and easy transfer of ideas from design to production , even in the convenience of the home office ( via 3D printers ) .', u'It has also created an unstable market environment .', u'This situation calls for novel solutions in manufacturing that allow high adaptability and responsiveness .', u'The use of smart , agent-based systems empowered by semantic technologies could provide the solution .', u"The authors ' ontology-based smart production system is based on the use of agents .", u'They present both the system architecture and a framework for deployment under a living lab environment .', u'They also give special focus to alleviating obstacles met in the small-series-like ramp-up of highly customized products , such as aircraft .']

entities: [[(u'software', u'Generic'), (u'medical systems', u'Task'), (u'process requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'industrial standards', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'customer-provided requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'internal quality management systems', u'Method')], [(u'software teams', u'Method')], [(u'collaborative , web-based solution', u'Method'), (u'process requirements', u'Task')], [(u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'them', u'Generic'), (u'activities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'tasks', u'Task')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'software engineers', u'Method'), (u'missing relevant information', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'software', u'USED-FOR', u'medical systems'), (u'industrial standards', u'CONJUNCTION', u'customer-provided requirements')], [], [(u'collaborative , web-based solution', u'USED-FOR', u'process requirements')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'solution'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'process requirement')], [(u'Requirements', u'USED-FOR', u'tasks'), (u'them', u'USED-FOR', u'activities'), (u'them', u'USED-FOR', u'tasks'), (u'activities', u'CONJUNCTION', u'tasks')], []]
sentences: [u'Organizations developing software for critical sectors like aerospace , automotive , and medical systems need to apply process requirements coming from different sources : industrial standards , customer-provided requirements , and procedures from internal quality management systems .', u'In these situations , software teams need to deal with complex sets of process requirements that govern different aspects of their work .', u'This paper describes the development of a collaborative , web-based solution to improve access to process requirements .', u'The solution makes use of semantic technologies to handle the context of process requirement .', u'Requirements are contextualized by linking them to activities , tasks , and work products .', u'With this tool , software engineers have a single point of access to all the applicable process requirements , avoiding the risk of missing relevant information .']

sentences: [u'Trading systems are tools to aid financial analysts in the investment process in companies .', u'This process is highly complex because a big number of variables take part in it .', u'Furthermore , huge sets of data must be taken into account to perform a grounded investment , making the process even more complicated .', u'In this paper we present a real trading system that has been developed using semantic technologies .', u'These cutting-edge technologies are very useful in this context because they enable the definition of schemes that can be used for storing financial information , which , in turn , can be easily accessed and queried .', u'Additionally , the inference capabilities of the existing reasoning engines enable the generation of a set of rules supporting this investment analysis process .']

entities: [[(u'chemical product', u'Method'), (u'work processes', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'modeling of work processes', u'Task'), (u'chemical industries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'iterative modeling procedure', u'Method'), (u'work processes', u'Method'), (u'software tools', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'work process models', u'Method'), (u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'enactment', u'Task'), (u'models', u'Generic'), (u'application tools', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'model checking', u'Task'), (u'model transformations', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'modeling of work processes')], [(u'work process simulation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications'), (u'work process simulation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'enactment'), (u'enactment', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications')], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'framework'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'model checking'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'model transformations'), (u'model checking', u'CONJUNCTION', u'model transformations')]]
sentences: [u'During the life cycle of a chemical product and its associated production process , diverse types of work processes are performed , such as design and operational processes .', u'In this contribution , a framework for the modeling of work processes in the chemical industries is presented which comprises an iterative modeling procedure , an extensible modeling language for work processes , and software tools for its practical application .', u'The framework supports the iterative creation of work process models for diverse applications such as work process simulation or enactment and the subsequent export of the models in suitable application tools .', u'Ease of use has been a key design criterion for the framework .', u'Internally , the framework builds on semantic technologies to provide substantial support for model checking and model transformations .']

entities: [[(u'presence-based application development', u'Task'), (u'Presence Management Systems', u'Method'), (u'PMSs )', u'Method'), (u'management of communication channels', u'Task')], [(u'presence management', u'Task'), (u'context-centric presence analysis', u'Task'), (u'privacy management', u'Task')], [(u'PMSs', u'Method'), (u'open and context-aware presence management', u'Task'), (u'extensions', u'Generic'), (u'XML-based XMPP', u'Method'), (u'message exchange', u'Task'), (u'online communication systems', u'Task')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'RDF vocabularies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'PMSs framework', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Presence Management Systems', u'USED-FOR', u'presence-based application development')], [(u'Solutions', u'USED-FOR', u'presence management'), (u'context-centric presence analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'privacy management')], [(u'XML-based XMPP', u'USED-FOR', u'message exchange')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF vocabularies')]]
sentences: [u'In pervasive environments , presence-based application development via Presence Management Systems ( PMSs ) is a key factor to optimise the management of communication channels , driving productivity increase .', u'Solutions for presence management should satisfy the interoperability requirements , in turn providing context-centric presence analysis and privacy management .', u'In order to push PMSs towards flexible , open and context-aware presence management , we propose some adaptation of two extensions to standard XML-based XMPP for message exchange in online communication systems .', u'The contribution allows for more complex specification and management of nested group and privacy lists , where semantic technologies are used to map all messages into RDF vocabularies and pave the way for a broader semantic integration of heterogeneous and distributed presence information sources in the standard PMSs framework .']

sentences: [u'The data heterogeneity in network measurements ( in data definition models , data sharing protocols , data processing algorithms , etc ) is a known problem and several projects are focused on solving it .', u'In this regard , MOMENT is a Seventh Framework Program European project that is focused on using semantic technologies to access multiple heterogeneous network measurement repositories .', u'In this paper we show one of the main algorithms of the MOMENT architecture , which handles distributed SPARQL repositories by rewriting the queries using optional clauses .', u'By means of a general ontology describing the network measurements domain and semantic wrappers for relational databases , the MOMENT mediator is able to semantically query from a unique access point and transparently to the user , several network measurement repositories like LOBSTER , ETOMIC , DIMES and MOME .']

entities: [[(u'Abstract Digital factory modelling', u'Method'), (u'virtual design', u'Method')], [(u'industrial systems', u'Method'), (u'semantic modelling technologies', u'Method'), (u'resource requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'customer demands', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'product design', u'Method'), (u'process and resource knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'integration method', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'PPR ontologies', u'Method'), (u'reuse of known and unknown knowledge', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'cloud manufacturing', u'Method'), (u'PPR ontology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'virtual design', u'USED-FOR', u'Abstract Digital factory modelling')], [(u'semantic modelling technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'industrial systems')], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'integration method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'PPR ontologies'), (u'PPR ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'integration method')], [(u'cloud manufacturing', u'USED-FOR', u'method')]]
sentences: [u'Abstract Digital factory modelling based on virtual design and simulation has emerged as part of the mainstream activities geared towards reducing product design cycle .', u'Some basic industrial systems are currently integrated via semantic modelling technologies so that products matching processes and resource requirements are integrated to fulfil customer demands .', u'Despite these achievements , product design is still dependent on the knowledge of designers and do not benefit from existing process and resource knowledge , which are in separate domains .', u'This paper therefore presents an integration method based on semantic technologies and PPR ontologies to enable the reuse of known and unknown knowledge .', u'The method relies on the use of cloud manufacturing to improve the efficiency of responsesgenerated by querying the PPR ontology .']

entities: [[(u'biomedical research', u'Task')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'distributed information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'Topic Maps', u'Method')], [(u'knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'biomedical domain', u'Material')], [(u'distributed and heterogeneous resources', u'Material'), (u'enterprise integration technologies', u'Method'), (u'J2EE', u'Metric'), (u'Web Services', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'unstructured information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'scientific publications', u'Material')], [(u'information portal', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'seamless semantic integration', u'Method'), (u'genome databases', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Topic Maps', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic technologies')], [(u'technical realization', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge representation')], [(u'enterprise integration technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'enterprise integration technologies'), (u'J2EE', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'enterprise integration technologies'), (u'J2EE', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web Services'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'Topic Map based views'), (u'unstructured information', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [(u'seamless semantic integration', u'USED-FOR', u'information portal')]]
sentences: [u'Within the last years the Web dramatically influenced biomedical research .', u'Although it allows for almost instantaneous access to a huge amount of distributed information the problem how to retrieve useful information still persist .', u'With semantic technologies ( especially Topic Maps ) the solution becomes tangible .', u'We will discuss in this paper concepts and a technical realization for knowledge representation within the biomedical domain .', u'This includes not only the semantic access of distributed and heterogeneous resources based on state-of-the-art enterprise integration technologies ( J2EE , Web Services ) but also an approach for Topic Map based views on unstructured information from scientific publications .', u'We will furthermore present the implementation of an information portal based on the seamless semantic integration of ~ 500 genome databases and ~16.000.000 abstracts .']

sentences: [u'Abstract Geographical maps are an ideal technique to present and visualizethe real world information which is retrieved from various resources such as satellite and sensors .', u'These data are effectively used in complex applications like Google and OpenStreet Map .', u'Every location or place in a map is represented by latitude and longitude coordinates .', u'Thislocation based search methodology can be utilized to find distance or path between two places , weather and traffic information , hotel , cafe and restaurant .', u'This paper proposes an approach to describe and retrieve information by annotating location and places using semantic technologies .', u'It is expected to retrieve more precise results by adding semantic annotation to the location .', u'Users can also customize themap using this method to look up cities , addresses and other map related information .']

entities: [[(u'intelligent learning systems', u'Method'), (u'knowledge intensive organizations', u'Task')], [(u'conceptual model', u'Method'), (u'knowledge systems', u'Method'), (u'dynamic content regulation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'self-learning', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'social networks', u'Method')], [], [(u'connectivist theory', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'intelligent learning systems', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge intensive organizations')], [(u'conceptual model', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge systems')], [], [(u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social networks')], [], []]
sentences: [u'This study is focused on the potentiality and benefits that intelligent learning systems can bring to knowledge intensive organizations , in particularly software houses .', u'Therefore the authors will present a conceptual model for the foundation of specialized knowledge systems with dynamic content regulation , oriented to self-learning .', u'Its structure is based on the combination of semantic technologies ( e.g .', u'ontologies ) and social networks , from where interaction lasts .', u'To achieve that goal , it is important to know how to explore the information in this type of environments , as well as understand which behaviors and trends influence the individuals learning in the digital era .', u'The connectivist theory offers an important contribution to the understanding of this phenomenon , being therefore one of the basic reference in the development of this work .']

entities: [[(u'Learning Management Systems', u'Task')], [], [(u'E-assessment', u'Task'), (u'learning process', u'Method')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'technology based learning systems', u'Method'), (u'learning resources', u'Material')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'e-assessment interoperability', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'learning object description', u'Task'), (u'global learning community', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'e-assessment system components', u'Method'), (u'high level education environments', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Learning Management Systems ( LMS ) were developed with different platforms and technologies .', u'Consequently , sharing learning resources and components has become a major challenge .', u'E-assessment as a primary activity of any learning process is facing the same challenges and problems .', u'With the capability to use semantic technologies , more specifically ontologies , it is easier to have a technology based learning systems that enable educators to share the learning resources .', u'This paper focuses on the development and implementation of an ontology for e-assessment interoperability .', u'The ontology is based on standards for learning object description widely used in global learning community .', u'This ontology collaborates with flexibility and enhances the possibility of sharing the e-assessment system components between educators in high level education environments .']

entities: [[(u'Web 2.0 technologies', u'Method'), (u'knowledge management', u'Task'), (u'corporate sphere', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Web 2.0', u'Method'), (u'knowledge transfer tool', u'Method'), (u'knowledge intensive firms', u'Method'), (u'mentoring', u'Task')], [(u'IM-TAG', u'Method'), (u'Web 2.0 tool', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'informal mentoring', u'Task')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'personal competencies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'opinion tagging', u'Method')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'IM-TAG', u'Material')], [(u'accuracy', u'Metric')], [(u'mentoring programs', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'The use of Web 2.0 technologies for knowledge management is invading the corporate sphere .', u'The Web 2.0 is the most adopted knowledge transfer tool within knowledge intensive firms and is starting to be used for mentoring .', u'This paper presents IM-TAG , a Web 2.0 tool , based on semantic technologies , for informal mentoring .', u'The tool offers recommendations of mentoring contents built upon personal competencies of the mentee , combined with content and opinion tagging .', u'To validate the tool , a case study comparing recommendations from the IM-TAG and a group of experts was conducted .', u"Results show that the accuracy of IM-TAG 's recommendations is notable and satisfactory .", u'The main conclusions of this research may be valuable to organizations immersed in mentoring programs .']

entities: [[(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Portals', u'Method'), (u'SEAL approach', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'heterogeneous and distributed infrastructure of Semantic Portals', u'Method'), (u'viz', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'OntoWeb.org portals', u'Material'), (u'KM-Vision.org portal', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'practical usability', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Portals', u'Method'), (u'portal infrastructures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'lay- ered SemanticPortal', u'Method')], [(u'modi', u'Method'), (u'robustness', u'Metric'), (u'SemanticPortals', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'We present a scalable and reliable framework for Semantic Portals which is an extension of our existing SEAL approach .', u'We il- lustrate the instantiation of our framework by the real-world example of a heterogeneous and distributed infrastructure of Semantic Portals , viz .', u'the portal of our institute AIFB , the OntoWeb.org portals and the KM-Vision.org portal .', u'The approach relies on the application of current semantic technologies whereby we still keep practical usability .', u'Gener- ally , we show that our approach can be used to build up Semantic Portals from scratch or to build up on existing portal infrastructures as a lay- ered SemanticPortal on top .', u'We present several modi for integration of multiple portals and show how we address practical issues like scalability and robustness of SemanticPortals .']

entities: [[(u'heterogeneous ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed and intelligent environments', u'Task')], [(u'ontology mapping', u'Task'), (u'meaning of entity names', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic heterogeneity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantically enriched model of ontologies', u'Method'), (u'domain concept', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'sortan entity type', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'identity criteria', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concepts', u'Generic'), (u'philosophical notions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'identity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rigidity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dependency', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'classification', u'Task'), (u'concept-level properties', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'meta-knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'they', u'Generic'), (u'meta-knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'meta knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic correspondences', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'meaning of entity names', u'USED-FOR', u'them')], [(u'semantically enriched model of ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic heterogeneity'), (u'identity', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'philosophical notions'), (u'identity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rigidity'), (u'rigidity', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'philosophical notions'), (u'rigidity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dependency'), (u'dependency', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'philosophical notions')], [(u'meta-knowledge', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'concept-level properties'), (u'meta-knowledge )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'concept-level properties')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Matching between heterogeneous ontologies becomes crucial for interoperability in distributed and intelligent environments .', u'Although many efforts in ontology mapping have already been conducted , most of them rely heavily on the meaning of entity names , rather than the semantics defined in ontologies .', u'In order to deal with semantic heterogeneity , we propose a semantically enriched model of ontologies ( called MetaOntoModel ) where every domain concept is treated as a sortan entity type that carries identity criteria for its instancesand classified these concepts based on three philosophical notions : identity , rigidity , and dependency .', u'According to the classification , concept-level properties ( called meta-knowledge ) are embedded for each concept .', u'Our novel idea is that if two concepts are semantically equivalent , then they have the same meta-knowledge .', u'On the contrary , if two concepts possess different kinds of meta knowledge , then they can not be matched .', u'We also prove that meta-knowledge can determine not only the scope of semantic correspondences , but also which properties are the most relevant in finding correspondence between two similar concepts .']

entities: [[(u'mapping/merging of ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'HCONE-merge approach', u'Method'), (u'merging process', u'Task')], [(u'HCONE-merge', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'WordNet senses', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Latent Semantic Indexing ( LSI ) method', u'Method')], [(u'mappings', u'Method'), (u'reasoning services of description logics', u'Method'), (u'HCONE-merge', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'mapping of concepts', u'Task'), (u'HCONE-merge approach', u'Method')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'ontology mapping', u'Task'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology merging', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'them', u'USED-FOR', u'WordNet senses'), (u'Latent Semantic Indexing ( LSI ) method', u'USED-FOR', u'WordNet senses')], [], [], [(u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology mapping')], []]
sentences: [u"Latest research efforts on the semi-automatic coordination of ontologies `` touch '' on the mapping/merging of ontologies using the whole breadth of available knowledge .", u'Addressing this issue , this paper presents the HCONE-merge approach , which is further extended towards automating the merging process .', u'HCONE-merge makes use of the intended informal meaning of concepts by mapping them to WordNet senses using the Latent Semantic Indexing ( LSI ) method .', u'Based on these mappings and using the reasoning services of description logics , HCONE-merge automatically aligns and then merges ontologies .', u'Since the mapping of concepts to their intended meaning is an essential step of the HCONE-merge approach , this paper explores the level of human involvement required for mapping concepts of the source ontologies to their intended meanings .', u'We propose a series of methods for ontology mapping ( towards merging ) with varying degrees of human involvement and evaluate them experimentally .', u'We conclude that , although an effective fully automated process is not attainable , we can reach a point where ontology merging can be carried out efficiently with minimum human involvement .']

relations: [[], [(u'Multilingual lexical resources', u'USED-FOR', u'map concepts')], [(u'retrieval of candidate matches', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'cross-lingual ontology mapping tasks')], [(u'mapped wordnets', u'USED-FOR', u'one')], [(u'synonym richness', u'CONJUNCTION', u'position')], [(u'word-translation correctness', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'translation eectiveness'), (u'word-translation correctness', u'CONJUNCTION', u'word sense coverage'), (u'word sense coverage', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'translation eectiveness'), (u'word sense coverage', u'CONJUNCTION', u'synset'), (u'word sense coverage', u'CONJUNCTION', u'synonym coverage'), (u'synset', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'translation eectiveness'), (u'synset', u'CONJUNCTION', u'synonym coverage'), (u'synonym coverage', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'translation eectiveness')], []]
sentences: [u'Accessing or integrating data lexicalized in dierent languages is a challenge .', u'Multilingual lexical resources play a fundamental role in reducing the language barriers to map concepts lexicalized in dierent languages .', u'In this paper we present a large-scale study on the eectiveness of automatic translations to support two key cross-lingual ontology mapping tasks : the retrieval of candidate matches and the selection of the correct matches for inclusion in the nal alignment .', u'We conduct our experiments using four dierent large gold standards , each one consisting of a pair of mapped wordnets , to cover four dierent families of languages .', u'We categorize concepts based on their lexicalization ( type of words , synonym richness , position in a subconcept graph ) and analyze their distributions in the gold standards .', u'Leveraging this categorization , we measure several aspects of translation eectiveness , such as word-translation correctness , word sense coverage , synset and synonym coverage .', u'Finally , we thoroughly discuss several ndings of our study , which we believe are helpful for the design of more sophisticated cross-lingual mapping algorithms .']

relations: [[(u'semantic information integration approach', u'USED-FOR', u'agent-based electronic markets'), (u'ontology-based technology', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic information integration approach'), (u'social networks', u'USED-FOR', u'trust relationships')], [(u'software agents', u'USED-FOR', u'ecommerce')], [], [], [], [(u'ontology-services', u'USED-FOR', u'agents interoperability')], [(u'consumer needs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'market capacities'), (u'consumer needs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semi-automatic mode'), (u'market capacities', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semi-automatic mode'), (u'social networks', u'USED-FOR', u'trust relationships')]]
sentences: [u'This paper proposes a semantic information integration approach for agent-based electronic markets based on ontology-based technology , improved by the application and exploitation of the trust relationships captured by the social networks .', u'We intent face the problem of the growth of ecommerce using software agents to support both customers and suppliers in buying and selling products .', u'The diversity of the involved actors leads to different conceptualizations of the needs and capabilities , giving rise to semantic incompatibilities between them .', u'It is hard to find two agents using precisely the same vocabulary .', u'They usually have a heterogeneous private vocabulary defined in their own private ontology .', u'In order to provide help in the conversation among different agents , we are proposing what we call ontology-services to facilitate agents interoperability .', u'More specifically , this work proposes an ontology-based information integration approach , exploiting the ontology mapping paradigm , by aligning consumer needs and the market capacities , in a semi-automatic mode , improved by the application and exploitation of the trust relationships captured by the social networks .']

entities: [[(u'semantic heterogeneity', u'Task'), (u'semantic mapping technologies', u'Method')], [(u'semantic mapping technologies', u'Method'), (u'semantic data integration task', u'Task')], [(u'domain expertise', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge engineering', u'Method')], [(u'abstract semantic mapping representation', u'Method'), (u'UML', u'Method'), (u'ontology mapping', u'Task')], [(u'domain experts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mappings', u'Method'), (u'UML representation', u'Method')], [(u'UML representation', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'mapping task', u'Task'), (u'UML representation', u'Method'), (u'tool', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'semantic mapping technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'domain experts'), (u'semantic mapping technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic data integration task')], [], [(u'abstract semantic mapping representation', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology mapping'), (u'UML', u'USED-FOR', u'abstract semantic mapping representation'), (u'UML', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology mapping')], [(u'domain experts', u'USED-FOR', u'mappings')], [], []]
sentences: [u'To address the problem of semantic heterogeneity , there has been a large body of research directed to the study of semantic mapping technologies .', u'Although various semantic mapping technologies have been investigated , facilitating the process for domain experts to perform a semantic data integration task is not an easy task .', u'This is because one is required not only to possess domain expertise but also to have a good understanding of knowledge engineering .', u'This work proposes an abstract semantic mapping representation using UML for undertaking ontology mapping .', u'The aim is to enable domain experts ( particularly system engineers ) to undertake mappings using the proposed UML representation that they are familiar with , while ensuring accuracy and ease of use of the automatically generated mappings .', u'The proposed UML representation is evaluated through usability experiments ( undertaken by system engineers ) using a developed tool that was developed to implement the propose approach .', u'The results show that the participants could correctly undertake the mapping task using the proposed UML representation and that the tool generated correct and executable mappings .']

entities: [[(u'heterogeneous knowledge models', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge representation standards', u'Method'), (u'conceptualisation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ontology mapping approaches', u'Method'), (u'symbolic entities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cognitive soundness', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge representation paradigms', u'Method'), (u'approaches', u'Generic')], [(u'representational approach', u'Method'), (u'symbolic ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Conceptual Spaces ( CS )', u'Method'), (u'automated computation of similarities', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'symbolic entities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'spacetime', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'symbols', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'bottom-up production of meaning', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'representational approach', u'USED-FOR', u'symbolic ontologies')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The increasing availability of ontologies raises the need to establish relationships and make inferences across heterogeneous knowledge models .', u'The approach proposed and supported by knowledge representation standards consists in establishing formal symbolic descriptions of a conceptualisation , which , it has been argued , lack grounding and are not expressive enough to allow to identify relations across separate ontologies .', u'Ontology mapping approaches address this issue by exploiting structural or linguistic similarities between symbolic entities , which is costly , error-prone , and in most cases lack cognitive soundness .', u'We argue that knowledge representation paradigms should have a better support for similarity and propose two distinct approaches to achieve it .', u'We first present a representational approach which allows to ground symbolic ontologies by using Conceptual Spaces ( CS ) , allowing for automated computation of similarities between instances across ontologies .', u'An alternative approach is presented , which considers symbolic entities as contextual interpretations of processes in spacetime or Differences .', u'By becoming a process of interpretation , symbols acquire the same status as other processes in the world and can be described ( tagged ) as well , which allows the bottom-up production of meaning .']

entities: [[(u'context-aware phonebook application', u'Task'), (u'collaborative context experience system', u'Method')], [(u'notification rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'phonebook-based contextual situations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'collaborative system', u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'generalization', u'Task')], [(u'Similarities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'collaborative knowledge sharing mechanism', u'Method'), (u'semantic technology', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u"Starting from a context-aware phonebook application , which allows users to see their contacts ' situation , we introduce a collaborative context experience system .", u'Users independently create notification rules , describing phonebook-based contextual situations for which they wish to receive notifications .', u'The collaborative system gathers such rules from all users , and identifies important ones , that is , frequently declared ones .', u'These rules are then processed to allow for generalization , and provided to users who can encounter a similar contextual situation .', u'Similarities for this collaborative knowledge sharing mechanism are processed by applying semantic technology .']

sentences: [u'The Control and Command ( C2 ) is the core of the warfare operation , applying semantic technology to C2 is an up-to-date research direction which is used to achieve information sharing quickly and effectively for improving information service.Aiming at extending extend the PCANS model , extended PCANS ( ePCANS ) C2 organization model is built.This paper proides and provide architecture concepts of C2 organization and researches modeling methodology of C2 organization ontology on the basis of ePCANS model.The results have inpoitant refer ance value to the concept and opplication of C2 organization .']

sentences: [u'The planning and engineering of industrial plants is characterized by a heterogeneous landscape of tools and data formats covering multiple engineering aspects , such as electrical engineering , mechanical engineering , software engineering , etc .', u'To provide plant engineers in different roles with an integrated view on engineering data , we propose a conceptual modelling approach based on MOF layering for representing plant knowledge across multiple disciplins .', u'Furthermore , we suggest to instantiate this conceptual modelling approach on a semantic technology stack featuring semantic data representation based on RDF and web-based plant navigation in a semantic Wiki .']
