sentences: [u'There are two major trends of industrial application for semantic technologies : integration and analytics .', u'The integration potential of semantics was the first one which came to industrial implementation , particularly due to adoption of semantic platform by ISO 15926 standard .', u'But there are certain problems in practical use of this standard , so integration is often built without using it .', u'We will show an example of implementation of semantic Enterprise Service Bus in RosEnergoTrans company , and discuss whether it was better to rely on ISO 15926 ontologies for this project .', u'Adding analytic features to semantic solution gives it much more business value that integration itself can offer .', u"We will discuss semantic solutions from this point of view , and compare analytical potential of ISO 15926 data models with `` simple '' semantics ."]

entities: [[(u'Forums', u'Material'), (u'knowledge creation', u'Task')], [(u'educational forums', u'Material'), (u'online educational environments', u'Task'), (u'topic disruption', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'forum thread', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'forum discussions', u'Task'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'statistical method', u'Method'), (u'online discussion forums', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Forums', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge creation')], [], [], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'statistical method'), (u'statistical method', u'USED-FOR', u'method')]]
sentences: [u'Forums play a key role in the process of knowledge creation , providing means for users to exchange ideas and to collaborate .', u'However , educational forums , along several others online educational environments , often suffer from topic disruption .', u'Since the contents are mainly produced by participants ( in our case learners ) , one or a few individuals might change the course of the discussions .', u'Thus , realigning the discussed topics of a forum thread is a task often conducted by a tutor or moderator .', u'In order to support learners and tutors to harmonically align forum discussions that are pertinent to a given lecture or course , in this paper , we present a method that combines semantic technologies and a statistical method to find and expose relevant topics to be discussed in online discussion forums .']

sentences: [u'This paper discusses the role of interaction and user experience in the design of an interface of search for digital libraries .', u"We present our preliminary work in the design of an advanced interaction interface for `` Publicamente '' , a web based semantic multimedia digital library that allows the archiving , man- agement and access to a collection of heterogeneous documents types .", u'In this paper we explore the user requirements , and present the design guidelines for the interface of the system .', u"Users of `` Publicamente '' are be both expert users and casual users and the interface need to being able to accommodate different search styles , make semantic technologies transparent to casual users , and leve- rage on the semantic layer in the presentation of the retrieved information and its context ."]

sentences: [u'In order to be part of a modern society , Parliaments must open up to the public in the process of making new laws .', u'The approach presented in this paper is conceptualized as a social system where information and communication technologies can change : ( i ) the way people interact with their elected representatives in Parliaments , ( ii ) the way people access to parliamentary proceedings and ( iii ) the way people subscribe to new parliamentary contents .', u'In this paper , we explore the use of multimedia content delivery technologies , semantic technologies , personalized retrieval of multimedia contents and social feedback in order to present a smart information system for parliamentary proceedings .', u'Currently , this approach is being developed for plenary sessions of the Parliament of the Canary Islands .']

sentences: [u'The possession of mobile devices with the always online # R # # N # paradigm eased a lot our communication habits : contacting somebody # R # # N # is becoming more and easier .', u'A major drawback of this is the scenario # R # # N # when an important meeting is interrupted by an unexpected phone call # R # # N # from a friend .', u'The need for an ecient control of unexpected incoming # R # # N # communication intention is immediate .', u'This paper proposes the ecient # R # # N # handling of interruptions from the user modeling perspective.We propose # R # # N # a mechanism to build user preferences that specify the level of interrupt- # R # # N # ibility during an activity , situation or event .', u'The proposed mechanism is # R # # N # built upon semantic technologies for dynamic and interoperability pur- # R # # N # poses .']

relations: [[], [(u'Interactive Concept Discovery', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'eLearning tools'), (u'Interactive Concept Discovery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'InCoD ) Learning')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this presentation we describe a new pedagogy that focuses learners attention on deep comprehension of the conceptual content of learned material .', u'Two new eLearning tools are described in some detail : Interactive Concept Discovery ( InCoD ) Learning ; and Meaning Equivalence Reusable Learning Objects ( MERLO ) .', u'These semantic technologies were developed at Ontario Institute for Studies in Education and Resource Centre for Academic Technology of University of Toronto , and tested since 2001 in several academic institutions in Canada and at the Russian Academy of Sciences ( patents pending ) .', u'We describe the rationale for developing these instructional tools ; their main characteristics ; and results of several evaluative implementations that demonstrate their potential to enhance learning outcomes and to provide authentic , credible , evidence-based formative and summative assessments of learning processes .']

entities: [[(u'data node', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'industrial applications', u'Task'), (u'data nodes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'nodes', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'distributed service-oriented architecture', u'Method'), (u'task', u'Generic')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'data nodes', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'product tracing', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'distributed service-oriented architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'task')], [], [(u'Semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'heterogeneity')], [(u'architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'product tracing')]]
sentences: [u'The current Internet of Things ( IoT ) has made it very convenient to obtain information about a product from a single data node .', u'However , in many industrial applications , information about a single product can be distributed in multiple different data nodes , and aggregating the information from these nodes has become a common task .', u'In this paper , we provide a distributed service-oriented architecture for this task .', u'In this architecture , each manufacturer provides service for their own products , and data nodes keep the information collected by themselves .', u'Semantic technologies are adopted to handle problems of heterogeneity and serve as the foundation to support different applications .', u'Finally , as an example , we illustrate the use of this architecture to solve the problem of product tracing .']

sentences: [u'A major challenge in information management today is the integration of huge amounts of data distributed across multiple data sources .', u'A suggested approach to this problem is ontology-based data integration where legacy data systems are integrated via a common ontology that represents a unified global view over all data sources .', u'However , data is often not natively born using these ontologies .', u'Instead , much data resides in legacy relational databases .', u'Therefore , mappings that relate the legacy relational data sources to the ontology need to be constructed .', u'Recent techniques and systems that automatically construct such mappings have been developed .', u'The quality metrics of these systems are , however , often only based on self-designed benchmarks .', u'This paper introduces a new publicly available benchmarking suite called RODI , which is designed to cover a wide range of mapping challenges in Relational-to-Ontology Data Integration scenarios .', u'RODI provides a set of different relational data sources and ontologies representing a wide range of mapping challenges as well as a scoring function with which the performance of relational-to-ontology mapping construction systems may be evaluated .']

sentences: [u'AbstractThis paper introduces an ontology mapping approach based on triangle fuzzy expression .', u'This approach imports several kinds of similarity fuzzy expressions based on concept feature information .', u'These similarity fuzzy expressions can be used to extend traditional mapping based on name and instance to composite mapping based on name , instance , attribute , taxonomy , dependence and axiom etc .', u'To implement this approach , two questions should be answered : the first is the unification of all kinds of similarity fuzzy expressions and the second is how to realize the composite mapping based on the unified similarity fuzzy expression .', u'The triangle fuzzy expression is regarded as the criterion of the other similarity fuzzy expressions .', u'After the transformation from the other similarity fuzzy expressions to the triangle fuzzy expression , the unified similarity fuzzy expression is realized .', u'Simultaneously , a mapping computation tree is also introduced to finish the whole composite mapping through a series of weight configuration , unification and synthesis .', u'Finally , associated with traditional non-fuzzy mapping approach , the mapping accuracy of this approach will be evaluated through an application example .']

sentences: [u'Web Services have been widely adopted in business projects , and almost all Web Service developers agree that security factors are the principal components that must be taken into consideration .', u'A large number of security metrics and measurements is available for specific business needs , and the best practice for different business demands is therefore needed if the quality of service security metrics ( Qos-SM ) is to be developed .', u'This research proposes a new way of developing Qos-SM using Qos ontology mapping with two information system standards , COBIT and ITIL , as a result of which new Qos-SM are developed .', u'In order to prove the correctness and precision of the metrics , the researchers have used the metrics to measure the level of security quality from Web service data sets .', u'The experimental results , based on vector analysis , show that the same level of security quality is attained with both of the metrics developed and the metrics from previous research .', u'This research also represents the metrics in the form of a class diagram , thus facilitating its application in the organization .']

entities: [[(u'Knowledge', u'Material'), (u'product-orientated manufacturing', u'Task')], [(u'networked technologies', u'Method'), (u'high-efficiency , energy-saving and service-orientated manufacturing models', u'Method'), (u'Cloud Manufacturing', u'Method')], [(u'Cloud Manufacturing', u'Task'), (u'service-orientated support', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'service-orientated knowledge fusion architecture', u'Method')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge', u'Generic'), (u'Cloud Manufacturing platform', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge organization model', u'Method'), (u'knowledge fusion', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology mapping', u'Method'), (u'fusion', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'Knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'product-orientated manufacturing')], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'ontology mapping', u'CONJUNCTION', u'fusion')], []]
sentences: [u'Knowledge is playing a more and more significant role in this knowledge-intensive world , particularly in product-orientated manufacturing in which design knowledge reuse would promote the procedure of new product development .', u'Meanwhile , with increasing applications of Internet and other networked technologies , as well as emerging needs for high-efficiency , energy-saving and service-orientated manufacturing models , Cloud Manufacturing is proposed to meet those needs .', u'In Cloud Manufacturing , all the resources are organized dynamically to provide service-orientated support .', u'However , knowledge is distributed in each braches and subsidiaries of Group Corporation and possesses heterogeneity which would limit the sharing of knowledge across the whole Group Corporation .', u'To deal with those problems , a service-orientated knowledge fusion architecture is presented in this paper .', u'In this architecture , knowledge is packaged as service in the Cloud Manufacturing platform that users could access according to their needs .', u'Base on the knowledge organization model , knowledge fusion could be fulfilled through the ontology mapping and fusion .', u'In the end , conclusion is made about the efficiency of this architecture']

entities: [[(u'multi-scale data analysis', u'Task')], [(u'summary information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'trends', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'law enforcement', u'Task')], [], [(u'CubeLink system', u'Method'), (u'relational data cubes', u'Material'), (u'link analytical semantic graphs', u'Method')], [(u'CubeLink', u'Method'), (u'formal mapping', u'Method'), (u'multidimensional data analysis', u'Method'), (u'link analysis', u'Task')], [(u'automatic schema-ontology mapping', u'Task'), (u'OLAP data cubes', u'Material'), (u'semantic graphs databases', u'Material'), (u'meta-data', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dimensional typing', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'The challenges facing the Department of Homeland Security ( DHS ) require not only multi-dimensional , but also multi-scale data analysis .', u'In particular , the ability to seamlessly move from summary information , such as trends , into detailed analysis of individual entities , while critical for law enforcement , typically requires manually transferring information among multiple tools .', u"Such time-consuming and error prone processes significantly hamper the analysts ' ability to quickly explore data and identify threats .", u'As part of a DHS Science and Technology effort , we have been developing and deploying for Immigration and Customs Enforcement the CubeLink system integrating information between relational data cubes and link analytical semantic graphs .', u'In this paper we describe CubeLink in terms of the underlying components , their integration , and the formal mapping from multidimensional data analysis into link analysis .', u"In so doing , we provide a formal basis for one particular form of automatic schema-ontology mapping from OLAP data cubes to semantic graphs databases , and point the way towards future `` intelligent '' OLAP data cubes equipped with meta-data about their dimensional typing ."]

sentences: [u'Todays market evolution and high volatility of business requirements put an increasing emphasis on the ability for systems to accommodate the changes required by new organizational needs while maintaining security objectives satisfiability .', u'This is all the more true in case of collaboration and interoperability between different organizations and thus between their information systems .', u'Ontology mapping has been used for interoperability and several mapping systems have evolv ed to support the same .', u'Usual solutions do not take care of security .', u'That is almost all systems do a mapping of ontologies which are unsecured .', u'We have developed a system for mapping secured ontologies using graph similarity concept .', u'Here we give no importance to the strings that describe ontology concepts , properties etc .', u'Because these strings may be encrypted in the secured ontology .', u'Instead we use the pure graphical structure to determine mapping between various concepts of given two secured ontologies .', u'The paper also gives the measure of accuracy of experiment in a tabular form in terms of precision , recall and F -measure .']

sentences: [u'Usually , integration of business intelligence ( BI ) from realistic telecom enterprise is by packing data warehouse ( DW ) , OLAP , data mining and reporting from different vendors together .', u'As a result , BI system users are transferred to a reporting system with reports , data models , dimensions and measures predefined by system designers .', u'As a result of survey , 85 % of DW projects failed to meet their intended objectives .', u'In this paper , we investigate how to integrate BI packages into an adaptive and flexible knowledge portal by constructing an internal link and communication channel from top-level business concepts to underlying enterprise information systems ( EIS ) .', u'An approach of three-level ontology services is developed , which implements unified naming , directory and transport of ontology services , and ontology mapping and query parsing among conceptual view , analytical view and physical view from user interfaces through DW to EIS .', u'Experiments on top of real telecom EIS shows that our solution for integrating BI presents much stronger power to support operational decision making more user-friendly and adaptively compared with those simply combining BI products presently available together .']

sentences: [u'A heterogeneous system interoperation framework based on multi-layer ontology was proposed to solve the problems of integrating heterogeneous systems during the business collaboration.Using the key components of business collaboration : product , activity , process as a point of departure , the framework defines a multi-layer ontology model composed of product knowledge ontology , activity ontology , and process ontology , to realize the semantic consistency of multi-components in collaboration process.Product knowledge ontology supports the product specification in activity ontology ; activity ontology describes the concept , function , implementation of each procedure or action in process ; and process ontology connects various activities by control construction to compose business process.The combined mapping theory and the semantic similarity semantic algorithm realize the semantic mapping and integration among different ontology libraries and achieve upper ontology.OWL-S is used to describe the release and request of Web service.The example of cloth sale showed how the business interoperation mechanism works to achieve business ordering process matching using the ontology mapping module and the semantic matching module in the prototype system .']

sentences: [u'In spite of being provided the abundant raw data from World Wide Web ( WWW ) , it is difficult to make any sense out of such massive data without data mining techniques .', u'In this paper , we emphasize on the mining of web access logs , web usage data .', u'Our propose framework is composed of five steps .', u'The first step is defining the purposes that our multipurpose analyzer can provide .', u'In second step , we define the ontology mapping based on Web Sites defined in the previous step .', u'After that , we perform preprocessing step base on our web log access data as the fundamental requirements of the proposed framework .', u'Web usage based mining based on frequent item sets and our proposed algorithms are the core step of the system .', u'In the final step , Naive Bayesian classifier is applied to predict for the future depending on the current analysis outcomes .', u'Our system is intended to provide for Web Site Maintainers , Web Site Developers , Personalization Systems , Pre-fetched Systems , Recommender Systems and Web Site Analysts , etc .']

sentences: [u'In this paper , we describe a machine learning approach to ontology mapping .', u'Although Machine learning techniques have been used earlier in many semantic integration approaches , dependence on precision recall curves to preset the weights and thresholds of the learning systems has been a serious bottleneck .', u'By recasting the mapping problem to a classification problem we try to automate this step and develop a robust and extendable meta learning algorithm .', u'The implication is that we can now extend the same method to map the ontology pairs with different similarity measures which might not be specialized for the specific domain , yet obtain results comparable to the state of the art mapping algorithms that exploit machine learning methods .', u'Interestingly we see that as the similarity measures are diluted , our approach performs significantly better for unbalanced classes .', u'We have tested our approach using several similarity measures and two real world ontologies , and the test results we discuss validate our claim .', u'We also present a discussion on the benefits of the proposed meta learning algorithm .']

relations: [[(u'semantics change', u'USED-FOR', u'data product')], [(u'ontology framework', u'USED-FOR', u'evolution of plain text')], [(u'DATAGENOME ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'semantics of plain text'), (u'intrinsic semantics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'CONTEXT ontology'), (u'CONTEXT ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'extension semantics')], [(u'chapter structure of plain text', u'USED-FOR', u'CONNOTATION ontology')], [(u'SECTION', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SENTENCE class')], [(u'CONTEXT ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'CONNOTATION ontology')], [], [], [(u'correlation of intrinsic semantics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'extension semantics')]]
sentences: [u'Data evolution is the process of semantics change for data product , in which data product has intrinsic semantics as well as extension semantics .', u'This paper presents an ontology framework for evolution of plain text .', u'The semantics of plain text is modeled as DATAGENOME ontology , including CONNOTATION ontology for expressing the intrinsic semantics and CONTEXT ontology for representing the extension semantics .', u'CONNOTATION ontology is constructed according to the chapter structure of plain text .', u'CHAPTER , SECTION , PARAGRAPH and SENTENCE class are used to describe a chapter , section , paragraph and sentence of plain text separately .', u'CONNOTATION ontology may accompany with many CONTEXT ontologies .', u'CONTEXT ontology consists of eight interconnected dimensions including what , when , where , who , how , which , why and awarings , is the description of virtual environment that lead to the existence of connotation .', u'Instances of the CONNOTATION ontology can be viewed as a tree according to the relationship among them , so do the instances of COTEXT ontology .', u'Mapping between connotation ontology tree and context tree show the correlation of intrinsic semantics and extension semantics .']

relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'Java-based plug-in system', u'USED-FOR', u'functionalities'), (u'architectural design', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'This paper proposes a new methodology for checking conformance of the software architectural design of Learning Management System ( LMS ) to Learning Technology System Architecture ( LTSA ) .', u'In our approach , the architectural designing of LMS follows the formal modeling style of Acme .', u'An ontology is built to represent the LTSA rules and the software architecture in Acme style .', u'Conformity of the design with LTSA rules is tested by reasoning the ontology with the query language SPARQL .', u'A Java-based plug-in system is introduced to implement functionalities like loading the elements of the architectural design into the ontology , mapping the architectural elements with LTSA elements , and performing the conformance test .', u'The advantage of the proposed methodology is two-folded .', u'First , it verifies an important software quality attribute conformance to technical standard at an early stage of development , like high-level design phase .', u'Secondly , instead of the conventional manual checklist based approach of conformance testing , this methodology focuses on an automated way to finding the conformance level of the system under check .']

sentences: [u'The paper presents a model to detect terrorism evi- dence in textual documents .', u'The model pre-processes domain spe- cific documents to extract the general patterns of text associated with the domain .', u'The model then incorporates the Conditional Random Field ( CRF ) model for detection of sentences containing patterns of terrorism evidence .', u'For incorporation of CRF model , the features are selected from generalized patterns rather than the text itself .', u'We prepared a small data set of manually tagged instances of terrorism evidence for training and testing the model .', u'We found that the proposed model achieves better results than other models such as Hidden Markov Model or conventional CRF which are directly applied to text .', u'The proposed model can be applied for improvement of terrorism event extraction and ontology creation systems , especially with the focus towards their effective role in Open Source Intelligence .', u'We describe briefly the existing systems along with possible improvements with incorporation of the presented model at different levels .', u'Index TermsOpen Source Intelligence , Terrorism Evidence Detection , Conditional Random Fields , Terrorism Ontology , Ter- rorism Event Extraction']

relations: [[(u'Semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'social networks')], [], [], [], [], [(u'semantic alignment function', u'USED-FOR', u'divide-and-conquer approach'), (u'multiplex social networks', u'USED-FOR', u'divide-and-conquer approach')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic technologies exploit to support collaborations in social networks .', u'However , these networks assume that linkages between actors should be ignored , more exactly , semantically identical .', u"For example , in bibliometrics , links on network are described with only 'co-authoring ' relationship between the actors .", u'In this paper , we focus on analysing semantically multiplex social networks , representing various relationships between people simultaneously .', u'Especially , we show how to discover important social patterns , from the networks .', u'Thereby , we propose a divide-and-conquer approach based on semantic alignment function , separating the multiplex social networks with respect to concepts describing the relationship .', u'Additionally , we exploit the relationships between topological features and the labels by statistical co-occurrence analysis .', u'Finally , we demonstrate our three-layered semantic space with some examples .']

entities: [[(u'Regulatory compliance', u'Metric'), (u'business domains', u'Material')], [(u'Financial Services', u'Task'), (u'regulations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'machine assistance', u'Task'), (u'regulatory text', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'financial services regulations', u'Task')], [(u'Legal/ Regulatory Subject-Matter-Experts', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic')], [(u'regulatory ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Subject-Matter-Expert-centric approach', u'Method'), (u'regulatory ontologies', u'Task'), (u'structured natural language', u'Material'), (u'Semantics of Business Vocabulary', u'Method'), (u'business Rules SBVR', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Legal/ Regulatory Subject-Matter-Experts', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [], [(u'Subject-Matter-Expert-centric approach', u'USED-FOR', u'regulatory ontologies'), (u'structured natural language', u'USED-FOR', u'Subject-Matter-Expert-centric approach'), (u'Semantics of Business Vocabulary', u'CONJUNCTION', u'business Rules SBVR')]]
sentences: [u'Regulatory compliance has proved to be difficult and time consuming across business domains .', u'In Financial Services , the wide and complex spectrum of regulations calls for machine assistance in making sense of , and in consuming , the regulatory text .', u'Semantic technologies , and Ontologies in particular , bring new solutions to the challenges in consuming financial services regulations that traditional technologies fell short in addressing .', u'Current state-of-the-art related work is silent on the role of Legal/ Regulatory Subject-Matter-Experts in building these ontologies .', u'This paper presents an on-going study on creating regulatory ontologies .', u'It describes a Subject-Matter-Expert-centric approach to collaborative development of regulatory ontologies using structured natural language , Semantics of Business Vocabulary and business Rules SBVR in particular .']

sentences: [u'The striking ability of music to elicit emotions assures its prominent status in human culture and every day life .', u'Music is often enjoyed and sought for its ability to induce or convey emotions , which may manifest in anything from a slight variation in mood , to changes in our physical condition and actions .', u'Consequently , research on how we might associate musical pieces with emotions and , more generally , how music brings about an emotional response is attracting ever increasing attention .', u'First , this paper provides a thorough review of studies on the relation of music and emotions from different disciplines .', u'We then propose new insights to enhance automated music emotion recognition models using recent results from psychology , musicology , affective computing , semantic technologies and music information retrieval .']

sentences: [u'In current organizations , the importance of knowledge and competence is unquestionable .', u'In Information Technology ( IT ) companies , which are , by definition , knowledge intensive , this importance is critical .', u'In such organizations , the models of knowledge exploitation include specific processes and elements that drive the production of knowledge aimed at satisfying organizational objectives .', u'However , competence evidence recollection is a highly intensive and time consuming task , which is the key point for this system .', u'SeCEC-IT is a tool based on software artifacts that extracts relevant information using natural language processing techniques .', u'It enables competence evidence detection by deducing competence facts from documents in an automated way .', u'SeCEC-IT includes within its technological components such items as semantic technologies , natural language processing , and human resource communication standards ( HR-XML ) .']

relations: [[(u'EMA ( Energy Management Adviser )', u'USED-FOR', u'personalised energy saving advice'), (u'personalised energy saving advice', u'USED-FOR', u"EDF 's customers")], [], [], []]
sentences: [u"The EMA ( Energy Management Adviser ) aims to produce personalised energy saving advice for EDF 's customers .", u"The advice takes the form of one or more 'tips ' , and personalisation is achieved using semantic technologies : customers are described using RDF , an OWL ontology provides a conceptual model of the relevant domain ( housing , environment , and so on ) and the different kinds of tips , and SPARQL query answering is used to identify relevant tips .", u'The current prototype provides tips to more than 300,000 EDF customers in France at least twice a year .', u"The main challenges for our future work include providing a timely service for all of the 35 million EDF customers in France , simplifying the system 's maintenance , and providing new ways for interacting with customers such as via a Web site ."]

sentences: [u'The ontology-based semantic approaches are gradually gaining mo- mentum in ambient intelligent environments such as smart homes , smart cars , intelligent offices , etc .', u'In spite of the significant research work carried out in the ontology design and application field , several issues remain unresolved .', u'The ontologies mainly focus on specific context information features .', u'The capabili- ties of services from different functional domains are rarely addressed and are not aligned with context ontologies .', u'No attempt has been made to integrate the existing ontologies , facilitating their future extension with emerging new tech- nologies for networks , devices , software architectures and platforms .', u'Moreover , the application developer support facilitating better understanding of semantic technologies is still in its infancy .', u'The research work presented in this paper tackles the aforementioned issues .']

entities: [[(u'computational analysis of verbal humor', u'Task'), (u'natural language cognition', u'Task')], [(u'computational humor', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'humor theories', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'computer', u'Generic'), (u'Ontological Semantic Technology', u'Method'), (u'meaning access approach', u'Method'), (u'natural language processing', u'Task')]]
sentences: [u'This paper deals with a contribution of computational analysis of verbal humor to natural language cognition .', u'After a brief introduction to the growing area of computational humor and of its roots in humor theories , it describes and compares the results of a human-subject and computer experiment .', u'The specific interest is to compare how well the computer , equipped with the resources and methodologies of the Ontological Semantic Technology , a comprehensive meaning access approach to natural language processing , can model several aspects of the cognitive behaviors of humans processing jokes from the Internet .']

sentences: [u'The web service discovery is the important part of web service systems construction.At present the mainstream approach to web discovery adopts the service matching based on the UDDI framework.However , UDDI register center only offers the search route through key words as well as lacking in the support of semantic information , thus causing inaccuracy and incompleteness.In response to the deficiency of present web service discovery technology , a solution to the problem-semantic technology is proposed and service dis-covery archetype framework is designed , so as to testify the feasibility of service discovery approach based on semantics .']

sentences: [u'Aiming at the multi-source and heteromerous characteristics of network security data , the semantic technology is imported to the data collection model based on agent , and a network security data collection model is designed which is distributed collecting and centralized managing.Based on the semantic agents , the model designed in this paper collects the multi-source and heteromerous security data , and represents it uniformly to standard data with semantic , so that it can provide more fully , reliable , accurate and easier understand data for other systems without semantic understanding error .']

sentences: [u'As documents become disseminated widely , establishing the context for interpretation becomes difficult .', u'We argue that high-impact documents require embedded user assistance facilities for their readers ( not authors ) to cope with their semantic complexity .', u'We suggest to illustrate such documents and their players with a semiformal background ontology , an interpretation mapping between domain concepts and semantic objects , and to enable with this setup semantic interaction .', u'We showcase the feasibility and interactional potential of user assistance for documents based on interactional semantic technology with an exemplary implementation for a high-impact Excel spreadsheet .']

sentences: [u"A grid is a large-scale resource sharing technology , which increases resource utilization by distributed collaboration.Grid service discovery is the basis and prerequisite for using the grid , but grid service discovery in the recall and precision rates ca n't reach a satisfactory level.This paper proposed the concept of service behavior , and used the semantic technology to note it.On this basis , a semantic annotation service behavior based grid service discovery algorithm was proposed.Experiments show that this algorithm is better than the traditional method.It has higher accuracy and recall rate , and stability ."]

sentences: [u'As regulatory actions against copyright infringement have become to a large degree ineffective in the global context of Internet , new solutions balancing the interests of copyright owners , users and intermediaries were required .', u'Semantic technology applied to Copyright may be considered an alternative to DRM or TPM systems , as metadata can be associated with a work , its title , author or right holder and intellectual property rights involved , so combining query languages and applications , the use or diffusion of those contents over the Internet can be controlled ( authorizing or denying them ) in what we named Semantic Copyright .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'issues')]]
sentences: [u'The interlinking , maintenance and updating of different Linked Data repositories is steadily becoming a critical issue as the amount of published data increases .', u'Hence , the automation or the provision of substantial computational support in various phases of the management process is a particularly important topic .', u'The present paper discusses the main considerations of managing and evolving Linked Data repositories and proposes an experimental methodology , based on the usage of unstructured online information , for handling the issues emerging from the Linked Data management process .']

sentences: [u'Linked Data is a web standard data definition method devised to connect , expand resources with a standardized type .', u'Linked Data built in various areas expands existing knowledge through an open data cloud like LOD ( Linked Open Data ) .', u'A project to link and service existing knowledge through LOD is under way worldwide .', u'However , LOD project in domestic is being participated in a specific field to the level of research .', u'In this paper , we suggests a method to build the area of technical knowledge like legislations in type of Linked Data , and distribute such Linked Data built to LOD .', u'The construction method suggested by this paper divides knowledge of legislations in structural , semantic , and integrated perspective , and builds each of them by converting to Linked Data according to the perspective .', u'Also , such built Linked Legal Data prepares to link knowledge in a standardized type by distributing them onto LOD .', u'Built Linked Legal Data are equipped with schema for link service in various types , and give help increase understand the access type to existing legal information .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'linked data resources', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SPARQL query')], [(u'collaborative Web platform', u'USED-FOR', u'syndication templates')], [(u'Templates', u'USED-FOR', u'applications'), (u'linked data resources', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SPARQL query results'), (u'linked data resources', u'USED-FOR', u'applications'), (u'SPARQL query results', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications'), (u'personal homepages', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications'), (u'personal homepages', u'CONJUNCTION', u'blogs/wikis'), (u'blogs/wikis', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications'), (u'blogs/wikis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'mobile widgets'), (u'mobile widgets', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications')], [], [], [(u'diagrams', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RSS feeds'), (u'RSS feeds', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mashups')]]
sentences: [u'Recently , the publishing of structured , semantic information as linked data has gained quite some momentum .', u'For ordinary users on the Internet , however , this information is not yet very visible and ( re- ) usable .', u'With LESS we present an end-to-end approach for the syndication and use of linked data based on the definition of templates for linked data resources and SPARQL query results .', u'Such syndication templates are edited , published and shared by using a collaborative Web platform .', u'Templates for common types of entities can then be combined with specific , linked data resources or SPARQL query results and integrated into a wide range of applications , such as personal homepages , blogs/wikis , mobile widgets etc .', u'In order to improve reliability and performance of linked data , LESS caches versions either for a certain time span or for the case of inaccessibility of the original source .', u'LESS supports the integration of information from various sources as well as any text-based output formats .', u'This allows not only to generate HTML , but also diagrams , RSS feeds or even complete data mashups without any programming involved .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'Ontology Purification System', u'USED-FOR', u'agent communication')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic web is the next generation web , which concerns the meaning of web documents It has the immense power to pull out the most relevant information from the web pages , which is also meaningful to any user , using software agents .', u"In today 's world , agent communication is not possible if concerned ontology is changed a little .", u'We have pointed out this very problem and developed an Ontology Purification System to help agent communication .', u'In our system you can send queries and view the search results .', u"If it ca n't meet the criteria then it finds out the mismatched elements .", u'Modification is done within a second and you can see the difference .', u"That 's why we emphasis on the word dynamic .", u'When Administrator is updating the system , at the same time that updation is visible to the user .']

relations: [[], [(u'id cards', u'CONJUNCTION', u'permits'), (u'permits', u'CONJUNCTION', u'e-services')], [], [(u'dynamic taxonomies', u'USED-FOR', u'solution')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'programmatic or agent-mediated access')]]
sentences: [u'Government e-services available to citizens represent one of the most frequent and critical points of contact between public administrations and citizens .', u'In addition to common services such as id cards , permits , e-services represent the only practical way of providing incentives and support to specific classes of citizens .', u'For this reason , discovery of e-services , rather than plain retrieval , is a critical functionality in e-government systems .', u'The solution we present in this paper is based on dynamic taxonomies , a semantic model for the transparent , guided , user-centric exploration of complex information bases .', u'It provides a single framework for the access and exploration of all e-government information and , differently from mainstream research in semantic web , it is intended for the direct use of end-users , rather than for programmatic or agent-mediated access .']

sentences: [u'Ontology evolution is an important problem in the Semantic Web research .', u"Recently , Alchourron , Gardenfors and Markinson 's ( AGM ) theory on belief change has been applied to deal with this problem .", u'However , most of current work only focuses on the feasibility of the application of AGM postulates on contraction to description logics ( DLs ) , a family of ontology languages .', u'So the explicit construction of a revision operator is ignored .', u'In this paper , we first generalize the AGM postulates on revision to DLs .', u'We then define two revision operators in DLs .', u'One is the weakening-based revision operator which is defined by weakening of statements in a DL knowledge base and the other is its refinement .', u'We show that both operators capture some notions of minimal change and satisfy the generalized AGM postulates for revision .']

entities: [[(u'network management models', u'Method'), (u'management information languages', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic expressiveness', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'management information models', u'Method')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic expressiveness of management information languages', u'Task')], [(u'Ontologies', u'Material'), (u'Web pages', u'Material'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'management information languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information definitions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'management languages', u'Material'), (u'behavior information', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'approach'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic expressiveness of management information languages')], [(u'Ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'Web pages'), (u'Ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantics'), (u'Web pages', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web services')], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'management information languages')]]
sentences: [u'The multiplicity of network management models may imply in some scenarios the use of multiple management information languages defining the resources to be managed .', u'Each language has a different level of semantic expressiveness , which is not easily measurable .', u'Also , these management information models can not be easily integrated due to the difficulty of translation of the semantics they contain .', u'The article proposes the use of ontologies as a new approach to improving the semantic expressiveness of management information languages .', u'Ontologies are currently used , for instance , to provide Web pages and Web services the semantics they usually lack ( known today as the semantic Web ) .', u'Applying ontologies to management information languages can also be useful for integration of information definitions specified by different management languages and adding behavior information to them .']

entities: [[(u'education field', u'Task'), (u'intelligent search system', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'Education Information Intelligent Search ( EIIS ) framework', u'Method'), (u'EIISReasoning mechanism', u'Method'), (u'search concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'field application requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'EIISRanking algorithm', u'Method'), (u'levels ranking', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic similarity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic based intelligent search system', u'Method'), (u'precision rate', u'Metric'), (u'ranking algorithm', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'intelligent search system')], [(u'semantic factor SR', u'CONJUNCTION', u'response time factor TR')], [(u'levels ranking', u'USED-FOR', u'EIISRanking algorithm')], [(u'precision rate', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'semantic based intelligent search system')]]
sentences: [u'Aiming at the special requirements oriented to the education field , this paper proposes an intelligent search system based on semantic web .', u"Under the guidance of the users ' needs and the proposed Education Information Intelligent Search ( EIIS ) framework , the EIISReasoning mechanism and its relevant rule sets are constructed to automatically reason the search concepts in order to self-adapt semantics to more levels , where the semantic factor SR and the response time factor TR are both introduced to detail field application requirements .", u'After this , the EIISRanking algorithm applies two levels ranking by the weight factor of semantic similarity , and the same relevance is differentiated in terms of education field needs .', u'The case test shows that the semantic based intelligent search system takes on a better precision rate , and the ranking algorithm can improve execution performance .']

entities: [[(u'Description Logic', u'Method'), (u'knowledge representation', u'Task')], [(u'Description Logic', u'Method'), (u'Distributed Description Logic', u'Method'), (u'distributed ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed information sources', u'Material')], [(u'default reasoning capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'incomplete or conflict information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'default extension', u'Method'), (u'Distributed Description Logics', u'Method')], [(u'Distributed Description Logics', u'Method'), (u'default information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'default satisfiability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Distributed Description Logics', u'Method'), (u'default rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'default reasoning', u'Task'), (u'default Tableau algorithm', u'Method'), (u'subsumption assertions', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Distributed Description Logic', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed ontologies'), (u'distributed information sources', u'USED-FOR', u'Distributed Description Logic'), (u'distributed information sources', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed ontologies')], [], [(u'default extension', u'USED-FOR', u'Distributed Description Logics'), (u'Distributed Description Logics', u'USED-FOR', u'default extension')], [(u'default information', u'USED-FOR', u'Distributed Description Logics'), (u'distributed knowledge base', u'USED-FOR', u'Distributed Description Logics')], [(u'default Tableau algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'default reasoning')]]
sentences: [u'Description Logic is now an active research area , which is applied universally to knowledge representation , Semantic Web and Ontology language .', u'Compared with Description Logic , Distributed Description Logic can be used to better establish distributed ontologies from distributed information sources .', u'But little attention has been paid to the problem of endowing Distributed Description Logic with default reasoning capabilities to deal with incomplete or conflict information .', u'In this paper we present a default extension to Distributed Description Logics to handle the heterogeneity and incompleteness of different information sources .', u'We extend Distributed Description Logics by adding default information into a distributed knowledge base , and discuss the default satisfiability based on Distributed Description Logics with default rules .', u'To perform default reasoning , a default Tableau algorithm is developed to check satisfiability of complex concepts and subsumption assertions .']

entities: [[(u'Web services orchestration engine', u'Method'), (u'WebContent semantic Web framework', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'semantic content management applications', u'Task')], [(u'WebContent framework', u'Method'), (u'semantic content', u'Material'), (u'data management', u'Task'), (u'document model', u'Method'), (u'XML', u'Method'), (u'exchange and retrieval of information', u'Task')], []]
relations: [[(u'Web services orchestration engine', u'USED-FOR', u'WebContent semantic Web framework')], [(u'semantic content management applications', u'USED-FOR', u'diverse domains')], [(u'semantic content', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data management'), (u'document model', u'USED-FOR', u'exchange and retrieval of information'), (u'XML', u'USED-FOR', u'document model')], []]
sentences: [u'We present the design and implementation of a Web services orchestration engine developed to support the WebContent semantic Web framework .', u'This framework is under development in the context of the WebContent project , whose goal is to provide a scalable and robust platform for the development of semantic content management applications for diverse domains .', u'The WebContent framework is based on a set of core services able to perform the main tasks associated with semantic content and data management , as well as on the adoption of a common document model based on XML , which facilitates the exchange and retrieval of information .', u'Our contribution lies in providing the necessary infrastructure to effectively and efficiently coordinate the diverse services and data sources , thus facilitating the rapid development of flexible and reliable applications .']

entities: [[(u'Social networks', u'Method'), (u'semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'social networks', u'Method'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'co-occurrence information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'content analysis based method', u'Method'), (u'automatic obtaining social networks', u'Task'), (u'Chinese event-based news stories', u'Material')], [(u'lexical analysis', u'Method')], [(u'main verbs recognition', u'Task')], [(u'directed graph expression', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'relationship expressions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'social network', u'Method')], [(u'relationships extraction', u'Task'), (u'method', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'social networks'), (u'co-occurrence information', u'USED-FOR', u'methods')], [(u'content analysis based method', u'USED-FOR', u'automatic obtaining social networks')], [], [], [], [(u'relationship expressions', u'USED-FOR', u'social network')], [(u'relationships extraction', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'method')]]
sentences: [u'Social networks have recently attracted much attention for their importance to the semantic Web .', u'Several methods exist to extract social networks for people from the Web based on co-occurrence information .', u'This paper proposed a content analysis based method for automatic obtaining social networks among various entities from Chinese event-based news stories .', u'First , the input articles are annotated by lexical analysis .', u'Second , the relationships among all entities are extracted by the way of main verbs recognition .', u'For directed graph expression , an arrow is drawn between each pair of entities which have relationship from the agent argument to the patient one .', u'Finally , all relationship expressions were established to build the social network up .', u'Experiment results for relationships extraction made on 50 independent news articles indicate that our method can work well .']

entities: [[(u'Modularization', u'Task'), (u'IT', u'Task')], [], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge management', u'Task')], [(u'cooperative database systems', u'Method')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'modularization techniques', u'Method')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'ontology modularization', u'Task')], [(u'modularization', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'knowledge provider', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web'), (u'modularization techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web')], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology modularization')], []]
sentences: [u'Modularization is a familiar concept in IT , widely used in e.g .', u'software development .', u'It has been somehow neglected in knowledge management .', u'Database research has only marginally addressed the topic , mainly for the development of cooperative database systems .', u'Instead , research on ontologies , seen as the knowledge provider for the semantic web , has significantly invested on modularization techniques , seen as a key capability in the current efforts towards scalable solutions that will enable ontologies to grow to the huge size that we can foresee in real world future applications .', u'Many different approaches exist to tackle ontology modularization , corresponding to different goals or building on different initial hypotheses .', u'This chapter aims at clarifying the vision of the domain by providing a detailed yet generic characterization of the issues and solutions related to the various facets of modularization .']

entities: [[(u'Data translation', u'Task'), (u'integration task', u'Task'), (u'source model', u'Method'), (u'mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'executable mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query engine', u'Method'), (u'data translation task', u'Task')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'executable mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'nested relational models', u'Method'), (u'semantic-web ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Mosto', u'Method'), (u'data translation', u'Task')], [(u'automatic generation', u'Task'), (u'data translation task', u'Task'), (u'DBpedia ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Data translation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'integration task'), (u'mappings', u'USED-FOR', u'source model')], [(u'query engine', u'USED-FOR', u'data translation task')], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'executable mappings'), (u'nested relational models', u'USED-FOR', u'approaches'), (u'nested relational models', u'USED-FOR', u'executable mappings')], [(u'Mosto', u'USED-FOR', u'data translation')], []]
sentences: [u'Data translation is an integration task that aims at populating a target model with data of a source model , which is usually performed by means of mappings .', u'To reduce costs , there are some techniques to automatically generate executable mappings in a given query language , which are executed using a query engine to perform the data translation task .', u'Unfortunately , current approaches to automatically generate executable mappings are based on nested relational models , which can not be straightforwardly applied to semantic-web ontologies due to some differences between both models .', u'In this paper , we present Mosto , a tool to perform the data translation using automatically generated SPARQL executable mappings .', u'In this demo , ER attendees will have an opportunity to test this automatic generation when performing the data translation task between two different versions of the DBpedia ontology .']

entities: [[(u'Expert Systems', u'Method'), (u'extraction of data', u'Task')], [(u'tools', u'Generic'), (u'slow execution time', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'delayed response times', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'response time', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'caching strat- egy', u'Method'), (u'Expert System', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web and reasoning', u'Method'), (u'inference techniques', u'Method')], [(u'Caching strategies', u'Method'), (u'XML queries', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'medical diagnosis', u'Task'), (u'system', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'Expert Systems', u'USED-FOR', u'extraction of data'), (u'reasoning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'inference')], [(u'tools', u'USED-FOR', u'delayed response times')], [], [(u'caching strat- egy', u'USED-FOR', u'Expert System'), (u'Semantic Web and reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'Expert System'), (u'Semantic Web and reasoning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'inference techniques'), (u'inference techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'Expert System')], [(u'Caching strategies', u'USED-FOR', u'XML queries')], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'medical diagnosis')]]
sentences: [u'Nowadays there is a large number of Expert Systems available to us- ers requiring the extraction of data relevant to specific domains , many of which are based on reasoning and inference .', u'However , many of these tools offer slow execution time , resulting in delayed response times to the queries made by us- ers .', u'The strategy of caching to define specific patterns of results enables such systems to eliminate the requirement to repeat the same queries , speeding up the response time and eliminating redundancy .', u'This paper proposes a caching strat- egy for an Expert System based on Semantic Web and reasoning and inference techniques .', u'Caching strategies have previously been applied to simple XML queries .', u'Performance has been evaluated using an existing system for medical diagnosis , which demonstrates the increased efficiency of the system .']

entities: [[(u'controlled natural language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web systems', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'OWL statements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'CNL', u'Material')], [(u'controlled natural language', u'Material'), (u'classical OWL notation', u'Material')], [(u'Attempto Controlled English', u'Method'), (u'Manchester OWL Syntax', u'Material')], [(u'evaluation framework', u'Method')], [(u'CNL', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'controlled natural language', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web systems')], [], [(u'controlled natural language', u'CONJUNCTION', u'classical OWL notation')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Different kinds of controlled natural language ( CNL ) have been proposed as a front-end for Semantic Web systems , in order to make them more accessible to users with no background in formal notations and methods .', u'This paper investigates whether OWL statements in CNL are indeed easier to understand than in other notations .', u'To this aim , an experiment with 64 participants was conducted that compares a controlled natural language to a classical OWL notation .', u'Concretely , Attempto Controlled English was compared to a simplified version of the Manchester OWL Syntax .', u'For a reliable and tool-independent evaluation of understandability , the experiment is based on a novel evaluation framework making use of simple and intuitive diagrams .', u'The results show that CNL is easier to understand , needs less learning time , and is more accepted by its users .']

relations: [[], [(u'ontology model', u'USED-FOR', u'PLM'), (u'ontology advantages', u'CONJUNCTION', u'features')], [(u'description logics', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology models'), (u'description logics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantics')], [], [(u'Description logics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web rule language'), (u'semantic web rule language', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Jess rule engine')], [(u'auto-categorisation of the input data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'multi-level re-classification of the class hierarchy')]]
sentences: [u'An important factor for improving the efficiency of PLM models is the implementation of information science new tools and technologies .', u'In this work , an ontology model of a product data and knowledge management semantic object model for PLM has been used , with the aim of implementing ontology advantages and features into the model , and to demonstrate the main capabilities the model has .', u'The development and extension of ontology models using description logics and semantics makes the models machine-understandable .', u'The initial model has been altered in order to facilitate new functionalities while preserving all previous capabilities .', u'Description logics , semantic web rule language and Jess rule engine have been used to extract knowledge .', u'Moreover , expressivity has increased allowing auto-categorisation of the input data and multi-level re-classification of the class hierarchy .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'data processing', u'Task'), (u'semantics of data', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic expression', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data models', u'Generic'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDF and OWL data model', u'Method'), (u'graph data models', u'Method')], [(u'implicit relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic associations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF graph', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic associations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'path associations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF graph', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'OWL constructs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'implicit relationships between semantic entities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'relationships', u'Generic'), (u'RDF model', u'Method')], [(u'techniques', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'data processing')], [(u'formal representation of knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic expression'), (u'formal representation of knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'data models'), (u'data models', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic expression'), (u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'data models'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'data models')], [], [], [(u'path associations', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic associations')], [], [(u'RDF model', u'USED-FOR', u'relationships')], [(u'University ontology benchmark', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'techniques')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web unleashed a new era of data processing by enabling machines to understand the semantics of data .', u'This semantic expression is achieved by formal representation of knowledge in data models such as RDF or OWL .', u'The RDF and OWL data model can be envisioned as graph data models .', u'The discovery of implicit relationships ( termed as semantic associations ) between entities in RDF graph had been the focus of research from quite some time now .', u'The semantic associations are found using different path associations between entities in a RDF graph .', u'This paper , however , exploits OWL constructs in an intelligent way to mine implicit relationships between semantic entities .', u'The discovered relationships may not be found directly using RDF model .', u'We employed our techniques on the available datasets of University ontology benchmark .']

entities: [[(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'Inconsistency', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'modeling errors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'migration', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'merging ontologies', u'Method'), (u'ontology evolution', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'inconsistent ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic')], [(u'inconsistency handling', u'Task'), (u'DL-Lite family', u'Method'), (u'DLs', u'Method'), (u'tractable reasoning', u'Method')], [(u'DLs', u'Method'), (u'DL-Lite', u'Method'), (u'disjoint axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'modeling errors', u'CONJUNCTION', u'migration'), (u'migration', u'CONJUNCTION', u'merging ontologies'), (u'merging ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology evolution')], [], [], [], [(u'inconsistency handling', u'USED-FOR', u'DL-Lite family')], []]
sentences: [u'As a shared conceptualization of a particular domain , ontologies play an important role for the success of the Semantic Web .', u'However it is often difficult to create an absolutely consistent ontology .', u'Inconsistency can occur due to several reasons , such as modeling errors , migration or merging ontologies , and ontology evolution .', u'So it is essential to study how to deal with inconsistent ontologies .', u'Many approaches have been proposed to solve this problem .', u'These approaches are mainly used for dealing with inconsistency in expressive Description Logics ( DLs ) .', u'In our work , we consider inconsistency handling in the DL-Lite family , which is a family of DLs that preserve tractable reasoning and are specifically tailored to deal with large amounts of data .', u'Like other DLs , inconsistencies in DL-Lite can also easily occur because disjoint axioms are allowed .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'todays ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'integrated approach', u'Method'), (u'evolution process of ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'evolution of metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'evolution of metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'evolution of metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'integrated approach', u'USED-FOR', u'evolution process of ontologies')], [(u'relations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'metadata')], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'evolution of metadata')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'evolution of metadata')]]
sentences: [u'In order to meet the demands of the Semantic Web , todays ontologies need to be dynamic , networked structures .', u'One important challenge , therefore , is to develop an integrated approach to the evolution process of ontologies and related metadata .', u'Within this context , the specific goal of this work is to capture the evolution of metadata due to changed concepts , relations or metadata in one of the ontologies , and to capture changes to the ontology caused by changes to the metadata .', u'After a short discussion of the nature of metadata , we propose a methodology to capture ( 1 ) the evolution of metadata induced by changes to the ontologies , and ( 2 ) the evolution of the ontology induced by changes to the underlying metadata .', u'This will lead to the implementation of an approach for evolution of metadata related to ontologies .']

relations: [[(u'heterogeneous sources', u'USED-FOR', u'business information'), (u'relational databases', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'heterogeneous sources'), (u'relational databases', u'CONJUNCTION', u'spread sheets'), (u'relational databases', u'CONJUNCTION', u'XML documents'), (u'spread sheets', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'heterogeneous sources'), (u'spread sheets', u'CONJUNCTION', u'XML documents'), (u'spread sheets', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web pages'), (u'XML documents', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'heterogeneous sources'), (u'XML documents', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web pages'), (u'Web pages', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'heterogeneous sources')], [], [(u'lexical level', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic or structural level')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Nowadays , the volume of information increases exponentially , forcing the corporations to keep their business information distributed under several heterogeneous sources such as relational databases , spread sheets , XML documents and Web pages , and stored under different structures and formats .', u'Integrating heterogeneous sources is recently acknowledged as an important vision on semantic web research .', u'The concept of heterogeneity arises at different levels : from the lexical level to the semantic or structural level .', u'For discovering and consolidating the semantic relationships among the semantically related data present in different types of databases and files , this paper presents the enhancements obtained due to the use of available online large lexical databases , combined with lexical and structural similarity models and the available source metadata .', u'Finally , we reveal the experimental results that demonstrate the applicability and usability of our approach .']

sentences: [u'The increasing number of personal digital photos makes their management , retrieval and visualization a difficult task .', u'Existing tools performing manual annotation are time consuming for the users .', u'To annotate automatically these photos using mobile devices is the emerging solution to facilitate the management of personal photos .', u'In this context , this paper proposes a mobile and location based system , called PhotoMap , for the automatic annotation and the spatial-temporal visualization of photo collections .', u'PhotoMap uses the new technologies of the Semantic Web in order to infer information about the taken photos and to improve both the visualization and retrieval .', u'We also present a demonstration of the PhotoMap application during a tourist tour in the city of Grenoble .', u'MOTS-CLES : Annotation semantique , ontologies , capture de contexte , dispositifs mobiles , services localises et Web 2.0 spatial .']

entities: [[(u'Scalable query answering', u'Method')], [(u'scalability problem', u'Task'), (u'decomposition-based approach', u'Method'), (u'OWL DL reasoners', u'Method'), (u'OWL DL ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'OWL DL ontology', u'Method'), (u'duplicated ABox axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conjunctive query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL DL reasoners', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'OWL DL reasoner', u'Method')], [(u'large benchmark ontologies', u'Material'), (u'benchmark queries', u'Material'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'scalability', u'Metric')]]

sentences: [u'Scalable query answering over Description Logic ( DL ) based ontologies plays an important role for the success of the Semantic Web .', u'Towards tackling the scalability problem , we propose a decomposition-based approach to optimizing existing OWL DL reasoners in evaluating conjunctive queries in OWL DL ontologies .', u'The main idea is to decompose a given OWL DL ontology into a set of target ontologies without duplicated ABox axioms so that the evaluation of a given conjunctive query can be separately performed in every target ontology by applying existing OWL DL reasoners .', u'This approach guarantees sound and complete results for the category of conjunctive queries that the applied OWL DL reasoner correctly evaluates .', u'Experimental results on large benchmark ontologies and benchmark queries show that the proposed approach can significantly improve scalability and efficiency in evaluating general conjunctive queries .']

entities: [[(u'application profiles', u'Material')], [(u'human-readable application profiles', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'machine-readable application profiles', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'quality control mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'data validation', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'application profiles', u'Generic'), (u'notion of data profiles', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'large-scale applications', u'Task'), (u'metadata aggregators', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'machine-readable application profiles', u'USED-FOR', u'quality control mechanisms'), (u'data validation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'quality control mechanisms')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DCMI commitment')], [(u'application profiles', u'CONJUNCTION', u'notion of data profiles')], [(u'metadata aggregators', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'large-scale applications')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we explore a range of issues yet to be addressed in the large-scale use of application profiles .', u'While considerable attention has been paid to human-readable application profiles , there is a growing need for machine-readable application profiles that can support quality control mechanisms including , but not limited to , data validation .', u'We examine these issues in the context of the evolving Semantic Web and the DCMI commitment to RDF and the challenges presented .', u'We frame the discussion in terms of select functions to be served by application profiles and our notion of data profiles .', u'While much remains to be done to address these issues , positive movement toward solutions is dependent on the appropriate framing of those issues in terms of the needs of large-scale applications such as metadata aggregators .']

sentences: [u'As ontology has become a convenient vehicle for domain knowledge and metadata , it is used for realizing information sharing at semantic level in geoscience .', u'Building geo-ontology is a systematic engineering and requires collaborative work , while there is a lack of ontology edit tools supporting collaborative work .', u'Since Wikis are cooperative tools for easy writing and sharing of content and semantic Wikis are the Wikis improved with Semantic Web for representing semantic information , we propose to use semantic Wikis as cooperative tools for building geo-ontology .', u'An architecture similar as semantic Wiki for geo-ontology editing is presented .', u'As well as the semantic hierarchy of geo-information and the evolvement mechanism of geo-ontology in it are presented .', u'The usefulness of the approach is demonstrated by a small case study .']

relations: [[], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'real world knowledge'), (u'conceptual modeling', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'R & D project management meeting')], [], [(u'Information sharing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data retrieval'), (u'Information sharing', u'USED-FOR', u'meeting attendants')], [], []]
sentences: [u'An ontology as the core technology of semantic web is an explicit specification of a conceptualization .', u'The ontology has been proposed as an important tool for expressing real world knowledge by conceptual modeling , and provides a basis for effectively managing the knowledge .', u'In this work , an ontology for R & D project management meeting is designed and established .', u'Various meetings and related data accompanied in the progress of R & D projects are to be managed for successful projects .', u'Information sharing and data retrieval are difficult for meeting attendants , and management for meeting data is not systematic .', u'An ontology is designed and implemented by analyzing and classifying the meeting and related data in R & D project meeting systematically .', u'Thereafter this can be applied to meeting management and service provision of an intelligent meeting examples .']

entities: [[(u'Ubiquitous Computing', u'Task')], [], [(u'Ubiquitous Semantics', u'Method'), (u'knowledge information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ubiquitous Semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge-filtering agent', u'Method'), (u'dynamic classification', u'Method'), (u'user context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'application', u'Generic'), (u'Recipe Recommendation Agent', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Ubiquitous Computing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [], [], [(u'Recipe Recommendation Agent', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'application')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we propose combination of Ubiquitous Computing and Semantic Web .', u'Data and services will be annotated even in the ubiquitous devices , and should be connected to the web of the semantics near future .', u'We call it Ubiquitous Semantics , where we would find huge amount of knowledge information , but also find most of them transitive along with user context .', u'Therefore , in order for an agent to meet users real-time query it is required to efficiently retrieve timely and useful piece of the knowledge from the Ubiquitous Semantics .', u'Thus , this paper shows a knowledge-filtering agent , which quickly responds the query by dynamic classification of the necessary information along with the user context changing in the real world .', u'Further , to evaluate our approach we validate the performance of an application : Recipe Recommendation Agent .']

sentences: [u'The development and maintenance of semantic web ( SW ) means that collaborative manufacturing systems are faced with increasing challenges caused by the growing difficulty in managing distributed manufacturing knowledge .', u'This paper presents a multi-perspective modelling approach to systematically manage distributed manufacturing knowledge on the SW .', u'Considering knowledge engineering as a cyclic and constructive modelling process , a multi-perspective knowledge modelling process is proposed to evolve along knowledge elicitation , engineering modelling , UML-based object modelling , OWL-based ontology modelling , knowledge formalisation and OWL-QL assisted knowledge verification activities .', u'The proposed approach is viewed as a promising knowledge management method that facilitates the implementation of computer supported cooperative work ( CSCW ) in distributed manufacturing for SW applications by integrating the industrial , UML enabled software engineering techniques into recent ontology-based knowledge engineering ...']
