sentences: [u'The object of our research is to develop an ontology-based agricultural knowledge fusion method that can be used as a comprehensive basis on which to solve agricultural information inconsistencies , analyze data , and discover new knowledge .', u'A recent survey has provided a detailed comparison of various fusion methods used with Deep Web data ( Li , 2013 ) .', u'In this paper , we propose an effective agricultural ontology-based knowledge fusion method by leveraging recent advances in data fusion , such as the semantic web and big data technologies , that will enhance the identification and fusion of new and existing data sets to make big data analytics more possible .', u'We provide a detailed fusion method that includes agricultural ontology building , fusion rule construction , an evaluation module , etc .', u'Empirical results show that this knowledge fusion method is useful for knowledge discovery .']

entities: [[(u'Decision Support System', u'Method'), (u'semantic representation', u'Method'), (u'software computing environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Decision Support System', u'Method')], [(u'DSS', u'Method'), (u'SDSS', u'Method'), (u'decision-making methodologies', u'Method'), (u'semantics formalization of decision problem', u'Task'), (u'decision model', u'Method'), (u'data', u'Generic'), (u'decision-making', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'semantic representation', u'Method'), (u'SDSS', u'Method')], [(u'semantic software computing environment', u'Method'), (u'modeling method', u'Method')], [(u'Collaborative decision making', u'Task'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SDSS', u'Method'), (u'decision bidding', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'role-based collaboration', u'Task')], [(u'prototype system', u'Generic'), (u'SDSS', u'Method'), (u'prototype system', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'SDSS', u'USED-FOR', u'semantics formalization of decision problem'), (u'decision-making methodologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantics formalization of decision problem'), (u'decision-making methodologies', u'USED-FOR', u'decision model'), (u'data', u'USED-FOR', u'decision-making'), (u'semantic web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology')], [], [], [(u'publishing decision requirement semantics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'decision bidding'), (u'decision bidding', u'CONJUNCTION', u'role-based collaboration')], []]
sentences: [u'To resolve inefficiencies in traditional Decision Support System ( DSS ) as the lack of semantic representation and imperfections of software computing environments , we proposed a Semantic Decision Support System ( SDSS ) .', u'Based on traditional DSS , SDSS expands the existing decision-making methodologies to realize semantics formalization of decision problem , decision model and other data related to decision-making with the help of semantic web and ontology .', u'We first explained the architecture and the semantic representation in SDSS .', u'Then we defined semantic software computing environment and its modeling method .', u'Collaborative decision making based on semantics is the working principle of SDSS which includes three steps : publishing decision requirement semantics , decision bidding , and role-based collaboration .', u'Lastly we presented the prototype system of SDSS , and an analysis of the effects of the prototype system .']

entities: [[(u'Named Entity Extraction', u'Method'), (u'NLP field', u'Task'), (u'web documents', u'Material')], [(u'services', u'Generic'), (u'dedicated APIs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'taxonomy', u'Method')], [(u'services', u'Generic')], [], [], [(u'NERD', u'Method'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'web', u'Material'), (u'NERD ontology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Named Entity Extraction', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'NLP field')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Named Entity Extraction is a mature task in the NLP field that has yielded numerous services gaining popularity in the Semantic Web community for extracting knowledge from web documents .', u'These services are generally organized as pipelines , using dedicated APIs and different taxonomy for extracting , classifying and disambiguating named entities .', u'Integrating one of these services in a particular application requires to implement an appropriate driver .', u'Furthermore , the results of these services are not comparable due to different formats .', u'This prevents the comparison of the performance of these services as well as their possible combination .', u'We address this problem by proposing NERD , a framework which unifies 10 popular named entity extractors available on the web , and the NERD ontology which provides a rich set of axioms aligning the taxonomies of these tools .']

entities: [[], [(u'Personalization', u'Method')], [(u'Web Services System', u'Method'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'personalization of services', u'Task'), (u'intelligent matchmaking', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web documents', u'Material'), (u'Web Services System', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'matchmaking', u'Method'), (u'Rule-based Search Method', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'personalization of services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'intelligent matchmaking')], [(u'general Web documents', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web documents'), (u'Web documents', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web documents'), (u'Semantic Web documents', u'PART-OF', u'Web Services System')], [(u'Rule-based Search Method', u'USED-FOR', u'system')], []]
sentences: [u'Nowadays Web users have clearly expressed their wishes to receive personalized services directly .', u'Personalization is the way to tailor services directly to the immediate requirements of the user .', u'However , the current Web Services System does not provide any features supporting this such as consideration of personalization of services and intelligent matchmaking .', u'In this research a flexible , personalized Rule-based Web Services System to address these problems and to enable efficient search , discovery and construction across general Web documents and Semantic Web documents in a Web Services System is proposed .', u"This system utilizes matchmaking among service requesters ' , service providers ' and users ' preferences using a Rule-based Search Method , and subsequently ranks search results .", u'A prototype of efficient Web Services search and construction for the suggested system is developed based on the current work .']

entities: [[(u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic mappings', u'Method')], [(u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'interoperable Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'global reasoning approach', u'Method'), (u'distributed reasoning technique', u'Method'), (u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'local reasoning chunks', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Distributed Description Logics', u'Method'), (u'semantically connected ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed tableau-based reasoning procedure', u'Method'), (u'extension', u'Generic'), (u'Description Logic tableau', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'distributed reasoning system', u'Method'), (u'DRAGO', u'Method'), (u'Distributed Reasoning Architecture', u'Method'), (u'Galaxy of Ontologies )', u'Material'), (u'distributed decision procedure', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic mappings', u'FEATURE-OF', u'ontologies')], [], [(u'distributed reasoning technique', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning'), (u'local reasoning chunks', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed reasoning technique')], [(u'Distributed Description Logics', u'USED-FOR', u'semantically connected ontologies'), (u'Distributed Description Logics', u'USED-FOR', u'sound and complete distributed tableau-based reasoning procedure'), (u'Description Logic tableau', u'USED-FOR', u'extension')], [(u'DRAGO', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'distributed reasoning system'), (u'Distributed Reasoning Architecture', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'distributed reasoning system'), (u'Distributed Reasoning Architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed decision procedure')]]
sentences: [u'The paper addresses the problem of reasoning with multiple ontologies interconnected by semantic mappings .', u'This problem is becoming more and more relevant due to the necessity of building the interoperable Semantic Web .', u'In contrast to the so called global reasoning approach , in this paper we propose a distributed reasoning technique that accomplishes reasoning through a combination of local reasoning chunks , internally executed in each separate ontology .', u'Using Distributed Description Logics as a formal framework for representation of multiple semantically connected ontologies , we define a sound and complete distributed tableau-based reasoning procedure which is built as an extension to standard Description Logic tableau .', u'Finally , the paper describes the design and implementation principles of a distributed reasoning system , called DRAGO ( Distributed Reasoning Architecture for a Galaxy of Ontologies ) , that implements such distributed decision procedure .']

entities: [[(u'conformance test suite', u'Method'), (u'reasoners', u'Task'), (u'OWL 2 RL/RDF rules language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'compliant super languages', u'Material'), (u'OWL 2 RDF-based semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'OWL 2 RL/RDF rules language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'W3C OWL Working Group', u'Method'), (u'practical reasoning', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'language', u'Generic')], [], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'reasoner creators', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'conformance test suite', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoners'), (u'OWL 2 RL/RDF rules language', u'CONJUNCTION', u'compliant super languages')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'practical reasoning')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'We present the first version of a comprehensive conformance test suite for reasoners implementing the OWL 2 RL/RDF rules language and compliant super languages , up to the scale of the OWL 2 RDF-based semantics .', u'The OWL 2 RL/RDF rules language is one of the new specifications of the W3C OWL Working Group , and it is a promising candidate to foster a larger spread of practical reasoning on the Semantic Web .', u'Several groups have now announced to develop reasoners for the language .', u'The test suite consists of more than 700 test cases that have been carefully constructed to check reasoners for valid conclusions .', u'It is meant to indirectly contribute to a wide adoption of the language by supporting reasoner creators to better assure the quality of their product .']

entities: [[(u'rule languages', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'language elements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'contexts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'higher-orderness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'non-monotonic negation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'language-specific properties', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'disjunctivity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'external components', u'Method')], [(u'Triple -oriented hybrid language', u'Method'), (u'locally stratified datalog', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'fixpoint semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pragmatic extensions', u'Method')], [(u'partial implementation', u'Task'), (u'stratified , semi-naive evaluation', u'Method'), (u'static filtering', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'rule languages', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'contexts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'higher-orderness'), (u'higher-orderness', u'CONJUNCTION', u'non-monotonic negation')], [(u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology languages'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL'), (u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'language-specific properties'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology languages'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'language-specific properties'), (u'disjunctivity', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology languages'), (u'disjunctivity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL'), (u'disjunctivity', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'language-specific properties')], [], [(u'fixpoint semantics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'pragmatic extensions'), (u'pragmatic extensions', u'USED-FOR', u'transformations between fact bases')], [(u'stratified , semi-naive evaluation', u'USED-FOR', u'partial implementation')]]
sentences: [u'In recent years , many researchers in the area of reasoning have focussed on the adoption of rule languages for the Semantic Web that led to remarkable approaches offering various functionality .', u'On one hand , this included language elements of the rule part itself like contexts , higher-orderness , and non-monotonic negation .', u'On the other hand , the proper integration with ontology languages like RDF and OWL had to consider language-specific properties like disjunctivity as well as the demand for using existing external components .', u'The paper proposes a Triple -oriented hybrid language that integrates the mentioned language elements of both aspects following the expressiveness of locally stratified datalog .', u'It introduces fixpoint semantics as well as pragmatic extensions for defining transformations between fact bases .', u'A partial implementation is based on stratified , semi-naive evaluation , and static filtering .']

entities: [[(u'Internet-based service', u'Task')], [(u'Web 2.0 instruments', u'Method'), (u'blogging', u'Task')], [(u'Gender', u'Material'), (u'determinant factor', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'blogs', u'Material')], [(u'gender disparity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'blogging applications', u'Task'), (u'3rd generation Internet-based services', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'web 3.0', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web')]]
sentences: [u'In this 2nd generation of Internet-based service or more known as Web 2.0 has brought greater collaboration among the society .', u'Among Web 2.0 instruments that have contributed to its success is blogging .', u'Gender has constantly been used as a determinant factor on how a person use , review or publish blogs .', u'In this paper , gender disparity towards blogging awareness among Malaysian higher education institution students is discussed .', u'It indicates that female are regular blog users and they prefer to read blogs that are feeling expression-oriented while male are vice versa and more likely to read blogs that are entertainment-oriented .', u'Discovering which gender dominates blogging may consider further significant studies in the future for blogging applications and potential instruments for 3rd generation Internet-based services known as web 3.0 or semantic web .']

sentences: [u'Reasoning is one of the essential application areas of the modern Semantic Web .', u'Nowadays , the semantic reasoning algorithms are facing significant challenges when dealing with the emergence of the Internet-scale knowledge bases , comprising extremely large amounts of data .', u'The traditional reasoning approaches have only been approved for small , closed , trustworthy , consistent , coherent and static data domains .', u'As such , they are not well-suited to be applied in data-intensive applications aiming on the Internet scale .', u'We introduce the Large Knowledge Collider as a platform solution that leverages the service-oriented approach to implement a new reasoning technique , capable of dealing with exploding volumes of the rapidly growing data universe , in order to be able to take advantages of the large-scale and on-demand elastic infrastructures such as high performance computing or cloud technology .']

sentences: [u'Recent research on model counting in CNF formulas has shown that a certain sampling method can yield results that are sound with a provably high probability .', u'The key idea is to iteratively restrict the search space , and to randomly choose which part to consider .', u'The expected value of this sampled count is equal to the real count .', u'If one minimizes over several trials , and purposefully underestimates the outcome of each trial by a constant factor , then the probability that the sampled count exceeds the real count decreases exponentially in the number of trials .', u'This method has proven to be quite successful for many CNF formulas .', u'The big question is : Can we devise similar methods for reasoning in the Semantic Web ?', u'Is it possible to obtain provably high-quality results based on sampling ?']

sentences: [u'Ambient Intelligence ( AmI ) is experiencing an increasing development of applications .', u'Flexibility and genericity in the deployment and provisioning of context management solutions are key issues to be able to tackle with the large variety of domains of these context-aware applications .', u'Existing proposals of Context Management Middleware ( CMM ) are still lacking such generic and flexible capabilities .', u'To respond to these challenges , we propose CONSERT , a CMM , based on techniques and principles from the Semantic Web and Multi-Agent Systems domains .', u'In this paper we focus on showing how the multi-agent architecture of this CMM provides the necessary flexibility to deploy different kinds of context provisioning patterns to address different AmI applications .', u'We showcase the usage of our solution with a scenario from the domain of smart university life management .']

sentences: [u'Rule-based approaches are using human-made rules to extract Named Entities ( NEs ) , it is one of the most famous ways to extract NE as well as Machine Learning .', u'The term Named Entity Recognition ( NER ) is defined as a task determined to indicate personal names , locations , organizations and many other entities .', u'In Arabic language , Big Data challenges make Arabic NER develops rapidly and extracts useful information from texts .', u'The current paper sheds some light on research progress in rule-based via a diagnostic comparison among linguistic resource , entity type , domain , and performance .', u'We also highlight the challenges of the processing Arabic NEs through rule-based systems .', u'It is expected that good performance of NER will be effective to other modern fields like semantic web searching , question answering , machine translation , information retrieval , and abstracting systems .']

sentences: [u'One can easily envisage future military operations and emerging civilian requirements ( e.g .', u'intelligent unmanned vehicles for urban warfare , intelligent manufacturing plants ) that will be both complex and stressing and will demand innovative sensors and sensor configurations .', u'The goal of our research into sensors as robots is to develop a cost effective and extendable approach for providing surveillance for a variety of applications in dynamically changing military and civilian environments .', u'We discuss the development of a futuristic intelligence , surveillance and reconnaissance concept utilizing the innovative integration of cutting edge technologies such as : knowledge-based signal processing ; robotics ; wireless networking ; waveform diversity ; the semantic Web ; advanced computer architectures and supporting software languages .', u'This concept is projected as an autonomous constellation of air , space , and ground vehicles that would offer a robust paradigm to build toward future deployments .']

sentences: [u'The article presents an organizational and production method for research trough use and integration of online tools , such as Zotero , Twitter and Skype .', u'The developed procedure is based on research steps described by Umberto Eco ( 1974 ) .', u'The online tools were applied to resource selection ; work planning and organization ; sheets and reports systematization ; and research editing .', u'From the advent of semantic web , the availability of data , information and knowledge in the web becomes even more attractive .', u'The growing presence of online applications provides new experiences and possibilities in explore , develop and share information and results among researchers .', u'These facts together offers a fertile environment to the development of collaborative researches , furthermore enables that search processes , cataloguing and team communication becomes more efficient .', u'The method was applied simultaneously to two academic works .']

sentences: [u'Web service is expected to be the key technology of implementing SOA solution on the Internet .', u'However , as web services proliferate , it is more and more difficult to find suitable services and further compose them into complex applications automatically .', u'In this paper , a novel service infrastructure named Service Network ( SN ) , which is constructed on the basis of service relations , is proposed to bridge the gap between service consumer and service provider .', u'Using the idea of social network and technology of semantic web , the paper focuses on studying the main characters of SN , including the detail structure , the definitions of service ontology and service relations , the functions from different perspectives , the constructing approach of service mining , especially the process of how service relations facilitate service discovery and service composition .']

sentences: [u'There are major trends to advance the functionality of search engines to a more expressive semantic level .', u'This is enabled by the advent of knowledge-sharing communities such as Wikipedia and the progress in automatically extracting entities and relationships from semistructured as well as natural-language Web sources .', u'In addition , Semantic-Web-style ontologies , structured Deep-Web sources , and Social-Web networks and tagging communities can contribute towards a grand vision of turning the Web into a comprehensive knowledge base that can be efficiently searched with high precision .', u'This vision and position paper discusses opportunities and challenges along this research avenue .', u'The technical issues to be looked into include knowledge harvesting to construct large knowledge bases , searching for knowledge in terms of entities and relationships , and ranking the results of such queries .']

sentences: [u'P2P systems are a revival paradigm for information sharing among distributed nodes in the network .', u'Currently , many research projects or practical applications have emerged from the early ICQ , Napster , Gnutella to most recently CAN , Gnougat , etc. , but few of them support semantic retrieval .', u'The advent of semantic Web is a highly innovative manner to enhance both the precision and recall simultaneously .', u'This paper investigates a searching problem as encountered in a tourism scenario .', u'Based on the scenario , we introduce several main requirements for constructing semantic retrieval in P2P network .', u'Based on an ambitious goal , we describe a preliminary architecture of average peer .', u'Finally , we offer an approach for a critical part of the architecture - the wrapper , which aims to alleviate the mismatches caused by the content representations among various peers .']

sentences: [u'IT decision making requires analysis of possible future scenarios .', u'The quality of the decisions can be enhanced by the use of architecture models that increase the understanding of the components of the system scenario .', u'It is desirable that the created models support the needed analysis effectively since creation of architecture models often is a demanding and time consuming task .', u'This paper suggests a framework for assessing interoperability on the systems communicating over the semantic web as well as a metamodel suitable for this assessment .', u'Extended influence diagrams are used in the framework to capture the relations between various interoperability factors and enable aggregation of these into a holistic interoperability measure .', u'The paper is concluded with an example using the framework and metamodel to create models and perform interoperability analysis .']

sentences: [u'The paradigm of Tabled Logic Programming ( TLP ) is now supported by a number of Prolog systems , including XSB , YAP Prolog , B-Prolog , Mercury , ALS , and Ciao .', u'The reasons for this are partly theoretical : tabling ensures termination and optimal known complexity for queries to a large class of programs .', u'However , the overriding reasons are practical .', u'TLP allows sophisticated programs to be written concisely and efficiently , especially when mechanisms such as tabled negation and call and answer subsumption are supported .', u'As a result , TLP has now been used in a variety of applications from program analysis to querying over the semantic web .', u'This paper provides a survey of TLP and its applications as implemented in the XSB Prolog , along with discussion of how XSB supports tabling with dynamically changing code , and in a multi-threaded environment .']

entities: [[(u'Rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'rules', u'Generic'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'DL-based ontology languages', u'Material'), (u'Knowledge Representation formalisms', u'Method'), (u'relational data model', u'Method'), (u'Logic Programming', u'Material'), (u'Deductive Databases', u'Material')], [(u'Rule authoring', u'Task'), (u'Knowledge Engineering task', u'Task'), (u'Machine Learning algorithms', u'Method')], [(u'Inductive Logic Programming ( ILP )', u'Method'), (u'Machine Learning', u'Task'), (u'Logic Programming', u'Method'), (u'Relational Learning', u'Task'), (u'Onto-Relational Learning', u'Task')], [(u'Onto-Relational Learning solution', u'Method'), (u'ILP', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Rules complement and extend ontologies on the Semantic Web .', u'We refer to these rules as onto-relational since they combine DL-based ontology languages and Knowledge Representation formalisms supporting the relational data model within the tradition of Logic Programming and Deductive Databases .', u'Rule authoring is a very demanding Knowledge Engineering task which can be automated though partially by applying Machine Learning algorithms .', u'In this chapter we show how Inductive Logic Programming ( ILP ) , born at the intersection of Machine Learning and Logic Programming and considered as a major approach to Relational Learning , can be adapted to Onto-Relational Learning .', u'For the sake of illustration , we provide details of a specific Onto-Relational Learning solution to the problem of learning rule-based definitions of DL concepts and roles with ILP .']

sentences: [u'The synthesis of existing Persistent Organic Pollutants # N # pollution monitoring databases with epidemiological data is # N # considered for identifying some impacts of Persistent Organic # N # Pollutants on human health .', u'This task requires new , rich , data , # N # services and models discovery capabilities from a multitude of # N # monitoring networks and web resources .', u'The FP7 project TaToo # N # ( Tagging Tool based on a Semantic Discovery Framework ) is # N # setting up a semantic web solution to close the discovery gap # N # that prevents a full and easy access to web resources .', u'The use # N # of TaToo tools together with the Global Environmental # N # Assessment and Information System and the System for # N # Visualizing of Oncological Data is discussed as TaToo # N # validation scenario for anthropogenic impact and global climate # N # change influence on Persistent Organic Pollutants trajectory .']

sentences: [u'Ranking the importance of concepts and the weights of relations is an effective method for evaluating an ontology , which can improve the design of ontology for domain expert , and be used as a component of semantic Web search engine .', u'Current link analysis ranking algorithms can not be directly applied to rank concepts , or efficiently to assign weights to relations .', u'According to the characteristic of ontology graph structure , an algorithm is proposed with Hub rating instead of Authority rating as importance of concepts .', u'The algorithm mutually reinforces importance of concepts and weights of relations in the iteration process which is proved to converge to the fixpoint of equations .', u'The experimental results show the algorithm has the similar convergence speed to PageRank but more reasonable ranking of concepts importance and relations weights .']

relations: [[(u'Cultural Heritage domain', u'FEATURE-OF', u'digital datasets')], [], [(u'formalisms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data standards'), (u'digital libraries', u'CONJUNCTION', u'digital archives')], [(u'API system', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic data')]]
sentences: [u'During the last years , the production of digital datasets in the Cultural Heritage domain , has seen an exponential increase and the structured repositories have become the most used infrastructure for knowledge management and consultation with different kinds of systems and platforms ensuring a complete interoperability and reach ability of data .', u'Furthermore , the dataset products represent a great resource from which it is possible to extract and deduce new knowledge .', u'In cultural heritage , thanks to the technology related to semantic web , we are able to manage and enrich our data using formalisms and data standards : digital libraries and digital archives , SPARQL-endpoint are some examples .', u'This work , starting from the analysis of Europeanas data model , discusses the integration and use of semantic data in third parts using the API system as a framework .']

sentences: [u'Knowledge sharing approaches enable collaborative process-oriented planning in adaptive and highly dynamic , i.e. , innovation and therefore change-driven , cross-organizational production environments .', u'Externalization of knowledge as well as knowledge and process formalization is the key enabling factors for supporting collaborative production process planning .', u'Beyond that SMEs request for a standardized production-planning oriented knowledge and feature representation .', u'Semantic Web- and at the same time Cloud-based application s solutions which are based on process-driven knowledge representation methodologies such as WPIM can satisfy these needs , support intelligent collaboration , being able to cope with high change dynamics and therefore support boosting overall adaptiveness of production processes .', u'Furthermore semantic knowledge representation and semantic querying add value to knowledge-based Computer-Aided Process Planning and , finally , pave the way towards automating planning , simulation and optimization .', u'2014 ASME']

entities: [[(u'secure information exchange', u'Task'), (u'organization/domain boundaries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'policy management', u'Method')], [(u'query federation test-bed', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web datasets', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'multi-schema federation', u'Method')], [(u'policy languages', u'Material'), (u'XACML', u'Method'), (u'AIR', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'dynamic translation', u'Task')], [(u'public education', u'Task'), (u'Massachusetts', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'It', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-schema federation')], [(u'policy languages', u'USED-FOR', u'dynamic translation'), (u'XACML', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'policy languages'), (u'XACML', u'CONJUNCTION', u'AIR'), (u'AIR', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'policy languages'), (u'them', u'USED-FOR', u'dynamic translation')], [(u'Massachusetts', u'USED-FOR', u'public education')]]
sentences: [u'Abstract : In this project , we investigated the problem of secure information exchange and integration across organization/domain boundaries using policy management .', u'We developed a query federation test-bed that allows users to make queries against multiple Semantic Web datasets simultaneously .', u'This system performs on-the-fly mash-ups of sensitive data , the access to which needs to be regulated .', u'It also supports multi-schema federation , which allows users to make queries in their schema without worrying about the schemas of the datasets in the federation .', u"We also studied policy languages such as XACML and AIR and modeled them in W3C 's Rule Interchange Format ( RIF ) to enable dynamic translation between policies in these commonly used policies .", u'Lastly , we studied how secure information sharing would benefit public education using Massachusetts as a usecase .']

entities: [[(u'sharable and reusable domain knowledge', u'Material'), (u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'Personalized management of domain ontologies', u'Task'), (u'personalized views of domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'run time', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user preferences', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'ontology-based application', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'personalized management of domain ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'user model', u'Method'), (u'user preferences', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'moderate-scale modules', u'Method'), (u'low coupling', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'modules', u'Generic')], [(u'modules', u'Generic'), (u'personalized views of domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'domain ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic Web')], [], [], [], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'personalized management of domain ontologies')], [(u'user model', u'USED-FOR', u'user preferences')], [(u'domain ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'moderate-scale modules'), (u'high cohesion', u'CONJUNCTION', u'low coupling')], [], [(u'modules', u'USED-FOR', u'personalized views of domain ontologies')]]
sentences: [u'As the sharable and reusable domain knowledge , domain ontology increasingly serves as a foundation for semantic Web .', u'Personalized management of domain ontologies is to provide personalized views of domain ontologies to users during run time according to user preferences .', u'It helps that users can focus on their interested parts , instead of the whole .', u'It increases the efficiency of ontology-based application .', u'This paper proposes a framework for personalized management of domain ontologies .', u'In this framework , a user model firstly is introduced to describe user preferences .', u'Secondly , domain ontologies are decomposed into moderate-scale modules with high cohesion and low coupling .', u"During run time , modules that a user is interested in are selected out based on the user 's preferences .", u'Finally , the selected modules are combined to construct personalized views of domain ontologies for the user .']

sentences: [u'Systems with knowledge representation and reasoning functionality are quite common within the robotics community .', u'Nevertheless , most of the proposed architectures are ad-hoc implementations , which lack of modularity , standardization , and that can not be reused or shared among different users .', u'We fill that the Semantic Web effort over the past years in promoting standard representations and ontology best practices should be adopted by the robotic community , to foster the design of more effective and reusable systems , adapt for non expert users in everyday activities .', u'In this paper , we investigate how to integrate ontology best practices and standard representations into the robotic system design , modelling an ontology for a real application field : urban search and rescue robotics .', u'We also discuss the benefits of this methodology for robotic systems , as well as presenting some effective design guidelines .']

entities: [[(u'HEALTHAGENTS', u'Method'), (u'diagnosis and prognosis of brain tumours', u'Task'), (u'imaging and spectral data', u'Material'), (u'semantic web and agent technologies', u'Method')], [(u'HEALTHAGENTS virtual organisation', u'Task'), (u'HEALTHAGENTS portal', u'Method'), (u'consortium internal collaboration process', u'Method')], [(u'meta- information repository', u'Material'), (u'HEALTHAGENTS consortium', u'Material')], [(u'HEALTHAGENTS portal', u'Method'), (u'content management system', u'Method'), (u'groupware', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'collaboration', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'workflow services', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'project management tool', u'Method'), (u'document publishing system', u'Method'), (u'data provenance', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]

sentences: [u'HEALTHAGENTS is a trans-European interdisciplinary project for the diagnosis and prognosis of brain tumours through the use of imaging and spectral data with semantic web and agent technologies .', u'The core of the HEALTHAGENTS virtual organisation , the HEALTHAGENTS portal fosters the consortium internal collaboration process .', u'The website accomplishes a repository of data concerning the development and management of the HEALTHAGENTS project as well as a meta- information repository , composed of comments , discussions and other contributions from the HEALTHAGENTS consortium .', u'From a technical perspective , the HEALTHAGENTS portal is a content management system comprising groupware , collaboration , and workflow services .', u'It has also become an effective project management tool and a document publishing system with data provenance .', u'The award for the best IST project website for EC-funded research projects was conferred upon the portal in 2006 .']

sentences: [u'The extensive dynamic capabilities of browsers allow for platforms of infinite extensibility and omni-functional power to be delivered via the internet .', u'This paper considers the advantages of converting web pages into multi-layered intelligent immersive omnifunctional documents .', u'Such standards-compliant documents can create powerful models for the next generation of internet usability .', u'This paper documents the advantages of adopting multilayered architectures for documents as against pagebased architectures , and the interesting presentation possibilities associated with it .', u'By providing multi-layered calculation elements , this medium provides powerful paradigms in the ability to calculate , to think and to present .', u'Manipulation of content in such spaces is specifically considered .', u'Algebraic expression of document structure is also attempted , to explain the salient features of omni-functionality , and how it interacts with the semantic web .']

sentences: [u'The need for annotating the continuously increasing volume of medical image data is recognized from medical experts for a variety of purposes , regardless if this is medical practice , research or education .', u'The rich information content latent in medical images can be made explicit and formal with the use of well-defined ontologies .', u'Evolution of the Semantic Web now offers a unique opportunity of a web-based , service-oriented approach .', u'Remote access to FMA and ICD-10 reference ontologies provides the ontological annotation framework .', u'The proposed system utilizes this infrastructure to provide a customizable and robust annotation procedure .', u'It also provides an intelligent search mechanism indicating the advantages of semantic over keyword search .', u'The common representation layer discussed facilitates interoperability between institutions and systems , while semantic content enables inference and knowledge integration .']

relations: [[], [(u'reasoner', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reasoner')], [], [(u'description logic reasoner', u'USED-FOR', u'debugging cues'), (u'Pellet', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'debugging cues'), (u'Pellet', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'description logic reasoner'), (u'Pellet', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'hypertextual ontology development environment'), (u'Swoop', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'debugging cues'), (u'Swoop', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'hypertextual ontology development environment')], []]
sentences: [u'As an increasingly large number of OWL ontologies become available on the Semantic Web and the descriptions in the ontologies become more complicated , finding the cause of errors becomes an extremely hard task even for experts .', u'Existing ontology development environments provide some limited support , in conjunction with a reasoner , for detecting and diagnosing errors in OWL ontologies .', u'Typically these are restricted to the mere detection of , for example , unsatisfiable concepts .', u'We have integrated a number of simple debugging cues generated from our description logic reasoner , Pellet , in our hypertextual ontology development environment , Swoop .', u'These cues , in conjunction with extensive undo/redo and Annotea based collaboration support in Swoop , significantly improve the OWL debugging experience , and point the way to more general improvements in the presentation of an ontology to new users .']

sentences: [u'Ontologies , as sets of concepts and their interrelations in a specific domain , have proven to be a useful tool in the areas of digital libraries , semantic web , and the like .', u'But large-scale analysis of ontology usage is constrained primarily in specific domain , like medical , scholarly artifact , biosciences , where knowledge presentation is structured and easier to understand .', u'The application of ontologies in the domain of humanities , especially history , however , is rare since the extraction from knowledge of history is hard .', u'In the current paper , we introduce an ontology based visualization model to integrate ontology in historical knowledge searching .', u'Particularly , this period of history is related with Kuomintang and Early Communist Periods of China .', u'The objective is assisting knowledge representation and knowledge inference for the purpose of knowledge management .']

entities: [[(u'Web-based social network data', u'Material'), (u'user interests', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'They', u'Generic'), (u'user modelling', u'Task'), (u'personalized services', u'Task')], [(u'social networks', u'Method')], [(u'ranking strategies', u'Method'), (u'social network data sources', u'Material')], [(u'social network data', u'Material')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'collaboration network data', u'Material'), (u'micro-blogging data', u'Material'), (u'Web-based personalized academic visit recommendation system', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'They', u'USED-FOR', u'user modelling'), (u'user modelling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'personalized services')], [], [(u'ranking strategies', u'USED-FOR', u'social network data sources')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Various Web-based social network data reflect user interests from multiple perspectives in a distributed environment .', u'They need to be integrated for better user modelling and personalized services .', u'We argue that in different scenarios , different social networks play different roles and their degrees of importance are not equivalent .', u'Hence , ranking strategies among different social network data sources are needed .', u'In addition , combining different social network data can produce interesting subsets of these data with different levels of importance .', u'In this paper , we propose social network data ranking and composition strategies , we validate the proposed methods by collaboration network data ( Semantic Web Dog Food ) and micro-blogging data ( from Twitter ) , then we use the ranked and composed results for developing a Web-based personalized academic visit recommendation system to show their potential effectiveness .']

sentences: [u'AbstractEffective knowledge sharing between communities of knowledge workers impacts the productivity , innovation and competitiveness of organizations .', u'The emergence of Peer-to-peer ( P2P ) technology has provided some solutions to knowledge sharing amongst peers .', u'In this paper we present a sophisticated Agent-based Semantic Knowledge networkASKnetthat features a unique combination of mobile agents , semantic web and semantic overlay networks to realize an effective knowledge sharing environment .', u'ASKnet enables the sharing of personalized knowledge repositoriestypically documents thematically organized by a knowledge workerof individual knowledge workers with the entire community .', u'The premise here is that if we trust the intellectual ability of the knowledge worker then his/her personalized knowledge repository can be regarded as a source of best-quality , relevant and validated knowledge for that domain/organization .']

sentences: [u'The Global Change Information System was created by the US Global Change Research Program to provide specialists and the general public with accessible and usable global change related information .', u'This system uses a relational and semantic web approach to describe the detailed provenance of global change information , such as in report x , figure y is derived from dataset z .', u'The system supported the development of the US Third National Climate Assessment , which was released in May 2014 and improves our understanding of climate change in the US .', u"Over the last year , a partnership has been developed with the Committee on Earth Observing Satellites and now their database of missions , instruments and observations is being used to provide traceability to the specific platforms and instruments that support the assessment 's findings and figures ."]

sentences: [u'As an important branch of semantic Web , the semantic desktop can be used to automatically extract the metadata of desktop documents when users are working with their PCs .', u'The metadata can be used to record the characteristics of documents including the general characteristics and the characteristics related to user actions , which is helpful for retrieval .', u'This paper provides a new document retrieval method based on conceptual graphs in the environment of semantic desktop .', u'This new method effectively builds a document indexing structure for helping fast retrieval by using the metadata provided by the semantic desktop .', u'According to experiments , the time performance is improved compared to the previous algorithm of the projection based on the inference process .', u'The experimental results prove the feasibility of the approach as for retrieval time performance .']

entities: [[(u'Cooking', u'Method')], [(u'ingredient substitution', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'real taste', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge acquisition model', u'Method'), (u'ingredient substitution', u'Task'), (u'Thai cuisine recipe', u'Method')], [(u'rare Thai ingredients', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'domain ontology', u'Method'), (u'entities', u'Generic'), (u'ingredient substitution', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Thai cuisine recipe', u'Material')], [(u'rule bases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web Rule Language', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'ingredient substitution', u'USED-FOR', u'real taste')], [(u'knowledge acquisition model', u'USED-FOR', u'ingredient substitution'), (u'Thai cuisine recipe', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge acquisition model')], [], [], [(u'Semantic Web Rule Language', u'USED-FOR', u'rule bases')]]
sentences: [u'Cooking is an important activity because food is one of the basic necessities of life .', u'However , some ingredients are difficult to find in some seasons or some regions , therefore ingredient substitution is needed for real taste .', u'This article presents a knowledge acquisition model for ingredient substitution by applying Thai cuisine recipe for a case study .', u'The main purpose of this research is to substitute rare Thai ingredients using existing ingredients .', u'The proposed model is applying the concept of domain ontology to design the entities and relations among these entities which are related to ingredient substitution in Thai cuisine recipe .', u'In addition , a set of rule bases by Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) is designed and embedded into the ontology to apply for discovering the existing ingredients that can substitute the rare Thai ingredients .']

sentences: [u'The World Wide Web is revolutionizing the way people create , share and use the information .', u'Social network is an extremely suitable space to instantly share the information between individuals and their neighbours .', u'This unbounded growth of users and contents in social network lower the barrier for users to create and share resources through social applications like Facebook , Twitter etc but heightened the issues of privacy , provenance and copyright etc .', u'Therefore , to know the user accountability and to ensure the quality of the data the origin of the web resources ( Provenance ) need to be identified .', u'Hence , this paper proposes framework for identifying the trustworthy user or groups in social network using the provenance data .', u'This paper uses semantic web environment .', u'The framework evaluates with confidence score , trust score and adaptivity metrics .']

entities: [[(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'information retrieval systems', u'Task'), (u'semantic Web-oriented architecture', u'Method'), (u'personalized intelligent information retrieval system', u'Task'), (u'hierarchical tree model', u'Method'), (u'biomedical diseases system', u'Method'), (u'OWL language', u'Material'), (u'annotate syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics of concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Automatic acquirement of remote information', u'Task'), (u'inference rules', u'Method'), (u'information semantics-based intelligent clustering algorithm', u'Method'), (u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'retrieval interests', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'personalized intelligent information search', u'Task'), (u'diseases diagnosis', u'Task'), (u'recall and precision', u'Metric'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'biomedical diseases system', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'The notion of ontology is introduced to information retrieval systems and semantic Web-oriented architecture of personalized intelligent information retrieval system is presented , and hierarchical tree model of local domain ontological repository of biomedical diseases system is constructed , in which the OWL language is used to detail annotate syntax and semantics of concepts , their attributes and relations among the concepts .', u'Automatic acquirement of remote information on the Internet and pretreatment of local domain ontological repository are implemented by inference rules and information semantics-based intelligent clustering algorithm in the architecture , and preference database of doctors are managed logically according to their retrieval interests .', u'Consequently , the system will meets the requirement of personalized intelligent information search for diseases diagnosis , and further improves recall and precision of information retrieval on biomedical diseases system .']

entities: [[(u'database systems', u'Method'), (u'continuous increase in processing power', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system designs', u'Method'), (u'dedicated hardware accelerators', u'Method')], [(u'dedicated hardware accelerators', u'Method'), (u'dedicated query', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web database', u'Material'), (u'flexible FPGA-based hardware accelerator', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'join operators', u'Method'), (u'query execution', u'Task')], [(u'FPGA implementation', u'Method'), (u'software solution', u'Method'), (u'general-purpose processor', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'The increasing amount of data to be processed by database systems asks for a continuous increase in processing power .', u'While traditional system designs can hardly cope with these performance requirements , dedicated hardware accelerators provide the required processing power .', u'However , dedicated hardware accelerators are inflexible and can not be adapted to the requirements of a dedicated query .', u'In this paper , a concept is introduced to improve the performance of a Semantic Web database by developing a flexible FPGA-based hardware accelerator .', u'The feasibility of this approach is shown by implementing different types of join operators as one of the most important and most time consuming operators in query execution .', u'The performance comparison between the proposed FPGA implementation and a software solution in C on a general-purpose processor shows a significant speed-up up to 10 times .']

entities: [[(u'semantic expression', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web service based Internet-based manufacturing solution.It', u'Task'), (u'ontology-based knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web service', u'Task'), (u'network manufacturing service', u'Method'), (u'ser-vice-driven manufacturing ontology model', u'Method'), (u'approximate service matchmaking', u'Method'), (u'manufacturing service', u'Task'), (u'configuration optimization', u'Method'), (u'distributed manufacturing resources', u'Material'), (u'semantic Web-based collaborative manufacturing service platform', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'ontology-based knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'ser-vice-driven manufacturing ontology model'), (u'evaluation method', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology-based knowledge'), (u'configuration optimization', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed manufacturing resources')]]
sentences: [u'The lacking of semantic expression is a bottleneck of currently Web service based Internet-based manufacturing solution.It is not easy to dynamic discover appropriate services from different service providers.This paper put forward a method of ontology-based knowledge modeling.It combined Web service with network manufacturing service and constructed the ser-vice-driven manufacturing ontology model by applying the method.The evaluation method of approximate service matchmaking is also developed , and the case is given to demonstrate mentioned above.The study solves three problems during the course of manufacturing service , which were communication between different roles , data exchange and reuse of knowledge resource.The share and the configuration optimization of distributed manufacturing resources were realized in the network manufacturing environment.It lays the foundation for the construction of the semantic Web-based collaborative manufacturing service platform .']

sentences: [u'Before undertaking new biomedical research , identifying concepts that have already been patented is essential .', u'A traditional keyword-based search on patent databases may not be sufficient to retrieve all the relevant information , especially for the biomedical domain .', u'This paper presents BioPatentMiner , a system that facilitates information retrieval and knowledge discovery from biomedical patents .', u'The system first identifies biological terms and relations from the patents and then integrates the information from the patents with knowledge from biomedical ontologies to create a semantic Web .', u'Besides keyword search and queries linking the properties specified by one or more RDF triples , the system can discover semantic associations between the Web resources .', u'The system also determines the importance of the resources to rank the results of a search and prevent information overload while determining the semantic associations .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'cultural heritage domain', u'Material')], [(u'metadata schemas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'controlled vocabularies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Method')], [(u'metadata schemas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'controlled vocabularies MultiMatch', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'reference models', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'cultural heritage domain', u'FEATURE-OF', u'knowledge representation')], [(u'metadata schemas', u'CONJUNCTION', u'controlled vocabularies')], [(u'metadata schemas', u'CONJUNCTION', u'controlled vocabularies MultiMatch')], []]
sentences: [u'textabstractThis deliverable provides an overview of current practice regarding knowledge representation in the cultural heritage domain .', u'It does so by providing an overview of the metadata schemas and controlled vocabularies that are widely used in the cultural heritage sector. # N # An overview of current practice is gathered from : # N # the cultural heritage partners in the project ; # N # cultural heritage institutes throughout Europe ; # N # work done within other ( research ) projects. # N # More generic knowledge representation standards and the use of the Semantic Web within the project are outlined .', u'This overview provides insight into the metadata schemas and controlled vocabularies MultiMatch might have to deal with and build upon .', u'The deliverable concludes with a first analysis of the most important schemas and reference models together with a preliminary outline of their possible usability in the MultiMatch project .']

sentences: [u'Thesauri such as the Art and Architecture Thesaurus ( AAT ) provide structured vocabularies for describing art objects .', u"However , if we want to create a knowledge-rich description of an ( image of an ) art object , such as required by the `` semantic web '' , thesauri turn out to provide only part of the knowledge needed .", u'In this paper we look at problems related to capturing background knowledge for art resources .', u'We describe a case study in which we attempt to construct an ontology for a subset of art-object descriptions , namely antique furniture , using AAT as well as metadata standards as input .', u'We discuss the representation requirements for such an ontology as well as representational problems for our sample ontology with respect to the emerging web standards for knowledge representation ( RDF , RDFS , OIL ) .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web ontologies', u'Method')], [(u'web applications', u'Task'), (u'inconsistent knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web services', u'Method')], [(u'RuleML', u'Method'), (u'normalized markup', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web', u'Material'), (u'Horn rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RuleML', u'Method')], [(u'rule format', u'Method'), (u'uncertain and/or inconsistent knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'truth maintenance logic', u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'rule format', u'USED-FOR', u'uncertain and/or inconsistent knowledge'), (u'truth maintenance logic', u'USED-FOR', u'rules')]]
sentences: [u'Ensuring the consistency and completeness of Semantic Web ontologies is practically impossible , because of their scale and highly dynamic nature .', u'Many web applications , therefore , must deal with vague , incomplete and even inconsistent knowledge .', u'Rules were shown to be very effective in processing such knowledge , and future web services are expected to depend heavily on them .', u'RuleML , which is the earliest effort to define a normalized markup for representing and exchanging rules on the web , is currently limited to Horn rules .', u'Significant research efforts are underway to extend RuleML with more flexible representation and reasoning capabilities .', u'This paper presents an extension of the current rule format intended to accommodate uncertain and/or inconsistent knowledge , and shows how one truth maintenance logic can be adapted and extended to support such rules .']

entities: [[(u'XML', u'Method'), (u'public documentations', u'Material'), (u'XML data', u'Material')], [(u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'text data', u'Material'), (u'XML data', u'Material')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic')], [(u'semi-automatic ontology generation method', u'Method'), (u'data mining technique', u'Method'), (u'association rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'association rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'XML documents', u'Material'), (u'conceptual relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'conceptual ontology domain level', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'XML documents', u'Material'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'XML Topic Maps', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'exchanging web documents', u'CONJUNCTION', u'public documentations')], [(u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'information retrieval'), (u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web')], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'text data')], [], [(u'data mining technique', u'USED-FOR', u'semi-automatic ontology generation method'), (u'association rules', u'USED-FOR', u'semi-automatic ontology generation method')], [(u'association rules', u'USED-FOR', u'XML documents')], []]
sentences: [u'Recently as XML is becoming the standard of exchanging web documents and public documentations , XML data are increasing in many areas .', u'And the semantic web based on the ontology is appearing for the exact information retrieval .', u'The ontology for not only the text data but also XML data is being required .', u'However , the existing ontology has been constructed manually and it is time and cost consuming .', u'Therefore in this paper , we propose the semi-automatic ontology generation method using the data mining technique , the association rules .', u'Applying the association rules to the XML documents , we intend to find out the conceptual relationships to construct the ontology .', u'Using the conceptual ontology domain level extracted from the XML documents , we construct the ontology by using XML Topic Maps ( XTM ) automatically .']

entities: [[(u'distributed sources', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'structured data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'distributed structured data sources', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data sources', u'Material'), (u'online information space', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'user interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'end users', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'technical skills', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'information tasks', u'Task')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'direct manipulation tools', u'Method')], [(u'accessing Linked Data', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'user interfaces', u'USED-FOR', u'end users'), (u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'information tasks')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The ability to build tools that support gathering and querying information from distributed sources on the Web rests on the availability of structured data .', u'Linked Data , as a way for publishing and linking distributed structured data sources on the Web , provides an opportunity to create this kind of tools .', u'Currently , however , the ability to complete such tasks over Linked Data sources is limited to users with advanced technical skills , resulting in an online information space largely inaccessible to non-technical end users .', u'This thesis explores the challenges of designing user interfaces for end users , those without technical skills , to use Linked Data to solve information tasks that require combining information from multiple sources .', u'The thesis explores the design space around interfaces that support access to Linked Data on demand , suggests potential use cases and stakeholders , and proposes several direct manipulation tools for end users with diverse needs and skills .', u'User studies indicate that the tools built offer solutions to various challenges in accessing Linked Data that are identified in this thesis .']

entities: [[(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'hyperlinked documents', u'Material')], [], [], [(u'web of connected data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data Web', u'Material')], [(u'legacy data', u'Material'), (u'University domain', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Universitys databases', u'Material'), (u'linked Data', u'Material'), (u'web', u'Material'), (u'provenance data', u'Material')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data publication', u'Task'), (u'legacy databases', u'Material'), (u'university domain', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Linked Data Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'web of connected data')], [(u'University domain', u'FEATURE-OF', u'legacy data')], [], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data publication'), (u'university domain', u'FEATURE-OF', u'legacy databases')]]
sentences: [u'Web was developed to share information among the users through internet as some hyperlinked documents .', u'If someone wants to collect some data from the web he has to search and crawl through the documents to fulfil his needs .', u'Concept of Linked Data creates a breakthrough at this stage by enabling the links within data .', u'So , besides the web of connected documents a new web developed both for humans and machines , i.e. , the web of connected data , simply known as Linked Data Web .', u'Since it is a very new domain , still a very few works has been done , specially the publication of legacy data within a University domain as Linked Data .', u'In this paper our approach concentrates on publishing the data from our Universitys databases as linked Data on the web and also ensuring the trustworthiness of the data by addition of provenance data along with .', u'For this purpose we have introduced a framework to make all the steps towards the Linked Data publication easy for legacy databases within a university domain .']

entities: [[(u'open source software', u'Method')], [(u'Existing search engines', u'Generic'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'open source software', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic search system', u'Method'), (u'open source software', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'open source software', u'Task')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic identification', u'Task'), (u'defined rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'search engine', u'Method'), (u'semantic aspect', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'semantic search system', u'USED-FOR', u'open source software')], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'It')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic identification'), (u'knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic identification')], [], []]
sentences: [u'To be able to use or reuse an open source software , we must be aware of its existence and find it first .', u'Existing search engines on the Web do not allow finding open source software satisfying given requirements while taking into account special semantics .', u'In this paper , we propose a semantic search system for open source software allowing to identify and localize them .', u'It relies on an ontology providing a mechanism to describe knowledge about open source software .', u'Moreover , it can infer knowledge for semantic identification through some defined rules .', u'Preliminary results are encouraging .', u'The evaluation results compared to a non-semantic version of the same search engine confirm the added value of the consideration of the semantic aspect in search .']

entities: [[(u'tourism multimedia information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'World Wide Web', u'Material'), (u'retrieval approaches', u'Method')], [(u'information retrieval approaches', u'Method'), (u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'subject perception semantic model', u'Method'), (u'SPSM )', u'Method'), (u'searching tourism information', u'Task'), (u'customized query threshold', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'tourism information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'Subject Hierarchy Graph', u'Method'), (u'semantic search capabilities', u'Task'), (u'subject perception', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics of query requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SPSM', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'World Wide Web', u'USED-FOR', u'tourism multimedia information')], [(u'keywords', u'USED-FOR', u'information retrieval approaches')], [(u'search requirements', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieval')], [(u'subject perception semantic model', u'USED-FOR', u'searching tourism information'), (u'customized query threshold', u'USED-FOR', u'tourism information')], [(u'Subject Hierarchy Graph', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search capabilities')], []]
sentences: [u'With the continued growth of tourism multimedia information made available through the World Wide Web , more efficient and accurate retrieval approaches are leading to an increasing demand .', u'Most existing information retrieval approaches are based upon keywords and therefore provide limited capabilities to capture the query requirements .', u'However , a complete understanding of search requirements is essential for improving the effectiveness of retrieval .', u'To achieve this goal , we propose a novel subject perception semantic model ( SPSM ) for searching tourism information , which allows the customized query threshold to retrieve tourism information .', u'In this model , we present the definition of Subject Hierarchy Graph to support semantic search capabilities , and propose computing methods of subject perception to quantify the semantics of query requirements .', u'The experiments show that SPSM obtained encouraging performances .']

entities: [[(u'search mechanisms', u'Method')], [(u'Social Network Services', u'Method'), (u'search approaches', u'Method')], [(u'SNS field', u'Task'), (u'expressive evolution', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approaches', u'Generic')], [(u'sociocultural aspects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SNS', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'personalized semantic search', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'shared meanings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SNS user', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'mechanism', u'Generic'), (u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'personalized semantic search')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Nowadays search mechanisms are decisive to people successfully access relevant and valuable information .', u'In the current Web environment , people connected to each other through Social Network Services ( SNSs ) bring new challenges for search approaches .', u'Recent literature in the SNS field shows expressive evolution but the approaches for searching still utilize mechanisms that just consider the syntactical processing of the information .', u'Based on sociocultural aspects of a SNS , we propose a novel approach that enables to provide personalized semantic search .', u'This approach makes use of ontologies to represent the shared meanings , and consequently to present better organized , ranked and adapted search results for each SNS user .', u'The paper presents the way the proposed mechanism was implemented and points out examples that illustrate the possibilities raised by the approach .']

entities: [[(u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge management systems', u'Method'), (u'KMS', u'Method'), (u'distributed web communities', u'Material'), (u'operational ontology-based KMS', u'Method')], [(u'INTEROP KMap', u'Method'), (u'competency management system', u'Method'), (u'Enterprise Interoperability', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information access', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'summary description and usage data', u'Material'), (u'KMap', u'Method'), (u'semantic search', u'Method'), (u'document ranking measures', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'domain ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge management systems'), (u'KMS', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'knowledge management systems')], [(u'INTEROP KMap', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantically indexed , competency management system'), (u'INTEROP KMap', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'competency management system')], [(u'information access', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontologies')], [(u'document ranking measures', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search')]]
sentences: [u'While it is generally acknowledged that domain ontologies can significantly improve knowledge management systems ( KMS ) within organizations and among distributed web communities , we have little evidence of operational ontology-based KMS and their practical utility in real settings in the literature .', u'We describe here the INTEROP KMap , a fully implemented , semantically indexed , competency management system , used to facilitate research collaboration and coordination of a Network of Excellence ( NoE ) on Enterprise Interoperability .', u'Since the main highlighted advantages of ontologies are improved information access and interoperability , our aim in this paper is to give experimental support to these claims .', u'We provide a summary description and usage data on the KMap , as well as experiments to quantify the added value of semantic search wrt traditional document ranking measures .']

entities: [[(u'group-based semantic search method-GBSS', u'Method'), (u'GBSS', u'Method'), (u'hybrid architecture', u'Method'), (u'DHT network', u'Method'), (u'search algorithm', u'Method'), (u'GBSS', u'Method'), (u'file grouping method', u'Method'), (u'friend relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'search interests', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'friend relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'search process', u'Method'), (u'GBSS algorithm', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'friend relations', u'USED-FOR', u'search algorithm')]]
sentences: [u"A group-based semantic search method-GBSS was presented.With regard to architecture , GBSS introduced a hybrid architecture in which the storage and search of raw data was based on DHT network , but the storage and search of meta-data was based on unstructured P2P network.With regard to search algorithm , GBSS presented a file grouping method without users ' description and constructs friend relations between nodes based on search interests and sharing files.The design idea came from some conclusions of P2P researches and complex network researches.The forwarding of user requests came use of friend relations in search process , which integrated effective caching strategy.The simulation tests prove that the GBSS algorithm is efficient , stable , and the performance improved times compared with traditional algorithms ."]

entities: [[(u'keyword based search systems', u'Method')], [(u'search system', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'natural language interface', u'Task')], [(u'multilingual SBVR based natural language interface', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SBVR vocabulary', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'SPARQL queries', u'Task'), (u'model transformations', u'Method')], [(u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'question mapping', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'Task')], [(u'Mooney Natural Language Learning Data', u'Material'), (u'natural language interface solutions', u'Method'), (u'English and Lithuanian languages', u'Material')], [(u'DOI', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'search system')], [(u'them', u'USED-FOR', u'SPARQL queries')], [(u'question mapping', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The semantic search over ontologies allows user to retrieve more relevant results comparing with ordinary keyword based search systems .', u'This type of search system is powered by ontologies and the most convenient interface to ontologies is natural language interface .', u'In this paper , we present multilingual SBVR based natural language interface to ontologies , which allows writing questions based on concepts of SBVR vocabulary and transforms them to SPARQL queries using model transformations .', u'The solution can also be used for questioning , when question mapping to ontology is not straightforward .', u'The experimental evaluation of correctness using Mooney Natural Language Learning Data showed results , similar to other natural language interface solutions , answering questions in English and Lithuanian languages .', u'DOI : http : //dx.doi.org/10.5755/j01.itc.46.1.13998']

sentences: [u'Matching search technology based on query keyword has been widely used by traditional search way .', u'It still belongs to pure keyword matching and can not acquire satisfactory search results .', u"The essential reason is that traditional Web search lacks semantic understanding to user 's search behaviors .", u'In this study , we propose a novel ontology-based framework for semantic expansion search .', u'Based on constructed domain ontology , semantic annotation algorithm and semantic expansion reasoning algorithm are presented in detail , which are associated with semantic annotation unit and semantic expansion reasoning engine respectively .', u'Then a semantic search prototype system is designed and implemented .', u'The experimental results show that semantic expansion search by proposed methodology can overcome limitations in comparison with traditional keyword search mode , and achieve higher recall ratio and precision ratio .']

entities: [[(u'enterprise search engines', u'Method')], [(u'retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'YASA Your Adaptive Search Agent', u'Method'), (u'ontology-based information retrieval system', u'Method'), (u'enterprise', u'Task')], [(u'YASA', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'YASA', u'Method'), (u'context-based personalization', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'faceted navigation', u'Task'), (u'semantic search capabilities', u'Task')], [(u'YASA', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Studies agree that searchers are often not satisfied with the performance of current enterprise search engines .', u'As a consequence , more scientists worldwide are actively investigating new avenues for searching to improve retrieval performance .', u'This paper contributes to YASA Your Adaptive Search Agent , a fully implemented and thoroughly evaluated ontology-based information retrieval system for the enterprise .', u'A salient particularity of YASA is that large parts of the ontology are automatically filled with facts by recycling and transforming existing data .', u'YASA offers context-based personalization , faceted navigation , as well as semantic search capabilities .', u'YASA has been deployed and evaluated in the pharmaceutical research department of Roche , Penzberg , and results show that already semantically simple ontologies suffice to considerably improve search performance .']

entities: [[(u'Amharic language', u'Material')], [(u'general search engine', u'Method'), (u'google.com.et', u'Material'), (u'Amharic Language', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Search Engine', u'Method'), (u'Amharic documents', u'Material')], [(u'search engine', u'Method'), (u'Ontology/Knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'Query Processor', u'Method'), (u'characteristics of Amharic language', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'ranker and query engine', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'meaning based searching', u'Task')]]
