sentences: [u'Recently the amount of documents written in Amharic language has been dramatically increasing .', u'Searching such content using localized and regional version of general search engine such as google.com.et returns documents containing search key terms while excluding specific characteristics of Amharic Language .', u'In this paper , we present the design and implementation of Semantic Search Engine for Amharic documents .', u'The search engine has Crawler , Ontology/Knowledge base , Indexer and Query Processor that consider characteristics of Amharic language .', u'The ontology provides shared concepts Sport .', u'This ontology is built manually by language and sport domain experts and it is used in building semantic indexer , ranker and query engine .', u'In addition , we show how the system facilitate meaning based searching , document relevant and popularity based documents ranking .']

sentences: [u'Internet-based e-Learning has experienced a boom and bust situation in the past 10 years [ 32 ] .', u'To bring in new forces to knowledge-oriented e-Learning , this paper addresses the semantic integration issue of multi-media resources and learning processes with theoretical learning supports in an integrated framework .', u'This paper proposes a context-mediated approach that aims to enable semantic-based inter-operations across knowledge domains , even across the WWW and the Semantic Web [ 8 ] .', u'The proposed semantic e-Learning framework enables intelligent operations of heterogeneous multi-media contents based on a generic semantic context intermediation model .', u"This framework supports intelligent e-Learning with a knowledge network for knowledge object visualization , an enhanced Kolb 's learning cycle [ 31 ] to guide learning practices , and a learning health care framework for personalized learning ."]

entities: [[(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'software tools', u'Method'), (u'web-based access', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous multilingual archival collections', u'Material')], [(u'widespread international encoding standards', u'Method'), (u'archival description', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic web methods', u'Method'), (u'archival collections', u'Material')], [(u'archival documents', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'methodology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'software tools')], [(u'widespread international encoding standards', u'USED-FOR', u'archival description')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The paper presents in brief a project aimed at the development of a methodology and corresponding software tools intended for building of proper environments giving up means for semantics oriented , web-based access to heterogeneous multilingual archival collections .', u'Some widespread international encoding standards for archival description and for representation of structured electronic versions of various kinds of documents have been used .', u'An analysis is made on the applicability of appropriate Semantic web methods and technologies in order to provide versatile , user-friendly access to archival collections based on the semantics of their contents .', u'Some practical results concerning the digitisation of a collection of archival documents from the period of the organization of the Sofia Municipal Government ( 1878 1879 ) and the development of a website presenting this collection are described in the paper .']

entities: [[(u'raw government datasets', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'transparency', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'large-scale distributed data integration', u'Task'), (u'collaborative data manipulation', u'Task'), (u'transparent data consumption', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Web-based TWC LOGD portal', u'Method'), (u'linked open government data', u'Material')], [(u'portal', u'Generic'), (u'open source infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'data curators', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'TWC LOGD Portal', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'International open government initiatives are releasing an increasing volume of raw government datasets directly to citizens via the Web .', u'The transparency resulting from these releases not only creates new application opportunities but also imposes new burdens inherent to large-scale distributed data integration , collaborative data manipulation and transparent data consumption .', u'The Tetherless World Constellation ( TWC ) at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute ( RPI ) has developed the Semantic Web-based TWC LOGD portal to support the deployment of linked open government data ( LOGD ) .', u'The portal is both an open source infrastructure supporting linked open government data production and consumption and a vibrant community portal that educates and serves the growing international open government community of developers , data curators and end users .', u'This paper motivates and introduces the TWC LOGD Portal and highlights innovative aspects and lessons learned .']

entities: [[(u'adaptation', u'Method'), (u'structure of ontological knowledge bases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'adaptation determinants', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Web 2.0', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'software component', u'Method'), (u'ontology evolution', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'adaptation determinants', u'FEATURE-OF', u'structure of ontological knowledge bases'), (u'adaptation determinants', u'FEATURE-OF', u'ontological knowledge bases')], [(u'Web 2.0', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'software component', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology evolution')]]
sentences: [u'The paper discusses new possible facets regarding the concept of adaptation , focused on allowing users to intervene in the process by having the possibility both to insert new data and to alter the structure of ontological knowledge bases which contain adaptation determinants .', u'The approach is based on the exploitation of the synergy between Web 2.0 and Semantic Web and may give the opportunity to obtain more personalized , comprehensive and tailored service to all users , by allowing user communities to model a domain of interest and to develop it according to their interests .', u'The paper discusses background ideas and gives technical details of an example implementation of a software component designed to perform ontology evolution based on the analysis of contributions expressed by users of a service in natural language .']

entities: [[(u'keyword search model', u'Method'), (u'computer based Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'condition probability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'search system', u'Method'), (u'keyword likelihood', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'Query-Likelihood of keyword search model of computer based Semantic Web is to compute the condition probability of the keywords in major subject blocks of all kinds of learning pages on the Web , describing the likelihood between the web and the keyword , and meanwhile , it can revise the computed likelihood result by refering to the relationship between the learning resources on the Web and the curriculum in the Learning Resource Repository.This intelligent search system can solve the problem of opening too many web pages when the user returns after searching in the Resource Repository.Based on the order of media , curriculum , and keyword likelihood , the user can quickly search for the useful information from the related media groups of returned system.In this way the accuracy of search can be improved .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'non-RDF/OWL data', u'Material')], [(u'declarative method', u'Method'), (u'RDF/OWL', u'Method')], [(u'declarative mapping language', u'Method')], [(u'syntax', u'Generic'), (u'declarative semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'matrix operations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'spreadsheets', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'language', u'Generic'), (u'spreadsheet data', u'Material'), (u'aggregations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF/OWL output', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'mapping and extraction technology', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'Integrating and accessing data from the many existing formats is a key challenge for the Semantic Web .', u'In particular , representing and understanding non-RDF/OWL data in terms of ontologies is important for reasoning about this data and its relationships to other data , and for extracting or accessing the data itself .', u'This paper presents a declarative method for mapping and translating spreadsheet data to RDF/OWL .', u'First , a declarative mapping language is presented .', u'Then , for this syntax , the paper presents a declarative semantics in terms of matrix operations as abstractions over spreadsheets and the relations therein .', u'The language supports arbitrary search and indexing functions over spreadsheet data and allows the generation of complex associations and aggregations in the RDF/OWL output .', u'Imperative and functional implementations of the mapping and extraction technology are presented .']

relations: [[], [(u'SPARQL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'expressive query language')], [(u'union', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'low-level notions of relational algebra'), (u'union', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'relational algebra'), (u'union', u'CONJUNCTION', u'filters'), (u'filters', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'relational algebra'), (u'filters', u'CONJUNCTION', u'grouping'), (u'grouping', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'relational algebra')], [(u'SQUALL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'high-level language')], [], [(u'one', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'web services'), (u'one', u'CONJUNCTION', u'another'), (u'DBpedia', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'SPARQL endpoint')]]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web is now made of billions of triples , which are available as Linked Open Data ( LOD ) or as RDF stores .', u'The most common approach to access RDF datasets is through SPARQL , an expressive query language .', u'However , SPARQL is difficult to learn for most users because it exhibits low-level notions of relational algebra such as union , filters , or grouping .', u'We present SQUALL , a high-level language for querying and updating an RDF dataset .', u'It has a strong compliance with RDF , covers all features of SPARQL 1.1 , and has a controlled natural language syntax that completely abstracts from low-level notions .', u'SQUALL is available as two web services : one for translating a SQUALL sentence to a SPARQL query or update , and another for directly querying a SPARQL endpoint such as DBpedia .']

entities: [[], [(u'semantic web', u'Method')], [], [(u'semantic environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'order model', u'Method'), (u'theorem prover', u'Method'), (u'description logic interface', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'choosen solution', u'Method'), (u'matchmaking process', u'Method')], [(u'personal device', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'reasoning backends', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'theorem prover', u'CONJUNCTION', u'description logic interface')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'During the past few years mobile phones have become an ubiquitous companion .', u"In parallel the semantic web provides enabling technologies to annotate and match information with a user 's interests .", u'This paper presents a thorough definition of annotations and profiles .', u'The optimizations of annotations and profiles make the mobile phone a first class participant of a semantic environment rather than a mere displaying client of services running elsewhere .', u'The implementation of the system - including a first order model generating theorem prover and a description logic interface - renders the idea viable in the real world .', u'The choosen solution even enables explanations within the matchmaking process .', u'The profile does not have to leave the personal device and ensures privacy by doing so .', u'An additionally benefit is the independence from communication with any reasoning backends .']

entities: [[(u'agent application', u'Task'), (u'network centric Warfare ( NCW )', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web-based information processing framework', u'Method'), (u'agent', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information superiority', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge superiority', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decision superiority', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology-based Web Service description model', u'Method'), (u'Web Services', u'Task'), (u'multi-directions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web Services', u'Task')], [(u'platform-independent technological framework', u'Method'), (u'Web Services', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'ontology-based Web Service description model', u'USED-FOR', u'Web Services')], [(u'platform-independent technological framework', u'USED-FOR', u'Web Services')]]
sentences: [u'This paper analyzes the feasibility of agent application in the network centric Warfare ( NCW ) , and points out the difficulties in this process as well .', u'The Semantic Web-based information processing framework is constructed , so that we can process information based on agent , effectively translate information superiority into knowledge superiority and finally build the decision superiority .', u'At the same time , this paper also propose an ontology-based Web Service description model to describe the Web Services in multi-directions , on the basis of which agent can accurately and correctly comprehend the function and process of Web Services .', u'Thus , a general platform-independent technological framework is built to make agent automatically invoke and compose the Web Services , and the interconnection , intercommunication and interoperation of information on various platforms also can be realized finally .']

sentences: [u'The Rule Responder project ( responder.ruleml.org ) extends the Semantic Web towards a Pragmatic Web infrastructure for collaborative human-computer networks .', u'These allow semi-automated agents - with their individual ( semantic and pragmatic ) contexts , decisions and actions - to form corporate , not-for-profit , educational , or other virtual teams or virtual organizations .', u'The project develops an effective methodology and an efficient infrastructure to interchange and reuse knowledge ( ontologies and rules ) .', u'Such knowledge plays an important role for ( semi-automatically and contextually ) transforming data , deriving new conclusions and decisions from existing knowledge , and acting according to changed situations or occurred ( complex ) events .', u'Ultimately , this might put AI theories on distributed multiagent systems into larger-scale practice and might form the basis for highly flexible and adaptive Web-based service-oriented/service-component architectures ( SOAs/SCAs ) .']

sentences: [u'Drools is the leading Java based Open Source rule engine .', u'It is a hybrid chaining engine meaning it can react to changes in data and also provides advanced query capabilities .', u'Drools provides built in temporal reasoning for complex event processing and is fully integrated with the jBPM project for BPMN2 based workflow .', u'Ongoing research includes ( but is not limited ) to planning , ontological reasoning ( semantic web ) , imperfect reasoning , truth maintenance and distributed collaboration through intelligent agents. # R # # N # # R # # N # This talk will provide an introduction into Drools what it is and how it works .', u'We will explain the concepts of forward and backward chaining within the context of Drools as well as exploring the rule engine syntax and how it has been extended for temporal reasoning for complex event processing .']

sentences: [u'A document implies intention of its own designer , which can be utilized actively in the automation of business processes .', u'With the understanding of document form and function , we can regard documents as executable computer programs in a special case .', u'For this approach , an active document model is proposed , which is composed of document form , data , rules , and queries .', u'These components reflect the form as well as the function of documents orthogonally .', u'In this model , documents can interact with machines and can cooperate with other applications .', u'The model establishes a framework of accelerating the development of intelligent document-centric applications .', u'Moreover , it shows in advance what will become of documents of the semantic Web .', u'To be concrete , a prototype development system for declarative Web applications based on the active documents is designed and implemented .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'capability matching', u'Task'), (u'service discovery', u'Task'), (u'Description Logic reasoner', u'Method'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'IO', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'automatic invocation', u'Task'), (u'automatic Web Services discovery', u'Task'), (u'invocation', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'Web Services'), (u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'capability matching'), (u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'service discovery'), (u'automatic Web Services discovery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'invocation')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web makes the automatic discovery and invocation of Web Services become possible But existing methods perform the capability matching , which is crucial for service discovery , either only according to inputs and outputs ( IO ) , which results in a not very precise matching , or trying to tackle arbitrary services , which results in an undecidable reasoning In this paper , targeting merely the information-providing type of Web Services , we present a precise and decidable matching method based on the Description Logic reasoner An outstanding property of our method is that it can determinate the accurate binding of IO between requested and advertised services , which is necessary for automatic invocation yet rarely addressed in previous work Besides , this paper also describes a useful use case for automatic Web Services discovery and invocation .']

sentences: [u'The intelligent learning systems provide direct customized instruction to the learners without the intervention of human tutors on the basis of Semantic Web resources .', u'Principal roles use ontologies as instruments for modeling learning processes , learners , learning disciplines and resources .', u'This paper examines the variety , relationships , and conceptualizations of ontologies used in intelligent learning systems .', u'The domain and application of ontologies assist in the building of learning content courseware and in the process of knowledge acquisition learning session .', u'In this paper , the conceptualization of the domain ontologies is presented by the upper levels of its taxonomies , a method and an algorithm intended for the generation of application ontologies of structural learning objects , that is , curriculum , syllabus , and lesson plan , are developed .', u'Examples of curriculum and syllabus application ontologies are given .']

sentences: [u'The success of the Semantic Web is impossible without any form of modularity , encapsulation , and access control .', u'In an earlier paper , we extended RDF graphs with weak and strong negation , as well as derivation rules .', u'The ERDF # n-stable model semantics of the extended RDF framework ( ERDF ) is defined , extending RDF ( S ) semantics .', u'In this paper , we propose a framework for modular ERDF ontologies , called modular ERDF framework , which enables collaborative reasoning over a set of ERDF ontologies , while support for hidden knowledge is also provided .', u'In particular , the modular ERDF stable model semantics of modular ERDF ontologies is defined , extending the ERDF # n-stable model semantics .', u'Our proposed framework supports local semantics and different points of view , local closed-world and open-world assumptions , and scoped negation-as-failure .', u'Several complexity results are provided .']

sentences: [u'Based on the bibliography references included in ISI Web of Knowledge , and by use of visualization network analysis toolCitespace to conduct co-citation and cluster analysis of collected data , this paper renders knowledge mapping on the development and evolution of information resource allocation research , reveals two different periods of information resource allocation research , and identifies representative scientists as well as relevant literatures in each period .', u'Meanwhile , this paper demonstrates the hot research fields represented by enterprise resource allocation , theory and practice research of information resource allocation , biological information resource allocation , retrieval and sharing research , and computer network communication resource allocation , and further presents the frontiers represented by empirical research of information resource allocation , information retrieval about resource allocation , network communication resource allocation , biological information data mining , biology knowledge management , gene-ontology and semantic web .']

sentences: [u'The Web contains hundreds of thousands of educational resources available any time and any place .', u'However no smart technology is available to help teachers and students locate appropriate resources customized to their needs and social characteristics .', u'When educational resources are indexed , it is often done by demographics , such as student age and grade .', u"This article describes customized Grid Learning Services ( GLS ) that will personalize instruction based on an individual 's presumed knowledge and cognitive and learning needs .", u'The customized GLS will use real-time student modeling , the Semantic Web , intelligent agents , and pre-tests of cognitive , affective , and social characteristics to personalize the selection of educational resources and problems .', u'Components of the customized GLS include an ontology construction agent , goal-based retrieval mechanisms , a lesson planner , and student and pedagogical agents .']

entities: [[(u'Schema matching', u'Task'), (u'finding semantic correspondences', u'Task'), (u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'data warehouse', u'Task'), (u'heterogeneous data sources integration', u'Task'), (u'semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'schema matching', u'Task'), (u'domain experts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'multistrategy schema matching framework', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic distances', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic similarity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'structural matching algorithm', u'Method'), (u'semantic similarity propagation', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'real-world domains', u'Material'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'accuracy', u'Metric')]]

sentences: [u'Schema matching , the problem of finding semantic correspondences between elements of two schemas , plays a key role in many applications , such as data warehouse , heterogeneous data sources integration and semantic Web .', u'Currently , schema matching is largely performed manually by domain experts , thus a time-consuming and labor-intensive process .', u'In this paper , we describe a multistrategy schema matching framework , which can combine multiple matching strategies flexibly and its architecture is extensible to new marchers .', u'We adopt an approach based on semantic distances between words to compute their semantic similarity .', u'We propose a structural matching algorithm based on semantic similarity propagation , which consider the effect between neighboring nodes .', u'After describe our approach , we present experiment results on several real-world domains , and show that the approach discovers semantic mappings with a high degree of accuracy .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'domain models', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic resources', u'Material')], [(u'reuse of semantic resources', u'Task'), (u'models', u'Generic')], [(u'domain models', u'Method'), (u'educational contexts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'domain model', u'Method'), (u'automatic item generation', u'Task')], [(u'domain model', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'domain models')], [], [], [(u'domain models', u'USED-FOR', u'educational contexts'), (u'domain model', u'USED-FOR', u'automatic item generation')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web offers many opportunities for reusing datasets and domain models in the field of education and assessment in particular .', u'We have conducted research to generate test questions from Semantic resources .', u'The reuse of semantic resources raises however challenges , since all data and models have not been conceived to be directly used for educational purposes .', u'We have therefore analysed existing domain models created specifically for educational contexts to identify structures and relations of the model that can help deem the relevance of a particular domain model for automatic item generation .', u'We present an initial set of conditions which can help identifying a relevant domain model to be used in an educational context .', u'We also suggest a mechanism to relate them to levels of knowledge to be assessed in generated items .']

entities: [[(u'Reasoning', u'Method')], [(u'semantic reasoning algorithms', u'Method'), (u'Internet-scale knowledge bases', u'Material')], [(u'reasoning approaches', u'Method')], [(u'they', u'Generic'), (u'data-intensive applications', u'Task'), (u'Internet scale', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Large Knowledge Collider', u'Method'), (u'platform solution', u'Method'), (u'service-oriented approach', u'Method'), (u'reasoning technique', u'Method'), (u'large-scale and on-demand elastic infrastructures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'high performance computing', u'Method'), (u'cloud technology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'they', u'USED-FOR', u'data-intensive applications')], [(u'service-oriented approach', u'USED-FOR', u'Large Knowledge Collider'), (u'service-oriented approach', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning technique'), (u'high performance computing', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'large-scale and on-demand elastic infrastructures'), (u'high performance computing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'cloud technology'), (u'cloud technology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'large-scale and on-demand elastic infrastructures')]]
sentences: [u'Reasoning is one of the essential application areas of the modern Semantic Web .', u'Nowadays , the semantic reasoning algorithms are facing significant challenges when dealing with the emergence of the Internet-scale knowledge bases , comprising extremely large amounts of data .', u'The traditional reasoning approaches have only been approved for small , closed , trustworthy , consistent , coherent and static data domains .', u'As such , they are not well-suited to be applied in data-intensive applications aiming on the Internet scale .', u'We introduce the Large Knowledge Collider as a platform solution that leverages the service-oriented approach to implement a new reasoning technique , capable of dealing with exploding volumes of the rapidly growing data universe , in order to be able to take advantages of the large-scale and on-demand elastic infrastructures such as high performance computing or cloud technology .']

sentences: [u"This report documents the program and the outcomes of Dagstuhl Seminar 12171 `` Semantic Data Management '' .", u'The purpose of the seminar was to have a fruitful exchange of ideas between the semantic web , database systems and information retrieval communities , organised across four main themes : scalability , provenance , dynamicity and search .', u'Relevant key questions cutting across all of these themes were : ( i ) how can existing DB and IR solutions be adapted to manage semantic data ; and ( ii ) are there new challenges that arise for the DB and IR communities ( i.e .', u'are radically new techniques required ) ?', u'The outcome was a deeper , more integrated understanding of the current state of the art on semantic data management and a the identification of a set of open challenges that will inform the three communities in this intersection .']

sentences: [u'Web engineering dapat dipandang sebagai penerapan software engineering pada lingkungan web yang # R # # N # memiliki aspek utama orientasi menuju sistem terdistribusi .', u'Saat ini , aplikasi lingkungan web menjadi # R # # N # andalan beberapa instansi/perusahaan dalam mengelola proses bisnis. # R # # N # Dalam automasi berbasis Internet , proses binis merupakan sekumpulan / penggabungan dari web service. # R # # N # Komposisi web service membutuhkan suatu mekanisme penggabungan agar bisa membentuk sebuah # R # # N # workflow untuk merepresentasikan bisnis proses .', u'Dibahas suatu metoda untuk mengkaji semantic web # R # # N # service agar sesuai dengan kebutuhan pengguna .', u'Model matematika graf bentuk Petri Net akan dipakai # R # # N # untuk memodelkan komposisi web service dan dipakai untuk melakukan verifikasi dan evaluasi kinerja # R # # N # sistem melalui matriks incidence. # R # # N # Kata kunci : web service , komposisi web service , Petri net , matriks incidence']

sentences: [u'RDF Schema is a basic and yet very important language for specifying ontologies in the context of Semantic Web .', u'Ontologies can be used to obtain more information from that explicitly stated .', u'Traditionally , the process of revealing implicit knowledge , known as inference or reasoning , is realised by a reasoner -- a component which either processes data to infer all conclusions in advance or , given a query , infers all implicit answers during a query evaluation process .', u'In this paper , we present an alternative approach based on structuring data in a database according to underlying ontologies .', u'This knowledge structure is employed for directing query evaluation to data relevant for the given query .', u'Thus , this method reduces reasoning to retrieving .', u'We show that the proposed schema preserves the semantics of RDF and RDFS in standard use cases .']

sentences: [u'Semantic Web is an effective technology for intelligent Internet of Things ( IoT ) , where Web Services are commonly used to describe the entity functions in the transaction process .', u'However , as a specification of information processing , conventional Web Services can not fully meet the needs of execution and control of the transactions on IoT .', u'To facilitate describing entities involved in the transactions on IoT , by extending OWL-S , we propose a specification model of dynamic services for IoT entities .', u'In our model , information of entity status is issued in real-time by the extended structure and is released to the requesters as dynamic services .', u'In this way , the transactions on IoT can be constructed and executed intelligently as needed .', u'Finally , the experimental results demonstrated the effectiveness of the proposed model of dynamic entity services for IoT .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge base design', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web languages', u'Material'), (u'automatic service composition', u'Task'), (u'network operation support', u'Task')], [(u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'Shared Information/Data ( SID ) model', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Method')], [(u'design', u'Generic'), (u'Service', u'Generic'), (u'SID model', u'Method'), (u'QoS )', u'Method'), (u'network service', u'Method')], [(u'operation service', u'Method'), (u'OWL-S Service', u'Method')], [(u'network services', u'Method'), (u'QoS', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'QoS services case', u'Task')], [(u'constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'We propose a knowledge base design by using Semantic Web languages to provide automatic service composition for network operation support .', u'A knowledge base is designed based on the Shared Information/Data ( SID ) model described in OWL .', u'In this design , a Service in the SID model ( e.g. , QoS ) is defined as a network service that represents a logical functionality of resources having some operation services .', u'An operation service is defined as an OWL-S Service for operating each network service .', u'In addition , constraints on resources that implement particular network services ( e.g. , QoS on Trails ) having particular operation services are studied .', u'We used the proposed method to construct a practical knowledge base for a specific QoS services case .', u'As a result , we verified that reasoning on the constraints works successfully by using a general reasoning tool .']

entities: [[(u'clinical trials data', u'Material')], [(u'database', u'Generic'), (u'LinkedCT', u'Method'), (u'clinical trials', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'semantic links', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'trials data', u'Material'), (u'data sources', u'Material')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'LinkedCT', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic link discovery', u'Task'), (u'approximate string matching techniques', u'Method'), (u'declarative and easy-to-use framework', u'Method')], [(u'link discovery scenarios', u'Task'), (u'LinkedCT', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'The Linked Clinical Trials ( LinkedCT ) project aims at publishing the first open semantic web data source for clinical trials data .', u'The database exposed by LinkedCT is generated by ( 1 ) transforming existing data sources of clinical trials into RDF , and ( 2 ) discovering semantic links between the records in the trials data and several other data sources .', u'In this paper , we discuss several challenges involved in these two steps and present the methodology used in LinkedCT to overcome these challenges .', u'Our approach for semantic link discovery involves using state-of-the-art approximate string matching techniques combined with ontology-based semantic matching of the records , all performed in a declarative and easy-to-use framework .', u'We present an evaluation of the performance of our proposed techniques in several link discovery scenarios in LinkedCT .']

entities: [[(u'on-the-fly ontology construction', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'DODDLE-R', u'Method'), (u'support environment', u'Method'), (u'user-centered ontology development', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'quality improvement part', u'Metric')], [(u'Pre-processing part', u'Task'), (u'prototype ontology', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'preliminary phase', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'modification', u'Task'), (u'DODDLE-R', u'Metric')], [(u'prototype ontology', u'Task'), (u'OWL-Lite level ontology', u'Method'), (u'taxonomic relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'non-taxonomic relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'on-the-fly ontology construction', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web'), (u'DODDLE-R', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'support environment'), (u'support environment', u'USED-FOR', u'user-centered ontology development')], [], [(u'prototype ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'Pre-processing part')], [], [(u'interactive support', u'USED-FOR', u'prototype ontology'), (u'interactive support', u'USED-FOR', u'OWL-Lite level ontology'), (u'OWL-Lite level ontology', u'PART-OF', u'prototype ontology'), (u'taxonomic relationships', u'CONJUNCTION', u'non-taxonomic relationships'), (u'non-taxonomic relationships', u'CONJUNCTION', u'non-taxonomic relationships')]]
sentences: [u'In order to realize the on-the-fly ontology construction for the Semantic Web , this paper proposes DODDLE-R , a support environment for user-centered ontology development .', u'It consists of two main parts : pre-processing part and quality improvement part .', u'Pre-processing part generates a prototype ontology semi-automatically , and quality improvement part supports the refinement of it interactively .', u'As we believe that careful construction of ontologies from preliminary phase is more efficient than attempting generate ontologies full-automatically ( it may cause too many modification by hand ) , quality improvement part plays significant role in DODDLE-R .', u'Through interactive support for improving the quality of prototype ontology , OWL-Lite level ontology , which consists of taxonomic relationships ( class - sub class relationship ) and non-taxonomic relationships ( defined as property ) , is constructed efficiently .']

entities: [[(u'Information Science', u'Task'), (u'Digital Age', u'Material')], [(u'library systems indeterminists', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'digital capabilities', u'Material'), (u'information science', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Digital Age', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Digital Age and postmodernism')], []]
sentences: [u'In this editorial the various trends in Information Science at a time marked by the whole , the Digital Age and postmodernism are analyzed .', u"Among other aspects , the following topics are discussed : The impact of `` liquid modernity '' in the processing of information , development of library systems indeterminists , areas of `` virtual plurality '' in the traditional spaces of the Libraries , the increasing instrumentation of the Open Access , the importance of librarians training in the specialized `` domain areas '' and interoperability of the Semantic Web , the professional profile in digital capabilities , the role of `` cultural heritage '' of libraries , archives and museums , the otherness of users in their new virtual life , the modern architecture of the `` Web of Things '' and their relationships with people , among other topics of vital significance to resolve new perspectives of information science ."]

sentences: [u'With the advent of web based learning and content management tools , e-learning has become a matured learning paradigm , and changed the trend of instructional design from instructor centric learning paradigm to learner centric approach , and evolved from one instructional design for many learners to one design for one learner or many designs for one learner .', u'Currently , there are mature technologies that can lead to the construction of a personalized e-learning environment , namely : Ontology , Semantic web , learning objects , and content management systems .', u'In this paper , a personalized e-learning framework is proposed , where learning objects are classified according to their suitability for the different types and styles of learning , and where these learning objects are offered to individual learners according to their personal preferences , skills and needs .']

entities: [[(u'SPARQL-to-SQL query rewriting', u'Method')], [(u'SPARQL-to-SQL query rewriting', u'Task')], [(u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'relational database', u'Task')], [(u'SPARQL-to-SQL query rewriting', u'Task'), (u'RDF views', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL-to-SQL query rewriting', u'Task'), (u'SPARQL statements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SQL statements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL query model graph', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL query mapping graph', u'Method')], [(u'relational database', u'Material'), (u'generated SQL statements', u'Material')], [(u'RDF data', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'How to efficiently implement the SPARQL-to-SQL query rewriting has became a serious problem in getting access to the Semantic Web dynamically .', u'The paper aims at solution on achieving the SPARQL-to-SQL query rewriting .', u'First , the paper describes the building of the RDF for the relational database .', u'Then , it talks about the construction of the basic framework of SPARQL-to-SQL query rewriting based on RDF views , which covers the key technologies of SPARQL-to-SQL query rewriting in rewriting the SPARQL statements to SQL statements through establishing a series of processes : the SPARQL query model graph , and SPARQL query mapping graph .', u'Thirdly , the paper touches the query result from relational database with generated SQL statements .', u'Finally , the paper finds a satisfactory result for customers with RDF data in returning the query results .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'mediated ontology', u'Method'), (u'information sources', u'Material'), (u'ontology relations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [], [(u'rewriting queries', u'Task'), (u'views', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rewriting conjunctive queries', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'description logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'mediated ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'answering queries')], [], [], [], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'rewriting conjunctive queries'), (u'description logic', u'USED-FOR', u'rewriting conjunctive queries')]]
sentences: [u'In this article , we investigate a first step towards the long-term vision of the Semantic Web by studying the problem of answering queries posed through a mediated ontology to multiple information sources whose content is described as views over the ontology relations .', u'The contributions of this paper are twofold .', u'We first offer a uniform logical setting which allows us to encompass and to relate the existing work on answering and rewriting queries using views .', u'In particular , we make clearer the connection between the problem of rewriting queries using views and the problem of answering queries using extensions of views .', u'Then we focus on an instance of the problem of rewriting conjunctive queries using views through an ontology expressed in a description logic , for which we exhibit a complete algorithm .']

sentences: [u'Taxonomies and , more generally , ontologies , are at the core of the semantic web .', u'In practice , it is rare to find data with meta-data markup in accordance with a full ontology , due to the intensive manual effort involved in the production and maintenance of both the ontology and the data .', u'In many cases , however , data is stored in XML documents or relational tables with implicit taxonomic information such as product type , location , business category , etc .', u'In this work we aim to use methods from formal concept analysis ( FCA ) to extract such embedded taxonomies , as a starting point for creation of a formal ontology or for further processing of the data .', u'Due to noise , data incompleteness , etc , a soft computing approach is necessary for all but the simplest cases .']

sentences: [u'The Web is still changing at a rapid rate .', u'Principles that define the Web 2.0 are now better understood than a few years ago , but continue to evolve .', u'The Semantic Web is coming of age , resulting , for instance , in a significant amount of data now being available as Linked Open Data .', u'Advanced Web services make sophisticated functionality such as entity extraction and location-data available for free .', u"Against this background , we feel that the potential of today 's Web for intelligent technology-supported learning is under-exploited .", u'Especially for AI exciting research opportunities arise from building on top of available data and services .', u'In this paper , we sketch the current state of the art of Web data and services , highlight potential future development and point out opportunities and challenges for Web-based technology-supported learning .']

sentences: [u'3D virtual environment provides a limited amount of information , mainly focusing on visual information .', u'This is the main cause of users losing the sense of direction in the environment .', u'Many researches for developing a navigation tools that address this problem have been carried out .', u'In this study , a navigation tool is designed by applying topic map , one of the technologies for semantic web construction , to a 3D virtual environment .', u'Topic map constructs a semantic link map by defining the connection relation between topics .', u'According to an experiment done to evaluate the proposed navigation tool , the tool was more helpful in finding detailed object than highly represented objects .', u'Also , it could be seen that providing the surrounding knowledge is effective for object selection by users when that target for searching is not defined .']

sentences: [u'Researchers in the semantic web community have been designing tools and architectures to integrate heterogeneous data originated from distributed sources in the last decade .', u'Technologies , such as RDF , have enabled new data spaces and concept descriptors to define an increasing complex and heterogeneous web of data .', u'To these growing data resource spaces it is necessary to bridge between the different knowledge domains and provide a homogeneous and user-friendly interface .', u'This paper discusses the limitations of some of the existing tools and solutions .', u'The authors also propose a new architecture to integrate , using a mediator and centralised global schema , semi structured heterogeneous sources with large scale of structured data sources , particularly Linked Open Data cloud , and provide a search interface for non-expert users to searching and to accessing to them .']

entities: [[(u'enterprise IT', u'Method')], [], [(u'open source information processing framework', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'flexible architecture', u'Method'), (u'BROX', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'An important requirement to the enterprise IT is the ability to manage information with high flexibility .', u'Semantic web research and resulting technologies are therefore getting more and more vital within business processes. # R # # N # # R # # N # One question is how to get the research work - done at universities or within corporations - into the enterprise easily .', u'One possible answer to this question is the availability of an open source information processing framework , which meets the requirements of an enterprise .', u'This framework should be mature and flexible enough to design any application. # R # # N # # R # # N # To move towards such a flexible architecture , which is able to process vast amounts of information in an enterprise , a joint development by BROX [ 1 ] and Empolis [ 2 ] , has been started on Eclipse [ 3 ] .']

entities: [[(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'hypertext environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'linking features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hypertext systems', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'scholarly publishing and research', u'Task')], [(u'scholarly literature', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'hypertext systems', u'USED-FOR', u'Web')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The Web has evolved as a hypertext environment whose value is derived from a simple ability to link resources together .', u'The advanced linking features of some early hypertext systems might be implemented in the Web in various ways .', u'The Semantic Web is one aspect of the continuing evolution of the Web which may be of value to the evolution of scholarly publishing and research , and may enable publishers to justify investment in the future .', u'The key advantages are the ability to unlock value from the existing scholarly literature by enabling innovation in research tools ; further encouraging the creation of a marketplace of services of value to the publishing industry ; and ensuring that websites and content are well integrated into the Web as it exists now and in the future .']

entities: [[(u'Determining trust of data', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'linked open data', u'Material'), (u'SPARQL endpoints', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SPARQL query', u'Material'), (u'abstract models', u'Method'), (u'annotated relational databases', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'provenance information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'major non-monotonic constructs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multiset semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'annotated relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'abstract models', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Determining trust of data', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [], [(u'provenance information', u'USED-FOR', u'SPARQL 1.1')], []]
sentences: [u'Determining trust of data available in the Semantic Web is fundamental for applications and users , in particular for linked open data obtained from SPARQL endpoints .', u'There exist several proposals in the literature to annotate SPARQL query results with values from abstract models , adapting the seminal works on provenance for annotated relational databases .', u'We provide an approach capable of providing provenance information for a large and significant fragment of SPARQL 1.1 , including for the first time the major non-monotonic constructs under multiset semantics .', u'The approach is based on the translation of SPARQL into relational queries over annotated relations with values of the most general m-semiring , and in this way also refuting a claim in the literature that the OPTIONAL construct of SPARQL can not be captured appropriately with the known abstract models .']

entities: [[(u'personal and organizational system', u'Task'), (u'cybersecurity threats', u'Material'), (u'vulnerabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'threats', u'Generic'), (u'overt and covert sources', u'Material'), (u'National Vulnerability Database', u'Material'), (u'CERT alerts', u'Material'), (u'blog posts', u'Material'), (u'social media', u'Material'), (u'dark web resources', u'Material')], [(u'Intelligence updates', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cybersecurity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'temporal events', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'security analyst', u'Method'), (u'computer system', u'Method')], [(u'CyberTwitter', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'Twitter', u'Material'), (u'OSINT ( Open-source intelligence ) source', u'Material')], [(u'real time information updates', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'tweets', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Web RDF', u'Method'), (u'SWRL rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alerts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'security analysts', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'National Vulnerability Database', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'overt and covert sources'), (u'National Vulnerability Database', u'CONJUNCTION', u'CERT alerts'), (u'National Vulnerability Database', u'CONJUNCTION', u'blog posts'), (u'CERT alerts', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'overt and covert sources'), (u'CERT alerts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'blog posts'), (u'CERT alerts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social media'), (u'blog posts', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'overt and covert sources'), (u'blog posts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social media'), (u'social media', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'overt and covert sources'), (u'social media', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dark web resources')], [(u'temporal events', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Intelligence updates')], [], [], [(u'alerts', u'USED-FOR', u'security analysts')]]
sentences: [u'In order to secure vital personal and organizational system we require timely intelligence on cybersecurity threats and vulnerabilities .', u'Intelligence about these threats is generally available in both overt and covert sources like the National Vulnerability Database , CERT alerts , blog posts , social media , and dark web resources .', u'Intelligence updates about cybersecurity can be viewed as temporal events that a security analyst must keep up with so as to secure a computer system .', u'We describe CyberTwitter , a system to discover and analyze cybersecurity intelligence on Twitter and serve as a OSINT ( Open-source intelligence ) source .', u'We analyze real time information updates , in form of tweets , to extract intelligence about various possible threats .', u'We use the Semantic Web RDF to represent the intelligence gathered and SWRL rules to reason over extracted intelligence to issue alerts for security analysts .']

relations: [[(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'Web Search')], [], [], [(u'content words', u'CONJUNCTION', u'query words'), (u'query words', u'USED-FOR', u'web page recommendation')], [(u'Differential Adaptive PMI Algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'Web Pages')], [(u'methodology', u'COMPARE', u'strategies'), (u'accuracy', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'methodology'), (u'accuracy', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'strategies')]]
sentences: [u'With the exponential rise in the amount of information in the World Wide Web , there is a need for a much efficient algorithm for Web Search .', u'The traditional keyword matching as well as the standard statistical techniques is insufficient as the Web Pages they recommend are not highly relevant to the query .', u'With the growth in Semantic Web , an algorithm which semantically computes the most relevant Web Pages is required .', u'In this paper , a methodology which computes the semantic heterogeneity between the keywords , content words and query words for web page recommendation is incorporated .', u'A Differential Adaptive PMI Algorithm is formulated for with varied thresholds for recommending the Web Pages based on the input query .', u'The proposed methodology yields an accuracy of 0.87 which is much better than the existing strategies .']

entities: [[(u'semantic heterogeneity problem', u'Task'), (u'SemanticWeb', u'Material')], [(u'semantic web languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'logic-based representation formalism', u'Method'), (u'mappings', u'Task')], [(u'formalism', u'Generic')], [(u'mapping language', u'Material'), (u'formalism', u'Generic'), (u'independent choice logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'probabilistic information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'query processing', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'logic-based representation formalism', u'USED-FOR', u'mappings')], [], [], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'mappings')], []]
sentences: [u'Creating mappings between ontologies is a common way of approaching the semantic heterogeneity problem on the SemanticWeb .', u'To fit into the landscape of semantic web languages , a suitable , logic-based representation formalism for mappings is needed .', u'We argue that such a formalism has to be able to deal with uncertainty and inconsistencies in automatically created mappings .', u'We analyze the requirements for such a mapping language and present a formalism that combines tightly integrated description logic programs with independent choice logic for representing probabilistic information .', u'We define the language , show that it can be used to resolve inconsistencies and merge mappings from different matchers based on the level of confidence assigned to different rules .', u'We also analyze the computational aspects of consistency checking and query processing in tightly integrated probabilistic description logic programs .']

entities: [[(u'fuzzy data', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'fuzzy datatypes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'database', u'Generic'), (u'fuzzy information extraction', u'Task'), (u'publishing', u'Task')], [(u'database schema', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology reasoner', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'structures', u'Generic')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'database', u'Generic'), (u'storage schema', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'fuzzy data', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'fuzzy information extraction', u'CONJUNCTION', u'publishing')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'This work deals with the need for managing large amounts of fuzzy data in the context of the Semantic Web .', u'A schema to store ontologies with fuzzy datatypes into a database is presented as part of a framework designed to perform tasks of fuzzy information extraction and publishing .', u'The database schema allows the storage of an ontology along with its instances preserving all information .', u'Ontology and instances are stored in different schemas in order to improve the access to instances while retaining the capacity of reasoning over the ontology .', u'This sets the foundations of a research opportunity on the definition of a ontology reasoner over these structures .', u'The paper also presents a brief description of the framework on which the database is included , and the structures conforming the storage schema proposed .']

entities: [[(u'bolero.net community', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'world trade messaging', u'Task'), (u'international trade', u'Task')], [(u'Bolero.net', u'Method'), (u'protocol', u'Generic'), (u'boleroXML', u'Method'), (u'electronic documents', u'Material'), (u'electronic international trade chain', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'electronic documents', u'Material'), (u'OWL ontology', u'Method')], [(u'boleroXML documents', u'Material'), (u'web-based community', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'web services', u'Task'), (u'web agents', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'protocol', u'USED-FOR', u'Bolero.net')], [(u'OWL ontology', u'FEATURE-OF', u'boleroXML standard electronic documents')], [], [(u'web services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web agents')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we have focused on using the bolero.net community in the semantic web and grid environment .', u'Bolero.net represents a community with the ambitious initiatives to standardise world trade messaging and to create a community for more efficient international trade .', u'Bolero.net uses a protocol called boleroXML that represents a set of standard electronic documents with the aim of facilitating interoperability amongst the members of the electronic international trade chain .', u'The idea of making the boleroXML standard electronic documents in the form of an OWL ontology is shown in this paper .', u'The main goal of using an ontology of the boleroXML documents is to moderate this kind of web-based community .', u'The way this ontology is connected with web services , as well as web agents , is shown through the use of ebXML Registry and Repository .']

entities: [[(u'information system', u'Method')], [(u'scientific information systems', u'Method')], [(u'ontology-based framework', u'Method'), (u'subjectivity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'research', u'Generic'), (u'data provenance', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'data history', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'constructs', u'Generic')], [(u'W7 model', u'Method'), (u'Toulmin model', u'Method'), (u'Proof Markup Language ( PML )', u'Method'), (u'Interlingua', u'Method'), (u'machine-readable and sharable form', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'space sciences', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'data provenance', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'research'), (u'data provenance', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontological foundations'), (u'Semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'research')], [], [], [(u'Interlingua', u'USED-FOR', u'viewpoints of data')], []]
sentences: [u'The explicit representation of context and subjectivity enables an information system to support multiple interpretations of the data it records .', u'This is a crucial aspect of learning and innovation within scientific information systems .', u'We present an ontology-based framework for context and subjectivity that integrates two lines of research : data provenance and ontological foundations of the Semantic Web .', u'Data provenance provides a set of constructs for representing data history .', u'We extend the definition of these constructs in order to describe multiple viewpoints or interpretations held within a domain .', u'The W7 model , the Toulmin model , and the Proof Markup Language ( PML ) provide the Interlingua for creating multiple viewpoints of data in a machine-readable and sharable form .', u'Example use cases in space sciences are used to demonstrate the feasibility and value of our approach .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'information usage', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic documents', u'Material'), (u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic document', u'Material')], [(u'uniform representation', u'Method'), (u'relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic documents', u'Material'), (u'WordNet', u'Material')], [(u'disambiguation', u'Task')], [(u'concept graph', u'Method'), (u'Levenshtein Distance', u'Method'), (u'classification of documents', u'Task')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'accuracy', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'WordNet', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic documents')], [], [(u'Levenshtein Distance', u'USED-FOR', u'classification of documents')], [(u'accuracy', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'methodology')]]
sentences: [u'There are a lot benefits to enable intelligent agent understanding the information from semantic web .', u'It enhances the efficiency of information usage and at the same time , suffices the need of users .', u'Semantic documents contain adequate semantic information which helps understanding .', u'However , discrepancy between ontology which is an interpreter of semantic document prevents the share of knowledge .', u'In this paper , we proposed a uniform representation for the content , which include concepts and relations , of semantic documents based on WordNet .', u'First , disambiguation is preceded within the key words in a document for the purpose of mapping them to concepts .', u'Then we present the whole document in the form of concept graph that Levenshtein Distance could be applied for making a classification of documents .', u'We have empirical result that this methodology makes a promising raise in accuracy .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'market processes', u'Task')], [(u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'job seekers', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'multilingual classification of European Skills', u'Task'), (u'Competences', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Qualifications', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Occupations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ESCO data model', u'Method'), (u'Simple Knowledge Organization System', u'Method')], [(u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'ESCO', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'market processes'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'market processes')], [], [], [(u'Competences', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Qualifications'), (u'Competences', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Occupations'), (u'Qualifications', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Occupations'), (u'Qualifications', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ESCO )')], [(u'Simple Knowledge Organization System', u'USED-FOR', u'ESCO data model')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web has a huge potential when it is used to organize market processes .', u'The labour market is an excellent example where it can add value .', u'By enhancing communication between employers and job seekers in the digital age , market processes become more efficient and more people can find the right jobs for them .', u'The multilingual classification of European Skills , Competences , Qualifications and Occupations ( ESCO ) is a central building block for an ecosystem of semantic assets on the labour market .', u'In this paper we explain how the ESCO data model was designed , building on the Simple Knowledge Organization System .', u'We further explain how new versions of the datasets are published and how they can be used by applications .', u'Finally , we summarize the next steps in the on-going work on ESCO .']

entities: [[(u'Molecular information systems', u'Method'), (u'data-driven drug discovery', u'Task')], [(u'decision making', u'Task')], [], [(u'compoundtargetpathwaydisease/phenotype data', u'Material'), (u'public and industrial drug discovery research', u'Task')], [], [(u'semantic web-based technology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Molecular information systems', u'USED-FOR', u'data-driven drug discovery')], [(u'association', u'CONJUNCTION', u'inference')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Molecular information systems play an important part in modern data-driven drug discovery .', u'They do not only support decision making but also enable new discoveries via association and inference .', u'In this review , we outline the scientific requirements identified by the Innovative Medicines Initiative ( IMI ) Open PHACTS consortium for the design of an open pharmacological space ( OPS ) information system .', u'The focus of this work is the integration of compoundtargetpathwaydisease/phenotype data for public and industrial drug discovery research .', u'Typical scientific competency questions provided by the consortium members will be analyzed based on the underlying data concepts and associations needed to answer the questions .', u'Publicly available data sources used to target these questions as well as the need for and potential of semantic web-based technology will be presented .']

entities: [[(u'structured data', u'Material'), (u'Web of Data', u'Material')], [(u'real-life concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web resources', u'Material'), (u'semantic representation of the user profile', u'Method'), (u'contextual information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'Web-based and question-based boardgame prototype', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'real-life concepts', u'USED-FOR', u'Serious Games')], [], [(u'Web-based and question-based boardgame prototype', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Educloud project')]]
sentences: [u'Given the increasing amount of structured data published on the Web , many possibilities are open for creating new types of games that use resources from the Web of Data .', u'In particular , if we consider the subcategory of Serious Games in which the object of the game is to educate the user through the interactive discovery of real-life concepts ( associated to Semantic Web resources ) , the inclusion of a semantic representation of the user profile and his contextual information becomes an important element to recommend the user more accurate concepts .', u'This paper proposes and describes an ontology that allows the creation of Serious Games with those characteristics .', u'The potential of the ontology is shown through two use cases : a serious , Web-based and question-based boardgame prototype and the Semantic Educloud project .']

sentences: [u'The problem of defining efficient techniques for knowledge representation ( KR ) is becoming more and more a challenging topic in both academic and industrial community .', u'The Semantic Web needs of formal knowledge representations for implementing useful services and put in common the different views between man and machines .', u'In this framework , we assume that new approaches for knowledge definition and representation may be useful , in particular the ones based on the concept of ontology .', u'In this paper we propose novel techniques and tools for ontology definition and management .', u'In particular , we propose a suitable model for representing knowledge and a system based on peer-to-peer ( P2P ) paradigm to share general and domain knowledge .', u'The network knowledge is exposed using a Web Service and it can be used by intelligent Web agents .']

sentences: [u'Mappings usually relate two similar knowledge representations .', u'Thus , we can find many examples of mappings amid thesauri , databases , ontologies ( domain ontologies , top-level and domain ontologies , PSM ( Problem Solving Method ) and domain ontologies , linguistic and domain ontologies ) ; additionally , we can frequently find systems with mappings that relate two different knowledge representations , for instance , databases and ontologies .', u'All these mappings are operationally different , and are also named differently ( mappings , correspondences , semantic bridges , transformations , semantic relations , functions , conversions , domain-PSM relations ) , but is there a single definition for these concepts ?', u'Can we find common characteristics ?', u'This paper analyzes the existing definitions and representation of the term ldquomappingrdquo ( and related terms ) in the ontology world and its semantic neighborhood and proposes a new definition and representation of ldquomappingrdquo for the Semantic Web field .']

relations: [[], [(u'P2P infrastructure', u'USED-FOR', u'Web Services discovery')], [(u'Peers', u'USED-FOR', u'Web Services information'), (u'data item descriptions', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Web Services information'), (u'data indexing structure', u'USED-FOR', u'Web Services information'), (u'data indexing structure', u'USED-FOR', u'Peer-to-Peer data networks'), (u'EST-GRID', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Web Services information'), (u'EST-GRID', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Peer-to-Peer data networks')], [(u'EST-GRID', u'USED-FOR', u'processing Exact match Queries'), (u'EST-GRID', u'USED-FOR', u'Exact match Queries')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Web services are becoming an important enabler of the Semantic Web .', u'In this paper , we present a new P2P infrastructure for Web Services discovery .', u'Peers that store Web Services information , such as data item descriptions , are efficiently located using a scalable and robust data indexing structure for Peer-to-Peer data networks , EST-GRID ( Exponential Search Tree ) .', u"EST-GRID provides support for processing Exact match Queries of the form `` given a key , map the key onto a node '' .", u'EST-GRID adapts efficiently update queries as nodes join and leave the system , and can answer queries even if the system is continuously changing .', u'Results from theoretical analysis show that the communication cost of the query and update operations scaling both in O ( log n ) time where n the number of nodes .']

entities: [[(u'DLclog', u'Method'), (u'hybrid formalism', u'Method'), (u'Logic Programming', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web serving', u'Task'), (u'DL + log', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'DLclog', u'Method'), (u'DL ontology', u'Method')], [(u'negative dl-atoms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Nonmonotonic Semantics', u'Method'), (u'dl-atoms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'circumscriptive models of DL ontology', u'Method'), (u'parallel circumscription', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'negative dl-atoms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formalism', u'Generic'), (u'NM-Semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'LP', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'decision procedure', u'Method'), (u'extended semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ALCIO', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ALCQO', u'Method'), (u'negative dl-atoms', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'DLclog', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'hybrid formalism'), (u'Logic Programming', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'hybrid formalism')], [], [], [(u'NM-Semantics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DL'), (u'DL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'LP')], [(u'decision procedure', u'USED-FOR', u'extended semantics'), (u'ALCIO', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ALCQO')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we propose DLclog , a new hybrid formalism combining Description Logics ( DL ) and Logic Programming ( LP ) for Semantic Web serving as an extension to DL + log [ 17 ] .', u'By DLclog , users can reason nonmonotonically with DL ontology .', u'We introduce negative dl-atoms to the bodies of the rules , and extend Nonmonotonic Semantics ( NM-Semantics ) of DL + log to evaluate dl-atoms with circumscriptive models of DL ontology in the sense of parallel circumscription .', u'In this way , negative dl-atoms are treated nonmonotonically , while the formalism still remains faithful to NM-Semantics , DL and LP .', u'We also present a decision procedure for the extended semantics based on a restricted form of DLclog , in which DL ontologies are written with ALCIO or ALCQO and roles are not allowed to occur in negative dl-atoms .']

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'user interaction', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web page', u'Material'), (u'JavaScript-events', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web standard Microformats', u'Method'), (u'fine-grained and meaningful user information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'user tracking solutions', u'Method'), (u'user interactions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'interaction data', u'Material'), (u'semantic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user intention', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'easy-to-integrate user tracker', u'Method'), (u'tracking information of configurable depth', u'Task'), (u'user model', u'Method'), (u'personalized services', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'recommendation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'search', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'user interaction'), (u'web page', u'USED-FOR', u'user interaction'), (u'JavaScript-events', u'USED-FOR', u'approach'), (u'JavaScript-events', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web standard Microformats'), (u'Semantic Web standard Microformats', u'USED-FOR', u'web page')], [], [(u'semantic knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'user intention')], [(u'easy-to-integrate user tracker', u'USED-FOR', u'personalized services'), (u'recommendation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'search'), (u'search', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'personalized services')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we present a novel approach to track user interaction on a web page based on JavaScript-events combined with the Semantic Web standard Microformats to obtain more fine-grained and meaningful user information .', u"Today 's user tracking solutions are mostly page-based and lose valuable information about user interactions .", u"To get an in-depth understanding of user 's interests and intentions from observing him while interacting on a website , interaction data needs to be tracked on an event rather than on a page basis enhanced with semantic knowledge to understand the user intention .", u'Our goal is to create an easy-to-integrate user tracker that is capable of collecting tracking information of configurable depth and feeding a highly sophisticated user model needed to provide personalized services such as recommendation and search .']

sentences: [u'We describe a generic framework for representing and reasoning with annotated Semantic Web data , a task becoming more important with the recent increased amount of inconsistent and non-reliable meta-data on the Web .', u'We formalise the annotated language , the corresponding deductive system and address the query answering problem .', u'Previous contributions on specific RDF annotation domains are encompassed by our unified reasoning formalism as we show by instantiating it on ( i ) temporal , ( ii ) fuzzy , and ( iii ) provenance annotations .', u'Moreover , we provide a generic method for combining multiple annotation domains allowing to represent , e.g. , temporally-annotated fuzzy RDF .', u'Furthermore , we address the development of a query language - AnQL - that is inspired by SPARQL , including several features of SPARQL 1.1 ( subqueries , aggregates , assignment , solution modifiers ) along with the formal definitions of their semantics .']

entities: [[(u'Ubiquitous Computing', u'Task'), (u'web service environment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'ubiquitous commerce', u'Material'), (u'semantic web and rule based services', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ubiquitous Computing Services System', u'Method'), (u'rule based search', u'Method'), (u'semantics based search', u'Method'), (u'electronic space', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'physical space', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web services', u'Task'), (u'web services', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'rule based search', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantics based search'), (u'electronic space', u'CONJUNCTION', u'physical space')]]
sentences: [u'Ubiquitous Computing makes it possible to determine in real time the location and situations of service requesters in a web service environment as it enables access to computers at any time and in any place .', u"Though research on various aspects of ubiquitous commerce is progressing at enterprises and research centers , both domestically and overseas , analysis of a customer 's personal preferences based on semantic web and rule based services using semantics is not currently being conducted .", u'This paper proposes a Ubiquitous Computing Services System that enables a rule based search as well as semantics based search to support the fact that the electronic space and the physical space can be combined into one and the real time search for web services and the construction of efficient web services thus become possible .']

entities: [[(u'co-operative information systems', u'Method')], [(u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'loose federation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'directed non-injective mappings', u'Method'), (u'IS', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'logical formalism of Description Logics', u'Method'), (u'IS integration', u'Task'), (u'semantic-web ontolgies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mappings', u'Task')], [(u'Distributed Description Logics', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'A central problem of co-operative information systems is the ability to integrate information from multiple sources .', u'Although this problem has been studied for several decades , there is a need for a more refined approach in those cases where the original sources form a loose federation , each maintaining its own independent view of the world .', u'In particular , we motivate with examples the utility of directed non-injective mappings between the individuals in the domains of multiple IS .', u'We then extend the logical formalism of Description Logics , which has previously served successfully in IS integration and is currently being used in semantic-web ontolgies , to handle such mappings .', u'The result is called Distributed Description Logics , and we consider some of its desirable properties , as well as some theorems concerning its computational aspects .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge intensive tasks', u'Task'), (u'quick decision-making', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'query enrichment', u'Method')], [(u'retrieval system', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'vector-space retrieval systems', u'Method')], [(u'ontology concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain terminology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'feature vector', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'feature vector', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'retrieval system', u'Method'), (u'Norwegian oil and gas industry', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'Retrieval of correct and precise information at the right time is essential in knowledge intensive tasks requiring quick decision-making .', u'In this paper , we propose a method for utilizing ontologies to enhance the quality of information retrieval ( IR ) by query enrichment .', u"We explain how a retrieval system can be tuned by adapting ontologies to provide both an in-depth understanding of the user 's needs as well as an easy integration with standard vector-space retrieval systems .", u'The ontology concepts are adapted to the domain terminology by computing a feature vector for each concept .', u'The feature vector is used to enrich a provided query .', u'The ontology and the whole retrieval system are under development as part of a Semantic Web standardization project for the Norwegian oil and gas industry .']
