sentences: [u'This paper provides an initial implementation of the novel module to transform OWL-S ontology into executable robot control code .', u'We explore the idea of formalizing robot behavior descriptions using Semantic Web knowledge representation .', u'The paper describes the methodology and implementation details of the robot control code generator to translate ontology file descriptions to a compilable Java code , as well as the robot control framework to execute the code at run-time. # R # # N # # R # # N # We validate our approach with the experiment , conducted on Sctios G5 robot .', u"The task `` follow the red object '' is translated into a working Java code from OWL-S ontology file .", u'The generated Java code is compiled and executed at run-time .', u'As a result , the robot is following the person with a red folder in his hands .']

sentences: [u'Nonmonotonic extensions of description logics ( DLs ) allow for default and local closed-world reasoning and are an acknowledged desired feature for applications , e.g .', u'in the Semantic Web .', u"A recent approach to such an extension is based on McCarthy 's circumscription , which rests on the principle of minimising the extension of selected predicates to close off dedicated parts of a domain model .", u'While decidability and complexity results have been established in the literature , no practical algorithmisation for circumscriptive DLs has been proposed so far .', u'In this paper , we present a tableaux calculus that can be used as a decision procedure for concept satisfiability with respect to concept-circumscribed $ { \\mathcal ALCO } $ knowledge bases .', u'The calculus builds on existing tableaux for classical DLs , extended by the notion of a preference clash to detect the non-minimality of constructed models .']

sentences: [u'Background # R # # N # The biosciences increasingly face the challenge of integrating a wide variety of available data , information and knowledge in order to gain an understanding of biological systems .', u'Data integration is supported by a diverse series of tools , but the lack of a consistent terminology to label these data still presents significant hurdles .', u'As a consequence , much of the available biological data remains disconnected or worse : becomes misconnected .', u'The need to address this terminology problem has spawned the building of a large number of bio-ontologies .', u'OBOF , RDF and OWL are among the most used ontology formats to capture terms and relationships in the Life Sciences , opening the potential to use the Semantic Web to support data integration and further exploitation of integrated resources via automated retrieval and reasoning procedures .']

sentences: [u'The paper describes a concept of an open cooperative web platform for developing , designing and executing compositional applications , here interpreted as instances dynamically composed of three kinds of semantically interrelated resources .', u'The resources include interoperable components , textual schemas describing their functionality and structuring rules as well as textual definitions of application structure and content .', u'The described open software environment is built on top of emerging XML based standards and technologies of web and grid services .', u'Its functionality comprises managing application resources and transforming them into contextual GUI which supports activities of developing , composing and executing applications .', u'Users and developers contribute to evolutional growth of application resources by creating new definitions , specifying new schemas and implementing components .', u'Semantic Web concepts with RDF/RDF Schema language are applied to organize resource pools accessible in the environment framework .']

sentences: [u'Spatial and temporal data are critical components in many applications .', u'This is especially true in analytical domains such as national security and criminal investigation .', u'The outcome of the analytical process in these applications often hinges on uncovering and analyzing complex relationships between disparate people , places and events .', u'Fundamentally new query operators based on the graph structure of Semantic Web data models , such as semantic associations , are proving useful in these applications .', u'However , these analysis mechanisms are primarily intended for thematic relationships .', u'We describe a framework built around the RDF metadata model for analysis of thematic , spatial and temporal relationships between named entities and describe an efficient implementation in Oracle DBMS .', u'Additionally , we demonstrate the scalability of our approach with a performance study using a synthetic dataset from the national security domain .']

sentences: [u'While the grid and Web services have helped us support heterogeneous resource access through the use of service oriented architectures , they have not addressed the issue of heterogeneous data representation .', u'Since service providers often describe their service interfaces using different data models than those assumed by the client , it is common for additional processing to be required to compensate for the mismatch in data formats .', u'By utilising technology from the semantic Web , we are able to augment existing Web service systems with middleware to automatically perform data harmonisation when a syntactic mismatch occurs .', u'To achieve this , we have developed a mapping language which can be used to annotate XML data structures with OWL concepts and properties , a mapping language engine to implement this language , and a dynamic web service invocation component to execute Web services .']

sentences: [u'In the Semantic Web , ontology plays a prominent role to actualize knowledge sharing and reuse among distributed knowledge sources .', u'Intelligently managing ontological knowledge ( classes , properties and instances ) enables efficacious ontological interoperability .', u'In this paper , we present a hybrid unsupervised clustering model , which comprises of Formal Concept Analysis , Self-Organizing Map and K-Means for managing ontological knowledge , and lexical matching based on Levenshtein edit distance for retrieving knowledge .', u'The ontological knowledge management framework supports the tasks of adding a new ontological concept , updating and editing an existing ontological concept and querying ontological concepts to facilitate knowledge retrieval through conceptual clustering , cluster-based identification and concept-based query .', u'The framework can be used to facilitate ontology reuse and ontological concept visualization and navigation in concept lattice form through the formal context space .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web community', u'Task'), (u'semantically annotated data', u'Material')], [(u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'Web scale', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reasoning algorithms', u'Method'), (u'restricted subsets', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'requirements', u'Generic'), (u'high-performance computing architectures', u'Method'), (u'large-scale semantic reasoning', u'Task'), (u'large-scale reasoning', u'Task'), (u'structured data', u'Material'), (u'heterogeneous data sets', u'Material')], [(u'scalability', u'Metric'), (u'high-performance computing', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'structured data', u'USED-FOR', u'large-scale reasoning'), (u'heterogeneous data sets', u'FEATURE-OF', u'structured data')], []]
sentences: [u'Recent advances in the Semantic Web community have enabled processing and exploitation of semantically annotated data by a variety of modern reasoning methods .', u'However , there is still a deep mismatch between the requirements for reasoning on a Web scale and the existing efficient reasoning algorithms over restricted subsets .', u'Fulfilment of those requirements can be greatly achieved by applying special techniques , which enable high-performance computing architectures to be included as a part of a sustainable infrastructure for large-scale semantic reasoning , as set up within the LarKC project that aims at providing large-scale reasoning over billions of structured data in heterogeneous data sets .', u"In this paper , the mainstream strategies for overcoming the limitations of today 's reasoning systems ' scalability and performance by means of applying high-performance computing are discussed ."]

entities: [[(u'transparency', u'Metric'), (u'digital privacy', u'Task')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'digital transaction', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'privacy policies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'law', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rule', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'contract', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'digital environment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'digital transaction', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'context information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic web representation', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'accountability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'transparency')], [(u'law', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'privacy policies'), (u'law', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rule'), (u'rule', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'privacy policies'), (u'rule', u'CONJUNCTION', u'contract'), (u'contract', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'privacy policies')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'There is a growing awareness and interest in the issues of accountability and transparency in the pursuit of digital privacy .', u'In previous work , we asserted that systems needed to be policy aware and able to compute the likely compliance of any digital transaction with the associated privacy policies ( law , rule , or contract ) .', u'This paper focuses on one critical step in respecting privacy in a digital environment , that of understanding the context associated with each digital transaction .', u'For any individual transaction , the pivotal fact may be context information about the data , the party seeking to use it , the specific action to be taken , or the associated rules .', u'We believe that the granularity of semantic web representation is well suited to this challenge and we support this position in the paper .']

relations: [[(u'Trust management systems', u'USED-FOR', u'joyless security'), (u'Trust management systems', u'USED-FOR', u'open and distributed environments'), (u'Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'open and distributed environments'), (u'Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web'), (u'Semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'open and distributed environments'), (u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Peer-to-peer networks'), (u'Peer-to-peer networks', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'open and distributed environments')], [], [], [], [(u'dynamic graphs', u'USED-FOR', u'Heritage Trust Model'), (u'dynamic graphs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontologies')]]
sentences: [u'Trust management systems has been proposed to address joyless security in open and distributed environments ( Web , Semantic Web , Peer-to-peer networks , etc . ) .', u'A user usually spent a lot of time by building her reputation and by creating a network of trusted/distrusted users .', u'Without possibility of seamless transfer from one trust management system to another , a user is forced to build a new reputation/network of trusted users again .', u'This problem will become even more severe , as many current systems using trust as a key factor influencing ability to communicate within a group of users will be outdated and some of them even down .', u'The paper presents a specification of the seamless transfer problem and it also introduces a solution - the Heritage Trust Model based on dynamic graphs and ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'WWW', u'Method'), (u'links', u'Material'), (u'HTML tags', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'modus operandi', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'Semantic Web approach', u'Method')], [(u'adaptation methods', u'Method'), (u'semantic adaptation', u'Method'), (u'Adaptive Web-Based Systems', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'semantic adaptation', u'USED-FOR', u'adaptation methods'), (u'semantic adaptation', u'USED-FOR', u'Adaptive Web-Based Systems')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The principles of the WWW used today rely solely on links and on content presented through simple HTML tags .', u'The drawback of the above mentioned modus operandi is that it is purely syntactic with no clear emphasis on meaning about data .', u'The Semantic Web approach tries to bridge that gap by providing additional information , mainly conceptual to the data at hand .', u'In this paper we are focusing on extension of the adaptation methods with semantic adaptation dedicated to Adaptive Web-Based Systems .', u'The approach is consisted of five steps based on querying RDF resources through SPARQL every time the user is visiting a particular resource .', u'It is worth mentioning that the retrieved resources represent similar resources relevant to the currently visited resource which guides the user towards the desired information while browsing .']

sentences: [u'This paper describes the initial stages in the development of a framework for browsing the current Web as a remapped semantic model in 3d space , building up an interactive universe of objects using a mixture of graphics , animation , stereo sound and , possibly , artificial intelligence components as multiple pages are fetched from a conventional visual web-site .', u'The initial purpose of the research is to explore the formalities of this remapping of real web sites and the definition of the graphical objects with appearances , behaviours and reactions to internal and external events .', u'The longer term objective is to be a platform for Semantic Web experiments , graphic design and human factor research and as an easily-installed semantic extension of normal page-by-page browsing for both mobile and immersive platforms .']

entities: [[(u'Infofox', u'Method')], [(u'Ecademy Web site', u'Material'), (u'information portal', u'Method')], [(u'intelligent search engine', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'joint classification scheme', u'Method'), (u'inference rules', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[(u'e-business', u'CONJUNCTION', u'e-government')], [], [], [(u'joint classification scheme', u'CONJUNCTION', u'inference rules')], []]
sentences: [u'Infofox is a project launched by the Ecademy , the National Network of Excellence of the Swiss Universities of Applied Sciences for e-business and e-government .', u'The paper discusses an envisioned improvement of the service level of the Ecademy Web site , an information portal which is set to integrate valuable information from the different member schools .', u'The goal of the Infofox project is the development of an intelligent search engine .', u'In order to fully exploit the potential of the information provided by the Ecademy members , the Infofox project team will need to implement aspects of a Semantic Web namely an ontology built upon a joint classification scheme and a set of inference rules .', u'The RIP paper presents the basic concept and the results of the first phase of the project .']

entities: [[(u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'query language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'read-only language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SQL', u'Method'), (u'Queries', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Web architecture', u'Task'), (u'Web architecture', u'Method')], [(u'update extension', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'Representational State Transfer ( REST )', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method')], [(u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'read-only language')], [], [(u'update extension', u'USED-FOR', u'SPARQL')], []]
sentences: [u'SPARQL is the standard query language for RDF , but currently is a read-only language defined in a way similar to SQL : Queries can be formulated , are submitted to a single processing facility , which then returns a result set .', u'In this paper , we examine the shortcomings of this approach with regard to Web architecture , and propose a path towards a language that is more in line with basic principles of Web architecture .', u'While this work has been done in the context of a proposed update extension for SPARQL , our focus is on how to apply the principles of Representational State Transfer ( REST ) to SPARQL .', u'Our claim is that a RESTful redesign of SPARQL allows the Semantic Web to evolve in a more decentralized and openly accessible way than the current RPC-style design of SPARQL .']

entities: [[(u'reusable rate of classification system of fishes', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'classification web services of fishes', u'Method'), (u'natural language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'Method'), (u'service composition graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heuristic service composition algorithm', u'Method'), (u'graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'java language', u'Material'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'web services composition', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'algorithm', u'CONJUNCTION', u'heuristic service composition algorithm')]]
sentences: [u'In order to enhance the reusable rate of classification system of fishes , it needs to combine the existing classification web services of fishes to satisfy the requests of users.It transformed the fish information described by natural language into the machine-understandable form of fish knowledge with the supports of semantic web and ontology technologies.The reasoning ability of ontology was applied to generate a service composition graph , and then a heuristic service composition algorithm based on the graph was presented , which was realized by use of the java language and Jena API.The program running results showed that this algorithm not only considered the services semantic aspect , but also adjusted web services composition plan dynamically according to the experiences of web services composition to enhance the adaptability of the services composition .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'Okkam4N', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'plug-ins'), (u'Okkam4N', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Okkam4P'), (u'Okkam4N', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'identifiers'), (u'Okkam4P', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'plug-ins'), (u'NeOn Toolkit and Protege software', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'plug-ins'), (u'identifiers', u'USED-FOR', u'OWL/RDF knowledge bases')], [], [(u'NeOn Toolkit 1.2', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Protege 3.4')]]
sentences: [u'In the current state of Semantic Web knowledge representation , it is fairly common that individuals in ontologies have different identifiers even if they are meant to denote the same object in the real world .', u'This makes data integration at the level of individuals quite difficult .', u'In this demonstration , we show two plug-ins called Okkam4N and Okkam4P developed for the NeOn Toolkit and Protege software respectively , which support the reuse of globally unique identifiers for individuals in OWL/RDF knowledge bases .', u'The key idea is that users are given a chance to look for an existing URI in the publicly available Entity Name System for the corresponding individual in the local OWL/RDF knowledge bases .', u'They are available and tested for the latest official release versions , the NeOn Toolkit 1.2 and Protege 3.4 .']

entities: [[(u'RDB2RDF approaches', u'Method'), (u'W3C', u'Method'), (u'relational data', u'Material'), (u'semantic web', u'Material'), (u'relational data', u'Material'), (u'RDF formatted data', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'relational data', u'Material'), (u'RDF data', u'Material'), (u'OWL ontology', u'Method'), (u'schema of database', u'Method')], [(u'schema information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rich semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Hadoop framework', u'Method'), (u'transformation process', u'Method'), (u'distributed system', u'Method'), (u'scalability', u'Metric')], [(u'mapping rules', u'Method'), (u'augmented direct mapping', u'Method'), (u'local ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rich semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'relational data', u'Material'), (u'RDF data', u'Material'), (u'OWL ontology', u'Method'), (u'large-sized databases', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'RDB2RDF approaches have been proposed and standardised by W3C , which publishes relational data to semantic web by converting relational data into RDF formatted data .', u'We propose a system that automatically transforms relational data into RDF data and creates OWL ontology based on the schema of database .', u'Some approaches have been proposed , but most of them did not fully make use of schema information to extract rich semantics , nor did they experiment on large databases for performance .', u'We utilise Hadoop framework in transformation process , which enables distributed system for scalability .', u'We present mapping rules that implement augmented direct mapping to create local ontology with rich semantics .', u'The results show that our system successfully transforms relational data into RDF data with OWL ontology , with satisfactory performance on large-sized databases .']

entities: [[(u'Web blog', u'Material'), (u'data volume', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'complexity', u'Metric')], [(u'Spatial-temporal information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'inside multimedia postings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'search engines', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic web community', u'Method'), (u'topic maps paradigm', u'Method'), (u'optimization of information creation', u'Task'), (u'navigation', u'Task')], [(u'layer', u'Generic'), (u'blog feed standards', u'Method')], [(u'RSS', u'Method'), (u'Atom', u'Method'), (u'topic map data model', u'Method'), (u'semantic-augmented and interoperable information exchange', u'Task')], [(u'topic maps layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic gap', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'With the breakthrough of Web blog , this easy way to publish information increases exponentially the data volume and its related complexity .', u'Spatial-temporal information ( about where and when ) contained inside multimedia postings need to be better understood by search engines or by end-users as it lacks semantics .', u'The semantic web community has promoted topic maps paradigm as a technology to increase the semantic regarding the optimization of information creation , navigation , their merge and dissemination .', u'This paper introduces a new layer that combines blog feed standards ( e.g .', u'RSS , Atom ) with the topic map data model for semantic-augmented and interoperable information exchange .', u'In addition , the paper carries out a case study on Isfahan ( Iran city ) using the topic maps layer to bridge the semantic gap in this context .']

entities: [[(u'browser', u'Generic'), (u'omni-functional power', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'intelligent immersive omni-functional platform', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'standards-compliant documents', u'Material'), (u'omni-functionalities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'calculations', u'Generic'), (u'graphics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'picture manipulation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'composition', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'presentation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic web structures', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'strategies', u'Generic')], [(u'webpage', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'full-fledged calculation platform', u'Method'), (u'spreadsheet tools', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'infinite extensibility', u'CONJUNCTION', u'omni-functional power')], [], [(u'omni-functionalities', u'FEATURE-OF', u'standards-compliant documents'), (u'graphics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'picture manipulation'), (u'graphics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'composition'), (u'picture manipulation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'composition'), (u'composition', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'calculations'), (u'composition', u'CONJUNCTION', u'presentation')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The extensive dynamic capabilities of the browser allow for platforms of infinite extensibility and omni-functional power to be delivered via the internet .', u'This paper considers the possibilities of converting web pages into an intelligent immersive omni-functional platform with special focus on calculations .', u'Such standards-compliant documents with omni-functionalities ( enhanced by calculations , but including advanced graphics , picture manipulation , composition , presentation , etc . )', u'can be intermingled with semantic web structures to create powerful models for the next generation of the Internet .', u'The paper builds on the features that are extended by such representations , and imply potential solutions that can be developed from such strategies .', u'The paper documents the possibility of converting every webpage into a full-fledged calculation platform ( named Websheets ) that demonstrate more power than the most advanced spreadsheet tools available today .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic wikis', u'Method'), (u'Web 2.0 advantages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web approach', u'Method')], [(u'collaborative tools', u'Method'), (u'wikis', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'collaborative editing mode', u'Task'), (u'offline work', u'Task'), (u'multi-synchronous editing', u'Task')], [(u'semantic wikis', u'Method')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'semantic wiki structure', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic wiki', u'Method'), (u'Multi-Synchronous Semantic Wiki', u'Method')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'semantic wikis', u'Method'), (u'multi-synchronous support', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic wiki pages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic servers', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'MS2W', u'Method'), (u'CCI consistency', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Logoot algorithm', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic wikis', u'USED-FOR', u'Web 2.0 advantages')], [(u'offline work', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'collaborative editing mode'), (u'offline work', u'CONJUNCTION', u'multi-synchronous editing'), (u'multi-synchronous editing', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'collaborative editing mode')], [], [], [(u'Multi-Synchronous Semantic Wiki', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic wiki')], [(u'semantic wikis', u'USED-FOR', u'model')], [], [(u'Logoot algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'CCI consistency')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic wikis have opened an interesting way to mix Web 2.0 advantages with the Semantic Web approach .', u'However , compared to other collaborative tools , wikis do not support all collaborative editing mode such as offline work or multi-synchronous editing .', u'The lack of multi-synchronous supports in wikis is a problematic , especially , when working with semantic wikis .', u'In these systems , it is often important to change multiple pages simultaneous in order to refactor the semantic wiki structure .', u'In this paper , we present a new model of semantic wiki called Multi-Synchronous Semantic Wiki ( MS2W ) .', u'This model extends semantic wikis with multi-synchronous support that allows to create a P2P network of semantic wikis .', u'Semantic wiki pages can be replicated on several semantic servers .', u'The MS2W ensures CCI consistency on these pages relying on the Logoot algorithm .']

relations: [[], [(u'Markov logic', u'USED-FOR', u'first-order logic'), (u'probabilistic modeling', u'USED-FOR', u'first-order logic'), (u'them', u'USED-FOR', u'features of Markov networks')], [], [(u'Inference algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'Markov logic'), (u'Markov chain Monte Carlo', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge-based model construction')], [(u'conjugate gradient algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'Learning algorithms'), (u'conjugate gradient algorithm', u'CONJUNCTION', u'pseudo-likelihood'), (u'conjugate gradient algorithm', u'CONJUNCTION', u'inductive logic programming'), (u'pseudo-likelihood', u'USED-FOR', u'Learning algorithms'), (u'pseudo-likelihood', u'CONJUNCTION', u'inductive logic programming'), (u'inductive logic programming', u'USED-FOR', u'Learning algorithms')], [(u'Markov logic', u'USED-FOR', u'entity resolution'), (u'Markov logic', u'USED-FOR', u'information extraction'), (u'entity resolution', u'CONJUNCTION', u'link prediction'), (u'entity resolution', u'CONJUNCTION', u'information extraction'), (u'link prediction', u'CONJUNCTION', u'information extraction'), (u'information extraction', u'CONJUNCTION', u'others')]]
sentences: [u'In recent years , it has become increasingly clear that the vision of the Semantic Web requires uncertain reasoning over rich , first-order representations .', u'Markov logic brings the power of probabilistic modeling to first-order logic by attaching weights to logical formulas and viewing them as templates for features of Markov networks .', u'This gives natural probabilistic semantics to uncertain or even inconsistent knowledge bases with minimal engineering effort .', u'Inference algorithms for Markov logic draw on ideas from satisfiability , Markov chain Monte Carlo and knowledge-based model construction .', u'Learning algorithms are based on the conjugate gradient algorithm , pseudo-likelihood and inductive logic programming .', u'Markov logic has been successfully applied to problems in entity resolution , link prediction , information extraction and others , and is the basis of the open-source Alchemy system .']

entities: [[(u'IT systems', u'Method'), (u'workflows of medical imaging departments', u'Task')], [(u'healthcare workflows', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'solutions', u'Generic'), (u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'web technologies', u'Method'), (u'web services', u'Method'), (u'web semantic ontologies', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'integrated web platform', u'Method'), (u'knowledge based', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'medical imaging workflows', u'Task')], [(u'knowledge management techniques', u'Method'), (u'semantic web ontologies', u'Method'), (u'prognosis and diagnosis procedures', u'Task'), (u'productivity', u'Metric'), (u'accuracy', u'Metric'), (u'medical diagnosis', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'IT systems', u'USED-FOR', u'workflows of medical imaging departments')], [], [(u'systems', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web technologies'), (u'web services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web semantic ontologies')], [(u'integrated web platform', u'USED-FOR', u'medical imaging workflows')], [(u'knowledge management techniques', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web ontologies'), (u'knowledge management techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'prognosis and diagnosis procedures'), (u'semantic web ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'prognosis and diagnosis procedures')]]
sentences: [u'Currently , several traditional IT systems exist for supporting workflows of medical imaging departments .', u'However , there is the recognized need for the next step ; an integrated and low cost open architecture platform which can manage various kinds of healthcare workflows .', u'The implementation of such solutions can be achieved by intelligent integration of existing systems , the use of web technologies , the utilization of available web services and web semantic ontologies .', u'Based on this approach , this paper presents an advanced , integrated web platform that is generic , agnostic , knowledge based , mobile oriented and supports all medical imaging workflows , complying at the same time with international standards and initiatives .', u'Furthermore , the utilization of knowledge management techniques and semantic web ontologies facilitate prognosis and diagnosis procedures , increase productivity and improve the accuracy and reliability of medical diagnosis .']

entities: [[(u'ontology documents', u'Material'), (u'management system', u'Method'), (u'store ontology data', u'Material'), (u'process queries', u'Material'), (u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'storage schema', u'Method'), (u'semantic web documents', u'Material'), (u'RDF/RDFS ontology language', u'Material'), (u'W3C', u'Method'), (u'relational databases', u'Material')], [(u'storage schema', u'Method'), (u'query processing', u'Task')], [(u'mechanism', u'Generic'), (u'RQL semantic queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SQL relational queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'MS-ACCESS', u'Method')], [(u'data query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'triple model', u'Method'), (u'schema and hierarchy information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SQL', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'management system', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic information'), (u'store ontology data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'process queries')], [(u'storage schema', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web documents'), (u'RDF/RDFS ontology language', u'USED-FOR', u'storage schema'), (u'RDF/RDFS ontology language', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web documents')], [(u'storage schema', u'USED-FOR', u'query processing')], [(u'mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'RQL semantic queries')], [(u'triple model', u'USED-FOR', u'data query')]]
sentences: [u'According to the widespread use of ontology documents , a management system which store ontology data and process queries is needed for retrieving semantic information efficiently .', u'In this paper I propose a storage schema that stores and retrieves semantic web documents based on RDF/RDFS ontology language developed by W3C in a relational databases .', u'Specially , the proposed storage schema is designed to retrieve efficiently hierarchy information and to increase efficiency of query processing .', u'Also , I describe a mechanism to transform RQL semantic queries to SQL relational queries and build up database using MS-ACCESS and implement in this paper .', u'According to the result of implementation , we can blow that not only data query based on triple model but also query for schema and hierarchy information are transformed simply to SQL .']

entities: [[(u'ubiquitous service conflicts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'event-condition-action ( ECA ) rule', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'service logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web rule language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules of resource consumption', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'resource state transition', u'Task')], [(u'resource state transition rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conflict service behaviors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ECA rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ECA rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'service logic conflicts', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'event-condition-action ( ECA ) rule', u'USED-FOR', u'service logic'), (u'rules of resource consumption', u'CONJUNCTION', u'resource state transition'), (u'resource consumption', u'CONJUNCTION', u'resource state transition')], [], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'service logic conflicts')]]
sentences: [u'Focusing on the problem of ubiquitous service conflicts , which is caused by active and context-driven characteristics of ubiquitous service in ubiquitous computing environments , the ubiquitous service conflicts detection method is studied .', u'The event-condition-action ( ECA ) rule is used to describe the service logic , and semantic web rule language ( SWRL ) is used to construct rules of resource consumption and resource state transition .', u'By analyzing the semantic of the service behavior using resource consumption and resource state transition rules , conflict service behaviors are identified , on the basis of which logic conflicts of ECA rules are detected , and the set of conflicting ECA rules is acquired .', u'Examples show that this method can detect parts of service logic conflicts and partly solve the ubiquitous service conflict detection problems in the ubiquitous service environment .']

entities: [[(u'Situation Awareness ( SA ) system', u'Method'), (u'vessel crews', u'Method'), (u'decision making process', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], [], [(u'incomplete information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web Rule Language', u'Method'), (u'maritime surveillance domain', u'Material')], [(u'ontology based system', u'Method'), (u'decision making process', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Situation Awareness ( SA ) system', u'USED-FOR', u'vessel crews')], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'system')], [(u'vessel crews', u'CONJUNCTION', u'control room operators')], [], [(u'Semantic Web Rule Language', u'USED-FOR', u'maritime surveillance domain')], [(u'ontology based system', u'USED-FOR', u'decision making process')]]
sentences: [u'This paper discusses about the design of a Situation Awareness ( SA ) system to support vessel crews and control room operators in improving the decision making process .', u'The architecture of the system is ontology based .', u'The vessel crews and control room operators may face a loss of SA .', u'They may have limited cognitive abilities which make it difficult to make a decision in a high stress level , short time availability and continuously evolving situation with incomplete information .', u'In this work , we describe the application of Semantic Web Rule Language to represent corresponding knowledge in the maritime surveillance domain .', u'The result of this research will demonstrate that an ontology based system can be used to remodel the information into a meaningful and valuable form to predict the future states of SA and improve the decision making process .']

sentences: [u'The interest in publishing language resources as linked data is increasing , as clearly corroborated by the recent growth of the Linguistic Linked Data cloud .', u'However , the actual value of data published as linked data is the fact that it is linked across datasets , supporting integration and discovery of data .', u'As the manual creation of links between datasets is costly and therefore does not scale well , automatic linking approaches are of great importance to increase the quality and degree of linking of the Linguistic Linked Data cloud .', u'In this paper we examine an automatic approach to link four different datasets to each other : two terminologies , the European Migration Network ( EMN ) glossary as well as the Interactive Terminology for Europe ( IATE ) , BabelNet , and the Manually Annotated Subcorpus ( MASC ) of the American National Corpus .', u'We describe our methodology , present some results on the quality of the links and summarize our experiences with this small linking exercise We will make sure that the resources are added to the linguistic linked data cloud .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'data integration', u'Task'), (u'real-world entity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'object conflicts problem', u'Task')], [(u'object conflicts resolution problem', u'Task'), (u'joint distribution of variables', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous information network', u'Method'), (u'Source-Object Network', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data sources', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'network effects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ObResolution', u'Method'), (u'Object Resolution )', u'Method')], [(u'ObResolution', u'Method'), (u'pairwise Markov Random Field ( pMRF )', u'Method')], [(u'real-world datasets', u'Material'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Object Conflicts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data Quality', u'Metric'), (u'Truth Discovery', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Linked Data community', u'USED-FOR', u'object conflicts problem')], [(u'joint distribution of variables', u'USED-FOR', u'object conflicts resolution problem'), (u'heterogeneous information network', u'USED-FOR', u'object conflicts resolution problem'), (u'heterogeneous information network', u'USED-FOR', u'joint distribution of variables'), (u'Source-Object Network', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'heterogeneous information network')], [(u'network effects', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [], [(u'real-world datasets', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'method'), (u'accuracy', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'method')], [(u'Object Conflicts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Object Conflicts'), (u'Object Conflicts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Linked Data Quality'), (u'Linked Data Quality', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Object Conflicts'), (u'Linked Data Quality', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Truth Discovery')]]
sentences: [u'Considerable effort has been made to increase the scale of Linked Data .', u'However , an inevitable problem when dealing with data integration from multiple sources is that multiple different sources often provide conflicting objects for a certain predicate of the same real-world entity , so-called object conflicts problem .', u'Currently , the object conflicts problem has not received sufficient attention in the Linked Data community .', u'In this paper , we first formalize the object conflicts resolution problem as computing the joint distribution of variables on a heterogeneous information network called the Source-Object Network , which successfully captures the all correlations from objects and Linked Data sources .', u'Then , we introduce a novel approach based on network effects called ObResolution ( Object Resolution ) , to identify a true object from multiple conflicting objects .', u'ObResolution adopts a pairwise Markov Random Field ( pMRF ) to model all evidences under a unified framework .', u'Extensive experimental results on six real-world datasets show that our method exhibits higher accuracy than existing approaches and it is robust and consistent in various domains .', u'\\keywords { Linked Data , Object Conflicts , Linked Data Quality , Truth Discovery']

entities: [[(u'Usability patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'graphical user interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'usability patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'books', u'Material'), (u'private repositories', u'Material'), (u'World-Wide Web', u'Material')], [(u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web concepts', u'Method'), (u'informal patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formal representations', u'Method'), (u'systematic design methods', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'usability knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]

sentences: [u'Usability patterns represent knowledge about known ways to design graphical user interfaces that are usable and meet the needs and expectations of users .', u'There is currently a plethora of usability patterns published in books , private repositories and the World-Wide Web .', u'The dominance of pattern discovery efforts has neglected the emerging need to organize the patterns so they can become a proactive resource for developing interfaces .', u'This paper presents an approach using Semantic Web concepts that turns informal patterns into formal representations capable of supporting systematic design methods .', u'Through this method , loosely coupled pattern collections can be turned into strongly coupled pattern languages that help organize usability knowledge into a form that is easily and widely disseminated .', u'This in turn can be used to facilitate the accumulation of usability development knowledge .']

sentences: [u'Abstract : At the University of Koblenz-Landau , we have worked on two infrastructures that allow for a seamless information flow between information sources and information users .', u'1 .', u'Based on a highly scalable infrastructure for distributed semantic information access , we have developed the SemaPlorer application that combines geographic map data with enrichments from a heterogeneous set of data sources ( Flickr , GeoNames , Swoogle , Wikipedia , etc . )', u'and allows for context-supported browsing of this data .', u'2 .', u'Based on novel modelling of core ontologies , we have developed a semantic approach for personal information management .', u'This semantic desktop enhances a standard PC desktop environment by the capability to cross-link data and use these cross-links for exploration of personal information .', u'Eventually , we have investigated how such a Semantic Web infrastructure benefits the knowledge worker .']

entities: [[(u'Enterprise architecture', u'Method'), (u'EA ) model analysis', u'Method'), (u'property assessment criteria', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'EA models', u'Method')], [(u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conceptual models', u'Method'), (u'computational inference', u'Task'), (u'models', u'Generic')], [(u'EA modelling languages', u'Method'), (u'conceptual models', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'enterprise architecture models', u'Method')], [(u'techniques', u'Generic'), (u'computational inference', u'Task'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method')], [(u'techniques', u'Generic'), (u'EA model analysis', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Enterprise architecture ( EA ) model analysis can be defined as the application of property assessment criteria to EA models .', u'Ontologies can be used to represent conceptual models , allowing the application of computational inference to derive logical conclusions from the facts present in the models .', u'As the actual common EA modelling languages are conceptual , advantage can be taken of representing such conceptual models using ontologies .', u'Several techniques for this purpose are widely available as part of the semantic web standards and frameworks .', u'This paper explores the use of the aforementioned techniques in the analysis of enterprise architecture models .', u'Namely , two techniques are used to this end : computational inference and the use of SPARQL .', u'The aim is to demonstrate the possibilities brought by the use of these techniques in EA model analysis .']

sentences: [u'Environmental informatics delivers techniques and tools for archiving and processing environmental data .', u'The ad- vent of the Internet had positively affected the availability and ease of access to large and diverse environmental da- tabases , distributed all over the world .', u'On the other hand , similar progress has not been matched by the availability of models and algorithms able to process these data , mostly because of the lack of standards in the annotation of the characteristics of environmental models .', u"In this paper we advocate the need for the semantic annotation of environ- mental `` knowledge '' , encompassing models and data .", u'The slow , but steady , introduction of the Semantic Web and the widespread use of ontologies for semantic annotationRizzoliAV_ will allow environmental informatics to cover the gap in the access and usability of models and algorithms for environmental data processing .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web community', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'meaning of content', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'Web Authoring', u'Method'), (u'Accessibility', u'Task'), (u'semantic structure of documents', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'WAfA', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'XHTML document', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web resource', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'Web document', u'Material')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'ontologies', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web community')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Conventional thought from the Semantic Web community equates the use of ontologies with the representation of the meaning of content .', u'Here , we skew this viewpoint by describing our ontology , Web Authoring for Accessibility ( WAfA ) , which investigates the way ontologies can describe the semantic structure of documents .', u'By understanding the way heterogeneous XHTML ( Extensible Hypertext Mark-up Language ) documents are structured we can better transform documents , currently inaccessible to visually impaired users .', u"WAfA performs two tasks : ( 1 ) it allows us to flexibly model an XHTML document within the context of navigation and orientation through the Web resource ; ( 2 ) it enables non-expert users to quickly annotate a Web document by providing a ` lingua franca ' between author and Web Accessibility Domain Experts .", u'Here we describe our ontology , its use , novelty , and importance .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'database-backed strategy', u'USED-FOR', u'large program analysis'), (u'graph algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'database-backed strategy'), (u'graph algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'large program analysis')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Software is rapidly increasing in size and complexity .', u'Static analyses must be designed to scale well if they are to be usable with realistic applications , but prior efforts have often been limited by available memory .', u'We propose a database-backed strategy for large program analysis based on graph algorithms , using a Semantic Web database to manage representations of the program under analysis .', u'Our approach is applicable to a variety of interprocedural finite distributive subset ( IFDS ) dataflow problems ; we focus on error propagation as a motivating example .', u'Our implementation analyzes multi-million-line programs quickly and in just a fraction of the memory required by prior approaches .', u'When memory alone is insufficient , our approach falls back on disk using several hybrid configurations tuned to put all available resources to good use .']

entities: [[(u'interactive virtual environments', u'Method'), (u'material processing technology', u'Method')], [(u'web-based systems', u'Method'), (u'material processing technology', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'online interactive virtual environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'operation ofinstruments', u'Task')], [(u'semantic web-based systems', u'Method'), (u'investigation of material processing technology', u'Task')], [(u'learning', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'web-based systems', u'USED-FOR', u'material processing technology')], [], [(u'online interactive virtual environments', u'USED-FOR', u'operation ofinstruments')], [(u'semantic web-based systems', u'USED-FOR', u'investigation of material processing technology'), (u'semantic web-based systems', u'USED-FOR', u'material processing technology')], []]
sentences: [u'This article describes an implementation of interactive virtual environments that have been designed for supporting the education of technical skills in material processing technology .', u'The developed web-based systems provide the capability to train students in the technical skills of material processing technology without the need to work on actual machines in the laboratory .', u'The effect of the developed system was examined both quantitatively and qualitatively .', u"Generally , our results indicated that incorporating online interactive virtual environments into engineering courses can enhance students ' technical skills in the operation ofinstruments , process planning and justification of process parameters .", u'Findings also showed that the developed semantic web-based systems were able to facilitate investigation of material processing technology .', u"The results also showed that there were significant improvements in the participants ' motivation and learning ."]

relations: [[], [], [(u'agent proxy', u'USED-FOR', u'QoS model')], [], []]
sentences: [u'With emerging Web standards and new methodologies constantly coming to light there is a growing gap between the theoretical recommendations and the actual implementations .', u'In practice , to update a core implementation for a given component one would have to wait for gradual global updates or simply work in an isolated network with the updates .', u'For instance , implementing a QoS model using an agent proxy instead of a basic UDDI would be a straight forward theoretical process but not something that can be easily implemented in practice without a major overhaul of the network components .', u'Consequently , testing such new technologies as they are being developed would fall behind and contribute to the growth of the gap between new and actual technologies .', u'This paper introduces a general purpose semantic Web simulator prototype .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reuse knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'digital library', u'Material'), (u'Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) tools', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'Nomino', u'Method')], [(u'corpus', u'Generic'), (u'noun phrases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'LIKES', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'Protege-2000', u'Material')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u"user 's requests", u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'ontology', u'PART-OF', u'digital library')], [(u'analysis of scientific documents', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [], [(u'Protege-2000', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u"user 's requests"), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u"user 's requests")]]
sentences: [u'As an extension of the Web , in the highway of the construction of the Semantic Web we find the same problems such as the difficulty to share and reuse knowledge .', u'The aim of this article is to present the development of an ontology in the context of a digital library , based on the use of Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) tools .', u'Our approach is based on the analysis of scientific documents and the use of the tool for acquisition of terms called Nomino .', u'A corpus was treated by extracting noun phrases in order to been used with LIKES , a tool capable to identify relationships between concepts .', u'The final ontology was modeled using Protege-2000 .', u"This way , our ontology provides a comprehensive representation of scientific terms and it 's used to enhance user 's requests ."]

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'heterogeneous sources', u'Material'), (u'trust-based query answering', u'Task'), (u'integrated knowledge base', u'Material')], [], [], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'probabilistic knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material')], [(u'knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'trust information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query answering process', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'On the semantic web , information from several sources ( with disparate trust levels ) may be fused with the goal of answering complex queries from end users .', u'In such context , it is critical to aggregate information from heterogeneous sources and support trust-based query answering over the integrated knowledge base .', u'In this paper , we describe a scalable probabilistic query answering over complex , uncertain and partially consistent knowledge bases .', u'The key contributions in this paper are fourfold .', u'First , our approach provides an intuitive query answering semantics over a probabilistic knowledge base .', u'Second , our approach tolerates inconsistencies in knowledge bases .', u'Third , we propose and evaluate a scalable error-bounded approximation query answering over a large knowledge base .', u'Finally , we empirically show the value of taking into account trust information in the query answering process .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'CKR', u'Method'), (u'OWL 2 knowledge bases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'qualifying attributes', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'CKR', u'Method'), (u'hierarchical coverage relation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'CKR', u'Method'), (u'concept satisfiability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'subsumption', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'2NExpTime', u'Material'), (u'natural deduction calculus', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'propagation of knowledge between contexts', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'time', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'qualifying attributes'), (u'topic', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'qualifying attributes')], [], [], [(u'syntax', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantics'), (u'syntax', u'CONJUNCTION', u'subsumption'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'propagation of knowledge between contexts'), (u'natural deduction calculus', u'USED-FOR', u'propagation of knowledge between contexts')]]
sentences: [u'We propose Contextualized Knowledge Repository ( CKR ) : an adaptation of the well studied theories of context for the Semantic Web .', u'A CKR is composed of a set of OWL 2 knowledge bases , which are embedded in a context by a set of qualifying attributes ( time , space , topic , etc . )', u'specifying the boundaries within which the knowledge base is assumed to be true .', u'Contexts of a CKR are organized by a hierarchical coverage relation , which enables an effective representation of knowledge and a flexible method for its reuse between the contexts .', u'The paper defines the syntax and the semantics of CKR ; shows that concept satisfiability and subsumption are decidable with the complexity upper bound of 2NExpTime , and it also provides a sound and complete natural deduction calculus that serves to characterize the propagation of knowledge between contexts .']

entities: [[(u'context-aware pervasive computing', u'Task'), (u'theoretical grounding', u'Task')], [], [(u'adaptive e-learning environments', u'Task')], [(u'context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'adaptivity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'context-aware systems', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'software development issues', u'Task')], [(u'context-aware pervasive application development', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web activities', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'context', u'CONJUNCTION', u'adaptivity'), (u'adaptivity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'context-aware systems'), (u'adaptivity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontologies'), (u'context-aware systems', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontologies'), (u'context-aware systems', u'CONJUNCTION', u'software development issues'), (u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'software development issues')], [(u'view point', u'USED-FOR', u'context-aware pervasive application development'), (u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web activities')]]
sentences: [u'In this article we present a review of selected literature of context-aware pervasive computing while integrating theory and practice from various disciplines in order to construct a theoretical grounding and a technical follow-up path for our future research .', u'This paper is not meant to provide an extensive review of the literature , but rather to integrate and extend fundamental and promising theoretical and technical aspects found in the literature .', u'Our purpose is to use the constructed theory and practice in order to enable anywhere and anytime adaptive e-learning environments .', u'We particularly elaborate on context , adaptivity , context-aware systems , ontologies and software development issues .', u'Furthermore , we represent our view point for context-aware pervasive application development particularly based on higher abstraction where ontologies and semantic web activities , also web itself , are of crucial .']

entities: [[(u'multi-agent systems', u'Method')], [(u'web ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'agent-oriented platforms', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'agents', u'Generic'), (u'infrastructure layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'storing', u'Task'), (u'domain-specific OWL ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'layer', u'Generic'), (u'agent platforms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web data', u'Material'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'platform', u'Generic'), (u'access layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontological reasoning engines', u'Method'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'agent programming', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'infrastructure layer', u'USED-FOR', u'agents'), (u'storing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'accessing')], [], [], [(u'knowledge representation', u'USED-FOR', u'agent programming')]]
sentences: [u'Several advantages can be obtained by allowing multi-agent systems to easily access ontologies , for example , in scenarios where agents make their decisions based on the knowledge provided by ontologies .', u'Thus , this paper presents an infrastructure to allow the use of web ontologies in different agent-oriented platforms .', u'The agents use this infrastructure layer as a tool for storing , accessing and querying domain-specific OWL ontologies .', u'As a result , this layer allows an integration of agent platforms with semantic web data and ontologies .', u'We exemplify in practice how agents , coded in one such platform , can use the proposed access layer to ontological reasoning engines , as well as which features can be obtained from it .', u'The performance of this semantic infrastructure is evaluated and compared against usual knowledge representation in agent programming .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web vision', u'Task'), (u'conceptualization', u'Task')], [(u'geospatial domain', u'Material'), (u'semi-automatic semantic composition', u'Method'), (u'geospatial web services', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')], [], [(u'rule engines', u'Method'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'execution speed', u'Metric')], [(u'execution solution', u'Method'), (u'JBoss Rules', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'implementations', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'complexity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'execution speed')], [(u'JBoss Rules', u'USED-FOR', u'execution solution'), (u'it', u'COMPARE', u'implementations')]]
sentences: [u'The main research focus toward the Semantic Web vision has been so far on conceptualization , while little concern was spent on the efficiency aspect .', u'In this paper we present practical experiences gained with the implementation of a use case from the geospatial domain , in particular a semi-automatic semantic composition of the functionality provided by 7 geospatial web services .', u'Although we obtained the desired results with our initial approach , the performance aspect was unsatisfactory .', u'For this reason we started the investigation into how significant performance improvements could be obtained .', u'We identified rule engines as a solution that would easily fit into our framework and also were mature enough in terms of complexity and execution speed .', u'We provide a new execution solution based on JBoss Rules and compare it with previous implementations .']

entities: [[(u'Triple Space Computing', u'Method'), (u'middleware paradigm', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'tuplespaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Triple Space infrastructure distribution of triplespaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'distributed triplespaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'content location of triplespaces', u'Task')], [(u'Peer-to-Peer overlay', u'Method'), (u'Distributed Hash Tables', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic overlay layers', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'combination approach', u'Method'), (u'triplespace selection problem', u'Task'), (u'triplespaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Triple Space Computing', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'middleware paradigm'), (u'semantics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'tuplespaces')], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'content location of triplespaces')], [(u'Distributed Hash Tables', u'USED-FOR', u'Peer-to-Peer overlay')], [(u'combination approach', u'USED-FOR', u'triplespace selection problem')]]
sentences: [u'Triple Space Computing is a new middleware paradigm [ 11,13 ] based on semantics and tuplespaces which can be used for the coordination of Semantic Web clients and services .', u'To achieve scalability of Triple Space infrastructure distribution of triplespaces is necessary .', u'A major problem within massively distributed triplespaces is to find the best suited triplespaces to answer a certain query .', u'In this paper we introduce a novel approach for efficient content location of triplespaces given a certain query .', u'We use a Peer-to-Peer overlay based on Distributed Hash Tables and three semantic overlay layers which are used to score the known triplespaces according to their probability to answer queries .', u'This combination approach is introduced to solve the triplespace selection problem more efficiently and support high performance operation handling in triplespaces .']

entities: [[(u'ontology modeling', u'Task'), (u'engineering', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'collaborative environment ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data exchange', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'synergizing Bayesian network', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'probabilistic information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'ontology and Bayesian networks', u'Method')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic')], [], []]
relations: [[(u'ontology modeling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'engineering')], [(u'collaborative environment ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'data exchange')], [], [(u'domain knowledge', u'CONJUNCTION', u'probabilistic information')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The concept of ontology modeling and engineering has drastically evolved with the emergence of semantic web .', u'Today in a collaborative environment ontologies need to interoperate for efficient data exchange .', u'Due to their deterministic nature , ontologies are unable to capture uncertainty inherent in many real world problems .', u'Efforts have been made to add the dimension of uncertainty by synergizing Bayesian network with ontology - a combination in which domain knowledge and probabilistic information go hand in hand .', u'This paper categorizes different approaches that have been proposed to blend ontology and Bayesian networks .', u'It also discusses the scope of these approaches and their intended application areas .', u'Their relative strengths and weaknesses are also highlighted .', u'The paper contributes significantly by providing a comprehensive comparison which could serve as the starting point for new researchers .']

entities: [[(u'open education resources movement', u'Task')], [(u'resource construction', u'Task')], [], [(u'uniform norms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'duplication of resource construction', u'Task'), (u'low resource utilization', u'Metric')], [(u'Semantic media Wiki', u'Method'), (u'Wiki', u'Method'), (u'structured knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'resource co-construction', u'Task'), (u'open education resources movement', u'Task')], [(u'online course Education Information Processing', u'Task'), (u"Semantic MediaWiki 's application", u'Task'), (u'open education resources construction', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'duplication of resource construction', u'CONJUNCTION', u'low resource utilization')], [(u'Semantic media Wiki', u'USED-FOR', u'resource co-construction'), (u'structured knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic media Wiki'), (u'structured knowledge', u'CONJUNCTION', u'structured knowledge')], [(u"Semantic MediaWiki 's application", u'USED-FOR', u'open education resources construction')]]
sentences: [u"Since the MIT 's OpenCourseWare project in 2001 , open education resources movement has gone through more than ten years .", u'Except for the fruitful results , some problems of resource construction are also exposed .', u'Part of open education resources projects can not be carried out or even were forced to drop out for a shortage of personnel or funds .', u'A lack of uniform norms or standards leads to the duplication of resource construction and low resource utilization .', u'Semantic media Wiki combines the openness , self-organization and collaboration of Wiki with the structured knowledge in the Semantic Web , which meets the needs of resource co-construction and sharing in open education resources movement .', u"In this study , based on the online course Education Information Processing , we explore the Semantic MediaWiki 's application in the open education resources construction ."]

entities: [[(u'Ranking', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'scoring', u'Method')], [], [(u'soft constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'common language element', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ranking', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SPARQL', u'Method')], [(u'formal syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics of preference expressions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method')], [(u'preference query processing', u'Method'), (u'ARQ query engine', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Ranking is an important concept to avoid empty or overfull and unordered result sets .', u'However , such scoring can only express total orders , which restricts its usefulness when several factors influence result relevance .', u'A more flexible way to express relevance is the notion of preferences .', u'Users state which kind of answers they prefer by adding soft constraints to their queries. # R # # N # # R # # N # Current approaches in the Semantic Web offer only limited facilities for specification of scoring and result ordering .', u'There is no common language element to express and formalize ranking and preferences .', u'We present a comprehensive extension of SPARQL which directly supports the expression of preferences .', u'This includes formal syntax and semantics of preference expressions for SPARQL .', u'Additionally , we report our implementation of preference query processing , which is based on the ARQ query engine .']

entities: [[(u'Conjunctive query answering', u'Task'), (u'ontology-based applications', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web query answering systems', u'Method')], [(u'systems', u'Generic')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'generating test data', u'Task')], [(u'data generation algorithms', u'Method'), (u'ontology languages', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'Conjunctive query answering is a key reasoning service for many ontology-based applications .', u'In order to improve scalability , many Semantic Web query answering systems give up completeness ( i.e. , they do not guarantee to return all query answers ) .', u'It may be useful or even critical to the designers and users of such systems to understand how much and what kind of information is ( potentially ) being lost .', u'We present a method for generating test data that can be used to provide at least partial answers to these questions , a purpose for which existing benchmarks are not well suited .', u'In addition to developing a general framework that formalises the problem , we describe practical data generation algorithms for some popular ontology languages , and present some very encouraging results from our preliminary evaluation .']

sentences: [u'The paper reviews the notions of expressiveness of description logics from ( N. Kurtonina and M. de Rijke .', u'Expressiveness of concept expressions in first-order description logics .', u'Artificial Intelligence , 107:303-333 , 1999 ) and exemplifies their use in the development in Semantic Web languages .', u"The notion of bisimulation -- which characterizes the description logic ALC -- provides a direct link to what 's in the field of sociology called social network analysis .", u'The perspective on data in this field -- data are represented as labeled graphs -- fits exactly the modeling intuitions of web languages like OIL and DAML+OIL .', u'This is exemplified in the study of trophic networks .', u'A further connection is established between web languages and hybrid logic , and an extension of OIL with a limited form of self reference is proposed .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'life sciences', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'software development', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'reuse techniques', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology languages', u'Material')], [(u'conceptual modeling', u'Method'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'ontological reuse units', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'modularization', u'Task')], [(u'role-based ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Description Logics', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'life sciences'), (u'Ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web'), (u'life sciences', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web')], [], [(u'reuse techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [(u'they', u'USED-FOR', u'ontological reuse units'), (u'they', u'USED-FOR', u'modularization')], []]
sentences: [u'Ontologies are already used in the life sciences and the Semantic Web , but are expected to be deployed in many other areas in the near future -- for example , in software development .', u'As the use of ontologies becomes commonplace , they will be constructed more frequently and also become more complex .', u'To cope with this issue , modularization paradigms and reuse techniques must be defined for ontologies and supported by ontology languages .', u'In this paper , we propose the use of roles from conceptual modeling for this purpose , and show how they can be used to define ontological reuse units and enable modularization .', u'We present role-based ontologies as an extension of standard ontologies and define their semantics through a reduction to standard Description Logics , such that existing reasoners can be used .']

entities: [[(u'collaborative tagging systems', u'Method'), (u'search and navigation of resources', u'Task'), (u'collective classification schema', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'tag space', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'social tagging systems', u'Task'), (u'collaborative organization', u'Task'), (u'concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'partial ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'shallow pre-processing strategies', u'Method'), (u'statistical techniques', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'del.icio.us and Flickr tag sets', u'Material'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'clusters', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'tags', u'USED-FOR', u'search and navigation of resources')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantics')], [(u'shallow pre-processing strategies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'statistical techniques')], [(u'del.icio.us and Flickr tag sets', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach'), (u'del.icio.us and Flickr tag sets', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'it')]]
sentences: [u'While tags in collaborative tagging systems serve primarily an indexing purpose , facilitating search and navigation of resources , the use of the same tags by more than one individual can yield a collective classification schema .', u'We present an approach for making explicit the semantics behind the tag space in social tagging systems , so that this collaborative organization can emerge in the form of groups of concepts and partial ontologies .', u'This is achieved by using a combination of shallow pre-processing strategies and statistical techniques together with knowledge provided by ontologies available on the semantic web .', u'Preliminary results on the del.icio.us and Flickr tag sets show that the approach is very promising : it generates clusters with highly related tags corresponding to concepts in ontologies and meaningful relationships among subsets of these tags can be identified .']

relations: [[(u'semantic web-based technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'heterogeneous data'), (u'semantic web-based technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'heterogeneous data integration model'), (u'medical information system', u'USED-FOR', u'heterogeneous data'), (u'Mediator/Wrapper framework', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'heterogeneous data integration model'), (u'ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Mediator/Wrapper framework'), (u'OGSA-DAI', u'USED-FOR', u'heterogeneous data integration model'), (u'OGSA-DAI', u'USED-FOR', u'Mediator/Wrapper framework'), (u'OGSA-DAI', u'USED-FOR', u'data accessing middleware')], [(u'Mediator', u'USED-FOR', u'uniform query interface'), (u'Mediator', u'USED-FOR', u'user queries'), (u'global ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'local ontologies')], [], [(u'two-layer ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic interoperability'), (u'two-layer ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'model'), (u'two-layer ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'three-hierarchy mappings'), (u'three-hierarchy mappings', u'CONJUNCTION', u'three-hierarchy mappings'), (u'global ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'three-hierarchy mappings'), (u'global ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'local ontologies')], [(u'heterogeneous semantics', u'FEATURE-OF', u'data sources')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we apply semantic web-based technologies to integrate heterogeneous data from medical information system , and design a heterogeneous data integration model , which combines Mediator/Wrapper framework with ontology , using OGSA-DAI as data accessing middleware .', u'Mediator provides uniform query interface , decomposes user queries based on the mapping relations between global ontology and local ontologies .', u'Wrapper receives subqueries and returns query results to Mediator .', u'To tackle the problem of semantic interoperability , the model uses two-layer ontologies and three-hierarchy mappings , that is the mapping between global ontology and local ontologies , among local ontologies , and the mapping between local ontologies and databases .', u'According to our integration model , users can get query results from heterogeneous medical data sources but need not to know anything about the data sources with heterogeneous semantics .']

sentences: [u'The huge expenses for healthcare by the larger section of the population in India have made it economically crucial .', u'The healthcare insurance is one of the cost-effective solutions to control the out-of-pocket expenditure in the sector .', u'Nevertheless , the existing information asymmetries in the field of healthcare insurance bewilder the potential client in selecting the right policy .', u'They are more dependent on the business agents for information and the chances of being exploited become high due to the imbalance in the information .', u'This paper proposes an information system that makes use of semantic Web techniques to minimize the information asymmetry in Indian healthcare insurance market .', u'The emerging concepts of semantic data mining encourage the cooperative way of existence and reduced chances of exploitation of the client or patient .']

sentences: [u'Aligning two representations of the same domain with different expressiveness is a crucial topic in nowadays semantic web and big data research .', u'OWL ontologies and Entity Relation Diagrams are the most widespread representations whose alignment allows for semantic data access via ontology interface , and ontology storing techniques .', u"The term `` '' alignment '' encompasses three different processes : OWL-to-ERD and ERD-to-OWL transformation , and OWL-ERD mapping .", u'In this paper an innovative statistical tool is presented to accomplish all the three aspects of the alignment .', u'The main idea relies on the use of a HMM to estimate the most likely ERD sentence that is stated in a suitable grammar , and corresponds to the observed OWL axiom .', u'The system and its theoretical background are presented , and some experiments are reported .']
