sentences: [u'paper deals with the application of multi-agent systems in the electronic market ( e-market ) .', u'Proposed is a multi-agent system which enables the complete automation of business processes and should be able to automate the semantic comparison of required and advertised Web services according to user preferences .', u'The system consists of semantic and mobile agents responsible for autonomous service discovery , automated negotiation and automated purchase .', u'Specific concepts and ontologies used for creating semantic information and agent interactions , as well as mechanisms that provide the ability of semantic reasoning , are presented .', u'A case study elaborates upon the developed agent- mediated e-market operations and interactions between agents during the transactions simulated in the business process of Multimedia Service .', u'Keywordsoftware agents , Web services , Semantic Web , OWL , OWL-S , semantic matchmaking , electronic market .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge management system', u'Method'), (u'machinery', u'Task'), (u'ontology technique', u'Method'), (u'information search efficiency', u'Metric')], [(u'Ontology technique', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'OWL and RAP languages', u'Material'), (u'knowledge management process', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'satisfaction evaluation', u'Metric'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'satisfaction', u'Metric')], []]
relations: [[(u'ontology technique', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge management system'), (u'ontology technique', u'USED-FOR', u'machinery'), (u'ontology technique', u'USED-FOR', u'information search efficiency')], [(u'Ontology technique', u'USED-FOR', u'system'), (u'Ontology technique', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web'), (u'OWL and RAP languages', u'USED-FOR', u'system'), (u'OWL and RAP languages', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The purpose of this study was to develop a knowledge management system for basic hand tools and machinery using ontology technique for increasing information search efficiency and for practical use .', u'Ontology technique was applied to help presenting the system in the form of semantic web using OWL and RAP languages that supported analyses in knowledge management process .', u'The system was designed to meet users need .', u'It was tested and evaluated by experts and users.The study showed that the system could help the users to efficiently use the right tools for the right jobs .', u'According to the satisfaction evaluation , the experts and the users were very satisfied with the developed system .', u'The satisfaction mean was 4.34 and the standard deviation was 0.54 .', u'This proved that the set hypothesis was true .']

entities: [[(u'media management', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'media processing methods', u'Method'), (u'knowledge representation techniques', u'Method')], [(u'knowledge representation', u'Task'), (u'computer vision', u'Task'), (u'personal media collection', u'Material')], [], [(u'media sharing services', u'Method'), (u'personal events', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'explicit spatio-temporal metadata', u'Material'), (u'event-centric vocabulary', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'media management', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web'), (u'media processing methods', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge representation techniques'), (u'knowledge representation techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'media around events')], [(u'knowledge representation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'computer vision')], [], []]
sentences: [u'There is currently a trend in media management and the semantic web to develop new media processing methods and knowledge representation techniques to organise and structure media around events .', u'While this increased interest for events as the central aggregator when organising media is supported by strong research in the fields of knowledge representation and computer vision ; it is not yet clear how the digital era users use events when sharing their personal media collection .', u'In this paper , we explore how users share photos online and discuss the results of a preliminary automatic processing of the data collected .', u'We show that while media sharing services do not support events as yet , users still share their media around personal events , either by providing explicit spatio-temporal metadata , or by using an event-centric vocabulary .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'DLclog', u'Method'), (u'hybrid formalism', u'Method'), (u'description logics', u'Method'), (u'DL )', u'Method'), (u'logic programming', u'Method'), (u'DL+log', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'DLclog', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'negative dl-atoms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'McCarthys parallel circumscription', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL predicates', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL predicates', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Nonmonotonic Circumscriptive Semantics', u'Method'), (u'DLclog', u'Method'), (u'hybrid system', u'Method'), (u'reasoning abilities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'decision procedure', u'Method'), (u'DL ontology', u'Method'), (u'ALCIO', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ALCQO', u'Method'), (u'negative dl-atoms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'complexity', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[(u'DLclog', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web'), (u'DLclog', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'hybrid formalism'), (u'description logics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'hybrid formalism'), (u'description logics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'logic programming'), (u'logic programming', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'hybrid formalism'), (u'syntax', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantics')], [], [(u'DLclog', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'hybrid system'), (u'reasoning abilities', u'PART-OF', u'hybrid system')], [(u'ALCIO', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ALCQO'), (u'ALCQO', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ALCQO')]]
sentences: [u'Based on the vision of the Semantic Web , DLclog , a new hybrid formalism combining description logics ( DL ) and logic programming ( LP ) , is described , which extends DL+log from syntax and semantics .', u'In DLclog , negative dl-atoms can occur in the bodies of the rules , and are interpreted non-classically by McCarthys parallel circumscription , i.e. , the extents of these DL predicates are minimized with the extents of all other DL predicates varying .', u'In this way , the Nonmonotonic Semantics ( NM-Semantics ) of DL+log is extended to the Nonmonotonic Circumscriptive Semantics ( NMC-Semantics ) , and therefore , DLclog becomes the hybrid system with the stronger expressiveness and reasoning abilities .', u'A decision procedure is given when DL ontology is written in ALCIO or ALCQO and roles are not allowed to occur in negative dl-atoms , and the complexity is analyzed .']

sentences: [u'Different kinds of controlled natural language CNL have been proposed as a front-end for Semantic Web systems , in order to make them more accessible to users with no background in formal notations and methods .', u'This paper investigates whether OWL statements in CNL are indeed easier to understand than in other notations .', u'To this aim , an experiment with 64 participants was conducted that compares a controlled natural language to a classical OWL notation .', u'Concretely , Attempto Controlled English was compared to a simplified version of the Manchester OWL Syntax .', u'For a reliable and tool-independent evaluation of understandability , the experiment is based on a novel evaluation framework making use of simple and intuitive diagrams .', u'The results show that CNL is easier to understand , needs less learning time , and is more accepted by its users .']

entities: [[(u'web services', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'human intervention', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'executable supply chain plans', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'supply chains', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'bullwhip effect', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information sharing', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'business process models', u'Method'), (u'integrated supply chain planning', u'Task')], [(u'business patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'business process models', u'Method'), (u'business patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'web services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology'), (u'web services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web'), (u'ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web')], [(u'bullwhip effect', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'supply chains')], [], [(u'business process models', u'USED-FOR', u'business patterns'), (u'BPMN V1.1', u'USED-FOR', u'business process models')]]
sentences: [u'With advances of several enabling technologies such as web services , ontology , and semantic web , the business envi- ronments are shifting to an open business environment where business applications autonomously share information and coordinate decisions with each other without any human intervention .', u'This open business environment provides supply chains with the opportunity to generate executable supply chain plans , mitigating the inefficiencies of traditional supply chains such as bullwhip effect that is caused by the lack of information sharing .', u'This paper aims to develop business process models that reflect realistic business scenarios and enable integrated supply chain planning in the open business environment .', u'For this purpose , we first classify business patterns based on the types of request for quotation , and then business process models are developed for the business patterns using BPMN V1.1 .']

sentences: [u'Web Question Answering ( WQA ) and Web Service ( WS ) are parallel fields in intelligent web computing .', u'In network services , they are used widely , and they are rarely combined together .', u'For many intelligent web applications , however , using them together tends to be important .', u'This paper based on the study of significant techniques of WQA , WS and Hierarchical Task Network ( HTN ) , including Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) , Web Service Ontology and a planner of HTN , gives a proposal of WQA framework .', u'This framework combines NLP , predicate logic , Semantic Web description and an HTN planner-SHOP2 , turning question answering into a planning problem by question mapping and service planning .', u"It addresses a transition from natural language to semantic expression , composites web services dynamically by using SHOP2 , and obtains the answering that meets customers ' question by executing the web services sequence ."]

entities: [[(u'eXtensible Markup Language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'storing', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'XML documents', u'Material'), (u'structural , and semantic aspects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'XML', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'XML', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'presentation methods', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'Since the early days of introducing eXtensible Markup Language ( XML ) , owing to its expressive capabilities and flexibilities , it became the defacto standard for representing , storing , and interchanging data on the Web .', u'Such features have made XML one of the building blocks of the Semantic Web .', u'From another viewpoint , since XML documents could be considered from content , structural , and semantic aspects , leveraging their semantics is very useful and applicable in different domains .', u'However , XML does not by itself introduce any built-in mechanisms for governing semantics .', u'For this reason , many studies have been conducted on the representation of semantics within/from XML documents .', u'This paper studies and discusses different aspects of the mentioned topic in the form of an overview with an emphasis on the state of semantics in XML and its presentation methods .']

relations: [[(u'resource retrieval', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieval process'), (u'tree index', u'USED-FOR', u'method'), (u'conceptual clustering method', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieval process')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Efficient resource retrieval is a crucial issue , particularly in the context of Semantic Web , since forms of reasoning are used for answering requests .', u'Resources are retrieved by performing a match test between each resource description and the query .', u'This approach becomes inefficient with the increase of available resources .', u'We propose a method for improving the retrieval process by constructing a tree index through a new conceptual clustering method for resources expressed in Web ontology languages .', u'In the index , the available resource descriptions are located at the leaf nodes , while inner nodes represent intensional descriptions ( generalizations ) of their child nodes .', u'The match process is executed by following the tree branches whose nodes satisfy the query .', u'Query answering time may be strongly improved as the steps may be O ( \\log n ) .']

sentences: [u'Knowledge engineering is a discipline concerned with constructing and maintaining knowledge bases to store knowledge of various domains and using the knowledge by automated reasoning techniques to solve problems in domains that ordinarily require human logical reasoning .', u'Therefore , the two key issues in knowledge engineering are how to construct and maintain knowledge bases , and how to reason out new knowledge from known knowledge effectively and efficiently .', u'The objective of this paper is the comparison and evaluation of a Deductive Database system ( ConceptBase ) with a Semantic Web reasoning engine ( Racer ) .', u'For each system a knowledge base is implemented in such a way that a fair comparison can be achieved .', u'Issues such as documentation , feasibility , expressiveness , complexity , distribution , performance and scalability are investigated in order to explore the advantages and shortcomings of each system .']

entities: [[(u'uncertainty representation', u'Method')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'# N # Human Language Technologies', u'Method')], [], [], [(u'It', u'Generic')], [(u'taxonomy acquisition', u'Task'), (u'knowledge extraction methods', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'The significance of uncertainty representation has become # N # obvious in the Semantic Web community recently .', u'This paper # N # presents new results of our research on uncertainty # N # incorporation into ontologies created automatically by means of # N # Human Language Technologies .', u"The research is related to OLE # N # ( Ontology LEarning ) \\footnote { The project 's web page can be # N # found at URL : \\url { http : //nlp.fi.muni.cz/projects/ole/ } . }", u'-- a # N # project aimed at bottom-up generation and merging of # N # ontologies .', u'It utilises a proposal of expressive fuzzy # N # knowledge representation framework called { \\sf ANUIC } ( Adaptive # N # Net of Universally Interrelated Concepts ) .', u'We discuss our # N # recent achievements in taxonomy acquisition and show how even # N # simple application of the principles of { \\sf ANUIC } can improve # N # the results of initial knowledge extraction methods .']

entities: [[(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'autoepistemic logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'uniform host formalism', u'Method')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'first-order autoepistemic logic', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'embeddings', u'Method'), (u'dl-programs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'r-hybrid knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'hybrid MKNF knowledge bases', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'FO-AEL', u'Method'), (u'standard-names assumption', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'any- and all-names semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]
relations: [[], [], [(u'rules', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontologies')], [(u'embeddings', u'USED-FOR', u'dl-programs'), (u'dl-programs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'r-hybrid knowledge bases'), (u'r-hybrid knowledge bases', u'CONJUNCTION', u'hybrid MKNF knowledge bases')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The combination of rules and ontologies has a central role in the ongoing development of the Semantic Web .', u'In previous work , autoepistemic logic ( AEL ) was advocated as a uniform host formalism to study different such combinations , enabling comparisons on a common basis .', u'In this paper , we continue this line of research and investigate different embeddings of major proposals to combine rules and ontologies into first-order autoepistemic logic ( FO-AEL ) .', u'In particular , we present embeddings for dl-programs , r-hybrid knowledge bases , and hybrid MKNF knowledge bases , which are representatives of different combination types .', u'We study the embeddings in the context of FO-AEL under the standard-names assumption , but we also discuss variants using the any- and all-names semantics .', u'Our results provide interesting insights into the properties of the discussed combination formalisms .']

entities: [[(u'Web search engines', u'Method'), (u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'semantics of user keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web space', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'semantic queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge representation language', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'translation task', u'Task'), (u'third-party thesaurus', u'Material'), (u'pre-existing ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Within the emergent Semantic Web framework , the use of traditional Web search engines based on keywords provided by the users is not adequate any more .', u'Instead , new methods based on the semantics of user keywords must be defined to search in the vast Web space without incurring in an undesirable loss of information .', u'In this paper we propose a system that takes as input a list of plain keywords provided by the user and outputs equivalent semantic queries expressed in a knowledge representation language , that could be used to retrieve relevant data .', u'For the translation task , specialized agents manage a third-party thesaurus and a pool of pre-existing ontologies to obtain the different meanings of the user keywords and discover semantic relationships between them in run-time .']

entities: [[(u'Software Engineering domain', u'Material'), (u'knowledge domain', u'Material')], [(u'XML-based format', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge management system', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'Software Engineering', u'Task'), (u'global ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'IEEE Glossary of Software Engineering', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'Method')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'objects semantic repositories', u'Method'), (u'software engineering elearning courses', u'Task'), (u'CMMI certification', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontologies', u'PART-OF', u'Software Engineering domain')], [], [(u'IEEE Glossary of Software Engineering', u'USED-FOR', u'global ontology')], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'objects semantic repositories'), (u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'software engineering elearning courses'), (u'objects semantic repositories', u'USED-FOR', u'software engineering elearning courses')]]
sentences: [u'Ontologies in the Software Engineering domain can improve the acquisition of knowledge in this field by providing a formal representation of this knowledge domain .', u'When encoded in a XML-based format , ontologies can therefore be easily processed by a knowledge management system , an expert system or a browser so it is possible to facilitate the location of Software Engineering resources in repositories or in the Semantic Web .', u'This article presents two ontologies related to the domain of Software Engineering : a global ontology created from the IEEE Glossary of Software Engineering and a specific ontology created to conceptualize the knowledge about CMMI Systems Engineering/Software Engineering ( staged ) specification .', u'These ontologies are now being used in objects semantic repositories for software engineering elearning courses as well as support for application of CMMI certification .']

sentences: [u'To support the sharing and reusing of well-defined knowledge among knowledge management systems , it is useful to use standardised formalisation .', u'It is also common effort to difficulty of knowledge acquisition known as knowledge acquisition bottleneck .', u'In this paper investigates the feasibility of using techniques in case -based reasoning of artificial intelligence for the knowledge acquisition phase in knowledge management systems .', u'The need of an ontological approach of the semantic web for well-defined set of domain knowledge is proposed in order to avoid knowledge acquisition bottleneck .', u'Our viewpoint of this approach is that the ontology-driven mechanism allows us to provide standardised structured vocabularies and conceptualisation of knowledge domain .', u'Over the standardised platform , we see an alternative to share and reuse homogenous information and knowledge in the knowledge management systems .']

sentences: [u'The Chinese government has devoted to e-Government development for decades .', u'Digital archives have been built up in almost every level of Chinese government hierarchy .', u'The structure features of the archives in Chinese government are discussed first in this paper .', u'Then , it proposes a practical approach for text mining of these semi-structured archives .', u'With the help of Semantic Web related technology , knowledge extracted through mining can be stored and managed in ontology base for administrators , and can be retrieved through ontology presentation system for end-users .', u'Finally , a case study in a provincial archives bureau of China is introduced , which shows that knowledge among the archives especially dynamic knowledge can be easily mined and utilized in this way .', u'It helps a lot in policy making , emergency decision support , and government routines .']

sentences: [u'Software architecting is a highly knowledge-intensive process demanding and producing a large and rich amount of information .', u'To remain competitive , companies and organizations working in the IT sector must be able to manage this knowledge portfolio and effectively exploit and reuse it .', u'In the era of Web 2.0 , knowledge grids , social networking , global development and semantic Web , this working session addresses the problem of building a knowledge community in the field of software architecture .', u'To this end , we aim at exploring the wishes of academics and industrial organizations , on the one hand , and their boundaries on he other .', u'Our goal is to compare and contrast the inputs from academia and industry , and gain a shared understanding about what can be done now , and in the near future .']

relations: [[(u'minimal knowledge', u'CONJUNCTION', u'negation'), (u'minimal knowledge', u'CONJUNCTION', u'failure MKNF'), (u'open and closed world reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'three-valued framework', u'USED-FOR', u'extension'), (u'alternating fixpoint', u'USED-FOR', u'extension'), (u'alternating fixpoint', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'three-valued framework'), (u'well-founded MKNF model', u'USED-FOR', u'extension'), (u'well-founded MKNF model', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'three-valued framework')], [(u'logic programming', u'USED-FOR', u'semantics')], [(u'MKNF model', u'COMPARE', u'three-valued ) MKNF models')], []]
sentences: [u'Recently , the logics of minimal knowledge and negation as failure MKNF [ 12 ] was used to introduce hybrid MKNF knowledge bases [ 14 ] , a powerful formalism for combining open and closed world reasoning for the Semantic Web .', u'We present an extension based on a new three-valued framework including an alternating fixpoint , the well-founded MKNF model .', u'This approach , the well-founded MKNF semantics , derives its name from the very close relation to the corresponding semantics known from logic programming .', u'We show that the well-founded MKNF model is the least model among all ( three-valued ) MKNF models , thus soundly approximating also the two-valued MKNF models from [ 14 ] .', u'Furthermore , its computation yields better complexity results ( up to polynomial ) than the original semantics where models usually have to be guessed .']

sentences: [u"Many web search engines retrieve enormous amounts of irrelevant information in answer to users ' queries .", u'The semantic web provides a promising approach to improve search operation .', u'For specific domains , ontologies can capture concepts to help machines deal with data semantically .', u'Our aim in writing this paper was to show how to measure the closeness ( relevancy ) of retrieved web sites to user query-concepts and re-rank them accordingly .', u'We therefore proposed a new relevancy measure to re-rank retrieved documents .', u"We termed the approach `` ontology concepts '' and it on the domain of electronic commerce .", u'Results suggested that we could re-rank the retrieved documents ( web sites ) according to their relevancy to the search query .', u"Our method depends on the frequency of the `` ontology concepts '' in the retrieved documents and uses this to compute their relevancy ."]

sentences: [u'One of the most challenging problems in the semantic web field consists of computing the semantic similarity between different terms .', u'The problem here is the lack of accurate domain-specific dictionaries , such as biomedical , financial or any other particular and dynamic field .', u'In this article we propose a new approach which uses different existing semantic similarity methods to obtain precise results in the biomedical domain .', u'Specifically , we have developed an evolutionary algorithm which uses information provided by different semantic similarity metrics .', u'Our results have been validated against a variety of biomedical datasets and different collections of similarity functions .', u'The proposed system provides very high quality results when compared against similarity ratings provided by human experts ( in terms of Pearson correlation coefficient ) surpassing the results of other relevant works previously published in the literature .']

sentences: [u'According to World Health Organization , coronary artery diseases are responsible for 17 % of the death in the world .', u'Diagnosing the disease in the right time could lower the danger that it may cause .', u'This paper presents an expert system ( CardioOWL ) that has the ability to diagnose any kind of coronary artery diseases .', u'CardioOWL supplies the expert with the diagnosing strategies that could be used and suggests the drugs and/or other required operations to be taken .', u"CardioOWL depends on ontology knowledge about the patient 's symptoms to build the knowledge base and then it utilizes Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) to deduce the suitable medicine and the required operation for the patient .", u'The system was tested by some general practitioners using several test cases .', u'The system proves to have very good precession and recall .']

sentences: [u'This paper explores the relationship between organizational culture , ontologies and the success of green IT initiatives .', u'It investigates the impact of organizational culture on the degree of adoption of Green IT initiatives and on their success .', u'The nature of culture within IT is explored and the effect of culture on the sustainable use of IT is analyzed .', u'The paper presents ontological dimensions from a philosophical perspective by outlining the origins of ontologies .', u'The ontological analysis is also investigated from a computing perspective with respect to semantic web concepts .', u'The relationship between Culture and Green ICT ontologies is explored .', u'It is argued that green IT systems should be designed with an ontology that incorporates cultural issues .', u'The final section of the paper presents concluding remarks and identifies areas of future work .']

sentences: [u'Built specifically for the Semantic Web , triple stores are required to accommodate a large number of RDF triples and remain primarily centralized .', u'As triple stores grow and evolve with time , there is a demanding need for scalable techniques to remove resource and performance bottlenecks in such systems .', u'To this end , we propose a fully decentralized peer-to-peer architecture for large scale triple stores in which triples are maintained by individual stakeholders , and a semantics-directed search protocol , mediated by topology reorganization , for locating triples of interest .', u'We test our design through simulations and the results show anticipated improvements over existing techniques for distributed triple stores .', u'In addition to engineering future large scale triple stores , our work will in particular benefit the federation of stand-alone triple stores of today to achieve desired scalability .']

sentences: [u"The FOAF ontology has become a core model for describing social data of people and their links on the Web , and the people ranking is growing in popularity since search engines are considering the author 's reputation of a Web page when generating search results .", u'FOAF alone is yet insufficient to model social networks for ranking people on the Web .', u'We concentrate here in co-authorship networks as a special case of social networks , and propose a model which extends FOAF with Page Rank and Author Rank metrics , both implemented in Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) , for gauging the reputation of authors .', u'Preliminary results are demonstrated , showcasing also the huge potential of this ranking approach for adopting it on social networks in general , and by search engines in particular where our future work will focus .']

sentences: [u'This site is an encyclopedia [ 2 ] for topics related to the sciences of embryology [ 3 ] , development , and reproductive medicine , their legal , ethical and social contexts , and histories of those sciences and contexts .', u'We have pictures , descriptive articles , interpretive essays , and other objects and further information .', u'The site is Open Access ( OA ) , so you can use it for free following the copyright and Creative Commons licensing agreements .', u'It grows , so you can find new contents regularly .', u'The contents receive rigorous peer , professional , and editorial review , so the content is trustworthy .', u'In addition , this site has several tools to help you navigate its contents , from the topmost toolbar that groups things according to their topics and types , to semantic web visualizations and exhibits .', u'The Embryo Project Encyclopedia has been online since 2007 .']

sentences: [u'Data warehouses use a multidimensional model .', u'Based on this model , OLAP cubes enable users to analyze data .', u'For correct OLAP analysis , multidimensional models should be checked .', u'In particular , these models should ensure summarizability .', u'Checking multidimensional models and their summarizability is complex and error-prone .', u'To perform this task , formal reasoning is appropriate .', u'In this paper , we propose and illustrate an approach to represent a multidimensional model as an OWL-DL ontology , and reason on this ontology to check the multidimensional model and its summarizability .', u'Beyond the reasoning capabilities of description logic , representing multidimensional models as OWL-DL ontologies is a means to move multidimensional modeling to the semantic Web .', u'To illustrate this , we investigate the complementarities between our approach and the RDF Data Cube vocabulary , and suggest how they could be combined .']

sentences: [u'Pavan Kapanipathi is a final year PhD candidate at Kno.e.sis Center , Wright State University , Dayton , Ohio .', u'He will soon join IBM TJ Watson Research Center as a Research Staff Member .', u'His PhD dissertation is focused on harnessing knowledge bases for addressing Big Data challenges on social media .', u'He has published his research at top conferences in his areas of expertise such as ISWC , and ESWC .', u'On the basis of his research , he has given invited talks at institutions such as IBM TJ Watson Research Center and EMC , CTO Office , Bangalore .', u'He was part of the team that developed a Tweet filtering system Twarql that won a LOD Triplification challenge , which was organized at I-Semantics 2010 , a prominent venue for the Semantic Web community .', u'For more information see http : //www.knoesis.org/researchers/pavan']

relations: [[(u'automatic method', u'USED-FOR', u'relational database'), (u'automatic method', u'USED-FOR', u'positive semantic queries'), (u'SQL triggers', u'USED-FOR', u'automatic method'), (u'SQL triggers', u'CONJUNCTION', u'foreign-keys'), (u'positive semantic queries', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web ontology')], [], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'integrity constraints')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'We propose an automatic method for modeling a relational database that uses SQL triggers and foreign-keys to efficiently answer positive semantic queries about ground instances for a Semantic Web ontology .', u'In contrast with existing knowledge-based approaches , we expend additional space in the database to reduce reasoning at query time .', u'This implementation significantly improves query response time by allowing the system to disregard integrity constraints and other kinds of inferences at run-time .', u'The surprising result of our approach is that load-time appears unaffected , even for medium-sized ontologies .', u'We applied our methodology to the study of brain electroencephalographic ( EEG and ERP ) data .', u'This case study demonstrates how our methodology can be used to proactively drive the design , storage and exchange of knowledge based on EEG/ERP ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'Federated simulations', u'Method'), (u'interoperability', u'Metric')], [(u'federated simulation', u'Method'), (u'composable simulations', u'Task'), (u'technical interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'federated simulation infrastructures', u'Method'), (u'substantive interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Emergent web services technologies', u'Method')], [(u'XMSF )', u'Method'), (u'generation modeling and simulation applications', u'Task')], [(u'multimodel and multisimulation formalisms', u'Method'), (u'semantic web and agent technologies', u'Method'), (u'runtime model discovery', u'Task'), (u'instantiation', u'Task'), (u'composition', u'Task'), (u'interoperation', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Federated simulations address the need for interoperability , as well as the improvement of reuse and composability .', u'The focal goal in a federated simulation is to facilitate composable simulations by standardizing interfaces to assure technical interoperability among disparate simulations .', u'Yet , existing federated simulation infrastructures neither facilitate substantive interoperability nor are dynamically extensible .', u'Emergent web services technologies hold out the potential to significantly improve the development of interoperable , extensible , and dynamically composable federations .', u'As such , recent initiatives ( i.e. , XMSF ) are urging the use of open standards that can be applied within an extensible framework for next generation modeling and simulation applications .', u'We discuss how the realization of multimodel and multisimulation formalisms in terms of semantic web and agent technologies may bring new vistas to demonstrate runtime model discovery , instantiation , composition , and interoperation .']

sentences: [u'Semantic Web provides huge potential and opportunities for developing the next generation of e-learning systems .', u'Although ontologies have a set of basic implicit reasoning mechanisms derived from the description logic , they need rules to make further inferences and to express relations that can not be represented by ontological reasoning .', u'We implemented an adaptive and intelligent web-based PRogramming TUtoring System -- - Protus .', u'One of the most important features of Protus is the adaptation of the presentation and navigation of a course material based on particular learner knowledge .', u"This system aims at automatically guiding the learner 's activities and recommend relevant actions during the learning process .", u'This paper describes the functionality , structure and implementation of a learner model used in Protus as well as syntax of SWRL rules implemented for on-the-fly update of learner model ontology .']

sentences: [u'The oreChem project is a collaboration between chemistry scholars and information scientists to develop and deploy the infrastructure , services , and applications to enable new models for research and dissemination of scholarly materials in the chemistry community .', u'Although the focus of the project is chemistry , the work is being undertaken with an attention to general cyber infrastructure for eScience , thereby enabling the linkages among disciplines that are required to solve todays key scientific challenges such as global warming .', u'A key aspect of this work , and a core aim of this project , is the design and implementation of an interoperability infrastructure based on semantic Web principles that will allow chemistry scholars to share , reuse , manipulate , and enhance data that are located in repositories , databases , and Web services distributed across the network .']

sentences: [u'Abstract Large scale process simulation is used in industry for e.g .', u'process and automation design , automation testing , safety analyses and for operator training and support purposes .', u'In modern computing environments very large dynamic process models of an entire plant can be calculated in real time or even faster than real time .', u'However current process simulation environments are separate tools that rarely have links to the other information management tools of a plant delivery project .', u'In this paper we present an approach where semantic modelling techniques ( semantic web ) are used within an ontology definition environment .', u'In this environment different plant modelling and simulation ontologies can be mapped and used together without compromising computational speed and scalability .', u'Ontology of one simulation solver type , namely companion model solver , is discussed as an example .']

entities: [[(u'Question Answering systems', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'Dialogue Manager', u'Method')], [(u'Dialogue Manager', u'Method'), (u'structure of the discourse', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user intentions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'question answering systems', u'Method')], []]
sentences: [u'Question Answering systems that resort to the Semantic Web as a knowledge base can go well beyond the usual matching words in documents and , preferably , find a precise answer , without requiring user help to interpret the documents returned .', u'In this paper , the authors introduce a Dialogue Manager that , through the analysis of the question and the type of expected answer , provides accurate answers to the questions posed in Natural Language .', u'The Dialogue Manager not only represents the semantics of the questions , but also represents the structure of the discourse , including the user intentions and the questions context , adding the ability to deal with multiple answers and providing justified answers .', u"The authors ' system performance is evaluated by comparing with similar question answering systems .", u'Although the test suite is slight dimension , the results obtained are very promising .']

relations: [[(u'decisionsupport system', u'USED-FOR', u'archetype-based medical records'), (u'ArchetypeQuery Language', u'USED-FOR', u'decisionsupport system'), (u'ArchetypeQuery Language', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web Rule Language'), (u'Semantic Web Rule Language', u'USED-FOR', u'decisionsupport system'), (u'SWRL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'logic language')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'By using archetypes , it is possible to define how data are stored in the EHR , which facilitates querying for data.The objective of this thesis is to investigate the possibility of connecting a decisionsupport system to archetype-based medical records by using the ArchetypeQuery Language ( AQL ) and the Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) .The result shows that , since SWRL is a logic language rather than a programminglanguage , built-ins are necessary to allow SWRL rules to function as programmingrules .', u'Built-ins are SWRL modules that can be written in e.g .', u'Java , which allows complex functions to be created.The conclusion is that built-ins can be used to connect archetypes and SWRLrules by querying the archetype path with AQL .', u'There are however several ruledesign factors to consider when using SWRL e.g .', u'data location problems .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'background knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'relation discovery')], [], []]
sentences: [u'One of the current bottlenecks for automating ontology evolution is resolving the right links between newly arising information and the existing knowledge in the ontology .', u'Most of existing approaches mainly rely on the user when it comes to capturing and representing new knowledge .', u'Our ontology evolution framework intends to reduce or even eliminate user input through the use of background knowledge .', u'In this paper , we show how various sources of background knowledge could be exploited for relation discovery .', u'We perform a relation discovery experiment focusing on the use of WordNet and Semantic Web ontologies as sources of background knowledge .', u'We back our experiment with a thorough analysis that highlights various issues on how to improve and validate relation discovery in the future , which will directly improve the task of automatically performing ontology changes during evolution .']

entities: [[(u'personalized services', u'Method'), (u'adaptive information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Push services', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic Web approach', u'Method'), (u'push services', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic association', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user preferences', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'service-specific ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'adaptive information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'description model', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'user preferences', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rich expressiveness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'adaptive information', u'USED-FOR', u'personalized services')], [], [(u'Semantic Web approach', u'USED-FOR', u'push services')], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'user preferences')]]
sentences: [u"Many personalized services that provide users with adaptive information according to users ' preferences have been researched and developed .", u"Push services are especially expected to be more economic impact because push services satisfy user 's potential needs even if the user does not require anything .", u'In this paper , we propose Semantic Web approach in order to enhance the performance of push services .', u'Our approach provides infrastructure to recommend contents based on semantic association by enabling information of contents and user preferences to be described on service-specific ontologies that reflect features of each service .', u'In addition , our approach can recommend users with adaptive information based on information represented in our description model .', u'Our approach enables information of contents and user preferences to be described with rich expressiveness , and it provides semantic interoperability .']

entities: [[(u'Web Service ( WS ) composition', u'Task'), (u'Service Orient Architecture', u'Task')], [(u'user centric paradigm', u'Method'), (u'service composition', u'Method'), (u'user requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'context adaptation feature', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'problems', u'Generic')], [(u'proposal', u'Generic'), (u'dynamic service composition', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'composition engine', u'Method'), (u'WS knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'context adaptation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Virtual WS', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'problems')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Web Service ( WS ) composition has become a key element for the development of Service Orient Architecture ( SOA ) in the Next Generation Network/Next Generation Service ( NGN/NGS ) Context .', u'From the viewpoint of user centric paradigm , existing work has limitation on whether the service composition satisfies the user requirements and has a context adaptation feature .', u'This article presents our approach for solving these problems .', u"Our proposal consists in a two level user centric approach for dynamic service composition , it is based on a composition engine which follows user 's specific needs and which yields a composed service through a WS knowledge base .", u'Users can mash up the services at run time with their own logic and have a fully dynamic composition with context adaptation through Virtual WS , the latter allows also semantic web .']

entities: [[(u'Auto-ID and Web technologies', u'Method'), (u'on-site event support system', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'RFID badges', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'interactive Web-based services', u'Task'), (u'touchscreen terminal', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'offline social networks', u'Method'), (u'online social Web', u'Material')], [(u'Web 2.0 technologies', u'Method'), (u'social , sensor and mobile technologies', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'user survey and usage log data', u'Material'), (u'Extended Semantic Web Conference', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'interactive Web-based services'), (u'touchscreen terminal', u'USED-FOR', u'interactive Web-based services')], [(u'offline social networks', u'CONJUNCTION', u'online social Web')], [(u'conferences', u'CONJUNCTION', u'events')], []]
sentences: [u'We combine Auto-ID and Web technologies in an extensible on-site event support system for enhancing experience of conference organizers as well as participants .', u'Our system enables users to authenticate themselves using RFID badges and to access interactive Web-based services via a touchscreen terminal .', u'The developed services aim at supporting social interactions of participants , and thus validate the promising usage directions of the combination of offline social networks and the online social Web .', u'Technically , we have investigated employment of Web 2.0 technologies in social , sensor and mobile technologies enabled systems at conferences and events .', u'This paper gives an overview of the overall system and its evaluation via a user survey and usage log data collected during the Extended Semantic Web Conference ( ESWC ) 2010 and similar international conferences , altogether with several hundred participants .']

sentences: [u'In the thesis the concept of semantic web has been studied and its advantages , technology and future development trends presented .', u'A prototype of the application a data network browser was made .', u'The browser accepts the ontology , written in the standard RDF language , via SPARQL queries and visualizes the information obtained .', u'It also allows searching and filtering for specific entities and their properties .', u'The visualization is interactive and the displayed graph can be explored further .', u'The implementation of the application is based on the HTML5 markup language and various JavaScript libraries which help with the visualization of graphs and other functionalities .', u'Data for the demonstration of the prototype was obtained from a database generated by the extracting of data from the Business Register of Slovenia ( APLRS ) , the content being enriched further by information from DBpedia .']

entities: [[(u'Customer Service System', u'Method'), (u'Customer Service System', u'Method'), (u'artificial answer system', u'Method'), (u'artificial answer system', u'Method'), (u'automatic answer system', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'Customer Service System', u'Method'), (u'Customer Service System', u'Method'), (u'Customer Service System', u'Method'), (u'Customer Service System', u'Method'), (u'Customer Service System', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'artificial answer system', u'PART-OF', u'Customer Service System')]]
sentences: [u"Customer Service System , as the survival foundation of the enterprise , is very important to enterprise 's development.The current Customer Service System can be simply divided into two classes : artificial answer system and automatic answer sys tem.The artificial answer system is the communication of people and people , and the automatic answer system makes computer can understand customers by the introduction of semantic web , is the interaction of people and computer.This paper reviews the current situation of the development of the Customer Service System , then analyses the importance of Customer Service System , and classifies the current Customer Service System from different angles , and finally points out the research content and possible improvement direction in the future of the Customer Service System based on the insufficiency in research and application of the current Customer Service System ."]

entities: [[(u'Ontology', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'machine readable state', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Task')], [(u'W3C', u'Method'), (u'HTML', u'Material')], [(u'constructing ontology', u'Task')], [(u'module', u'Generic'), (u'HTML documents', u'Material'), (u'HTML tags', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'OWL 2', u'Material')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'structural refinement', u'Method'), (u'ontology skeleton and linguistic approach', u'Method'), (u'skeleton', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'module', u'USED-FOR', u'HTML documents'), (u'it', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL 2')], []]
sentences: [u'Ontology is known to be one of the most important technologies in achieving semantic web .', u'It is critical as it represents the knowledge in a machine readable state .', u'World Wide Web Consortium ( W3C ) has been contributing to the development of ontology for the last several years .', u'However , the recommendation of W3C left out HTML despite the massive amount of information it contains .', u'Also , it is difficult and time consuming to keep up with all the technologies especially in the case of constructing ontology .', u'Thus , we propose a module and methods that reuse HTML documents , extract necessary information from HTML tags and mapping it to OWL 2 .', u'We will be combining two kinds of approaches which will be the structural refinement for making an ontology skeleton and linguistic approach for adding detailed information onto the skeleton .']

entities: [[(u'Triple Space Computing', u'Method'), (u'communication and coordination paradigm', u'Method'), (u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'space-based computing', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'Triple Spaces', u'Method'), (u'sharing of data', u'Task'), (u'dynamic and heterogeneous systems', u'Method')], [(u'information processing tasks', u'Task'), (u'World Wide Web', u'Material')], [(u'Ubiquitous Web', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Triple Space Computing', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'communication and coordination paradigm'), (u'Triple Space Computing', u'USED-FOR', u'Web services'), (u'communication and coordination paradigm', u'USED-FOR', u'Web services'), (u'space-based computing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'Triple Spaces', u'USED-FOR', u'machines'), (u'sharing of data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'coordination of devices and services'), (u'coordination of devices and services', u'USED-FOR', u'dynamic and heterogeneous systems')], [(u'World Wide Web', u'USED-FOR', u'information processing tasks')], []]
sentences: [u'Triple Space Computing is a communication and coordination paradigm for Web services that combines space-based computing and the Semantic Web .', u'Triple Spaces aim at providing a web that is optimized for machines , thus simplifying the sharing of data and the coordination of devices and services in dynamic and heterogeneous systems .', u'The more ubiquitous the Web becomes , the more the information processing tasks have to be performed by services hidden in the World Wide Web .', u"Services will have to coordinate their efforts , understand each other and exchange information over the Ubiquitous Web to allow human users access to the world 's information spaces whenever and wherever they find themselves - or rather , access to the right service for the right person at the right time and at the right place ( and with the right price ) ."]

entities: [[(u'Reasoning', u'Task')], [(u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'approximate reasoning methods', u'Method'), (u'computational property', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'methods', u'Generic')], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic')], [(u'incremental method', u'Method'), (u'instance retrieval', u'Task'), (u'ontology approximation', u'Method'), (u'approximation strategies', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Web', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning')], [], [], [], [(u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'approximation'), (u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning')], [(u'incremental method', u'USED-FOR', u'instance retrieval'), (u'ontology approximation', u'USED-FOR', u'incremental method'), (u'ontology approximation', u'USED-FOR', u'instance retrieval')]]
sentences: [u'Reasoning is computationally expensive .', u'This is especially true for reasoning on the Web , where data sets are very large and often described by complex terminologies .', u'One way to reduce this complexity is through the use of approximate reasoning methods which trade one computational property ( eg .', u'quality of answers ) for others , such as time and memory .', u'Previous research into approximation on the Semantic Web has been rather ad-hoc , and we propose a framework for systematically studying such methods .', u'We developed a workbench which allows the structured combination of different algorithms for approximation , reasoning and measuring in one single framework .', u'As a case-study we investigate an incremental method for instance retrieval through ontology approximation , and we use our workbench to study the computational behaviour of several approximation strategies .']

entities: [[(u'prototype software tool suite', u'Method'), (u'semantic information integration', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'local metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontological format', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic query facility', u'Method'), (u'data sources', u'Material'), (u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'GUI', u'Method'), (u'mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'local metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'system reliability', u'Metric'), (u'query execution', u'Task')], [(u'tool suite', u'Generic'), (u'W3C Semantic Web specifications', u'Method'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'Commercial EII products', u'Method'), (u'low level query processing', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'prototype software tool suite', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic information integration')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'local metadata')], [], [(u'it', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic query facility')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'mappings'), (u'local metadata', u'CONJUNCTION', u'domain ontology')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'system reliability'), (u'query execution', u'USED-FOR', u'system reliability')], [(u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'W3C Semantic Web specifications'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'W3C Semantic Web specifications')], [(u'Commercial EII products', u'USED-FOR', u'low level query processing')]]
sentences: [u'We describe a prototype software tool suite for semantic information integration ; it has the following features .', u'First , it can import local metadata as well as a domain ontology .', u'Imported metadata is stored persistently in an ontological format .', u'Second , it provides a semantic query facility that allows users to retrieve information across multiple data sources using the domain ontology directly .', u'Third , it has a GUI for users to define mappings between the local metadata and the domain ontology .', u'Fourth , it incorporates a novel mechanism to improve system reliability by dynamically adapting query execution upon detecting various types of environmental changes .', u'In addition , this tool suite is compatible with W3C Semantic Web specifications such as RDF and OWL .', u'It also uses the query engine of Commercial EII products for low level query processing .']

entities: [[(u'XML-based access control languages', u'Method'), (u'XACML', u'Method'), (u'network resources', u'Material')], [(u'semantic-Web style metadata', u'Material'), (u'access control policies', u'Task'), (u'XACML policies', u'Method'), (u'ontology-based resource and subject descriptions', u'Task'), (u'P3P base data schema', u'Method')], [(u'XACML conditions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology-based models representing semantics', u'Method')], [(u'expansion technique', u'Method'), (u'online reasoning', u'Method'), (u'consistent rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'redundant attributes', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'In the last few years XML-based access control languages like XACML have been increasingly used for specifying complex policies regulating access to network resources .', u'Today , growing interest in semantic-Web style metadata for describing resources and users is stimulating research on how to express access control policies based on advanced descriptions rather than on single attributes. # R # # N # # R # # N # In this paper , we discuss how standard XACML policies can handle ontology-based resource and subject descriptions based on the standard P3P base data schema .', u'We show that XACML conditions can be transparently expanded according to ontology-based models representing semantics .', u"Our expansion technique greatly reduces the need for online reasoning and decreases the system administrator 's effort for producing consistent rules when users ' descriptions comprise multiple credentials with redundant attributes ."]

sentences: [u'Rapid growth of information has made information access inherently difficult .', u'Semantic Web , with the help of formal Ontologies , has provided an efficient way to represent data which makes it easy to find and organize by creating a mesh of information linked up in machine process-able way .', u'The formal query languages ( SPARQL ) can exploit the semantics in information access ; however formal languages are complex for naive users .', u"On the other hand , keyword search ca n't benefit from semantics of information .", u'In this paper we present a query interface that performs semantic manipulation of non- semantic natural language-based queries .', u'The proposed query interface semantically manipulates the user query to generate RDF triples to be queried using SPARQL .', u'Proposed system provides the richness of semantics of formal query languages while maintaining query simplicity .']

entities: [[(u'Text document clustering', u'Method'), (u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'digital library environments', u'Task')], [(u'Ontology', u'Material'), (u'knowledge management', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'Peer-to-Peer ( P2P ) systems', u'Method'), (u'shared access', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'network', u'Generic')], [(u'modularity', u'Metric'), (u'flexibility', u'Metric'), (u'scalability', u'Metric'), (u'distributed P2P', u'Material'), (u'semantic enhanced hierarchical P2P', u'Method')], [(u'semantic analysis mechanism', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy document clustering scheme', u'Method'), (u'P2P distributed network', u'Method'), (u'clustering', u'Method'), (u'clustering methods', u'Method')], [(u'newsgroup data sets', u'Material')], [(u'clustering', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy concept', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic distributed P2P proposed techniques', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Text document clustering is the technique used to group documents with reference to their similarity in digital library environments .', u'Ontology is playing an increasingly important role in knowledge management and the semantic web .', u'Peer-to-Peer ( P2P ) systems provide shared access to resources that are spread over the network .', u'To address the problem of modularity , flexibility and scalability in distributed P2P , semantic enhanced hierarchical P2P is determined to be better .', u'In this paper , the semantic analysis mechanism is enhanced with a fuzzy document clustering scheme in a P2P distributed network , which has a capability of providing better clustering results than other clustering methods .', u'Our experiments are conducted on 20 newsgroup data sets .', u'The evaluation result indicates better clustering results by using the fuzzy concept with semantic distributed P2P proposed techniques .']

entities: [[(u'personalization techniques', u'Method'), (u'knowledge representation paradigms', u'Method'), (u'ontologybased approach', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web eld', u'Material'), (u'task', u'Generic')], [(u'Personalization', u'Task'), (u'multimedia content', u'Material'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'contextualization', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'personalization', u'Task'), (u'multimedia environment', u'Task')], [(u'contextual knowledge modeling scheme', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'user interests', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user activities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'interactive retrieval process', u'Task')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'user scenarios', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'multimedia content', u'CONJUNCTION', u'information retrieval')], [], [(u'user activities', u'FEATURE-OF', u'user interests')], [], [(u'user scenarios', u'USED-FOR', u'methodology')]]
sentences: [u'Combining traditional personalization techniques with novel knowledge representation paradigms , such as the ontologybased approach proposed in the Semantic Web eld , is a challenging task .', u'Personalization is a difcult problem when dealing with multimedia content and information retrieval , where context is increasingly acknowledged to be a key notion in order to make proper sense of user needs .', u'This work focuses on contextualization within personalization in a multimedia environment .', u'Towards that scope , we propose a novel contextual knowledge modeling scheme , and an approach for the dynamic , contextual activation of semantic user preferences to better represent user interests in coherence with ongoing user activities , e.g .', u'in an interactive retrieval process .', u'The application of this methodology is demonstrated using two user scenarios , and the performance results of a preliminary experiment are shown .']

entities: [[(u'Knowledge Organization', u'Task')], [(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'plain terminological approaches', u'Method')], [(u'ISKO', u'Method')], [(u'Knowledge Organization', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web 3.0', u'Method'), (u'Knowledge Organization systems', u'Method'), (u'shared metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formalized ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic approaches', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'user driven systems', u'Method'), (u'logical descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'specialized evaluation', u'Task'), (u'self-organizing principles', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Semantic Web 3.0', u'USED-FOR', u'Knowledge Organization systems'), (u'shared metadata', u'USED-FOR', u'Knowledge Organization systems'), (u'shared metadata', u'CONJUNCTION', u'formalized ontologies'), (u'formalized ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'Knowledge Organization systems')], [(u'semantic approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'user driven systems'), (u'approach', u'COMPARE', u'semantic approaches'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'user driven systems')], []]
sentences: [u'Traditionally Knowledge Organization is the ordering of documents on a bookshelf and the indexing of these in a more or less one-dimensional catalog .', u'Now with the Web , its many and hyperlinked , distributed and heterogeneous sources the plain terminological approaches are no longer sufficient .', u'Given this , ISKO has to rethink its mission .', u'The new Knowledge Organization , which aims at the Semantic Web 3.0 tries to combine different Knowledge Organization systems by shared metadata and formalized ontologies .', u"While the semantic approaches have quite an opposite approach to the user driven systems the future might lay in a combination of logical descriptions , specialized evaluation , and self-organizing principles , what could be named `` Self Organizing Knowledge Organization Systems '' .", u'There are open questions which need to be solved in future by ISKO and similar organizations .']

relations: [[(u'rule-based systems', u'CONJUNCTION', u'intelligent agents')], [(u'rule acquisition', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'rule-based systems')], [], [(u'XRML', u'USED-FOR', u'identification of rules')], [], [], [(u'ontology OntoRule', u'USED-FOR', u'automated rule identification')], [(u'OntoRule', u'USED-FOR', u'rule identification')], []]
sentences: [u'As research on the Semantic Web actively progresses , a more intelligent Web environment is expected in various domains including rule-based systems and intelligent agents .', u'However , rule acquisition is still a bottleneck in the utilization of rule-based systems .', u'To extract rules from Web pages , the framework of eXtensible Rule Markup Language ( XRML ) has been developed .', u'XRML allows the identification of rules from Web pages and generates rules automatically .', u"However , the knowledge engineer 's burden is still high because rule identification requires considerable manual work .", u"In order to reduce the knowledge engineer 's burden , we proposed an ontology-based methodology of enhanced rule identification .", u'First , we have designed an ontology OntoRule for automated rule identification .', u'Also , we proposed a procedure of rule identification using OntoRule .', u'Lastly , we showed the performance of our approach with an experiment .']

entities: [[(u'Named Entity Recognition systems', u'Method'), (u'pharmacological domain', u'Material'), (u'pharmacological treatment prescription', u'Task'), (u'official databases', u'Material')], [(u'resour- ces', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'and/or enhance lexicons', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Named Entity Recognition systems', u'Method')], [(u'pharmacological domain', u'Material')], [(u'synonyms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'variations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'historical information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'official databases', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'resour- ces'), (u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web 2.0'), (u'Named Entity Recognition systems', u'USED-FOR', u'and/or enhance lexicons')], [], [(u'synonyms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'variations'), (u'variations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'historical information')]]
sentences: [u'Nowadays Named Entity Recognition systems in the pharmacological domain , which are needed to help healthcare professional during pharmacological treatment prescription , suffer limitations related to the lack of coverage in official databases .', u'Therefore , it seems necessary to analyse the reliability of existing resour- ces , both in the Semantic Web and Web 2.0 , and determine whether it is feasible or not to use these resources for additional information to generate and/or enhance lexicons used by Named Entity Recognition systems .', u'For this reason , this paper analyses the main sources of information related to the pharmacological domain available on the Internet .', u'This analysis leads to the conclusion that there is reliable information and it would enhance existing lexicons with synonyms , variations and even historical information not collected or maintained in official databases .']

sentences: [u'As increasing linked datasets are progressively published on the Semantic Web , discovering the most similar entities in large linked datasets becomes crucial in many semantic applications .', u'Conventional approaches usually draw upon either ontology taxonomy or relationships unilaterally .', u'In this paper , we present a novel approach which utilizes node and link types together with the topology of semantic graph to derive a similarity graph from linked datasets .', u'Firstly , semantic similarity transition is proposed to calculate the similarity between two resources .', u'Furthermore , a system is developed to derive and visualize the similarity graph based on the calculated similarity .', u'We apply this approach to a real-world linked dataset generated in healthcare domain and the evaluation result shows that our method yields a satisfying result in a use case of clinical decision-making .']

relations: [[(u'MyCampus', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web environment'), (u'Semantic Web environment', u'USED-FOR', u'context-aware mobile services')], [], [(u'calendar', u'CONJUNCTION', u'location tracking functionality'), (u'location tracking functionality', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web services')], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'personal resources'), (u'personal resources', u'CONJUNCTION', u'contextual attributes'), (u'contextual attributes', u'CONJUNCTION', u'user preferences'), (u'contextual attributes', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web services'), (u'user preferences', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web services')], [(u'Contextual information', u'CONJUNCTION', u'personal details')]]
sentences: [u"In this paper , we introduce MyCampus , a Semantic Web environment for context-aware mobile services , which we are in the process of developing and validating on Carnegie Mellon University 's campus .", u'The environment revolves around a growing collection of customizable agents capable of ( semi- ) automatically discovering and accessing user personal resources ( e.g .', u'calendar , location tracking functionality , food preferences ) and Web services as they assist their users in carrying out different tasks such as planning an evening out , organizing a study group or filtering incoming messages .', u'The openness of the MyCampus architecture directly derives from a set of ontologies for describing personal resources , contextual attributes , user preferences and web services .', u'Contextual information and other personal details about a user are accessed via a Semantic e-Wallet , subject to access privileges set by the user .']

entities: [[(u'semantic network mechanisms', u'Method')], [(u'networked ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'ontology network', u'Method'), (u'Linear Temporal Logics', u'Method')], [(u'logics', u'Generic')], [(u'semantic networks of ontologies', u'Task'), (u'alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'formalisation', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'LTL operators', u'Method'), (u'incoherent mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'incoherent mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic network of ontologies', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Linear Temporal Logics', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology network')], [], [], [(u'ontologies', u'PART-OF', u'semantic web')], [(u'incoherent mappings', u'PART-OF', u'semantic network of ontologies')]]
sentences: [u'In this study , we exploit the semantic network mechanisms to deal with the alignment of a set of ontologies .', u'We formally define the interoperability among the networked ontologies and we show how they can be modelled as an ontology network with the Linear Temporal Logics ( LTLs ) .', u'These logics consist of expressing properties over a single sequence of states .', u'This view is suitable for the reasoning of semantic networks of ontologies where we assume a sequence of alignments .', u'The formalisation enables to handle the potential incoherencies caused by aligning different ontologies in the semantic web .', u'In our case , LTL operators play an important role , specially , in the process of debugging the set of incoherent mappings and providing relevant definitions for repairing these incoherent mappings in the semantic network of ontologies .']

sentences: [u'rdquoThe increasing Web service in spatial information domain , demands us to discovery service precisely and efficiently .', u"However traditional Web service discovery provides keywords based search method , which would lead to rough search results , ca n't satisfy our request .", u'Besides Web services lack of semantic description , unable to be interpreted by computers , it is difficult to realize services automatically selected and dynamically assembled .', u'This paper introduces semantic web to spatial information services and embeds OWL-S in UDDI , applying semantic description in Web services discovery .', u'Authors introduce semantic description and publishing mechanism of Web service based on OWL-S and UDDI , propose a algorithm of semantic similar degree based semantic distance , discuss services matching algorithm between request and advertisement based ontology similar degree , designs a preliminary spatial information Web service discovery system framework .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology views', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'localized customization', u'Method'), (u'ontology views', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formalism', u'Method'), (u'ontology views', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology view formalism', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'methodology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'formalism')]]
sentences: [u'Ontologies are the foundation of the Semantic Web ( SW ) and one of the keys necessary to its success Conversely , ontology views hold the promise of ; ( a ) provide a manageable portion of a larger ontology for the localized applications and users , ( b ) enable precise extraction of sub-onlogies of a larger ontology that commits to the main ontology , ( c ) enable localized customization and usage of the portion of a larger ontology and ( d ) enable interoperability between large ontology bases and applications Therefore , it is interesting to look at ontology views and their desired properties , as there exists no agreed upon standard , methodology or formalism to specify , define and materialize ontology views Thus , in this paper , we elaborate on our own research direction towards proposing a meaningful ontology view formalism and its associated semantics .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'RDF access authorization model', u'Method'), (u'ontology hierarchy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF triple pattern', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'authorization model', u'Method'), (u'RDF query validation', u'Task'), (u'approved access authorizations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'subscribed SPARQL or RQL query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF triple patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF triple pattern', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'query validation process', u'Method'), (u'RDF subsumption inference', u'Method'), (u'query validation algorithm', u'Method'), (u'conflict conditions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Dewey graph labeling technique', u'Method')], [(u'validation algorithm', u'Method'), (u'validation time', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'As an effort to secure Semantic Web , in this paper , we introduce an RDF access authorization model based on an ontology hierarchy and an RDF triple pattern .', u'In addition , we apply the authorization model to RDF query validation for approved access authorizations .', u'A subscribed SPARQL or RQL query , which has RDF triple patterns , can be denied or granted according to the corresponding access authorizations which have an RDF triple pattern .', u'In order to efficiently perform the query validation process , we first analyze some primary authorization conflict conditions under RDF subsumption inference , and then we introduce an efficient query validation algorithm using the conflict conditions and Dewey graph labeling technique .', u'Through experiments , we also show that the proposed validation algorithm provides a reasonable validation time and when data and authorizations increase it has scalability .']

sentences: [u'Object Oriented ( OO ) programming is dominant in the current software development .', u'Starting from the design of OO models for applications , developers also expect to address issues on the data of models and the semantics of models .', u'Objects , being the data of models , could be stored in relational databases , and ontologies appear as a good candidate for capturing the semantics of models .', u'This poster presents a method and system which elegantly generates relational schema , OWL ontology , and semantic mapping between them , for any given OO model .', u"The resulting relational schema serves for storing objects that are defined in the input OO model , the resulting OWL ontology is assured by a semantically `` close '' model transformation , and the generated automation mapping between them enables relational persistence and Semantic Web style access simultaneously for objects ."]
