sentences: [u'Distributed RDF data management systems become increasingly important with the growth of the Semantic Web .', u'Currently , several such systems have been proposed , however , their indexing methods meet performance bottlenecks either on data loading or querying when processing large amounts of data .', u'In this work , we propose a high throughout index to enable rapid analysis of large datasets .', u'We adopt a hybrid structure to combine the loading speed of similar-size based methods with the execution speed of graph-based approaches , using dynamic data repartitioning over query workloads .', u'We introduce the design and detailed implementation of our method .', u'Experimental results show that the proposed index can indeed vastly improve loading speeds while remaining competitive in terms of performance .', u'Therefore , the method could be considered as a good choice for RDF analysis in large-scale distributed scenarios .']

entities: [[(u'SKELETOME', u'Method'), (u'community-driven knowledge curation platform', u'Method'), (u'skeletal dysplasia domain', u'Material')], [(u'SKELETOME', u'Method'), (u'ontologydriven knowledge engineering cycle', u'Method'), (u'continuous evolution of the domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'collaborative diagnosis process', u'Method'), (u'well-structured case studies', u'Material')], [(u'platform', u'Generic')], [(u'SKELETOME', u'Method'), (u'Drupal 7', u'Method'), (u'embedded Semantic Web components', u'Method'), (u'modules', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'In this paper we report on our on-going efforts in building SKELETOME - a community-driven knowledge curation platform for the skeletal dysplasia domain .', u'SKELETOME introduces an ontologydriven knowledge engineering cycle that supports the continuous evolution of the domain knowledge .', u'Newly submitted , undiagnosed patient cases undergo a collaborative diagnosis process that transforms them into well-structured case studies , classified , linked and discoverable based on their likely diagnosis ( es ) .', u'The paper presents the community requirements driving the design of the platform , the underlying implementation details and the results of a preliminary usability study .', u'Because SKELETOME is built on Drupal 7 , we discuss the limitations of some of its embedded Semantic Web components and describe a set of new modules , developed to handle these limitations ( which will soon be released as open source to the community ) .']

sentences: [u'Semantic Web ( SW ) technology aims to facilitate the integration of legacy data sources spread worldwide .', u'Despite the plethora of SW languages ( e.g. , RDF/S , DAML+OIL , OWL ) recently proposed for supporting large scale information interoperation , the vast majority of legacy sources still rely on relational databases ( RDB ) published on the Web or corporate intranets as virtual XML .', u'In this paper , we advocate a Datalog framework for mediating high-level queries to relational and/or XML sources using community ontologies expressed in a SW language such as RDF/S .', u'We describe the architecture and the reasoning services of our SW integration middleware , called SWIM , and we present the main design choices and techniques for supporting powerful mappings between different data models , as well as , reformulation and optimization of queries expressed against mediation schemas and views .']

sentences: [u'An important aspect of the semantic web is that systems have an understanding of the content and context of text , images , sounds and videos .', u'Although research in these fields has progressed over the last years , there is still a semantic gap between data available of multimedia and metadata annotated by humans describing the content .', u'This research investigates how the complete interpretation space of humans about the content and context of this data can be captured .', u'The methodology consists of using open-ended crowdsourcing tasks that optimize the capturing of multiple interpretations combined with disagreement based metrics for evaluation of the results .', u'These descriptions can be used meaningfully to improve information retrieval and recommendation of multimedia , to train and evaluate machine learning components and the training and assessment of experts .']

entities: [[(u'personal digital collections', u'Material')], [(u'tools', u'Generic'), (u'manual spatial and content annotation', u'Task')], [(u'mobile devices', u'Method')], [(u'mobile and location-based system', u'Method'), (u'PhotoMap', u'Method'), (u'automatic annotation', u'Task'), (u'spatiotemporal visualization of photo collections', u'Task')], [(u'PhotoMap', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'visualization', u'Task'), (u'retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'PhotoMap application', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'mobile and location-based system', u'USED-FOR', u'automatic annotation'), (u'PhotoMap', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'mobile and location-based system')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'PhotoMap'), (u'visualization', u'CONJUNCTION', u'retrieval')], []]
sentences: [u'The amount of photos in personal digital collections has grown rapidly making their management and retrieval a complicated task .', u'In addition , existing tools performing manual spatial and content annotation are still time consuming for the users .', u'To annotate automatically these photos using mobile devices is the emerging solution to decrease the lack of the description in photo files .', u'In this context , this paper proposes a mobile and location-based system , called PhotoMap , for the automatic annotation and the spatiotemporal visualization of photo collections .', u'PhotoMap uses the new technologies of the Semantic Web in order to infer information about the taken photos and to improve both the visualization and the retrieval .', u'We also present a demonstration of the PhotoMap application during a tourist tour in the city of Grenoble .']

entities: [[(u'social semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'social web area', u'Task'), (u'folksonomies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'social web technologies', u'Method'), (u'Data mining', u'Method'), (u'meaning of tags in folksonomies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'user profiles', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Data mining', u'USED-FOR', u'meaning of tags in folksonomies')], []]
sentences: [u'In these recent years , the social semantic web has recognized a real attention by the majority of researchers in the world .', u'We propose in this paper an original approach concerning a powerful technology which has recognized a great success in the social web area , we talk about folksonomies .', u'The aim of our contribution is to provide another view about the semantics missed in the social web technologies and show how we can use the methods of Data mining to extract the meaning of tags in folksonomies .', u'Especially we will present how we can analyze user profiles according to their tags in order to personalize the recommendation of pertinent resources and surmount the lack of semantic links between tags for improving the quality of results returned by the current folksonomies .']

sentences: [u'Discusses the application of the semantic web in the area of international cooperation .', u'Identifies three models : the spidering central database system to assemble information from similarly coded databases ; multiple results assembly from dynamic sites ; authoring systems drawing content from different sites into static pages .', u'Describes some services representing these models : the European Libraries Network for Development ( ELAND ) ; the Accessible Information on Development Activities ( AIDA ) project ; more-over.com .', u'In future , data and services will be traded to provide content for web services .', u'Notes that the World Wide Web has had a huge impact in relation to libraries and catalogues and has implications for the way libraries ( real and virtual ) are resourced in the future .', u'Concludes that any present practices and policies will remain the same , but the design and technology will change .']

sentences: [u'Plenty of the research on automated Web Service Frame ( WSF ) relates it to an AI planning task , where the composition is primarily done offline before to execution .', u'Some of this optimization can be done offline , many interesting and beneficial optimizations are data dependent , and must be done following execution of at least some information gathering services .', u'Recent research on WSF has argued convincingly for the features of optimizing quality of service , trust , and user preferences .', u'In this paper , we examine this class of WSF problems without excessive data gathering .', u'Our investigation is performed in the context of the semantic web exercising an existing preference based Hierarchical Task Network WSC system .', u'Our experiments explained the potential improvement in both the quality and speed of composition generation afforded by our approach .']

entities: [[(u'web services', u'Method'), (u'syntactic interoperability problem', u'Task'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'news paradigms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Computing Grid', u'Method'), (u'web services', u'Method'), (u'semantic component', u'Method'), (u'grid environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Web intelligence field', u'Task'), (u'soft computing techniques', u'Method'), (u'evolutionary computation', u'Method')], [(u'topics', u'Generic'), (u'Web Services', u'Task'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'genetic algorithms application', u'Task'), (u'satellite image classification problem', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'evolutionary computation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'soft computing techniques')], [(u'Grid current development', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web Services'), (u'genetic algorithms application', u'USED-FOR', u'satellite image classification problem')]]
sentences: [u'During many years , the web services have been interested about the syntactic interoperability problem among applications , but forgetting semantics .', u'With the great amount of available information in the Web , and the emergence of news paradigms as Computing Grid , it is necessary to improve the web services by including the semantic component in order to achieve a better benefit from these resources and from necessary elements to be used in a grid environment .', u'In the Web intelligence field , have been proposed several projects , among them , the application of soft computing techniques , such as , evolutionary computation .', u'In this paper we will carry out a review about the Grid current development and other related topics , such as , Semantic Web and Web Services , as well as , the different approaches about the genetic algorithms application in satellite image classification problem .']

entities: [[(u'OCP', u'Method'), (u'middleware', u'Generic'), (u'contextual information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'host system', u'Method'), (u'proactive capacities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'environmental intelligence', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'contextual information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web derived technologies', u'Method'), (u'decision rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'latter', u'Generic')], [(u'OCP', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'contextual information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'proactive capacities', u'CONJUNCTION', u'proactive capacities')], [(u'modelling of contextual information', u'PART-OF', u'approach'), (u'Semantic Web derived technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'modelling of contextual information'), (u'Semantic Web derived technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'contextual information')], [], []]
sentences: [u'This paper describes OCP ( Open Context Platform ) , a middleware which provides support for management of contextual information and merging of information from different sources .', u'The host system is thus endowed with proactive capacities which , in turn , provide a certain environmental intelligence ( 8 ) .', u'The approach consists of a modelling of contextual information which is based on Semantic Web derived technologies and a description of the structured merging in the form of decision rules .', u'The latter serve to classify situations of interest and subsequently to trigger off the relevant actions at each moment .', u'Elsewhere , the underlying architecture in OCP is designed so that it can function both by centralizing all the contextual information from a central server and by distributing it among consumers and producers of this type of information .']

sentences: [u'Ontology Web Language ( OWL ) is an ontology description language for the semantic web .', u'It is known for its capabilities of representing knowledge and knowledge-based reasoning .', u'OWL has been increasingly used for modeling the entities in pervasive computing environment .', u'However , OWL gives no specific support for exclusive relations between properties owned by subjects , which bring inconvenience for using it on semantic expressing and reasoning .', u'In this paper , a new method to support exclusive properties is presented , which extends OWL by adding a new construct .', u'The formal definitions of the grammar and semantic for the proposed construct are given based on description logics .', u'In addition , a corresponding semantic parser is implemented by defining a rule set over Jena .', u'Case study in pervasive computing shows that the construct works well .']

entities: [[(u'SOWL', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'spatio-temporal information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'dynamic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'4D-fluents', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'N-ary ) approach', u'Method')], [(u'RCC- 8 topological and cone-shaped directional relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SOWL', u'Method')], [(u'qualitative temporal and spatial information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'temporal or spatial extents', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'temporal relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'quantitative information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'temporal and spatial information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SOWL', u'Method')], [(u'SOWL reasoner', u'Method'), (u'completeness', u'Metric'), (u'tractability', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[(u'OWL', u'FEATURE-OF', u'spatio-temporal information')], [(u'N-ary ) approach', u'USED-FOR', u'dynamic information')], [], [(u'temporal and spatial information', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'quantitative information')], [(u'soundness', u'CONJUNCTION', u'completeness'), (u'completeness', u'CONJUNCTION', u'tractability')]]
sentences: [u'We propose SOWL , an ontology for representing and reasoning over spatio-temporal information in OWL .', u'Building upon well established standards of the semantic web ( OWL 2.0 , SWRL ) SOWL enables representation of static as well as of dynamic information based on the 4D-fluents ( or , equivalently , on the N-ary ) approach .', u'Both RCC- 8 topological and cone-shaped directional relations are integrated in SOWL .', u"Representing both qualitative temporal and spatial information ( i.e. , information whose temporal or spatial extents are unknown such as `` left-of '' for spatial and `` before '' for temporal relations ) in addition to quantitative information ( i.e. , where temporal and spatial information is defined precisely ) is a distinctive feature of SOWL .", u'The SOWL reasoner is capable of inferring new relations and checking their consistency , while retaining soundness , completeness , and tractability over the supported sets of relations .']

sentences: [u'With the rapid growth of emerging applications like social network analysis , semantic Web analysis , and bioinformatics network analysis , it is urgent to require the processing capability on large scale graphs with billions of vertices , which is the hot topic of the research and development in the current high performance computing field.With the features of cloud computing and from the aspects of graph management and graph processing mechanisms , this paper surveys the key issues of large scale graph processing on cloud computing environments , including graph data storage scheme , index structure of graph data , graph partitioning strategy , graph computing model , message communication mechanism , fault-tolerance management , scalability , and graph query processing.This paper summarizes the state-of-art of current research works completely , analyzes the existing challenge problems in detail , and deeply explores the research directions in future .']

sentences: [u'Recognizing diseases from theoretical perspective can help ordinary people have a general understanding of medicine .', u'The usual process of identifying syndromes or diseases in Traditional Chinese Medicine ( TCM ) is by confirming the frequently symptom patterns .', u'Semantic Web and ontologies introduce well-structured controlled vocabularies for biomedical science .', u'The direct correspondence between symptoms and syndromes can be formatted to semantic inference rules as a additional knowledge upon a medical ontology. # R # # N # # R # # N # In this paper , we present a simplified rule-based diagnostic system for febrile disease theory in TCM , which make use of the capability of semantic inference based on medical ontology .', u'Actually the method is rather general for logic-based medical diagnosis , and we show that without interpreting clinical data , the medical knowledge itself can be applied to do basic clinical diagnosis .']

sentences: [u'since 1970 , technology innovations transformed radically the tourism processes and strategies , essentially with the Internet apparition .', u'Nowadays , E-Tourism systems are well implanted into the Internet , with a lot of offers and online possibilities ( reservations , virtual visit , etc . ) .', u"Nevertheless , with the great evolution of the Internet , users ' needs and attends changed too , they are now looking for more personalized and adapted contents .", u'Here is the lack of the most E-Tourism systems , they are not , or a little , user centered .', u'Based both on techniques of the Semantic Web and Adaptive Hypermedia Systems , this paper presents a solution for dynamic adaptation of the offer according to semantic criteria characterizing the Internet , in order to improve customer relationship management .', u"A case study about tourism in the Cote-d'Or department in Burgundy is presented ."]

sentences: [u'The design reuse of products is vital for mass customization .', u'In small- and medium-sized manufacturing enterprises ( SMMEs ) , employing design reuse is a challenging issue because of the limited level and scale of these enterprises .', u'Previous studies have not considered this issue and have attempted to rebuild a complete novel system .', u'In this study , we propose a design reuse approach based on an engineering semantic web ( ESW ) and implement a design reuse system .', u'This system does not rebuild the current parts library in SMMEs .', u'In our approach , we construct an ESW and a mapping relation to introduce engineering semantic information into the existing parts library .', u'In addition , we employ ant colony optimization ( ACO ) for the retrieval of design information .', u'A design reuse prototype system is implemented for solving the problem of design reuse in SMMEs .']

sentences: [u'Context-sensitive knowledge is widespread in Semantic Web , but traditional RDF triples lack references to situations , points in time , or generally contexts .', u'In order to resolve this problem , Dimensional Ontology ( DO ) theory is put forward , which features dimensional relations , dimensional operators as well as reasoning mechanism for context-sensitive knowledge .', u'The notion of context in DO is actuarially a vector of dimensions , which are crisp sets representing certain contextual aspects .', u'We propose an approach of modeling uncertain contexts of DO through fuzzy subsets instead of crisp ones .', u'In this way , DO provides the ability of representing fuzzy triples in uncertain contexts .', u'Apart from describing uncertain context model of DO , we discuss how dimensional operators and reasoning mechanism can be applied to uncertain contexts to allow more complex manipulations .']

entities: [[(u'logic- and rule- based reasoning', u'Task'), (u'SW agents', u'Method'), (u'rea- soning task interoperability', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'SW', u'Method'), (u'third-party trusted reasoning ser- vices', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rule', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'logic paradigm', u'Method'), (u'external reasoning service', u'Method'), (u'receiving agent', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'multi-agent system', u'Method'), (u'third-party trusted defeasible reasoning service', u'Method'), (u'incomplete and inconsistent information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'brokering trade scenario', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'receiving agent', u'USED-FOR', u'semantics')], [(u'third-party trusted defeasible reasoning service', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-agent system')], []]
sentences: [u'Based on the plethora of proposals and standards for logic- and rule- based reasoning for the Semantic Web ( SW ) , a key factor for SW agents is rea- soning task interoperability .', u'This paper reports on a framework for interoperable reasoning among agents in the SW that deploys third-party trusted reasoning ser- vices .', u'This way , agents can exchange arguments , without conforming to a common rule or logic paradigm ; via an external reasoning service , the receiving agent can grasp the semantics of the received rule set .', u'The paper presents how a multi-agent system was extended with a third-party trusted defeasible reasoning service , which offers agents the ability of reasoning with incomplete and inconsistent information .', u'In addition , a brokering trade scenario is presented that illustrates the usability of the approach .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web reasoning applications', u'Task')], [(u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'Web scale', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reasoning engines', u'Method')], [(u'performance limitation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'large-scale e-Infrastructures', u'Method'), (u'LarKC', u'Method'), (u'Large Knowledge Collider', u'Method'), (u'massive distributed incomplete reasoning', u'Task'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'scalability barriers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'HPC systems', u'Method')], [(u'parallelization', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic applications', u'Task')], [(u'parallelization strategies', u'Method'), (u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'LarKC', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'large-scale e-Infrastructures', u'USED-FOR', u'performance limitation'), (u'LarKC', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'large-scale e-Infrastructures'), (u'LarKC', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Large Knowledge Collider')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Performance is the most critical aspect towards achieving high scalability of Semantic Web reasoning applications , and considerably limits the application areas of them .', u'There is still a deep mismatch between the requirements for reasoning on a Web scale and performance of the existing reasoning engines .', u'The performance limitation can be considerably reduced by utilizing such large-scale e-Infrastructures as LarKC - the Large Knowledge Collider - an experimental platform for massive distributed incomplete reasoning , which offers several innovative approaches removing the scalability barriers , in particularly , by enabling transparent access to HPC systems .', u'Efficient utilization of such resources is facilitated by means of parallelization being the major element for accomplishing performance and scalability of semantic applications .', u'Here we discuss application of some emerging parallelization strategies and show the benefits obtained by using such systems as LarKC .']

relations: [[(u'uncertainty', u'CONJUNCTION', u'vagueness'), (u'Description Logics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rules'), (u'rules', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'fuzzy set theory', u'USED-FOR', u'hybrid MKNF knowledge bases')], [], [(u'fixpoint operator', u'CONJUNCTION', u'iterative fixpoint semantics')], [(u'polynomial time', u'FEATURE-OF', u'modal atom'), (u'polynomial time', u'FEATURE-OF', u'data complexity'), (u'data complexity', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'modal atom')]]
sentences: [u'We present an infrastructure for describing and handling uncertainty and vagueness in a combination of Description Logics and rules in the Semantic Web .', u'More concretely , we apply fuzzy set theory to hybrid MKNF knowledge bases , and establish fuzzy hybrid MKNF knowledge bases , which is sound with respect to the classical two-valued semantics .', u'Furthermore , we discuss some fundamental properties of fuzzy semantics , and characterize fuzzy MKNF models of general MKNF knowledge bases .', u'We also provide characterizations of fuzzy MKNF models of positive and stratified MKNF knowledge bases in terms of a fixpoint operator and an iterative fixpoint semantics , respectively .', u'Finally , we describe a special case of fuzzy nondisjunctive positive MKNF knowledge base , in which the truth value of a modal atom can be computed in polynomial time in the data complexity .']

relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'ontology violation check', u'USED-FOR', u'building ontology intersection')], []]
sentences: [u'By integrating ontologies , knowledge represented in these ontologies can be extended and reused for purposes like building new ontologies , composing advanced services on the semantic web and sharing knowledge .', u'The ontology integration is a difficult task because of semantic barriers .', u'In this paper , an approach of building context for ontology integration is presented .', u'The integration of the ontologies is carried out by using context and ontology violation check .', u'To provide context for the integration , context rules are utilized for interpretation and reasoning across ontologies .', u'The ontology violation check is applied in the process of building ontology intersection under the open world assumption .', u'As a result of the integration , an ontology intersection is produced , which is larger than the intersection of entities , but not larger than the union of the original entities .']

sentences: [u'In an effort to reduce healthcare costs , home healthcare devices are seeing increased use .', u'However , many of these devices are specialized , operate independently and use proprietary interfaces , diluting the cost savings .', u'Smartphones offer a way to retain these cost savings by serving as a sensor hub within the home .', u'In this paper we describe an extensible framework that combines a mobile device interfacing with health sensors in the home , a set of ontologies to map sensor data to clinical information standards such as IEEE 11073 , and a cloud-based reasoning and mapping system built with OWL , SPARQL and SPIN .', u'This approach capitalizes on the ease of use and low cost of smartphones , and the computational power and flexibility of a cloud-based semantic web reasoner .', u'A proof of concept implementation is presented .']

sentences: [u"The real future of the Internet is n't about the semantic Web , or indeed anything fundamentally to do with knowledge .", u'The principal ways in which we use the Internet -Web , email and media streaming -happen to be examples where information is knowledge .', u'The Mesh is feasible using current technology if we are prepared to think differently .', u'The author had focused on device control and user interface design , but the Mesh would serve any type of software application since it is underpinned by an abstract and general-purpose language .', u'In the same way that we think of the Web as seamlessly connecting databases of the world to provide a global font of knowledge , the Mesh would connect software of the world to provide a global means of control for all devices , machines and systems .']

sentences: [u'Schema matching , which can find semantic correspondences between elements of two schemas , plays a key role in many applications , such as data warehouse , heterogeneous data sources integration and semantic web .', u'Currently , most schema matching problems are achieved by the similar column names in the schemas to be matched , or common domains in the data stored in the schemas .', u"However , reasonable results can not be obtained by these methods when column names and data values are difficult to explain or `` opaque '' in schemas .", u'In this paper , a new schema matching algorithm which can discover semantic matches between opaque database schemas is proposed .', u'Compared with the original schema matching algorithm , the computation is reduced greatly , the core calculation process and matching process of algorithm are simplified , and the efficiency and precision is enhanced .']

sentences: [u'The results of scientific activities that include observations , experiments , interactions , deductions , etc .', u'are stored in data sets which are typically kept and managed in an ad-hoc manner .', u'It requires a substantial effort to discover and evaluate data quality and suitability for a particular analysis .', u'The provision of appropriate metadata and links to related resources assists in finding and evaluating data sets for scientific research .', u'This paper addresses the problem of modeling of ontologies in Semantic Web , and presents a method for describing and managing semantic information for scientific domain spaces .', u'We have developed a semantic layer over a database management system to give support to retrieval services for data sets semantics .', u'The conceptualization of domain spaces including the development of the vocabulary is performed using RDF model and schema constructs .']

entities: [[(u'Knowledge-driven text mining', u'Method'), (u'pharmacogenomics target genes', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'adverse drug events', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge integration', u'Task'), (u'ADEs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantically annotated literature corpus Semantic MEDLINE', u'Method'), (u'semantically coded ADE knowledgebase', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ADEpedia', u'Material'), (u'semantic web based framework', u'Method')], [(u'knowledge discovery approach', u'Method'), (u'network analysis', u'Method'), (u'protein-protein interaction', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'PPI ) network', u'Method'), (u'gene functional classification approach', u'Method')], [(u'drug-induced long QT syndrome', u'Task'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'ADEs', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Knowledge-driven text mining is becoming an important research area for identifying pharmacogenomics target genes .', u'However , few of such studies have been focused on the pharmacogenomics targets of adverse drug events ( ADEs ) .', u'The objective of the present study is to build a framework of knowledge integration and discovery that aims to support pharmacogenomics target predication of ADEs .', u'We integrate a semantically annotated literature corpus Semantic MEDLINE with a semantically coded ADE knowledgebase known as ADEpedia using a semantic web based framework .', u'We developed a knowledge discovery approach combining a network analysis of a protein-protein interaction ( PPI ) network and a gene functional classification approach .', u'We performed a case study of drug-induced long QT syndrome for demonstrating the usefulness of the framework in predicting potential pharmacogenomics targets of ADEs .']

sentences: [u'The maturity of deep learning techniques has led in recent years to a breakthrough in object recognition in visual media .', u'While for some specific benchmarks , neural techniques seem to match if not outperform human judgement , challenges are still open for detecting arbitrary concepts in arbitrary videos .', u'In this paper , we propose a system that combines neural techniques , a large scale visual concepts ontology , and an active learning loop , to provide on the fly model learning of arbitrary concepts .', u'We give an overview of the system as a whole , and focus on the central role of the ontology for guiding and bootstrapping the learning of new concepts , improving the recall of concept detection , and , on the user end , providing semantic search on a library of annotated videos .']

sentences: [u'Keyword-based search in general is particularly applicable if the searcher really knows what she is looking for and how to find it , i.e .', u'to know the appropriate keywords to obtain the desired results .', u'But in many cases either the objectives of the searcher are intrinsically fuzzy or she is not aware of the appropriate keywords .', u'One way to solve this problem is to navigate and explore the search space along guided routes .', u'In this paper we show , how Linked Open Data can be adopted to facilitate an exploratory semantic search for video data .', u'We present a prototype implementation of exploratory video search and show how traditional keyword-based search can be augmented by the use of Linked Open Data .']

sentences: [u'In this fast moving world searching is the important and vital field where each and every activity involved in it .', u'The semantic search adds special flavor to the normal searching technique .', u'It improves accuracy , amount of time for searching is reduced and the knowledge about searching is also improved .', u'In this paper a technique for the search engine which involves logic based retrieval and relationship are based on RDF .', u'In current RDF the relationship are based on static and manual methods for obtaining relations .', u'We propose a method which automatically generates the logical relation with the help of input URL .', u'The URL is given as input and automatic RDF is generated .', u'The RDF which is generated with the help of URL can be optimized .']

sentences: [u'The Internet of Things envisions a multitude of heterogeneous objects and interactions with the physical environment .', u'The functionalities provided by these objects can be termed as real-world services as they provide a near real-time state of the physical world .', u'A structured , machine-processible approach to provision such real-world services is needed to make heterogeneous physical objects accessible on a large scale and to integrate them with the digital world .', u'This paper presents a semantic modeling approach for different components in an IoT framework .', u'It is also discussed how the model can be integrated into the IoT framework by using automated association mechanisms with physical entities and how the data can be discovered using semantic search and reasoning mechanisms .']

sentences: [u'A computer-implemented system for searching a plurality of images for an image of interest including a database of semantic image representations corresponding to the plurality of images , wherein the semantic image representations link a semantic model of clinical properties , a syntactic model of high level image properties and an image vocabulary of low level image properties , a set of queries associated with the semantic image representations , and a semantic search engine , embodied as computer readable code executed by a processor , for receiving a search query , selecting at least one of the set of queries based on the search query , and searching the plurality of images for the image of interest by comparing the plurality of images against the semantic image representations associated with a selected query .']

sentences: [u'Semantic search refers to a broad array of methods that aim to improve retrieval by interpreting queries beyond the traditional weighted bag of words model of document retrieval .', u'In this talk , we will focus on the subset of these methods that rely on explicit semantic annotations , i.e .', u'linking queries and text to items in a Knowledge Base .', u'We will discuss techniques of entity linking on queries and documents , and the potential impact of these methods on improving performance on the classical ad-hoc document retrieval task .', u'We will also discuss some novel tasks , including entity retrieval and related entity recommendations , and their implementation in Yahoo Search .', u'We will close by considering some of the challenges that are specific to developing search services in a mobile context .']

sentences: [u'The emergence of Internet advertising brings about an economic and ecient marketing means for small and medium enterprises in service industries .', u'Every day , massive service advertising information is published over the Internet .', u'Nevertheless , on the other side , service consumers nd it dicult to quickly and precisely retrieve their desired services .', u'This problem is partly caused by the ubiquitous , heterogeneous , and ambiguous nature of online service advertising information .', u'In this paper , we propose a systematic framework - UCOSAIS - for online service advertising information search .', u'Inspired by the philosophy of usercentered design , this framework comprises an ontology-learning-based focused crawler for service information discovery and classication , a faceted semantic search component for service concept selection , and a user-click-based similarity computing component for service concept ranking adjustment .']

sentences: [u'Several fields have created ontologies for their subdomains .', u'For example , the biological sciences have developed extensive ontologies such as the Gene Ontology , which is considered a great success .', u'Ontologies could provide similar advantages to the Modeling and Simulation community .', u'They provide a way to establish common vocabularies and capture knowledge about a particular domain with community-wide agreement .', u'Ontologies can support significantly improved ( semantic ) search and browsing , integration of heterogeneous information sources , and improved knowledge discovery capabilities .', u'This paper discusses the design and development of an ontology for Modeling and Simulation called the Discrete-event Modeling Ontology ( DeMO ) , and it presents prototype applications that demonstrate various uses and benefits that such an ontology may provide to the Modeling and Simulation community .']

sentences: [u'Internet is so popular that nearly everybody using it every day .', u'Current Internet shows some characteristics of intelligent .', u'For example , it can help people find the proper resources using semantic search .', u'So this paper focuses on the wisdom of Internet .', u'Firstly , the definition and relationship among information , knowledge and wisdom are introduced .', u'Then , the definition of Internet information , Internet knowledge and Internet wisdom is proposed .', u"Internet information follows the Shannon 's theory on information .", u'Internet knowledge is the set of Internet abilities , such as reliability , security , mobility .', u'Internet wisdom is the overall performance of Internet for a certain event .', u"Lastly , using the Shannon 's on information entropy , the quantification process is brought out to quantify the three elements that we have defined ."]

sentences: [u'SKOOP searches with an open architecture that allows the integration any existing resources and services and bring any search , 3rd-party services , tools or message mining products into one place .', u'Through a powerful rules-based approach , SKOOP uses a combination of semantic search and meta-search to leverage social relationships and to provide the most comprehensive insight into content and brand management across all of those locations .', u'That wide reach allows SKOOP clients to see the various ways that their current or targeted consumers interact based on the digital location they are using with the ability to identify and follow content , people and actions across web , social media in order to give a comprehensive view into all major touch-points .']

sentences: [u': The paper presents a concept of a system supporting planning of innovation processes , which aim is to estimate key parameters of newly launching innovation process .', u'A base of this estimation is knowledge contained in a large number of different kinds of documents describing the innovation processes that have been implemented before .', u'Considering the diverse and unformalized structure of such documents the system has been proposed basing on semantic search and document linkage mechanism .', u'The paper presents how the estimations can support decision making in innovation management .', u'The concept of architecture of this system along with the descriptions of its functions and modules also has been described .', u'The paper also introduces the concept and role of innovation processes ontology in building the semantic innovation planning system']

sentences: [u'A method of processing source document to provide complementary semantic databases to enable an improved semantic search .', u'Source documents are parsed and type annotations indicating adherence to one of a set of predefined types are associated with particular words in the source documents .', u'For each annotated word semantic keys are identified that corresponding to the annotations associated therewith .', u'These semantic keys correspond to semantic keys defined in a semantic model , which associated each semantic key with a plurality of semantic descriptors .', u'On this basis a complementary database is compiled associating each word with the semantic descriptors associated with each semantic key thus identified as corresponding to the annotations associated with a respective word .', u'A number of different complementary databases are proposed .']

sentences: [u'An ontology-based representation of information about a domain is flexible enough to support different strategies in presenting the information .', u'In this paper , we present two applications for creating interactive presentations in a cultural heritage domain , that share the same database of informative units and the same representation of the domain , encoded in a light-weight ontology .', u'# R # # N # # R # # N # An application for drama-based guided tours assembles the informative units in a location-aware fashion , by exploiting the structure of the ontology to enforce the notion of discourse focusing in the generated presentation .', u"A browsing-based application for accessing the informative units supports semantic search , consulting the ontology to suggest modifications of the user 's search to circumscribe or enlarge the result sets ."]

sentences: [u'Named entities often occur in web pages , in particular news articles , and are important to what the web pages are about .', u'They have ontological features , namely , their aliases , types , and identifiers , which are hidden from their textual appearance .', u'In this chapter , for text searching and clustering , we propose an extended Vector Space Model with multiple vectors defined over spaces of entity names , types , name-type pairs , identifiers , and keywords .', u'Both hard and fuzzy text clustering experiments of the proposed model on selected data subsets of Reuters-21578 are conducted and evaluated .', u'The results prove that a weighted combination of named entities and keywords are significant to clustering quality .', u'Implementation and demonstration of text clustering with named entities in a semantic search engine are also presented .']

sentences: [u'We concentrate on the use of ontologies for the categorization of objects , e.g. , photos , books , web pages .', u'Lightweight ontologies are ontologies with a tree structure where each node is associated a natural language label .', u'Faceted lightweight ontologies are lightweight ontologies where the labels of nodes are organized according to certain predefined patterns which capture different aspects of meaning , i.e. , facets .', u'We introduce facets based on the Analytico-Synthetic approach , a well established methodology from Library Science which has been successfully used for decades for the classification of books .', u'Faceted lightweight ontologies have a well defined structure and , as such , they are easier to create , to share among users , and they also provide more organized input to semantics based applications , such as semantic search and navigation .']

sentences: [u'Traditional keyword-based search engine does not consider the additional information provided by the structure of XML documents , it returns imprecise results often ; searching according to keywords and structure information of XML documents inputted is not suitable for contain users.Semantic search for XML data based on tag-keywords overcomes the limitations above , but its efficiency needs to be improved.This paper analyzes semantic information provided by the structure of XML documents deeply.It puts forward a new index structure for XML data and semantic related decision function between two nodes.Based on this , it proposes a fast semantic search algorithm for XML data.The search algorithm reduces the times to decide semantic correla- tion greatly.The experimental results with real data sets illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm .']

sentences: [u'A natural language interface is always desirable for a search system .', u'While performance of machine translation for general texts with acceptable computational costs seems to reach a limit , narrowing down the domain to one of queries reduces the complexity and enables better translation correctness .', u'This paper proposes a query translation method that is robust to ill-formed questions and exploits knowledge of an ontology for semantic search .', u'It uses conceptual graphs as the target language for the translation .', u'As a logical interlingua with smooth mapping to and from natural language , conceptual graphs simplify translation rules and can be easily converted to other formal query languages .', u'Experiment results of the method on the TREC 2002 and TREC 2007 data sets are also presented and discussed .']

entities: [[(u'keyword-based IR approaches', u'Method'), (u'document context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'document ranking approach', u'Method')], [(u'knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'annotations', u'Generic'), (u'semantic search', u'Task')], [(u'ranking', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'document context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ranking approach', u'Method'), (u'precision', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'precision', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'ranking approach')]]
sentences: [u'Traditional keyword-based IR approaches take into account the document context only in a limited manner .', u'In our paper we present a novel document ranking approach based on the semantic relationships between named entities .', u'In the first step we annotate all documents with named entities from a knowledge base ( for example people , places and organisations ) .', u'In the next step these annotations in combination with the relationships from the knowledge base are used to rank documents in order to perform a semantic search .', u'Documents that contain the specific named entity that was searched for as well as other strongly related entities , receive a higher ranking .', u'The inclusion of the document context in the ranking approach achieves a higher precision in the Top-K results .']

sentences: [u'In order to increase the percentage of women in academics or researchers , there is need for a functioning research networking through which women can exchange ideas ; ask questions and more importantly , mentorship , in Nigeria .', u'In order to make for this , several recommendations have been suggested but are not scientific .', u'Therefore , to bridge this gap scientifically , this paper is presenting an overview of a question and answering system framework that hybridize semantic search methodology and cognitive reasoning .', u'The hybridization will enhance the question and answering accuracy especially due to the introduction of domain ontology for the semantic process .', u'This paper also presents the output of the first phase of the implementation which is the development of the domain ontology for the question and answering system .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'decision-making processes', u'USED-FOR', u'design phases')], [], [(u'web-based toolkit', u'USED-FOR', u'Clockwork knowledge management methodology'), (u'web-based toolkit', u'USED-FOR', u'engineering models')], [(u'semantic search of engineering models', u'USED-FOR', u'Reuse')], [(u'industrial organisations', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach')]]
sentences: [u'Engineering design is a knowledge intensive activity .', u'Design is characterized as comprising a number of phases from requirements to detailed specification .', u'Transitions between the design phases stem from decision-making processes supported both by generally available domain and design knowledge and from unique and original knowledge worth of recording for future reuse .', u'The Clockwork project addresses the problems of representing , sharing and reusing knowledge in a collaborative design engineering environment .', u'The Clockwork knowledge management methodology is supported by a web-based toolkit that allows designers to share , formally and informally annotate and reuse engineering models .', u'Reuse is supported through the semantic search of engineering models and of the design rationale by which the engineering models were developed .', u'The approach has been successfully deployed in two industrial organisations .']

sentences: [u'Most work in semantic search has thus far focused upon either manually building language-specific taxonomies/ontologies or upon automatic techniques such as clustering or dimensionality reduction to discover latent semantic links within the content that is being searched .', u'The former is very labor intensive and is hard to maintain , while the latter is prone to noise and may be hard for a human to understand or to interact with directly .', u"We believe that the links between similar user 's queries represent a largely untapped source for discovering latent semantic relationships between search terms .", u'The proposed system is capable of mining user search logs to discover semantic relationships between key phrases in a manner that is language agnostic , human understandable , and virtually noise-free .']

entities: [[(u'Asynchronous discussion forums', u'Method'), (u'e-learning', u'Method'), (u'academic and social contexts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learner participation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'active collaborative learning', u'Task')], [(u'Base', u'Metric'), (u'text mining technologies', u'Method'), (u'discussion transcripts', u'Material'), (u'structural modeling', u'Task'), (u'semantic association', u'Method'), (u'discussion forum', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic search', u'Task'), (u'thematic navigation', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'thematic navigational guidance', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Asynchronous discussion forums', u'USED-FOR', u'e-learning'), (u'activity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'learner participation'), (u'learner participation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'learner participation and collaboration'), (u'learner participation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'collaboration')], [], [(u'Base', u'USED-FOR', u'structural modeling'), (u'discussion transcripts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'text mining technologies')], [(u'semantic search', u'CONJUNCTION', u'thematic navigation')], []]
sentences: [u'Asynchronous discussion forums are used increasingly in e-learning in which learners interact in academic and social contexts , whereas some challenges and difficulties exist pertaining to the activity and variability in learner participation and collaboration .', u'To motivating and facilitating active collaborative learning , this paper describes the design of an enhanced asynchronous discussion forum .', u'Base on the domain ontology and text mining technologies , discussion transcripts are automatically processed for structural modeling with semantic association , which lays the foundation for the fulfillment of distinctive functionalities in the discussion forum ( i.e .', u'semantic search , thematic navigation and recommendation ) .', u'An experimental study is conducted to show that the approach is effective to discover learning peers with same interests and search for related messages with thematic navigational guidance .']

entities: [[(u'A3-D6', u'Method'), (u'personalized information systems', u'Method')], [(u'documentation strategy', u'Method'), (u'REWERSE network', u'Method')], [(u'ques- tionnaire', u'Method'), (u'A3-D2', u'Method'), (u'prototypes', u'Generic'), (u'human- and machine-readable form', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'personalization', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'A3', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'A3-D6', u'USED-FOR', u'personalized information systems')], [], [(u'human- and machine-readable form', u'FEATURE-OF', u'prototypes')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'A3-D6 delivers demonstrators and prototypes of personalized information systems .', u'In this ac- companying report we continue the documentation strategy developed in deliverable A3-D2 , were we gave a detailed analysis on use cases of partners in the REWERSE network , and analyzed these use cases .', u'This accompanying report provides an improved version of the ques- tionnaire developed in A3-D2 , and gives an overview on current prototypes in both human- and machine-readable form .', u'Guidelines for development of use cases have been incorperated in this documentation .', u'During the development of the prototypes , some key issues on personalization for the Semantic Web have been identified during various discussions and meetings .', u'We sum- marize these findings in a brief lessons-learnt section , and conclude the report with a roadmap of future work in A3 .']

entities: [[(u'semantic grid', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web and grid computing', u'Task'), (u'ontology technology', u'Method'), (u'data retrieval methodology', u'Method'), (u'distributed semantic grid resources', u'Material')], [(u'semantic grid resources', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology servers', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'validation framework', u'Method'), (u'sub-ontology extraction workflows', u'Task'), (u'semantic grid computing environment', u'Method')], [(u'ontology optimization schemes', u'Method'), (u'workflow models', u'Method'), (u'Petri Net', u'Method')], [(u'model', u'Generic')], [(u'validation framework', u'Method'), (u'models', u'Generic'), (u'sub-ontology extraction workflows', u'Task'), (u'semantic grid', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'The semantic grid as the uniting concept of semantic web and grid computing , and its ontology technology provide an efficient data retrieval methodology in widely distributed semantic grid resources over the Internet .', u'As the number of semantic grid resources increase , e.g. , ontology servers , the amount of data increases and managing job workflows is becoming increasingly complex .', u'This paper proposed a validation framework for sub-ontology extraction workflows in our proposed semantic grid computing environment .', u'We considered two ontology optimization schemes and design its workflow models using Petri Net .', u'The workflow for each model is described and validated .', u'The results justify the feasibilities of our proposed validation framework of the aforementioned models which can be used as building blocks to model large and efficient sub-ontology extraction workflows in a semantic grid .']

entities: [[(u'distance education', u'Task'), (u'semiconductor lasers', u'Method')], [(u'Education resource', u'Material'), (u'distance education', u'Task'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web markup languages', u'Material'), (u'static XML-documents', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'IEDE', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'simulator LaserCAD III', u'Method')], [(u'IEDE', u'Method'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'semiconductor QW lasers', u'Method')], [(u'IEDE', u'Method'), (u'QW lasers', u'Method'), (u'optoelectronics', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'interactive environment', u'USED-FOR', u'distance education')], [(u'Education resource', u'USED-FOR', u'distance education')], [], [(u'static XML-documents', u'USED-FOR', u'method'), (u'static XML-documents', u'CONJUNCTION', u'simulator LaserCAD III')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'IEDE'), (u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'interactive physics of semiconductor QW lasers')], []]
sentences: [u'In this work the interactive environment for distance education for studying the physical basics of semiconductor lasers is presented .', u'Education resource that is part of the interactive environment ( IEDE ) for distance education corresponds to the first level of the model of Semantic Web markup languages and is a complex of static XML-documents .', u'The original method for building up of IEDE is proposed .', u'The method is founded on integration of static XML-documents and novel simulator LaserCAD III by means JSP .', u'The created IEDE utilizes the proposed method and gives possibilities of practical interactive physics of semiconductor QW lasers .', u'The use of IEDE allows to wide understanding of the working principles and peculiarities of practical utilizing of QW lasers and organize the system of distance education in optoelectronics .']

entities: [[(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'model', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic ambiguity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'application areas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Knowledge Management', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'E-Commerce', u'Material')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'measures', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'application areas', u'Task')], [(u'ones', u'Generic'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'granularity', u'Metric')]]

sentences: [u'An ontology is a model of a domain of knowledge .', u'The knowledge that is captured in an ontology can be used for providing interoperability , sharing of information and reduction in semantic ambiguity in application areas such as Knowledge Management , the Semantic Web and E-Commerce .', u'Given that each of these application areas may have differing requirements , how do we assess whether an ontology adequately addresses the requirements of a given application ?', u'In this paper , we consider how existing criteria and measures can be used to evaluate different aspects of the suitability of ontologies for application areas in the domain of travel and geography .', u'Specifically , we consider some existing measures of coverage , as well as propose new ones , and determine whether they address the application requirement of appropriate granularity .']

entities: [[(u'education', u'Task'), (u'virtual learning environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'network-based education', u'Task'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'teaching and learning activities', u'Task'), (u'instructional management', u'Task')], [(u'virtual learning environment systems', u'Method'), (u'educational processes', u'Method')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'virtual learning environment', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'Ontology', u'Material'), (u'UML', u'Material')], []]
relations: [[(u'teaching and learning activities', u'CONJUNCTION', u'instructional management')], [], [(u'model', u'USED-FOR', u'virtual learning environment'), (u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Ontology'), (u'Ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'UML')], []]
sentences: [u'With the continuous development of computer theories and technologies in the field of education , virtual learning environments ( VLEs ) are widely used in network-based education because of their features flexibly supporting teaching and learning activities and instructional management .', u'In this paper , based on the study of existing virtual learning environment systems , and taking individualized creation and performance of educational processes as the core , we focused on the problems that how to set up various Non-linear learning sequences and comprehensive execution conditions of learning Units .', u'Then , a model of virtual learning environment was proposed and implemented through adopting the theories and techniques of Semantic Web , Ontology , and UML .', u'The study can efficiently meet the individualized requirements of educators and learners , thereby further optimizing the efficiency of teaching and learning .']

entities: [[(u'OWL-S', u'Method'), (u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'composite process specification', u'Method'), (u'precise mathematic semantic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'process specification', u'Method'), (u'OWL-S', u'Method'), (u'formal analysis', u'Method')], [(u'formal framework', u'Method'), (u'composite process description', u'Task'), (u'rewriting logic', u'Method'), (u'compositional reasoning', u'Method'), (u'OWL-S composite process model', u'Method')], [(u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'Maude language', u'Method'), (u'rewriting logic based methodology', u'Method'), (u'formal modeling and analysis', u'Method'), (u'system design', u'Method'), (u'inconsistencies in composition', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL-S composite process specification', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'Web services')], [(u'precise mathematic semantic', u'USED-FOR', u'composite process specification')], [(u'formal framework', u'USED-FOR', u'composite process description'), (u'rewriting logic', u'USED-FOR', u'compositional reasoning'), (u'compositional reasoning', u'PART-OF', u'OWL-S composite process model')], [(u'Maude language', u'USED-FOR', u'technique'), (u'rewriting logic based methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'technique')]]
sentences: [u'OWL-S is one of the leading standards for the description of Web services on the Semantic Web .', u'However its composite process specification is lack of precise mathematic semantic which leads the process specification described in OWL-S is only a semi-formal one , and canpsilat do reasoning and formal analysis in this part .', u'This paper proposes a formal framework for enriching composite process description with rewriting logic that facilitates compositional reasoning about services in OWL-S composite process model .', u'The technique is based on Maude language , a rewriting logic based methodology in which formal modeling and analysis can be used from the earliest phases of system design to uncover many errors and inconsistencies in composition , and to reach high assurance for critical components with runtime verification of OWL-S composite process specification .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'domain', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'Domain changes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conceptualization', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'evolution of ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'operability problems', u'Task')], [(u'versioning mechanism', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology versioning', u'Task')], [(u'database schema versioning', u'Task'), (u'program interface versioning', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'versioning mechanism', u'Method'), (u'ontology identification', u'Task'), (u'change specification', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'database schema versioning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'program interface versioning'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'versioning mechanism'), (u'ontology identification', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'versioning mechanism'), (u'ontology identification', u'CONJUNCTION', u'change specification'), (u'change specification', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'versioning mechanism')]]
sentences: [u'Ontologies are often seen as basic building blocks for the Semantic Web , as they provide a reusable piece of knowledge about a specific domain .', u'However , those pieces of knowledge are not static , but evolve over time .', u'Domain changes , adaptations to different tasks , or changes in the conceptualization require modifications of the ontology .', u'The evolution of ontologies causes operability problems , which will hamper their effective reuse .', u'A versioning mechanism might help to reduce those problems , as it will make the relations between different revisions of an ontology explicit .', u'This paper will discuss the problem of ontology versioning .', u'Inspired by the work done in database schema versioning and program interface versioning , it will also propose building blocks for the most important aspects of a versioning mechanism , i.e. , ontology identification and change specification .']

entities: [[(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'XMDR', u'Method'), (u'legacy system', u'Method')], [(u'extension', u'Generic'), (u'MSO', u'Method'), (u'management of metadata', u'Task'), (u'management of location information', u'Task'), (u'Topic Map', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'TMDR', u'Method')], [(u'intelligent layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Topic Map functions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Topic Map', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'real data', u'Material'), (u'Topic Map', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Topic Map', u'Method'), (u'method', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'XMDR'), (u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'legacy system'), (u'XMDR', u'USED-FOR', u'legacy system')], [(u'MSO', u'USED-FOR', u'extension'), (u'MSO', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ML'), (u'Topic Map', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'This study suggests a method for extending XMDR to integrate and search legacy system .', u'This extension blends MSO ( Meta Semantic Ontology ) for the management of metadata , ML ( Meta Location ) for the management of location information , and Topic Map which is the standard language used to represent semantic web .', u'This study refers to it as TMDR ( Topic Map MetaData Registry ) .', u'As an intelligent layer , Topic Map functions like an index .', u'However , if the data frequently changes , the efficiency of Topic Map may drop .', u'To solve this problem , the proposed system represents the relation among metadata , the relation among real data , and the relation between metadata and real data as Topic Map .', u'The represented Topic Map proposes a method to reduce the changing relation among real data caused by the relation among metadata .']

entities: [[(u'project management', u'Task')], [(u'web-based project management systems', u'Method'), (u'WPMS )', u'Method')], [(u'wiki technology', u'Method')], [(u'semantic wiki', u'Method'), (u'structured collaboration knowledge sharing', u'Method'), (u'closing and initiation phases', u'Task'), (u'project management', u'Task')], [(u'prototype', u'Generic'), (u'semantic MediaWiki', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'virtual environment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'real project data', u'Material'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'data gathering', u'Task')], [(u'Questionnaire analysis', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'WPMS )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'web-based project management systems')], [], [(u'semantic wiki', u'USED-FOR', u'closing and initiation phases'), (u'semantic wiki', u'USED-FOR', u'project management'), (u'structured collaboration knowledge sharing', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic wiki')], [(u'semantic MediaWiki', u'USED-FOR', u'prototype')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The use of lessons learned in project management is still not fully satisfactory .', u'The current web-based project management systems ( WPMS ) mainly support project lifecycle with no much consideration to project initiation and closing .', u'The main objective of this paper is to incorporate the features of semantic web and features of wiki technology to capture project lessons learned knowledge .', u'This paper also illustrates how the semantic wiki can utilize structured collaboration knowledge sharing to improve closing and initiation phases in project management .', u'A prototype has been developed using semantic MediaWiki in virtual environment , real project data obtained and inserted into the system .', u'A questionnaire has been designed and used for data gathering in an Egyptian engineering and construction company .', u'Questionnaire analysis showed that semantic wiki improved lessons learned capture process .']

sentences: [u'Abstract : The objective of this effort was to extend the state of the art in Zoomable User Interfaces ( ZUIs ) and closely related interface techniques to support the Command Post of the Future ( CPoF ) and Semantic Web DARPA projects .', u'This project had several important outcomes in the following areas , each of which will be described in more detail .', u'In addition , all relevant published papers that were written as a result of this work are also included along with the amount of use of our work by others indicated by web access .', u'In addition , a description of all invited presentations of this work is listed .', u'The areas of work are .. Jazz toolkit to support ZUIs , Piccolo toolkit to support ZUIs , PhotoMesa image browser , CounterPoint presentation tool , OZONE ontology navigator and Fisheye menus for selection within long lists .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Material'), (u'semantic annotation method', u'Method'), (u'heuristic rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology entity.These rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology entity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'There are huge amount of data in internet today , which result in great difficult to retrieval useful and personal information for different users.Semantic Web brings us the opportunity to deal with this problem.However , there great gulf fixed between semantic web and the current internet , for it is impossible to transfer all of these data into semantic knowledge.Propose a semantic annotation method based the content of document and ontology.According to several heuristic rules , it annotates document by ontology entity.These rules calculate the relevant degree between ontology entity and a document by taking account of semantic context instead of the entity itself.There are two factors impact the effectiveness of this method : the 1st one is the quality of the domain ontology we made , and the 2nd is the quality of the document .']

entities: [[(u'XSPARQL', u'Method'), (u'tree-based XML format', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'graph-based RDF format', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'XML', u'Method'), (u'data exchange format', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'data format', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'SPARQL', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'XSPARQL', u'Method'), (u'XQuery', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'unified query language', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'XSPARQL', u'Method'), (u'nested queries', u'Material')], [(u'queries', u'Generic'), (u'XML data', u'Material')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'nested queries', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'optimisations', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'tree-based XML format', u'CONJUNCTION', u'graph-based RDF format')], [(u'XML', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'data exchange format')], [(u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'data format'), (u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web'), (u'data format', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'XSPARQL', u'USED-FOR', u'unified query language'), (u'XQuery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'XSPARQL'), (u'XQuery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SPARQL')], [], [], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'nested queries')], []]
sentences: [u'XSPARQL is a language to transform data between the tree-based XML format and the graph-based RDF format .', u'XML is a widely adopted data exchange format which brings its own query language XQuery along .', u'RDF is the standard data format of the Semantic Web with SPARQL being the corresponding query language .', u'XSPARQL combines XQuery and SPARQL to a unified query language which provides a more intuitive and maintainable way to translate data between the two data formats .', u'A naive implementation of XSPARQL can be inefficient when evaluating nested queries .', u'However , such queries occur often in practice when dealing with XML data .', u'We present and compare several approaches to optimise nested queries .', u'By implementing these optimisations we improve efficiency up to two orders of magnitude in a practical evaluation .']

entities: [[(u'web technologies', u'Method'), (u'interactive social network environment', u'Method')], [(u'technologies', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'e-learning systems', u'Method'), (u'instructional content design', u'Task')], [(u'social-constructivist approach', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Wiki', u'Method'), (u'educational contents', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Wikis', u'Method'), (u'knowledge management', u'Task'), (u're-use of learning resources', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'e-learning systems', u'USED-FOR', u'instructional content design')], [], [(u'Semantic Wikis', u'USED-FOR', u're-use of learning resources')]]
sentences: [u'The rapid evolving of web technologies has brought to the increasingly diffusion of applications making the Web an interactive social network environment .', u'The World Wide Web Consortium and several research centers are working on the integration of such technologies into the project of a Semantic Web .', u'Consequently , e-learning systems and tools supporting instructional content design could take advantage of these advancements .', u'In this scenario , according to a social-constructivist approach , the authors discuss the adoption of Semantic Wiki as a collaborative environment to design educational contents .', u'The paper will outline the application perspectives and the strategies to adopt , in order to facilitate meaningful learning processes , and the potential advantages that Semantic Wikis would bring from the point of view of knowledge management , as well as for the re-use of learning resources .']

entities: [[(u'social network analysis', u'Method'), (u'on-line social interactions', u'Task')], [(u'interactions', u'Generic'), (u'social networks', u'Method')], [(u'Classical social network analysis methods', u'Method'), (u'semantic representations', u'Method'), (u'rich expressiveness', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'`` enriched `` representations of social networks', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic social networks', u'Method'), (u'collective intelligence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'collaborative interactions', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Classical social network analysis methods', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic representations')], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic social networks'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'collective intelligence')]]
sentences: [u'One of the challenges of social network analysis ( SNA ) is to understand and exploit on-line social interactions .', u'Research in Semantic Web has provided models to leverage the richness of these interactions that we use to represent these social networks .', u'Classical social network analysis methods have been applied to these semantic representations without fully exploiting their rich expressiveness .', u'Furthermore , we can extend the representation of social links thanks to the semantic relationships found in the vocabularies shared by the members of the social networks .', u'These `` enriched `` representations of social networks , combined with a similar enrichment of the semantics of the meta-data attached to the shared resources , will allow the elaboration of `` shared knowledge graphs `` .', u'In this paper we present our approach to analyse such semantic social networks and capture collective intelligence from collaborative interactions .']

sentences: [u'Internet Learning Management Systems ( LMSs ) are powerful tools that help us in our daily teaching and learning activities .', u'Most users and software are mainly focused in content dissemination and group works , but the possibilities that Internet LMSs could offer go further .', u'Some recent approaches use semantic web to improve the capabilities and user experiences in e-learning by mean of artificial intelligence and knowledge management techniques .', u'In this work , we develop a procedure to achieve the integration of different e-learning systems , and to give semantics to entities and relations in the database of LMSs by mean of ontologies .', u'This integration could ease the dissemination of learning resources and knowledge from the databases of the Learning Management Systems .', u'Moreover , the semantic interpretation of database schemes would allow to find precise information quickly .']
