sentences: [u'Knowledge Management ( KM ) is one of the key progress factors in organizations .', u'It aims at capturing explicit and tacit knowledge of an organization in order to facilitate the access , sharing , and reuse of that knowledge as well as creation of new knowledge and organizational learning .', u'We introduce in this tutorial knowledge engineering techniques that help at structuring information and knowledge and we present techniques defined in CSCW to handle design rationale and negotiation .', u'An example of collective knowledge is then defined : Project memory .', u'Approaches that help to keep track project knowledge are then detailed .', u'We extend our tutorial by presenting multi-agents techniques and the socio semantic web approach which helps to represent concepts built collectively in an organization .', u'These approaches can be illustrated in real applications in several domains : design , safety , marketplace , etc .']

entities: [[(u'Context-aware engineering services', u'Method'), (u'ubiquitous environments', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic')], [(u'Ubiquitous and Context-Aware computing Framework', u'Method'), (u'collaborative virtual Engineering services', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'engineering service orchestration', u'Task'), (u'choreography', u'Material'), (u'semantic web-based context-awareness', u'Method'), (u'human-centered engineering services', u'Task')], [(u'engineering contexts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'collaborative virtual engineering services', u'Task'), (u'service interfaces', u'Task')], [(u'Web services', u'Method'), (u'engineering service federations', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Ubiquitous and Context-Aware computing Framework', u'USED-FOR', u'collaborative virtual Engineering services')], [(u'engineering service orchestration', u'CONJUNCTION', u'choreography')], [(u'collaborative virtual engineering services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'service interfaces')], []]
sentences: [u'Context-aware engineering services in ubiquitous environments are emerging as a viable alternative to traditional engineering services .', u'Most of the previous approaches are computer-centered rather than human-centered .', u'In this paper , we present a Ubiquitous and Context-Aware computing Framework for collaborative virtual Engineering services .', u'The proposed approach utilizes BPEL-based ( Business Process Execution Language ) process templates for engineering service orchestration and choreography and adopts semantic web-based context-awareness for providing human-centered engineering services .', u'The paper discusses how to utilize engineering contexts and share this knowledge in support of collaborative virtual engineering services and service interfaces .', u'The paper also discusses how Web services and JINI ( Java Intelligent Network Infrastructure ) services are utilized to support engineering service federations and seamless Interactions among persons , devices , and various kinds of engineering services .']

entities: [[(u'Local organizations', u'Task')], [(u'information system integration', u'Method')], [(u'searching system', u'Method'), (u'local organizations', u'Task'), (u'onomastic , spatial', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'temporal ontological components', u'Method'), (u'LOWCOST', u'Method'), (u'Consolidated Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'onotologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'searching process', u'Method')], [(u'writing systems', u'Method')], [(u'integrated search tools', u'Method'), (u'semantic web environment', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Local organizations use more and more the Internet as a form of presenting and delivering services and products .', u'In order to find local operating organisations worldwide one has to use suitable information system integration .', u'In this paper we present a searching system for local organizations which uses onomastic , spatial as well as temporal ontological components , called LOWCOST ( Local Organization Search With Consolidated Ontologies for name , Space , and Time ) .', u'The use of the different onotologies for the benefit of the searching process is shown .', u'As names of organizations can be used in many different alternatives as well as in different writing systems LOWCOST comprises a name matching part which leads to a better matching of names in different variations .', u'This will help implementing integrated search tools for the semantic web environment .']

entities: [[(u'ISO Common Logic', u'Method'), (u'CL', u'Method'), (u'automation', u'Task'), (u'integration', u'Task'), (u'reuse', u'Metric'), (u'applications', u'Generic')], [], [(u'Conceptual Graphs', u'Method'), (u'CL', u'Method'), (u'Amine CG software', u'Method'), (u'SW', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Protege OWL software', u'Method'), (u'mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'CG Tools', u'Method'), (u'Ontology interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'CL', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SW', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'CL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ISO Common Logic'), (u'discovery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'automation'), (u'discovery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'integration'), (u'automation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'integration'), (u'automation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reuse'), (u'integration', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reuse')], [], [(u'OWL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Amine')], [], [(u'CG Tools', u'USED-FOR', u'Ontology interoperability'), (u'CL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SW')]]
sentences: [u'ISO Common Logic ( CL , ISO/IEC 24707:2007 ) offers the Semantic Web ( SW ) a new and powerful dimension in achieving the effective discovery , automation , integration , and reuse across applications , data and knowledge .', u'The paper shows how it is possible to explore such interoperability through small scale exemplar projects .', u'As Conceptual Graphs ( CG ) is a key technology in CL , we focused on the Amine CG software and for the SW we focused on the Protege OWL software , exploring the possible mappings between ontologies captured in OWL and in Amine .', u'Through this practical exercise the dimensions and extent of the desired interoperability could be demonstrated .', u'This small but significant experiment provided a practical insight into how CG Tools can actually interoperate towards achieving the wider goal of Ontology interoperability between CL and the SW .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'information providers', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic level', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'formal model', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Flow Networks )', u'Method'), (u'composite mapping discovery', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Flow Networks', u'Method'), (u'SFN', u'Method')], [(u'SFN', u'Method'), (u'mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'mapping', u'Task'), (u'compound mapping', u'Method')], [(u'CSP formulation', u'Method'), (u'composite mapping discovery', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'CSP formulation', u'USED-FOR', u'composite mapping discovery')]]
sentences: [u'In an open context such as the Semantic Web , information providers usually rely on different ontologies to semantically characterize contents .', u'In order to enable interoperability at a semantic level , ontologies underlying information sources must be linked by discovering alignments , that is , set of correspondences or mappings .', u'The aim of this paper is to provide a formal model ( i.e. , Semantic Flow Networks ) to represent networks of ontologies and alignments with the aim to investigate the problem of composite mapping discovery .', u'Semantic Flow Networks ( SFN ) differ from other models of networks of ontologies for two main aspects .', u'SFN consider constraints over mappings that are necessary to take into account their dependencies .', u'Moreover , a different notion of mapping , that is , compound mapping is considered .', u'Complexity results and a CSP formulation for composite mapping discovery are provided .']

relations: [[(u'mechanic', u'CONJUNCTION', u'electronic and software')], [], [], [], [(u'holistic manner', u'USED-FOR', u'MO'), (u'holistic manner', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic Web')], [(u'approach', u'COMPARE', u'database approach')], []]
sentences: [u'In general , mechanic , electronic and software are developed independently by different design tools for the same mechatronic object ( MO ) .', u"As a consequence , it 's difficult to find links between interrelated data which are needed by back-end tools like simulators .", u'Even new concepts based on the idea of mechatronic objects are restricted to particular views of fabrication .', u'Different views generate different descriptions and semantics of MO .', u'This paper proposes to define MO in a holistic manner by the language for the semantic Web , OWL ( Ontology Web Language ) such that each specific view of holistic mechatronic objects ( HMO ) can use a common knowledge base .', u'This approach could be compared with the database approach where each application has its own view of the database .', u'Furthermore , HMO concept also supports the plug-and-play philosophy .']

entities: [[(u'modalities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'human-computer interaction', u'Task')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'intelligent multimodal affective interfaces', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'Sentic Computing', u'Method'), (u'opinion mining and sentiment analysis paradigm', u'Method'), (u'AI and Semantic Web techniques', u'Method'), (u'facial emotional classifier', u'Method'), (u'Maxine', u'Method'), (u'multimodal animation engine', u'Method'), (u'virtual agents', u'Task'), (u'3D scenarios', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'emotional classification', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'continuous 2D emotional space', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'affective extraction modules', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'The capability of perceiving and expressing emotions through different modalities is a key issue for the enhancement of human-computer interaction .', u'In this paper we present a novel architecture for the development of intelligent multimodal affective interfaces .', u'It is based on the integration of Sentic Computing , a new opinion mining and sentiment analysis paradigm based on AI and Semantic Web techniques , with a facial emotional classifier and Maxine , a powerful multimodal animation engine for managing virtual agents and 3D scenarios .', u'One of the main distinguishing features of the system is that it does not simply perform emotional classification in terms of a set of discrete emotional labels but it operates in a continuous 2D emotional space , enabling the integration of the different affective extraction modules in a simple and scalable way .']

entities: [[(u'semantic expression', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web service based manufacturing solution', u'Task')], [], [(u'ontology-based knowledge modeling', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'Web service', u'Method'), (u'network manufacturing service', u'Method'), (u'service-driven manufacturing ontology model', u'Method'), (u'method', u'Generic')], [(u'approximate service matchmaking', u'Method')], [(u'manufacturing service process', u'Task'), (u'data exchange', u'Task'), (u'reuse of knowledge resource', u'Task')], [(u'distributed manufacturing resources', u'Material'), (u'networked manufacturing environment', u'Method')], [(u'semantic Web-based collaborative manufacturing service platform', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'The lacking of semantic expression is a bottleneck of current Web service based manufacturing solution .', u'It is not easy to dynamically discover appropriate services from different service providers .', u'A method of ontology-based knowledge modeling was put forward .', u'It combines Web service with network manufacturing service and the service-driven manufacturing ontology model is constructed by applying the method .', u'The evaluation method of approximate service matchmaking was also developed , and a case was given to demonstrate the above mentioned .', u'The study solves three problems during the manufacturing service process , which are communication between different roles , data exchange and reuse of knowledge resource .', u'The share and the configuration optimization of distributed manufacturing resources were realized in the networked manufacturing environment .', u'It lays the foundation for the construction of the semantic Web-based collaborative manufacturing service platform .']

sentences: [u'[ Brodie et al. , 2005 ] outlines a comprehensive framework that integrates two complimentary and revolutionary technical advances , Service-Oriented Architectures ( SOA ) and Semantic Web , into a single computing architecture , that we call Semantically Enabled Service-Oriented Architecture ( SESA ) .', u'While SOA is widely acknowledged for its potential to revolutionize the world of computing , that success depends on resolving two fundamental challenges that SOA does not address , integration , and search or mediation .', u'In a services-oriented world , billions of services must be discovered and selected based on requirements , then orchestrated and adapted or integrated .', u'SOA depends on but does not address either search or integration .', u'This talk introduces some ideas on SESAs potential role for Ubiquitous Services , as well as the potential role of Ubiquitous Services for SESA , with a focus on aspects of context-awareness .']

entities: [[(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'first-order classical logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'nonmonotonic rule languages', u'Material')], [(u'modular approaches', u'Method'), (u'hybrid knowledge bases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decidability issues', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Quantified Equilibrium Logic ( QEL )', u'Method'), (u'unified framework', u'Method'), (u'classical logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'disjunctive logic programs', u'Method'), (u'open ) answer set semantics', u'Method')], [(u'QEL', u'Method'), (u'names assumption', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'QEL', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'modular approaches', u'Method'), (u'hybrid knowledge bases', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'rules', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontologies')], [(u'modular approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'hybrid knowledge bases')], [], [], [(u'framework', u'COMPARE', u'modular approaches'), (u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'hybrid knowledge bases'), (u'modular approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'hybrid knowledge bases')]]
sentences: [u'In the ongoing discussion about combining rules and ontologies on the Semantic Web a recurring issue is how to combine first-order classical logic with nonmonotonic rule languages .', u'Whereas several modular approaches to define a combined semantics for such hybrid knowledge bases focus mainly on decidability issues , we tackle the matter from a more general point of view .', u'In this paper , we show how Quantified Equilibrium Logic ( QEL ) can function as a unified framework which embraces classical logic as well as disjunctive logic programs under the ( open ) answer set semantics .', u'In the proposed variant of QEL , we relax the unique names assumption , which was present in earlier versions of QEL .', u'Moreover , we show that this framework elegantly captures the existing modular approaches for hybrid knowledge bases in a unified way .']

sentences: [u'There is an increasing need to effectively mine for knowledge both across the Internet and in particular Web localities .', u'Manual processing of Web documents with specific information about a particular domain is a delicate and very time-consuming activity performed by expert professionals , and which can not be easily delegated to automatic tools .', u'The introduction of tools , which exploit semantics for Web mining and are designed to be interactive and usable by domain experts who are not necessarily computer experts , will contribute to save time from domain experts and accelerate the process of semantic annotation of Web documents .', u'This paper presents an ontology-based classifier to facilitate and speed up the process of population and up-to-date maintenance of the domain ontology of a semantic Web portal ( the beta-CKE portal )']

sentences: [u'Ontology is the backbone of the semantic web and can overcome semantic barriers .', u'A domain ontology provides a common understanding of the knowledge of a particular domain .', u'Information Science , meanwhile , is an interdisciplinary science that is yet to be defined .', u'It is necessary to develop an Ontology of Information Science ( OIS ) to represent the knowledge in the field .', u'This paper presents a representation of specific domain knowledge by providing a definition , scope , and boundaries of Information Science ( IS ) .', u'The OIS has fourteen facets : actors , method , practice , studies , mediate , kinds , domains , resources , legislation , philosophy and theories , societal , tools , time and space .', u'The methodology followed is Methontology , which is based on the IEEE standard for the development of a software life-cycle process .', u'The paper then discusses the OIS ontology , particularly its structure .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'syntax of HTML documents', u'USED-FOR', u'web browser'), (u'HTML documents', u'USED-FOR', u'web browser')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The WWW is the largest single information resource humanity .', u'Unfortunately , despite its dependence on computers to operate at all , most of the information is only understandable by humans and not by computers .', u'While computers can use the syntax of HTML documents to display in a web browser , Web computers cant understand the content the semantics .', u'Human beings are capable of using the Web to carry out tasks such as finding the information .', u'However , a computer can not accomplish the same tasks without human direction because web pages are designed to be read by public , not machines .', u'The semantic web is a vision of information that is understandable by computers , so that public can perform more of the tedious work involved in finding , sharing and combining information on the web .', u'The paper emphasizes the semantic tools available .']

sentences: [u'Emergency management has attracted the focus of mobile computing research in the last years due to the flexibility that it provides in critical scenarios .', u'The lack of a pre-existing infrastructure or even a communication breakdown are important issues that mobile computing can deal with .', u'In addition , Semantic Web techniques to handle the data in these scenarios , such as knowledge representation and reasoning , have been proven useful .', u'In the SHERLOCK project [ 1 ] we are developing a general system to provide users with interesting Location-Based Services ( LBSs ) that can help in emergency management .', u'SHERLOCK executes on mobile devices and leverages their communication mechanisms to exchange information among them .', u'The system uses : 1 ) ontologies and semantic reasoners to handle knowledge about LBSs and interesting objects , and 2 ) mobile agents to balance CPU consumption and communication load .']

entities: [[(u'semantic content', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'concept hierarchies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [], [(u'P2P networks', u'Method'), (u'hash values', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data', u'Generic'), (u'semantic values', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'stored data', u'Material')], [(u'hash values', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'P2P network', u'Method')], [(u'hash values', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data classification', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'locality sensitive hashing', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'hash values', u'USED-FOR', u'P2P networks')], [], [(u'data classification', u'USED-FOR', u'hash values'), (u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'data classification'), (u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'locality sensitive hashing'), (u'locality sensitive hashing', u'USED-FOR', u'hash values'), (u'locality sensitive hashing', u'USED-FOR', u'data classification')]]
sentences: [u'The increasing volume of semantic content available in the Web , generally classified by concept hierarchies or simple ontologies , turns the searching and reasoning upon these data a great challenge .', u'Generally , a search in Semantic Web may not be addressed to a specific document , but to a group of data classified in the same concept .', u'Several structures used to distribute data , e.g .', u'P2P networks , use hash values to identify these data , without maintaining the semantic values of the stored data .', u'This paper contributes by proposing the creation of hash values that keep similar data stored near to each other in a P2P network , reducing the effort to retrieve similar data .', u'The proposed hash values are derived from the data classification based on ontologies , using locality sensitive hashing ( LSH ) functions .']

sentences: [u'The underlying assumptions for interpreting the meaning of data often change over time , which further complicates the problem of semantic heterogeneities among autonomous data sources .', u'As an extension to the Context Interchange ( COIN ) framework , this paper introduces the notion of temporal context as a formalization of the problem .', u'We represent temporal context as a multi-valued method in F-Logic ; however , only one value is valid at any point in time , the determination of which is constrained by temporal relations .', u'This representation is then mapped to an abductive constraint logic programming framework with temporal relations being treated as constraints .', u'A mediation engine that implements the framework automatically detects and reconciles semantic differences at different times .', u'We articulate that this extended COIN framework is suitable for reasoning on the Semantic Web .']

sentences: [u'This paper discusses the relationship between academics and practitioners in their approaches to research .', u'It considers how the mission , aims and objectives of their respective employing organisations influence the nature and methods of the research they undertake .', u'It argues that the best model of the research relationship between academics and practitioners is one that is collaborative , interactive , and iterative .', u"It explores some current examples of international collaborative projects and describes how the UK National Archives , as a major practitioner and one of the UK 's seven Independent Research Organisations , is repositioning its strategy on research .", u"It finishes by highlighting some of TNA 's current research projects , including the Semantic Web , archiving Web sites , conservation science and climate change , understanding online users , and developing a wiki for users of the National Archives ."]

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Semantically Enhanced Resource Allocation', u'Task'), (u'multi-agent system', u'Method')], [(u'distributed resource allocation process', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'Cloud and agent technologies', u'Method')], [(u'allocation process', u'Method'), (u'customer and providers policies', u'Method')], [(u'SERA agents', u'Method'), (u'system scalability', u'Metric')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'SERA', u'Method'), (u'Service Provider', u'Method'), (u'clusters', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'grids', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'clouds', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantically Enhanced Resource Allocation')], [(u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed resource allocation process')], [], [], [(u'SERA', u'USED-FOR', u'Service Provider'), (u'clusters', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'platforms'), (u'clusters', u'CONJUNCTION', u'grids'), (u'grids', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'platforms'), (u'grids', u'CONJUNCTION', u'clouds')]]
sentences: [u'This paper presents a new approach of the Semantically Enhanced Resource Allocation ( SERA ) distributed as a multi-agent system .', u'It presents a distributed resource allocation process which combines the benefits of semantic web for making easier the integration between multiple resource providers in the Cloud and agent technologies for coordinating and adapting the execution accross the different providers .', u'The allocation process is based on the negotiation of different agents which allows the combination of customer and providers policies getting scheduling results which satisfies both parts .', u'The SERA agents can be deployed in multiple locations improving the system scalability .', u'The new approach makes the SERA suitable for working as a scheduler inside a Service Provider as well as a metascheduler integrating resources from different providers and platforms ( clusters , grids , clouds , ... ) .']

entities: [[(u'travel agent', u'Method'), (u'software agent', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'W3C', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'Task')]]
sentences: [u'With the rapid growth of tourism information , the quality of tourism can not satisfy the requirements of tourists.The method of travel agent is provided to improve the quality of tourism of tourists.Put forward the travel agent based on the idea of software agent , depict the concept and the role of travel agent , describe the structure of the semantic Web and the concept of ontology , construct ontology library of the field of tourism with Protege , study the significance of the travel agent in the environment of semantic Web.Construct the system on the standard from W3C , and try to provide new thinking about the application of ontology in travel agent.But the study is just a beginning step of the research in this field.There are a lot of problems in the model and need a further study .']

sentences: [u'The advent of Web 2.0 has brought a surprise to users , which helps us acquire massive information dynamically and communicate with others flexibly .', u'Meanwhile , social computing for learning has developed also to help further information processing and analyzing in a powerful way .', u'People can learn and communicate through several ways , including Internet based on computers and mobile networks based on mobile phones .', u'Service Delivery Platform ( SDP ) is a platform which enables efficient creation , execution and convenient deployment , management of services .', u'The next generation of SDP ( NGSDP ) will be constructed based on Web 2.0 with principles of SOA .', u'A cognitive SDP model is proposed by this paper to help social computing in communications and interactions .', u'With the development of semantic web and Web 3.0 , the model will lead a new telecom way for social computing .']

sentences: [u'Many articles have been written about what digital resources represent or could represent for improving the performance of memory institutions .', u'But the majority of them refer to digital resources as things to be consumed and made available to users , but rarely as something to be produced and later made available to them .', u'Starting with the functions of archives , the article proposes the creation of digital resources according to standards ( metadata structures , OAIPMH , semantic Web , etc . )', u'in order to enhance resource discovery and information visibility , for specialists as well as for other types of users .', u'Europe must give top priority to the development of new information retrieval systems # N # and new products based on emerging standards and protocols in order for European countries to achieve a more competitive standing within the information society .']

entities: [[(u'rail transit', u'Method'), (u'Information resource integration platform', u'Task'), (u'architectural complexity', u'Metric'), (u'SOA technology', u'Method'), (u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantically significant information resource integration methodology', u'Method'), (u'top-layer logics of the information platform', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'service functions', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'information resource integration methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'domain ontologies')]]
sentences: [u'Taking rail transit as an example , the paper expounds the issues faced in the construction of its Information resource integration platform such as the cross-discipline , multi-function , inter-organization and heterogeneity of the information resources which bring architectural complexity to the technological realization of the platform.In view of the situation , the paper proposes the construction architecture of the basic information platform based on semantic web and SOA technology , etc.The architecture , as a whole , takes specific domain ontologies as the foundation to the description of the service resources , on the one hand and employs the semantically significant information resource integration methodology to construct the top-layer logics of the information platform , on the other , thus the realization of a physically distributed and logically uniform information resource platform architecture capable of multiple service functions .']

entities: [[(u'DBpedia', u'Material'), (u'Wikipedia data', u'Material'), (u'structured form', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Open Data', u'Material')], [(u'Hive-QL', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method')], [(u'Hive-QL', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'stability problem', u'Task')], [(u'Shark query language', u'Material'), (u'Hive-QL', u'Material')], [(u'execution time', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Open Data')], [], [(u'Hive-QL', u'COMPARE', u'SPARQL')], [], []]
sentences: [u'DBpedia is nowadays considered one of the main projects in the World Wide Web that extracts and enriches Wikipedia data in a structured form .', u'Also , it is considered the central hub for the Linked Open Data .', u'Querying DBpedia using big data approaches such as Hive-QL is regarded as one of the new techniques to solve the shortcomings of SPARQL ; the main query language of DBpedia and the Semantic Web .', u'Nevertheless , despite the speed of Hive-QL compared to SPARQL , it has a stability problem .', u'Our paper presents a new architecture and implementation for querying DBpedia using Shark query language in addition to Hive-QL .', u'As a result of this work , An obvious decrease in execution time , as well as , an increase in the degree of stability have been attained .']

entities: [[(u'Open Information Extraction OIE', u'Method')], [(u'task', u'Generic')], [(u'OIE', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'engineering construction', u'Task')], [(u'OIE', u'Method'), (u'high-level semantic web task', u'Task')], [(u'OIE', u'Method'), (u'formalisation of natural language definitions', u'Task')], [(u'formalisation task', u'Task'), (u'pizza ontology', u'Material')], [(u'OWL DL', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'Open Information Extraction OIE aims to automatically identify all the possible assertions within a sentence .', u'Results of this task are usually a set of triples subject , predicate , object .', u'In this paper , we first present what OIE is and how it can be improved when we work in a given domain of knowledge .', u'Using a corpus made up of sentences in building engineering construction , we obtain an improvement of more than 18i ? % .', u'Next , we show how OIE can be used at a base of a high-level semantic web task .', u'Here we have applied OIE on formalisation of natural language definitions .', u'We test this formalisation task on a corpus of sentences defining concepts found in the pizza ontology .', u'At this stage , 70.27i ? % of our 37 sentences-corpus are fully rewritten in OWL DL .']

sentences: [u'The distributed computing is getting more and more momentum as integration network architecture attempt to streamline business processes and improve productivity .', u'A novel publish/subscribe model message-driven approach is introduced for the implementation of distributed message middleware Architecture that is composed from a number of basic service components and based on semantic web .', u'This matches messages in content- based .', u'Discussed in the framework of the new system , message routing problems , message matching , and other key issues , and is compatible with other existing publish/subscribe systems .', u'The component runtime dependency model is explained in details .', u'A practical implementation shows that the distributed message-driven middleware architecture design is able to support extensible on-demand management services and is capable to scale up for integration network architecture without costly development efforts .']

sentences: [u'With the continuous growth of data volume on the Web , the search for information has become a challenging task .', u'Ontologies are used to improve the accuracy of information retrieval from the web by incorporating a degree of semantic analysis during the search .', u'However , manual ontology building is time consuming .', u"An automatic approach may aid to solve this problem by analyzing implicitly available knowledge such as the users ' search feedback .", u'In this context , we propose a semantic web search system founded on Case-Based-Reasoning ( CBR ) and ontology learning that aims to enrich automatically the ontologies by using previous search queries performed by the user .', u'Some experiments and results obtained with the proposed system are also presented , which show an improvement on the precision of the Web search and ontology enrichment .']

entities: [[(u'uncertainty reasoning', u'Method'), (u'Rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Proof layers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'probabilistic description logic programs', u'Task'), (u'probabilistic logic programs', u'Method'), (u'probabilistic default theories', u'Method'), (u'description logics', u'Method'), (u'OWL Lite', u'Method'), (u'OWL DL', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'entailment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'conditional constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'classical and purely probabilistic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'formalisms', u'Generic'), (u'probabilistic default reasoning', u'Task'), (u'conditional constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'probabilistic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'entailment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'default knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'computational problems', u'Task'), (u'probabilistic description logic programs', u'Task'), (u'inheritance', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'overriding', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Towards uncertainty reasoning in the Rules , Logic , and Proof layers of the Semantic Web , we present a novel approach to probabilistic description logic programs , which combine probabilistic logic programs , probabilistic default theories , and the description logics behind OWL Lite and OWL DL .', u'The approach is based on new notions of entailment for reasoning with conditional constraints , which realize the principle of inheritance with overriding for both classical and purely probabilistic knowledge .', u'They are obtained by generalizing previous formalisms for probabilistic default reasoning with conditional constraints .', u'In addition to dealing with probabilistic knowledge , the new notions of entailment thus also allow for handling default knowledge .', u'We analyze the semantic properties of the new entailment relations .', u'We also present algorithms for solving the main computational problems related to probabilistic description logic programs under inheritance with overriding .']

entities: [[(u'Web of trust', u'Task'), (u'reputation system', u'Method'), (u'recommendation system', u'Method'), (u'semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'web of trust', u'Task'), (u'Web of trust', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'deceptive data', u'Material'), (u'deceptive data', u'Material')], [(u'deceptive data', u'Material')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'structural analysis of Web', u'Task'), (u'deceptive data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'reputation system', u'CONJUNCTION', u'recommendation system'), (u'recommendation system', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic Web')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Web of trust is the foundation of the reputation system , recommendation system and semantic Web .', u'Most of existing research on web of trust concentrates on aggregating the trust ratings on subjects and objects in the Web of trust .', u'The problem with this approach is that an adversary subject can accumulate reputation gradually and can be highly trusted by many other subjects .', u'If this subject later deliberately releases a deceptive data , the effect caused by this deceptive data may be disastrous .', u'Not only can this deceptive data greatly affect people who directly trust this individual , but also , its consequence may have an effect on many other subjects in the network .', u'Our model illustrates how the structural analysis of Web can help evaluate the deleterious result of the deceptive data .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'embedded domains', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'interoperability platform', u'Method'), (u'Smart-M3', u'Method'), (u'RDF information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'reasoning capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'platform', u'Generic'), (u'problems', u'Generic'), (u'resource allocation', u'Task'), (u'conflict resolution', u'Task'), (u'dynamic context sensitive environments', u'Task')], [(u'efficiency', u'Metric'), (u'scalability', u'Metric'), (u'localized reasoning', u'Method')], [(u'Answer Set Programming ( ASP ) techniques', u'Method')], [(u'integration framework', u'Method'), (u'ASP solver Smodels', u'Method'), (u'Smart-M3', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'ubiquitous systems', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web')], [(u'interoperability platform', u'USED-FOR', u'embedded domains'), (u'Smart-M3', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'interoperability platform')], [(u'reasoning capabilities', u'USED-FOR', u'platform'), (u'resource allocation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'conflict resolution')], [(u'efficiency', u'CONJUNCTION', u'scalability'), (u'scalability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'localized reasoning')], [], [(u'ASP solver Smodels', u'USED-FOR', u'integration framework')], [(u'framework', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rules')]]
sentences: [u'The background for this work lies in the visions of ubiquitous systems and semantic web .', u'To realize this vision in embedded domains we have implemented an interoperability platform called Smart-M3 , which allows sharing of RDF information .', u'In this paper we investigate integrating reasoning capabilities to this platform for solving problems arising from resource allocation and conflict resolution under preferences in dynamic context sensitive environments .', u'Additional goals for our work is to take into account requirements for efficiency , scalability and localized reasoning .', u'For this we are investigating Answer Set Programming ( ASP ) techniques in particular .', u'We present an integration framework for using an ASP solver Smodels with Smart-M3 and we demonstrate its use within a use case .', u'Both the framework and the rules described in this paper are available for trial .']

relations: [[(u'narrative text', u'CONJUNCTION', u'clinical data')], [(u'search engine', u'USED-FOR', u'indexing'), (u'web technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'search engine')], [], [(u'HIV', u'CONJUNCTION', u'AIDS')], [], [(u'relationships', u'USED-FOR', u'context sensitive search')], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'medical classification systems'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'clinical practice guidelines'), (u'medical classification systems', u'CONJUNCTION', u'clinical practice guidelines')], [(u'search engine', u'COMPARE', u'XML retrieval methods')]]
sentences: [u'Most clinical data is narrative text and often not accessible and searchable at the clinical workstation .', u'We have therefore developed a search engine that allows indexing , searching and linking different kinds of data using web technologies .', u'Text matching methods fail to represent implicit relationships between data , e.g .', u'the relationship between HIV and AIDS .', u'The international organization for standardization ( ISO ) topic maps standard provides a data model that allows representing arbitrary relationships between resources .', u'Such relationships form the basis for a context sensitive search and accurate search results .', u'The extensible markup language ( XML ) standards are used for the interchange of data relationships .', u'The approach has been applied to medical classification systems and clinical practice guidelines .', u"The search engine is compared to other XML retrieval methods and the prospect of a `` semantic web '' is discussed ."]

sentences: [u'Research shows that most agent-based collaborations suffer from lack of flexibility .', u"This is due to the fact that most agent-based applications assume pre-defined knowledge of agents ' capabilities and/or neglect basic cognitive and interactional requirements in multi-agent collaboration .", u'The highlight of this paper is that it brings cognitive models ( inspired from cognitive sciences and HCI ) proposing architectural and knowledge-based requirements for agents to structure ontological models for cognitive profiling in order to increase cognitive awareness between themselves , which in turn promotes flexibility , reusability and predictability of agent behavior ; thus contributing towards minimizing cognitive overload incurred on humans .', u'The semantic Web is used as an action mediating space , where shared knowledge base in the form of ontological models provides affordances for improving cognitive awareness .']

entities: [[(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'first-order classical logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'nonmonotonic rule languages', u'Material')], [(u'modular approaches', u'Method'), (u'hybrid knowledge bases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decidability issues', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Quantified Equilibrium Logic ( QEL )', u'Method'), (u'unified framework', u'Method'), (u'classical logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'disjunctive logic programs', u'Method'), (u'open ) answer set semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'QEL', u'Method'), (u'names assumption', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'QEL', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'modular approaches', u'Method'), (u'hybrid knowledge bases', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'In the ongoing discussion about combining rules and Ontologies on the Semantic Web a recurring issue is how to combine first-order classical logic with nonmonotonic rule languages .', u'Whereas several modular approaches to define a combined semantics for such hybrid knowledge bases focus mainly on decidability issues , we tackle the matter from a more general point of view .', u'In this paper we show how Quantified Equilibrium Logic ( QEL ) can function as a unified framework which embraces classical logic as well as disjunctive logic programs under the ( open ) answer set semantics .', u'In the proposed variant of QEL we relax the unique names assumption , which was present in earlier versions of QEL .', u'Moreover , we show that this framework elegantly captures the existing modular approaches for hybrid knowledge bases in a unified way .']

[u'Dengan berkembangnya teknologi informasi saat ini maka sifat informasi # R # # N # sekarang ini juga mengalami perkembangan .', u'Perkembangan ini mendorong sumber # R # # N # informasi menjadi semakin dinamis , otonomi , beragam dan berukuran besar. # R # # N # Keragaman yang terjadi tidak saja pada tingkat teknis tapi juga pada tingkat # R # # N # representasi informasi .', u'Perbedaan ini bisa terjadi pada sintaktis , skematis dan # R # # N # semantik level. # R # # N # Karena keragaman ini , maka untuk pertukaran informasi antar berbagai # R # # N # sumber akan menjadi kendala .', u'Untuk mengatasi kendala itu maka dikembangkan # R # # N # sebuah metode .', u'Metode tersebut adalah Semantic Web dengan menggunakan # R # # N # pendekatan ontology # R # # N # Melalui penulisan ini , akan dibahas pemanfaatan sebuah pendekatan model # R # # N # data berbasis ontology untuk menyimpan suatu basis data informasi persediaan VCD # R # # N # dan DVD pada Rental Video Club dengan menggunakan protege3.2 Beta']

entities: [[(u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Delicious tags', u'Material'), (u'HTML keyword META tags', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web pages', u'Material'), (u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'datasets', u'Generic'), (u'Delicious dataset', u'Material')], [(u'datasets', u'Generic'), (u'micro and macro vocabulary overlap', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'classification of web pages', u'Task')], [(u'non-overlapped tags', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Delicious dataset', u'Material'), (u'social tagging systems', u'Method'), (u'non-overlapped tags', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'HTML dataset', u'Material'), (u'organization-oriented contents', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Delicious dataset', u'Material'), (u'HTML dataset', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Delicious tags', u'CONJUNCTION', u'HTML keyword META tags'), (u'Delicious dataset', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'datasets')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we investigate the difference between metadata generated by users and authors .', u'Delicious tags and HTML keyword META tags associated with the same set of web pages on topics related to semantic web are collected , forming two datasets ( i.e. , Delicious dataset and HTML dataset ) .', u'Comparisons of the two datasets in micro and macro vocabulary overlap as well as classification of web pages are analyzed .', u'The results show that ( 1 ) overlap between the two datasets exists ; ( 2 ) non-overlapped tags in Delicious dataset reveal systematic deficiency of social tagging systems ; non-overlapped tags in HTML dataset expose organization-oriented contents ; and ( 3 ) Delicious dataset tends to cluster web pages according to their popularity and subject area while HTML dataset clusters the web pages according to different websites/authors .']

sentences: [u'Machine-understandable data constitutes the foundation for the Semantic Web .', u'This paper presents a viable way for authoring and annotating Semantic Documents on the desktop .', u'In our approach , the PDF file format is the container for document semantics , being able to store both the content and the related metadata in a single file .', u'To achieve this , we provide a framework ( SALT - Semantically Annotated $ \\mbox { \\LaTeX } $ ) , that extends the $ \\mbox { \\LaTeX } $ writing environment and supports the creation of metadata for scientific publications .', u'SALT allows the author to create metadata concurrently , i.e .', u'while in the process of writing a document .', u'We discuss some of the requirements which have to be met when developing such a support for creating semantic documents .', u'In addition , we describe a usage scenario to show the feasability and benefit of our approach .']

sentences: [u'Abstract Creative approaches at the interface of ecology , statistics , mathematics , informatics , and computational science are essential for improving our understanding of complex ecological systems .', u'For example , new information technologies , including powerful computers , spatially embedded sensor networks , and Semantic Web tools , are emerging as potentially revolutionary tools for studying ecological phenomena .', u'These technologies can play an important role in developing and testing detailed models that describe real-world systems at multiple scales .', u'Key challenges include choosing the appropriate level of model complexity necessary for understanding biological patterns across space and time , and applying this understanding to solve problems in conservation biology and resource management .', u'Meeting these challenges requires novel statistical and mathematical techniques for distinguishing among alternative ecological theories and hypotheses .', u'Examples from a wide array of research areas in population biology ...']

sentences: [u'The rapid increase in the amount of available information from vari- ous online sources poses new challenges for programs that endeavor to process these sources automatically and identify the most relevant material for a given application .', u'This paper introduces an approach for optimizing queries to Semantic Web resources based on ideas originally proposed by MacQueen for optimal stopping in business economics .', u'Modeling applications as decision makers looking for op- timal action/answer sets , facing search costs for acquiring information , test costs for checking these information , and receiving a reward depending on the useful- ness of the proposed solution , yields strategies for optimizing queries to exter- nal services .', u'An extensive evaluation compares these strategies to a conventional coverage based approach , based on real world response times taken from popular Web services .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web community', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'meaning of content', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'Web Authoring', u'Method'), (u'Accessibility', u'Task'), (u'semantic structure of documents', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'WAfA', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'XHTML document', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web resource', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'Web document', u'Material')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'ontologies', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web community')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Conventional thought from the Semantic Web community equates the use of ontologies with the representation of the meaning of content .', u'Here , we skew this viewpoint by describing our ontology , Web Authoring for Accessibility ( WAfA ) , which investigates the way ontologies can describe the semantic structure of documents .', u'By understanding the way heterogeneous XHTML ( Extensible Hypertext Mark-up Language ) documents are structured we can better transform documents , currently inaccessible to visually impaired users .', u"WAfA performs two tasks : ( 1 ) it allows us to flexibly model an XHTML document within the context of navigation and orientation through the Web resource ; ( 2 ) it enables non-expert users to quickly annotate a Web document by providing a 'lingua franca ' between author and Web Accessibility Domain Experts .", u'Here we describe our ontology , its use , novelty , and importance .']

sentences: [u'Traditional keyword based information retrieval methods can not understand the semantic of information .', u'Ontology is the foundation of the Semantic Web .', u'However , the geographic ontology construction studies are not thorough enough .', u'Similarity measurement in geographic information search , particularly in query expansion , plays an important role , while the existing semantic similarity measurement models only focus on single impact factor , which leads to poor convergence performance and lower calculation accuracy , and they are greatly influenced by subjective consciousness .', u'In this paper , the building of geographic ontology is researched .', u'According to four impact factors , a semantic similarity measurement model based on geographic ontology is proposed .', u'The experiment results indicate that this model has better performance than classical models , meaning that the semantic similarity of proposed model is more consistent with the expert experience in field .']

entities: [[(u'cultural heritage information workers', u'Material'), (u'web/Semantic Web technologists', u'Material'), (u'resource description tasks', u'Task'), (u'bibliographic universe', u'Material')], [(u'cataloging theory', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'resource description exemplars', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'cultural heritage information workers', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web/Semantic Web technologists')], [], []]
sentences: [u'This paper summarizes a research program that focuses on how catalogers , other cultural heritage information workers , web/Semantic Web technologists , and the general public understand , explain , and manage resource description tasks by creating , counting , measuring , classifying , and otherwise arranging descriptions of cultural heritage resources within the bibliographic universe and beyond it .', u'A significant effort is made to update the nineteenth-century mathematical and scientific ideas present in traditional cataloging theory to their twentieth- and twenty-first-century counterparts .', u'There are two key elements in this approach : ( 1 ) a technique for diagrammatically depicting and manipulating large quantities of individual and grouped bibliographic entities and the relationships between them , and ( 2 ) the creation of resource description exemplars ( problemsolution sets ) that are intended to play theoretical , pedagogical , and IT system design roles .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'shared conceptual model', u'Method'), (u'ontology application', u'Task'), (u'ontology construction methods', u'Method'), (u'concept hierarchies of ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'probabilistic model', u'Method'), (u'ontology presentation.Users', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'probabilistic model', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology presentation.Users')]]
sentences: [u'As the foundation of the semantic web , ontology is a formal , explicit specification of a shared conceptual model and provides a way for computers to exchange , search and identify characteristics.It becomes an important problem on ontology application to build and present ontology.However , there are some defects between several kinds of existing ontology construction methods in many aspects.After analyzing and comparing , this paper makes up these defects by applying formal concept analysis theory to construct concept hierarchies of ontology , and expresses the relevancy of concepts and documents in combination with probabilistic model for ontology presentation.Users can easily search for the most relevant information using the order of the related documents and concepts , so that search efficiency is improved.A case is given to demonstrate how to construct and present ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web page segmentation algorithms', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'self-developed algorithm', u'Method'), (u'WebTerrain', u'Method'), (u'approaches', u'Generic')], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic')], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'HTML', u'Material'), (u'DOM', u'Method'), (u'plain HTML', u'Material')], [(u'average F-score', u'Metric')]]

sentences: [u'We compare three known semantic web page segmentation algorithms , each serving as an example of a particular approach to the problem , and one self-developed algorithm , WebTerrain , that combines two of the approaches .', u'We compare the performance of the four algorithms for a large benchmark of modern websites we have constructed , examining each algorithm for a total of eight configurations .', u'We found that all algorithms performed better on random pages on average than on popular pages , and results are better when running the algorithms on the HTML obtained from the DOM rather than on the plain HTML .', u'Overall there is much room for improvement as we find the best average F-score to be 0.49 , indicating that for modern websites currently available algorithms are not yet of practical use .']

sentences: [u'Education of design engineering has started to change in response to the advancement of computer technology .', u'This paper proposes a new design engineering educational framework using an e - learning system called ShareFast , a Semantic Web-based software for document management system with workflow .', u'The software offers a function to keep tracks of learners behavior so that the instructor can analyze it to improve learning materials and class efficiency .', u'It can also record learner s input and output history data for the instructor to conduct performance analysis activities .', u'This educational framework has been used for empirical studies with university students .', u'The results showed that the framework could help the instructor to understand the students problems during the class , and it can shorten the students learning duration by means of learning materials improvement .']

sentences: [u'In image retrieval systems , user information needs is expressed using multiple types of query .', u'Unfortunately , due to user subjectivity perception to visual features and semantic depths of images , the conventional query submitted to the system encounter difficulties to identify user information need .', u'The blooming of interest in semantic image retrieval requires current research direction to be more concerned into semantics .', u'This paper describes our on-going research work in formulating a new query approach for image databases .', u'The enabling technologies of the semantic web formed the building blocks of our query specification .', u'Using the MRML as the communication protocol , XML in the form of SVG as the visual content description ( sketch based ) and RDF for binding the semantic meanings of images , this research provides an initial framework towards semantic based query formulation framework .']

sentences: [u'Local health policies are not as evidence based as they could be if the public health impacts of policies were easier to simulate .', u'Here we address the inaccessibility of high quality models of public health and policy presenting the concepts of a new simulation framework , IMPACT , built on Semantic Web principles .', u'Model and simulation data are persisted with rich semantics and context to support sharing and interpretation .', u'For this purpose , graph storage systems are explored alongside a new framework for mapping clinical data objects to graphical models .', u'The computation employs functional programming for the parallelised simulation of locally representative populations/cohorts changing over time .', u'The input data , model information and simulation results are mapped to social networks of policy making using the Work/Research Object and e-Lab paradigm that is emerging in E-Science .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'conceptual frameworks', u'CONJUNCTION', u'conceptual frameworks')], [(u'human intervention', u'USED-FOR', u'problem')]]
sentences: [u"One vision of the `` Semantic Web '' of the future is that software agents will interact with each other using formal metadata that reveal their interfaces .", u"We examine one plausible paradigm , where agents provide service descriptions that tell how they can be used to accomplish other agents ' goals .", u'From the point of view of these other agents , the problem of deciphering a service description is quite similar to the standard AI planning problem , with some interesting twists .', u'Two such twists are the possibility of having to reconcile contradictory ontologies -- or conceptual frameworks -- used by the agent , and having to rearrange the data structures of a message-sending agent so they match the expectations of the recipient .', u'We argue that the former problem requires human intervention and maintenance , but that the latter can be fully automated .']

sentences: [u"The paper deals with learning-by-doing activities through learner 's authoring of analytical materials in well-defined learning situations , considering some specifics of education in humanities .", u"These ` learning-by-authoring ' activities are facilitated by Semantic Web techniques to support the learners in the access and filtration of necessary information objects to be analysed during the authoring process .", u'The paper discusses a framework for Technology Enhanced Learning environment under experimental realisation for a concrete humanitarian domain - Bulgarian Iconography covered in a set of educational disciplines like iconography , arts , history , culture studies , theology , etc .', u'The paper contains an example with structured formulation of a concrete learning task , used in the environment to help in the execution of the steps of collection development and in the evaluation of the adequacy of the selected representative subset of objects .']

sentences: [u'B2B and long running B2C process are a complex business process that contains set of services , state , transaction management , and involve notification of events occur during the execution of process .', u'Business processes are driven by events and evaluating the business processes at regional or national scale reveals diversity in products , terminology and processes involved in carrying out a complete business activity .', u'Because of dynamic nature , heterogeneity and lack of knowledge among business partner there is a need of mechanism to compose services dynamically according to events , and to provide interoperable integration for automation of business process .', u'We proposed convergence of semantic web , web services and grid computing to achieve context and location based interoperable integration , event-driven dynamic composition , scalable architecture and middleware support for state , transaction , notification and lifecycle management of business process .']

entities: [[(u'Description Logic Programs', u'Method')], [(u'formalism', u'Generic'), (u'answer set programming', u'Method'), (u'description logics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'logic programs', u'Method'), (u'description logic programs', u'Method'), (u'dl-program', u'Method'), (u'models', u'Generic'), (u'completion and loop formulas', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dl-programs', u'Method'), (u'canonical answer set semantics', u'Method'), (u'canonical loop formulas', u'Method')], [(u'canonical answer sets', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'circular justifications', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'canonical answer sets', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'formalism', u'USED-FOR', u'answer set programming')], [(u'dl-program', u'USED-FOR', u'dl-program')], [(u'semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'dl-programs')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Description Logic Programs ( dl-programs ) proposed by Eiter et al .', u'constitute an elegant yet powerful formalism for the integration of answer set programming with description logics , for the Semantic Web .', u'In this paper , we generalize the notions of completion and loop formulas of logic programs to description logic programs and show that the answer sets of a dl-program can be precisely captured by the models of its completion and loop formulas .', u'Furthermore , we propose a new , alternative semantics for dl-programs , called the canonical answer set semantics , which is defined by the models of completion that satisfy what are called canonical loop formulas .', u'A desirable property of canonical answer sets is that they are free of circular justifications .', u'Some properties of canonical answer sets are also explored .']

sentences: [u'The Web enters a new era where contents are to take the back seat and services will take the driver seat to form a service-oriented web .', u'In this paper , we present a smart user interface design for this emerging service- oriented web .', u'The design leverages the advances of semantic web and service composition technologies to provide an intelligent and generic user interface to query , compose and execute web services for a variety of user tasks .', u'First we develop a simple cost model for estimating the development and learning overheads of web service interfaces for service-oriented applications as the motivation of this work .', u'Then , we present the design of the service-oriented browser and discuss the enabling technologies .', u'A prototype system is developed using existing technologies and standards as proof of concept .']

sentences: [u'There are three kind of protocols available to establish knowledge sharing between agents like knowledge management system , web page , and expert system .', u'All these three protocols are OAI-PMH , Semantic Web , and KQML .', u'OAI-PMH developed and used by librarians as an excerpt of each document and it can be used as knowledge sharing system on metadata level .', u'This is also the reason why PMH stands for Protocol for Metadata Harvesting .', u'OAI-PMH make any data provider agents become open for any other harvester agents to harvest their metadata , as intended by Open Archives Initiatives .', u'However , as open as their intention , there are some circumstances where some specific metadata are only intended for a specific harvester .', u'Thus , this research propose a mechanism where a data provider can restrict access through credential filtering .']

entities: [[(u'business rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'business software', u'Method'), (u'E-Commerce systems', u'Task')], [(u'OntoAgent framework', u'Method'), (u'declarative specification of agent systems', u'Task')], [(u'business rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'agent environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'migration path', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'legacy data', u'Material'), (u'technology', u'Generic'), (u'Web Services', u'Material')], [(u'Web Service parameters', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'OntoAgent framework', u'USED-FOR', u'declarative specification of agent systems')], [], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'agent environment'), (u'specification', u'USED-FOR', u'framework')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The enormous gap between business rules and their actual implementation in business software has long been identified as a major obstacle for having easily maintainable and adaptable E-Commerce systems .', u'We address this problem with our OntoAgent framework , which allows the declarative specification of agent systems .', u'In OntoAgent , business rules can be specified in a declarative way using emerging standards from the area of the Semantic Web .', u'Our framework builds and runs the agent environment based on the specification provided by the developer .', u'We also enable a migration path by allowing the integration of legacy data and existing technology such as Web Services .', u'This is achieved via semantically tagging existing data and Web Service parameters and results in order to seamlessly integrate those into the agent fact base .']

sentences: [u'This research is to develop product retrieval system through simplified communication by applying intelligent agent technology based on automatically created domain ontology to present solution on problems with e-commerce system which searches in the web documents with a simple keyword .', u'Ontology development extracts representative term based on classification information of international product classification code ( UNSPSC ) and jewelry websites that is applied to analogy relationship thesaurus to establish standardized ontology .', u'The intelligent agent technology is applied to retrieval stage to support efficiency of information collection for users by designing and developing e-commerce system supported with semantic web .', u'Moreover , it designs user profile to personalized search environment and provide personalized retrieval agent and retrieval environment with inference function to make available with fast information collection and accurate information search .']

entities: [[(u'Conjunctive query answering', u'Task'), (u'ontology-based applications', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web query answering systems', u'Method')], [(u'systems', u'Generic')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'generating test data', u'Task')], [(u'data generation algorithms', u'Method'), (u'ontology languages', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'Conjunctive query answering is a key reasoning service for many ontology-based applications .', u'In order to improve scalability , many Semantic Web query answering systems give up completeness ( i.e. , they do not guarantee to return all query answers ) .', u'It may be useful or even critical to the designers and users of such systems to understand how much and what kind of information is ( potentially ) being lost .', u'We present a method for generating test data that can be used to provide at least partial answers to these questions , a purpose for which existing benchmarks are not well suited .', u'In addition to developing a general framework that formalises the problem , we describe practical data generation algorithms for some popular ontology languages , and present some very encouraging results from our preliminary evaluation .']

entities: [[(u'multi-attribute negotiation', u'Task'), (u'game-theoretic viewpoint', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'logical preference languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multiattribute utility functions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'preference languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Boolean games', u'Method')], [(u'automated multi-attribute negotiation', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'Boolean description logic games', u'Method'), (u'Boolean games', u'Method'), (u'ontological background knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'expressive description logics', u'Method')], [(u'service negotiation scenario', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Boolean description logic games', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'game-theoretic viewpoint', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-attribute negotiation')], [], [], [(u'Semantic Web', u'FEATURE-OF', u'automated multi-attribute negotiation'), (u'Boolean description logic games', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web'), (u'ontological background knowledge', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Boolean games'), (u'ontological background knowledge', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontological background knowledge')], []]
sentences: [u'Recently , multi-attribute negotiation has been extensively studied from a game-theoretic viewpoint .', u'Since normal and extensive form games have the drawback of requiring an explicit representation of utility functions ( listing the utility values for all combinations of strategies ) , logical preference languages have been proposed , which provide a convenient way to compactly specify multiattribute utility functions .', u'Among these preference languages , there are also Boolean games .', u'In this paper , towards automated multi-attribute negotiation in the Semantic Web , we introduce Boolean description logic games , which are a combination of Boolean games with ontological background knowledge , formulated in expressive description logics .', u'We include and discuss several generalizations , and show how a travel and a service negotiation scenario can be formulated in Boolean description logic games , which shows their practical usefulness .']

relations: [[(u'Static analysis techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'consistency checking of workflows')], [], [], [], [(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'inconsistencies'), (u'semantic web reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'algorithm'), (u'semantic web reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'inconsistencies')], []]
sentences: [u'Static analysis techniques for consistency checking of workflows allow to avoid runtime errors .', u'This is in particular crucial for long running workflows where errors , detected late , can cause high costs .', u'In many classes of workflows , the data perspective is rather simple , and the control flow perspective is the focus of consistency checking .', u'In our setting , however , workflows are used to collect and integrate complex data based on a given domain ontology .', u'In such scenarios , the data perspective becomes central and data consistency checking crucial. # R # # N # # R # # N # In this paper , we motivate and sketch a simple workflow language with an ontology-based data perspective ( SWOD ) , explain its semantics , classify possible inconsistencies , and present an algorithm for detecting such inconsistencies utilizing semantic web reasoning .', u'We discuss soundness and completeness of the technique .']

entities: [[(u'Machine- understandable data', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'PDF file format', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'document semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'LATEX writing environment', u'Method'), (u'scientific publications', u'Material')], [(u'SALT', u'Method'), (u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'semantic documents', u'Material')], [(u'usage scenario', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approach', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Machine- understandable data constitutes the foundation for the Semantic Web .', u'This paper presents a viable way for authoring and annotating Semantic Documents on the desktop .', u'In our approach , the PDF file format is the container for document semantics , being able to store both the content and the related metadata in a single file .', u'To achieve this , we provide a framework ( SALT - Semantically Annotated LATEX ) , that extends the LATEX writing environment and supports the creation of metadata for scientific publications .', u'SALT allows the author to create metadata concurrently , i.e .', u'while in the process of writing a document .', u'We discuss some of the requirements which have to be met when developing such a support for creating semantic documents .', u'In addition , we describe a usage scenario to show the feasability and benefit of our approach .']

sentences: [u'Semantic web is constructed by semantic documents ( such as RDF and OWL documents ) and its size is determined by the number of semantic documents that are available on the web .', u'Each semantic document contains several triples and makes relations between different entities by them .', u'The number of explicit links among semantic documents compared to existing hyperlinks among HTML documents is low .', u'Hence to be able to calculating the rank scores of semantic documents , some methods are required to discover links among them .', u'In this paper we are building a connected semantic document graph by use of explicit and implicit links .', u'We also proposed a method that automatically assigns weights to different links .', u'The obtained results show that the proposed method is successful in calculating ranks and improves the accuracy of the ranking algorithm .']

sentences: [u'Gaining access to sensitive resources on the Web usually involves an explicit registration step , where the client has to provide a predetermined set of information to the server .', u'The registration process yields a login/password combination , a cookie , or something similar that can be used to access the sensitive resources .', u'In this paper we show how an explicit registration step can be avoided on the Semantic Web by using appropriate semantic annotations , rule-oriented access control policies , and automated trust negotiation .', u'After presenting the PeerTrust language for policies and trust negotiation , we describe our implementation of implicit registration and authentication that runs under the Java-based MINERVA Prolog engine .', u'The implementation includes a PeerTrust policy applet and evaluator , facilities to import local metadata , policies and credentials , and secure communication channels between all parties .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'uncertainties', u'CONJUNCTION', u'imperfections')], [], [], [(u'editors', u'USED-FOR', u'classic ontologies'), (u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy ontologies')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Building ontologies is very important for diverse domains and especially for semantic Web .', u'We find in the literature many methods and tools for this building .', u'However , the fuzzy aspect is not enough studied in these methods and tools , whereas information systems can include uncertainties and imperfections .', u'The goal of the definition of fuzzy ontologies is to integrate these characteristics .', u'So , we must be able to modulate uncertainties , on the one hand , and to product representations accessible and understandable by machines , on the other hand .', u'If we find actually many building methods and editors for classic ontologies ( i.e. , crisp or exact ) , we do not find such methods for fuzzy ontologies .', u'Then , this paper defines our work for fuzzy ontologies building .', u'It presents our fuzzy ontologies building method Fuzzy OntoMethodology .']

sentences: [u'Evaluating Web sites for accessibility is a quality assurance process that becomes increasingly difficult to manage as the size and complexity of a Web site increases .', u'There is a growing need to effectively manage and monitor the accessibility of Web sites throughout the development process .', u'The Evaluation and Report Language ( EARL ) is a semantic Web vocabulary , and is a W3C royalty-free format for expressing test results .', u'While EARL can be used to support generic Web quality assurance processes , it has been specifically developed to assist Web accessibility evaluation reviews .', u'EARL facilitates the exchange of test results between development and quality assurance tools .', u'While a lot of development has already gone into EARL and tools that support the EARL format , a lot more work and research remains to be addressed']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web vision', u'Task')], [(u'learning ontology', u'Task'), (u'natual language understanding', u'Task')], [], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web tables', u'Material')], [(u'apporach', u'Generic'), (u'1+1+N model', u'Method'), (u'core ontology', u'Method'), (u'global ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'local ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Type spotters', u'Method'), (u'instance-based schema matching', u'Task'), (u'heuristics rules', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [(u'core ontology', u'PART-OF', u'1+1+N model')], [(u'Type spotters', u'CONJUNCTION', u'instance-based schema matching'), (u'heuristics rules', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], []]
sentences: [u'Creating plenty of ontologies is a crucial task for relizing the Semantic Web vision .', u'Techniques of learning ontology from text are far from mature because of the limitations of natual language understanding .', u'However , discovering concepts and relations from tables is much easier .', u'In this paper , we proposed a novel approach to generate ontologies from web tables .', u'Our apporach can be described as a 1+1+N model : one core ontology which contains the core concepts of a given domain and serves as the global ontology , one standard table which serves as a reference during the construction of other ontologies , N new tables from which local ontologies are generated .', u'Type spotters , instance-based schema matching , and some heuristics rules are employed to generate ontologies .', u'Experiment results show that our appoach is feasible and quite effective .']
