sentences: [u'Ontologies , the important implementation tools for semantic web , are widely used in various areas such as search , reasoning , and knowledge representation .', u'Developing well-defined ontologies , however , requires a lot of resources in terms of time and materials .', u'There have been efforts to construct ontologies automatically to overcome these problems .', u'In this paper , ontologies are automatically constructed from the natural languages sentences directly .', u'To do this , the analysis of morphemes and a sentence structure is performed at first .', u'then , the program finds predicates inside the sentence and the predicates are transformed to the corresponding ontology predicates .', u"For matching the corresponding ontology predicate from a predicate in the sentence , we develop the `` predicate ontology '' .", u'An experimental comparison between human ontology engineer and the program shows that the proposed system outperforms the human engineer in an accuracy .']

entities: [[(u'ranking semantic web resources', u'Task'), (u'RDF knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'class-oriented attributes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'class-oriented attributes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'vector', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'vector', u'USED-FOR', u'ranking scores of resources')]]
sentences: [u'Disclosed is a process for ranking semantic web resources , comprising the steps of ; establishing an RDF knowledge base using diverse tools that support the establishment of ontologies ; setting , by class , object and subject weights for an object type attribute and a weight for a data type attribute on the schema composed of classes that constitute a domain and of attributes that describe relationships between these classes ; extracting from the RDF knowledge base an RDF triple composed of three portions , i.e. , a subject , a predicate and an object ; creating a weight matrix of class-oriented attributes based on a set weight and the extracted RDF triple ; and operating the created weight matrix of class-oriented attributes to calculate a first eigenvector and obtain a vector for ranking scores of resources .']

sentences: [u'Everyone has his own perception or viewpoint of real worlds objects .', u'In this paper , a multi-viewpoints paradigm is integrated in on- tology with using the ontology design patterns .', u'Ontology development and use constitute an important research area for semantic web .', u'Ontol- ogy has been established for knowledge sharing and is widely used as a means for conceptually structuring domains of interest .', u'An ontology that supports multi-views representation of its concepts is the key to achieve the objective of allowing each user to build his own view accord- ing to his perception of the world / his needs and independently of other users .', u'This paper describes a new ontology design pattern called multi- viewpoints pattern for integrating viewpoints notion in ontology .', u'The multi-view pattern is evaluated by an extended formal concept analysis .']

relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'communication technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'devices')], [], [(u'semantic-web tools', u'USED-FOR', u'home gateway')]]
sentences: [u'Energy consumption has increased considerably in the last years .', u'How to reduce and make energy consumption more efficient in home environments has become of great interest for researchers .', u'This could be achieved by introducing a Home Energy Management System ( HEMS ) into user residences .', u'This system might allow the user to control the devices in the home network through an interface and apply energy management strategies to reduce and optimize their consumption .', u'Furthermore , the number of devices and appliances found in users residences is increasing and these devices are usually manufactured by different producers and can use different communication technologies .', u'This paper tackles this problem .', u'A home gateway which integrates different devices with a HEMS based on set of semantic-web tools providing a common control interface and energy management strategies .']

entities: [[(u'software applications', u'Task'), (u'conceptual models', u'Method')], [], [(u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'Ontologies', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'information exchange problem', u'Task')], [(u'data exchange', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web-based information systems', u'Task')], [(u'facilitating data exchange', u'Task'), (u'shared basic-level categories', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web'), (u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'information exchange problem')], [], []]
sentences: [u'There is an increasing need to allow software applications to exchange data , which usually requires the negotiation of meanings between incompatible conceptual models .', u'Theoretically , the concepts in one application can be mapped to those in another , but this can be challenging in practice .', u"The problem is more fundamental than `` information plumbing '' ; it requires reconciliation between alternative and possibly conflicting ways of viewing the world .", u'Ontologies and the Semantic Web have been proposed as potential solutions to the information exchange problem .', u'This research investigates from first principles what kinds of data exchange are possible , with the aim of analyzing the issue in a useful way for the developers and users of web-based information systems .', u'The analysis suggests particular means of facilitating data exchange involving the use of a simple set of shared basic-level categories .']

entities: [[(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'induction of logical decision trees', u'Task')], [(u'tree nodes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Description Logic concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'expressive terminological languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'full negation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'logics', u'Generic'), (u'ontology languages', u'Material'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'top-down method', u'Method'), (u'inducing terminological decision trees', u'Task'), (u'tree-induction methods', u'Method')], [(u'Description logics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concept descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'terminological trees', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'System TermiTIS', u'Method'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'A new framework for the induction of logical decision trees is presented .', u'Differently from the original setting , tests at the tree nodes are expressed with Description Logic concepts .', u'This has a number of advantages : expressive terminological languages are endowed with full negation , thus allowing for a more natural division of the individuals at each test node ; these logics support the standard ontology languages for representing knowledge bases in the Semantic Web .', u'A top-down method for inducing terminological decision trees is proposed as an adaptation of well-known tree-induction methods .', u'This offers an alternative way for learning in Description logics as concept descriptions can be associated to the terminological trees .', u'A new version of the System TermiTIS , implementing the methods , is experimentally evaluated on ontologies from popular repositories .']

entities: [[(u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Machine Learning approach', u'Method'), (u'search problem', u'Task'), (u'operators', u'Generic'), (u'search space', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'structural representation', u'Method'), (u'concept definitions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'definitions', u'Generic'), (u'extensional knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge-intensive inductive approach', u'Method'), (u'task', u'Generic'), (u'expressive Semantic Web representations', u'Method'), (u'Description Logics', u'Method'), (u'well-founded reasoning capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'core inferential mechanism', u'Method'), (u'multilevel counterfactuals', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'We focus on the induction and revision of terminologies from metadata .', u'Following a Machine Learning approach , this setting can be cast as a search problem to be solved employing operators that traverse the search space expressed in a structural representation , aiming at correct concept definitions .', u'The progressive refinement of such definitions in a terminology is driven by the available extensional knowledge ( metadata ) .', u'A knowledge-intensive inductive approach to this task is presented , that can deal with on the expressive Semantic Web representations based on Description Logics , which are endowed with well-founded reasoning capabilities .', u'The core inferential mechanism , based on multilevel counterfactuals , can be used for either inducing new concept descriptions or refining existing ( incorrect ) ones .', u'The soundness of the approach and its applicability are also proved and discussed .']

entities: [[(u'Competitive intelligence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'analytical process', u'Method'), (u'competitors capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'intentions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'position', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'intelligence resources', u'Material'), (u'web resources', u'Material')], [(u'XML', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Material'), (u'intelligence resources', u'Material')], [(u'intelligence domain ontology', u'Method'), (u'competitive intelligence analysis system', u'Method')], [(u'competitive intelligence analysis system', u'Method'), (u'modules', u'Generic'), (u'semantic content analysis', u'Task'), (u'intelligence retrieving', u'Task')], [(u'enterprise development strategies', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Competitive intelligence can be considered as an analytical process that transforms tumultuously gathered competitor and market information into actionable knowledge about competitors capabilities , intentions , performance , and position .', u'Most of the intelligence resources are on the web , so it is very important to describe the semantic meaning of the web resources .', u'In this article , we use the XML , RDF and ontology on the semantic web to describe the intelligence resources .', u'Besides , we build competitive intelligence domain ontology , which is the precondition of the construction of the competitive intelligence analysis system .', u'In this paper , model architecture of competitive intelligence analysis system is proposed , which consists of several modules , such as semantic content analysis , and intelligence retrieving , and so on .', u'The competitive intelligence analysis system can assist business executives making decisions and developing enterprise development strategies .']

entities: [[(u'algebraic graph transformation', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'transformation operations', u'Task'), (u'abstraction', u'Task')], [], [(u'modification operations', u'Method'), (u'settings', u'Generic'), (u'SPARQL/Update language', u'Material'), (u'rule-based graph transformation approach', u'Method')], [], [(u'rule-based transformation approach', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'application engineering', u'Task'), (u'rule engineering', u'Task'), (u'generic solutions', u'Method'), (u'modification operations', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'In this paper , we show how formal methods of algebraic graph transformation can be made available in the technological environment of the Semantic Web .', u'This new and promising approach allows to model and formulate transformation operations on a high level of abstraction .', u'To demonstrate its feasibility , we develop a small book shop case study .', u'We show how some of the necessary modification operations in this settings can be realised by the proposed SPARQL/Update language and by our rule-based graph transformation approach .', u'In a comparison , we highlight the main differences between these two approaches .', u'The most important benefit of our rule-based transformation approach is that it facilitates to move from application engineering to rule engineering and thereby support generic solutions , which lower the maintenance efforts by supporting the declarative specification of modification operations .']

sentences: [u'Nonmonotonic rule systems are expected to play an important role in the layered development of the semantic Web .', u'Defeasible reasoning is a direction in nonmonotonic reasoning that is based on the use of rules that may be defeated by other rules .', u'It is a simple , but often more efficient approach than other nonmonotonic rule systems for reasoning with incomplete and inconsistent information .', u'This paper reports on the implementation of a system for defeasible reasoning on the Web .', u'The system 1 ) is syntactically compatible with RuleML , 2 ) features strict and defeasible rules , priorities , and two kinds of negation , 3 ) is based on a translation to logic programming with declarative semantics , 4 ) is flexible and adaptable to different intuitions within defeasible reasoning , and 5 ) can reason with rules , RDF , RDF Schema , and ( parts of ) OWL ontologies']

sentences: [u'We propose a personal knowledge publishing system called Semblog is realized with integration of Semantic Web techniques and Weblog tools .', u'Semblog suite provides an integrated environment for gathering , authoring , publishing , and making human relationship seamlessly to enable people to exchange information and knowledge with easy and casual fashion .', u'We use a lightweight metadata format like RSS to activate the information flow and its activities .', u"We define three level of interest of information gathering and publishing i.e. , `` check '' , `` clip '' and `` post '' and provide suitable ways to distribute information depending on the interest level .", u'Our system called Semblog platform consists of two types of extended content aggregator and information retrieval / recommendation applications .', u'We also design a new metadata module to define personal ontology that realizes semantic relations among people and Weblog sites .']

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'information sources', u'Material')], [(u'TRELLIS', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'TRELLIS', u'Method'), (u'semantic markup', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'TRELLIS', u'Method'), (u'annotations', u'Generic')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formal and human language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formal representations', u'Method'), (u'Web resources', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'analysis of alternative information sources')], [], [(u'annotations', u'USED-FOR', u'TRELLIS')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper describes an approach to derive assessments about information sources based on individual feedback about the sources .', u'We describe TRELLIS , a system that helps users annotate their analysis of alternative information sources that can be contradictory and incomplete .', u'As the user makes a decision on which sources to dismiss and which to believe in making a final decision , TRELLIS captures the derivation of the decision in a semantic markup .', u'TRELLIS then uses these annotations to derive an assessment of the source based on the annotations of many individuals .', u'Our work builds on the Semantic Web and presents a tool that helps users create annotations that are in a mix of formal and human language , and exploits the formal representations to derive measures of trust in the content of Web resources and their original source .']

entities: [[], [(u'workflow management systems', u'Method')], [(u'Multi-agent systems', u'Method'), (u'software agents', u'Method'), (u'norm-governed organisation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'flexibility', u'Metric'), (u'robustness', u'Metric'), (u'workflow enactment process', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'norm-governed multi-agent system', u'Method'), (u'workflows', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'knowledge', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web languages', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'flexibility', u'CONJUNCTION', u'robustness')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'norm-governed multi-agent system')], [], [(u'Semantic Web languages', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge')]]
sentences: [u'Workflows represent the coordination requirements of various distributed operations in an organisation .', u'Typical workflow management systems are centralised and rigid ; they can not cope with the unexpected flexibly .', u'Multi-agent systems offer the possibility of enacting workflows in a distributed manner , via software agents which are intelligent and autonomous , and respect the constraints in a norm-governed organisation .', u'Agents should bring flexibility and robustness to the workflow enactment process .', u'In this paper , we describe a method for building a norm-governed multi-agent system which can enact a set of workflows and cope with exceptions .', u'We do this by providing agents with knowledge of the organisation , the domain , and the tasks and capabilities of agents .', u'This knowledge is represented with Semantic Web languages , and agents can reason with it to handle exceptions autonomously .']

sentences: [u'Narrowing the performance deficit between design intent and the real-time environmental and energy performance of buildings is a complex and involved task , impacting on all building stakeholders .', u'Buildings are designed , built and operated with increasingly complex technologies .', u'Throughout their life-cycle , they produce vast quantities of data .', u'However , many commercial buildings do not perform as originally intended. # R # # N # # R # # N # This paper presents a semantic web based approach to the performance gap problem , describing how heterogeneous building data sources can be transformed into semantically enriched information .', u'A performance assessment ontology and performance framework ( software tool ) are introduced , which use this heterogeneous data as a service for a structured performance analysis .', u'The demonstrator illustrates how heterogeneous data can be published semantically and then interpreted using a life-cycle performance framework approach .']

entities: [[], [(u'estimation', u'Generic'), (u'innovation processes', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'semantic search', u'Method'), (u'document linkage mechanism', u'Method')], [(u'innovation management', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'innovation processes ontology', u'Method'), (u'semantic innovation planning system', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'semantic search', u'CONJUNCTION', u'document linkage mechanism'), (u'document linkage mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'system')], [], [], [(u'innovation processes ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic innovation planning system')]]
sentences: [u'The paper presents a concept of a system supporting planning of innovation processes , which aim is to estimate key parameters of newly launching innovation process .', u'A base of this estimation is knowledge contained in a large number of different kinds of documents describing the innovation processes that have been implemented before .', u'Considering the diverse and unformalized structure of such documents the system has been proposed basing on semantic search and document linkage mechanism .', u'The paper presents how the estimations can support decision making in innovation management .', u'The concept of architecture of this system along with the descriptions of its functions and modules also has been described .', u'The paper also introduces the concept and role of innovation processes ontology in building the semantic innovation planning system .']

sentences: [u'This paper addresses the important problem of finding relevant information in the context of a business process .', u'It presents an information access solution called EIL ( enterprise information leverage ) which combines information extraction and semantic search to support information needs of professionals selling IT services .', u'EIL leverages structured and unstructured data using novel architecture and special purpose algorithms .', u'Our approach is to organize information around business activities ( e.g .', u'a sale ) , and the system supports semantic concept based information retrieval by utilizing both database query and document search where the relevant business activities act as a contextual constraint .', u'We experimentally show that this approach is promising for reducing noise in search results .', u'EIL is currently under pilot deployment in one of the IBM services sales units .']

entities: [[(u'Engineering design', u'Task'), (u'knowledge intensive activity', u'Task')], [(u'Design', u'Method')], [(u'Transitions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decision-making processes', u'Method'), (u'domain and design knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'collaborative design engineering environment', u'Method')], [(u'Clockwork knowledge management methodology', u'Method'), (u'web-based toolkit', u'Method'), (u'engineering models', u'Method')], [(u'Reuse', u'Method'), (u'semantic search of engineering models', u'Method'), (u'engineering models', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'industrial organisations', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'Engineering design is a knowledge intensive activity .', u'Design is characterized as comprising a number of phases from requirements to detailed specification .', u'Transitions between the design phases stem from decision-making processes supported both by generally available domain and design knowledge and from unique and original knowledge worth of recording for future reuse .', u'The Clockwork project addresses the problems of representing , sharing and reusing knowledge in a collaborative design engineering environment .', u'The Clockwork knowledge management methodology is supported by a web-based toolkit that allows designers to share , formally and informally annotate and reuse engineering models .', u'Reuse is supported through the semantic search of engineering models and of the design rationale by which the engineering models were developed .', u'The approach has been successfully deployed in two industrial organisations .']

sentences: [u'Calculating semantic relatedness between terms is crucial in numerous knowledge and information processing tasks highly relevant to the biomedical domain .', u'Examples include semantic search and automated processing of scientific texts .', u'Most available methods rely heavily on highly specialised resources , which substantially limits their reusability in various applications within the domain .', u'In this work we present a simple semantic relatedness measure that relies only on very general resources and its design features allow minimising the costs of online computations .', u'The relatedness is computed through comparing automatically extracted key-phrases relevant to respective input terms .', u'This simple strategy provides a method that gives promising early test results , comparable to those of human annotators and state-of-the-art methods , on a well established benchmark .']

entities: [[(u'mining methodology', u'Method'), (u'spatial and temporal information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'natural language text', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'spatial and temporal relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic coherence', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Heterogeneous semantic network', u'Method'), (u'extended family relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'relational-situational analysis', u'Task')], [(u'correlation lining', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'spatial and temporal categories', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Markov-logic networks', u'Method'), (u'Markov-logic networks', u'Method'), (u'logical formulas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'combined spatial-temporal logic', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'semantic search', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'The paper presents a mining methodology , which is based on processing of spatial and temporal information in natural language text .', u'It is based on methodology capable of recognizing the relationship between events and objects in the text , using spatial and temporal relationships between these events to enhance the semantic coherence of natural language text .', u'Heterogeneous semantic network with extended family relationships is used to implement relational-situational analysis between the words in the sentence .', u'For correlation lining between spatial and temporal categories and events in the text the mechanism of Markov-logic networks is used , allowing to operate in the peaks of Markov-logic networks with the normal logical formulas representing the combined spatial-temporal logic .', u'The described system can be used in tasks of semantic search .']

relations: [[(u'syntactic analysis', u'USED-FOR', u'verb serialization structures'), (u'Korean', u'FEATURE-OF', u'verb serialization structures')], [], [], [], [(u'Conceptual Interface', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper presents a syntactic analysis of two types of verb serialization structures in Korean : compound and serial verbs .', u'Compound and serial verb constructions have syntactic structures in common where the second verbs take the first verb phrases as complement .', u'Those verb serialization constructions semantically represent one event by involving only one v projection , the locus for the existence of a grammatical event .', u'But compound verbs are distinct from serial verbs in that the former involve incorporation while the latter lack this process .', u'Idiomatic interpretations of compound verbs correlate to their local syntactic structures , which thus form a single unit of semantic search at the Conceptual Interface .', u'This paper supports the approach of Distributed Morphology , which argues for word-formation in the syntax .']

sentences: [u"The need for more comprehensive and `` easy to use '' search tools especially for patent documents still exists .", u'In this paper , the developments of the ongoing project of voestalpine Stahl GmbH together with their partners regarding the implementation of a semantic search tool and an appropriate visualisation are revealed .', u'The main focus is on the different methods of analysis and examples of applications of the software .', u"The features are on the one hand , a semantic representation of the content of the patent documents , in combination with the user 's feedback and the use of landscape visualisation during the retrieval process .", u'On the other hand a satisfactory quality is ensured by using among other features a document corpus which is finite and focused on the technology areas of voestalpine .']

sentences: [u'A link manager for a computer system including data objects and application programs for performing operations on the data objects wherein container objects contain references to linked data residing in server objects and including a link mechanism for invoking a server application program for providing linked data to a presentation window .', u'The link manager includes a reference selector selecting a single reference to linked data in a container object and a moniker generator to generate a moniker identifying a server object containing the linked data .', u'The link mechanism responds to the moniker pointer by invoking a server application program to open the server object and provide the linked data to the presentation window .', u'Each reference includes a file name and a path name and a search mechanism determines the server object directory path , which is used in generating the moniker .', u'The link manager responds to a second reference by modifying the moniker to identify a second server object and the link mechanism reuses the link by closing the first application program and server object and invoking a second server application program to open the second server object and provide the linked data to the presentation window .', u'A moniker manager allows the opening of plural links , each with a moniker , but directs the moniker generator to modify and reuse a previous moniker and link when at a preseleted limit .']

sentences: [u'Linked Data transforms traditional ways of structuring , publishing , discovering , accessing , and integrating data .', u'The advantages of Linked Data , including the common data model , standardized data access mechanism , and link-based data discovery , allow effective sharing and discovery of geospatial resources in Spatial Data Infrastructures ( SDI ) .', u'Web geoprocessing workflows have been widely used in SDI to support distributed geoprocessing .', u'Geospatial data and services are discovered from SDI and chained as geoprocessing workflows .', u'Workflow results can be published as new resources in SDI .', u'The whole process could be improved by the Linked Data approach , so that sensors , observations , data , services , workflows , and provenance can be linked and published into the Web of Data .', u'This paper explores the integration of Linked Data and Web geoprocessing workflows by discovering geospatial resources in the Web of Data to build geoprocessing workflows .', u'It adopts the Linked Data approach to publish geospatial data including in-situ observations and satellite images , as well as geospatial Web services .', u'The workflow results , including data products and processing steps , are also exposed as Linked Data in turn for tracing provenance .', u'The results not only support semantic discovery and integration of heterogeneous geospatial resources , but also provide transparency in data sharing and processing .', u'The approach is implemented as extensions to an existing geoprocessing workflow tool , GeoJModelBuilder , to illustrate its applicability .']

entities: [[(u'Ranking information resources', u'Material'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'Web search engines', u'Method')], [(u'filtering and rating data', u'Task'), (u'ranking strategies', u'Method'), (u'navigation of users', u'Task')], [(u'ranking algorithms', u'Method'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'problem', u'Generic')], [(u'problem space', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ranking algorithms', u'Method'), (u'Web pages', u'Material')], [(u'ranking algorithms', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data solutions', u'Method'), (u'ranking strategies', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'classification', u'Task'), (u'ranking Linked Data', u'Task')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'ranking Linked Data', u'Task'), (u'algorithms', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'ranking strategies', u'USED-FOR', u'navigation of users')], [(u'ranking algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'problem')], [], [(u'ranking algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data')], [], [], [], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'ranking Linked Data')]]
sentences: [u'Ranking information resources is a task that usually happens within more complex workflows and that typically occurs in any form of information retrieval , being commonly implemented by Web search engines .', u'By filtering and rating data , ranking strategies guide the navigation of users when exploring large volumes of information items .', u'There exist a considerable number of ranking algorithms that follow different approaches focusing on different aspects of the complex nature of the problem , and reflecting the variety of strategies that are possible to apply .', u'With the growth of the web of linked data , a new problem space for ranking algorithms has emerged , as the nature of the information items to be ranked is very different from the case of Web pages .', u'As a consequence , existing ranking algorithms have been adapted to the case of Linked Data and some specific strategies have started to be proposed and implemented .', u'Researchers and organizations deploying Linked Data solutions thus require an understanding of the applicability , characteristics and state of evaluation of ranking strategies and algorithms as applied to Linked Data .', u'We present a classification that formalizes and contextualizes under a common terminology the problem of ranking Linked Data .', u'In addition , an analysis and contrast of the similarities , differences and applicability of the different approaches is provided .', u'We aim this work to be useful when comparing different approaches to ranking Linked Data and when implementing new algorithms .']

entities: [[(u'national archives of Korea', u'Material'), (u'linked data cloud of Korea', u'Task')], [(u'data structure of authority data', u'Material'), (u'retrieval system', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'RDF/OWL', u'Material'), (u'Dublin Core', u'Material'), (u'SKOS', u'Method')], [(u'TopBraid ComposerTM', u'Method'), (u'ontology construction', u'Task')], [(u'tool', u'Generic')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'authority data', u'Material')], [(u'museums', u'Material'), (u'libraries', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'The purpose of this study is to develop linked data of authority data in national archives of Korea as a cornerstone for linked data cloud of Korea .', u'The study analyzed data structure of authority data as well as a retrieval system .', u'It finally developed linked data based on RDF/OWL , Dublin Core , and SKOS .', u'The study also employed TopBraid ComposerTM as a tool for ontology construction .', u'The visualization of the tool provides users with flexible search and browsing between data as well as access of detail authority data .', u'It complements the search of a current system in terms of flexible linking between records and authority data .', u'The study also suggests future work to publish linked data of archival data set itself and make rich relationships among data in museums , libraries , and other archives .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Links', u'Method'), (u'enriched semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'merging of data sets', u'Task')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'creation of links', u'Task'), (u'automated approaches', u'Method'), (u'low-quality links', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'unsuitable network structures', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'LINK-QA', u'Method'), (u'assessment of Linked Data mappings', u'Task'), (u'network metrics', u'Metric')], [(u'metrics', u'Generic'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'mapping system', u'Method'), (u'metrics', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'LINK-QA', u'USED-FOR', u'assessment of Linked Data mappings'), (u'network metrics', u'USED-FOR', u'assessment of Linked Data mappings'), (u'network metrics', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data mappings')], []]
sentences: [u'Linked Data is at its core about the setting of links between resources .', u'Links provide enriched semantics , pointers to extra information and enable the merging of data sets .', u'However , as the amount of Linked Data has grown , there has been the need to automate the creation of links and such automated approaches can create low-quality links or unsuitable network structures .', u'In particular , it is difficult to know whether the links introduced improve or diminish the quality of Linked Data .', u'In this paper , we present LINK-QA , an extensible framework that allows for the assessment of Linked Data mappings using network metrics .', u'We test five metrics using this framework on a set of known good and bad links generated by a common mapping system , and show the behaviour of those metrics .']

entities: [[(u'Dutch Ships', u'Material')], [(u'heterogeneous dataset', u'Generic'), (u'curated datasets', u'Material'), (u'Dutch Maritime history', u'Material'), (u'five-star linked data', u'Material')], [(u'datamodels', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'models', u'Generic'), (u'interoperability layer', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'datasets', u'Generic'), (u'modeling decisions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'internal links', u'Material'), (u'external data sources', u'Material')], [(u'dataset', u'Generic'), (u'historical research', u'Task')], [(u'Dutch Ships and Sailors Linked Data Cloud', u'Material'), (u'hub dataset', u'Material'), (u'digital history research', u'Task'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Dutch Maritime history', u'FEATURE-OF', u'curated datasets'), (u'five-star linked data', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'curated datasets')], [], [], [(u'datasets', u'CONJUNCTION', u'modeling decisions'), (u'modeling decisions', u'CONJUNCTION', u'internal links')], [(u'dataset', u'USED-FOR', u'historical research')], [(u'Dutch Ships and Sailors Linked Data Cloud', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'hub dataset'), (u'Dutch Ships and Sailors Linked Data Cloud', u'USED-FOR', u'digital history research')]]
sentences: [u'We present the Dutch Ships and Sailors Linked Data Cloud .', u'This heterogeneous dataset brings together four curated datasets on Dutch Maritime history as five-star linked data .', u'The individual datasets use separate datamodels , designed in close collaboration with maritime historical researchers .', u'The individual models are mapped to a common interoperability layer , allowing for analysis of the data on the general level .', u'We present the datasets , modeling decisions , internal links and links to external data sources .', u'We show ways of accessing the data and present a number of examples of how the dataset can be used for historical research .', u'The Dutch Ships and Sailors Linked Data Cloud is a potential hub dataset for digital history research and a prime example of the benefits of Linked Data for this field .']

entities: [[(u'data management practices', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'strategic management perspective', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data ecosystems', u'Method'), (u'business and value creation processes', u'Task'), (u'technology', u'Generic')], [(u'Linked Data technologies', u'Method'), (u'data management practices', u'Method')], [(u'Linked Data technologies', u'Method'), (u'value creation', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'semantic metadata', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data ecosystems'), (u'technology', u'USED-FOR', u'business and value creation processes')], [], []]
sentences: [u'This paper discusses the adoption of new data management practices , known as Linked Data , by publishing companies from a strategic management perspective .', u'It investigates the role of semantic metadata in the creation and exploitation of so called Linked Data ecosystems and discusses organizational effects on business and value creation processes stimulated by the technology .', u'The theoretical assumptions are complemented by two case studies that provide insights how publishing companies use Linked Data technologies to diversify their business , strategically position themselves within emerging business ecosystems and adapt to the affordances of advanced data management practices .', u'The analysis reveals that despite of differences in the adoption strategy both publishing companies have identified Linked Data technologies as the core of their innovation strategy having a profound impact on existing business practices and new strategies of value creation .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data specialists', u'Method')], [(u'solutions', u'Generic')], [(u'Uduvudu', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'engine', u'Generic'), (u'JavaScript', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Non-specialist users', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Uduvudu', u'Material'), (u'recurring subgraph patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'patterns', u'Generic'), (u'usage context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Uduvudu', u'Method'), (u'user interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'User Interfaces', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data')], [], [], [(u'JavaScript', u'USED-FOR', u'engine')], [(u'Non-specialist users', u'USED-FOR', u'recurring subgraph patterns'), (u'Uduvudu', u'USED-FOR', u'Non-specialist users'), (u'Uduvudu', u'USED-FOR', u'recurring subgraph patterns')], [], [(u'Uduvudu', u'USED-FOR', u'user interfaces')]]
sentences: [u'Creating good User Interfaces ( UIs ) to render Linked Data visually is a complex task , often involving both UI and Linked Data specialists .', u'The resulting solutions are typically application-dependent and dicult to adapt or reuse in a dierent context .', u'To tackle this problem , we propose Uduvudu , a exible , open-source engine to visualize Linked Data .', u'Our engine is built in JavaScript and runs in the browser natively .', u'Non-specialist users can use Uduvudu to describe recurring subgraph patterns occurring in their data .', u'They can then exibly and automatically extract , transform , and visually render such patterns in multiple ways depending of the usage context .', u'Uduvudu is intuitive , exible , and ecient and makes it possible to jump-start the development of complex user interfaces based on Linked Data without the need of data specialists .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Software Engineering', u'Task')], [(u'open source licences', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'source code', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'In this poster , we review the limitations open source licences introduce to the application of Linked Data in Software Engineering .', u'We investigate whether open source licences support special requirements to publish source code as Linked Data on the Internet .']

entities: [[(u'Service-oriented computing', u'Method'), (u'service paradigm', u'Method'), (u'software systems', u'Generic')], [(u'dynamic binding of services', u'Task'), (u'runtime', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'service-based environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'industrial-strength implementation', u'Method')], [(u'rich service specifications', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'service provisioning', u'Task'), (u'service engineering', u'Task'), (u'semantic concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'semantic service provisioning reference architecture framework', u'Method'), (u'business scenario', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'service-based software technologies', u'Method'), (u'service provisioning', u'Task')], [(u'provisioning platform', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic service provisioning', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'dynamic binding of services', u'USED-FOR', u'runtime'), (u'dynamic binding of services', u'USED-FOR', u'service-based environments')], [], [(u'service provisioning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'service engineering'), (u'semantic concepts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'service engineering'), (u'semantic concepts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dynamic discovery'), (u'dynamic discovery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'composition')], [], [], [(u'use case scenario', u'CONJUNCTION', u'provisioning platform')], []]
sentences: [u'Service-oriented computing has recently gained extensive momentum in both industry and academia , and major software vendors hook on to the service paradigm and tailor their software systems towards services in order to accommodate ever-changing process and product requirements in todays dynamic market environments .', u'While dynamic binding of services at runtime was identified as a core functionality of service-based environments as far back as 2000 , its industrial-strength implementation has yet to be achieved .', u'The main reason for this is the lack of rich service specifications , concepts , and tools to process them .', u'This book introduces advanced concepts in service provisioning and service engineering , including semantic concepts , dynamic discovery and composition , and illustrates them in a concrete business use case scenario .', u'To prove the validity of the concepts and technologies , a semantic service provisioning reference architecture framework as well as a prototypical implementation of its subsystems and a prototypical realization of a proper business scenario are presented .', u'Thus the book goes way beyond current service-based software technologies by providing a coherent and consistent set of technologies and systems functionality that realizes advanced concepts in service provisioning .', u'Both the use case scenario and the provisioning platform have already been substantiated and implemented by the EU-funded Adaptive Services Grid project .', u'The book therefore presents state-of-the-art research results that have already passed a real industrial implementation evaluation which is based on the work of over 20 European partners cooperating in the field of semantic service provisioning .']

sentences: [u'Design patterns are used in software engineering for guiding code design : they play the role of models to be followed for producing code of better quality .', u'In the same way , knowledge patterns are intro- duced in knowledge engineering as ontology components that can be used as models and reused as ontology design patterns ( ODPs ) in ontology engineering .', u'The representation of domain knowledge is not an easy task and this is actually the case for knowledge patterns .', u'Accordingly , we present in this paper the use of both Formal Concept Analysis ( FCA ) and Relational Concept Analysis ( RCA ) for designing compact concept lattices that can be re-engineered as ODPs .', u'Starting with a simple ex- ample , it is shown how to derive conceptual and relational abstractions that can be considered as knowledge patterns , following and adapting the meta-modeling activity in software engineering .', u'This paper aims at showing that FCA and RCA are e']

entities: [[(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'expressive and/or larger ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'design patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'these', u'Generic'), (u'generic and bespoke patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'biomedical ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'Method'), (u'pattern based approach', u'Method'), (u'SIO ontology', u'Method')], [(u'Tawny-OWL library', u'Material'), (u'full-programmatic development of ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'data structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'biomedical ontology engineering', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'karyotypes'), (u'pattern based approach', u'USED-FOR', u'biomedical ontologies'), (u'pattern based approach', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')], [(u'Tawny-OWL library', u'USED-FOR', u'full-programmatic development of ontologies')], []]
sentences: [u'Developing ontologies can be expensive , time-consuming , as well as difficult to develop and maintain .', u'This is especially true for more expressive and/or larger ontologies .', u'Some ontologies are , however , relatively repetitive , reusing design patterns ; building these with both generic and bespoke patterns should reduce duplication and increase regularity which in turn should impact on the cost of development .', u'# R # # N # Here we report on the usage of patterns applied to two biomedical ontologies : firstly a novel ontology for karyotypes which has been built ground-up using a pattern based approach ; and , secondly , our initial refactoring of the SIO ontology to make explicit use of patterns at development time .', u'To enable this , we use the Tawny-OWL library which enables full-programmatic development of ontologies .', u'We show how this approach can generate large numbers of classes from much simpler data structures which is highly beneficial within biomedical ontology engineering .']

entities: [[(u'Co-Evolute methodology', u'Method'), (u'knowledge creation', u'Task')], [(u'Co-Evolute methodology', u'Method')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Method')], [(u'applications', u'Generic'), (u"person 's physical competencies", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'organizational environment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'organizational environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'Wiley Periodicals', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'personal development', u'CONJUNCTION', u'organizational development')], [], [(u'ontology engineering', u'USED-FOR', u'methodology')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'This article aims to illustrate how the Co-Evolute methodology can be applied to capture the proactive vision of the personnel of a technology company in terms of personal development and organizational development , from the viewpoint of learning and knowledge creation .', u'The Co-Evolute methodology was developed at Tampere University of Technology in Pori , Finland .', u'The methodology uses ontology engineering to support the use of several specific fuzzy applications on the Internet .', u"Four different applications are tested here : one to evaluate a person 's physical competencies ; one to evaluate the project manager 's generic and specific competencies ; one to evaluate the organizational environment from the viewpoint of new knowledge creation ; and one to evaluate the organizational environment from the viewpoint of learning .", u'The results of an empirical study carried out in the subsidiary of a multinational technology company in Finland are also presented in this article .', u'2009 Wiley Periodicals , Inc .']

entities: [[(u'entailment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'entailment', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'Description Logic-based ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'practical techniques', u'Method')], [(u'subsumption entailment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'black-box algorithm', u'Method'), (u'entailment', u'Task'), (u'relevance-based selection function', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic')], [(u'entailment', u'Task')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'real-life ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'selection function', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'black-box algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'entailment'), (u'relevance-based selection function', u'USED-FOR', u'black-box algorithm')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Finding the justifications of an entailment , i.e .', u'minimal sets of axioms responsible for the entailment , is an important problem in ontology engineering and thus has become a key reasoning task for Description Logic-based ontologies .', u'Although practical techniques to find all possible justifications exist , efficiency is still a problem .', u'Furthermore , in the worst case the number of justifications for a subsumption entailment is exponential in the size of the ontology .', u'Therefore , it is not always desirable to compute all justifications .', u'In this paper , we propose a novel black-box algorithm that iteratively constructs a set of justifications of an entailment using a relevance-based selection function .', u'Each justification returned by our algorithm is attached with a weight denoting its relevance degree w.r.t .', u'the entailment .', u'Finally , we implement the algorithm and present evaluation results over real-life ontologies that show the benefits of the selection function .']

entities: [[(u'computational framework', u'Method'), (u'framing of news coverage', u'Task'), (u'ideologically distant news media sources', u'Material')], [(u'news media sources', u'Material'), (u'formation of public opinion', u'Task'), (u'dynamics of the public debates', u'Task')], [(u'political players', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'political arena', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'corpus extraction techniques', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL queries', u'Material'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Method'), (u'positions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'political players', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'discourse spaces', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ideologically distant news media sources', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'The aim of this study is to develop a computational framework for analyzing the framing of news coverage for controversial public issues by comparing the coverage from ideologically distant news media sources .', u'Because news media sources play a key role in the formation of public opinion , their coverage also plays a major role in the dynamics of the public debates .', u'It can be hypothesized that the public interactions of political players may be treated differently in the media based on the editorial perspective of the media sources in question and the positions that the political players occupy in the political arena .', u'However , the question arises , how can these differences be measured ?', u'Using corpus extraction techniques , SPARQL queries , and ontology engineering , this study compares the positions that key political players occupy in discourse spaces that are modeled by two ideologically distant news media sources based on the same controversial public issue .']

sentences: [u'Commercial-off-the-Shelf ( COTS ) Simulation Packages ( CSPs ) have proved popular in a wider industrial setting .', u'Reuse of Simulation Component ( SC ) models by collaborating organisations or divisions is restricted , however , by the same semantic issues that restrict the inter-organisation use of other software services .', u'Semantic models , in the form of ontology , utilised by a web-service-based discovery and deployment architecture provide one approach to support simulation model reuse .', u'Semantic interoperation is achieved using domain-grounded SC ontology to identify reusable components and subsequently loaded into a CSP , and locally or remotely executed .', u'The work is based on a health service simulation that addresses the transportation of blood .', u'The ontology-engineering framework and discovery architecture provide a novel approach to inter-organisation simulation , uncovering domain semantics and providing a less intrusive mechanism for component reuse .', u'The resulting web of component models and simulation execut ...']

relations: [[(u'Concept lattices', u'PART-OF', u'formal concept analysis')], [(u'data mining', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge representation'), (u'knowledge representation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'areas'), (u'knowledge representation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology engineering'), (u'ontology engineering', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'areas')], [], [], [(u'propositional formulae', u'CONJUNCTION', u'closure property of relations')], [(u'Horn formula', u'USED-FOR', u'concept lattice')], [(u'Horn representation', u'USED-FOR', u'concept counting problem'), (u'# P-completeness', u'USED-FOR', u'concept counting problem')]]
sentences: [u'Concept lattices are the central notion of formal concept analysis .', u'They are applied in many different areas such as data mining , knowledge representation or ontology engineering and are subject to ongoing research .', u'In order to better understand the nature of concept lattices , it is useful to consider their links to other mathematical notions .', u'For example , a concept lattice can be viewed as a special kind of poset or closure system .', u'In this paper , we consider another view of concept lattices by establishing a link to propositional formulae and a special closure property of relations .', u'The main result is an elementary derivation of a Horn formula that uniquely represents a concept lattice based on prime implicates .', u'Using the derived Horn representation , we re-establish the # P-completeness of the concept counting problem and find that the Horn representation is closely related to the stem base of a concept lattice .']

entities: [[(u'Language', u'Material'), (u'institutional repository', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'controlled vocabulary', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Transitioning', u'Method'), (u'linked data vocabulary', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mapping pre-existing terms', u'Task'), (u'semantic loss', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u"OCLC 's FAST vocabulary", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'resource usage', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'linked data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Language', u'USED-FOR', u'institutional repository')], [(u'mapping pre-existing terms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'mapping pre-existing terms')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Language used to describe resources in an institutional repository may benefit from the consistency offered by a controlled vocabulary and an introduction into the larger linked data universe .', u'Transitioning to a linked data vocabulary presents concerns regarding the effectiveness of mapping pre-existing terms and the potential for semantic loss .', u"This paper describes such a transition to OCLC 's FAST vocabulary in the University of Kansas institutional repository .", u'It analyzes the outcomes of this transition and its subsequent impact on resource usage when exposed as linked data .']

sentences: [u'The addition of Linked Data to the geographic standards may # R # # N # produce effective cost savings in spatial data production and use by improving some issues relevant to Spatial Data Infrastructures ( SDI ) .', u'The combination of Linked Data and SDIs , its benefits and challenges are collected in the report on Linked Data presented at 32nd ISO/TC 211 plenary in Delft .', u'This paper presents a brief summary of the mentioned report , where we focus on the main recommendations in the context and evaluate their potential impact in SDIs .']

entities: [[(u'Service Ecosystem', u'Method'), (u'Service Use Ecosystem', u'Method'), (u'Service Supply Ecosystem', u'Method')], [(u'Service matchmakers', u'Material')], [(u'matchmakers', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantically classifying service entities', u'Task'), (u'human computer interactions', u'Method')], [(u'semantic service matchmakers', u'Method'), (u'service concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'service concept recommendation system', u'Method'), (u'semantic similarity model', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'semantic service matchmaker', u'Method'), (u'service concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic similarity models', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'distance-based measures', u'Method'), (u'semantic network environment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'content-based measures', u'Method'), (u'ontology environment', u'Task')], [(u'ontology environment', u'Task'), (u'concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'sufficient datatype properties', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'object properties', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'restrictions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concept similarity measures', u'Metric')], [(u'semantic similarity model', u'Method'), (u'service ontology environment', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'Service Use Ecosystem', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Service Supply Ecosystem')], [], [], [], [(u'semantic similarity model', u'USED-FOR', u'service concept recommendation system')], [], [(u'them', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic network environment'), (u'distance-based measures', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic similarity models'), (u'distance-based measures', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic network environment'), (u'content-based measures', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology environment')], [(u'sufficient datatype properties', u'CONJUNCTION', u'object properties'), (u'object properties', u'CONJUNCTION', u'restrictions')], [(u'semantic similarity model', u'USED-FOR', u'service ontology environment')], []]
sentences: [u'A Service Ecosystem is a biological view of the business and software environment , which is comprised of a Service Use Ecosystem and a Service Supply Ecosystem .', u'Service matchmakers play an important role in ensuring the connectivity between the two ecosystems .', u"Current matchmakers attempt to employ ontologies to disambiguate service consumers ' service queries by semantically classifying service entities and providing a series of human computer interactions to service consumers .", u'However , the lack of relevant service domain knowledge and the wrong service queries could prevent the semantic service matchmakers from seeking the service concepts that can be used to correctly represent service requests .', u'To resolve this issue , in this paper , we propose the framework of a service concept recommendation system , which is built upon a semantic similarity model .', u"This system can be employed to seek the concepts used to correctly represent service consumers ' requests , when a semantic service matchmaker finds that the service concepts that are eventually retrieved can not match the service requests .", u'Whilst many similar semantic similarity models have been developed to date , most of them focus on distance-based measures for the semantic network environment and ignore content-based measures for the ontology environment .', u'For the ontology environment in which concepts are defined with sufficient datatype properties , object properties , and restrictions etc. , the content of concepts should be regarded as an important factor in concept similarity measures .', u'Hence , we present a novel semantic similarity model for the service ontology environment .', u'The technical details and evaluation details of the framework are discussed in this paper .']

entities: [[(u'Ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'software sys- tems', u'Task')], [(u'ontology learning', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task')], [(u'ontology construction', u'Task')], [(u'ontology learning community', u'Method'), (u'text collections', u'Material')], [(u'environmental domains', u'Material'), (u'numerical measurement data', u'Material'), (u'methods', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'threshold value', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'numerical measurement data', u'Material'), (u'ontological rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'nutrient status', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'data mining', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'numerical value', u'Metric'), (u'lake nutrient status', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'spatial and temporal context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'numerical measurement data', u'Material'), (u'environmental software systems', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'software sys- tems')], [], [], [(u'text collections', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology learning community')], [], [], [(u'numerical measurement data', u'USED-FOR', u'threshold value'), (u'numerical measurement data', u'USED-FOR', u'ontological rules')], [(u'data mining', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontologies'), (u'numerical value', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'lake nutrient status')], []]
sentences: [u'Ontology has become increasingly important to software sys- tems .', u'The aim of ontology learning is to ease one of the major problems in ontology engineering , i.e .', u'the cost of ontology construction .', u'Much of the effort within the ontology learning community has focused on learn- ing from text collections .', u'However , environmental domains often deal with numerical measurement data and , therefore , rely on methods and tools for learning beyond text .', u'We discuss this characteristic using two relations of an ontology for lakes .', u'Specifically , we learn a threshold value from numerical measurement data for ontological rules that classify lakes according to nutrient status .', u'We describe our methodology , highlight the cyclical interaction between data mining and ontologies , and note that the numerical value for lake nutrient status is specific to a spatial and temporal context .', u'The use case suggests that learning from numerical measurement data is a research area relevant to environmental software systems .']

entities: [[(u'ontology-based information content security analysis framework', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering method', u'Method'), (u'information content security surveillance', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'ICSO', u'Method'), (u'surveillance system', u'Task'), (u'reasoning subsystem', u'Method'), (u'ICSO knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information content security surveillance', u'Task'), (u'interpreting surveillance data', u'Task'), (u'surveillance decision making', u'Task')], [(u'ICSO', u'Method'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'relative SNA methods', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'web pages', u'Material'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'information content security', u'Task'), (u'knowledge-based systems', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'ontology engineering method', u'USED-FOR', u'information content security surveillance')], [(u'reasoning subsystem', u'USED-FOR', u'information content security surveillance'), (u'reasoning subsystem', u'USED-FOR', u'surveillance decision making'), (u'ICSO knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning subsystem'), (u'ICSO knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'interpreting surveillance data'), (u'ICSO knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'surveillance decision making'), (u'interpreting surveillance data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'surveillance decision making')], [], [(u'framework', u'PART-OF', u'system'), (u'framework', u'COMPARE', u'knowledge-based systems')]]
sentences: [u'This paper proposes an ontology-based information content security analysis framework , which adopts artificial intelligent system designing theory and ontology engineering method to improve information content security surveillance .', u'This framework introduces ICSO ( information content security ontology ) , by which we incorporate disparate and heterogeneous data sources into surveillance system , and an novel reasoning subsystem to utilize ICSO knowledge to support information content security surveillance in interpreting surveillance data and improving surveillance decision making .', u'The ICSO is not only a knowledge base but also a SNA ( social network analysis ) model , thus we could easily implement relative SNA methods to focuses on individualpsilas computer mediated communication ( CMC ) networks to effectively spot harmful characters .', u'And we test our system on Enron Email Dataset and web pages , the result shows this framework is an efficient and effective solution in information content security and can be spread to other knowledge-based systems .']

entities: [[(u'Volcanic hazards', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'source dangers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'volcanic phenomena', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Assessment of volcanic hazards', u'Task'), (u'geoscientific data', u'Material'), (u'information phenomena', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Understanding of volcanic systems', u'Task'), (u'structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'geochemistry', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dynamics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'environment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'process of volcano formation', u'Method')], [(u'Ontology engineering', u'Method'), (u'domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'volcano system and volcanic hazards assessment ontology', u'Task'), (u'conceptual modelling', u'Method'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'volcanic hazards management', u'Task')], [(u'Volcano system', u'Method'), (u'semantic information of volcanic system', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Volcanic hazards is source dangers that caused by volcanic phenomena .', u'Assessment of volcanic hazards require integrated access to the many sources of geoscientific data , consisting of current information phenomena and the knowledge or experience gained from similar situations in the past .', u'Understanding of volcanic systems which involves its structure , geochemistry , dynamics , environment , and the process of volcano formation is vital to reveal information about how the volcano works and to forecast its behaviour in the future .', u'Ontology engineering can be deployed as technology to capture and represent this domain knowledge .', u'This paper presents volcano system and volcanic hazards assessment ontology as conceptual modelling and knowledge base for volcanic hazards management .', u'Volcano system and volcanic hazards assessment ontology will provide a precise representation and semantic information of volcanic system and volcanic hazards domain knowledge .', u'The ontology helps to understand the holistic and comprehensive of volcano hazard management data .']

entities: [[(u'pervasive computing', u'Method')], [(u'wireless technologies', u'Method'), (u'hand-held devices', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'middlewares', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'technologies', u'Generic')], [(u'semantic profiling', u'Method'), (u'context-sensitive management module', u'Method'), (u'networked embedded computing', u'Task')], [(u'Profiling', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Method'), (u'shared terminologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'NEC', u'Task'), (u'middlewares', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'context-sensitive management module', u'Method'), (u'profiles', u'Generic')], [(u'OntoMail Application', u'Task'), (u'middleware', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'wireless technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'hand-held devices')], [], [], [(u'ontology engineering', u'USED-FOR', u'Profiling'), (u'NEC', u'CONJUNCTION', u'middlewares')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The concept of pervasive computing is becoming more concrete and grounded with every passing day .', u'This is owed to the explosive growth of wireless technologies and hand-held devices .', u'However , supporting middlewares embedded in these technologies are not coping with this astonishing growth due to lack of effective profiling and management of system information .', u'We present the semantic profiling and the context-sensitive management module as two new promising concepts in the domain of networked embedded computing ( NEC ) in general and pervasive computing in specific .', u'Profiling is based on ontology engineering that will provide the shared terminologies for information used in NEC and reliability needed in supporting middlewares .', u'The context-sensitive management module is a small footprint knowledge base system that is used to manipulate and mess these profiles according to the environment situation .', u'The paper presents the OntoMail Application as a proof of concept for the proposed middleware .']

entities: [[(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'methodological guidance', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'NeOn Methodology', u'Method'), (u'rigid workflow', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'ontology design patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'non-ontological resources', u'Material'), (u'folksonomies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'thesauri', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'NeOn Methodology framework', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'logy life cycle models', u'Method'), (u'methodological guidelines', u'Method'), (u'outputs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'workflow specifications', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'In contrast to other approaches that provide methodological guidance for ontology engineering , the NeOn Methodology does not prescribe a rigid workflow , but instead it suggests a variety of pathways for developing ontologies .', u'The nine scenarios proposed in the methodology cover commonly occurring situations , for example , when available ontologies need to be re-engineered , aligned , modular- ized , localized to support different languages and cultures , and integrated with ontology design patterns and non-ontological resources , such as folksonomies or thesauri .', u'In addition , the NeOn Methodology framework provides ( a ) a glossary of processes and activities involved in the development of ontologies , ( b ) two onto- logy life cycle models , and ( c ) a set of methodological guidelines for different processes and activities , which are described ( a ) functionally , in terms of goals , inputs , outputs , and relevant constraints ; ( b ) procedurally , by means of workflow specifications ; and ( c ) empirically , through a set of illustrative examples .']

relations: [[], [(u'OntoDM-core', u'USED-FOR', u'data mining entities'), (u'three-layered ontological structure', u'USED-FOR', u'data mining entities'), (u'specification', u'PART-OF', u'three-layered ontological structure')], [(u'representational framework', u'USED-FOR', u'mining structured data'), (u'representational framework', u'USED-FOR', u'data mining tasks'), (u'datasets', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining tasks'), (u'datasets', u'CONJUNCTION', u'generalizations'), (u'data mining tasks', u'CONJUNCTION', u'generalizations'), (u'data mining tasks', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining algorithms'), (u'generalizations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining algorithms'), (u'generalizations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'constraints'), (u'data mining algorithms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'constraints')], [(u'OntoDM-core', u'USED-FOR', u'applications/use cases'), (u'semantic annotation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications/use cases'), (u'data mining algorithms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'datasets'), (u'datasets', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications/use cases'), (u'annotation of QSAR studies', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications/use cases')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this article , we present OntoDM-core , an ontology of core data mining entities .', u'OntoDM-core defines the most essential data mining entities in a three-layered ontological structure comprising of a specification , an implementation and an application layer .', u'It provides a representational framework for the description of mining structured data , and in addition provides taxonomies of datasets , data mining tasks , generalizations , data mining algorithms and constraints , based on the type of data .', u'OntoDM-core is designed to support a wide range of applications/use cases , such as semantic annotation of data mining algorithms , datasets and results ; annotation of QSAR studies in the context of drug discovery investigations ; and disambiguation of terms in text mining .', u'The ontology has been thoroughly assessed following the practices in ontology engineering , is fully interoperable with many domain resources and is easy to extend .', u'OntoDM-core is available at http : //www.ontodm.com .']

entities: [[(u'Product development environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'PLM business activity', u'Method')], [(u'PLM', u'Method'), (u'product-related components', u'Method')], [(u'environments', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information exchange', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'PLM needs', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'PLM key criteria', u'Metric')], [(u'positive and negative aspects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'PLM purposes', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'PLM purposes')]]
sentences: [u'Product development environments are known for their growing complexity , especially if they are envisioned for the whole product lifecycle .', u'The objective of the PLM business activity is to manage products across their lifecycles , from cradle to grave .', u'PLM is focused on the product , and holistically brings together many product-related components .', u'For such environments , ontologies could play an important role to ensure semantic interoperability and correct information exchange .', u'But what kinds of ontologies are best suited to fulfil this task .', u'The work presented in this paper overviews some of the prominent ontologies used in product development and explores the usefulness of some typical known ontologies for PLM needs .', u'The ontologies are assessed with respect to some ontology engineering and PLM key criteria .', u'By identifying positive and negative aspects with respect to the previous criteria , we clarify the range of alternatives in creating an ontology devoted to PLM purposes .']

sentences: [u'The paper is devoted to the interplay issues between ontology engineering and cognitive psychology .', u'It describes the study targeted at new visual structuring paradigm of ontology development .', u'Such approach is formed with regard to personal cognitive features .', u'The research was performed within the KOMET knowledge and content structuring via methods of collaborative ontology design project .', u'Two phases of research have been done within the project .', u"First was devoted to study of correlations between the expert 's personal cognitive style features and the peculiarities of expert 's subject domain ontology development procedure .", u"The second deals with research on the relationship between the expert 's individual cognitive style and the collective ontology design including the design performed in groups consisting of experts either of similar or of different cognitive styles .", u'The results of this research project can be applied to organising the collaborative ontology design , data and content structuring and other group analytical work .']

sentences: [u'Purpose The purpose of this paper is to describe an attempt to provide a model for the description of the major aspects of historical interpersonal relationships between celebrities , with a focus on modelling different kinds of evidence about them , from documented and contrasted data to mere rumours.Design/methodology/approach The approach takes the form of analysis of cases and ontology engineering .', u'A formal schema is provided for the model .', u'The way information can be organized according to this is illustrated with examples about life facts and rumours regarding a popular Hollywood actress.Findings Some web systems that exploit the representation of personal relationships for purposes such as finding jobs or business opportunities have gained popularity recently .', u'These systems enable users to take advantage of their personal information when combined with information provided by others who are willing to attain similar objectives .', u'However , the importance of that kind of social information can also ...']

sentences: [u'Ontologies can play a very important role in information systems .', u'They can support various information system processes , particularly information acquisition and integration .', u'Ontologies themselves need to be designed , built and maintained .', u'An important part of the ontology engineering cycle is the ability to keep a handcrafted ontology up to date .', u'Therefore , we have developed a tool called MnM that helps during the ontology maintenance process .', u'MnM extracts information from texts and populates an ontology .', u'It uses NLP ( Natural Language Processing ) , Information Extraction and Machine Learning technologies .', u'In particular , MnM was tested using an electronic newsletter consisting of news articles describing events happening in the Knowledge Media Institute ( KMi ) .', u'MnM could constitute an important part of an ontology-driven information system , with its integrated web-based ontology editor and provision of open APIs to link to ontology servers and to integrate with information extraction tools .']
