sentences: [u'Purpose To describe how semantic knowledge technology can be used to enhance a digital library.Design The paper examines the main research challenges in the field of digital libraries and identifies the extent to which semantic knowledge technology can be used to respond to these challenges .', u'Functionality developed within the SEKT project ( http : //sekt.semanticweb.org ) is used to enhance an existing digital library .', u'The development of a good ontology is central to such an application , and the paper describes the particular ontology engineering approach adopted.Findings Four broad challenges were identified : achieving interoperability ; describing objects and repositories ; managing multimedia collections ; and improving user interfaces and humancomputer interaction .', u'The SEKT digital library case study is using semantic knowledge technology to respond to the first two and the last of these .', u'The paper describes how this is being done and the kind of enhanced functionality being developed.Originality/valu ...']

sentences: [u'Measurement is the key element of engineering processes .', u'To control , track and improve the quality of any object , it should be defined in quantitative ways .', u'Ontology like other engineering products needs a method for quality assessment during its life cycle .', u'Recently , quality assessment of ontology has been the topic of many research activities .', u'In many works , measuring structural aspects of ontology has been considered , but semantic aspects of ontology have received less attention .', u'In this paper , Knowledge Cartography reasoning technique is used to represent semantic aspects of ontology .', u'To illustrate the applicability of this technique for measuring ontology , we focused on modularity as an important requirement for collaborative ontology engineering and control quality factors ( such as maintenance , changeability , scalability , and reusability ) .', u'So a semantic similarity metric is proposed based on Knowledge Cartography representation and then Louvain algorithm is applied to extract high cohesion and loosely coupled modules .']

sentences: [u'In order to solve the problems of integration of network information resources , the authors propose a framework about the integration of network information resources by the basic idea of linked data , on the base of which a free network resources integration system is designed and implemented in Wuhan University taken as the basic unit.Following the principles of linked data , the system can provide two kinds of services : linked data browsing and SPARQL search which reflects the great advantage of using linked data in resource integration .']

sentences: [u'Linked Data resources change rapidly over time , making a valid consistent state difficult .', u'As a solution , the Memento framework offers content negotiation in the datetime dimension .', u'However , due to a lack of formally described versioning , every server needs a costly custom implementation .', u'In this poster paper , we exploit published provenance of Linked Data resources to implement a generic Memento service .', u'Based on the w3c prov standard , we propose a loosely coupled architecture that offers a Memento interface to any Linked Data service publishing provenance .']

sentences: [u'Schema matching is a key task in several applications such as data integration and ontology engineering .', u"All application fields require the matching of several schemes also known as `` holistic matching '' , but the difficulty of the problem spawned much more attention to pairwise schema matching rather than the latter .", u'In this paper , we propose a new approach for holistic matching .', u'We suggest modelling the problem with some techniques borrowed from the combinatorial optimization field .', u'We propose a linear program , named LP4HM , which extends the maximum-weighted graph matching problem with different linear constraints .', u'The latter encompass matching setup constraints , especially cardinality and threshold constraints ; and schema structural constraints , especially superclass/subclass and coherence constraints .', u'The matching quality of LP4HM is evaluated on a recent benchmark dedicated to assessing schema matching tools .', u'Experimentations show competitive results compared to other tools , in particular for recall and HSR quality measures']

entities: [[(u'Ontology evaluation', u'Task')], [(u'automated methods', u'Method')], [(u'automated ontology evaluation method', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'automated ontology evaluation procedure', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'principles', u'Generic'), (u'ontology evaluation', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'evaluation method', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task')]]
sentences: [u'Ontology evaluation is a labour intensive and laborious job .', u'Hence , it is relevant to investigate automated methods .', u'But before an automated ontology evaluation method is considered reliable and consistent , it must be validated by human experts .', u'In this paper we want to present a meta-analysis of an automated ontology evaluation procedure as it has been applied in earlier tests .', u'It goes without saying that many of the principles touched upon can be applied in the context of ontology evaluation as such , irrespective of it being automated or not .', u'Consequently , the overall quality of an ontology is not only determined by the quality of the artifact itself , but also by the the quality of its evaluation method .', u'Providing an analysis on the set-up and conditions under which an evaluation of an ontology takes place can only be beneficial to the entire domain of ontology engineering .']

sentences: [u'This paper presents an approach aimed at creating business ontologies for knowledge codification in company .', u'It is based on the principles of ontological engineering and cognitive psychology .', u'Ontologies that describe the main concepts of knowledge are used both for knowledge creation and codification .', u'The proposed framework is targeted at the development of methodologies that can scaffold the process of knowledge structuring and orchestrating for better understanding and knowledge sharing .', u'The orchestrating procedure is the kernel of ontology development .', u'The main stress is put on using visual techniques of mind mapping .', u'Cognitive bias and some results of Gestalt psychology are highlighted as a general guideline .', u'The ideas of balance , clarity , and beauty are applied to the ontology orchestrating procedures .', u'The examples are taken mainly from the project management practice .', u'The paper contributes to managerial practice by describing the practical recommendations for effective knowledge management based on ontology engineering and knowledge structuring techniques .']

sentences: [u'According to research teams experiments in ontology engineering field , building ontologies is much more time-consuming and costly than building terminologies with regard to ontology complexity and formality , two major differences between these types of resources .', u'In the meantime , there are already many consensual terminologies for numerous knowledge domains available on the web , consequently these knowledge representations can constitute a great contribution in saving time and money in ontology building process field since terminologies can be considered as preliminary attempts to model particular domains by their respective experts .', u'Though before performing such a reuse , it is essential to distinguish clearly which type of resource we are dealing with and therefore decide for its suitability for our purposes or not .', u'This paper will focus on two leading points : on the one hand , a comparison between ontology and terminology on the basis of several features such as : basic principles , methodological aspects ...']
